collins.tran: 登记本；注册簿；（官方）记录
collins.def: A register is an official list or record of people or things.

example.ex: ...registers of births, deaths and marriages...
example.tran: 出生、死亡和婚姻记录

example.ex: He signed the register at the hotel...
example.tran: 他在酒店的登记簿上签了名。

collins.def: If you register to do something, you put your name on an official list, in order to be able to do that thing or to receive a service.

example.ex: Have you come to register at the school?...
example.tran: 你来学校注册了吗？

example.ex: Thousands lined up to register to vote...
example.tran: 数千选民排队登记投票。

collins.def: If you register something, such as the name of a person who has just died or information about something you own, you have these facts recorded on an official list.

example.ex: In order to register a car in Japan, the owner must have somewhere to park it...
example.tran: 在日本要登记一辆汽车，车主必须先要有车位。

example.ex: We registered his birth...
example.tran: 我们给他进行了出生登记。

collins.def: When something registers on a scale or measuring instrument, it shows on the scale or instrument. You can also say that something registers a certain amount or level on a scale or measuring instrument.

example.ex: It will only register on sophisticated X-ray equipment...
example.tran: 只有精密的X射线仪器才能显示出来。

example.ex: The earthquake registered 5.3 points on the Richter scale...
example.tran: 地震的震级达到里氏5.3级。

collins.def: If you register your feelings or opinions about something, you do something that makes them clear to other people.

example.ex: Voters wish to register their dissatisfaction with the ruling party...
example.tran: 选民希望表达他们对执政党的不满。

example.ex: Workers stopped work to register their protest.
example.tran: 工人罢工以示抗议。

collins.def: If a feeling registers on someone's face, their expression shows clearly that they have that feeling.

example.ex: Surprise again registered on Rodney's face.
example.tran: 罗德尼的脸上再次露出诧异的神情。

collins.tran: 引起注意;（被）意识到;（使）留下印象
collins.def: If a piece of information does not register or if you do not register it, you do not really pay attention to it, and so you do not remember it or react to it.

example.ex: What I said sometimes didn't register in her brain...
example.tran: 有时我说的话她根本没听进去。

example.ex: The sound was so familiar that she didn't register it.
example.tran: 这个声音如此耳熟，她根本没怎么留意。

collins.def: If you sing or play something in a high or low register, you sing, or play it using high or low notes. If you say something in a high or low register, you say it in a high or low voice.
In linguistics, the register of a piece of speech or writing is its level and style of language, which is usually appropriate to the situation or circumstances in which it is used.
You use somewhere to refer to a place without saying exactly where you mean.

example.ex: I've got a feeling I've seen him before somewhere...
example.tran: 我有种感觉——我以前曾在哪里见过他。

example.ex: I'm not going home yet. I have to go somewhere else first...
example.tran: 我还不准备回家，我要先去别的地方。

collins.def: You use somewhere when giving an approximate amount, number, or time.

example.ex: The Queen is believed to earn somewhere between seven million and one hundred million pounds...
example.tran: 据说女王的收入大约在 700 万至 1 亿英镑之间。

example.ex: Caray is somewhere between 73 and 80 years of age...
example.tran: 卡瑞的年纪在 73 到 80 岁之间。

collins.def: If you say that you are getting somewhere, you mean that you are making progress towards achieving something.

example.ex: At last they were agreeing, at last they were getting somewhere...
example.tran: 他们最终逐渐达成共识，终于取得了一些进展。

example.ex: This time it looks as if we're really going to get somewhere.
example.tran: 这一次，我们似乎真的要取得进展了。

collins.tran: 糊涂的;头脑迟钝的;愚蠢的
collins.def: If you say that someone or something is stupid, you mean that they show a lack of good judgment or intelligence and they are not at all sensible.

example.ex: I'll never do anything so stupid again...
example.tran: 我再也不会做这种傻事了。

example.ex: I made a stupid mistake...
example.tran: 我犯了个愚蠢的错误。

collins.tran: 讨厌的;恼人的;无足轻重的
collins.def: You say that something is stupid to indicate that you do not like it or care about it, or that it annoys you.

example.ex: I wouldn't call it art. It's just stupid and tasteless...
example.tran: 我不认为这是艺术。它简直无聊透顶，毫无品位。

example.ex: Friendship is much more important to me than a stupid old ring!
example.tran: 友谊对我来说可比一个破戒指重要得多！

means: 常作 mysteries 秘技，秘诀

collins.tran: 谜;神秘的事物;难懂的事物
collins.def: A mystery is something that is not understood or known about.

example.ex: The source of the gunshots still remains a mystery.
example.tran: 枪炮声来自何处仍是个谜。

example.ex: ...the mysteries of mental  breakdown.
example.tran: 精神崩溃之谜

collins.def: If you talk about the mystery of someone or something, you are talking about how difficult they are to understand or know about, especially when this gives them a rather strange or magical quality.

example.ex: She's a lady of mystery...
example.tran: 她是个神秘的女人。

example.ex: It is an elaborate ceremony, shrouded in mystery.
example.tran: 仪式是精心筹划的，笼罩着一层神秘的色彩。

collins.def: A mystery person or thing is one whose identity or nature is not known.

example.ex: The mystery hero immediately alerted police after spotting a bomb.
example.tran: 那个无名英雄发现炸弹后马上报了警。

example.ex: ...a mystery prize of up to £1,000.
example.tran: 高达1,000英镑的神秘奖品

collins.def: A mystery is a story in which strange things happen that are not explained until the end.

example.ex: His fourth novel is a murder mystery set in London.
example.tran: 他的第四部小说讲述的是一起发生在伦敦的神秘谋杀案。

collins.def: If you describe something as crucial, you mean it is extremely important.

example.ex: He had administrators under him but took the crucial decisions himself...
example.tran: 他手下有管理人员，但重要的决策仍由他自己来做。

example.ex: ...the most crucial election campaign for years...
example.tran: 几年来最重要的竞选活动

collins.tran: (房屋、工厂、道路、桥梁等的)建筑，建造
collins.def: Construction is the building of things such as houses, factories, roads, and bridges.

example.ex: He'd already started construction on a hunting lodge.
example.tran: 他已经开始建造一间狩猎用的小屋。

example.ex: ...the only nuclear power station under construction in Britain.
example.tran: 英国唯一一家在建的核电站

collins.def: The construction of something such as a vehicle or machine is the making of it.

example.ex: ...companies who have long experience in the construction of those types of equipment...
example.tran: 长期从事此类设备制造的公司

example.ex: With the exception of teak, this is the finest wood for boat construction.
example.tran: 这是除柚木以外最好的造船木材。

collins.def: The construction of something such as a system is the creation of it.

example.ex: ...the construction of a just system of criminal justice.
example.tran: 一套公正的刑事审判制度的创建

collins.def: You can refer to an object that has been built or made as a construction .

example.ex: The British pavilion is an impressive steel and glass construction the size of Westminster Abbey.
example.tran: 这座英式亭阁是令人赞叹的钢和玻璃建筑，大小和威斯敏斯特教堂相当。

collins.def: You use construction to refer to the structure of something and the way it has been built or made.

example.ex: The Shakers believed that furniture should be plain, simple, useful, practical and of sound construction...
example.tran: 震颤派教徒认为家具应当朴素、简单、有用、实用，并且结构合理。

example.ex: The chairs were light in construction yet extremely strong.
example.tran: 这些椅子构造轻巧，但却极为结实。

collins.tran: (对某人言行的)解释，理解，阐释
collins.def: The construction that you put on what someone says or does is your interpretation of what it means.

example.ex: The denial was limited to rejecting the construction put on his remarks...
example.tran: 这种否认仅限于不接受对他所说话语的阐释。

example.ex: He put the wrong construction on what he saw.
example.tran: 他误解了所见到的事情。

collins.def: A grammatical construction is a particular arrangement of words in a sentence, clause, or phrase.

example.ex: Avoid complex verbal constructions.
example.tran: 避免使用复杂的动词结构。

collins.def: If you are lying somewhere, you are in a horizontal position and are not standing or sitting.

example.ex: There was a child lying on the ground...
example.tran: 地上躺着一个小孩。

example.ex: The injured man was lying motionless on his back...
example.tran: 那名受伤的男子一动不动地仰面躺在那里。

collins.def: If an object lies in a particular place, it is in a flat position in that place.

example.ex: ...a newspaper lying on a nearby couch...
example.tran: 放在旁边沙发上的一张报纸

example.ex: Broken glass lay scattered on the carpet.
example.tran: 碎玻璃散落在地毯上。

collins.def: If you say that a place lies in a particular position or direction, you mean that it is situated there.

example.ex: The islands lie at the southern end of the Kurile chain.
example.tran: 这些岛屿位于千岛群岛的南端。

collins.def: You can use lie to say that something is or remains in a particular state or condition. For example, if something lies forgotten, it has been and remains forgotten.

example.ex: She turned back to the Bible lying open in her lap...
example.tran: 她将注意力又转回到摊放在腿上的《圣经》。

example.ex: The picture lay hidden in the archives for over 40 years...
example.tran: 这张照片在档案室中藏了40多年。

collins.def: You can use lie to say what position a competitor or team is in during a competition.

example.ex: I was going well and was lying fourth...
example.tran: 我当时发挥不错，排在第四。

example.ex: Blyth Tait is lying in second place.
example.tran: 布莱思·泰特目前名列第二。

collins.tran: （问题、解决方法、过错等）存在，在于
collins.def: You can talk about where something such as a problem, solution, or fault lies to say what you think it consists of, involves, or is caused by.

example.ex: The problem lay in the large amounts spent on defence...
example.tran: 问题在于防务方面耗资巨大。

example.ex: They will only assume that, as a woman, the fault lies with me...
example.tran: 他们只会假定是我出了错，因为我是女人。

collins.tran: （尤指不快或困难之事）将发生，在等待
collins.def: You use lie in expressions such as lie ahead ,lie in store, and lie in wait when you are talking about what someone is going to experience in the future, especially when  it is something unpleasant or difficult.

example.ex: She'd  need all her strength and bravery to cope with what lay in store...
example.tran: 她需要所有的力量与勇气去应付将会出现的问题。

example.ex: The President's  most serious challenges lie ahead.
example.tran: 对总统来说最为严重的挑战还在后面。

collins.tran: （尤用于墓碑上的文字中）长眠
collins.def: Lie is used in formal English, especially on gravestones, to say that a dead person is buried in a particular place.

example.ex: The inscription reads: Here lies Catin, the son of Magarus...
example.tran: 碑文写着：马格勒斯之子卡廷长眠于此。

example.ex: My father lies in the small cemetery a few miles up this road.
example.tran: 我父亲葬在沿这条路往北几英里处的一个小公墓里。

collins.def: If you say that light, clouds, or fog lie somewhere, you mean that they exist there or are spread over the area mentioned.

example.ex: It had been wet overnight, and a morning mist lay on the field.
example.tran: 前一天晚上下了雨，田野上笼着一层晨雾。

collins.def: The lie of an object or area is its position or the way that it is arranged.

example.ex: The actual site of a city is determined by the natural lie of the land.
example.tran: 城市的实际选址取决于这片土地的自然状况。

means: 常作 innings（与单数或复数动词连用）显身手的机会

collins.tran: (棒球比赛中双方各上场击球一次的)局,回合
collins.def: An inning is one of the nine periods that a standard baseball game is divided into. Each team is at bat once in each inning.

means: （工人间的）伙伴，同事，老兄，老弟〔工人，水手间的亲密称呼〕
配偶〔男女任何一方〕，动物之偶（尤指鸟类），（一对中的）一只，配对物

collins.tran: 伙伴，朋友(尤指男性之间)
collins.def: You can refer to someone's friends as their mates, especially when you are talking about a man and his male friends.

example.ex: He's off drinking with his mates...
example.tran: 他跟哥儿们出去喝酒了。

example.ex: A mate of mine used to play soccer for Liverpool.
example.tran: 我的一个朋友在利物浦队踢过球。

collins.tran: (用于男性之间的称呼)老兄，老弟
collins.def: Some men use mate as a way of addressing other men when they are talking to them.

example.ex: Come on mate, things aren't that bad.
example.tran: 别灰心，兄弟，事情没那么糟。

collins.def: Someone's wife, husband, or sexual partner can be referred to as their mate .

example.ex: He has found his  ideal mate.
example.tran: 他找到了理想的伴侣。

example.ex: ...as women do become as powerful in the marketplace as their mates.
example.tran: 随着女人在商界的确变得和男人一样强大

collins.def: An animal's mate is its sexual partner.

example.ex: The males guard their mates zealously.
example.tran: 雄性动物死死地守护着他们的配偶。

collins.def: When animals mate, a male and a female have sex in order to produce young.

example.ex: This allows the pair to mate properly and stops the hen staying in the nest-box...
example.tran: 这样可以使这对公鸡和母鸡正常交配，让母鸡不再呆在鸡窝里。

example.ex: They want the males to mate with wild females...
example.tran: 他们希望这些雄性动物可以和野生的雌性动物交配。

collins.def: On a commercial ship, the mate or the first mate is the most important officer except for the captain. Officers of lower rank are also called mates .

example.ex: ...the mate of a fishing trawler.
example.tran: 拖网渔船上的大副

collins.def: In the United States Navy, a mate is a petty officer who has a particular set of skills and who assists a warrant officer.
In chess, mate is the same as checkmate .
Skis are long, flat, narrow pieces of wood, metal, or plastic that are fastened to boots so that you can move easily on snow or water.

example.ex: ...a pair of skis.
example.tran: 一副滑雪板

collins.def: When people ski, they move over snow or water on skis.

example.ex: They surf, ski and ride...
example.tran: 他们冲浪，滑雪，还骑马。

example.ex: The whole party then skied off.
example.tran: 然后整群人都滑着雪离去。

collins.tran: 滑雪用的;滑雪的;滑水的
collins.def: You use ski to refer to things that are concerned with skiing.

example.ex: ...the Swiss ski resort of Klosters.
example.tran: 瑞士克洛斯特斯滑雪胜地

example.ex: ...a private ski instructor.
example.tran: 私人滑雪教练

collins.tran: (尤指依靠电或无线电波的)通信系统，通信
collins.def: Communications are the systems and processes that are used to communicate or broadcast information, especially by means of electricity or radio waves.

example.ex: ...a communications satellite.
example.tran: 通讯卫星

example.ex: ...communications equipment.
example.tran: 通讯设备

collins.def: A communication is a message.

example.ex: The ambassador has brought with him a communication from the President.
example.tran: 大使带来了总统的口信。

means: 技术（性）的，工艺的，学术（上）的，专门（技术）的，艺术的
[商]人造的，用工业方法制造的，由市场内部因素（如投机等）引起的
〈美俚〉外表的，表面上的，浅薄的

collins.def: Technical means involving the sorts of machines, processes, and materials that are used in industry, transport, and communications.

example.ex: In order to reach this limit a number of technical problems will have to be solved.
example.tran: 要达到这个限度，还有很多技术问题必须解决。

example.ex: ...jobs that require technical knowledge...
example.tran: 要求具备技术知识的工作岗位

collins.def: You use technical to describe the practical skills and methods used to do an activity such as an art, a craft, or a sport.

example.ex: Their technical ability is exceptional...
example.tran: 他们技艺超群。

example.ex: In the realm of sculpture too, the technical skill of foreign artists was long recognised.
example.tran: 在雕塑领域，外国艺术家的技艺也早已得到认可。

collins.def: Technical language involves using special words to describe the details of a specialized activity.

example.ex: The technical term for sunburn is erythema...
example.tran: 晒斑的专业术语叫红斑。

example.ex: He's just written a book: large format, nicely illustrated and not too technical.
example.tran: 他刚出了本书：大开本，插图精美，专业性也不太强。

collins.tran: (声音或运动的)节奏，韵律，节拍
collins.def: A rhythm is a regular series of sounds or movements.

example.ex: His music of that period fused the rhythms of Jazz with classical forms...
example.tran: 他那个时期的音乐将爵士乐的韵律和古典音乐的形式融合在了一起。

example.ex: He had no sense of rhythm whatsoever...
example.tran: 他没有任何节奏感。

collins.tran: (身体、季节、潮汐等的)规律性变化，节奏
collins.def: A rhythm is a regular pattern of changes, for example changes in your body, in the seasons, or in the tides.

example.ex: Begin to listen to your own body rhythms.
example.tran: 开始聆听你自己身体的节奏。

example.ex: ...the seasonal rhythm of the agricultural year.
example.tran: 一年中农业的季节性

collins.def: If people or animals dig, they make a hole in the ground or in a pile of earth, stones, or rubbish.

example.ex: They tried digging in a patch just below the cave...
example.tran: 他们试着在洞穴正下方的一块地上挖掘。

example.ex: Dig a largish hole and bang the stake in first...
example.tran: 挖一个大点儿的洞，先把木桩敲进去。

collins.def: If you dig into something such as a deep container, you put your hand in it to search for something.

example.ex: He dug into his coat pocket for his keys.
example.tran: 他把手伸进上衣口袋里摸钥匙。

collins.def: If you dig one thing into another or if one thing digs into another, the first thing is pushed hard into the second, or presses hard into it.

example.ex: She digs the serving spoon into the moussaka...
example.tran: 她把分菜匙伸进那盘碎肉茄子蛋中。

example.ex: I grab George's arm and dig my nails into his flesh...
example.tran: 我抓住乔治的胳膊，指甲抠进了他的肉里。

collins.def: If you dig into a subject or a store of information, you study it very carefully in order to discover or check facts.

example.ex: The enquiry dug deeper into the alleged financial misdeeds of his government...
example.tran: 这一调查对其政府涉嫌的财政违规行为展开了进一步深究。

example.ex: He has been digging into the local archives...
example.tran: 他一直在仔细查阅当地的档案资料。

collins.tran: (尤指从自己造成的困境或令人不快的情形中)脱（身）
collins.def: If you dig yourself out of a difficult or unpleasant situation, especially one which you caused yourself, you manage to get out of it.

example.ex: Occupants of the White House have exploited their office at key moments in an election campaign to dig themselves out of trouble...
example.tran: 在竞选活动的关键时刻，白宫的主人利用职权帮助自己摆脱了麻烦。

example.ex: He's taken these measures to try and dig himself out of a hole.
example.tran: 他已采取了这些措施，试图让自己摆脱困境。

collins.def: If you say that you dig something, you mean that you like it and understand it.

example.ex: 'They play classic rock'n'roll,' states her boyfriend, 'My dad digs them too.'...
example.tran: “他们演奏经典摇滚乐，”她的男朋友说道，“我爸爸也喜欢他们。”

example.ex: I can dig it. I don't expect a band always to be innovative.
example.tran: 我可以理解。我不指望一个乐队总能创新。

collins.def: A dig is an organized activity in which people dig into the ground in order to discover ancient historical objects.

example.ex: He's an archaeologist and has been on a dig in Crete for the past year.
example.tran: 他是位考古学家，过去的一年都在参与克里特岛上的一项考古发掘工作。

collins.def: If you have a dig at someone, you say something which is intended to make fun of them or upset them.

example.ex: Americans are always quick to have a dig at the British...
example.tran: 美国人总是动不动就嘲讽英国人。

example.ex: She couldn't resist a dig at Dave after his unfortunate performance.
example.tran: 戴夫糟糕的表演结束后，她忍不住想挖苦他一番。

collins.def: If you give someone a dig in a part of their body, you push them with your finger or your elbow, usually as a warning or as a joke.

example.ex: Cassandra silenced him with a sharp dig in the small of the back.
example.tran: 卡桑德拉使劲戳了一下他的后腰，让他住嘴。

collins.def: If you live in digs, you live in a room in someone else's house and pay them rent.

example.ex: He went to London and lived in digs in Gloucester Road...
example.tran: 他去了伦敦，在格洛斯特路的一所房子里租了房间住。

collins.def: If you dig deep, you do a very thorough investigation into something.

example.ex: I want you to dig deep. Find out who she is, and where she came from.
example.tran: 我想让你彻底调查一下，弄清她是谁，从哪里来的。

collins.def: If someone digs into their pocket or digs into their purse, they manage after some difficulty to find the money to pay for something.

example.ex: Holidaymakers are digging deep into their pockets to book late summer breaks.
example.tran: 度假者想方设法拿出钱来预订夏末的短暂假期。

means: 使能够，提供做…的权利[措施]

collins.def: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it.

example.ex: The new test should enable doctors to detect the disease early.
example.tran: 新的检测手段应该能够使医生们尽早查出这种疾病。

example.ex: ...a new charter for training to enable young people to make the most of their potential.
example.tran: 能够使年轻人充分发挥潜能的新培训规章

collins.def: To enable something to happen means to make it possible for it to happen.

example.ex: The hot sun enables the grapes to reach optimum ripeness...
example.tran: 炙热的阳光使葡萄能够达到最佳成熟状态。

example.ex: A series of holes in the side panels enables the position of the shelves to be adjusted...
example.tran: 通过侧板上的一系列小孔可以对隔板位置进行调整。

collins.def: To enable someone to do something means to give them permission or the right to do it.

example.ex: The republic's legislation enables young people to do a form of alternative service.
example.tran: 共和国的法律允许年轻人服某种形式的替代役。

collins.def: Steam is the hot mist that forms when water boils. Steam vehicles and machines are operated using steam as a means of power.

example.ex: In an electric power plant the heat converts water into high-pressure steam.
example.tran: 在发电厂里，热能将水转化成高压蒸汽。

example.ex: ...the invention of the steam engine.
example.tran: 蒸汽发动机的发明

collins.def: If something steams, it gives off steam.

example.ex: ...restaurants where coffee pots steamed on their burners.
example.tran: 咖啡壶在炉子上冒着热气的餐馆

example.ex: ...a basket of steaming bread rolls.
example.tran: 一篮子热腾腾的面包卷

collins.def: If you steam food or if it steams, you cook it in steam rather than in water.

example.ex: Steam the carrots until they are just beginning to be tender...
example.tran: 将胡萝卜蒸至刚好变软。

example.ex: Leave the vegetables to steam over the rice for the 20 minutes cooking time.
example.tran: 让蔬菜在米饭上蒸 20 分钟。

collins.def: If something such as a plan or a project goes full steam ahead, it progresses quickly.

example.ex: The Government was determined to go full steam ahead with its privatisation programme...
example.tran: 政府下决心要全力实施私有化计划。

example.ex: Plans are rolling full steam ahead for the Jamaica Festival.
example.tran: 庆祝牙买加节的准备工作正开展得如火如荼。

collins.def: If you let off steam, you get rid of your energy, anger, or strong emotions with physical activity or by behaving in a noisy or violent way.

example.ex: Regular exercise helps to combat unwanted stress and is a good way of relaxing or letting off steam.
example.tran: 经常运动有助于摆脱多余的压力，也是放松或宣泄情感的好办法。

collins.tran: (信念、计划、项目等)变得越来越重要，开始发展壮大
collins.def: If a belief, a plan, or a project picks up steam, it starts to develop and become more important.

example.ex: Just as the presidential campaign was picking up steam, riots exploded in Los Angeles.
example.tran: 正当总统竞选活动的声势日益壮大时，洛杉矶爆发了暴乱。

collins.tran: 精疲力竭;丧失热情;泄气
collins.def: If you run out of steam, you stop doing something because you have no more energy or enthusiasm left.

example.ex: I decided to paint the bathroom ceiling but ran out of steam halfway through.
example.tran: 我决定粉刷一下浴室的天花板，但干了一半就精疲力竭了。

collins.def: If you do something under your own steam, you do it without any help from anyone else.

example.ex: Patients who are well enough to turn up under their own steam are well enough to wait to be seen by a doctor.
example.tran: 让那些身体状况不那么糟、还能自己来看病的病人花点时间候诊没什么问题。

collins.def: An exception is a particular thing, person, or situation that is not included in a general statement, judgment, or rule.

example.ex: Few guitarists can sing as well as they can play; Eddie, however, is an exception...
example.tran: 很少有吉他手唱歌像弹吉他那么好，然而埃迪是个例外。

example.ex: There were no floral offerings at the ceremony, with the exception of a single red rose...
example.tran: 除了一朵红色玫瑰花外，仪式上没有任何献花。

collins.def: If you make a general statement, and then say that something or someone is no exception, you are emphasizing that they are included in that statement.

example.ex: Marketing is applied to everything these days, and books are no exception...
example.tran: 现在市场营销已无处不在，图书也不例外。

example.ex: Most people have no real idea how to change to healthy food, and Maureen was no exception.
example.tran: 大多数人并不真正清楚究竟如何转而食用健康食品，莫琳也是如此。

collins.tran: 证明普遍性的例外；规则必有例外
collins.def: If you are making a general statement and you say that something is the exception that proves the rule, you mean that although it seems to contradict your statement, in most other cases your statement will be true.

example.ex: Wine-making and accountants don't usually go together, but Thierry Hasard is an exception that proves the rule.
example.tran: 酿酒和会计通常不搭边，而蒂埃里·阿萨尔却是普遍中的例外。

collins.def: If you take exception to something, you feel offended or annoyed by it, usually with the result that you complain about it.

example.ex: He also took exception to having been spied on...
example.tran: 他也讨厌被暗中监视。

example.ex: And the problem is that they take exception to any kind of noise whatsoever.
example.tran: 问题是他们反感任何形式的噪音。

collins.def: You use with the exception of to introduce a thing or person that is not included in a general statement that you are making.

example.ex: Yesterday was a day off for everybody, with the exception of Lawrence...
example.tran: 昨天所有人都放一天假，劳伦斯除外。

example.ex: In virtually every sport, with the possible exception of women's gymnastics, the players are now bigger and stronger than before.
example.tran: 几乎在所有体育运动中，可能除女子体操外，现在的运动员都要比过去更加高大强壮。

collins.def: You use without exception to emphasize that the statement you are making is true in all cases.

example.ex: The vehicles are without exception old, rusty and dented...
example.tran: 那些车辆一律都很破旧，锈迹斑斑，布满凹痕。

example.ex: Almost without exception those convicted were our friends and colleagues.
example.tran: 那些被判有罪的人几乎无一例外都是我们的朋友和同事。

means: 剧本、广播稿或者电影剧本
为电影（或戏剧等）写剧本

collins.tran: (戏剧、电影)剧本;(电视节目)广播稿
collins.def: The script of a play, film, or television programme is the written version of it.

example.ex: Jenny's writing a film script.
example.tran: 珍妮在写一个电影剧本。

collins.tran: 为(电影等)写剧本;为(广播、电视节目)撰稿
collins.def: The person who scripts a film or a radio or television play writes it.

example.ex: ...James Cameron, who scripted and directed both films.
example.tran: 詹姆斯·卡梅伦，这两部电影的编剧兼导演

collins.tran: (一种语言的)书写系统，字母表
collins.def: You can refer to a particular system of writing as a particular script .

example.ex: ...a text in the Malay language but written in Arabic script.
example.tran: 一篇使用阿拉伯字母书写的马来语演讲稿

collins.def: If you say that something which has happened is not in the script, or that someone has not followed the script, you mean that something has happened which was not expected or intended to happen.

example.ex: Losing was not in the script...
example.tran: 没想到会输掉比赛。

example.ex: The game plan was right. We just didn't follow the script.
example.tran: 比赛战术是正确的。只是我们没有照部署去打。

collins.def: Allied forces or troops are armies from different countries who are fighting on the same side in a war.

example.ex: ...the approaching Allied forces...
example.tran: 正在到来的盟军

example.ex: They're backed by allied warplanes and tanks.
example.tran: 他们受到盟军战机和坦克的掩护。

collins.tran: （国家、军队、政党等）同盟的，结盟的
collins.def: Allied countries, troops, or political parties are united by a political or military agreement.

example.ex: ...forces from three allied nations.
example.tran: 来自三个同盟国的军队

example.ex: ...a think-tank allied to the right wing of the Democratic Party.
example.tran: 与民主党右翼结盟的智囊团

collins.def: If one thing or group is allied to another, it is related to it because the two things have particular qualities or characteristics in common.

example.ex: ...lectures on subjects allied to health, beauty and fitness...
example.tran: 与保健、美容和健身等主题相关的讲座

example.ex: Only now have doctors, and allied medical professionals, come to appreciate this.
example.tran: 直到现在医生和相关医学人士才开始对此有所认识。

collins.def: Something that is allied to another thing occurs with the other thing.

example.ex: He possessed a raw energy allied to a feeling of something special.
example.tran: 他粗犷豪放，给人一种特殊的感觉。

example.ex: ...a disastrous rise in interest rates allied with a stock market slump.
example.tran: 股市下跌的同时，利率却在灾难性地上涨

collins.def: A formula is a plan that is invented in order to deal with a particular problem.

example.ex: It is difficult to imagine how the North and South could ever agree on a formula to unify the divided peninsula.
example.tran: 很难想象南北双方在统一半岛的方案上究竟怎样才能达成一致。

example.ex: ...a peace formula.
example.tran: 和平方案

collins.def: A formula for a particular situation, usually a good one, is a course of action or a combination of actions that is certain or likely to result in that situation.

example.ex: After he was officially pronounced the world's oldest man, he offered this simple formula for a long and happy life...
example.tran: 在他被正式宣布为世界上最年长的人后，他给出了这样一个简单的快乐长寿的秘诀。

example.ex: Clever exploitation of the latest technology would be a sure formula for success...
example.tran: 对最新技术的灵活利用必将带来成功。

collins.def: A formula is a group of letters, numbers, or other symbols which represents a scientific or mathematical rule.

example.ex: He developed a mathematical formula describing the distances of the planets from the Sun.
example.tran: 他研究出了一个用于计算行星与太阳之间距离的数学公式。

collins.def: In science, the formula for a substance is a list of the amounts of various substances which make up that substance, or an indication of the atoms that it is composed of.
Formula is used followed by a number to indicate a particular type of racing car or something relating to that type of car.

example.ex: ...Formula 1 racing cars.
example.tran: 一级方程式赛车

example.ex: ...Formula 3000 racing.
example.tran: 方程式 3000 赛车

collins.def: Formula is a powder which you mix with water to make artificial milk for babies.

example.ex: ...bottles of formula.
example.tran: 几瓶配方奶

collins.def: The beginning of an event or process is the first part of it.

example.ex: This was also the beginning of her recording career...
example.tran: 这也是她唱片生涯的开始。

example.ex: Think of this as a new beginning.
example.tran: 把这当作一个新起点。

collins.def: The beginnings of something are the signs or events which form the first part of it.

example.ex: I had the beginnings of a headache...
example.tran: 我有了头痛的先兆。

example.ex: The discussions were the beginnings of a dialogue with Moscow.
example.tran: 讨论拉开了同莫斯科对话的序幕。

collins.def: The beginning of a period of time is the time at which it starts.

example.ex: The wedding will be at the beginning of March.
example.tran: 婚礼定于三月初举行。

collins.def: The beginning of a piece of written material is the first words or sentences of it.

example.ex: ...the question which was raised at the beginning of this chapter.
example.tran: 在本章开头所提出的问题

collins.def: If you talk about the beginnings of a person, company, or group, you are referring to their backgrounds or origins.

example.ex: His views come from his own humble beginnings.
example.tran: 他的观点源于他卑微的出身。

collins.def: You use beginning to describe someone who is in the early stages of learning to do something.

example.ex: The people that she had in her classroom were beginning learners.
example.tran: 她带的这班学生都是初学者。

means: 破坏，毁灭，消灭，灭亡，扑灭，驱除

collins.def: Destruction is the act of destroying something, or the state of being destroyed.

example.ex: ...an international agreement aimed at halting the destruction of the ozone layer.
example.tran: 一项旨在阻止臭氧层破坏的国际协议

example.ex: ...weapons of mass destruction.
example.tran: 大规模杀伤性武器

collins.tran: 清楚地;明显地;肯定地;当然
collins.def: You use definitely to emphasize that something is the case, or to emphasize the strength of your intention or opinion.

example.ex: I'm definitely going to get in touch with these people...
example.tran: 我肯定会跟这些人取得联系。

example.ex: Something should definitely be done about that...
example.tran: 对此一定要采取一些措施。

collins.def: If something has been definitely decided, the decision will not be changed.

example.ex: He told them that no venue had yet been definitely decided.
example.tran: 他告诉他们还没有确定下场地。

collins.def: A speaker or writer uses yours to refer to something that belongs or relates to the person or people that they are talking or writing to.

example.ex: I'll take my coat upstairs. Shall I take yours, Roberta?...
example.tran: 我要把我的外套拿到楼上去。罗伯塔，要我把你的也拿上去吗？

example.ex: I believe Paul was a friend of yours...
example.tran: 我想保罗曾是你的朋友。

collins.tran: （用于书信结尾的签名前）你的/您的诚挚的/您的忠实的
collins.def: People write yours ,yours sincerely, or yours faithfully at the end of a letter before they sign their name.

example.ex: With best regards, Yours, George...
example.tran: 致以最诚挚的祝愿，您真挚的，乔治

example.ex: Yours faithfully, Michael Moore, London Business School...
example.tran: 您忠实的，迈克尔·穆尔，伦敦商学院

collins.def: You use so-called to indicate that you think a word or expression used to describe someone or something is in fact wrong.

example.ex: These are the facts that explode their so-called economic miracle...
example.tran: 这些就是用来粉碎他们所谓的经济奇迹的事实。

example.ex: More and more companies have gone 'green' and started producing so-called environmentally-friendly products.
example.tran: 越来越多的公司变得“环保”起来，开始生产所谓的环境友好型产品。

collins.tran: (指通常的称谓)所说的，所谓的
collins.def: You use so-called to indicate that something is generally referred to by the name that you are about to use.

example.ex: ...a summit of the world's seven leading market economies, the so-called G-7...
example.tran: 世界七大市场经济国家，即所谓的“七国集团”召开的一次峰会

example.ex: She was one of the so-called Gang of Four.
example.tran: 她是所谓的“四人帮”之一。

collins.def: A guitar is a musical instrument with six strings and a long neck. You play the guitar by plucking or strumming the strings.
Exposure to something dangerous means being in a situation where it might affect you.

example.ex: Exposure to lead is known to damage the brains of young children.
example.tran: 众所周知，接触铅对幼儿的大脑有害。

example.ex: ...the potential exposure of people to nuclear waste.
example.tran: 核废料对人们造成辐射的潜在风险

collins.def: Exposure is the harmful effect on your body caused by very cold weather.

example.ex: He was suffering from exposure and shock but his condition was said to be stable...
example.tran: 他被冻伤了，而且出现了休克，但是据说情况稳定。

example.ex: At least two people died of exposure in Chicago overnight.
example.tran: 昨天晚上，芝加哥至少有两人冻死。

collins.def: The exposure of a well-known person is the revealing of the fact that they are bad or immoral in some way.

example.ex: ...the exposure of Anthony Blunt as a former Soviet spy...
example.tran: 安东尼·布伦特前苏联间谍身份的曝光

example.ex: Their sporting reputation has suffered enormously from Johnson's exposure.
example.tran: 由于约翰逊东窗事发，他们的体育声誉受到了严重损害。

collins.def: Exposure is publicity that a person, company, or product receives.

example.ex: All the candidates have been getting an enormous amount of exposure on television and in the press.
example.tran: 所有候选人都在电视和报刊上频频亮相。

collins.def: In photography, an exposure is a single photograph.

example.ex: Larger drawings tend to require two or three exposures to cover them.
example.tran: 较大的图画往往需要两三张胶片才能拍下来。

collins.def: In photography, the exposure is the amount of light that is allowed to enter a camera when taking a photograph.

example.ex: A tripod also lets you shoot long exposures at night.
example.tran: 三脚架也可以让你在晚上长时间曝光。

example.ex: ...an exposure of 1/18sec at f/11...
example.tran: 1/18秒f/11光圈的曝光量

collins.def: A reward is something that you are given, for example because you have behaved well, worked hard, or provided a service to the community.

example.ex: A bonus of up to 5 per cent can be added to a pupil's final exam marks as a reward for good spelling, punctuation and grammar...
example.tran: 小学生期末考试的分数最多可以加5分，作为对其拼写、标点和语法正确的奖励。

example.ex: He was given the job as a reward for running a successful leadership bid.
example.tran: 因为成功组织了领导职位竞选活动，他得到了这份工作。

collins.def: A reward is a sum of money offered to anyone who can give information about lost or stolen property or about someone who is wanted by the police.

example.ex: The firm last night offered a £10,000 reward for information leading to the conviction of the killer.
example.tran: 昨晚这家公司悬赏 1万英镑，寻找能将凶手定罪的证据。

collins.def: If you do something and are rewarded with a particular benefit, you receive that benefit as a result of doing that thing.

example.ex: Make the extra effort to impress the buyer and you will be rewarded with a quicker sale.
example.tran: 多用心去打动顾客，货物就会更快售出。

collins.def: The rewards of something are the benefits that you receive as a result of doing or having that thing.

example.ex: The company is only just starting to reap the rewards of long-term investments...
example.tran: 这家公司才刚刚开始收获长期投资的回报。

example.ex: Potentially high financial rewards are attached to senior hospital posts.
example.tran: 当上医院的高级职员就有可能享受丰厚的经济报酬。

collins.def: If you say that something rewards your attention or effort, you mean that it is worth spending time or effort on it.

example.ex: The compression and density make this a difficult book to read, but it richly rewards the effort.
example.tran: 这本书内容丰富，思想深刻，很难读懂，但是非常值得一读。

means: （骑兵队等的）急袭，突然袭击，突击，（军舰等的）游击
劫掠，劫夺，（盗贼，狐等的）侵入

collins.def: When soldiers raid a place, they make a sudden armed attack against it, with the aim of causing damage rather than occupying any of the enemy's land.

example.ex: The guerrillas raided banks and destroyed a police barracks and an electricity substation.
example.tran: 游击队突袭了银行，摧毁了一处警察驻地和一个变电站。

collins.def: If the police raid a building, they enter it suddenly and by force in order to look for dangerous criminals or for evidence of something illegal, such as drugs or weapons.

example.ex: Fraud squad officers raided the firm's offices.
example.tran: 反欺诈小组的工作人员突击搜查了这家公司的办公室。

collins.def: If someone raids a building or place, they enter it by force in order to steal something.

example.ex: A 19-year-old man has been found guilty of raiding a bank.
example.tran: 一个19岁的男子被判抢劫银行罪。

collins.tran: 扫荡（冰箱、食品柜等处）的食物
collins.def: If you raid the fridge or the larder, you take food from it to eat instead of a meal or in between meals.

example.ex: She made her way to the kitchen to raid the fridge.
example.tran: 她走向厨房去扫荡冰箱。

collins.def: Steel is a very strong metal which is made mainly from iron. Steel is used for making many things, for example bridges, buildings, vehicles, and cutlery.

example.ex: ...steel pipes.
example.tran: 钢管

example.ex: ...the iron and steel industry...
example.tran: 钢铁工业

collins.def: Steel is used to refer to the industry that produces steel and items made of steel.

example.ex: ...a three-month study of European steel...
example.tran: 对欧洲钢铁工业为期 3 个月的考察研究

example.ex: The company has interests in steel and other products.
example.tran: 公司在钢铁和其他产品领域都有投资。

collins.def: If you steel yourself, you prepare to deal with something unpleasant.

example.ex: Those involved are steeling themselves for the coming battle...
example.tran: 那些参与者正准备迎接即将到来的战斗。

example.ex: I was steeling myself to call round when Simon arrived.
example.tran: 我正下决心准备去拜访时，西蒙来了。

explain: /'s(j)uːɪsaɪd//'suɪsaɪd/ - n. 自杀；自杀者；自杀行为 - adj. 自杀的 - vt. 自杀 - vi. 自杀

means: 进攻（性）的，攻击的，攻势的

collins.tran: 冒犯的；得罪人的；唐突的;无礼的
collins.def: Something that is offensive upsets or embarrasses people because it is rude or insulting.

example.ex: Some friends of his found the play horribly offensive.
example.tran: 他的一些朋友觉得该剧非常让人反感。

example.ex: ...offensive remarks which called into question the integrity of my firm.
example.tran: 令我公司的诚信遭受质疑的冒犯性言论

collins.def: A military offensive is a carefully planned attack made by a large group of soldiers.

example.ex: Its latest military offensive against rebel forces is aimed at reopening important trade routes...
example.tran: 它对叛军的最新一轮军事进攻旨在重新打开重要的贸易通道。

example.ex: The armed forces have launched offensives to recapture lost ground.
example.tran: 这支武装部队已发动进攻要夺回失去的阵地。

collins.tran: （表示愤怒或反对的）强硬行动
collins.def: If you conduct an offensive, you take strong action to show how angry you are about something or how much you disapprove of something.

example.ex: Republicans acknowledged that they had little choice but to mount an all-out offensive on the Democratic nominee.
example.tran: 共和党人承认他们别无选择，只有对获提名的民主党人展开全面攻击。

example.ex: ...a diplomatic offensive.
example.tran: 外交攻势

collins.tran: （体育运动中球队）进攻的，攻方的
collins.def: In sports such as American football or basketball, the offensive team is the team which has possession of the ball and is trying to score.

example.ex: The worst-ever defeat of this team proved once again that Stanford can be one of the most explosive offensive teams in the country.
example.tran: 该队前所未有的惨败再次证明斯坦福队是国内最具爆发力的进攻型队伍之一。

collins.tran: 采取强势行动；采取攻势
collins.def: If you go on the offensive ,go over to the offensive, or take the offensive, you begin to take strong action against people who have been attacking you.

example.ex: The West African forces went on the offensive in response to attacks on them...
example.tran: 西非部队对袭击者展开全力还击。

example.ex: The Foreign Secretary has decided to take the offensive in the discussion on the future of the community.
example.tran: 外交大臣决定在有关该社群未来的讨论中采取攻势。

collins.def: You use merely to emphasize that something is only what you say and not better, more important, or more exciting.

example.ex: Michael is now merely a good friend...
example.tran: 迈克尔现在仅仅是个不错的朋友而已。

example.ex: Francis Watson was far from being merely a furniture expert...
example.tran: 弗朗西斯·沃森远远不止是个家具行家。

collins.tran: 只不过，仅仅(用于强调数量之小)
collins.def: You use merely to emphasize that a particular amount or quantity is very small.

example.ex: The brain accounts for merely three per cent of body weight.
example.tran: 大脑仅占体重的3%。

collins.def: You use not merely before the less important of two contrasting statements, as a way of emphasizing the more important statement.

example.ex: The team needs players who want to play cricket for England, not merely any country that will have them...
example.tran: 球队需要的是想为英格兰而战的板球选手，而不是愿为任何国家打球的选手。

example.ex: His were not merely crimes of theft but of violence against elderly people.
example.tran: 他所犯的不止是偷窃罪，而是针对老年人的暴力犯罪。

collins.def: A hint is a suggestion about something that is made in an indirect way.

example.ex: The Minister gave a strong hint that the government were thinking of introducing tax concessions for mothers...
example.tran: 部长明显地暗示政府正在考虑对母亲们实行税收减免。

example.ex: I'd dropped a hint about having an exhibition of his work up here...
example.tran: 我已经暗示要在这里举办一次他的作品展。

collins.def: If you hint at something, you suggest it in an indirect way.

example.ex: She suggested a trip to the shops and hinted at the possibility of a treat of some sort...
example.tran: 她建议去逛逛商店，并暗示可能要请客。

example.ex: Criticism is hinted at, but never made explicit...
example.tran: 批评总是含沙射影，但从未明说。

collins.tran: 有益的建议;不错的主意;好点子
collins.def: A hint is a helpful piece of advice, usually about how to do something.

example.ex: Here are some helpful hints to make your journey easier...
example.tran: 几条有用的建议可以让你的旅途更轻松。

example.ex: I'm hoping to get some fashion hints.
example.tran: 我希望能得到一些有关时尚的建议。

collins.def: A hint of something is a very small amount of it.

example.ex: She added only a hint of vermouth to the gin...
example.tran: 她只在杜松子酒里加了少许苦艾酒。

example.ex: I glanced at her and saw no hint of irony on her face.
example.tran: 我瞥了她一眼，没有在她的脸上看到一丝嘲弄。

collins.def: A merchant is a person who buys or sells goods in large quantities, especially one who imports and exports them.

example.ex: Any knowledgeable wine merchant would be able to advise you.
example.tran: 任何一个懂行的葡萄酒商人都可以给你提出建议。

collins.def: A merchant is a person who owns or runs a shop, store, or other business.

example.ex: The family was forced to live on credit from local merchants.
example.tran: 这家人不得不靠向当地商人赊账生活。

collins.def: Merchant seamen or ships are involved in carrying goods for trade.

example.ex: There's been a big reduction in the size of the British merchant fleet in recent years.
example.tran: 近些年来英国商船队伍的规模大为缩减。

collins.def: A brilliant person, idea, or performance is extremely clever or skilful.

example.ex: She had a brilliant mind...
example.tran: 她头脑聪明。

example.ex: It was his brilliant performance in 'My Left Foot' that established his reputation.
example.tran: 他在《我的左脚》中的精彩表演使他一举成名。

collins.tran: 非常好的；很棒的；出色的
collins.def: You can say that something is brilliant when you are very pleased about it or think that it is very good.

example.ex: If you get a chance to see the show, do go — it's brilliant...
example.tran: 如果你有机会去看那个演出，你一定要去——棒极了！

example.ex: My sister's  given me this brilliant book.
example.tran: 我的姐姐给了我这本非常好看的书。

collins.def: A brilliant career or success is very successful.

example.ex: He served four years in prison, emerging to find his brilliant career in ruins...
example.tran: 他坐了4年牢，出狱后发现自己的辉煌事业已不复存在。

example.ex: The raid was a brilliant success.
example.tran: 这次偷袭非常成功。

collins.def: A brilliant colour is extremely bright.

example.ex: The woman had brilliant green eyes.
example.tran: 这个女子有双明亮的碧眼。

example.ex: ...a brilliant white open-necked shirt.
example.tran: 一件雪白的开领衬衣

collins.tran: （光线等）明亮的，夺目的，灿烂的
collins.def: You describe light, or something that reflects light, as brilliant when it shines very brightly.

example.ex: The event was held in brilliant sunshine...
example.tran: 这一活动是在阳光明媚的日子举办的。

example.ex: It was 250 million times more brilliant than the Sun.
example.tran: 它比太阳亮2.5亿倍。

collins.def: If you admire someone or something, you like and respect them very much.

example.ex: I admired her when I first met her and I still think she's marvellous...
example.tran: 初次见面时，我就非常佩服她，时至今日我仍然认为她很出色。

example.ex: He admired the way she had coped with life...
example.tran: 他欣赏她处世的方式。

collins.def: If you admire someone or something, you look at them with pleasure.

example.ex: We took time to stop and admire the view.
example.tran: 我们特意驻足欣赏风景。

means: （英国公共汽车或火车上的）查票员

collins.def: An inspector is a person, usually employed by a government agency, whose job is to find out whether people are obeying official regulations.

example.ex: The mill was finally shut down by state safety inspectors.
example.tran: 工厂终于遭国家安全检查员关闭了。

collins.tran: (英国警察中职位低于警司高于巡佐的)巡官,督察
collins.def: In Britain, an inspector is an officer in the police who is higher in rank than a sergeant and lower in rank than a superintendent.

example.ex: Last week gunmen attacked Mogadishu airport killing a police inspector...
example.tran: 上周持枪歹徒袭击了摩加迪沙机场，杀死了一名警察巡官。

example.ex: I got on the phone to Inspector Joplin at Scotland Yard.
example.tran: 我与伦敦警察厅的乔普林巡官通过电话了。

collins.tran: (美国警察中仅次于总警监的)督察长
collins.def: In the United States, an inspector is an officer in the police who is next in rank to a superintendent or police chief.

example.ex: ...San Francisco police inspector Tony Camileri.
example.tran: 旧金山警察局督察长托尼·卡米莱里

collins.tran: 政权，政体（指非民主且统治手段不被认可的政府或政权体系）
collins.def: If you refer to a government or system of running a country as a regime, you are critical of it because you think it is not democratic and uses unacceptable methods.

example.ex: ...the collapse of the Fascist regime at the end of the war...
example.tran: 在战争末期法西斯政权的倒台

example.ex: Pujol was imprisoned and tortured under the Franco regime.
example.tran: 普约尔在佛朗哥政权统治时期受到了监禁和折磨。

collins.tran: （机构、公司、经济等的）管理制度，组织方法
collins.def: A regime is the way that something such as an institution, company, or economy is run, especially when it involves tough or severe action.

example.ex: The authorities moved him to the less rigid regime of an open prison.
example.tran: 当局把他转到一个管制不那么严格的开放式监狱。

example.ex: ...a drastic regime of economic reform and financial discipline.
example.tran: 雷厉风行的经济改革和财经纪律

collins.def: A regime is a set of rules about food, exercise, or beauty that some people follow in order to stay healthy or attractive.

example.ex: He has a new fitness regime to strengthen his back.
example.tran: 他有一个增强背部力量的新健身计划。

collins.def: A pool is the same as a swimming pool .

example.ex: ...a heated indoor pool...
example.tran: 室内温水泳池

example.ex: During winter, many people swim and the pool is crowded.
example.tran: 冬季来游泳的人很多，泳池人满为患。

collins.def: A pool is a fairly small area of still water.

example.ex: The pool had dried up and was full of bracken and reeds.
example.tran: 水塘已经干涸，里面都是欧洲蕨和芦苇。

example.ex: ...beautiful gardens filled with pools, fountains and rare birds.
example.tran: 处处可见水池、喷泉和珍稀鸟类的美丽花园

collins.def: A pool of liquid or light is a small area of it on the ground or on a surface.

example.ex: She was found lying in a pool of blood...
example.tran: 她被发现躺在一片血泊中。

example.ex: It was raining quietly and steadily and there were little pools of water on the gravel drive...
example.tran: 雨一直静静地下着，沙砾车道上积起了一摊摊水。

collins.def: A pool of people, money, or things is a quantity or number of them that is available for an organization or group to use.

example.ex: The available pool of healthy manpower was not as large as military officials had expected...
example.tran: 可用的健壮人力没有军官预计的那么多。

example.ex: The new proposal would create a reserve pool of cash.
example.tran: 这项新的提议将建立一个现金储备基金。

collins.tran: 共用，聚拢（资金、知识、设备等）
collins.def: If a group of people or organizations pool their money, knowledge, or equipment, they share it or put it together so that it can be used for a particular purpose.

example.ex: We pooled ideas and information...
example.tran: 我们集思广益，共享信息。

example.ex: Philip and I pooled our savings to start up my business.
example.tran: 我和菲利普把积蓄凑到一起开办了我的公司。

collins.def: Pool is a game played on a large table covered with a cloth. Players use a long stick called a cue to hit a white ball across the table so that it knocks coloured balls with numbers on them into six holes around the edge of the table.

example.ex: We played pool together and were good mates...
example.tran: 我们一起打过台球，是好哥们儿。

example.ex: The Seaman was a bar for pool players and hard drinkers...
example.tran: “水手”是供台球玩家和酒徒消遣的酒吧。

collins.tran: （下注猜足球比赛结果的）赌球
collins.def: If you do the pools, you take part in a gambling competition in which people try to win money by guessing correctly the results of football matches.

example.ex: The odds of winning the pools are about one in 20 million.
example.tran: 赌球获胜的几率大约是二千万分之一。

collins.tran: (陆军、空军或海军陆战队的)上校
collins.def: A colonel is a senior officer in an army, air force, or the marines.

example.ex: This particular place was run by an ex-Army colonel.
example.tran: 这个地方以前由一位前陆军上校经管。

example.ex: ...Colonel Edward Staley.
example.tran: 爱德华·斯特利上校

collins.def: A neat place, thing, or person is tidy and smart, and has everything in the correct place.

example.ex: So they left her in the neat little house, alone with her memories...
example.tran: 于是他们把她一个人留在整洁的小房子里，只有记忆陪着她。

example.ex: She undressed and put her wet clothes in a neat pile in the corner.
example.tran: 她脱掉衣服，把湿衣服整齐地码成一堆放在角落里。

collins.def: Someone who is neat keeps their home or possessions tidy, with everything in the correct place.

example.ex: 'That's not like Alf,' he said, 'leaving papers muddled like that. He's always so neat.'
example.tran: 他说道：“这不像是阿尔夫的风格，他不会把文件弄得那么乱。他一向很爱整洁。”

collins.tran: 匀整的;秀气的;小巧优雅的
collins.def: A neat object, part of the body, or shape is quite small and has a smooth outline.

example.ex: ...a faded woman with neat features.
example.tran: 姿色虽衰但五官清秀的女人

example.ex: ...neat handwriting.
example.tran: 娟秀的笔迹

collins.def: A neat movement or action is done accurately and skilfully, with no unnecessary movements.

example.ex: A neat move between Black and Keane left Nigel Clough in the clear, but his shot skimmed wide of the far post.
example.tran: 奈杰尔·克拉夫凭借一次漂亮的跑位在布莱克和基恩之间扯出了空当儿，但是他的射门却大大偏出了远门柱。

collins.tran: 巧妙的;简洁的;简便易行的
collins.def: A neat way of organizing, achieving, explaining, or expressing something is clever and convenient.

example.ex: It had been such a neat, clever plan...
example.tran: 这曾是个如此巧妙、机智的计划。

example.ex: Neat solutions are not easily found to these issues...
example.tran: 很难找到解决这些问题的巧妙办法。

collins.def: If you say that something is neat, you mean that it is very good.

example.ex: 'Oh, those new apartments are really neat,' the girl babbled on...
example.tran: 那个女孩赞不绝口地说：“噢，那些新公寓真是非常棒。”

example.ex: It'll be neat to have a father and son playing on the same team...
example.tran: 爸爸和儿子同队效力，那真是太棒了。

collins.def: When someone drinks strong alcohol neat, they do not add a weaker liquid such as water to it.

example.ex: He poured himself a brandy and swallowed it neat...
example.tran: 他给自己倒了一杯白兰地，没兑水就一饮而尽。

example.ex: He took a mouthful of neat whisky, and coughed.
example.tran: 他喝了一口纯威士忌，咳嗽了起来。

collins.def: You use basically for emphasis when you are stating an opinion, or when you are making an important statement about something.

example.ex: This gun is designed for one purpose—it's basically to kill people...
example.tran: 这种枪只有一个用途——就是用来杀人。

example.ex: Basically I think he would be someone who complemented me in terms of character.
example.tran: 我基本上认为他是在性格上和我互补的人。

collins.tran: 大致说来；从根本上来讲
collins.def: You use basically to show that you are describing a situation in a simple, general way, and that you are not concerned with less important details.

example.ex: Basically you've got two choices...
example.tran: 大致说来，你有两个选择。

example.ex: It's basically a vegan diet...
example.tran: 从根本上来讲，这是严格的素食主义饮食。

collins.def: Done is the past participle of do .
A task or activity that is done has been completed successfully.

example.ex: When her deal is done, the client emerges with her purchase.
example.tran: 交易完成后，委托人会出现并将她购买的东西交给她。

collins.def: When something that you are cooking is done, it has been cooked long enough and is ready.

example.ex: As soon as the cake is done, remove it from the oven.
example.tran: 蛋糕一烤好就从炉子里取出来。

collins.def: You say 'Done' when you are accepting a deal, arrangement, or bet that someone has offered to make with you.

example.ex: 'You lead and we'll look for it.' — 'Done.'
example.tran: “你领头，我们来找。”——“行。”

collins.tran: 完全了结的;彻底完成的
collins.def: If you say that something is over and done with, you mean that it is completely finished and you do not have to think about it any more.

example.ex: Once this is all over and done with you can have a rest.
example.tran: 大功告成后你就可以休息了。

means: 速度比赛，赛跑，赛马，赛车等
专为比赛而设计或饲养的，比赛用的

collins.tran: 动物赛跑比赛;(尤指)赛马;赛车
collins.def: Racing refers to races between animals, especially horses, or between vehicles.

example.ex: Mr Honda was himself a keen racing driver in his younger days...
example.tran: 本田先生自己年轻时就是位热衷赛车的车手。

example.ex: ...horse racing...
example.tran: 赛马

collins.def: Your resignation is a formal statement of your intention to leave a job or position.

example.ex: Mr Morgan has offered his resignation and it has been accepted.
example.tran: 摩根先生己经递交了辞呈，并已获准。

example.ex: ...his letter of resignation.
example.tran: 他的辞职书

collins.tran: 屈从;顺从;听任;勉强接受
collins.def: Resignation is the acceptance of an unpleasant situation or fact because you realize that you cannot change it.

example.ex: There was no grief in his expression, only deep resignation...
example.tran: 他的表情里没有悲痛，只有深深的无奈。

example.ex: He sighed with profound resignation.
example.tran: 他极其无奈地叹了一口气。

collins.def: You can refer to the political issues which are important at a particular time as an agenda.

example.ex: Does television set the agenda on foreign policy?...
example.tran: 电视舆论对外交政策有影响吗？

example.ex: Many of the coalition members could have their own political agendas...
example.tran: 许多联盟成员可能会有他们自己的政治议题。

collins.def: An agenda is a list of the items that have to be discussed at a meeting.

example.ex: This is sure to be an item on the agenda next week...
example.tran: 这一定会成为下星期议事日程上的一项议题。

example.ex: High on the agenda of tomorrow's meeting will be the turmoil in Japan.
example.tran: 日本发生的骚乱将是明天会议的首要议题。

collins.def: An embassy is a group of government officials, headed by an ambassador, who represent their government in a foreign country. The building in which they work is also called an embassy .

example.ex: The American Embassy has already complained...
example.tran: 美国大使馆已经提出了抗议。

example.ex: Mr Cohen held discussions at the embassy with one of the rebel leaders.
example.tran: 科恩先生在大使馆和其中一个叛军头目进行了磋商。

means: 山谷，溪谷，峡谷，谷地，深谷

collins.def: A valley is a low stretch of land between hills, especially one that has a river flowing through it.

example.ex: ...a wooded valley set against the backdrop of Monte Rosa.
example.tran: 罗莎峰背后树木繁茂的山谷

example.ex: ...the Loire valley.
example.tran: 卢瓦尔山谷

collins.tran: （用于科研的）实验室，研究室，实验楼
collins.def: A laboratory is a building or a room where scientific experiments, analyses, and research are carried out.
A laboratory in a school, college, or university is a room containing scientific equipment where students are taught science subjects such as chemistry.

collins.tran: （改变或区别）显著的，显而易见的
collins.def: A marked change or difference is very obvious and easily noticed.

example.ex: There has been a marked increase in crimes against property...
example.tran: 侵财案件明显增加了。

example.ex: He was a man of austere habits, in marked contrast to his more flamboyant wife...
example.tran: 他处事严谨，与他爱张扬的妻子形成了鲜明的对比。

collins.tran: 成为攻击对象的;处境危险的
collins.def: If you describe someone as a marked man or woman, you mean that they are in danger from someone who wants to harm or kill them.

example.ex: All he needs to do is make one phone call and I'm a marked man.
example.tran: 他只消打一个电话，我就大难临头了。

collins.def: If you fold something such as a piece of paper or cloth, you bend it so that one part covers another part, often pressing the edge so that it stays in place.

example.ex: He folded the paper carefully...
example.tran: 他把纸小心地折起来。

example.ex: Fold the omelette in half...
example.tran: 把煎蛋对折。

collins.def: A fold in a piece of paper or cloth is a bend that you make in it when you put one part of it over another part and press the edge.

example.ex: Make another fold and turn the ends together.
example.tran: 再折一下，把末端对齐。

collins.def: The folds in a piece of cloth are the curved shapes which are formed when it is not hanging or lying flat.

example.ex: The priest fumbled in the folds of his gown.
example.tran: 牧师胡乱整了整长袍上的褶皱。

collins.def: If a piece of furniture or equipment folds or if you can fold it, you can make it smaller by bending or closing parts of it.

example.ex: The back of the bench folds forward to make a table...
example.tran: 长凳的靠背可以向前翻折成一张桌子。

example.ex: This portable seat folds flat for easy storage...
example.tran: 这张便携椅可以折叠，便于收纳。

collins.def: If you fold your arms or hands, you bring them together and cross or link them, for example over your chest.

example.ex: Meer folded his arms over his chest and turned his head away...
example.tran: 米尔双臂交叉在胸前，把头转到一边。

example.ex: Mrs Ringrose sat down and folded her hands in her lap.
example.tran: 林罗斯夫人坐下来，双手叠放在腿上。

collins.def: If a business or organization folds, it is unsuccessful and has to close.

example.ex: But as other shops fold, the march of the superstores continues...
example.tran: 但在其他商店纷纷关门倒闭之时，大型超市的强劲扩张势头却依旧不减。

example.ex: 2,500 small businesses were folding each week.
example.tran: 每周有2,500家小企业关张。

collins.def: When someone joins an organization or group, you can say that they have come into the fold. When they leave the organization or group, you can say that they leave the fold .

example.ex: The EU wanted to bring the US back into the fold...
example.tran: 欧盟想要让美国重新回到他们的阵营之中。

example.ex: He might find it difficult to return to the family fold when he realizes his mistake.
example.tran: 他可能会发现等他意识到自己的错误时再想重返家族已经非常难了。

collins.def: In cooking, if you fold in an ingredient or fold it into the other ingredients, you mix it very gently into the other ingredients.

example.ex: Fold in the flour...
example.tran: 拌入面粉。

example.ex: Fold the cream into the egg yolk mixture.
example.tran: 把奶油调入蛋黄液中。

collins.def: If you fold something up, you make it into a smaller, neater shape by folding it, usually several times.

example.ex: She folded it up, and tucked it into her purse...
example.tran: 她将其折叠起来，塞进了钱包里。

example.ex: He folded up his paper and put it away.
example.tran: 他把文件折了几折，然后收了起来。

collins.def: When something drifts somewhere, it is carried there by the movement of wind or water.

example.ex: We proceeded to drift on up the river...
example.tran: 我们继续向河流的上游漂流。

example.ex: The climbing balloon drifted silently over the countryside...
example.tran: 不断上升的气球静静地飘过乡间。

collins.tran: 无意间进入;不知不觉陷入
collins.def: If someone or something drifts into a situation, they get into that situation in a way that is not planned or controlled.

example.ex: We need to offer young people drifting into crime an alternative set of values...
example.tran: 我们需要给那些无意间犯了罪的年轻人灌输另一套价值观。

example.ex: She and her husband drifted apart and, eventually, they divorced...
example.tran: 她和她丈夫渐行渐远,最后他们离婚了。

collins.def: If you say that someone drifts around, you mean that they travel from place to place without a plan or settled way of life.

example.ex: You've been drifting from job to job without any real commitment.
example.tran: 你一直在无目的地更换工作，从未真正投入进去。

collins.tran: 移动;动向;趋势;逐渐变化
collins.def: A drift is a movement away from somewhere or something, or a movement towards somewhere or something different.

example.ex: ...the drift towards the cities.
example.tran: 涌向城市的趋势

collins.def: To drift somewhere means to move there slowly or gradually.

example.ex: As rural factories shed labour, people drift towards the cities.
example.tran: 由于农村的工厂纷纷裁员,人们逐渐流向城市。

collins.def: If sounds drift somewhere, they can be heard but they are not very loud.

example.ex: Cool summer dance sounds are drifting from the stereo indoors.
example.tran: 清凉的夏日舞曲的声音从室内音响中传了出来。

collins.def: If snow drifts, it builds up into piles as a result of the movement of the wind.

example.ex: The snow, except where it drifted, was only calf-deep...
example.tran: 除了吹得堆积起来的地方,雪只有小腿肚深。

example.ex: The storm caused severe drifting.
example.tran: 暴风雪造成了严重的积雪现象。

collins.def: A drift is a mass of snow that has built up into a pile as a result of the movement of wind.

example.ex: ...a nine-foot snow drift.
example.tran: 9英尺深的雪堆

collins.def: A drift of something is an amount of it that has been created by the movement of wind or water.

example.ex: There was a drift of smoke above the trees.
example.tran: 树林上空飘浮着一股烟。

collins.def: The drift of an argument or speech is the general point that is being made in it.

example.ex: Grace was beginning to get his drift...
example.tran: 格雷丝慢慢明白了他的意思。

example.ex: Anybody who's listening will get the drift of what he was saying...
example.tran: 任何一个在专心听的人都会领悟他所说的大意。

collins.def: A pan is a round metal container with a long handle, which is used for cooking things in, usually on top of a cooker or stove.

example.ex: Heat the butter and oil in a large pan.
example.tran: 把黄油和食用油放到大平底锅里加热。

collins.def: A pan is a shallow metal container used for baking foods.

collins.tran: 抨击，严厉批评（影片、书籍等）
collins.def: If something such as a film or a book is panned by journalists, they say it is very bad.

example.ex: His first high-budget movie, called 'Brain Donors', was panned by the critics.
example.tran: 他的第一部高成本制作电影《撞板三舞男》遭到恶评。

collins.def: If you pan a film or television camera or if it pans somewhere, it moves slowly round so that a wide area is filmed.

example.ex: The camera panned along the line of players...
example.tran: 摄像机沿着那排选手移动拍摄。

example.ex: He panned over the crowd for a few minutes before swivelling back to the right...
example.tran: 他从头到尾移动拍摄了那群人好几分钟，才转回右侧。

collins.def: If someone pans for gold, they use a shallow metal container to try to find small pieces of gold from a river.

example.ex: People came westward in the 1800s to pan for gold...
example.tran: 在19世纪，人们前往西部淘金。

example.ex: Every year they panned about a ton and a half of gold.
example.tran: 每年他们淘出大约1.5吨金子。

collins.def: If one thing spurs you to do another, it encourages you to do it.

example.ex: It's the money that spurs these fishermen to risk a long ocean journey in their flimsy boats...
example.tran: 是金钱驱使这些渔民驾着破旧小船冒险出海远航。

example.ex: His friend's  plight had spurred him into taking part.
example.tran: 朋友的困境促使他投身参与。

collins.def: If something spurs a change or event, it makes it happen faster or sooner.

example.ex: The administration may put more emphasis on spurring economic growth...
example.tran: 政府可能会更加重视推动经济增长。

example.ex: The trade pacts will spur an exodus of US businesses to Mexico.
example.tran: 这些贸易协定将会促使大批美国企业涌向墨西哥。

collins.def: Something that acts as a spur to something else encourages a person or organization to do that thing or makes it happen more quickly.

example.ex: ...a belief in competition as a spur to efficiency...
example.tran: 认为竞争会促进效率的信念

example.ex: Redundancy is the spur for many to embark on new careers.
example.tran: 裁员促使很多人开始从事新事业。

collins.def: Spurs are small metal wheels with sharp points that are attached to the heels of a rider's boots. The rider uses them to make their horse go faster.
The spur of a hill or mountain is a piece of ground which sticks out from its side.
If you do something on the spur of the moment, you do it suddenly, without planning it beforehand.

example.ex: They admitted they had taken a vehicle on the spur of the moment...
example.tran: 他们承认是一时冲动偷走了一辆车。

example.ex: It wasn't a spur-of-the-moment decision. We discussed it in detail beforehand.
example.tran: 这可不是头脑一热作出的决定。我们事先仔细地讨论过。

collins.def: If you win your spurs or earn your spurs, you achieve a particular status by proving that you can do something skilfully.

example.ex: Young conductors earn their spurs in a small orchestra or opera house.
example.tran: 年轻的指挥家们在小乐队或小歌剧院里崭露头角。

collins.tran: 严明的;严格的;必须恪守的
collins.def: A strict rule or order is very clear and precise or severe and must always be obeyed completely.

example.ex: The officials had issued strict instructions that we were not to get out of the jeep...
example.tran: 有关官员严令禁止我们下吉普车。

example.ex: French privacy laws are very strict...
example.tran: 法国的隐私法非常严苛。

collins.def: If a parent or other person in authority is strict, they regard many actions as unacceptable and do not allow them.

example.ex: My parents were very strict.
example.tran: 父母对我要求非常严格。

example.ex: ...a few schools selected for their high standards and their strict discipline.
example.tran: 因教学水平高、纪律严而入选的几所学校

collins.def: If you talk about the strict meaning of something, you mean the precise meaning of it.

example.ex: It's not quite peace in the strictest sense of the word, rather the absence of war.
example.tran: 严格说来，这并不是真正的和平，只是没有战争罢了。

collins.def: You use strict to describe someone who never does things that are against their beliefs.

example.ex: Four million Britons are now strict vegetarians...
example.tran: 目前有400万英国人是严格的素食者。

example.ex: He was a strict, old-school Freudian.
example.tran: 他是个不折不扣、传统守旧的弗洛伊德学说信奉者。

collins.def: A coalition is a government consisting of people from two or more political parties.

example.ex: Since June the country has had a coalition government...
example.tran: 从6月份起，该国一直由一个联合政府执掌政权。

example.ex: It took five months for the coalition to agree on and publish a medium-term economic programme.
example.tran: 联合政府花了5个月的时间才达成并公布了一项中期经济计划。

collins.def: A coalition is a group consisting of people from different political or social groups who are co-operating to achieve a particular aim.

example.ex: He had been opposed by a coalition of about 50 civil rights, women's and Latino organizations.
example.tran: 大约有50个民权组织、女性社团和拉丁裔社团联合起来反对他。

collins.def: If you solve a problem or a question, you find a solution or an answer to it.

example.ex: Their domestic reforms did nothing to solve the problem of unemployment...
example.tran: 他们的国内改革未能解决失业问题。

example.ex: We may now be able to get a much better idea of the true age of the universe, and solve one of the deepest questions of our origins.
example.tran: 现在，我们也许能够更加清楚地了解宇宙生成的年代，并且解答关于人类起源最为深奥的问题之一。

collins.tran: 人类免疫缺陷病毒;艾滋病病毒
collins.def: HIV is a virus which reduces people's resistance to illness and can cause AIDS. HIV is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'hu-man immunodeficiency virus'.

collins.tran: 艾滋病病毒检测呈阳性的/阴性的
collins.def: If someone is HIV positive, they are infected with the HIV virus, and may develop AIDS. If someone is HIV negative, they are not infected with the virus.

collins.tran: 在…旁边；沿着…的边；与…并排靠拢
collins.def: If one thing is alongside another thing, the first thing is next to the second.

example.ex: He crossed the street and walked alongside Central Park...
example.tran: 他穿过街道，沿着中央公园走。

example.ex: Much of the industry was located alongside rivers.
example.tran: 许多工厂都设在河边。

collins.def: If you work alongside other people, you all work together in the same place.

example.ex: He had worked alongside Frank and Mark and they had become friends...
example.tran: 他与弗兰克和马克一起工作过，并且成了朋友。

example.ex: Men aged 60 are fighting alongside young boys.
example.tran: 年届六十的男人们和少年小伙们并肩作战。

collins.def: If one thing exists or develops alongside another, the two things exist or develop together at the same time.

example.ex: Her self-confidence will develop alongside her technique...
example.tran: 随着她的技术不断提高，她会愈发自信。

example.ex: Alongside the Job Creation Programme they launched a Work Experience Programme.
example.tran: 在开展创造就业项目的同时，他们还启动了工作经历项目。

collins.def: If you cope with a problem or task, you deal with it successfully.

example.ex: It was amazing how my mother coped with bringing up three children on less than three pounds a week...
example.tran: 我妈妈用每周不到3英镑的钱抚养大了3个孩子，简直太不可思议了。

example.ex: The problems were an annoyance, but we managed to cope.
example.tran: 这些问题很讨厌，但是我们都设法解决了。

collins.tran: 应付，忍受(不愉快的局面)
collins.def: If you have to cope with an unpleasant situation, you have to accept it or bear it.

example.ex: Never before has the industry had to cope with war and recession at the same time...
example.tran: 这个行业以前从未有过必须同时应付战争和萧条的经历。

example.ex: She has had to cope with losing all her previous status and money.
example.tran: 她不得不忍受彻底失去以前所拥有的地位和金钱的痛苦。

collins.def: If a machine or a system can cope with something, it is large enough or complex enough to deal with it satisfactorily.

example.ex: New blades have been designed to cope with the effects of dead insects...
example.tran: 新的桨片设计使其可以应付昆虫尸体带来的影响。

example.ex: The country's prisons are filled with drug-takers, and cannot cope with the numbers...
example.tran: 这个国家的监狱里挤满了瘾君子，都容纳不下了。

collins.tran: (基督教牧师在特殊仪式中所穿的)长袍，法衣
collins.def: A cope is a long sleeveless piece of clothing worn by some Christian priests on special occasions.
A weekly event or publication happens or appears once a week or every week.

example.ex: Each course comprises 10-12 informal weekly meetings...
example.tran: 每门课程都包括10至12次每周一次的非正式讨论会。

example.ex: We go and do the weekly shopping every Thursday.
example.tran: 我们每周四去采购一次。

collins.def: Weekly quantities or rates relate to a period of one week.

example.ex: In addition to my weekly wage, I got a lot of tips.
example.tran: 除了每周的薪水外，我还能得到不少小费。

collins.def: A weekly is a newspaper or magazine that is published once a week.

example.ex: Two of the four national daily papers are to become weeklies.
example.tran: 4份全国性日报中有两份将改为周报。

collins.def: The tone of a sound is its particular quality.

example.ex: Cross could hear him speaking in low tones to Sarah.
example.tran: 克罗斯听得到他对萨拉低声说话。

example.ex: ...the clear tone of the bell.
example.tran: 清亮的铃音

collins.def: Someone's tone is a quality in their voice which shows what they are feeling or thinking.

example.ex: I still didn't like his tone of voice...
example.tran: 我还是不喜欢他说话的语气。

example.ex: Suddenly he laughed again, this time with a cold, sharp tone…
example.tran: 突然他又笑了，这次笑得冷漠、刺耳。

collins.def: The tone of a speech or piece of writing is its style and the opinions or ideas expressed in it.

example.ex: The spokesman said the tone of the letter was very friendly...
example.tran: 发言人说信函的语气非常友好。

example.ex: His comments to reporters were conciliatory in tone...
example.tran: 他对记者们的讲话带着安抚的口吻。

collins.def: The tone of a place or an event is its general atmosphere.

example.ex: The high tone of the occasion was assured by the presence of a dozen wealthy patrons…
example.tran: 十几位富有资助人的出席确保了仪式的高格调。

example.ex: The service desk at the entrance, with its friendly, helpful and efficient staff, sets the tone for the rest of the store.
example.tran: 入口处设有服务台，加之友好、热心与高效的服务人员，营造了这家商店的整体氛围。

collins.tran: （身体的）强健状况；(尤指肌肉的)紧实度，结实度
collins.def: The tone of someone's body, especially their muscles, is its degree of firmness and strength.

example.ex: ...stretch exercises that aim to improve muscle tone...
example.tran: 旨在提高肌肉结实度的伸展锻炼

example.ex: Keeping your muscles strong and in tone helps you to avoid back problems.
example.tran: 保持肌肉强健有力有助于避免背部疾病。

collins.def: Something that tones your body makes it firm and strong.

example.ex: This movement lengthens your spine and tones the spinal nerves...
example.tran: 这一动作舒展脊椎，使脊神经更加强健。

example.ex: Try these toning exercises before you start the day.
example.tran: 在开始一天的活动之前，试着做做这些强身健体的体操。

collins.def: A tone is one of the lighter, darker, or brighter shades of the same colour.

example.ex: Each brick also varies slightly in tone, texture and size...
example.tran: 每块砖在色调、质地与大小上也都略有不同。

example.ex: I'm a cheery sort of person, so I like cheerful tones.
example.tran: 我是个活泼类型的人，因此喜欢明亮的色调。

collins.def: If one thing tones with another, the two things look nice together because their colours are similar in quality or brightness.

example.ex: Princess Margaret toned with her in a turquoise print dress.
example.tran: 玛格丽特公主那条青绿色的印花裙子与她很相配。

collins.def: A tone is one of the sounds that you hear when you are using a telephone, for example the sound that tells you that a number is engaged or busy, or no longer exists.
A tone is a difference in pitch between two musical notes equal to two semitones.
If you say that something lowers the tone of a place or event, you mean that it is not appropriate and makes the place or event seem less respectable.

example.ex: Councillors say plastic-framed windows lower the tone of the neighbourhood.
example.tran: 市政会委员说塑料框架的窗户让这个社区掉份儿了。

collins.tran: 使(颜色)柔和；使(味道)变淡;调和
collins.def: If you tone down a colour or a flavour, you make it less bright or strong.

example.ex: When Ken Hom wrote his first book for the BBC he was asked to tone down the spices and garlic in his recipes.
example.tran: 当肯·霍姆为英国广播公司写第一本书的时候，他被要求在菜谱里少用些香料和大蒜。

collins.def: If you have a conversation with someone, you talk with them, usually in an informal situation.

example.ex: He's a talkative guy, and I struck up a conversation with him...
example.tran: 他是一个健谈的人，于是我开始和他攀谈起来。

example.ex: I waited for her to finish a telephone conversation.
example.tran: 我等着她打完电话。

collins.def: If you say that people are in conversation, you mean that they are talking together.

example.ex: When I arrived I found her in conversation with Mrs Williams.
example.tran: 我到的时候，发现她正在和威廉斯夫人谈话。

collins.def: If you make conversation, you talk to someone in order to be polite and not because you really want to.

example.ex: He had been trying to make conversation.
example.tran: 他一直在尽量找话说。

collins.def: A pile of things is a mass of them that is high in the middle and has sloping sides.

example.ex: ...a pile of sand...
example.tran: 一堆沙子

example.ex: ...a little pile of crumbs...
example.tran: 一小堆面包屑

collins.tran: （一个压着一个摆放整齐的）叠，摞
collins.def: A pile of things is a quantity of things that have been put neatly somewhere so that each thing is on top of the one below.

example.ex: ...a pile of boxes...
example.tran: 一叠盒子

example.ex: We sat in Sam's study, among the piles of books...
example.tran: 我们坐在萨姆的书房里，身边是一堆一堆的书。

collins.def: If you pile things somewhere, you put them there so that they form a pile.

example.ex: He was piling clothes into the  suitcase...
example.tran: 他在把衣服一件件叠放进手提箱中。

example.ex: A few newspapers and magazines were piled on a table.
example.tran: 几份报纸和杂志堆在桌上。

collins.def: If something is piled with things, it is covered or filled with piles of things.

example.ex: Tables were piled high with local produce.
example.tran: 桌上高高堆放着当地的农产品。

example.ex: ...trucks piled with luggage.
example.tran: 塞满成堆行李的卡车

collins.def: If you talk about a pile of something or piles of something, you mean a large amount of it.

example.ex: I've got a pile of questions afterwards for you.
example.tran: 我有一大堆的问题等着过后问你。

example.ex: ...a whole pile of disasters.
example.tran: 灾难迭至

collins.def: If a group of people pile into or out of a vehicle, they all get into it or out of it in a disorganized way.

example.ex: They all piled into Jerrold's car...
example.tran: 他们一窝蜂地挤进杰罗尔德的车里。

example.ex: A fleet of police cars suddenly arrived. Dozens of officers piled out.
example.tran: 突然开来一队警车，数十个警察一拥而出。

collins.tran: （尤指富人或要人居住的）高大宏伟的建筑物
collins.def: You can refer to a large impressive building as a pile, especially when it is the home of a rich important person.

example.ex: ...some stately pile in the country.
example.tran: 乡下某座恢宏气派的建筑

collins.def: Piles are wooden, concrete, or metal posts which are pushed into the ground and on which buildings or bridges are built. Piles are often used in very wet areas so that the buildings do not flood.

example.ex: ...settlements of wooden houses, set on piles along the shore.
example.tran: 建在沿岸桩柱上的木制房屋居住区

collins.def: Piles are painful swellings that can appear in the veins inside a person's anus.

collins.tran: （地毯或织物的）绒面，绒毛，绒头
collins.def: The pile of a carpet or of a fabric such as velvet is its soft surface. It consists of a lot of little threads standing on end.

example.ex: ...the carpet's thick pile.
example.tran: 地毯的厚绒

collins.tran: 处于（社会或某组织的）下层/上层
collins.def: Someone who is at the bottom of the pile is low down in society or low down in an organization. Someone who is at the top of the pile is high up in society or high up in an organization.
A casualty is a person who is injured or killed in a war or in an accident.

example.ex: Troops fired on demonstrators near the Royal Palace causing many casualties.
example.tran: 军队在皇宫附近向示威人群开枪，造成大量伤亡。

collins.def: A casualty of a particular event or situation is a person or a thing that has suffered badly as a result of that event or situation.

example.ex: Fiat has been one of the greatest casualties of the recession.
example.tran: 菲亚特一直是经济萧条中损失最惨重的公司之一。

collins.def: Casualty is the part of a hospital where people who have severe injuries or sudden illnesses are taken for emergency treatment.

example.ex: I was taken to casualty at St Thomas's Hospital.
example.tran: 我被送往圣·托马斯医院的急救室。

collins.def: If something gives you pleasure, you get a feeling of happiness, satisfaction, or enjoyment from it.

example.ex: Watching sport gave him great pleasure...
example.tran: 观看体育比赛给他以极大的愉悦。

example.ex: Everybody takes pleasure in eating...
example.tran: 每个人都从吃中得到满足感。

collins.tran: （尤指工作、职责之外的）娱乐，消遣
collins.def: Pleasure is the activity of enjoying yourself, especially rather than working or doing what you have a duty to do.

example.ex: He mixed business and pleasure in a perfect and dynamic way...
example.tran: 他以互动的方式将工作和娱乐完美地结合起来。

example.ex: I read for pleasure.
example.tran: 我读书消遣。

collins.tran: 乐趣；乐事；给人愉快的事物
collins.def: A pleasure is an activity, experience or aspect of something that you find very enjoyable or satisfying.

example.ex: Watching TV is our only pleasure.
example.tran: 看电视是我们唯一的乐事。

example.ex: ...the pleasure of seeing a smiling face.
example.tran: 看到一张微笑的面孔的愉悦

collins.tran: 很高兴见到…/…莅临的荣幸
collins.def: If you meet someone for the first time, you can say, as a way of being polite, that it is a pleasure to meet them. You can also ask for the pleasure of someone's company as a polite and formal way of inviting them somewhere.

example.ex: 'A pleasure to meet you, sir,' he said...
example.tran: 他说：“先生，很高兴见到您。”

example.ex: Mr and Mrs James Stephens request the pleasure of your company at the marriage of their daughter Caroline Mary to Mr David Smith.
example.tran: 詹姆斯·斯蒂芬斯夫妇敬请您莅临小女卡罗琳·玛丽与戴维·史密斯先生的婚礼。

collins.tran: （受到感谢时的一种礼貌回答）别客气，不用谢，是我的荣幸
collins.def: You can say 'It's a pleasure ' or 'My pleasure ' as a polite way of replying to someone who has just thanked you for doing something.

example.ex: 'Thanks very much anyhow.' — 'It's a pleasure.'
example.tran: “无论怎样，非常感谢。”——“别客气。”

example.ex: 'Thanks for your call.' — 'My pleasure.'
example.tran: “谢谢你打来电话。”——“不用谢。”
