example.tran: 我们仍有机会获得联赛冠军，而且我们还想一路杀进足总杯决赛。

collins.def: To execute someone means to kill them as a punishment for a serious crime.

example.ex: He was executed by lethal injection earlier today...
example.tran: 他于今天早些时候被注射处死。

example.ex: One group claimed to have executed the American hostage...
example.tran: 一个组织声称已经处决了那名美国人质。

collins.def: If you execute a plan, you carry it out.

example.ex: We are going to execute our campaign plan to the letter.
example.tran: 我们将严格施行我们的竞选计划。

collins.def: If you execute a difficult action or movement, you successfully perform it.

example.ex: I executed the hairpin turn high on the sheer western face of the mountains...
example.tran: 我在山脉西侧陡峭的高处成功地急转弯。

example.ex: The landing was skilfully executed.
example.tran: 熟练地完成了着陆。

collins.def: When someone executes a work of art, they make or produce it, using an idea as a basis.

example.ex: Morris executed a suite of twelve drawings in 1978...
example.tran: 莫里斯在1978年创作了由12幅画组成的一组作品。

example.ex: A well-executed shot of a tall ship is a joy to behold.
example.tran: 欣赏优秀的高桅横帆船摄影作品是种乐趣。

collins.def: A poem is a piece of writing in which the words are chosen for their beauty and sound and are carefully arranged, often in short lines which rhyme.
An auto is a car.

example.ex: ...the auto industry.
example.tran: 汽车工业

collins.def: The interior of something is the inside part of it.

example.ex: The interior of the house was furnished with heavy, old-fashioned pieces...
example.tran: 房子里摆放着笨重的旧式家具。

example.ex: The boat's interior badly needed painting.
example.tran: 该船内部亟需油漆。

collins.def: You use interior to describe something that is inside a building or vehicle.

example.ex: The interior walls were painted green...
example.tran: 内墙漆成了绿色。

example.ex: There is more interior space than in some rival cars...
example.tran: 车内空间比有些同类车宽敞。

collins.def: The interior of a country or continent is the central area of it.

example.ex: ...a 5-day hike into the interior.
example.tran: 为期 5 天、深入内地的远足

example.ex: ...the unknown interior of South America...
example.tran: 南美洲不为人知的腹地

collins.def: A country's interior minister, ministry, or department deals with affairs within that country, such as law and order.

example.ex: The French Interior Minister has intervened in a scandal over the role of a secret police force.
example.tran: 法国内政部长对一起涉及秘密警察部队所扮演角色的丑闻进行了干预。

collins.def: A country's minister or ministry of the interior deals with affairs within that country, such as law and order.

example.ex: An official from the Ministry of the Interior said six people had died.
example.tran: 内政部的一位官员说已有 6 人丧生。

collins.def: Interior thoughts or processes go on inside someone's head and are not expressed aloud.

example.ex: She depicted the interior life of human beings, and particularly their moral stresses and strains.
example.tran: 她描写人类的内心生活,尤其是他们所承受的道德压力。

example.ex: ...the mind's interior space.
example.tran: 心灵的内在空间

means: 夏威夷群岛的书面缩写

collins.def: In informal situations, you say 'hi' to greet someone.

example.ex: 'Hi, Liz,' she said shyly.
example.tran: “你好，利兹，”她腼腆地说。

collins.tran: （作为文学形式的）诗，诗歌，韵文
collins.def: Poems, considered as a form of literature, are referred to as poetry .

example.ex: ...Russian poetry...
example.tran: 俄罗斯诗歌

example.ex: Lawrence Durrell wrote a great deal of poetry...
example.tran: 劳伦斯·达雷尔创作了大量的诗歌。

collins.tran: 诗的意境；诗一般美的事物
collins.def: You can describe something very beautiful as poetry .

example.ex: His music is purer poetry than a poem in words.
example.tran: 他的音乐比真正的诗歌更具诗意。

collins.def: The leader of the government of a country is sometimes referred to as the country's premier .

example.ex: ...Australian premier Paul Keating.
example.tran: 澳大利亚总理保罗·基廷

collins.tran: 最好的；最佳的；最重要的
collins.def: Premier is used to describe something that is considered to be the best or most important thing of a particular type.

example.ex: ...the country's premier opera company.
example.tran: 这个国家的顶尖歌剧团

collins.def: If you decorate something, you make it more attractive by adding things to it.

example.ex: He decorated his room with pictures of all his favorite sports figures...
example.tran: 他用自己最喜欢的几位体育明星的照片装饰房间。

example.ex: Use shells to decorate boxes, trays, mirrors or even pots.
example.tran: 用贝壳来装点盒子、托盘、镜子甚至是花盆。

collins.def: If you decorate a room or the inside of a building, you put new paint or wallpaper on the walls and ceiling, and paint the woodwork.

example.ex: When they came to decorate the rear bedroom, it was Jemma who had the final say...
example.tran: 他们装修后面的卧室时，是耶马最后说了算。

example.ex: The boys are planning to decorate when they get the time...
example.tran: 小伙子们正打算有时间油漆一下。

collins.def: If something decorates a place or an object, it makes it look more attractive.

example.ex: Constable posters decorate the walls.
example.tran: 康斯太布尔风景画的海报装点着那些墙面。

collins.def: If someone is decorated, they are given a medal or other honour as an official reward for something that they have done.

example.ex: He was decorated for bravery in battle.
example.tran: 他因为作战英勇而被授予奖章。

collins.def: When people or things are apart, they are some distance from each other.

example.ex: He was standing a bit apart from the rest of us, watching us...
example.tran: 他站在离我们其余人不远的地方，看着我们。

example.ex: She saw Sheila standing some distance apart...
example.tran: 她看见希拉站开了一段距离。

collins.def: If two people or things move apart or are pulled apart, they move away from each other.

example.ex: John and Isabelle moved apart, back into the sun...
example.tran: 约翰和伊莎贝拉彼此分开，回到了阳光下。

example.ex: He tried in vain to keep the two dogs apart before the neighbour intervened.
example.tran: 邻居过来帮忙前，他费了半天劲儿也没把两只狗分开。

collins.def: If two people are apart, they are no longer living together or spending time together, either permanently or just for a short time.

example.ex: It was the first time Jane and I had been apart for more than a few days...
example.tran: 那是我第一次和简分开数日。

example.ex: Mum and Dad live apart.
example.tran: 妈妈和爸爸分居。

collins.def: If you take something apart, you separate it into the pieces that it is made of. If it comes or falls apart, its parts separate from each other.

example.ex: When the clock stopped he took it apart to find out what was wrong...
example.tran: 钟一不走了，他就把它拆开看看哪儿出毛病了。

example.ex: Many school buildings are unsafe, and some are falling apart.
example.tran: 许多校舍不安全，有些简直是摇摇欲坠。

collins.def: If something such as an organization or relationship falls apart, or if something tears it apart, it can no longer continue because it has serious difficulties.

example.ex: Any manager knows that his company will start falling apart if his attention wanders...
example.tran: 每个经理都知道只要自己的注意力有所分散，公司就会分崩离析。

example.ex: Her marriage to film producer Michael Greenburg fell apart.
example.tran: 她和电影制片人迈克尔·格林伯格的婚姻破裂了。

collins.def: If something sets someone or something apart, it makes them different from other people or things.

example.ex: What really sets Mr Thaksin apart is that he comes from northern Thailand...
example.tran: 他信先生真正与众不同之处是他来自泰国北部。

example.ex: Health spending tends to rise disproportionately as countries become richer; but even adjusting for this, America is a case apart.
example.tran: 随着国家愈加富有，医疗保健费用增加的幅度却往往与之不成比例；但即使美国为此作出调整，还是与别国不同。

collins.tran: 意见不一致的；有分歧的
collins.def: If people or groups are a long way apart on a particular topic or issue, they have completely different views and disagree about it.

example.ex: Officials say they're so far apart on such a wide range of issues there's no telling how long the talks could drag on...
example.tran: 官员们声称他们在许多问题上分歧甚大，所以无法预见谈判将拖多久。

example.ex: Their concept of a performance and our concept were miles apart.
example.tran: 他们对于表演的理解和我们的大相径庭。

collins.def: If you can't tell two people or things apart, they look exactly the same to you.

example.ex: I can still only tell Mark and Dave apart by the colour of their shoes!
example.tran: 我仍然只能根据鞋子的颜色来区分马克和戴夫！

example.ex: Free range and battery eggs, boiled for four minutes, were hard to tell apart.
example.tran: 柴鸡蛋和笼养鸡蛋在煮过4分钟之后很难区分。

means: 遏制[阻止]（液体的流动等）

collins.def: If a condition or problem stems from something, it was caused originally by that thing.

example.ex: All my problems stem from drink...
example.tran: 我所有的问题都源于酗酒。

example.ex: Much of the instability stems from the economic effects of the war.
example.tran: 不稳定局面多半是由战争对经济的影响造成的。

collins.def: If you stem something, you stop it spreading, increasing, or continuing.

example.ex: Austria has sent three army battalions to its border with Hungary to stem the flow of illegal immigrants...
example.tran: 奥地利已派出 3 个营的兵力去本国和匈牙利交界的边境地区阻止非法移民的流入。

example.ex: The authorities seem powerless to stem the rising tide of violence...
example.tran: 当局似乎无力阻止愈演愈烈的暴力活动。

collins.def: The stem of a plant is the thin, upright part on which the flowers and leaves grow.

example.ex: He stooped down, cut the stem for her with his knife and handed her the flower.
example.tran: 他弯下腰，用刀替她将花茎割断，然后将花递给她。

collins.def: The stem of a wine glass is the long thin part which connects the bowl to the base.
The stem of a pipe is the long thin part through which smoke is sucked.

example.ex: He chewed the stem of his pipe and eyed her sceptically.
example.tran: 他嘴里衔着烟斗柄，满腹狐疑地打量着她。

collins.def: In grammar, the stem of a word is the main part of it, which does not change when the ending changes.
If something happens from stem to stern on a boat, it involves the whole of the boat.

example.ex: A South African television report said the ship was ablaze from stem to stern.
example.tran: 南非一则电视新闻报道称，那艘船从头到尾都着了火。

collins.tran: (政治观点或政策)温和的，不激进的
collins.def: Moderate political opinions or policies are not extreme.

example.ex: He was an easygoing man of very moderate views...
example.tran: 他的观点非常温和，容易相处。

example.ex: Both countries have called for a moderate approach to the use of force.
example.tran: 两国都呼吁不要滥用武力。

collins.def: You use moderate to describe people or groups who have moderate political opinions or policies.

example.ex: ...a moderate Democrat.
example.tran: 温和的民主党人

example.ex: ...the moderate wing of the army.
example.tran: 军队中的稳健派

collins.tran: 中等的;普通的;适度的；适量的
collins.def: You use moderate to describe something that is neither large nor small in amount or degree.

example.ex: While a moderate amount of stress can be beneficial, too much stress can exhaust you.
example.tran: 适度的压力是有好处的，但是压力太大会把人压垮。

example.ex: ...moderate exercise.
example.tran: 适度的锻炼

collins.def: A moderate change in something is a change that is not great.

example.ex: Most drugs offer either no real improvement or, at best, only moderate improvements.
example.tran: 大多数药物要么不能使病情真正好转，要么最多只能带来轻微的改善。

collins.def: If you moderate something or if it moderates, it becomes less extreme or violent and easier to deal with or accept.

example.ex: They are hoping that once in office he can be persuaded to moderate his views...
example.tran: 他们希望等他一上台，可以说服他观点别那么激进。

example.ex: Amongst relief workers, the immediate sense of crisis has moderated somewhat...
example.tran: 救援人员的紧迫危机感已经有所减弱。

collins.def: To manufacture something means to make it in a factory, usually in large quantities.

example.ex: They manufacture the class of plastics known as thermoplastic materials...
example.tran: 他们生产这类被称为热塑材料的塑料制品。

example.ex: The first three models are being manufactured at the factory in Ashton-under-Lyne...
example.tran: 最初的3种型号在阿什顿安德莱恩的工厂生产。

collins.def: Manufactures are goods or products which have been made in a factory.

example.ex: ...a long-term rise in the share of manufactures in nonoil exports.
example.tran: 非石油出口产品中工业品份额的长期增长

collins.def: If you say that someone manufactures information, you are criticizing them because they invent information that is not true.

example.ex: According to the prosecution, the officers manufactured an elaborate story...
example.tran: 根据控方意见，官员们精心编造了事情经过。

example.ex: He said the allegations were manufactured on the flimsiest evidence.
example.tran: 他说这些指控都是凭空捏造的。

collins.def: A myth is a well-known story which was made up in the past to explain natural events or to justify religious beliefs or social customs.

example.ex: There is a famous Greek myth in which Icarus flew too near to the Sun.
example.tran: 有一个著名的希腊神话，讲的是伊卡洛斯飞得离太阳过近的故事。

example.ex: ...the world of magic and of myth.
example.tran: 魔法和神话的世界

collins.tran: 错误的看法（或认识）；编造的话;谎言
collins.def: If you describe a belief or explanation as a myth, you mean that many people believe it but it is actually untrue.

example.ex: Contrary to the popular myth, women are not reckless spendthrifts.
example.tran: 和人们的普遍观念恰恰相反，女性并不是胡乱挥霍者。

collins.def: Spray is a lot of small drops of water which are being thrown into the air.

example.ex: The moon was casting a rainbow through the spray from the waterfall...
example.tran: 月亮在瀑布溅起的水雾上照出了一道彩虹。

example.ex: The rope whipped clear of the water, throwing up a spray of droplets.
example.tran: 绳子猛地甩过水面，带起一片水珠。

collins.def: A spray is a liquid kept under pressure in a can or other container, which you can force out in very small drops.

example.ex: ...hair spray.
example.tran: 喷发胶

example.ex: ...a can of insect spray.
example.tran: 一罐喷雾杀虫剂

collins.def: If you spray a liquid somewhere or if it sprays somewhere, drops of the liquid cover a place or shower someone.

example.ex: A sprayer hooked to a tractor can spray five gallons onto ten acres...
example.tran: 用拖拉机牵引的喷雾器可以将 5 加仑药水喷洒在 10 英亩田地上。

example.ex: Two inmates hurled slates at prison officers spraying them with a hose...
example.tran: 两名囚犯朝着用水管向他们喷水的狱警们扔石板瓦。

collins.def: If a lot of small things spray somewhere or if something sprays them, they are scattered somewhere with a lot of force.

example.ex: A shower of mustard seeds sprayed into the air and fell into the grass...
example.tran: 许多芥子撒向空中，然后落进了草丛里。

example.ex: The intensity of the blaze shattered windows, spraying glass on the streets below...
example.tran: 熊熊烈火灼裂了玻璃窗，碎玻璃飞溅到了下面的街道上。

collins.def: If someone sprays bullets somewhere, they fire a lot of bullets at a group of people or things.

example.ex: He ran to the top of the building spraying bullets into shoppers below...
example.tran: 他跑到楼顶上，向下面的购物人群开枪扫射。

example.ex: The army lorries were sprayed with machine gun fire from guerrillas in the woods.
example.tran: 部队的运货卡车遭到了树林中游击队机关枪的扫射。

collins.def: If something is sprayed, it is painted using paint kept under pressure in a container.

example.ex: The bare metal was sprayed with several coats of primer.
example.tran: 裸露的金属上被喷上了几层底漆。

collins.def: When someone sprays against insects, they cover plants or crops with a chemical which prevents insects feeding on them.

example.ex: He doesn't spray against pests or diseases...
example.tran: 他并不喷药防虫祛病。

example.ex: Confine the use of insecticides to the evening and do not spray plants that are in flower...
example.tran: 只在晚间使用杀虫剂，而且不要对正在开花的植物喷药。

collins.tran: (尤指用于植被的)喷水器，喷雾器
collins.def: A spray is a piece of equipment for spraying water or another liquid, especially over growing plants.
A spray of flowers or leaves is a number of flowers or leaves on one stem or branch.

example.ex: ...a small spray of freesias.
example.tran: 一小簇小苍兰

collins.def: Your personality is your whole character and nature.

example.ex: She has such a kind, friendly personality...
example.tran: 她个性善良友好。

example.ex: Through sheer force of personality Hugh Trenchard had got his way...
example.tran: 休·特伦查德完全凭着个人魅力就能随心所欲。

collins.tran: 强烈的（或鲜明的)个性;个性鲜明的人
collins.def: If someone has personality or is a personality, they have a strong and lively character.

example.ex: ...a woman of great personality...
example.tran: 极有个性的女人

example.ex: He is such a personality — he is so funny.
example.tran: 他很有个性魅力——非常风趣。

collins.tran: （娱乐界或体育界的）名流，名人，风云人物
collins.def: You can refer to a famous person, especially in entertainment, broadcasting, or sport, as a personality.

example.ex: ...the radio and television personality, Jimmy Saville.
example.tran: 广播电视界风云人物，吉米·萨维尔

collins.def: If you are immune to a particular disease, you cannot be affected by it.

example.ex: This blood test will show whether or not you're immune to the disease...
example.tran: 这个血检会显示你是否对这种疾病具有免疫力。

example.ex: Most adults are immune to Rubella.
example.tran: 大多数成人对风疹具有免疫力。

collins.def: An immune response or reaction is a reaction by the body's immune system to something harmful that is affecting it.

example.ex: It is hoped the procedure will trigger an immune response that will wipe out HIV-infected cells while leaving non-infected cells unharmed.
example.tran: 希望这一治疗会激发免疫反应,清除感染了艾滋病病毒的细胞，同时又不损伤未感染细胞。

collins.def: If you are immune to something that happens or is done, you are not affected by it.

example.ex: Whilst Marc did gradually harden himself to the poverty, he did not become immune to the sight of death...
example.tran: 尽管马克逐渐对贫困现象无动于衷,但他对于死亡的惨象还是不免动容。

example.ex: Football is not immune to economic recession.
example.tran: 足球不可能不受到经济衰退的影响。

collins.def: Someone or something that is immune from a particular process or situation is able to escape it.

example.ex: Members of the Bundestag are immune from prosecution for corruption...
example.tran: 德国联邦议院的成员可免受贪腐罪的起诉。

example.ex: No one is immune from scandal.
example.tran: 谁都难免会有丑闻。

collins.def: To obtain something means to get it or achieve it.

example.ex: Evans was trying to obtain a false passport and other documents...
example.tran: 埃文斯正试图取得一本假护照和其他证件。

example.ex: The perfect body has always been difficult to obtain.
example.tran: 完美的身材总是很难拥有。

collins.def: If a situation obtains, it exists.

example.ex: The longer this situation obtains, the more extensive the problems become.
example.tran: 这种局面持续的时间越长，问题波及的范围就越广。

collins.def: If something happens shortly after or before something else, it happens not long after or before it. If something is going to happen shortly, it is going to happen soon.

example.ex: Their trial will shortly begin...
example.tran: 他们的审判很快就要开始了。

example.ex: The work will be completed very shortly...
example.tran: 这项工作很快就会完成。

collins.tran: 没好气地;不耐烦地;粗鲁地;气冲冲地
collins.def: If you speak to someone shortly, you speak to them in a cross or impatient way.

example.ex: 'I don't know you,' he said shortly, 'and I'm in a hurry.'
example.tran: “我不认识你，”他不耐烦地说，“而且我在赶时间。”

collins.def: A task is an activity or piece of work which you have to do, usually as part of a larger project.

example.ex: Walker had the unenviable task of breaking the bad news to Hill...
example.tran: 沃克不得不把这个坏消息告诉希尔。

example.ex: She used the day to catch up with administrative tasks.
example.tran: 她白天忙着处理行政工作。

collins.def: If you are tasked with doing a particular activity or piece of work, someone in authority asks you to do it.

example.ex: The minister was tasked with checking that British aid money was being spent wisely.
example.tran: 部长被指派去督查英国的援助资金是否已用到实处。

collins.def: If you take someone to task, you criticize them or tell them off because of something bad or wrong that they have done.

example.ex: The country's intellectuals are also being taken to task for their failure to speak out against the regime.
example.tran: 该国知识分子也因未能公开反对该政权受到了指责。

collins.def: Retirement is the time when a worker retires.

example.ex: ...the proportion of the population who are over retirement age...
example.tran: 超过退休年龄的人口比例

example.ex: The Governor of the prison and another official are to take early retirement.
example.tran: 这个监狱的监狱长和另外一个官员将会提前退休。

collins.def: A person's retirement is the period in their life after they have retired.

example.ex: ...financial support for the elderly during retirement.
example.tran: 为退休期间的老年人提供的经济支持

collins.def: A chamber is a large room, especially one that is used for formal meetings.

example.ex: We are going to make sure we are in the council chamber every time he speaks.
example.tran: 每次他发表讲话我们都会确保赶到市议会会议厅去。

collins.def: You can refer to a country's parliament or to one section of it as a chamber .

example.ex: More than 80 parties are contesting seats in the two-chamber parliament...
example.tran: 有80多个党派在竞争两院的议席。

example.ex: Signor Amato's government has only a 16-seat majority in the Chamber of Deputies.
example.tran: 阿马托先生的政府在下议院仅以16席的优势占有多数席位。

collins.def: A chamber is a room designed and equipped for a particular purpose.

example.ex: For many, the dentist's surgery remains a torture chamber.
example.tran: 对许多人来说，牙医的治疗室一直是间受刑室。

collins.def: A chamber is a hollow place inside the body of a person or animal, or inside a plant.
The offices used by judges and barristers are referred to as chambers.
When you are angry, you feel strong dislike or impatience about something.

example.ex: She had been very angry at the person who stole her new bike...
example.tran: 她很生气有人偷走了她的新自行车。

example.ex: Are you angry with me for some reason?...
example.tran: 你是因为什么原因在生我的气吗？

collins.def: An angry wound or rash is red and painful.

example.ex: He was badly concussed, the glass leaving two angry cuts across his forehead.
example.tran: 他遭受了严重的脑震荡，脑门上留下的两道被玻璃划破的口子已经红肿。

collins.tran: （天空或海洋）天昏地暗的，狂风暴雨的
collins.def: If you describe the sky or sea as angry, you mean that it is dark and stormy.
If two things are equal or if one thing is equal to another, they are the same in size, number, standard, or value.

example.ex: Investors can borrow an amount equal to the property's purchase price.
example.tran: 投资者可以获得与房产购买价格相等的借款额。

example.ex: ...in a population having equal numbers of men and women...
example.tran: 在男女人数相等的人口中

collins.def: If different groups of people have equal rights or are given equal treatment, they have the same rights or are treated the same as each other, however different they are.

example.ex: We will be justly demanding equal rights at work.
example.tran: 我们将要求享有工作中应得的平等权利。

example.ex: ...the commitment to equal opportunities.
example.tran: 对机会均等的承诺

collins.tran: （指人的权利和机会）平等的，均等的
collins.def: If you say that people are equal, you mean that they have or should have the same rights and opportunities as each other.

example.ex: We are equal in every way...
example.tran: 我们在各个方面都是平等的。

example.ex: At any gambling game, everyone is equal.
example.tran: 在任何赌博游戏中，每个人都机会均等。

collins.tran: （能力、地位或权利等）同样的人，相当的人
collins.def: Someone who is your equal has the same ability, status, or rights as you have.

example.ex: She was one of the boys, their equal...
example.tran: 她也是男孩子们中的一员，和他们不相上下。

example.ex: You should have married somebody more your equal.
example.tran: 你本应该和一个更门当户对的人结婚。

collins.def: If someone is equal to a particular job or situation, they have the necessary ability, strength, or courage to deal successfully with it.

example.ex: She was determined that she would be equal to any test the corporation put to them...
example.tran: 她下定决心要成功应对公司对他们的任何考验。

example.ex: The guards were equal to anything.
example.tran: 那些卫兵能够应对任何事情。

collins.def: If something equals a particular number or amount, it is the same as that amount or the equivalent of that amount.

example.ex: 9 percent interest less 7 percent inflation equals 2 percent...
example.tran: 9%的利息减去7%的通货膨胀率等于2%。

example.ex: The average pay rise equalled 1.41 times inflation.
example.tran: 薪水的平均增长幅度是通货膨胀率的1.41倍。

collins.def: To equal something or someone means to be as good or as great as them.

example.ex: The victory equalled Southend's best in history...
example.tran: 那次胜利堪比索森德历史上最漂亮的获胜。

example.ex: No amount of money can equal memories like that.
example.tran: 再多的金钱也比不上那样的记忆。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something has no equal, you think that there is nothing that is as good as them or that reaches the same standard.

example.ex: As a pastor, it can be argued he has no equal...
example.tran: 作为牧师，他可以说是出类拔萃。

example.ex: The film demands attention, and has no equal in cinema history.
example.tran: 那部电影众人瞩目，在电影史上无与伦比。

collins.tran: 如果其他条件不变;如无意外情况发生
collins.def: If you say 'other things being equal' or 'all things being equal' when talking about a possible situation, you mean if nothing unexpected happens or if there are no other factors which affect the situation.

example.ex: Other things being equal, most tenants would prefer single to shared rooms...
example.tran: 如果其他条件不变，大多数房客都愿意住单人间而不会选择与他人同住。

example.ex: All things being equal, should it matter who earns most money?
example.tran: 如果一切不变，谁赚的钱最多有什么关系吗？

collins.def: An excess of something is a larger amount than is needed, allowed, or usual.

example.ex: An excess of house plants in a small flat can be oppressive...
example.tran: 在小公寓中摆放过多室内植物会让人觉得很压抑。

example.ex: Polyunsaturated oils are essential for health. Excess is harmful, however.
example.tran: 多不饱和油对健康很重要。但是，食用过量就会有害。

collins.def: Excess is used to describe amounts that are greater than what is needed, allowed, or usual.

example.ex: After cooking the fish, pour off any excess fat...
example.tran: 烹完鱼后，倒掉多余的油。

example.ex: The major reason for excess weight is excess eating.
example.tran: 体重超标的主要原因是饮食过量。

collins.def: Excess is behaviour that is unacceptable because it is considered too extreme or immoral.

example.ex: She said she was sick of her life of excess.
example.tran: 她说她厌倦了自己无节制的生活。

example.ex: ...adolescent excess.
example.tran: 青春期的放肆

collins.def: Excess is used to refer to additional amounts of money that need to be paid for services and activities that were not originally planned or taken into account.

example.ex: ...a letter demanding an excess fare of £20...
example.tran: 要求额外付20英镑邮资的信

example.ex: Staff who have to travel farther can claim excess travel expenses.
example.tran: 需要到更远的地方出差的职员可以领取额外差旅费。

collins.tran: （保险中的）免赔额，承保人本人需承担的款额
collins.def: The excess on an insurance policy is a sum of money which the insured person has to pay towards the cost of a claim. The insurance company pays the rest.

example.ex: The company wanted £1,800 for a policy with a £500 excess for under-21s.
example.tran: 那家公司想要办理单价1,800英镑的保单，并且要求21岁以下人员承担价值500英镑的免赔额。

collins.def: In excess of means more than a particular amount.

example.ex: Avoid deposits in excess of £20,000 in any one account...
example.tran: 单一账户存款勿超过两万英镑。

example.ex: The energy value of dried fruits is considerably in excess of that of fresh items.
example.tran: 干果的能量值大大超过新鲜水果。

collins.def: If you do something to excess, you do it too much.

example.ex: I was reasonably fit, played a lot of tennis, and didn't smoke or drink to excess...
example.tran: 我相当健康，经常打网球，不怎么吸烟，也不酗酒。

example.ex: Red meat, eaten to excess, is very high in fat and calories.
example.tran: 过量食用的红肉中脂肪和卡路里含量很高。

means: 特性，特征，特色，[数]（对数的）首数

collins.def: The characteristics of a person or thing are the qualities or features that belong to them and make them recognizable.

example.ex: Genes determine the characteristics of every living thing.
example.tran: 基因决定每个生物的特征。

example.ex: ...their physical characteristics.
example.tran: 他们的身体特征

collins.tran: (品质、特点)明显的，显著的，典型的
collins.def: A quality or feature that is characteristic of someone or something is one which is often seen in them and seems typical of them.

example.ex: ...the absence of strife between the generations that was so characteristic of such societies...
example.tran: 这些社会中典型的代际冲突的缺失

example.ex: Windmills are a characteristic feature of the Mallorcan landscape...
example.tran: 风车是马略卡岛风光的一大特色。

collins.def: An illustration is an example or a story which is used to make a point clear.

example.ex: ...a perfect illustration of the way Britain absorbs and adapts external influences.
example.tran: 英国吸收借鉴外来影响的绝好例证

collins.def: An illustration in a book is a picture, design, or diagram.

example.ex: She looked like a princess in a nineteenth-century illustration.
example.tran: 她看起来像19世纪插图读物中的公主。

collins.tran: 未被认出的；未被识别的
collins.def: If you describe someone or something as unidentified, you mean that nobody knows who or what they are.

example.ex: He was shot this morning by unidentified intruders at his house.
example.tran: 他今天早上在家中被身份不明的闯入者射杀。

example.ex: ...unidentified cancer-causing substances in the environment.
example.tran: 环境中未知的致癌物质

collins.tran: 不愿透露姓名（或名称）的
collins.def: If you use unidentified to describe people, groups, and organizations, you do not want to give their names.

example.ex: ...his claims, which were based on the comments of anonymous and unidentified sources.
example.tran: 他的说法是基于不知姓名且身份不明的消息人士的话

collins.def: You use upper to describe something that is above something else.

example.ex: There is a smart restaurant on the upper floor...
example.tran: 楼上有一家时尚的餐馆。

example.ex: Students travel the cheap lower deck and tourists the upper.
example.tran: 学生坐廉价的下层舱，游客坐上层舱。

collins.def: You use upper to describe the higher part of something.

example.ex: ...the upper part of the foot.
example.tran: 脚面部分

example.ex: ...the muscles of the upper back and chest.
example.tran: 上背部和胸部的肌肉

collins.def: If you have the upper hand in a situation, you have more power than the other people involved and can make decisions about what happens.

example.ex: The government was beginning to gain the upper hand...
example.tran: 政府开始占上风。

example.ex: It was easy to see who had the upper hand.
example.tran: 不难看出谁占上风。

collins.def: The upper of a shoe is the top part of it, which is attached to the sole and the heel.

example.ex: Wear well-fitting, lace-up shoes with soft uppers...
example.tran: 穿合脚的、系带的软帮鞋。

example.ex: Leather uppers allow the feet to breathe.
example.tran: 皮革鞋帮使脚得以透气。

collins.def: Uppers are drugs that make you feel very happy, excited, and full of energy.

example.ex: ...people crazy on alcohol and cocaine and uppers and downers...
example.tran: 酗酒、吸食可卡因、兴奋剂及镇静剂的人

example.ex: I'd taken a handful of uppers.
example.tran: 我吃了几片兴奋剂。

collins.def: Sand is a substance that looks like powder, and consists of extremely small pieces of stone. Some deserts and many beaches are made up of sand.

example.ex: They all walked barefoot across the damp sand to the water's edge.
example.tran: 他们全都光着脚走过潮湿的沙地来到水边。

example.ex: ...grains of sand.
example.tran: 沙粒

collins.def: Sands are a large area of sand, for example a beach.

example.ex: ...miles of golden sands.
example.tran: 绵延数英里的金色沙滩

collins.def: If you sand a wood or metal surface, you rub sandpaper over it in order to make it smooth or clean.

example.ex: Sand the surface softly and carefully.
example.tran: 用砂纸仔细而轻柔地打磨表面。

collins.def: If you refer to the shifting sands of a situation, you mean that it changes so often that it is difficult to deal with.

example.ex: He had been a rock in the shifting sands of her existence.
example.tran: 他一直是她曲折坎坷的生活中的主心骨。

example.ex: ...his shrewd tactical skills in the shifting sands of Arab politics.
example.tran: 他在阿拉伯风云变幻的政局中的高明谋略

collins.def: If you persuade someone to do something, you cause them to do it by giving them good reasons for doing it.

example.ex: My husband persuaded me to come...
example.tran: 我丈夫说服我前来。

example.ex: We're trying to persuade manufacturers to sell them here...
example.tran: 我们正在努力劝说制造商在这里销售。

collins.def: If something persuades someone to take a particular course of action, it causes them to take that course of action because it is a good reason for doing so.

example.ex: The Conservative Party's victory in April's general election persuaded him to run for President again...
example.tran: 4月保守党在大选中获胜促使他再次竞选总统。

example.ex: It was the lack of privacy that eventually persuaded us to move after Ben was born.
example.tran: 就是因为想要清静，我们最终在本出生后搬家了。

collins.def: If you persuade someone that something is true, you say things that eventually make them believe that it is true.

example.ex: I've persuaded Mrs Tennant that it's time she retired...
example.tran: 我已经说服坦南特夫人她该退休了。

example.ex: We had managed to persuade them that it was worth working with us...
example.tran: 我们已经让他们相信与我们合作是值得的。

collins.def: A person's childhood is the period of their life when they are a child.

example.ex: She had a happy childhood...
example.tran: 她曾有过一个幸福的童年。

example.ex: He was remembering a story heard in childhood.
example.tran: 他在回忆儿时听过的一个故事。

means: 对（财产、收入等）进行估价（作为征税根据）
确定（损害赔偿金、税款、罚款等）的金额

collins.def: When you assess a person, thing, or situation, you consider them in order to make a judgment about them.

example.ex: Our correspondent has been assessing the impact of the sanctions...
example.tran: 我们的记者一直在评估制裁带来的影响。

example.ex: The test was to assess aptitude rather than academic achievement...
example.tran: 这次测试是考查能力，而不是学习成绩。

collins.def: When you assess the amount of money that something is worth or should be paid, you calculate or estimate it.

example.ex: Ask them to send you information on how to assess the value of your belongings...
example.tran: 让他们把怎样评估你的财产价值的资料寄来。

example.ex: What's the property's assessed value?
example.tran: 这些财产的估值是多少？

collins.def: A higher degree or diploma is a qualification of an advanced standard or level.

example.ex: ...a higher diploma in hotel management.
example.tran: 酒店管理高级证书

collins.def: Expense is the money that something costs you or that you need to spend in order to do something.

example.ex: He's bought a specially big TV at vast expense so that everyone can see properly...
example.tran: 他花大价钱买了一台特别大的电视机，这样每个人都能看清楚。

example.ex: To avoid extra expense and mess later on, try to decide on fittings before the plastering's finished...
example.tran: 为避免将来出现额外的开支和不必要的麻烦，尽量在抹灰完工之前把固定设施确定下来。

collins.tran: （由雇主报销的）开支，费用，业务费用
collins.def: Expenses are amounts of money that you spend while doing something in the course of your work, which will be paid back to you afterwards.

example.ex: As a member of the International Olympic Committee her fares and hotel expenses were paid by the IOC...
example.tran: 作为国际奥林匹克委员会的成员，她的交通费用和酒店住宿费用都由国际奥委会支付。

example.ex: Can you claim this back on expenses?
example.tran: 这个你能报销吗？

collins.def: If you do something at someone's expense, they provide the money for it.

example.ex: Should architects continue to be trained for five years at public expense?...
example.tran: 建筑师是否应该继续接受5年的公费培训呢？

example.ex: Teachers who signed up did so out of personal choice and at their own expense.
example.tran: 报名的教师完全出于自愿而且费用自理。

collins.tran: 拿…开玩笑;以…为嘲弄的对象
collins.def: If someone laughs or makes a joke at your expense, they do it to make you seem foolish.

example.ex: I think he's having fun at our expense.
example.tran: 我想他在拿我们寻开心。

collins.def: If you achieve something at the expense of someone, you do it in a way which might cause them some harm or disadvantage.

example.ex: But skeptics worry that costs may be trimmed at the expense of the patient...
example.tran: 但是持怀疑态度的人担心费用的削减会以牺牲病人的利益为代价。

example.ex: According to this study, women have made notable gains at the expense of men.
example.tran: 根据这项研究，女性以牺牲男性的利益为代价而获得了显著的收益。

collins.def: If you say that someone does something at the expense of another thing, you are expressing concern at the fact that they are not doing the second thing, because the first thing uses all their resources.

example.ex: They are worth having but not at the expense of better services...
example.tran: 它们值得拥有，但是不能因此放弃更好的服务。

example.ex: The orchestra has more discipline now, but at the expense of spirit.
example.tran: 那个管弦乐团现在更有纪律性了，却丧失了灵魂。

collins.def: If you go to the expense of doing something, you do something which costs a lot of money. If you go to great expense to do something, you spend a lot of money in order to achieve it.

example.ex: Why go to the expense of buying an electric saw when you can hire one?...
example.tran: 既然可以租电锯，为什么要花大价钱买一个呢？

example.ex: It was said that he went to great expense to install a lift in the building.
example.tran: 据说他花费巨资在大楼里安装了一台电梯。

collins.def: The height of a person or thing is their size or length from the bottom to the top.

example.ex: Her weight is about normal for her height...
example.tran: 按她的身高，她的体重基本正常。

example.ex: I am 5'6'' in height...
example.tran: 我身高5英尺6英寸。

collins.def: Height is the quality of being tall.

example.ex: She admits that her height is intimidating for some men.
example.tran: 她承认自己的高个头会令有些男人却步。

collins.tran: （距离地面或他物的某一）高度
collins.def: A particular height is the distance that something is above the ground or above something else mentioned.

example.ex: At the speed and height at which he was moving, he was never more than half a second from disaster.
example.tran: 以这样的速度在这么高的地方移动，他离灾难始终只有半步之遥。

example.ex: ...a test in which a 6.3 kilogram weight was dropped on it from a height of 1 metre...
example.tran: 让6.3公斤的重物从1米高的地方落到它上面的试验

collins.def: A height is a high position or place above the ground.

example.ex: From a height, it looks like a desert...
example.tran: 从高处看，它像一片沙漠。

example.ex: I'm not afraid of heights.
example.tran: 我不恐高。

collins.def: When an activity, situation, or organization is at its height, it is at its most successful, powerful, or intense.

example.ex: During the early sixth century emigration from Britain to Brittany was at its height...
example.tran: 6世纪初，从不列颠涌向布列塔尼的移民潮达到了高峰。

example.ex: At its height Bletchley Park employed 12,000 people...
example.tran: 布莱奇利园的雇员数在巅峰时期曾达1.2万人。

collins.def: If you say that something is the height of a particular quality, you are emphasizing that it has that quality to the greatest degree possible.

example.ex: The hip-hugging black and white polka-dot dress was the height of fashion...
example.tran: 黑白圆点花纹的紧身连衣裙当时是最时尚的。

example.ex: I think it's the height of bad manners to be dressed badly...
example.tran: 我认为衣着不当是最没有礼貌的行为。

collins.def: If something reaches great heights, it becomes very extreme or intense.

example.ex: ...the mid-1980s, when house prices rose to absurd heights...
example.tran: 房价高得离谱的20世纪80年代中期

example.ex: Recently the speculation has reached new heights...
example.tran: 最近猜测又升级了。

collins.def: A pen is a long thin object which you use to write in ink.
If someone pens a letter, article, or book, they write it.

example.ex: I really intended to pen this letter to you early this morning...
example.tran: 我真的打算今天一大早给你写这封信的。

example.ex: She penned a short memo to his private secretary.
example.tran: 她给他的私人秘书写了一份简短的备忘录。

collins.def: A pen is also a small area with a fence round it in which farm animals are kept for a short time.

example.ex: ...a holding pen for sheep...
example.tran: 暂时搭建的羊圈

example.ex: He wasn't sure exactly how a fox could have got into the sheep's pen.
example.tran: 他不是十分确定狐狸是怎么进入羊圈的。

collins.def: If people or animals are penned somewhere or are penned up, they are forced to remain in a very small area.

example.ex: ...to drive the cattle back to the house so they could be milked and penned for the night...
example.tran: 将牛群赶回家，这样就能挤奶并将其关进牛棚过夜

example.ex: The goats are penned in and fodder has to be cut and carried each day...
example.tran: 山羊被关进圈里，每天都得铡草运料。

collins.def: People sometimes say the pen to refer to a prison.
If you put pen to paper, you write something.

example.ex: Whenever he put pen to paper he was at a loss for the right words to break the news.
example.tran: 他每次一提笔就不知道如何措辞透露这个消息。

collins.def: You use maximum to describe an amount which is the largest that is possible, allowed, or required.

example.ex: Under planning law the maximum height for a fence or hedge is 2 metres...
example.tran: 规划法中规定，围栏或树篱最高为2米。

example.ex: China headed the table with maximum points.
example.tran: 中国队以最高分位居榜首。

collins.def: You use maximum to indicate how great an  amount is.

example.ex: ...the maximum amount of information...
example.tran: 海量信息

example.ex: It was achieved with minimum fuss and maximum efficiency.
example.tran: 事情事半功倍地完成了。

collins.def: If you say that something is a particular amount maximum, you mean that this is the greatest amount it should be or could possibly be, although a smaller amount is acceptable or very possible.

example.ex: We need an extra 6g a day maximum.
example.tran: 我们一天最多还需要6克。

collins.tran: 最大限度地;尽可能充分地;竭尽全力地
collins.def: If you say that someone does something to the maximum, you are emphasizing that they do it to the greatest degree possible.

example.ex: You have to develop your capabilities to the maximum.
example.tran: 你必须尽你所能。

collins.def: The tide is the regular change in the level of the sea on the shore.

example.ex: The tide was at its highest...
example.tran: 潮水正处于最高位。

example.ex: The tide was going out, and the sand was smooth and glittering...
example.tran: 正在退潮，沙滩平坦，闪着微光。

collins.def: A tide is a current in the sea that is caused by the regular and continuous movement of large areas of water towards and away from the shore.

example.ex: Roman vessels used to sail with the tide from Boulogne to Richborough.
example.tran: 罗马的船只过去经常乘着潮汐从布洛涅航行到里奇伯勒。

collins.def: The tide of opinion, for example, is what the majority of people think at a particular time.

example.ex: The tide of opinion seems overwhelmingly in his favour.
example.tran: 绝大多数人的观点看来是一边倒地支持他的。

collins.def: People sometimes refer to events or forces that are difficult or impossible to control as the tide of history, for example.

example.ex: They talked of reversing the tide of history...
example.tran: 他们谈到扭转历史潮流。

example.ex: The tide of war swept back across their country.
example.tran: 战争的浪潮回过头来席卷了全国。

collins.def: You can talk about a tide of something, especially something which is unpleasant, when there is a large and increasing amount of it.

example.ex: ...an ever increasing tide of crime...
example.tran: 不断高涨的犯罪浪潮

example.ex: The tide of nationalism is still running high in a number of republics.
example.tran: 民族主义浪潮在许多共和国势头正盛。

collins.def: In some religions, heaven is said to be the place where God lives, where good people go when they die, and where everyone is always happy. It is usually imagined as being high up in the sky.

example.ex: I believed that when I died I would go to heaven and see God.
example.tran: 我相信自己死后会升入天堂，见到上帝。

collins.tran: 极乐（之地）；天堂般美好（的世界）
collins.def: You can use heaven to refer to a place or situation that you like very much.

example.ex: We went touring in Wales and Ireland. It was heaven...
example.tran: 我们去了威尔士和爱尔兰旅游。那里真是人间仙境。

example.ex: I was in cinematic heaven.
example.tran: 我简直是到了观影者的天堂。

collins.def: The heavens are the sky.

example.ex: He walked out into the middle of the road, looking up at the heavens.
example.tran: 他走出去站在大路中间，抬头仰望着天空。

example.ex: ...a detailed map of the heavens.
example.tran: 详细的星空图

collins.tran: 但愿不会这样;千万不要这样;苍天不容;老天不许
collins.def: You say 'Heaven forbid!' to emphasize that you very much hope that something will not happen.

example.ex: Heaven forbid that he should leave because of me!
example.tran: 但愿他不会因为我而离开！

collins.def: You say 'Good heavens!' or 'Heavens!' to express surprise or to emphasize that you agree or disagree with someone.

example.ex: Good Heavens! That explains a lot!...
example.tran: 天哪！这下我明白了！

example.ex: 'I thought you were bringing it.'  — 'Heavens, no.'
example.tran: “我以为你会带来的。”——“天哪，不会吧。”

collins.tran: …只有靠天帮忙了;谁也帮不了…了
collins.def: You say 'Heaven help someone' when you are worried that something bad is going to happen to them, often because you disapprove of what they are doing or the way they are behaving.

example.ex: If this makes sense to our leaders, then heaven help us all...
example.tran: 如果我们的领导人认为这是合情合理的，那么谁也帮不了我们了。

example.ex: Heaven help the man she marries.
example.tran: 谁要娶了她就只有靠老天保佑了。

collins.def: You can say 'Heaven knows' to emphasize that you do not know something, or that you find something very surprising.

example.ex: Heaven knows what they put in it.
example.tran: 天知道他们在里面放了些什么。

collins.def: You can say 'Heaven knows' to emphasize something that you feel or believe very strongly.

example.ex: Heaven knows they have enough money...
example.tran: 他们的钱够多了。

example.ex: This gained me some thinking time, and heaven knows I needed it.
example.tran: 这为我赢得了一点思考的时间，而我确实非常需要它。

collins.tran: 想尽一切办法;竭尽全力;千方百计
collins.def: If you move heaven and earth to do something, you try as hard as you can to do it.

example.ex: They would move heaven and earth to stop me if they could.
example.tran: 可能的话，他们会千方百计地阻止我。

collins.tran: （用于以 what、when、who、why 及 how 开头的疑问句中表示强调）到底，究竟
collins.def: You can use in heaven's name in questions beginning with 'what', 'when', 'who', 'why' and 'how' to add emphasis in a way that shows that you are very angry or surprised.

example.ex: Where in heaven's name was she?
example.tran: 她到底在哪儿？

collins.def: If the heavens open, it suddenly starts raining very heavily.

example.ex: The match had just begun when the heavens opened and play was suspended.
example.tran: 比赛刚刚开始就突然下起倾盆大雨，所以只好暂停了。

collins.def: If someone who has authority over you gives you permission to do something, they say that they will allow you to do it.

example.ex: He asked permission to leave the room...
example.tran: 他请求准许离开房间。

example.ex: Finally his mother relented and gave permission for her youngest son to marry...
example.tran: 最后他母亲让步了,准许她的小儿子结婚。

collins.def: A permission is a formal, written statement from an official group or place allowing you to do something.

example.ex: ...oil exploration permissions.
example.tran: 石油勘探许可证

collins.def: Being is the present participle of be .

collins.tran: （用于说明原因的非限定性从句中）因为，由于
collins.def: Being is used in non-finite clauses where you are giving the reason for something.

example.ex: It being a Sunday, the old men had the day off...
example.tran: 因为是星期天，所以老人都休息。

example.ex: Little boys, being what they are, might decide to play on it...
example.tran: 出于天性，小男孩们可能会决定利用这一点。

collins.def: You can refer to any real or imaginary creature as a being .

example.ex: People expect a horse to perform like a car, with no thought for its feelings as a living being.
example.tran: 人们希望马能像汽车一样，完全没有考虑到马作为一种有生命的动物会有什么样的感受。

example.ex: ...beings from outer space.
example.tran: 来自外太空的生物

collins.def: Being is existence. Something that is in being or comes into being exists.

example.ex: Abraham Maslow described psychology as 'the science of being.'...
example.tran: 亚伯拉罕·马斯洛形容心理学是“存在的科学”。

example.ex: The Kingdom of Italy formally came into being on 17 March 1861.
example.tran: 意大利王国于1861年3月17日正式成立。

collins.tran: （用于解释所说内容的原因）因为，由于
collins.def: You can use being as to introduce a reason for what you are saying.

example.ex: I used to go everywhere with my mother being as I was the youngest.
example.tran: 我以前到哪儿都跟着我妈，因为我是老小。

collins.def: A marine is a  member of an armed force, for example the US Marine Corps or the Royal Marines, who is specially trained for military duties at sea as well as on land.
Marine is used to describe things relating to the sea or to the animals and plants that live in the sea.

example.ex: ...breeding grounds for marine life.
example.tran: 海洋生物的繁殖地

example.ex: ...research in marine biology.
example.tran: 海洋生物学研究

collins.def: Marine is used to describe things relating to ships and their movement at sea.

example.ex: ...a solicitor specialising in marine law.
example.tran: 专攻海事法的律师

example.ex: ...marine insurance claims.
example.tran: 海事保险索赔

collins.def: Collective actions, situations, or feelings involve or are shared by every member of a group of people.

example.ex: It was a collective decision...
example.tran: 这是集体的决定。

example.ex: The country's politicians are already heaving a collective sigh of relief.
example.tran: 该国的政界人士均已松了口气。

collins.def: A collective amount of something is the total obtained by adding together the amounts that each person or thing in a group has.

example.ex: Their collective volume wasn't very large.
example.tran: 他们的总量不是太大。

collins.def: The collective term for two or more types of thing is a general word or expression which refers to all of them.

example.ex: Social science is a collective name, covering a series of individual sciences.
example.tran: 社会科学是一个统称，涵盖一系列的独立学科。

collins.def: A collective is a business or farm which is run, and often owned, by a group of people who take an equal share of any profits.

example.ex: He will see that he is participating in all the decisions of the collective.
example.tran: 他会确保自己参与集体企业的各项决策。

means: （做了蠢事或出现差错时表示懊恼，用作 shit 的委婉语）哎呀，真是的

collins.def: Sugar is a sweet substance that is used to make food and drinks sweet. It is usually in the form of small white or brown crystals.

example.ex: ...bags of sugar...
example.tran: 几袋食糖

example.ex: Ice cream is high in fat and sugar.
example.tran: 冰激凌富含脂肪和糖。

collins.def: If someone has one sugar in their tea or coffee, they have one small spoon of sugar or one sugar lump in it.

example.ex: How many sugars do you take?
example.tran: 你加几勺糖？

example.ex: ...a mug of tea with two sugars.
example.tran: 一杯加了两块方糖的茶

collins.def: If you sugar food or drink, you add sugar to it.

example.ex: He sat down and sugared and stirred his coffee.
example.tran: 他坐下来，在咖啡中加糖并搅拌。

collins.def: Sugars are substances that occur naturally in food. When you eat them, the body converts them into energy.

example.ex: Plants produce sugars and starch to provide themselves with energy.
example.tran: 植物产生糖和淀粉来为自身提供能量。

example.ex: ...the natural sugars found in grape juice.
example.tran: 葡萄汁中所含的天然糖分

collins.def: If one person knows another person very well and likes them a lot, they sometimes call them sugar .

example.ex: I know how to make you feel better, sugar. I'll tell you a story.
example.tran: 宝贝，我知道怎么能让你感觉好些，我给你讲个故事。

collins.def: A penalty is a punishment that someone is given for doing something which is against a law or rule.

example.ex: One of those arrested could face the death penalty...
example.tran: 被捕的那些人中有一人可能被判死刑。

example.ex: The maximum penalty is up to 7 years imprisonment or an unlimited fine.
example.tran: 最高处罚是最多7年监禁或者无上限罚款。

collins.def: In sports such as football, rugby, and hockey, a penalty is an opportunity to score a goal, which is given to the attacking team if the defending team breaks a rule near their own goal.

example.ex: Referee Michael Reed had no hesitation in awarding a penalty...
example.tran: 裁判迈克尔·里德毫不犹豫地判了点球。

example.ex: Jonathan Davies scored a penalty goal.
example.tran: 乔纳森·戴维斯点球得分。

collins.def: The penalty that you pay for something you have done is something unpleasant that you experience as a result.

example.ex: Why should I pay the penalty for somebody else's mistake?...
example.tran: 为什么我要代人受过？

example.ex: It's a penalty of us being girls — sons have an easy time.
example.tran: 这是我们身为女孩的弊端——男孩子们过得轻松。

collins.def: When a broken bone or other injury heals or when something heals it, it becomes healthy and normal again.

example.ex: Within six weeks the bruising had gone, but it was six months before it all healed...
example.tran: 青瘀在6周内就消退了，但伤却是6个月后才全好了。

example.ex: If they'd operated and pinned her arm at once, she might have healed by now...
example.tran: 如果他们当时马上就给她的胳膊做手术并用钢针固定，她现在可能已经痊愈了。

collins.tran: （感情创伤）愈合;（情感）恢复常态
collins.def: When someone's emotional pain heals, they feel normal and happy again.

example.ex: A year later, she had healed to the point of at least being able to consider a romantic relationship with another man...
example.tran: 一年以后，她的感情创伤已慢慢愈合，至少能考虑和另一个男性开始恋爱关系了。

example.ex: Only by fully experiencing the depth of our pain can we be healed from it and be done with it.
example.tran: 只有充分感受了深切的痛苦，我们才能从中走出，并将它抛诸脑后。

collins.def: If you heal something such as a rift or a wound, or if it heals, the situation is put right so that people are friendly or happy again.

example.ex: Today Sophie and her sister have healed the family rift and visit their family every weekend...
example.tran: 如今索菲和她的姐姐已经和家人和好，每个周末都回家探望他们。

example.ex: The psychological effects on the United States were immense and in Washington the wounds have still not fully healed.
example.tran: 对美国造成的心理影响是巨大的，在华盛顿创伤仍未完全弥合。

collins.def: A desert is a large area of land, usually in a hot region, where there is almost no water, rain, trees, or plants.

example.ex: ...the Sahara Desert.
example.tran: 撒哈拉大沙漠

example.ex: ...the burning desert sun...
example.tran: 沙漠中火辣辣的太阳

collins.tran: 枯燥乏味的地方（或境况）
collins.def: If you refer to a place or situation as a desert, you think it is bad for people because it is not interesting, exciting, or useful in any way.

example.ex: They live in 12 high-rise apartment buildings that sit in a desert of concrete...
example.tran: 他们居住的地方是坐落于一片钢筋水泥丛林中的12栋高层公寓楼。

example.ex: Pubs are a cultural desert.
example.tran: 酒馆是文化沙漠。

collins.def: If people or animals desert a place, they leave it and it becomes empty.

example.ex: Farmers are deserting their fields and coming here looking for jobs...
example.tran: 小农场主正舍弃他们的土地，到这里来寻找工作。

example.ex: After the show, the audience deserts the Blackpool streets.
example.tran: 演出结束后，观众从布莱克浦的大街上消失了踪迹。

collins.def: If someone deserts you, they go away and leave you, and no longer help or support you.

example.ex: Mrs Roding's husband deserted her years ago...
example.tran: 罗丁太太的丈夫数年前抛弃了她。

example.ex: He has been deserted by most of his advisers.
example.tran: 他的大多数顾问都弃他而去。

collins.def: If you desert something that you support, use, or are involved with, you stop supporting it, using it, or being involved with it.

example.ex: The paper's price rise will encourage readers to desert in even greater numbers...
example.tran: 报纸价格的上涨将导致更多的读者不再订阅。

example.ex: He was pained to see many youngsters deserting kibbutz life...
example.tran: 看到那么多的年轻人放弃了合作农场的生活，他感到很痛心。

collins.def: If a quality or skill that you normally have deserts you, you suddenly find that you do not have it when you need it or want it.

example.ex: Even when he appeared to be depressed, a dry sense of humour never deserted him...
example.tran: 即使在他看上去很沮丧的时候，他也从没有丧失过自己的冷面幽默。

example.ex: She lost the next five games, and the set, as her confidence abruptly deserted her.
example.tran: 她突然自信心全失，接下来连败 5 局，并最终丢了这一盘。

collins.tran: 擅离(职守);（尤指从军队)开小差
collins.def: If someone deserts, or deserts a job, especially a job in the armed forces, they leave that job without permission.

example.ex: He was a second-lieutenant in the army until he deserted...
example.tran: 他在擅离部队之前是一名陆军少尉。

example.ex: He deserted from army intelligence last month...
example.tran: 上个月他从陆军情报机关开小差跑了。

collins.def: If you say that someone has got their just deserts, you mean that they deserved the unpleasant things that have happened to them, because they did something bad.

example.ex: At the end of the book the child's true identity is discovered, and the bad guys get their just deserts.
example.tran: 在书的结尾，那个孩子的真实身份大白于世，坏人则得到了应有的惩罚。

collins.def: A storm is very bad weather, with heavy rain, strong winds, and often thunder and lightning.

example.ex: ...the violent storms which whipped America's East Coast.
example.tran: 席卷美国东海岸的猛烈暴风雨

collins.tran: 强烈的反应;群情激愤;激动人心
collins.def: If something causes a storm, it causes an angry or excited reaction from a large number of people.

example.ex: The photos caused a storm when they were first published...
example.tran: 照片最初刊登出来时曾引起了一片公愤。

example.ex: The announcement provoked an immediate storm of protest.
example.tran: 公告一发布就引发了一场强烈的抗议。

collins.def: A storm of applause or other noise is a sudden loud amount of it made by an audience or other group of people in reaction to something.

example.ex: His speech was greeted with a storm of applause...
example.tran: 人们对他的演讲报以雷鸣般的掌声。

example.ex: Not since the 1968 Olympic Games has a medals ceremony caused such a storm of booing.
example.tran: 自1968 年奥运会以来，没有哪次颁奖仪式引起过如此哗然的一片嘘声。

collins.def: If you storm into or out of a place, you enter or leave it quickly and noisily, because you are angry.

example.ex: After a bit of an argument, he stormed out...
example.tran: 争吵了几句后，他气冲冲地走了出去。

example.ex: He stormed into an office, demanding to know where the head of department was.
example.tran: 他气冲冲地闯进一间办公室，质问部门经理在哪里。

collins.def: If you storm, you say something in a very loud voice, because you are extremely angry.

example.ex: 'It's a fiasco,' he stormed.
example.tran: “这是场彻底的失败，”他怒吼道。

collins.def: If a place that is being defended is stormed, a group of people attack it, usually in order to get inside it.

example.ex: Government buildings have been stormed and looted...
example.tran: 政府大楼遭到了攻击和抢劫。

example.ex: The refugees decided to storm the embassy.
example.tran: 难民们决定冲进大使馆。

collins.def: If someone or something takes a place by storm, they are extremely successful.

example.ex: Kenya's long distance runners have taken the athletics world by storm.
example.tran: 肯尼亚的长跑运动员在田径界获得了巨大成功。

collins.def: If someone weathers the storm, they succeed in reaching the end of a very difficult period without much harm or damage.

example.ex: He insists he will not resign and will weather the storm.
example.tran: 他坚称自己不会辞职，一定渡过难关。

collins.tran: 有价值的;有益的;有用的
collins.def: If you describe something or someone as valuable, you mean that they are very useful and helpful

example.ex: Many of our teachers also have valuable academic links with Heidelberg University...
example.tran: 我们的很多老师也和海德堡大学保持着有益的学术联系。

example.ex: If you decide to do you own make-up, here are a few valuable tips that will help you look your best...
example.tran: 如果你决定自己化妆，这里有一些有用的小窍门，可以帮助你呈现最美的一面。

collins.def: Valuable objects are objects which are worth a lot of money.

example.ex: Just because a camera is old does not mean it is valuable.
example.tran: 古旧的相机不一定就值钱。

example.ex: ...valuable books.
example.tran: 贵重书籍

means: 尖声地说（或唱），尖声啼鸣

collins.tran: （通常指金属或塑料制的）管子，管道
collins.def: A pipe is a long, round, hollow object, usually made of metal or plastic, through which a liquid or gas can flow.

example.ex: They had accidentally damaged a gas pipe while drilling...
example.tran: 打钻时，他们不小心钻破了一根燃气管道。

example.ex: The plant makes plastic covered steel pipes for the oil and gas industries.
example.tran: 这家工厂为石油和燃气企业生产包塑钢管。

collins.def: A pipe is an object which is used for smoking tobacco. You put the tobacco into the cup-shaped part at the end of the pipe, light it, and breathe in the smoke through a narrow tube.
A pipe is a simple musical instrument in the shape of a tube with holes in it. You play a pipe by blowing into it while covering and uncovering the holes with your fingers.
Pipes are the same as bagpipes .
An organ pipe is one of the long hollow tubes in which air vibrates and produces a musical note.

collins.tran: 用管子输送，用管道运输（液体或气体）
collins.def: If liquid or gas is piped somewhere, it is transferred from one place to another through a pipe.

example.ex: The heated gas is piped through a coil surrounded by water...
example.tran: 受热气体通过水中的盘管输送。

example.ex: The villagers piped in drinking water from the reservoir...
example.tran: 村民用管道从水库引来饮用水。

collins.def: If someone, especially a child, pipes something, they say it in a high-pitched voice.

example.ex: 'But I want to help,' Bessie piped.
example.tran: 贝茜尖声说：“但我想去帮忙。”

collins.tran: （一些计算机系统中用来在程序间传送信息的）管道
collins.def: In some computer systems, a pipe is a method of passing information from one program to another.

means: 作出庄重有约束力的誓言

collins.def: When someone makes a pledge, they make a serious promise that they will do something.

example.ex: The meeting ended with a pledge to step up cooperation between the six states of the region.
example.tran: 会议以承诺加快这一地区六国间的合作而结束。

example.ex: ...a £1.1m pledge of support from the Spanish ministry of culture.
example.tran: 来自西班牙文化部110万英镑的资助许诺

collins.tran: 保证，许诺，发誓（做）；保证给予
collins.def: When someone pledges to do something, they promise in a serious way to do it. When they pledge something, they promise to give it.

example.ex: Mr Dudley has pledged to give any award to charity...
example.tran: 达德利先生已承诺将任何所获的损害赔偿额都捐给慈善机构。

example.ex: Philip pledges support and offers to help in any way that he can...
example.tran: 菲利普保证给予支持，并主动提出尽其所能提供帮助。

collins.def: If you pledge a sum of money to an organization or activity, you promise to pay that amount of money to it at a particular time or over a particular period.

example.ex: The French President is pledging $150 million in French aid next year...
example.tran: 法国总统许诺为法国明年的援助经费拨款1.5亿美元。

example.ex: The government has now pledged £170m over the next six years for improving primary care.
example.tran: 为了改善初级卫生保健工作，政府已承诺在未来6年内拨款1.7亿英镑。

collins.tran: 使保证，使许诺，使发誓（遵循或支持）
collins.def: If you pledge yourself to something, you commit yourself to following a particular course of action or to supporting a particular person, group, or idea.

example.ex: The President pledged himself to increase taxes for the rich but not the middle classes...
example.tran: 总统保证增加对富人而非中产阶级的税收。

example.ex: Tony Cottee has pledged himself to Everton Football Club for another three years...
example.tran: 托尼·科蒂已答应同埃弗顿足球俱乐部再续约3年。

collins.def: If you pledge something such as a valuable possession or a sum of money, you leave it with someone as a guarantee that you will repay money that you have borrowed.

example.ex: He asked her to pledge the house as security for a loan.
example.tran: 他要她拿房子来抵押贷款。

means: 使成玫瑰色，使（面颊）发红

collins.def: Rose is the past tense of rise .
A rose is a flower, often with a pleasant smell, which grows on a bush with stems that have sharp points called thorns on them.

example.ex: She bent to pick a red rose.
example.tran: 她弯腰去摘一朵红玫瑰。

example.ex: ...a bunch of yellow roses.
example.tran: 一束黄玫瑰

collins.def: A rose is bush that roses grow on.

example.ex: Prune rambling roses when the flowers have faded.
example.tran: 花朵凋谢后要剪除杂生的玫瑰枝。

example.ex: ...fragrant rose bushes.
example.tran: 芳香的玫瑰丛

collins.def: Something that is rose is reddish-pink in colour.

example.ex: ...the rose and violet hues of a twilight sky.
example.tran: 黄昏时天空中玫瑰色和紫罗兰色的云霞

collins.def: A rose is a device with very small holes in it that fits onto the end of a hosepipe or watering can. The water comes out of the rose in a fine spray so that you can water plants.
If you say that a situation is not a bed of roses, you mean that it is not as pleasant as it seems, and that there are some unpleasant aspects to it.

example.ex: We all knew that life was unlikely to be a bed of roses back in England.
example.tran: 我们都知道回到英格兰以后的生活不太可能幸福完美。

collins.tran: 一切进展顺利;一帆风顺
collins.def: If you say that everything is coming up roses for someone, you mean that everything is going well for them.

example.ex: Earlier this year, everything was coming up roses for them. Their 'Going Blank Again' album was selling well, and their British tour was a virtual sell-out.
example.tran: 今年年初，他们一切都很顺利。专辑《再次一片空白》十分畅销，英国巡演的票也几乎销售一空。

collins.def: A brush is an object which has a large number of bristles or hairs fixed to it. You use brushes for painting, for cleaning things, and for tidying your hair.

example.ex: We gave him paint and brushes...
example.tran: 我们给了他油漆和几把刷子。

example.ex: Stains are removed with buckets of soapy water and scrubbing brushes.
example.tran: 污渍是用几桶肥皂水和几把硬毛刷除去的。

collins.def: If you brush something or brush something such as dirt off it, you clean it or tidy it using a brush.

example.ex: Have you brushed your teeth?...
example.tran: 你刷牙了吗？

example.ex: She brushed the powder out of her hair...
example.tran: 她把头发上的粉末刷掉了。

collins.def: If you brush something with a liquid, you apply a layer of that liquid using a brush.

example.ex: Take a sheet of filo pastry and brush it with melted butter.
example.tran: 取一张擀得很薄的油酥面皮，上面刷上一层熔化的牛油。

collins.def: If you brush something somewhere, you remove it with quick light movements of your hands.

example.ex: He brushed his hair back with both hands...
example.tran: 他用两手把头发往后捋。

example.ex: She brushed away tears as she spoke of him...
example.tran: 谈到他时，她拭去了脸上的泪水。

collins.def: If one thing brushes against another or if you brush one thing against another, the first thing touches the second thing lightly while passing it.

example.ex: Something brushed against her leg...
example.tran: 有什么东西扫了一下她的腿。

example.ex: I felt her dark brown hair brushing the back of my shoulder...
example.tran: 我感觉到她深褐色的头发拂过我的肩。

collins.def: If you brush past someone or brush by them, you almost touch them as you go past them.

example.ex: My father would burst into the kitchen, brushing past my mother...
example.tran: 我父亲会紧贴着母亲擦身而过，冲进厨房。

example.ex: He brushed by with a perfunctory wave to the crowd.
example.tran: 他擦身而过，朝人群敷衍地挥了挥手。

collins.def: If you have a brush with someone, you have an argument or disagreement with them. You use brush when you want to make an argument or disagreement sound less serious than it really is.

example.ex: My first brush with a headmaster came six years ago...
example.tran: 我跟校长的第一次冲突发生在6年前。

example.ex: It is his third brush with the law in less than a year.
example.tran: 这已是他在不到一年的时间里第三次触犯法律了。

collins.def: If you have a brush with a particular situation, usually an unpleasant one, you almost experience it.

example.ex: ...the trauma of a brush with death...
example.tran: 和死神擦肩而过的心灵创伤

example.ex: The corporation is fighting to survive its second brush with bankruptcy.
example.tran: 公司正在努力摆脱自身遭遇的第二次破产危机。

collins.def: Brush is an area of rough open land covered with small bushes and trees. You also use brush to refer to the bushes and trees on this land.

example.ex: ...the brush fire that destroyed nearly 500 acres.
example.tran: 焚毁了近500亩灌木丛的大火

example.ex: ...a meadow of low brush and grass.
example.tran: 长有低矮灌木和草的牧场

collins.def: To ruin something means to severely harm, damage, or spoil it.

example.ex: My wife was ruining her health through worry...
example.tran: 忧虑严重损害了我妻子的健康。

example.ex: Entire villages have been washed away. Roads and bridges have been destroyed and crops ruined.
example.tran: 这些村庄全部都被冲走了。道路和桥梁都被破坏了，农作物也全毁了。

collins.def: To ruin someone means to cause them to no longer have any money.

example.ex: She accused him of ruining her financially with his taste for the high life.
example.tran: 她指责他为了追求奢华的生活致使她倾家荡产。

collins.def: Ruin is the state of no longer having any money.

example.ex: The farmers say recent inflation has driven them to the brink of ruin.
example.tran: 农民们说最近的通货膨胀使他们濒临破产。

collins.def: Ruin is the state of being severely damaged or spoiled, or the process of reaching this state.

example.ex: The vineyards were falling into ruin...
example.tran: 这些葡萄园日渐没落。

example.ex: She wasn't going to let her plans go to ruin.
example.tran: 她不会让她的计划破产的。

collins.def: The ruins of something are the parts of it that remain after it has been severely damaged or weakened.

example.ex: The new Turkish republic he helped to build emerged from the ruins of a great empire...
example.tran: 他帮助建立起的新土耳其共和国是从一个伟大帝国的废墟上发展起来的。

example.ex: He stood very still, staring in at the ruins of his work.
example.tran: 他站在那里一动也不动，呆呆地看着他残余的作品。

collins.def: The ruins of a building are the parts of it that remain after the rest has fallen down or been destroyed.

example.ex: One dead child was found in the ruins almost two hours after the explosion...
example.tran: 爆炸发生将近两个小时以后，在废墟中发现了一个已经死亡的小孩。

example.ex: There's only the mountain in this direction, and higher up an old ruin, an abandoned castle.
example.tran: 从这个方向望去只看得到这座山，以及更高处的一处废墟，一座废弃的城堡。

collins.tran: 完全崩溃;垮掉;破败不堪
collins.def: If something is in ruins, it is completely spoiled.

example.ex: Its heavily-subsidized economy is in ruins...
example.tran: 其靠资助维持的经济已经完全崩溃了。

example.ex: This country was once proud of its education system. Now it seems to be in ruins.
example.tran: 这个国家曾一度为其教育体系感到自豪。但现在它似乎已经千疮百孔了。

collins.def: If a building or place is in ruins, most of it has been destroyed and only parts of it remain.

example.ex: The abbey was in ruins...
example.tran: 这个修道院已经成了一片废墟。

example.ex: Within Germany, the city of Berlin lay in ruins.
example.tran: 在德国，柏林市已经满目疮痍。

collins.def: A tunnel is a long passage which has been made under the ground, usually through a hill or under the sea.

example.ex: ...two new railway tunnels through the Alps.
example.tran: 穿过阿尔卑斯山的两条新的铁路隧道

example.ex: …the motorway tunnels under the Hudson river.
example.tran: 哈得孙河下的高速公路隧道

collins.def: To tunnel somewhere means to make a tunnel there.

example.ex: The rebels tunnelled out of a maximum security jail...
example.tran: 叛乱者挖地道逃离了戒备最为森严的监狱。

example.ex: The caterpillars tunnel into the fruit to grow and mature.
example.tran: 毛虫钻入果实，并在其中生长为成虫。

collins.def: Horror is a feeling of great shock, fear, and worry caused by something extremely unpleasant.

example.ex: I felt numb with horror...
example.tran: 我惊呆了。

example.ex: As I watched in horror the boat began to power away from me.
example.tran: 我惊恐万分地看着船加足马力从我身边开走了。

collins.def: If you have a horror of something, you are afraid of it or dislike it very much.

example.ex: ...his horror of death.
example.tran: 他对死亡的惧怕

collins.def: The horror of something, especially something that hurts people, is its very great unpleasantness.

example.ex: ...the horror of this most bloody of civil wars.
example.tran: 这场极其血腥的内战的惨烈

collins.tran: 极其不愉快（或可怕）的经历
collins.def: You can refer to extremely unpleasant or frightening experiences as horrors .

example.ex: Can you possibly imagine all the horrors we have undergone since I last wrote you?
example.tran: 你能想象得出自从我上次给你写信以来我们所经历的所有可怕事情吗？

collins.tran: 极讨厌（或丑陋）的人（或事物）
collins.def: If you refer to someone or something as a horror, you mean that you think they are very unpleasant or ugly.

example.ex: Our host was arrogant and offensive. How his sweet wife could tolerate such a horror was baffling.
example.tran: 招待我们的男主人傲慢无礼。真不知道他温柔的妻子怎么能容忍这样一个讨厌的家伙。

collins.tran: （影片或故事）情节恐怖的，惊悚的
collins.def: A horror film or story is intended to be very frightening.

example.ex: ...a psychological horror film.
example.tran: 心理恐怖片

collins.def: You can refer to an account of a very unpleasant experience or event as a horror story.

example.ex: ...a horror story about lost luggage while flying.
example.tran: 乘飞机旅行时丢失行李的糟糕经历

collins.def: Horror of horrors is used to refer to something that you consider to be the worst part of a situation.

example.ex: The company has already boosted its share of the UK tea market with its round tea bags. Now it is successfully converting the nation to (horror of horrors) instant tea.
example.tran: 该公司已经凭借其袋泡茶提高了自己在英国茶叶市场的占有份额。现在它正在成功地使该国人民改喝（最可怕不过的）速溶茶。

collins.def: A right-wing person or group has conservative or capitalist views.

example.ex: ...a right-wing government...
example.tran: 右翼政府

example.ex: Liberals say the paper is too right-wing.
example.tran: 自由主义者说这家报纸太保守了。

collins.def: The right wing of a political party consists of the members who have the most conservative or the most capitalist views.

example.ex: ...the right wing of the Conservative Party...
example.tran: 保守党右翼

example.ex: Why did the right wing have so much power within the Kremlin?
example.tran: 为什么右派在克里姆林宫有如此大的权力？

collins.def: Medicine is the treatment of illness and injuries by doctors and nurses.

example.ex: He pursued a career in medicine...
example.tran: 他从事医学。

example.ex: I was interested in alternative medicine and becoming an aromatherapist...
example.tran: 我对替代疗法非常感兴趣，想做个芳香疗法治疗师。

collins.def: Medicine is a substance that you drink or swallow in order to cure an illness.

example.ex: People in hospitals are dying because of shortage of medicine.
example.tran: 由于药品匮乏，医院里的病人濒临死亡。

example.ex: ...herbal medicines.
example.tran: 草药

collins.def: A complaint is a statement in which you express your dissatisfaction with a particular situation.

example.ex: There's been a record number of complaints about the standard of service on Britain's railways...
example.tran: 有关英国铁路服务水平的投诉空前的多。

example.ex: People have been reluctant to make formal complaints to the police...
example.tran: 人们不愿向警方作出正式投诉。

collins.tran: 投诉的原因;不满的原因
collins.def: A complaint is a reason for complaining.

example.ex: If you have a complaint about shoes bought from a shop covered by the Footwear Code, there are several ways of putting the matter right...
example.tran: 如果对在Footwear Code旗下零售店里买的鞋有不满意的地方，有几种解决问题的方式。

example.ex: I've got no complaints about them...
example.tran: 对他们我没什么意见。

collins.def: You can refer to an illness as a complaint, especially if it is not very serious.

example.ex: Eczema is a common skin complaint which often runs in families.
example.tran: 湿疹是一种常见的皮肤病，通常具遗传性。

collins.def: The meaning of a word, expression, or gesture is the thing or idea that it refers to or represents and which can be explained using other words.

example.ex: I hadn't a clue to the meaning of 'activism'...
example.tran: 我根本不明白 activism 的意思。

example.ex: I became more aware of the symbols and their meanings.
example.tran: 我进一步理解了这些符号及其意义。

collins.tran: (言语、书、电影等的)含义，主旨，意图
collins.def: The meaning of what someone says or of something such as a book or film is the thoughts or ideas that are intended to be expressed by it.

example.ex: Unsure of the meaning of this remark, Ryle chose to remain silent...
example.tran: 由于不确定这句话究竟是什么意思，赖尔选择了保持沉默。

example.ex: Her book is not without autobiographical meaning.
example.tran: 她的书不无为自己作传的意图。

collins.def: If an activity or action has meaning, it has a purpose and is worthwhile.

example.ex: Art has real meaning when it helps people to understand themselves.
example.tran: 当艺术有助于人们了解自身的时候才有真正的意义。

example.ex: ...a challenge that gives meaning to life.
example.tran: 使生活变得有意义的挑战

collins.tran: (由于缺乏经历、资质等)不理解这个词的含义，不知道什么叫…
collins.def: If you mention something and say that someone doesn't know the meaning of the word, you are emphasizing that they have never experienced the thing mentioned or do not have the quality mentioned.

example.ex: Don't mention failure when Kevin is around. He doesn't know the meaning of the word.
example.tran: 凯文在的时候不要提“失败”这个词。他不知道什么叫“失败”。

means: 有资格的，胜任的，适当的，合格的

collins.tran: (通过考试)取得资格的，有资格的，合格的
collins.def: Someone who is qualified has passed the examinations that they need to pass in order to work in a particular profession.

example.ex: Demand has far outstripped supply of qualified teachers...
example.tran: 有教学资格的教师远远供不应求。

example.ex: The reader should seek the services of a qualified professional for such advice.
example.tran: 读者应该向有资历的专业人士征求此类意见。

collins.tran: （支持、赞同）有限度的，有保留的
collins.def: If you give someone or something qualified support or approval, your support or approval is not total because you have some doubts.

example.ex: The government has given qualified support to the idea...
example.tran: 政府已有所保留地支持这个观点。

example.ex: Mr Wade answers both questions with a qualified yes.
example.tran: 韦德先生对两个问题给出了不完全肯定的回答。

collins.def: If you describe something as a qualified success, you mean that it is only partly successful.

example.ex: Even as a humanitarian mission it has been only a qualified success.
example.tran: 即便是作为一次人道主义行动，它也不过是取得了有限的成功。

means: 带状地带（或森林、湖面等）

collins.def: A strip of something such as paper, cloth, or food is a long, narrow piece of it.

example.ex: ...a new kind of manufactured wood made by pressing strips of wood together and baking them...
example.tran: 一种用木条压紧并烘烤而制成的新型人造木材

example.ex: The simplest rag-rugs are made with strips of fabric plaited together...
example.tran: 最简单的碎布地毯是由碎布条编在一起制成的。

collins.tran: 狭长区域;带状(陆地、水域)
collins.def: A strip of land or water is a long narrow area of it.

example.ex: The coastal cities of Liguria sit on narrow strips of land lying under steep mountains.
example.tran: 利古里亚的沿海城市坐落在陡峭山脉下的狭长地带上。

example.ex: ...a short boat ride across a narrow strip of water.
example.tran: 乘船渡过一小段狭窄的带状水域。

collins.def: A strip is a long street in a city or town, where there are a lot of stores, restaurants, and hotels.

example.ex: ...Goff's Charcoal Hamburgers on Lover's Lane, a busy commercial strip in North Dallas.
example.tran: 位于北达拉斯的一条名为“情人巷”的繁华商业街上的戈夫炭烤汉堡店

collins.def: If you strip, you take off your clothes.

example.ex: They stripped completely, and lay in the damp grass...
example.tran: 他们脱光衣服，躺在潮湿的草地上。

example.ex: Women residents stripped naked in protest.
example.tran: 女性居民裸体以示抗议。

collins.def: If someone is stripped, their clothes are taken off by another person, for example in order to search for hidden or illegal things.

example.ex: One prisoner claimed he'd been dragged to a cell, stripped and beaten.
example.tran: 一名犯人声称他曾被拖进一间牢房，全身被脱光并遭到毒打。

collins.def: To strip something means to remove everything that covers it.

example.ex: After Mike left for work I stripped the beds and vacuumed the carpets...
example.tran: 迈克去上班后，我扯下了床罩并用吸尘器清扫地毯。

example.ex: The floorboards in both this room and the dining room have been stripped, sanded and sealed.
example.tran: 这个房间和餐厅的木地板都已经被刮除涂层并进行了打磨上蜡。

collins.def: If you strip an engine or a piece of equipment, you take it to pieces so that it can be cleaned or repaired.

example.ex: Volvo's three-man team stripped the car and restored it.
example.tran: 沃尔沃公司的 3 人小组将车拆开进行了维修。

collins.tran: 剥夺，褫夺(财产、权利、头衔)
collins.def: To strip someone of their property, rights, or titles means to take those things away from them.

example.ex: The soldiers have stripped the civilians of their passports, and every other type of document...
example.tran: 士兵们已经夺走了平民的护照以及所有其他类型的证件。

example.ex: A senior official was stripped of all his privileges for publicly criticising his employer.
example.tran: 一名高管由于公然批评其老板而被剥夺了所有特权。

collins.def: In a newspaper or magazine, a strip is a series of drawings which tell a story. The words spoken by the characters are often written on the drawings.

example.ex: ...the Doonesbury strip.
example.tran: 杜尼斯伯理政治漫画

collins.tran: 怒斥;痛骂;把…骂得狗血淋头
collins.def: If you tear a strip off someone or if you tear them off a strip, you speak to them angrily and criticize them severely.

example.ex: He heard Nora tearing a strip off an orderly for not returning the food bins to the kitchen soon enough...
example.tran: 他听到诺拉正在破口大骂一名勤务兵没有将食品箱及时送回厨房。

example.ex: When the police arrived to tear him off a strip he apologised for all the trouble he'd caused them.
example.tran: 当警察赶到把他狠狠地教训了一番后，他为自己给他们带来的所有麻烦表示道歉。

collins.def: A grain of wheat, rice, or other cereal crop is a seed from it.

example.ex: ...a grain of wheat.
example.tran: 一粒小麦

example.ex: ...rice grains.
example.tran: 米粒

collins.def: Grain is a cereal crop, especially wheat or corn, that has been harvested and is used for food or in trade.

example.ex: ...a bag of grain.
example.tran: 一袋谷物

example.ex: ...the best grains.
example.tran: 优质谷物

collins.def: A grain of something such as sand or salt is a tiny hard piece of it.

example.ex: ...a grain of sand.
example.tran: 一粒沙子

collins.def: A grain of a quality is a very small amount of it.

example.ex: There's more than a grain of truth in that.
example.tran: 其中含有很深刻的道理。

collins.def: The grain of a piece of wood is the direction of its fibres. You can also refer to the pattern of lines on the surface of the wood as the grain.

example.ex: Brush the paint generously over the wood in the direction of the grain.
example.tran: 顺着木材的纹理刷上厚厚的一层漆。

collins.tran: 违背本来的原则；与…格格不入
collins.def: If you say that an idea or action goes against the grain, you mean that it is very difficult for you to accept it or do it, because it conflicts with your previous ideas, beliefs, or principles.

example.ex: Privatisation goes against the grain of their principle of opposition to private ownership of industry.
example.tran: 私有化有悖于他们反对工业私有的原则。

means: 使有动机，促动，激发，诱导

collins.def: If you are motivated by something, especially an emotion, it causes you to behave in a particular way.

example.ex: They are motivated by a need to achieve...
example.tran: 对成功的渴望激励着他们。

example.ex: The crime was not politically motivated...
example.tran: 该犯罪行为没有政治动机。

collins.def: If someone motivates you to do something, they make you feel determined to do it.

example.ex: How do you motivate people to work hard and efficiently?...
example.tran: 你是怎样激励大家奋发高效地工作的？

example.ex: Never let it be said that the manager doesn't know how to motivate his players.
example.tran: 绝对不要让人说这位主教练不知道如何激励他的队员。

means: 同时代的，同属一个时期的

collins.def: Contemporary things are modern and relate to the present time.
