collins.def: Mild soap or washing-up liquid feels pleasant on your skin and does not contain any substances that might make your skin sore.

example.ex: Wash your face thoroughly with a mild soap and warm water.
example.tran: 用刺激性不强的肥皂和热水把脸彻底洗干净。

collins.def: Mild is a clear, dark-coloured beer.
If you are confident about something, you are certain that it will happen in the way you want it to.

example.ex: I am confident that everything will come out right in time...
example.tran: 我坚信一切终究都会好起来。

example.ex: Mr Ryan is confident of success...
example.tran: 瑞安先生坚信一定会成功。

collins.def: If a person or their manner is confident, they feel sure about their own abilities, qualities, or ideas.

example.ex: In time he became more confident and relaxed...
example.tran: 过了一段时间，他变得更加自信、更为放松。

example.ex: She is a confident woman who is certain of her views.
example.tran: 她是一位充满自信的女性，对自己的观点深信不疑。

collins.def: If you are confident that something is true, you are sure that it is true. A confident statement is one that the speaker is sure is true.

example.ex: She is confident that everybody is on her side...
example.tran: 她确信所有人都站在她这边。

example.ex: 'Bet you I can', comes the confident reply.
example.tran: “我肯定行。”传来一个很有把握的回答。

collins.def: A judgment is an opinion that you have or express after thinking carefully about something.

example.ex: In your judgment, what has changed over the past few years?...
example.tran: 依你看，过去几年里发生了什么改变呢？

example.ex: How can he form any judgement of the matter without the figures?...
example.tran: 没有这些数字，他怎么能对这件事作出任何评价呢？

collins.def: Judgment is the ability to make sensible guesses about a situation or sensible decisions about what to do.

example.ex: I respect his judgement and I'll follow any advice he gives me...
example.tran: 我尊重他的判断能力，会接受他提出的任何建议。

example.ex: He said that publication of the information was a serious error in judgment.
example.tran: 他说该信息的公布属于严重的判断失误。

collins.def: A judgment is a decision made by a judge or by a court of law.

example.ex: The industry was awaiting a judgment from the European Court...
example.tran: 该行业正在等待欧洲法庭作出裁决。

example.ex: The Court is expected to give its judgement within the next ten days.
example.tran: 法庭应于10日内作出判决。

collins.def: If something is against your better judgment, you believe that it would be more sensible or better not to do it.

example.ex: Against my better judgement I agreed...
example.tran: 我勉强同意了。

example.ex: She had become so fond of him, almost against her better judgement.
example.tran: 虽然明知不对，她还是深深喜欢上了他。

collins.tran: 作出评价；（尤指）批评，指责
collins.def: If you pass judgment on someone or something, you give your opinion about it, especially if you are making a criticism.

example.ex: It's not for me to pass judgement, it's a personal matter between the two of you...
example.tran: 不该由我来说三道四，这是你们两个人之间的私事。

example.ex: It's very hard to pass judgement on yourself.
example.tran: 很难对自身作出评价。

collins.tran: 保留意见；暂不发表意见
collins.def: If you reserve judgment on something, you refuse to give an opinion about it until you know more about it.

example.ex: Doctors are reserving judgement on his ability to travel until later in the week.
example.tran: 医生们要等到这周晚些时候再决定他是否适宜旅行。

collins.def: To sit in judgment means to decide whether or not someone is guilty of doing something wrong.

example.ex: He argues very strongly that none of us has the right to sit in judgement.
example.tran: 他激烈地争论说，我们中任何一个人都无权进行审判。

collins.def: If you call someone a fool, you are indicating that you think they are not at all sensible and show a lack of good judgment.

example.ex: 'You fool!' she shouted...
example.tran: “你这个白痴!”她大叫道。

example.ex: He'd been a fool to get involved with her!
example.tran: 他竟然跟她扯到了一起，真是傻瓜！

collins.def: Fool is used to describe an action or person that is not at all sensible and shows a lack of good judgment.

example.ex: What a damn fool thing to do!...
example.tran: 做的什么蠢事啊!

example.ex: What can that fool guard be thinking of?
example.tran: 那个愚蠢的守卫能想什么？

collins.def: If someone fools you, they deceive or trick you.

example.ex: Art dealers fool a lot of people...
example.tran: 艺术经纪人能欺骗很多人。

example.ex: Don't be fooled by his appearance...
example.tran: 别被他的外表欺骗了。

collins.def: If you say that a person is fooling with something or someone, you mean that the way they are behaving is likely to cause problems.

example.ex: What are you doing fooling with such a staggering sum of money?...
example.tran: 你拿着这么一大笔钱瞎折腾什么呢？

example.ex: He kept telling her that here you did not fool with officials.
example.tran: 他一直在告诫她这里的官员不好糊弄。

collins.tran: (旧时国王或王后豢养的)弄臣，小丑
collins.def: In the courts of kings and queens in medieval Europe, the fool was the person whose job was to do silly things in order to make people laugh.
Fool is a dessert made by mixing soft cooked fruit with whipped cream or with custard.

example.ex: ...gooseberry fool.
example.tran: 奶油醋栗泥

collins.def: If you make a fool of someone, you make them seem silly by telling people about something stupid that they have done, or by tricking them.

example.ex: Your brother is making a fool of you...
example.tran: 你哥哥在戏弄你。

example.ex: He'd been made a fool of.
example.tran: 他被愚弄了。

collins.def: If you make a fool of yourself, you behave in a way that makes other people think that you are silly or lacking in good judgment.

example.ex: He was drinking and making a fool of himself.
example.tran: 他在喝酒，让自己出尽了丑。

collins.def: If you say to someone 'More fool you' when they tell you what they have done or what they plan to do, you are indicating that you think that it is silly and shows a lack of judgment.

example.ex: Most managers couldn't care less about information technology. More fool them.
example.tran: 多数的经理管理者根本不关心信息技术，他们真的很傻。

collins.def: If you play the fool or act the fool, you behave in a playful, childish, and foolish way, usually in order to make other people laugh.

example.ex: They used to play the fool together, calling each other silly names and giggling.
example.tran: 他们过去常在一起胡闹，互相取笑。

collins.def: If you fool around, you behave in a silly, dangerous, or irresponsible way.

example.ex: They were fooling around on an Army firing range...
example.tran: 他们在军队的射击训练场里闲晃。

example.ex: Have you been fooling around with something you shouldn't?
example.tran: 你有没有做不该做的事？

collins.def: If someone fools around with another person, especially when one of them is married, they have a casual sexual relationship.

example.ex: Never fool around with the clients' wives...
example.tran: 永远不要和客户的妻子乱搞。

example.ex: Her husband was fooling around.
example.tran: 她的丈夫在外面拈花惹草。

collins.def: If you fool around, you behave in a playful, childish, and silly way, often in order to make people laugh. In British English, you can also say you fool about .

example.ex: Stop fooling about, man...
example.tran: 不要再扮傻充愣了，老兄。

example.ex: They fooled around for the camera.
example.tran: 他们在相机前面乱摆姿势。

collins.def: A railway is a route between two places along which trains travel on steel rails.

example.ex: The road ran beside a railway.
example.tran: 公路建在铁路旁边。

example.ex: ...a disused railway line.
example.tran: 废弃的铁路线

collins.def: A railway is a company or organization that operates railway routes.

example.ex: ...the state-owned French railway.
example.tran: 法国国有铁路公司

example.ex: ...the privatisation of the railways.
example.tran: 铁路私有化

collins.def: A railway is the system and network of tracks that trains travel on.
A vessel is a ship or large boat.

example.ex: A Moroccan fishing vessel and a South Korean cargo ship collided in rough seas.
example.tran: 一艘摩洛哥渔船与一艘韩国货船在波涛汹涌的大海上相撞了。

example.ex: ...a New Zealand navy vessel.
example.tran: 一艘新西兰海军军舰

collins.def: A vessel is a bowl or other container in which liquid is kept.

example.ex: He makes decorative vessels in copper, stainless steel and silver.
example.tran: 他用铜、不锈钢和银制造装饰性器皿。

example.ex: ...storage vessels.
example.tran: 储物容器

collins.def: Your relatives are the members of your family.

example.ex: Do relatives of yours still live in Siberia?...
example.tran: 你的亲属仍然住在西伯利亚吗？

example.ex: Get a relative to look after the children.
example.tran: 找一个亲戚来照看孩子。

collins.def: You use relative to say that something is true to a certain degree, especially when compared with other things of the same kind.

example.ex: The fighting resumed after a period of relative calm...
example.tran: 战斗在相对平静的一段时间之后再次打响。

example.ex: It is a cancer that can be cured with relative ease...
example.tran: 这是一种相对来说比较容易治疗的癌症。

collins.def: You use relative when you are comparing the quality or size of two things.

example.ex: They chatted about the relative merits of London and Paris as places to live...
example.tran: 他们聊起了伦敦和巴黎两座城市相比较都有哪些宜居的优点。

example.ex: I reflected on the relative importance of education in 50 countries.
example.tran: 我思考了50个国家相对而言对教育的重视程度。

collins.tran: 与…相比;与…有关;涉及;关于
collins.def: Relative to something means with reference to it or in comparison with it.

example.ex: Japanese interest rates rose relative to America's...
example.tran: 日本利率随美国利率上浮。

example.ex: House prices now look cheap relative to earnings...
example.tran: 相对收入而言房价现在看起来比较便宜。

collins.def: If you say that something is relative, you mean that it needs to be considered and judged in relation to other things.

example.ex: Fitness is relative; one must always ask 'Fit for what?'...
example.tran: “适合”是相对而言的;应该常常问一问“适合什么？”

example.ex: Truth is relative.
example.tran: 真理是相对的。

collins.tran: 亲缘动物（或植物、语言、发明等)
collins.def: If one animal, plant, language, or invention is a relative of another, they have both developed from the same type of animal, plant, language, or invention.

example.ex: The pheasant is a close relative of the Guinea hen.
example.tran: 雉与珍珠鸡有很近的亲缘关系。

collins.def: A trick is an action that is intended to deceive someone.

example.ex: We are playing a trick on a man who keeps bothering me.
example.tran: 我们正在戏弄那个一直烦我的家伙。

collins.def: If someone tricks you, they deceive you, often in order to make you do something.

example.ex: Stephen is going to be pretty upset when he finds out how you tricked him...
example.tran: 如果斯蒂芬发现你怎样欺骗了他，他会非常气愤。

example.ex: His family tricked him into going to Pakistan, and once he was there, they took away his passport...
example.tran: 家人骗他去了巴基斯坦，等到他一到那里，他们就拿走了他的护照。

collins.def: A trick is a clever or skilful action that someone does in order to entertain people.

example.ex: He shows me card tricks.
example.tran: 他表演纸牌戏法给我看。

collins.def: A trick is a clever way of doing something.

example.ex: Tiffany revamped her sitting room with simple decorative tricks.
example.tran: 蒂法尼采用简单的装饰技巧将起居室翻新。

example.ex: It is not just a little trick you can pick up in half an hour.
example.tran: 这不是你半个小时就能学会的小窍门。

collins.def: If something does the trick, it achieves what you wanted.

example.ex: Sometimes a few choice words will do the trick.
example.tran: 有时说几句尖酸刻薄的话就有人听了。

collins.tran: 千方百计;浑身解数;所有的办法
collins.def: If someone tries every trick in the book, they try every possible thing that they can think of in order to achieve something.

example.ex: Companies are using every trick in the book to stay one step in front of their competitors.
example.tran: 各公司想方设法地保持比竞争者领先一步的优势。

collins.def: If you say that something is a trick of the light, you mean that what you are seeing is an effect caused by the way that the light falls on things, and does not really exist in the way that it appears.

example.ex: Her head appears to be on fire but that is only a trick of the light.
example.tran: 她的头部看上去像是着火了，但那只是灯光造成的幻觉。

collins.tran: 无所(不)知;无事(不)晓;把握住任何机会
collins.def: If you say that someone does not miss a trick, you mean that they always know what is happening and take advantage of every situation.

example.ex: When it comes to integrating their transport systems, the French don't miss a trick.
example.tran: 法国人从不放过任何整合其交通系统的机会。

collins.def: The tricks of the trade are the quick and clever ways of doing something that are known by people who regularly do a particular activity.

example.ex: To get you started, we have asked five successful writers to reveal some of the tricks of the trade.
example.tran: 为了让你开始写作，我们邀请了 5 位成功作家向你透露一些写作秘诀。

collins.def: If you say that someone is up to their tricks or up to their old tricks, you disapprove of them because they are behaving in the dishonest or deceitful way in which they typically behave.

example.ex: I have no respect for my father who, having remarried, is still up to his old tricks.
example.tran: 我对父亲没任何敬意，他已经再婚，却依然喜欢耍老把戏。

collins.def: If a surface is rough, it is uneven and not smooth.

example.ex: His hands were rough and calloused, from years of karate practice...
example.tran: 由于多年练习空手道，他的双手粗糙不平，布满老茧。

example.ex: Grace made her way slowly across the rough ground.
example.tran: 格雷斯缓慢地走过高低不平的地面。

collins.tran: (人或行为)粗暴的，粗野的，粗鲁的
collins.def: You say that people or their actions are rough when they use too much force and not enough care or gentleness.

example.ex: Rugby's a rough game at the best of times...
example.tran: 即使是在比赛最不激烈的时候，橄榄球也是一种粗野的运动。

example.ex: They have complained of discrimination and occasional rough treatment.
example.tran: 他们抗议遭受歧视，而且偶尔还会遭到粗暴的对待。

collins.tran: (地区、城市、学校等)危险的，充斥暴力的，犯罪率高的
collins.def: A rough area, city, school, or other place is unpleasant and dangerous because there is a lot of violence or crime there.

example.ex: It was quite a rough part of our town.
example.tran: 这是我们城里犯罪率很高的地区。

collins.tran: (日子)艰难的，困难的，不愉快的
collins.def: If you say that someone has had a rough time, you mean that they have had some difficult or unpleasant experiences.

example.ex: All women have a rough time in our society...
example.tran: 在我们的社会中，所有女性的日子都不好过。

example.ex: Tomorrow, he knew, would be a rough day.
example.tran: 他知道明天将会是艰难的一天。

collins.def: If you feel rough, you feel ill.

example.ex: The virus won't go away and the lad is still feeling a bit rough.
example.tran: 病毒无法清除，这个小伙子仍然觉得有点不舒服。

collins.tran: (计算、猜测)大概的，粗略的，不精确的
collins.def: A rough calculation or guess is approximately correct, but not exact.

example.ex: We were only able to make a rough estimate of how much fuel would be required...
example.tran: 我们只能对所需燃料作一个粗略的估计。

example.ex: As a rough guide, a horse needs 2.5 per cent of his body weight in food every day.
example.tran: 作为一个大致的参照，一匹马每天需要吃相当于其体重2.5％的食物。

collins.tran: (想法、描述)粗略的，简略的，大致的;(图画)简笔的
collins.def: If you give someone a rough idea, description, or drawing of something, you indicate only the most important features, without much detail.

example.ex: I've got a rough idea of what he looks like...
example.tran: 我已经大致知道他长什么样子了。

example.ex: It often helps to make a rough sketch showing where the vehicles were.
example.tran: 画一个简略的草图标示车辆当时所在的位置往往很有用。

collins.tran: 做工粗糙的;不精致的;简陋的
collins.def: You can say that something is rough when it is not neat and well made.

example.ex: ...a rough wooden table.
example.tran: 做工粗糙的木桌子

example.ex: ...chairs set in a rough circle in the middle of the room.
example.tran: 房间中央大致围成一圈的椅子

collins.tran: (天气)恶劣的，狂风暴雨的;(海面)波浪滔天的
collins.def: If the sea or the weather at sea is rough, the weather is windy or stormy and there are very big waves.

example.ex: A fishing vessel and a cargo ship collided in rough seas.
example.tran: 一艘捕鱼船和一艘货船在波涛汹涌的海上相撞了。

collins.tran: 风餐露宿地;无家可归地;流浪地
collins.def: When people sleep or live rough, they sleep out of doors, usually because they have no home.

example.ex: It makes me so sad when I see young people begging or sleeping rough on the streets.
example.tran: 我看到年轻人沿街乞讨、露宿街头，心里会非常难过。

collins.tran: 过（从前没有过的）艰苦的生活
collins.def: If you have to rough it, you have to live without the possessions and comforts that you normally have.

example.ex: You won't be roughing it; each room comes equipped with a telephone and a 3-channel radio.
example.tran: 你不会过得太艰苦;每个房间都配备了一部电话和一台可以接收3个频道的收音机。

collins.def: An intention is an idea or plan of what you are going to do.

example.ex: Beveridge announced his intention of standing for parliament...
example.tran: 贝弗里奇宣布他打算竞选议员。

example.ex: It is my intention to remain in my position until a successor is elected...
example.tran: 我的打算是继续呆在岗位上,直到选出继任者。

collins.tran: 不想/很想;不打算/一心打算
collins.def: If you say that you have no intention of doing something, you are emphasizing that you are not going to do it. If you say that you have every intention of doing something, you are emphasizing that you intend to do it.

example.ex: We have no intention of buying American jets...
example.tran: 我们无意购买美国喷气式飞机。

example.ex: Those close to him are convinced that he has every intention of staying on until the end of his seven-year term.
example.tran: 他身边的人都确信他打算继续留任，直到 7 年任期期满。

means: 给…戴上帽子，为…提供帽子

collins.def: A hat is a head covering, often with a brim round it, which is usually worn out of doors to give protection from the weather.

If you say that someone is wearing a particular hat, you mean that they are performing a particular role at that time. If you say that they wear several hats, you mean that they have several roles or jobs.

example.ex: ...putting on my nationalistic hat.
example.tran: 扮演我的民族主义角色

example.ex: ...various problems, including too many people wearing too many hats.
example.tran: 各种问题，包括有太多的人身兼多职

collins.tran: 毫不犹豫地;非常乐意地
collins.def: If you say that you are ready to do something at the drop of a hat, you mean that you are willing to do it immediately, without hesitating.

example.ex: India is one part of the world I would go to at the drop of a hat.
example.tran: 印度是世界上我迫不及待想要去的一个地方。

collins.def: If you tell someone to keep a piece of information under their hat, you are asking them not to tell anyone else about it.

example.ex: Look, if I tell you something, will you promise to keep it under your hat?...
example.tran: 喂，如果我告诉你一件事，你能答应保守秘密吗？

example.ex: He kept it all very much under his hat.
example.tran: 在这件事儿上他嘴很紧。

collins.def: If you say that something or someone is old hat, you mean that they have existed or been known for a long time, and they have become uninteresting and boring.

example.ex: The younger generation tell me that religion is 'old hat' and science has proved this.
example.tran: 年轻的一代告诉我，宗教已经过时了，科学已证明了这一点。

collins.tran: 募捐，凑份子（美国英语用 pass the hat）
collins.def: In British English, if you pass the hat around, you collect money from a group of people, for example in order to give someone a present. In American English, you just say pass the hat .

example.ex: Professors are passing the hat to help staff in their department.
example.tran: 教授们正在凑钱帮助系里的同事。

collins.def: If you say that you take your hat off to someone, you mean that you admire them for something that they have done.

example.ex: I take my hat off to Mr Clarke for taking this action...
example.tran: 我很钦佩克拉克先生的这一举动。

example.ex: I was impressed by that, you have to take your hat off to the guy.
example.tran: 我对此印象深刻，你不得不钦佩那个家伙。

collins.def: If you say 'Hats off to someone', you are expressing admiration for them.

example.ex: Hats off to them for supporting the homeless.
example.tran: 向他们帮扶无家可归者的善举致敬！

collins.tran: （常指没落时）出乎意料地获取（胜利、成功）
collins.def: To pull something out of the hat means to do something unexpected which helps you to succeed, often when you are failing.

example.ex: Southampton had somehow managed to pull another Cup victory out of the hat.
example.tran: 南安普敦队最终还是出乎意料地又一次获得了足总杯赛的胜利。

collins.tran: （比赛中挑选胜出者时）随机地，任意地
collins.def: In competitions, if you say that the winners will be drawn or picked out of the hat, you mean that they will be chosen randomly, so everyone has an equal chance of winning.

example.ex: The first 10 correct entries drawn out of the hat will win a pair of tickets, worth £20 each.
example.tran: 随机抽出的前10位答对问题者将获得两张票，每张价值20英镑。

collins.def: Your soul is the part of you that consists of your mind, character, thoughts, and feelings. Many people believe that your soul continues existing after your body is dead.

example.ex: She went to pray for the soul of her late husband...
example.tran: 她去为亡夫的灵魂祈祷。

example.ex: 'I will put my heart and soul into the job,' he promises.
example.tran: “我会全身心投入到工作中去，”他保证说。

collins.tran: (民族或政治运动的)精神，精髓
collins.def: The soul of a nation or a political movement is its basic nature and beliefs.

example.ex: ...a struggle for the soul of the Republican Party.
example.tran: 为实现共和党的基本宗旨而进行的奋斗

collins.def: You can refer to someone as a particular kind of soul when you are describing their character or condition.

example.ex: He's a jolly soul...
example.tran: 他是个乐天派。

example.ex: Her mother, poor soul, came to an even worse end.
example.tran: 她的母亲，那个可怜的人，结局更糟糕。

collins.tran: (用于否定句中)一个人(也没有)
collins.def: You use soul in negative statements like not a soul to mean nobody at all.

example.ex: I've never harmed a soul in my life...
example.tran: 我这一生从未伤害过任何人。

example.ex: There was not a soul there.
example.tran: 那里一个人也没有。

collins.tran: 灵乐(一种主要由美国黑人音乐家表演的流行音乐，源出福音唱诗及布鲁斯乐曲)
collins.def: Soul or soul music is a type of pop music performed mainly by black American musicians. It developed from gospel and blues music and often expresses deep emotions.

example.ex: ...American soul singer Anita Baker.
example.tran: 美国灵乐歌手安妮塔·贝克

collins.def: You can refer to the number of people who live in a particular place as souls .

example.ex: ...a tiny village of only 100 souls.
example.tran: 一个只有 100 位居民的小村庄

collins.tran: 出卖灵魂;做违背良心的事
collins.def: If you say that someone sells their soul, you mean that they do something immoral or bad in order to get something they want such as success or money.

example.ex: ...politicians who would sell their soul for the sake of office.
example.tran: 为了谋求官位而不择手段的政客

means: 老练的，资深的，经验丰富的

collins.def: A veteran is someone who has served in the armed forces of their country, especially during a war.

example.ex: They approved a $1.1 billion package of pay increases for the veterans of the Persian Gulf War.
example.tran: 他们通过了对参加过波斯湾战争的老兵增发共计11亿美元的一揽子提案。

collins.def: You use veteran to refer to someone who has been involved in a particular activity for a long time.

example.ex: ...Tony Benn, the veteran Labour MP and former Cabinet minister.
example.tran: 托尼·本，一位经验丰富的工党下院议员和前内阁部长

collins.def: If something swings or if you swing it, it moves repeatedly backwards and forwards or from side to side from a fixed point.

example.ex: The sail of the little boat swung crazily from one side to the other...
example.tran: 小船的帆猛烈地左右摇摆着。

example.ex: She was swinging a bottle of wine by its neck...
example.tran: 她正握着瓶颈摇晃一瓶葡萄酒。

collins.tran: (使)成弧线运动;(使)转动;(使)转弯
collins.def: If something swings in a particular direction or if you swing it in that direction, it moves in that direction with a smooth, curving movement.

example.ex: The torchlight swung across the little beach and out over the water, searching...
example.tran: 手电筒的光在小海滩上扫过，而后照向水面搜索着。

example.ex: The canoe found the current and swung around...
example.tran: 独木舟遇上急流后直打转。

collins.def: If a vehicle swings in a particular direction, or if the driver swings it in a particular direction, they turn suddenly in that direction.

example.ex: Joanna swung back on to the main approach and headed for the airport...
example.tran: 乔安娜猛地调转车头回到主路上，朝机场开去。

example.ex: The tyres dug into the grit as he swung the car off the road.
example.tran: 当他一个急转弯把车驶离马路时，轮胎陷进了沙子里。

collins.def: If someone swings around, they turn around quickly, usually because they are surprised.

example.ex: She swung around to him, spilling her tea without noticing it.
example.tran: 她一下子转身面向他，茶水溅了出来都没注意到。

collins.tran: (挥动手臂等)朝…打去;朝…挥击;挥向
collins.def: If you swing at a person or thing, you try to hit them with your arm or with something that you are holding.

example.ex: Blanche swung at her but she moved her head back and Blanche missed...
example.tran: 布兰奇挥手朝她打去，但她头向后一闪，布兰奇没有打到。

example.ex: I picked up his baseball bat and swung at the man's head.
example.tran: 我捡起他的棒球棒朝那个人的头打去。

collins.def: A swing is a seat hanging by two ropes or chains from a metal frame or from the branch of a tree. You can sit on the seat and move forwards and backwards through the air.

collins.tran: 摇摆乐(流行于 20 世纪 30 年代的爵士舞曲)
collins.def: Swing is a style of jazz dance music that was popular in the 1930's. It was played by big bands.

collins.tran: (意见、态度或感情的)改变;(尤指)突变，巨变
collins.def: A swing in people's opinions, attitudes, or feelings is a change in them, especially a sudden or big change.

example.ex: There was a massive twenty per cent swing away from the Conservatives to the Liberal Democrats...
example.tran: 出现了一个巨大转变:多达20％的人由支持保守党转而支持自由民主党。

example.ex: Educational practice is liable to sudden swings and changes...
example.tran: 教学实践中经常会出现突然的变化与改革。

collins.tran: (意见、态度或感情)改变;(尤指)突然转变，完全改变
collins.def: If people's opinions, attitudes, or feelings swing, they change, especially in a sudden or extreme way.

example.ex: In two years' time there is a presidential election, and the voters could swing again...
example.tran: 总统选举在两年后举行，届时选民们可能会再次倒向另一方。

example.ex: The mood amongst Tory MPs seems to be swinging away from their leader.
example.tran: 保守党议员似乎正在疏远他们的领袖。

collins.def: If someone such as a politician makes a swing through a particular country or area, they go on a quick trip through it, visiting a number of different places.

example.ex: ...a campaign swing through South Dakota and Texas.
example.tran: 在南达科他州和得克萨斯州的巡回竞选活动

collins.tran: 在热烈进行中;处于兴盛阶段
collins.def: If something is in full swing, it is operating fully and is no longer in its early stages.

example.ex: When we returned, the party was in full swing and the dance floor was crowded...
example.tran: 我们回来时，聚会已进入高潮，舞池里挤满了人。

example.ex: The international rugby season is in full swing.
example.tran: 国际橄榄球赛季正如火如荼地进行着。

collins.tran: 融入;完全投入;对…乐在其中
collins.def: If you get into the swing of something, you become very involved in it and enjoy what you are doing.

example.ex: Everyone understood how hard it was to get back into the swing of things after such a long absence.
example.tran: 每个人都知道这么长时间不在，再重新完全融入进来有多难。

collins.def: If you say that something is going with a swing, you mean that it is lively and exciting.

example.ex: Sara Lewis' impressive recipes are guaranteed to make the party go with a swing.
example.tran: 萨拉·刘易斯令人赞不绝口的食谱一定能使聚会的气氛热烈非凡。

collins.def: If you say that a situation is swings and roundabouts, you mean that there are as many gains as there are losses.

collins.tran: （尤指足够的或超出需要的）丰富，充足，大量
collins.def: If there is plenty of something, there is a large amount of it. If there are plenty of things, there are many of them. Plenty is used especially to indicate that there is enough of something, or more than you need.

example.ex: There was still plenty of time to take Jill out for pizza...
example.tran: 还有充裕的时间带吉尔出去吃比萨饼。

example.ex: Most businesses face plenty of competition...
example.tran: 大多数企业面临着巨大的竞争压力。

collins.def: Plenty is a situation in which people have a lot to eat or a lot of money to live on.

example.ex: You are all fortunate to be growing up in a time of peace and plenty.
example.tran: 你们都很幸运，成长在和平富足的时代。

example.ex: ...an area that has become a symbol of despair in the midst of America's plenty.
example.tran: 在富庶的美国已成为绝望象征的一个地区

collins.tran: （用于形容词或副词前）非常，十分，很
collins.def: You use plenty in front of adjectives or adverbs to emphasize the degree of the quality they are describing.

example.ex: The water looked plenty deep...
example.tran: 这水看起来很深。

example.ex: The compartment is plenty big enough...
example.tran: 这个隔间足够大了。

collins.def: If there are things in plenty, those things exist or happen in large amounts or numbers.

example.ex: There were thrills in plenty on Saturday at Terrassa, where Germany won the gold medal...
example.tran: 周六的塔拉萨充满着紧张兴奋的气氛，德国队在此赢得了金牌。

example.ex: School inspectors visit regularly, finding everything satisfactory, books in plenty and five computer terminals.
example.tran: 督学定期进行检查，发现所有方面都令人满意，教材充足，还有5台计算机终端设备。

collins.def: To harm a person or animal means to cause them physical injury, usually on purpose.

example.ex: The hijackers seemed anxious not to harm anyone.
example.tran: 劫持犯似乎焦虑不安，不想伤害任何人。

collins.def: Harm is physical injury to a person or an animal which is usually caused on purpose.

example.ex: All dogs are capable of doing harm to human beings.
example.tran: 只要是狗就可能会咬人。

collins.tran: 破坏;损害;对…产生不利影响
collins.def: To harm a thing, or sometimes a person, means to damage them or make them less effective or successful than they were.

example.ex: ...a warning that the product may harm the environment...
example.tran: 该产品可能会危害环境的警告

example.ex: Low-priced imports will harm the industry.
example.tran: 低价进口品将会对该行业造成危害。

collins.def: Harm is the damage to something which is caused by a particular course of action.

example.ex: The abuse of your powers does harm to all other officers who do their job properly...
example.tran: 滥用权力会对其他所有恪守职责的官员们造成伤害。

example.ex: To cut taxes would probably do the economy more harm than good.
example.tran: 减税对经济而言可能弊大于利。

collins.tran: 不会受损害;不会受到伤害;会安然无恙
collins.def: If you say that someone or something will come to no harm or that no harm will come to them, you mean that they will not be hurt or damaged in any way.

example.ex: There is always a lifeguard to ensure that no one comes to any harm...
example.tran: 总是有一个救生员在场以确保无人受到伤害。

example.ex: 'Go back and make sure that no harm comes to him,' he said quietly.
example.tran: “快回去吧，要保证他安然无恙，”他平静地说。

collins.tran: 也许值得（做某事）;不妨（做某事）
collins.def: If you say it does no harm to do something or there is no harm in doing something, you mean that it might be worth doing, and you will not be blamed for doing it.

example.ex: They are not always willing to take on untrained workers, but there's no harm in asking.
example.tran: 他们并不总是乐意雇用未经培训的工人，但问问也无妨。

collins.tran: （做某事）没有坏处，有益;不妨（做某事）
collins.def: If you say that something would do no harm, or do someone no harm, you are recommending a course of action which you think is worthwhile, helpful, or useful.

example.ex: It would do her no harm to try them until we found the one which suited her best.
example.tran: 她不妨把这些都试试，直到我们找到最适合她的为止。

collins.tran: 没有产生危害;没有人受到伤害
collins.def: If you say that there is no harm done, you are telling someone not to worry about something that has happened because it has not caused any serious injury or damage.

example.ex: There, now, you're all right. No harm done.
example.tran: 好了，你现在没事了，没人受伤。

collins.def: If someone is put in harm's way, they are caused to be in a dangerous situation.

example.ex: These men were never told how they'd been put in harm's way...
example.tran: 从来没人告诉这些人他们是如何被置于险境的。

example.ex: They could be in harm's way if military action becomes necessary.
example.tran: 如果非采取军事行动不可的话，他们的处境会非常危险。

collins.tran: 在安全的地方;没有危险
collins.def: If someone or something is out of harm's way, they are in a safe place away from danger or from the possibility of being damaged.

example.ex: For parents, it is an easy way of keeping their children entertained, or simply out of harm's way...
example.tran: 对父母来说，这是一个能让孩子们开心或者说是让他们远离危险的简单方法。

example.ex: Workers scrambled to carry priceless objects out of harm's way.
example.tran: 工人们争先恐后地将价值连城的物品运到安全的地方。

collins.def: Previously means at some time before the period that you are talking about.

example.ex: Guyana's railways were previously owned by private companies...
example.tran: 圭亚那的铁路以前是归私有企业所有的。

example.ex: The contract was awarded to a previously unknown company...
example.tran: 合同签给了一个之前并不知名的公司。

collins.def: You can use previously to say how much earlier one event was than another event.

example.ex: He had first entered the House 12 years previously...
example.tran: 12年前，他首次成为议员。

example.ex: She had rented the flat from the council some fourteen months previously.
example.tran: 大约14个月以前，她从地方政府那里租下了这套公寓。

collins.def: If you remark that something is the case, you say that it is the case.

example.ex: I remarked that I would go shopping that afternoon...
example.tran: 我说过我那天下午要去购物。

example.ex: 'Some people have more money than sense,' Winston had remarked...
example.tran: “某些人钱多但无头脑，”温斯顿曾经评论道。

collins.def: If you make a remark about something, you say something about it.

example.ex: She has made outspoken remarks about the legalisation of cannabis in Britain...
example.tran: 她对英国关于大麻的立法进行了大胆评论。

example.ex: Geoff Cooke's recent remark that no one is indispensable will certainly not have escaped him.
example.tran: 杰夫·库克近来关于没有什么人是不可缺少的那番话当然也包括他。

collins.def: If you sustain something, you continue it or maintain it for a period of time.

example.ex: But he has sustained his fierce social conscience from young adulthood through old age...
example.tran: 而他从青年时期一直到老年都始终保持着强烈的社会良知。

example.ex: The parameters within which life can be sustained on Earth are extraordinarily narrow.
example.tran: 地球上生命可以存活下来的地域范围是非常狭小的。

collins.def: If you sustain something such as a defeat, loss, or injury, it happens to you.

example.ex: Every aircraft in there has sustained some damage...
example.tran: 那里的每架飞机都受到了一些损坏。

example.ex: A seventeen-year-old tourist died late last night of injuries sustained in yesterday's bomb blast.
example.tran: 一位 17 岁的游客在昨天的炸弹爆炸中受伤并于当天深夜身亡。

collins.def: If something sustains you, it supports you by giving you help, strength, or encouragement.

example.ex: The cash dividends they get from the cash crop would sustain them during the lean season...
example.tran: 从经济作物中获得的收益能帮助他们度过不景气的时期。

example.ex: I am sustained by letters of support and what people say to me in ordinary daily life...
example.tran: 这些支持的信件和人们每天对我的鼓励一直支撑着我。

collins.def: When someone screams, they make a very loud, high-pitched cry, for example because they are in pain or are very frightened.

example.ex: Women were screaming; some of the houses nearest the bridge were on fire...
example.tran: 女人们在尖叫;离桥最近的几所房屋起火了。

example.ex: If I hear one more joke about my hair, I shall scream...
example.tran: 如果我再听到有人拿我的头发开玩笑，我就会尖叫。

collins.def: If you scream something, you shout it in a loud, high-pitched voice.

example.ex: 'Brigid!' she screamed. 'Get up!'...
example.tran: “布里吉德！”她尖叫道，“起来！”

example.ex: I was screaming at them to get out of my house...
example.tran: 我尖叫着让他们离开我的家。

collins.def: When something makes a loud, high-pitched noise, you can say that it screams .

example.ex: She slammed the car into gear, the tyres screaming as her foot jammed against the accelerator...
example.tran: 她用力关上车门发动汽车，脚猛踩油门时轮胎发出刺耳的声音。

example.ex: As he talked, an airforce jet screamed over the town.
example.tran: 他谈话时，一架军用喷气式飞机在镇子上空呼啸而过。

collins.def: If you say that someone is a scream, you think they are very funny.
Chaos is a state of complete disorder and confusion.

example.ex: The world's first transatlantic balloon race ended in chaos last night...
example.tran: 昨晚世界第一届跨大西洋热气球比赛在一片混乱中收场。

example.ex: It is impossible to establish democracy amid economic chaos.
example.tran: 经济秩序混乱不堪，是不可能建立民主的。

means: 浪漫的，谈情说爱的，多情的，风流的，香艳的
空想的，虚构的，怪诞的，想入非非的，不实际的，难实行的（计划等）
传奇（式）的，小说般的，情节离奇的
浪漫主义作家[画家等]，浪漫派诗人[艺术家]

collins.tran: （人）浪漫的，富于浪漫气息的，有情调的
collins.def: Someone who is romantic or does romantic things says and does things that make their wife, husband, girlfriend, or boyfriend feel special and loved.

example.ex: When we're together, all he talks about is business. I wish he were more romantic...
example.tran: 我们在一起的时候，他总是谈论生意。我希望他能更浪漫一点。

example.ex: They enjoyed a romantic dinner for two at one of their favourite restaurants.
example.tran: 他俩在他们最喜欢的一家餐馆里吃了一顿浪漫的二人晚餐。

collins.def: Romantic means connected with sexual love.

example.ex: ...his early romantic experiences...
example.tran: 他早期的性爱经历

example.ex: He was not interested in a romantic relationship with Ingrid.
example.tran: 他并没有兴趣和英格丽德发生性关系。

collins.tran: （戏剧、电影或故事）关于爱情的，浪漫的
collins.def: A romantic play, film, or story describes or represents a love affair.

example.ex: It is a lovely romantic comedy, well worth seeing.
example.tran: 这是一部温馨的爱情喜剧，非常值得一看。

example.ex: ...romantic novels.
example.tran: 爱情小说

collins.tran: (观点等)不现实的，不切实际的，空想的
collins.def: If you say that someone has a romantic view or idea of something, you are critical of them because their view of it is unrealistic and they think that thing is better or more exciting than it really is.

example.ex: He has a romantic view of rural society...
example.tran: 他对农村的看法不切实际。

example.ex: I don't have any romantic notions about having a baby. It's a really tough job.
example.tran: 我对生孩子并没有抱任何幻想。这的确是件很不容易的事情。

collins.tran: （事物）浪漫的，富有浪漫色彩的，充满浪漫气息的
collins.def: Something that is romantic is beautiful in a way that strongly affects your feelings.

example.ex: Seacliff House is one of the most romantic ruins in Scotland.
example.tran: 海崖城堡是苏格兰最富有浪漫色彩的遗迹之一。

example.ex: ...romantic images from travel brochures.
example.tran: 旅行手册上充满浪漫色彩的图片

collins.tran: 浪漫主义的（描述18、19世纪注重抒发个人情感的艺术运动）
collins.def: Romantic means connected with the artistic movement of the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries which was concerned with the expression of the individual's feelings and emotions.

example.ex: ...the poems and prose of the English romantic poets.
example.tran: 英国浪漫主义诗人的诗歌和散文

collins.def: A diplomat is a senior official who discusses affairs with another country on behalf of his or her own country, usually working as a member of an embassy.
Juice is the liquid that can be obtained from a fruit.

example.ex: ...fresh orange juice...
example.tran: 鲜榨橙汁

example.ex: Soak the couscous overnight in the juice of about six lemons.
example.tran: 将粗麦粉浸于大约6个柠檬榨出的果汁中，浸泡整夜。

collins.def: The juices of a piece of meat are the liquid that comes out of it when you cook it.

example.ex: When cooked, drain off the juices and put the meat in a processor or mincer.
example.tran: 肉煮熟后，沥干肉汁，将其放入食品加工机或绞肉机中。

collins.def: The juices in your stomach are the fluids that help you to digest food.

collins.tran: (常指在生理上，有时也指在精神上)生病的，有病的
collins.def: If you are sick, you are ill. Sick usually means physically ill, but it can sometimes be used to mean mentally ill.

example.ex: He's very sick. He needs medication...
example.tran: 他病得很厉害，需要药物治疗。

example.ex: She found herself with two small children, a sick husband, and no money...
example.tran: 她发觉自己有两个年幼的孩子和一个有病在身的丈夫，却没钱养活他们。

collins.def: If you are sick, the food that you have eaten comes up from your stomach and out of your mouth. If you feel sick, you feel as if you are going to be sick.

example.ex: She got up and was sick in the handbasin...
example.tran: 她起身在洗手池里吐了起来。

example.ex: The very thought of food made him feel sick...
example.tran: 一想到食物他就恶心。

collins.def: Sick is vomit.
If you say that you are sick of something or sick and tired of it, you are emphasizing that you are very annoyed by it and want it to stop.

example.ex: I am sick and tired of hearing all these people moaning...
example.tran: 我厌倦了听这些人大发牢骚。

example.ex: Most people here are sick of violence.
example.tran: 这儿的大多数人都厌恶暴力。

collins.tran: (笑话、故事等)令人毛骨悚然的，病态的，不健康的
collins.def: If you describe something such as a joke or story as sick, you mean that it deals with death or suffering in an unpleasantly humorous way.

example.ex: ...a sick joke about a cat...
example.tran: 关于猫的一则令人毛骨悚然的笑话

example.ex: That's really sick.
example.tran: 那真够吓人的。

collins.def: If you say that something or someone makes you sick, you mean that they make you feel angry or disgusted.

example.ex: It makes me sick that people commit offences and never get punished...
example.tran: 一些人屡屡犯罪却从未受到惩戒，这真让我气愤。

example.ex: The British press makes me sick.
example.tran: 英国新闻界让我很反感。

collins.def: If you are off sick, you are not at work because you are ill.

example.ex: When we are off sick, we only receive half pay.
example.tran: 我们请病假的时候只能拿一半薪水。

collins.def: If you say that you are worried sick, you are emphasizing that you are extremely worried.

example.ex: He was worried sick about what our mothers would say.
example.tran: 对于我们双方的母亲会说什么他十分担心。

collins.def: You use o'clock after numbers from one to twelve to say what time it is. For example, if you say that it is 9 o'clock, you mean that it is nine hours after midnight or nine hours after midday.

example.ex: The trouble began just after ten o'clock last night...
example.tran: 昨晚刚过10点钟麻烦就开始了。

example.ex: I went to sleep, and at two o'clock in the morning I woke up.
example.tran: 我睡着了，凌晨两点的时候醒了过来。

means: 恐怖主义者，恐怖分子，恐怖分子

collins.def: A terrorist is a person who uses violence, especially murder and bombing, in order to achieve political aims.

example.ex: One American was killed and three were wounded in terrorist attacks.
example.tran: 在几起恐怖袭击中，一名美国人遇难，三人受伤。

collins.def: If you advertise something such as a product, an event, or a job, you tell people about it in newspapers, on television, or on posters in order to encourage them to buy the product, go to the event, or apply for the job.

example.ex: The players can advertise baked beans, but not rugby boots...
example.tran: 球员可以给烤菜豆做广告，但不能代言橄榄球靴。

example.ex: In 1991, the house was advertised for sale at $49,000...
example.tran: 1991年，这座房子登广告出售，售价为49,000美元。

collins.tran: （在报纸、电视、公告栏上）登广告招募，登广告征求
collins.def: If you advertise for someone to do something for you, for example to work for you or share your accommodation, you announce it in a newspaper, on television, or on a notice board.

example.ex: We advertised for staff in a local newspaper...
example.tran: 我们在一家地方报纸上刊登了招聘广告。

example.ex: I shall advertise for someone to go with me.
example.tran: 我将登广告寻人和我同去。

collins.tran: （通过外表或行为）显示（某种特质）；使变得显眼
collins.def: If someone or something advertises a particular quality, they show it in their appearance or behaviour.

example.ex: His hard sinewy body advertised his ruthlessness of purpose.
example.tran: 他健硕的身体使他显得意志尤为坚强。

collins.tran: 宣扬；张扬；引起对…的注意
collins.def: If you do not advertise the fact that something is the case, you try not to let other people know about it.

example.ex: There is no need to advertise the fact that you are a single woman...
example.tran: 没有必要张扬你是一个单身女性。

example.ex: I didn't want to advertise the fact that he hadn't driven me to the airport.
example.tran: 我不想宣扬他没有开车送我去机场的事。

collins.def: Something that is a symbol of a society or an aspect of life seems to represent it because it is very typical of it.

example.ex: To them, the monarchy is the special symbol of nationhood...
example.tran: 对他们来说，君主政体是国家地位的特殊象征。

example.ex: She was put under house arrest two years ago but remained a powerful symbol in last year's election.
example.tran: 虽然两年前就已遭软禁，她在去年的选举中仍然是势力强大的代表人物。

collins.def: A symbol of something such as an idea is a shape or design that is used to represent it.

example.ex: Later in this same passage Yeats resumes his argument for the Rose as an Irish symbol...
example.tran: 随后在同一篇诗歌里，叶芝再次将玫瑰作为爱尔兰的标志。

example.ex: I frequently use sunflowers as symbols of strength.
example.tran: 我经常用向日葵来作为力量的象征。

collins.def: A symbol for an item in a calculation or scientific formula is a number, letter, or shape that represents that item.

example.ex: What's the chemical symbol for mercury?
example.tran: 汞的化学元素符号是什么？

collins.def: If doctors or medical treatments cure an illness or injury, they cause it to end or disappear.

example.ex: An operation finally cured his shin injury...
example.tran: 手术最终治好了他胫部的伤。

example.ex: Her cancer can only be controlled, not cured.
example.tran: 她的癌症只能控制，无法治愈。

collins.tran: 治好，治愈(病人);使恢复健康
collins.def: If doctors or medical treatments cure a person, they make the person well again after an illness or injury.

example.ex: MDT is an effective treatment and could cure all the leprosy sufferers worldwide...
example.tran: 联合化疗是一种有望治愈全世界所有麻风病患者的有效治疗方法。

example.ex: Almost overnight I was cured...
example.tran: 几乎是一夜间我就被治好了。

collins.def: A cure for an illness is a medicine or other treatment that cures the illness.

example.ex: There is still no cure for a cold...
example.tran: 尚没有治疗感冒的特效药。

example.ex: Atkinson has been told rest is the only cure for his ankle injury.
example.tran: 阿特金森被告知休息是唯一能治好他脚踝伤的办法。

collins.def: If someone or something cures a problem, they bring it to an end.

example.ex: Private firms are willing to make large scale investments to help cure Russia's economic troubles...
example.tran: 私有企业愿意投巨资帮助俄罗斯渡过经济难关。

example.ex: We need to cure our environmental problems.
example.tran: 我们需要解决环境问题。

collins.def: A cure for a problem is something that will bring it to an end.

example.ex: Punishment can never be an effective cure for acute social problems...
example.tran: 惩罚绝不是解决严重社会问题的有效办法。

example.ex: The magic cure for inflation does not exist.
example.tran: 抑制通货膨胀没有什么灵丹妙药。

collins.tran: 矫正，使放弃(习惯或态度)
collins.def: If an action or event cures someone of a habit or an attitude, it makes them stop having it.

example.ex: The experience was a detestable ordeal, and it cured him of any ambitions to direct again...
example.tran: 那次经历是一次令人厌恶的煎熬，使得他放弃了任何再当导演的想法。

example.ex: He went to a clinic to cure his drinking and overeating.
example.tran: 他去诊所戒酒并控制饮食。

collins.tran: (用干燥、熏、腌等方法)加工贮藏
collins.def: When food, tobacco, or animal skin is cured, it is dried, smoked, or salted so that it will last for a long time.

example.ex: Legs of pork were cured and smoked over the fire.
example.tran: 在火上熏制猪腿。

example.ex: ...sliced cured ham.
example.tran: 切成片的熏火腿

means: 取…的样品，尤指用样品来检验

collins.def: A sample of a substance or product is a small quantity of it that shows you what it is like.

example.ex: You'll receive samples of paint, curtains and upholstery...
example.tran: 你将收到涂料、窗帘、家具垫衬套的样品。

example.ex: We're giving away 2000 free samples...
example.tran: 我们正免费发放 2,000 份样品。

collins.def: A sample of a substance is a small amount of it that is examined and analysed scientifically.

example.ex: They took samples of my blood.
example.tran: 他们取了我的血样。

example.ex: ...urine samples.
example.tran: 尿样

collins.def: A sample of people or things is a number of them chosen out of a larger group and then used in tests or used to provide information about the whole group.

example.ex: We based our analysis on a random sample of more than 200 males.
example.tran: 我们随机抽查了 200 多名男性，并在此基础上进行分析。

collins.def: If you sample food or drink, you taste a small amount of it in order to find out if you like it.

example.ex: We sampled a selection of different bottled waters.
example.tran: 我们品尝了一系列不同品牌的瓶装水。

collins.def: If you sample a place or situation, you experience it for a short time in order to find out about it.

example.ex: ...the chance to sample a different way of life.
example.tran: 体验不同生活方式的机会

collins.def: When musicians or pieces of their music are sampled, parts of their music are used by other musicians in their own work.

example.ex: I don't actually mind being sampled as long as people give credit where it's due.
example.tran: 只要人们在适当处标明出处，我其实并不在乎自己的音乐被人节录。

collins.def: The universe is the whole of space and all the stars, planets, and other forms of matter and energy in it.

example.ex: Einstein's equations showed the Universe to be expanding...
example.tran: 爱因斯坦的方程式表明宇宙正在膨胀。

example.ex: Early astronomers thought that our planet was the centre of the universe.
example.tran: 早期的天文学家认为我们的星球是宇宙的中心。

collins.def: If you talk about someone's universe, you are referring to the whole of their experience or an important part of it.

example.ex: Good writers suck in what they see of the world, recreating their own universe on the page...
example.tran: 优秀的作家从他们眼中的世界汲取体验，然后在纸上重塑自己的天地。

example.ex: They marked out the boundaries of our visual universe...
example.tran: 他们标出了我们视觉经验领域的界限。

collins.def: If you say that something is, for example, the best or biggest thing of its kind in the universe, you are emphasizing that you think it is bigger or better than anything else of its kind.

example.ex: According to my friends I am the coolest, thinnest, cleverest, funniest journalist in the universe.
example.tran: 我的朋友说我是全天下最酷、最瘦、最聪明、最幽默的记者。

collins.tran: （用于否定句）哪儿，到处（都没有）
collins.def: You use anywhere in statements with negative meaning to indicate that a place does not exist.

example.ex: I haven't got anywhere to live...
example.tran: 我还没找到住的地方。

example.ex: There had never been such a beautiful woman anywhere in the world.
example.tran: 世界上从未有过如此美丽的女人。

collins.tran: （用于疑问句和条件从句）某个地方，哪里
collins.def: You use anywhere in questions and conditional clauses to ask or talk about a place without saying exactly where you mean.

example.ex: Did you try to get help from anywhere?...
example.tran: 你尝试过从哪里寻求帮助吗？

example.ex: If she wanted to go anywhere at all she had to wait for her father to drive her.
example.tran: 她想去任何地方都只能等父亲开车送她去。

collins.tran: （用于描述所谈论的某个地方的词语前）…地方
collins.def: You use anywhere before words that indicate the kind of place you are talking about.

example.ex: In America most leisure-time activities are about a million times better than anywhere else...
example.tran: 美国大多数休闲娱乐活动比其他地方要丰富得多的多。

example.ex: He'll meet you anywhere you want...
example.tran: 他随你在哪儿见面都行。

collins.def: You use anywhere to refer to a place when you are emphasizing that it could be any of a large number of places.

example.ex: Rachel would have known Julia Stone anywhere.
example.tran: 甭管到哪儿，雷切尔都会认出朱莉娅·斯通。

example.ex: ...jokes that are so funny they always work anywhere.
example.tran: 屡试不爽的极为有趣的笑话

collins.def: When you do not want to be exact, you use anywhere to refer to a particular range of things.

example.ex: His shoes cost anywhere from $200 up...
example.tran: 他买的鞋子总在200美元以上。

example.ex: My visits lasted anywhere from three weeks to two months.
example.tran: 我每次逗留时间从3个星期到两个月不等。

collins.tran: （用于强调）根本，一点儿，将近，几乎
collins.def: You use anywhere in expressions such as anywhere near and anywhere close to to emphasize a statement that you are making.

example.ex: There weren't anywhere near enough empty boxes...
example.tran: 空箱子数量远远不够。

example.ex: The only one who's anywhere close to the truth is my mother.
example.tran: 唯一算得上了解真相的人是我的母亲。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is not getting anywhere or is not going anywhere, you mean that they are not making progress or achieving a satisfactory result.

example.ex: The conversation did not seem to be getting anywhere...
example.tran: 会谈好像没有取得任何进展。

example.ex: I didn't see that my career as a film-maker was going anywhere.
example.tran: 我发现我作为电影制片人的职业没有什么发展前途。

means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 沃尔地貌名称，石墙，来源于古英语
[人名] [爱尔兰姓氏] 沃尔地貌名称，泉或溪流，来源于北方中世纪英语，北方英格兰人姓氏
[人名] [爱尔兰姓氏] 沃尔 Vale的变体，盖尔语姓氏的英语形式

collins.def: A wall is one of the vertical sides of a building or room.

example.ex: Kathryn leaned against the wall of the church...
example.tran: 凯瑟琳倚靠在教堂的墙上。

example.ex: The bedroom walls would be painted light blue...
example.tran: 卧室的墙壁会被漆成浅蓝色。

collins.def: A wall is a long narrow vertical structure made of stone or brick that surrounds or divides an area of land.

example.ex: He sat on the wall in the sun...
example.tran: 他坐在墙上晒太阳。

example.ex: The well is surrounded by a wall only 12 inches high.
example.tran: 井台只有12英寸高。

collins.def: The wall of something that is hollow is its side.

example.ex: He ran his fingers along the inside walls of the box.
example.tran: 他用手指摸了摸盒子的内壁。

collins.tran: 屏障;堆成墙的大量物品
collins.def: A wall of something is a large amount of it forming a high vertical barrier.

example.ex: She gazed at the wall of books...
example.tran: 她目不转睛地盯着书墙。

example.ex: I was just hit by a wall of water.
example.tran: 我刚撞上了一堵水墙。

collins.def: You can describe something as a wall of a particular kind when it acts as a barrier and prevents people from understanding something.

example.ex: The police say they met the usual wall of silence...
example.tran: 警方称他们像往常一样碰了壁，没人吭气。

example.ex: Despite its prevalence, schizophrenia has existed behind a wall of secrecy for years.
example.tran: 尽管精神分裂症患者为数众多，但多年来这种病一直被捂着掩着。

collins.def: If you say that you are banging your head against a wall, you are emphasizing that you are frustrated because someone is stopping you from making progress in something.

example.ex: I appealed for help but felt I was always banging my head against a wall...
example.tran: 我寻求帮助，却发现自己处处碰壁。

example.ex: I wondered if I was banging my head against a brick wall.
example.tran: 我怀疑自己是不是在把鸡蛋往石头上碰，徒劳无益。

collins.tran: 处于困境（或绝境);走投无路
collins.def: If you have your back to the wall, you are in a very difficult situation and can see no way out of it.

example.ex: Their threat to hire replacement workers has the union with its back to the wall.
example.tran: 他们威胁说要雇用替工，这使工会陷入了困境。

collins.def: If you say that you are climbing the walls, you are emphasizing that you feel very frustrated, nervous, or anxious.

example.ex: Sitting at home would only have had him climbing the walls with frustration.
example.tran: 呆在家里只会让他沮丧得抓狂。

collins.tran: 把…逼得发疯；逼得…受不了
collins.def: If you say that something or someone is driving you up the wall, you are emphasizing that they annoy and irritate you.

example.ex: The heat is driving me up the wall...
example.tran: 炎热快把我逼疯了。

example.ex: I sang in the bath and drove my parents up the wall.
example.tran: 我在浴室里唱歌，我父母快受不了了。

collins.def: If a person or company goes to the wall, they lose all their money and their business fails.

example.ex: Even quite big companies are going to the wall these days.
example.tran: 现如今甚至有些大公司也濒临破产。

collins.def: A palace is a very large impressive house, especially one which is the official home of a king, queen, or president.

example.ex: ...Buckingham Palace...
example.tran: 白金汉宫

example.ex: They entered the palace courtyard.
example.tran: 他们进入了宫殿庭院。

collins.def: When the members of a royal palace make an announcement through an official spokesperson, they can be referred to as the Palace .

example.ex: The Palace will not comment on questions about the family's private life.
example.tran: 王室不会就有关皇家私生活的问题发表任何评论。

collins.def: You can refer to any large splendid house or other building as a palace .

example.ex: They'd bought a huge barn with some land and planned to turn it into a palace.
example.tran: 他们买了一个带有一片土地的大谷仓，计划将其改建为一座豪宅。

collins.def: Socialist means based on socialism or relating to socialism.

example.ex: ...members of the ruling Socialist party...
example.tran: 执政的社会主义党党员

example.ex: ...low-inflation policies practised by the socialist government...
example.tran: 社会主义政府执行的低通货膨胀政策

collins.tran: 社会主义者;社会主义党人
collins.def: A socialist is a person who believes in socialism or who is a member of a socialist party.

example.ex: The French electorate voted out the socialists.
example.tran: 法国大选中社会主义党人落选。

means: （国家的）岁入，税收，（土地，财产等的）收入，收益，所得，（个人的）固定收入

collins.tran: (公司、组织的)收入，收益;（政府的）财政收入，税收
collins.def: Revenue is money that a company, organization, or government receives from people.

example.ex: ...a boom year at the cinema, with record advertising revenue and the highest ticket sales since 1980...
example.tran: 电影院非常景气的一年，创下1980年以来广告及票房收入新高

example.ex: One study said the government would gain about $12 billion in tax revenues over five years.
example.tran: 一项研究表明政府将在5年中获得约120亿美元的税收。

collins.def: Salt is a strong-tasting substance, in the form of white powder or crystals, which is used to improve the flavour of food or to preserve it. Salt occurs naturally in sea water.

example.ex: Season lightly with salt and pepper.
example.tran: 略微加点盐和胡椒调味。

example.ex: ...a pinch of salt.
example.tran: 一撮盐

collins.def: When you salt food, you add salt to it.

example.ex: Salt the stock to your taste and leave it simmering very gently.
example.tran: 根据自己的口味给原汤加点盐，然后用文火慢炖。

collins.tran: 盐，盐类(酸和碱的化合物)
collins.def: Salts are substances that are formed when an acid reacts with an alkali.

example.ex: The rock is rich in mineral salts.
example.tran: 该岩石中富含矿盐。

collins.tran: 人中豪杰;社会中坚;吃苦耐劳的人
collins.def: If you describe someone as the salt of the earth, you have a lot of respect for them as the type of person who deals with difficult or demanding situations without making any unnecessary fuss.

example.ex: Most of the people there are salt-of-the-earth, good, working-class people.
example.tran: 那里的大多数人都是吃苦耐劳、心地善良的工人阶级。

collins.tran: 对…半信半疑;不完全相信
collins.def: If you take something with a pinch of salt, you do not believe that it is completely accurate or true.

example.ex: The more miraculous parts of this account should be taken with a pinch of salt.
example.tran: 对这篇记述中那些颇具神奇色彩的部分也不应全信。

collins.def: If you say, for example, that any doctor worth his or her salt would do something, you mean that any doctor who was good at his or her job or who deserved respect would do it.

example.ex: Any coach worth his salt would do exactly as I did.
example.tran: 任何称职的教练都会采取和我一模一样的行动。

collins.tran: 往伤口上撒盐;雪上加霜;落井下石
collins.def: If someone or something rubs salt into the wound, they make the unpleasant situation that you are in even worse, often by reminding you of your failures or faults.

example.ex: I had no intention of rubbing salt into a friend's wounds, so all I said was that I did not give interviews.
example.tran: 我不想往朋友的伤口上撒盐，所以我只说我没有进行面试。

collins.def: An enterprise is a company or business, often a small one.

example.ex: There are plenty of small industrial enterprises.
example.tran: 有许多小型工业企业。

example.ex: ...the integration of farming enterprises.
example.tran: 农业企业的整合

collins.tran: （新的、困难的或重要的）事业，项目
collins.def: An enterprise is something new, difficult, or important that you do or try to do.

example.ex: ...the first Director of such a novel enterprise...
example.tran: 这样一个全新项目的第一任主管

example.ex: Horse breeding is indeed a risky enterprise.
example.tran: 养马确实是个有风险的营生。

collins.def: Enterprise is the activity of managing companies and businesses and starting new ones.

example.ex: He is still involved in voluntary work promoting local enterprise.
example.tran: 他仍在从事促进当地创业的志愿者工作。

example.ex: ...a national program of subsidies to private enterprise.
example.tran: 国家个人创业补贴计划

collins.tran: 进取心;事业心;创业精神
collins.def: Enterprise is the ability to think of new and effective things to do, together with an eagerness to do them.

example.ex: ...the spirit of enterprise worthy of a free and industrious people.
example.tran: 自由勤劳的民族具有的进取精神

example.ex: ...the group's lack of enterprise.
example.tran: 那个团队事业心的缺乏

collins.def: A premium is a sum of money that you pay regularly to an insurance company for an insurance policy.

example.ex: It is too early to say whether insurance premiums will be affected.
example.tran: 现在说保险费是否会受影响还为时过早。

collins.def: A premium is a sum of money that you have to pay for something in addition to the normal cost.

example.ex: Even if customers want 'solutions', most are not willing to pay a premium for them...
example.tran: 即使顾客想得到“解决方案”，他们大多数也不愿意为此支付额外费用。

example.ex: Callers are charged a premium rate of 48p a minute.
example.tran: 打电话要支付每分钟48便士的附加费。

collins.def: Premium goods are of a higher than usual quality and are often expensive.

example.ex: At the premium end of the market, business is booming.
example.tran: 高端市场业务繁荣。

example.ex: ...the most popular premium ice cream in this country.
example.tran: 这个国家最受欢迎的优质冰激凌

collins.tran: 紧缺的；稀缺的；难以得到的
collins.def: If something is at a premium, it is wanted or needed, but is difficult to get or achieve.

example.ex: If space is at a premium, choose adaptable furniture that won't fill the room.
example.tran: 如果空间有限，就选择一些不会把房间占得很满的可改装家具。

collins.tran: 超出平常价，以高价（买进或售出）
collins.def: If you buy or sell something at a premium, you buy or sell it at a higher price than usual, for example because it is in short supply.

example.ex: He eventually sold the shares back to the bank at a premium.
example.tran: 他最后以高价把股票回售给银行。

collins.def: If you place a high premium on a quality or characteristic or put a high premium on it, you regard it as very important.

example.ex: I place a high premium on what someone is like as a person...
example.tran: 我非常重视一个人的人品。

example.ex: They put a high premium on prevention and primary care.
example.tran: 他们对预防和初级护理极为重视。

collins.def: If something bursts or if you burst it, it suddenly breaks open or splits open and the air or other substance inside it comes out.

example.ex: The driver lost control when a tyre burst...
example.tran: 一个车胎爆了，司机失去了控制。

example.ex: It is not a good idea to burst a blister.
example.tran: 把水泡挑破不是个好主意。

collins.def: If a dam bursts, or if something bursts it, it breaks apart because the force of the river is too great.

example.ex: A dam burst and flooded their villages.
example.tran: 堤坝决口，淹没了他们的村庄。

collins.def: If a river bursts its banks, the water rises and goes on to the land.

example.ex: Monsoons caused the river to burst its banks.
example.tran: 季风雨使河堤决口。

collins.def: When a door or lid bursts open, it opens very suddenly and violently because someone pushes it or there is great pressure behind it.

example.ex: The door burst open and an angry young nurse appeared.
example.tran: 门突然被推开，一名怒气冲冲的年轻护士出现在门口。

collins.def: To burst into or out of a place means to enter or leave it suddenly with a lot of energy or force.

example.ex: Gunmen burst into his home and opened fire...
example.tran: 持枪歹徒突然闯进他家里开枪射击。

example.ex: Rachel burst out as the door was flung open again.
example.tran: 当门被再次猛地推开时，雷切尔冲了出去。

collins.def: If you say that something bursts onto the scene, you mean that it suddenly starts or becomes active, usually after developing quietly for some time.

example.ex: He burst onto the fashion scene in the early 1980s.
example.tran: 20世纪80年代初他突然在时尚界活跃起来。

collins.def: If you say that someone is about to burst with pride, anger, or another emotion, you are emphasizing the intensity of the emotion they are feeling.

example.ex: He almost burst with pride when his son John began to excel at football...
example.tran: 当儿子约翰在足球方面表现优秀时，他心中充满了自豪。

example.ex: He thought his heart would burst with grief.
example.tran: 他觉得自己悲痛欲绝。

collins.def: When a firework or bomb bursts in the air, it explodes.

example.ex: Hundreds of fireworks burst simultaneously in midair...
example.tran: 成百上千朵烟花在半空中同时绽放。

example.ex: Every now and then you hear some bombs bursting.
example.tran: 你会时不时地听到一些爆炸声。

collins.def: A burst of something is a sudden short period of it.

example.ex: ...a burst of machine-gun fire...
example.tran: 一阵炮火

example.ex: It is easier to cope with short bursts of activity than with prolonged exercise...
example.tran: 和长时间的锻炼相比，短期内加强活动更容易应付。

collins.def: Pregnancy is the condition of being pregnant or the period of time during which a female is pregnant.

example.ex: It would be wiser to cut out all alcohol during pregnancy...
example.tran: 在怀孕期间最好滴酒不沾。

example.ex: She was exhausted by eight pregnancies in 13 years.
example.tran: 13年中怀孕8次让她疲惫不堪。

collins.def: You can describe someone's behaviour as threatening when you think that they are trying to harm you.

example.ex: The police could have charged them with threatening behaviour...
example.tran: 警方本可指控他们恐吓。

example.ex: She said Denny had received a threatening letter and asked me if I sent it.
example.tran: 她说丹尼收到一封恐吓信，并问是不是我寄的。

collins.def: If a woman or female animal is pregnant, she has a baby or babies developing in her body.

example.ex: Lena got pregnant and married...
example.tran: 莉娜怀孕并结婚了。

example.ex: Tina was pregnant with their first daughter.
example.tran: 蒂娜怀了他们的第一个女儿。

collins.tran: 耐人寻味的；意味深长的；心照不宣的
collins.def: A pregnant silence or moment has a special meaning which is not obvious but which people are aware of.

example.ex: There was a long, pregnant silence.
example.tran: 当时出现了长时间耐人寻味的沉默。

example.ex: ...a deceptive peace, pregnant with invisible threats.
example.tran: 一种和平的假象，潜伏着许多无形的威胁

means: 使处于某种特定的情况之下

collins.def: The circumstances of a particular situation are the conditions which affect what happens.

example.ex: Recent opinion polls show that 60 percent favor abortion under certain circumstances...
example.tran: 最近的民意调查显示，60%的人赞成在某些情况下可以堕胎。

example.ex: The strategy was too dangerous in the explosive circumstances of the times...
example.tran: 在当时那种一触即发的形势下，采取那样的策略太危险了。

collins.def: The circumstances of an event are the way it happened or the causes of it.

example.ex: I'm making inquiries about the circumstances of Mary Dean's murder...
example.tran: 我在调查玛丽·迪安谋杀案的详情。

example.ex: Hundreds of people had died there in terrible circumstances during and after the revolution.
example.tran: 在革命期间和其后的恶劣形势下，那里有成百上千的人死去。

collins.tran: 生活状况;境况;(尤指)经济状况
collins.def: Your circumstances are the conditions of your life, especially the amount of money that you have.

example.ex: ...help and support for the single mother, whatever her circumstances...
example.tran: 不论单身母亲的经济状况如何均为其提供的帮助与扶持

example.ex: I wouldn't have expected to find you in such comfortable circumstances.
example.tran: 我怎么也没有想到你生活这么优裕。

collins.def: Events and situations which cannot be controlled are sometimes referred to as circumstance .

example.ex: There are those, you know, who, by circumstance, end up homeless...
example.tran: 您知道，会有那么一些人，因为命运捉弄而落得无家可归。

example.ex: You might say that we've been victims of circumstance.
example.tran: 你可以说我们一直不走运吧。

collins.tran: 在任何情况下;无论如何
collins.def: You can emphasize that something must not or will not happen by saying that it must not or will not happen under any circumstances .

example.ex: Racism is wholly unacceptable under any circumstances...
example.tran: 无论在何种情况下，种族主义都是千万要不得的。

example.ex: She made it clear that under no circumstances would she cancel the trip.
example.tran: 她明确表示，无论如何她都不会取消旅行。

collins.tran: 在那种情况下;情况既然如此
collins.def: You can use in the circumstances or  under the circumstances before or after a statement to indicate that you have considered the conditions affecting the situation before making the statement.

example.ex: Under the circumstances, a crash was unavoidable...
example.tran: 在那种情况下，撞车是难以避免的。

example.ex: In the circumstances, Paisley's plans looked highly appropriate.
example.tran: 佩斯利所拟定的计划在当时的情况下看来非常恰当。

collins.def: You use mobile to describe something large that can be moved easily from place to place.

example.ex: ...special mobile units where men can have their fingerprints taken and donate a specimen of blood.
example.tran: 人们可以取指纹和捐献血样的特设流动点

example.ex: ...the four hundred seat mobile theatre.
example.tran: 有400个座位的流动剧场

collins.tran: 走动方便的；行动自如的；出行方便的
collins.def: If you are mobile, you can move or travel easily from place to place, for example because you are not physically disabled or because you have your own transport.

example.ex: I'm still very mobile.
example.tran: 我仍然行动自如。

collins.tran: (社会)流动性的;(在职业、住所或社会阶层间)自由流动的
collins.def: In a mobile society, people move easily from one job, home, or social class to another.

example.ex: We're a very mobile society, and people move after they get divorced.
example.tran: 我们的社会具有很大的流动性，离婚以后人们就会搬家离开。

example.ex: ...young, mobile professionals.
example.tran: 流动性大的年轻专业人员

collins.def: If someone has a mobile face, the expression on their face changes quickly as their feelings change.

example.ex: Robyn had the more mobile, more expressive face.
example.tran: 罗宾有一张更加善变、表情更加丰富的脸。

collins.tran: (悬挂在天花板上的)风动小饰物
collins.def: A mobile is a decoration which you hang from a ceiling. It usually consists of several small objects which move as the air around them moves.
A mobile is the same as a mobile phone .
In Britain, the United States, and some other countries, the Treasury is the government department that deals with the country's finances.

example.ex: The Treasury has long been predicting an upturn in consumer spending.
example.tran: 财政部早就预测消费者支出会出现上扬。

collins.def: The treasury in a building such as a castle or a church is a room where valuable objects are displayed or stored.
If something impresses you, you feel great admiration for it.

example.ex: What impressed him most was their speed...
example.tran: 最令他佩服的是他们的速度。

example.ex: ...a group of students who were trying to impress their girlfriends...
example.tran: 一群竭力想让女友刮目相看的学生

collins.def: If you impress something on someone, you make them understand its importance or degree.

example.ex: I had always impressed upon the children that if they worked hard they would succeed in life...
example.tran: 我总让孩子们牢记努力工作就会成功。

example.ex: I've impressed upon them the need for more professionalism...
example.tran: 我已使他们深刻认识到提高专业素养的必要性。

collins.def: If something impresses itself on your mind, you notice and remember it.

example.ex: But this change has not yet impressed itself on the minds of the British public.
example.tran: 但这一变化还没有引起英国公众的注意。

collins.def: If someone or something impresses you as a particular thing, usually a good one, they gives you the impression of being that thing.

example.ex: Billy Sullivan had impressed me as a fine man.
example.tran: 比利·沙利文给我留下的印象是他是个很不错的人。

collins.def: A requirement is a quality or qualification that you must have in order to be allowed to do something or to be suitable for something.

example.ex: Its products met all legal requirements...
example.tran: 它的产品符合所有的法律要求。

example.ex: Graduate status is the minimum requirement for entry to the teaching profession...
example.tran: 研究生学历是从事教学工作的最低要求。

collins.def: Your requirements are the things that you need.

example.ex: Variations of this programme can be arranged to suit your requirements.
example.tran: 本方案可以进行调整，以满足您的需求。

example.ex: ...a packaged food which provides 100 percent of your daily requirement of one vitamin.
example.tran: 能够百分之百满足人体对于一种维生素每日所需的包装食品

collins.def: Tactics are the methods that you choose to use in order to achieve what you want in a particular situation.

example.ex: What sort of tactics will the President use to rally the people behind him?
example.tran: 总统会用什么样的策略把人们号召起来支持他呢？

example.ex: He pressed on in the hope that a few others would join him. The tactic paid off.
example.tran: 他硬着头皮干下去，希望能有几个人加入进来。这一招奏效了。

means: （尤指由政府或雇主给予的）特许权

collins.tran: (尤指为平息争端或冲突而作出的)让步，妥协
collins.def: If you make a concession to someone, you agree to let them do or have something, especially in order to end an argument or conflict.

example.ex: The King made major concessions to end the confrontation with his people.
example.tran: 为了结束与其臣民的冲突，国王作出了很大的让步。

collins.def: A concession is a special right or privilege that is given to someone.

example.ex: The government has granted concessions to three private telephone companies.
example.tran: 政府已经向3家私营电话公司授予了特许权。

example.ex: ...tax concessions for mothers who stay at home with their children.
example.tran: 针对在家照顾孩子的母亲的纳税优惠

collins.tran: (通常指针对老人、学生和失业人员的)优惠价格
collins.def: A concession is a special price which is lower than the usual price and which is often given to old people, students, and the unemployed.

example.ex: Open daily; admission £1.10 with concessions for children and OAPs.
example.tran: 每天开放;门票1.10英镑，儿童和退休人士可享受票价优惠。

collins.tran: (尤指在别家公司大楼内的)销售权(或经营权)协议
collins.def: A concession is an arrangement where someone is given the right to sell a product or to run a business, especially in a building belonging to another business.
If you bake, you spend some time preparing and mixing together ingredients to make bread, cakes, pies, or other food which is cooked in the oven.

example.ex: How did you learn to bake cakes?...
example.tran: 你怎么学会烘蛋糕的？

example.ex: I love to bake.
example.tran: 我喜欢烘烤糕点。

collins.def: When a cake or bread bakes or when you bake it, it cooks in the oven without any extra liquid or fat.

example.ex: Bake the cake for 35 to 50 minutes...
example.tran: 将蛋糕烘35到50分钟。

example.ex: The batter rises as it bakes.
example.tran: 烘烤的时候，面糊会膨胀起来。

collins.def: If places or people become extremely hot because the sun is shining very strongly, you can say that they bake .

example.ex: If you closed the windows you baked...
example.tran: 如果把窗户关上，你会热死的。

example.ex: Britain bakes in a Mediterranean heatwave.
example.tran: 地中海的热浪炙烤着英国。

collins.tran: （蔬菜或鱼与其他配料切碎拌和后经烘烤的）烤菜
collins.def: A vegetable or fish bake is a dish that is made by chopping up and mixing together a number of ingredients and cooking them in the oven so that they form a fairly dry solid mass.

example.ex: ...an aubergine bake.
example.tran: 烤茄子

means: <口>可怕的事情，无法摆脱的恐惧

collins.def: A nightmare is a very frightening dream.

example.ex: All the victims still suffered nightmares...
example.tran: 所有受害者仍然被恶梦困扰。

example.ex: Jane did not eat cheese because it gives her nightmares.
example.tran: 简没吃奶酪，因为那会让她做恶梦。

collins.tran: 令人恐怖的处境;可怕的情景
collins.def: If you refer to a situation as a nightmare, you mean that it is very frightening and unpleasant.

example.ex: The years in prison were a nightmare.
example.tran: 监狱里的那些年是一场噩梦。

collins.tran: 恼人的情景;惹人烦的局面
collins.def: If you refer to a situation as a nightmare, you are saying in a very emphatic way that it is irritating because it causes you a lot of trouble.

example.ex: Taking my son Peter to a restaurant was a nightmare...
example.tran: 带我儿子彼得外出吃饭简直糟糕透了。

example.ex: In practice a graduate tax is an administrative nightmare.
example.tran: 毕业税具体操作起来不啻一场行政噩梦。

collins.def: A toy is an object that children play with, for example a doll or a model car.

example.ex: He was really too old for children's toys.
example.tran: 他已经长大了，实在不再适合玩儿童玩具了。

example.ex: ...a toy telephone.
example.tran: 玩具电话

collins.def: You can refer to objects that adults use for fun rather than for a serious purpose as toys .

example.ex: Computers have become household toys.
example.tran: 计算机已成了家庭的消遣玩意儿。

collins.def: Short-term is used to describe things that will last for a short time, or things that will have an effect soon rather than in the distant future.

example.ex: Investors weren't concerned about short-term profits over the next few years...
example.tran: 投资者对未来几年里的短期收益并不感兴趣。

example.ex: This is a cynical manipulation of the situation for short-term political gain...
example.tran: 这是为了获取短期政治利益而损人利己地对局势进行操纵。

means: （古代神话中的）神人，半神的勇士

collins.tran: （书、戏剧、电影或故事中品行端正的）男主角，男主人公
collins.def: The hero of a book, play, film, or story is the main male character, who usually has good qualities.

example.ex: The hero of Doctor Zhivago dies in 1929.
example.tran: 《日瓦戈医生》的男主角于1929年去世。

example.ex: ...the author's decision to make his hero a photographer.
example.tran: 作者将男主角设计成一名摄影师的决定

collins.tran: （尤指男性）英雄，英雄人物，豪杰，勇士
collins.def: A hero is someone, especially a man, who has done something brave, new, or good, and who is therefore greatly admired by a lot of people.

example.ex: He called Mr Mandela a hero who had inspired millions.
example.tran: 他称曼德拉先生为鼓舞了数百万民众的英雄。

example.ex: ...the goalscoring hero of the British hockey team...
example.tran: 英国曲棍球队的得分英雄

collins.tran: 偶像;崇拜对象;心目中的英雄
collins.def: If you describe someone as your hero, you mean that you admire them a great deal, usually because of a particular quality or skill that they have.

example.ex: My boyhood hero was Bobby Charlton...
example.tran: 我童年时代的偶像是博比·查尔顿。

example.ex: No matter, he remained the hero of the crowds.
example.tran: 不要紧，他仍是众人心目中的英雄。

means: （巨大成功或胜利的）心满意足

collins.tran: 非凡的成功;杰出的成就
collins.def: A triumph is a great success or achievement, often one that has been gained with a lot of skill or effort.

example.ex: The championships proved to be a personal triumph for the coach, Dave Donovan...
example.tran: 事实证明，在这次锦标赛中教练戴夫·多诺万取得了非凡的个人成就。

example.ex: Cataract operations are a triumph of modern surgery, with a success rate of more than 90 percent...
example.tran: 成功率达到 90% 以上的白内障手术是现代外科学的杰出成果。

collins.tran: (成功或获胜时的)极大的满足，狂喜，骄傲
collins.def: Triumph is a feeling of great satisfaction and pride resulting from a success or victory.

example.ex: Her sense of triumph was short-lived...
example.tran: 她只感受了片刻成功的喜悦。

example.ex: He was laughing with triumph.
example.tran: 他发出胜利的大笑。

collins.def: If someone or something triumphs, they gain complete success, control, or victory, often after a long or difficult struggle.

example.ex: All her life, Kelly had stuck with difficult tasks and challenges, and triumphed...
example.tran: 凯莉一生经历了各种艰巨的任务与挑战，她都一一成功应对了。

example.ex: The whole world looked to her as a symbol of good triumphing over evil.
example.tran: 全世界都把她视为正义战胜邪恶的象征。

collins.def: Something that is vast is extremely large.

example.ex: ...Afrikaner farmers who own vast stretches of land...
example.tran: 拥有广袤土地的南非白人农场主

example.ex: The vast majority of the eggs would be cracked.
example.tran: 绝大部分鸡蛋都会被打碎。

means: 剧烈的，（风，爆炸等）猛烈的，狂暴的

collins.def: If someone is violent, or if they do something which is violent, they use physical force or weapons to hurt, injure, or kill other people.

example.ex: A quarter of current inmates have committed violent crimes.
example.tran: 现在关押的犯人中有1/4是暴力犯罪。

example.ex: ...violent anti-government demonstrations...
example.tran: 反政府的暴力示威

collins.def: A violent event happens suddenly and with great force.

example.ex: A violent impact hurtled her forward...
example.tran: 一股强大的冲击波把她向前抛去。

example.ex: A violent explosion seemed to jolt the whole ground.
example.tran: 剧烈的爆炸好像要把整个地面都掀起来。

collins.tran: （言行或感觉）激烈的，强烈的，狂暴的
collins.def: If you describe something as violent, you mean that it is said, done, or felt very strongly.

example.ex: Violent opposition to the plan continues...
example.tran: 对该计划的强烈反对之声仍不绝于耳。

example.ex: He had violent stomach pains.
example.tran: 他胃疼得厉害。

collins.def: Violent changes are extreme changes from one state to another.

example.ex: Larry began suffering severe headaches and violent mood swings.
example.tran: 拉里开始出现严重的头痛和剧烈的情绪波动。

collins.tran: （死亡）痛苦的，突发性的，暴力造成的
collins.def: A violent death is painful and unexpected, usually because the person who dies has been murdered.

example.ex: ...an innocent man who had met a violent death.
example.tran: 死于非命的无辜男子

collins.tran: （电影或电视节目）多暴力镜头的，渲染暴力的
collins.def: A violent film or television programme contains a lot of scenes which show violence.

example.ex: It was the most violent film that I have ever seen.
example.tran: 这是我看过的最暴力的一部电影。

collins.tran: （色彩）强烈的，刺目的，鲜艳夺目的
collins.def: If you describe a colour as violent, you mean that it is extremely, and often unpleasantly, bright.

example.ex: ...the violent red of dying sunset.
example.tran: 夕阳将逝时夺目的红色

collins.def: Violent weather is extremely stormy and windy.

example.ex: A violent storm had struck the area.
example.tran: 一场猛烈的暴风雨席卷了该地区。

collins.tran: 单色的；素色的；无花纹（或图案、字迹）的
collins.def: A plain object, surface, or fabric is entirely in one colour and has no pattern, design, or writing on it.

example.ex: In general, a plain carpet makes a room look bigger...
example.tran: 一般来说，单色的地毯使房间显得更宽敞。

example.ex: He placed the paper in a plain envelope...
example.tran: 他把论文装进一个空白信封里。

collins.def: Something that is plain is very simple in style.

example.ex: Bronwen's dress was plain but it hung well on her...
example.tran: 布朗温的长裙虽然朴素，却很合身。

example.ex: It was a plain, grey stone house, distinguished mainly by its largely unspoilt simplicity.
example.tran: 这是一幢简朴的灰石房子，主要以其天然简约的风格显得与众不同。

collins.def: If a fact, situation, or statement is plain, it is easy to recognize or understand.

example.ex: It was plain to him that I was having a nervous breakdown...
example.tran: 他能明显地看出我快要精神崩溃了。

example.ex: He's made it plain that he loves the game and wants to be involved still.
example.tran: 他明确表示自己热爱这项运动，并仍想参与其中。

collins.def: If you describe someone as plain, you think they look ordinary and not at all beautiful.

example.ex: ...a shy, rather plain girl with a pale complexion.
example.tran: 肤色苍白、相貌平平的害羞女孩

collins.tran: 平原；（几乎没有树木的）大片平地
collins.def: A plain is a large flat area of land with very few trees on it.

example.ex: Once there were 70 million buffalo on the plains.
example.tran: 北美大平原上曾有过7,000万头野牛。

collins.tran: （用于形容词前加强语气）显然，完全地
collins.def: You can use plain before an adjective in order to emphasize it.

example.ex: The food was just plain terrible.
example.tran: 这食物实在太难吃了。

collins.tran: （尤在与另一个更加不同寻常或让人印象深刻的名字比较时表示强调）普通的，平凡的
