collins.def: You can use plain before a name to emphasize how simple and ordinary it is, especially when you are comparing it with another more unusual or impressive name.

example.ex: Why couldn't they call you plain Ann or Alice like the rest?
example.tran: 他们为什么不能像其他人一样，给你取个普普通通的安或艾丽斯的名字呢？

collins.def: If a police officer is in plain clothes, he or she is wearing ordinary clothes instead of a police uniform.

example.ex: Three officers in plain clothes told me to get out of the car.
example.tran: 3名便衣警察让我下车。

collins.def: If you describe someone as honest, you mean that they always tell the truth, and do not try to deceive people or break the law.

example.ex: My dad was the most honest man I ever met...
example.tran: 爸爸是我所见过的最正直的人。

example.ex: I know she's honest and reliable.
example.tran: 我知道她诚实可靠。

collins.tran: 坦诚的;直率的;不隐瞒真相的
collins.def: If you are honest in a particular situation, you tell the complete truth or give your sincere opinion, even if this is not very pleasant.

example.ex: I was honest about what I was doing...
example.tran: 我对自己所做的事情并无隐瞒。

example.ex: He had been honest with her and she had tricked him!...
example.tran: 他对她坦诚相见，而她却骗了他！

collins.def: You say 'honest' before or after a statement to emphasize that you are telling the truth and that you want people to believe you.

example.ex: I'm not sure, honest.
example.tran: 我不能肯定，真的。

collins.tran: （表示强调）真的，实在，千真万确
collins.def: Some people say 'honest to God' to emphasize their feelings or to emphasize that something is really true.

example.ex: I wish we weren't doing this, Lillian, honest to God, I really do...
example.tran: 我希望我们没有在干这事，莉莲，真的，我真这么想。

example.ex: You wanna know the honest-to-God truth?
example.tran: 你想知道真正的事实吗？

collins.def: You can say 'to be honest' before or after a statement to indicate that you are telling the truth about your own opinions or feelings, especially if you think these will disappoint the person you are talking to.

example.ex: To be honest the house is not quite our style...
example.tran: 说实话，这所房子不太适合我们。

example.ex: I'd rather get it out the way, to be honest.
example.tran: 老实说，我情愿把它处理掉。

collins.def: Someone's absence from a place is the fact that they are not there.

example.ex: ...a bundle of letters which had arrived for me in my absence...
example.tran: 我不在期间寄给我的一大堆信件

example.ex: Eleanor would later blame her mother-in-law for her husband's frequent absences.
example.tran: 埃莉诺过后会因丈夫经常不在家而责怪婆婆。

collins.def: The absence of something from a place is the fact that it is not there or does not exist.

example.ex: The presence or absence of clouds can have an important impact on heat transfer...
example.tran: 有无云层对热量的传递会产生重要的影响。

example.ex: In the absence of a will the courts decide who the guardian is.
example.tran: 在没有遗嘱的情况下，由法庭指定监护人。

collins.tran: 无记名投票；无记名选举；无记名表决
collins.def: A ballot is a secret vote in which people select a candidate in an election, or express their opinion about something.

example.ex: The result of the ballot will not be known for two weeks...
example.tran: 无记名投票的结果将于两周后公布。

example.ex: Fifty of its members will be elected by direct ballot.
example.tran: 50名成员将通过直选产生。

collins.def: A ballot is a piece of paper on which you indicate your choice or opinion in a secret vote.

example.ex: Election boards will count the ballots by hand...
example.tran: 选举委员会将人工计票。

example.ex: They succeeded in putting Perot's name on the ballot in Florida.
example.tran: 他们成功地让佩罗在佛罗里达州成为了候选人之一。

collins.tran: 在…中间进行无记名投票（或表决）
collins.def: If you ballot a group of people, you find out what they think about a subject by organizing a secret vote.

example.ex: The union said they will ballot members on whether to strike.
example.tran: 工会称他们将要求会员投票表决是否罢工。

collins.def: A cutting is a  piece of writing which has been cut from a newspaper or magazine.

example.ex: ...a stack of old photographs and newspaper cuttings...
example.tran: 一堆旧照片和剪报

example.ex: Here are the press cuttings and reviews.
example.tran: 这是些新闻剪辑和评论。

collins.def: A cutting from a plant is a part of the plant that you have cut off so that you can grow a new plant from it.

example.ex: Take cuttings from it in July or August.
example.tran: 7月或8月时从它上边剪一些插枝。

collins.tran: (在山中开凿的供铁路或道路通过的)狭窄通道，路堑
collins.def: A cutting is a narrow valley cut through a hill so that a railway line or road can pass through.
A cutting remark is unkind and likely to hurt someone's feelings.

example.ex: People make cutting remarks to help themselves feel superior or powerful.
example.tran: 人们说话尖酸刻薄是为了使自己感觉高高在上或是有权有势。

collins.def: The shores or the shore of a sea, lake, or wide river is the land along the edge of it. Someone who is on shore is on the land rather than on a ship.

example.ex: They walked down to the shore.
example.tran: 他们走到了湖边。

example.ex: ...elephants living on the shores of Lake Kariba...
example.tran: 生活在卡里巴湖滨的大象

collins.def: When someone or something reaches the shores of a country or continent, they arrive in that country or continent.

example.ex: It is feared that a similar epidemic will soon reach the shores of Europe...
example.tran: 人们担心类似的流行病很快会传到欧洲。

example.ex: This youngster is another destined to leave these shores.
example.tran: 这个年轻人是又一个注定要离开这个国家的人。

means: （建筑物的）结构（如墙、地面、屋顶）：质地

collins.def: Fabric is cloth or other material produced by weaving together cotton, nylon, wool, silk, or other threads. Fabrics are used for making things such as clothes, curtains, and sheets.

example.ex: ...small squares of red cotton fabric...
example.tran: 小块方形红棉布

example.ex: Whatever your colour scheme, there's a fabric to match.
example.tran: 无论什么样的色彩图案，都有与之相配的织物。

collins.def: The fabric of a society or system is its basic structure, with all the customs and beliefs that make it work successfully.

example.ex: The fabric of society has been deeply damaged by the previous regime...
example.tran: 社会结构已遭到上届政府极大的破坏。

example.ex: Years of civil war have wrecked the country's infrastructure and destroyed its social fabric.
example.tran: 经年内战已破坏了国家的基础设施，摧毁了其社会结构。

collins.def: The fabric of a building is its walls, roof, and the materials with which it is built.

example.ex: Condensation will eventually cause the fabric of the building to rot away.
example.tran: 冷凝作用将最终使建筑结构腐朽掉。

collins.def: A bay is a part of a coast where the land curves inwards.

example.ex: ...a short ferry ride across the bay.
example.tran: 乘渡船横渡海湾的短途旅行

example.ex: ...the Bay of Bengal.
example.tran: 孟加拉海湾

collins.def: A bay is a partly enclosed area, inside or outside a building, that is used for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The animals are herded into a bay, then butchered...
example.tran: 动物们被赶到一个隔间里，然后进行宰杀。

example.ex: The car reversed into the loading bay.
example.tran: 汽车倒入装卸间。

collins.def: On an aircraft or ship, a bay is a section that is used for carrying cargo or equipment.

example.ex: ...in the cargo bays of aircraft.
example.tran: 在飞机的货舱里

collins.tran: （建筑物的）凸出部分；（尤指）飘窗，凸窗
collins.def: A bay is an area of a room which extends beyond the main walls of a house, especially an area with a large window at the front of a house.
A bay horse is reddish-brown in colour.
If a number of people are baying for something, they are demanding something angrily, usually that someone should be punished.

example.ex: The referee ignored voices baying for a penalty.
example.tran: 裁判对要求判罚点球的叫喊声不予理睬。

example.ex: Opposition politicians have been baying for his blood.
example.tran: 反对派的政治家们一直呼吁对其严惩。

collins.def: If a dog or wolf bays, it makes loud, long cries.

example.ex: A dog suddenly howled, baying at the moon.
example.tran: 一只狗突然对着月亮狂吠不止。

collins.def: If you keep something or someone at bay, or hold them at bay, you prevent them from reaching, attacking, or affecting you.

example.ex: Eating oranges keeps colds at bay...
example.tran: 吃橘子可以预防感冒。

example.ex: Prisoners armed with baseball bats used the hostages to hold police at bay.
example.tran: 手持棒球棒的囚犯们挟持了人质，使警察无法靠近。

means: [美国俚语]（尤指在商店）行窃，偷窃

collins.tran: 使增长；推动；改进；使兴旺
collins.def: If one thing boosts another, it causes it to increase, improve, or be more successful.

example.ex: It wants the government to take action to boost the economy...
example.tran: 它希望政府采取行动促进经济发展。

example.ex: The move is designed to boost sales during the peak booking months of January and February.
example.tran: 这一举措旨在增加1月和2月预订高峰期的销售量。

collins.def: If something boosts your confidence or morale, it improves it.

example.ex: We need a big win to boost our confidence...
example.tran: 我们需要大胜一场来增强信心。

example.ex: Do what you can to give her confidence and boost her morale.
example.tran: 尽你所能让她树立信心，提高士气。

collins.tran: 引人注目的;异乎寻常的;显著的
collins.def: Something that is striking is very noticeable or unusual.

example.ex: The most striking feature of those statistics is the high proportion of suicides...
example.tran: 那些统计数据最引人注目之处是其极高的自杀率。

example.ex: He bears a striking resemblance to Lenin.
example.tran: 他酷似列宁。

collins.tran: 妩媚动人的;标致的;俊秀的
collins.def: Someone who is striking is very attractive, in a noticeable way.

example.ex: She was a striking woman with long blonde hair.
example.tran: 她是个留着金色长发的俏女郎。

collins.def: When people cheer, they shout loudly to show their approval or to encourage someone who is doing something such as taking part in a game.

example.ex: The crowd cheered as Premier Wayne Goss unveiled a lifesize statue of poet Banjo Paterson...
example.tran: 韦恩·戈斯州长揭开诗人巴尼奥·佩特森的等身塑像时，人群欢呼起来。

example.ex: Swiss fans cheered Jakob Hlasek during yesterday's match with Courier.
example.tran: 昨天，瑞士球迷在雅各布·赫拉塞克对阵库里耶的比赛中为赫拉塞克喝彩加油。

collins.def: If you are cheered by something, it makes you happier or less worried.

example.ex: Stephen noticed that the people around him looked cheered by his presence...
example.tran: 斯蒂芬注意到，周围的人们似乎因为他的到来而受到鼓舞。

example.ex: The weather was perfect for a picnic, he told himself, but the thought did nothing to cheer him.
example.tran: 他告诉自己，那样的天气出去野餐再合适不过了，可是，这丝毫不能让他提起精神来。

collins.def: Cheer is a feeling of cheerfulness.

example.ex: They were impressed by his steadfast good cheer...
example.tran: 他整天笑呵呵的样子给他们留下很深的印象。

example.ex: A timely bingo win brought some cheer to Juliet Little's family yesterday.
example.tran: 昨天玩宾戈赢了一把，适时地给朱丽叶·利特尔一家带来些许的欢快心情。

collins.def: People sometimes say 'Cheers' to each other just before they drink an alcoholic drink.
Some people say 'Cheers' as a way of saying 'thank you' or 'goodbye'.
A path is a long strip of ground which people walk along to get from one place to another.

example.ex: We followed the path along the clifftops...
example.tran: 我们沿着悬崖顶上的小路走。

example.ex: Feet had worn a path in the rock...
example.tran: 经年的踩踏在岩石上形成了一条小径。

collins.def: Your path is the space ahead of you as you move along.

example.ex: A group of reporters blocked his path...
example.tran: 一群记者堵住了他的去路。

example.ex: She did not notice the man until he moved into her path.
example.tran: 直到那个男人拦住她的去路，她才注意到他。

collins.def: The path of something is the line which it moves along in a particular direction.

example.ex: He stepped without looking into the path of a reversing car.
example.tran: 一辆汽车正在倒车，他看都没看它倒向哪里就一脚迈了出去。

example.ex: ...people who live near airports or under the flight path of airplanes...
example.tran: 住在机场附近或者航线下方的人们

collins.def: A path that you take is a particular course of action or way of achieving something.

example.ex: The opposition appear to have chosen the path of cooperation rather than confrontation...
example.tran: 反对派似乎已经选择了合作而不是对抗的路线。

example.ex: He promised that within 100 days he would put the country on the path to economic recovery.
example.tran: 他许诺在100天内让国家走上经济复兴之路。

collins.def: You can say that something is in your path or blocking your path to mean that it is preventing you from doing or achieving what you want.

example.ex: The Church of England put a serious obstacle in the path of women who want to become priests.
example.tran: 英国国教在妇女成为牧师的道路上设置了重大障碍。

collins.def: If you cross someone's path or if your paths cross, you meet them by chance.

example.ex: It was highly unlikely that their paths would cross again...
example.tran: 他们再次偶遇的可能性非常小。

example.ex: Over the years, Yul and Kirk had crossed paths many times.
example.tran: 几年来，尤尔和柯克偶遇了很多次。

collins.def: When people chat, they talk to each other in an informal and friendly way.

example.ex: The women were chatting...
example.tran: 女人们在聊天。

example.ex: I was chatting to him the other day...
example.tran: 前几天我和他聊了一阵。

collins.def: A tune is a series of musical notes that is pleasant and easy to remember.

example.ex: She was humming a merry little tune.
example.tran: 她正哼着一支欢快的小调。

collins.def: You can refer to a song or a short piece of music as a tune .

example.ex: She'll also be playing your favourite pop tunes.
example.tran: 她还将演奏你最喜欢的流行乐曲。

collins.def: When someone tunes a musical instrument, they adjust it so that it produces the right notes.

example.ex: 'We do tune our guitars before we go on,' he insisted.
example.tran: “我们在演奏以前确实会为吉他调音，”他坚持说道。

collins.tran: 调试，调整(发动机或机器)
collins.def: When an engine or machine is tuned, it is adjusted so that it works well.

example.ex: Drivers are urged to make sure that car engines are properly tuned.
example.tran: 司机们被敦促要确保汽车发动机调试妥当。

collins.def: If your radio or television is tuned to a particular broadcasting station, you are listening to or watching the programmes being broadcast by that station.

example.ex: A small colour television was tuned to an afternoon soap opera.
example.tran: 一台小彩色电视机频道调在了一出下午的肥皂剧上。

collins.def: If you say that a person or organization is calling the tune, you mean that they are in a position of power or control in a particular situation.

example.ex: Who would then be calling the tune in Parliament?
example.tran: 那在国会谁说了算？

collins.tran: 改变调子;变卦;改变态度
collins.def: If you say that someone has changed their tune, you are criticizing them because they have changed their opinion or way of doing things.

example.ex: You've changed your tune since this morning, haven't you?...
example.tran: 你从今天早上就变卦了，是不是？

example.ex: Yesterday he changed his tune, saying the fare increase was experimental.
example.tran: 昨天他变卦了，说提价只是试行。

collins.tran: 被…牵着鼻子走;受…的控制
collins.def: If you say that someone is dancing to someone else's tune, you mean that they are allowing themselves to be controlled by the other person.

example.ex: The danger of commercialism is that the churches end up dancing to the tune of their big business sponsors.
example.tran: 商业主义的危险就是教会最终可能会被大赞助商牵着鼻子走。

collins.tran: 合调的/走调的;在调子上/不在调子上
collins.def: A person or musical instrument that is in tune produces exactly the right notes. A person or musical instrument that is out of tune does not produce exactly the right notes.

example.ex: It was just an ordinary voice, but he sang in tune...
example.tran: 他声音很一般，但唱得都在调子上。

example.ex: Many of the notes are out of tune...
example.tran: 很多音都走调了。

collins.tran: 一致/不一致;赞同/不赞同
collins.def: If you are in tune with a group of people, you are in agreement or sympathy with them. If you are out of tune with them, you are not in agreement or sympathy with them.

example.ex: Today, his change of direction seems more in tune with the times...
example.tran: 今天，他方向的改变似乎更与时代合拍。

example.ex: The peace campaigners were probably out of tune with most Britons.
example.tran: 和平倡导者可能不被大部分英国人认同。

collins.def: To the tune of a particular amount of money means to the extent of that amount.

example.ex: They've been sponsoring the World Cup to the tune of a million and a half pounds.
example.tran: 他们已经对世界杯提供了高达 150 万英镑的赞助费。

collins.def: Consideration is careful thought about something.

example.ex: He said there should be careful consideration of the future role of the BBC.
example.tran: 他说应该认真思考英国广播公司将来要扮演的角色。

collins.def: If something is under consideration, it is being discussed.

example.ex: Several proposals are under consideration by the state assembly.
example.tran: 有几个提案州议会正在讨论中。

collins.def: If you show consideration, you pay attention to the needs, wishes, or feelings of other people.

example.ex: Show consideration for other rail travellers...
example.tran: 体谅其他铁路乘客。

example.ex: Really, her tone said, some people have absolutely no consideration.
example.tran: 她的语气的确是在说有些人从不替他人考虑。

collins.tran: (尤指在计划或决定时)应考虑的因素
collins.def: A consideration is something that should be thought about, especially when you are planning or deciding something.

example.ex: They should not allow partisan political considerations or interests to cloud their judgment...
example.tran: 他们不应该让党派政治因素或者党派利益影响自己的判断。

example.ex: A major consideration when choosing a dog is the size of your house and garden.
example.tran: 选择狗时，一个重要的考虑因素是房子和花园的大小。

collins.def: If you take something into consideration, you think about it because it is relevant to what you are doing.

example.ex: The whole affair is bound to be taken into consideration when the Indian side is picked...
example.tran: 如果选的是印度一方，整个事件必定会纳入考虑范围之中。

example.ex: Safe driving is good driving because it takes into consideration the lives of other people.
example.tran: 安全驾驶是良好的驾驶习惯，因为它考虑到了他人的人身安全。

collins.tran: (常出于广告目的而)赞助，资助
collins.def: If an organization or an individual sponsors something such as an event or someone's training, they pay some or all of the expenses connected with it, often in order to get publicity for themselves.

example.ex: Mercury, in association with The Independent, is sponsoring Britain's first major Pop Art exhibition for over 20 years...
example.tran: 《信使报》正携手《独立报》一起为 20 多年来英国举办的首届大型通俗艺术展览提供赞助。

example.ex: The competition was sponsored by Ruinart Champagne...
example.tran: 比赛是由慧纳酒庄赞助的。

collins.def: In Britain, if you sponsor someone who is doing something to raise money for charity, for example trying to walk a certain distance, you agree to give them a sum of money for the charity if they succeed in doing it.

example.ex: Please could you sponsor me for my school's campaign for Help the Aged?
example.tran: 我在参加我们学校举办的“助老”募捐活动，您能赞助我吗？

collins.tran: 倡议，发起(某项提议或建议)
collins.def: If you sponsor a proposal or suggestion, you officially put it forward and support it.

example.ex: Eight senators sponsored legislation to stop the military funding.
example.tran: 8 位参议员支持立法停止军事拨款。

collins.def: When a country or an organization such as the United Nations sponsors negotiations between countries, it suggests holding the negotiations and organizes them.

example.ex: Given the strength of pressure on both sides, the superpowers may well have difficulties sponsoring negotiations...
example.tran: 迫于来自对方的强大压力，两个超级大国想要组织谈判肯定会有困难。

example.ex: The protest comes on the eve of two days of talks in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, sponsored by the United Nations.
example.tran: 抗议活动发生在联合国组织的于埃塞俄比亚首都亚的斯亚贝巴进行的为期两天的会谈即将开始前。

collins.tran: (一国)坐视(某次袭击事件)而不顾，支持
collins.def: If one country accuses another of sponsoring attacks on it, they mean that the other country does not do anything to prevent the attacks, and may even encourage them.

example.ex: We have to make the states that sponsor terrorism pay a price.
example.tran: 我们必须让那些支持恐怖主义的国家付出代价。

collins.tran: 赞助(电视节目);做…的广告赞助商
collins.def: If a company or organization sponsors a television programme, they pay to have a special advertisement shown at the beginning and end of the programme, and at each commercial break.

example.ex: Companies will now be able to sponsor programmes on ITV and Channel 4.
example.tran: 现在公司可以在独立电视台和第 4 频道上出资做节目广告了。

collins.tran: 赞助人;资助人;倡议者;发起人;主办者
collins.def: A sponsor is a person or organization that sponsors something or someone.

example.ex: I understand Coca-Cola are to be named as the new sponsors of the League Cup later this week...
example.tran: 我知道可口可乐公司将在本周晚些时候被指定为联赛杯的新赞助商。

example.ex: The chief sponsor of the New York law, state Senator Emanuel Gold, says he's not giving up.
example.tran: 纽约州立法的主要倡议人州参议员伊曼纽尔·戈尔德说，他不会放弃。

collins.def: A mirror is a flat piece of glass which reflects light, so that when you look at it you can see yourself reflected in it.

example.ex: He absent-mindedly looked at himself in the mirror...
example.tran: 他心不在焉地看着镜中的自己。

example.ex: He checked his mirror and saw that a dark coloured van was immediately behind him.
example.tran: 他看了一下后视镜，发现一辆深色货车紧随其后。

collins.def: If something mirrors something else, it has similar features to it, and therefore seems like a copy or representation of it.

example.ex: The book inevitably mirrors my own interests and experiences...
example.tran: 这本书不可避免地反映出我个人的喜好与经历。

example.ex: His own shock was mirrored on her face.
example.tran: 他和她面面相觑。

collins.def: If you see something reflected in water, you can say that the water mirrors it.

example.ex: ...the sudden glitter where a newly-flooded field mirrors the sky...
example.tran: 刚刚被洪水淹没的田野映照出了天空，那里突然泛起亮光

example.ex: The ship would lie there mirrored in a perfectly unmoving glossy sea.
example.tran: 船会停靠在那里，映衬在一片波澜不兴的湛蓝海水之中。

means: （经过试验、检验或体验发表的）决定

collins.tran: （陪审团或法官的）裁决，裁定，裁断
collins.def: In a court of law, the verdict is the decision that is given by the jury or judge at the end of a trial.

example.ex: The jury returned a unanimous guilty verdict...
example.tran: 陪审团一致作出了有罪裁决。

example.ex: Three judges will deliver their verdict in October.
example.tran: 3名法官将在10月份作出裁决。

collins.tran: （经过思考或调查后的）意见，结论
collins.def: Someone's verdict on something is their opinion of it, after thinking about it or investigating it.

example.ex: The doctor's verdict was that he was entirely healthy...
example.tran: 医生的结论是他完全健康。

example.ex: The critics were too quick to give their verdict on us.
example.tran: 评论家们给我们下定论未免太操之过急了。

collins.def: If you pause while you are doing something, you stop for a short period and then continue.

example.ex: 'It's rather embarrassing,' he began, and paused...
example.tran: “非常令人难堪，”他开口道，然后停顿了一下。

example.ex: He had to pause to clear his throat...
example.tran: 他不得不停顿一下清清嗓子。

collins.def: A pause is a short period when you stop doing something before continuing.

example.ex: After a pause Alex said sharply: 'I'm sorry if I've upset you'...
example.tran: 歇了一会儿后，亚历克斯毫不客气地说：“要是让你心烦了，那我很抱歉。”

example.ex: There was a pause while the barmaid set down two plates in front of us.
example.tran: 酒吧女招待在我们面前摆放两个盘子时停顿了一下。

collins.def: If something gives you pause for thought, it makes you think carefully about something, especially in a different way than you have thought about it before.

example.ex: An opposition spokesman said he hoped the agreement would give them pause for thought about the futility of violence.
example.tran: 反对派发言人说他希望协议能够让他们仔细想想暴力行为毫无意义。

collins.def: If someone integrates into a social group, or is integrated into it, they behave in such a way that they become part of the group or are accepted into it.

example.ex: He didn't integrate successfully into the Italian way of life...
example.tran: 他没有顺利地融入到意大利的生活方式中。

example.ex: Integrating the kids with the community, finding them a role, is essential...
example.tran: 使孩子融入社区并为他们找到某个角色非常必要。

collins.tran: (使)(种族)融合;使取消种族隔离
collins.def: When races integrate or when schools and organizations are integrated, people who are black or belong to ethnic minorities can join white people in their schools and organizations.

example.ex: Schools came to us because they wanted to integrate...
example.tran: 学校来向我们寻求帮助是因为他们想让不同种族的学生得到平等待遇。

example.ex: Encouraging teacher transfer would not, by itself, integrate the teaching corps.
example.tran: 鼓励教师调动本身不会消弭教学队伍中的种族隔离。

collins.tran: (使)(与…)成为一体;(使)结合;(使)合并
collins.def: If you integrate one thing with another, or one thing integrates with another, the two things become closely linked or form part of a whole idea or system. You can also say that two things integrate .

example.ex: Integrating the pound with other European currencies could cause difficulties...
example.tran: 把英镑与欧洲其他货币合并会引发许多难题。

example.ex: Ann wanted the conservatory to integrate with the kitchen...
example.tran: 安想把温室与厨房打通。

collins.def: The headquarters of an organization are its main offices.

example.ex: ...fraud squad officers from London's police headquarters...
example.tran: 伦敦警察总部诈骗案调查组的警官们

example.ex: The building is the headquarters of the family firm.
example.tran: 这座大楼是该家族公司的总部。

means: [法]（无遗嘱死亡者的）财产分配

collins.def: The distribution of things involves giving or delivering them to a number of people or places.

example.ex: ...the council which controls the distribution of foreign aid...
example.tran: 掌管外援物资派发的委员会

example.ex: He admitted there had been distribution problems.
example.tran: 他承认曾出现过配给问题。

collins.def: The distribution of something is how much of it there is in each place or at each time, or how much of it each person has.

example.ex: ...a more equitable distribution of wealth.
example.tran: 更公平合理的财富分配

example.ex: One of the side effects may be to change the geographical distribution of parasitic diseases such as malaria.
example.tran: 其中的一个意外后果可能是改变诸如疟疾之类的寄生虫引发的疾病的地理分布。

collins.def: Film distribution involves deciding which cinemas a particular film is shown in.

example.ex: ...a film-distribution company.
example.tran: 电影发行公司

collins.def: If you have an ambition to do or achieve something, you want very much to do it or achieve it.

example.ex: His ambition is to sail round the world...
example.tran: 他的梦想是环球航行。

example.ex: He harboured ambitions of becoming a Tory MP.
example.tran: 他梦想成为托利党下院议员。

collins.def: Ambition is the desire to be successful, rich, or powerful.

example.ex: Even when I was young I never had any ambition.
example.tran: 即使是年轻时，我也从没有什么雄心壮志。

example.ex: ...a mixture of ambition and ruthlessness.
example.tran: 既野心勃勃又冷酷无情

collins.def: A steady situation continues or develops gradually without any interruptions and is not likely to change quickly.

example.ex: Despite the steady progress of building work, the campaign against it is still going strong...
example.tran: 尽管建筑施工已在稳步进行，但反对活动仍然高涨。

example.ex: The improvement in standards has been steady and persistent, but has attracted little comment from educationalists...
example.tran: 标准一直在持续提高，但却几乎没有教育学家对此发表意见。

collins.tran: 稳定的;牢固的;不摇晃的
collins.def: If an object is steady, it is firm and does not shake or move about.

example.ex: Get as close to the subject as you can and hold the camera steady...
example.tran: 尽量靠近拍摄对象，拿稳相机。

example.ex: It takes a very steady hand and plenty of practice to paint a perfect line.
example.tran: 只有手不发抖并多加练习才能画出完美的线条。

collins.def: If you look at someone or speak to them in a steady way, you look or speak in a calm, controlled way.

example.ex: 'Well, go on,' said Camilla, her voice fairly steady...
example.tran: “好吧，请继续，”卡米拉用很沉着的语气说道。

example.ex: Gail was silent for a moment, regarding Harry with his steady gaze.
example.tran: 盖尔镇定地注视着哈里，沉默了片刻。

collins.def: If you describe a person as steady, you mean that they are sensible and reliable.

example.ex: He was firm and steady unlike other men she knew.
example.tran: 他坚定可靠，和她认识的其他男人不一样。

example.ex: ...a politician who's steady almost to the point of being boring.
example.tran: 理智得近乎乏味的政治家

collins.def: If you steady something or if it steadies, it stops shaking or moving about.

example.ex: Two men were on the bridge-deck, steadying a ladder...
example.tran: 两名男子在船桥甲板上扶着一架梯子不让它摇晃。

example.ex: Lovelock eased back the throttles and the ship steadied.
example.tran: 洛夫洛克慢慢地拉杆减速，船稳了下来。

collins.def: If you steady yourself, you control your voice or expression, so that people will think that you are calm and not nervous.

example.ex: Somehow she steadied herself and murmured, 'Have you got a cigarette?'...
example.tran: 她设法让自己镇定下来，并小声问：“你有烟吗?”

example.ex: She breathed in to steady her voice.
example.tran: 她吸了一口气，好使自己的声音平静下来。

collins.def: You say 'steady on' to someone to tell them to calm down or to be careful about what they are saying.

example.ex: 'What if there's another murder?' — 'Steady on!'...
example.tran: “万一又有人被杀呢?”——“说话注意点！”

example.ex: 'One can't live with a man like that!' — 'Steady on,' said Chris.
example.tran: “和那样的男人没法过日子！”——“冷静点，”克里斯说。

collins.tran: 有确定的情侣关系;恋爱关系稳定
collins.def: If two people are going steady, they are having a long, fairly serious romantic relationship.

example.ex: She's been going steady with Randolph for almost a year now.
example.tran: 她和伦道夫已经谈了近一年恋爱了。

collins.def: You use initial to describe something that happens at the beginning of a process.

example.ex: The initial reaction has been excellent...
example.tran: 初期的反应非常好。

example.ex: The aim of this initial meeting is to clarify the issues.
example.tran: 本次初步会议的目标是澄清这些问题。

collins.tran: (姓名的)首字母(例如 Michael Dennis Stocks 的首字母缩写为 M.D.S.)
collins.def: Initials are the capital letters which begin each word of a name. For example, if your full name is Michael Dennis Stocks, your initials will be M.D.S.

example.ex: ...a silver Porsche car with her initials JB on the side.
example.tran: 车身有她姓名缩写JB的银色保时捷跑车

collins.tran: 用姓名的首字母签名于
collins.def: If someone initials an official document, they write their initials on it, for example to show that they have seen it or that they accept or agree with it.

example.ex: Would you mind initialing this voucher?...
example.tran: 请在凭单上用首字母签名。

example.ex: The agreement was initialled in June.
example.tran: 这份协议是6月份草签的。

collins.def: If you refer to the replacement of one thing by another, you mean that the second thing takes the place of the first.

example.ex: ...the replacement of damaged or lost books.
example.tran: 受损或丢失图书的更换或补充

collins.tran: 替补(成员或队员)；接替者
collins.def: Someone who takes someone else's place in an organization, government, or team can be referred to as their replacement .

example.ex: Taylor has nominated Adams as his replacement...
example.tran: 泰勒提名亚当斯接替他。

example.ex: The 18-year-old made his debut last week as a replacement for the injured Gordon Durie.
example.tran: 这个18岁选手作为受伤的戈登·迪里的替补在上周首次出场。

collins.tran: 克里姆林宫（位于莫斯科，为俄罗斯政府处理公务的地方）
collins.def: The Kremlin is the building in Moscow where Russian government business takes place.

example.ex: ...a two hour meeting in the Kremlin.
example.tran: 在克里姆林宫召开的为时两小时的会议

collins.def: A miner is a person who works underground in mines in order to obtain minerals such as coal, diamonds, or gold.
If something is nearby, it is only a short distance away.

example.ex: He might easily have been seen by someone who lived nearby...
example.tran: 住在附近的人很可能有谁见过他。

example.ex: He spoke softly to a couple standing nearby...
example.tran: 他轻声和站在旁边的一对夫妇说话。

collins.def: If you resign from a job or position, you formally announce that you are leaving it.

example.ex: A hospital administrator has resigned over claims he lied to get the job...
example.tran: 一位医院的管理人员辞职了，因为有人指责他为了得到这份工作而撒了谎。

example.ex: Mr Robb resigned his position last month.
example.tran: 罗布先生上个月辞职了。

collins.tran: 屈从;顺从;安于;勉强接受
collins.def: If you resign yourself to an unpleasant situation or fact, you accept it because you realize that you cannot change it.

example.ex: Pat and I resigned ourselves to yet another summer without a boat...
example.tran: 我和帕特在没有船的情况下勉强又凑合了一个夏天。

example.ex: He had resigned himself to watching the European Championships on television.
example.tran: 他只好将就着在电视上看欧洲锦标赛。

means: （电台的）时事评论员，实况广播报导员
主持[解释]宗教仪式的非教士

collins.def: A commentator is a broadcaster who gives a radio or television commentary on an event.

example.ex: ...a sports commentator.
example.tran: 体育解说员

collins.def: A commentator is someone who often writes or broadcasts about a particular subject.

example.ex: ...a political commentator...
example.tran: 政治评论员

example.ex: A. M. Babu is a commentator on African affairs.
example.tran: A. M. 巴布是一位非洲事务评论员。

collins.def: The implications of something are the things that are likely to happen as a result.

example.ex: The Attorney General was aware of the political implications of his decision to prosecute...
example.tran: 司法部长很清楚他决定起诉可能引发的政治后果。

example.ex: The low level of current investment has serious implications for future economic growth.
example.tran: 当前低迷的投资水平会对未来的经济增长产生严重影响。

collins.def: The implication of a statement, event, or situation is what it implies or suggests is the case.

example.ex: The implication was obvious: vote for us or it will be very embarrassing for you...
example.tran: 弦外之音很明显：投票给我们,否则你会非常难堪。

example.ex: The implication that marital infidelity enhances a leader's credibility is preposterous.
example.tran: 婚姻不忠会提升领导人可信度的暗示荒谬之极。

collins.def: If you describe someone or something as lovely, you mean that they are very beautiful and therefore pleasing to look at or listen to.

example.ex: You look lovely, Marcia...
example.tran: 你看上去真漂亮，马西娅。

example.ex: He had a lovely voice...
example.tran: 他的声音很动听。

collins.def: If you describe something as lovely, you mean that it gives you pleasure.

example.ex: Mary! How lovely to see you!...
example.tran: 玛丽，见到你真是太高兴了！

example.ex: It's a lovely day...
example.tran: 今天天气真好。

collins.tran: 亲切和善的；心地善良的
collins.def: If you describe someone as lovely, you mean that they are friendly, kind, or generous.

example.ex: Laura is a lovely young woman...
example.tran: 劳拉是个亲切友好的姑娘。

example.ex: She's a lovely child.
example.tran: 她是个心地善良的孩子。

collins.def: You use somewhat to indicate that something is the case to a limited extent or degree.

example.ex: He concluded that Oswald was somewhat abnormal...
example.tran: 他断定奥斯瓦尔德有点不正常。

example.ex: He explained somewhat unconvincingly that the company was paying for everything...
example.tran: 他解释说公司会支付一切费用，这个说法有点令人不能信服。

collins.def: An announcement is a statement made to the public or to the media which gives information about something that has happened or that will happen.

example.ex: Sir Robert made his announcement after talks with the President...
example.tran: 在与总统会谈之后，罗伯特爵士发表了声明。

example.ex: There has been no formal announcement by either government.
example.tran: 双方政府都未作正式通告。

collins.def: The announcement of something that has happened is the act of telling people about it.

example.ex: ...the announcement of their engagement...
example.tran: 他们订婚消息的宣布

example.ex: There has been no official announcement of the arrests.
example.tran: 还没有正式发布逮捕这些人的消息。

collins.tran: （在报纸、商店橱窗等处刊登的）启事，广告，通告
collins.def: An announcement in a public place, such as a newspaper or the window of a shop, is a short piece of writing telling people about something or asking for something.

example.ex: He will place an announcement in the personal column of The Daily Telegraph.
example.tran: 他将在《每日电讯报》的个人专栏上登一则启事。

collins.tran: 风险项目（或活动);冒险事业
collins.def: A venture is a project or activity which is new, exciting, and difficult because it involves the risk of failure.

example.ex: ...his latest writing venture.
example.tran: 他最新的写作尝试

example.ex: ...a Russian-American joint venture.
example.tran: 一家俄美合资企业

collins.def: If you venture somewhere, you go somewhere that might be dangerous.

example.ex: People are afraid to venture out for fear of sniper attacks...
example.tran: 由于害怕狙击手，人们不敢冒险外出。

example.ex: Few Europeans who had ventured beyond the Himalayas had returned to tell the tale.
example.tran: 少数几个冒险翻越了喜马拉雅山的欧洲人回来后讲述了这个故事。

collins.tran: 斗胆提出（问题）;冒险发表（陈述）
collins.def: If you venture a question or statement, you say it in an uncertain way because you are afraid it might be stupid or wrong.

example.ex: 'So you're Leo's  girlfriend?' he ventured...
example.tran: “那么你就是列奥的女朋友了？”他大胆问道。

example.ex: He ventured that plants draw part of their nourishment from the air...
example.tran: 他大胆提出植物从空气中吸收部分养分的观点。

collins.def: If you venture to do something that requires courage or is risky, you do it.

example.ex: 'Don't ask,' he said, whenever Ginny ventured to raise the subject.
example.tran: 每当金尼鼓起勇气提起这个话题时，他就说“不要问”。

collins.def: If you venture into an activity, you do something that involves the risk of failure because it is new and different.

example.ex: He enjoyed little success when he ventured into business.
example.tran: 他冒险涉足商界后几乎没有取得什么成功。

collins.def: A phase is a particular stage in a process or in the gradual development of something.

example.ex: This autumn, 6000 residents will participate in the first phase of the project...
example.tran: 今年秋天，将有6000名居民参加该项目的第一阶段。

example.ex: The crisis is entering a crucial, critical phase...
example.tran: 目前危机正进入决定性的关键阶段。

collins.def: If an action or change is phased over a period of time, it is done in stages.

example.ex: The redundancies will be phased over two years.
example.tran: 裁员将在两年内分阶段进行。

example.ex: ...a phased withdrawal of American forces from the Philippines.
example.tran: 美国从菲律宾的分阶段撤军

collins.tran: 不同步的（地）/同步的（地）；不协调的（地）/协调的（地）
collins.def: If two things are out of phase with each other, they are not working or happening together as they should. If two things are in phase, they are working or occurring together as they should.

example.ex: The Skills Programme is out of phase with the rest of the curriculum.
example.tran: 技能课程与其他课程不协调。

example.ex: ...uncomfortable jet-lag symptoms of indigestion and out-of-phase sleeping and waking.
example.tran: 消化不良、睡眠时间混乱等不舒服的飞行时差症状

collins.def: Enthusiasm is great eagerness to be involved in a particular activity which you like and enjoy or which you think is important.

example.ex: The lack of enthusiasm for unification among most West Germans fills him with disappointment...
example.tran: 大多数西德人都没有渴望统一的热情，这令他无比失望。

example.ex: Their skill, enthusiasm and running has got them in the team.
example.tran: 他们的技术、热忱和跑动能力使他们得以加入这支球队。

collins.tran: 感兴趣的活动;热衷的学科
collins.def: An enthusiasm is an activity or subject that interests you very much and that you spend a lot of time on.

example.ex: Draw him out about his current enthusiasms and future plans.
example.tran: 让他畅所欲言地谈谈自己目前热衷的活动和将来的计划。

collins.def: If you are eager to do or have something, you want to do or have it very much.

example.ex: Robert was eager to talk about life in the Army...
example.tran: 罗伯特很想谈谈陆军生活。

example.ex: When my own son was five years old, I became eager for another baby...
example.tran: 我家儿子5岁的时候，我特别想再要一个孩子。

collins.tran: （看起来或听上去）急切的，期盼的
collins.def: If you look or sound eager, you look or sound as if you expect something interesting or enjoyable to happen.

example.ex: Arty sneered at the crowd of eager faces around him...
example.tran: 阿蒂对他身边那些期盼的面孔嗤之以鼻。

example.ex: Her voice was girlish and eager.
example.tran: 她的声音像个小姑娘似的，而且带着一股急不可耐。

collins.def: A buyer is a person who is buying something or who intends to buy it.

example.ex: Car buyers are more interested in safety and reliability than speed.
example.tran: 购车者们更感兴趣的是汽车的安全性和可靠性，而不是它的速度。

collins.tran: （大商店的）采购员，进货员；买手
collins.def: A buyer is a person who works for a large store deciding what goods will be bought from manufacturers to be sold in the store.

example.ex: I was a buyer for the women's clothing department.
example.tran: 我是女装部的进货员。

means: 使复杂化( complicate的过去式)

collins.tran: 复杂的;难懂的;难处理的
collins.def: If you say that something is complicated, you mean it has so many parts or aspects that it is difficult to understand or deal with.

example.ex: The situation in Lebanon is very complicated.
example.tran: 黎巴嫩的情况十分复杂。

example.ex: ...a very complicated voting system.
example.tran: 非常复杂的选举体制

means: （建筑物内、家具或地板等上的）灰尘

collins.def: Dust is very small dry particles of earth or sand.

example.ex: Tanks raise huge trails of dust when they move...
example.tran: 坦克开动时扬起大量尘土。

example.ex: He reversed into the stockade in a cloud of dust.
example.tran: 他在一阵尘土中将车倒进了围栏。

collins.def: Dust is the very small pieces of dirt which you find inside buildings, for example on furniture, floors, or lights.

example.ex: I could see a thick layer of dust on the stairs...
example.tran: 我可以看见楼梯上有一层厚厚的灰尘。

example.ex: The rooms were empty of furniture and dust lay everywhere.
example.tran: 房间里没有家具,到处都是灰尘。

collins.def: Dust is a fine powder which consists of very small particles of a substance such as gold, wood, or coal.

example.ex: The air is so black with diesel fumes and coal dust, I can barely see.
example.tran: 空气中充斥着柴油烟雾和煤尘粉末,黑乎乎的,我几乎什么都看不见。

collins.def: When you dust something such as furniture, you remove dust from it, usually using a cloth.

example.ex: I vacuumed and dusted the living room...
example.tran: 我用吸尘器打扫了客厅,擦了擦灰尘。

example.ex: She dusted, she cleaned, and she did the washing-up.
example.tran: 她擦掉灰尘，打扫卫生，还清洗了餐具。

collins.def: If you dust something with a fine substance such as powder or if you dust a fine substance onto something, you cover it lightly with that substance.

example.ex: Lightly dust the fish with flour...
example.tran: 在鱼上撒上少许面粉。

example.ex: Dust and blend blusher on the apples of your cheeks...
example.tran: 将胭脂调匀涂在你脸颊红润的地方。

collins.def: If you say that something has bitten the dust, you are emphasizing that it no longer exists or that it has failed.

example.ex: In the last 30 years many cherished values have bitten the dust...
example.tran: 在过去的 30 年中,许多珍贵的价值观已经消失殆尽。

example.ex: The allegation has caused one lecturer's career to bite the dust.
example.tran: 这项指控断送了一名讲师的前程。

collins.tran: 尘埃落定;形势明朗;事态平息
collins.def: If you say that something will happen when the dust settles, you mean that a situation will be clearer after it has calmed down. If you let the dust settle before doing something, you let a situation calm down before you try to do anything else.

example.ex: Once the dust had settled Beck defended his decision...
example.tran: 事态一旦平息,贝克就为他的决定辩白。

example.ex: I think we need to let the dust settle and see what's going to happen after that.
example.tran: 我认为我们需要等事态平息之后再看看会发生什么。

collins.def: If you say that something is gathering dust, you mean that it has been left somewhere and nobody is using it or doing anything with it.

example.ex: Many of the machines are gathering dust in basements...
example.tran: 许多机器尘封在地下室里。

example.ex: The album is finally being released in October after gathering dust for over a year.
example.tran: 尘封了一年多后,专辑终于在 10 月发行。

collins.def: A barrel is a large, round container for liquids or food.

example.ex: The wine is aged for almost a year in oak barrels.
example.tran: 这葡萄酒已经在橡木桶里存放近一年了。

example.ex: ...barrels of pickled fish.
example.tran: 几桶腌鱼

collins.tran: （石油工业中）一桶的量（相当于159升）
collins.def: In the oil industry, a barrel is a unit of measurement equal to 159 litres.

example.ex: In 1989, Kuwait was exporting 1.5 million barrels of oil a day...
example.tran: 1989年，科威特每天出口150万桶石油。

example.ex: Oil prices were closing at $19.76 a barrel.
example.tran: 油价收于每桶19.76美元。

collins.def: The barrel of a gun is the tube through which the bullet moves when the gun is fired.

example.ex: He pushed the barrel of the gun into the other man's open mouth.
example.tran: 他把枪管塞进了另一个人的嘴里。

collins.def: If a vehicle or person is barreling in a particular direction, they are moving very quickly in that direction.

example.ex: The car was barreling down the street at a crazy speed.
example.tran: 这辆车疯了一般沿街疾驶。

collins.def: If you say, for example, that someone moves or buys something lock, stock, and barrel, you are emphasizing that they move or buy every part or item of it.

example.ex: They dug up their New Jersey garden and moved it lock, stock, and barrel back home.
example.tran: 他们把在新泽西的花园刨了个遍，然后将里面的东西一样不落地搬回了家。

collins.tran: 使…受制于人；使…处于不利地位；迫使…做…
collins.def: If someone has you over a barrel, they have put you in a difficult situation where you have little choice but to do what they want you to do.

collins.tran: 凑合用劣质的东西；将就行事
collins.def: If you say that someone is scraping the barrel, or scraping the bottom of the barrel, you disapprove of the fact that they are using or doing something of extremely poor quality.

collins.tran: 非常有趣的事；笑料不断的开心果
collins.def: If an experience is a barrel of laughs, it is very enjoyable. If someone is a barrel of laughs, they are fun to be with.

example.ex: Weddington is the first to admit she's not exactly a barrel of laughs...
example.tran: 韦丁顿第一个承认自己其实并不爱搞笑。

example.ex: The suppers are always a barrel of laughs.
example.tran: 晚餐总是充满欢笑。

collins.def: Your identity is who you are.

example.ex: Abu is not his real name, but it's one he uses to disguise his identity...
example.tran: 阿布不是他的真名，是他用于伪装身份的名字。

example.ex: The police soon established his true identity and he was quickly found.
example.tran: 警方不久就查出了他的真实身份，并很快找到了他。

collins.def: The identity of a person or place is the characteristics they have that distinguish them from others.

example.ex: I wanted a sense of my own identity.
example.tran: 我想要确立自己的个性意识。

example.ex: ...the distinct cultural, religious and national identity of many Italians.
example.tran: 许多意大利人独有的文化、宗教、民族特性

means: 前进(advance的过去式和过去分词)

collins.def: An advanced system, method, or design is modern and has been developed from an earlier version of the same thing.

example.ex: Without more training or advanced technical skills, they'll lose their jobs.
example.tran: 没有进一步的培训或高级技能的话，他们就会丢掉工作。

example.ex: ...the most advanced optical telescope in the world.
example.tran: 世界上最先进的光学望远镜

collins.def: A country that is advanced has reached a high level of industrial or technological development.

example.ex: ...a technologically advanced society.
example.tran: 科技发达的社会

collins.tran: （学生）程度高的；（课程）高级的，高等的
collins.def: An advanced student has already learned the basic facts of a subject and is doing more difficult work. An advanced course of study is designed for such students.

example.ex: The course is suitable for beginners and advanced students...
example.tran: 本课程适合初学者及程度较高者。

example.ex: The lab has recently been updated to allow for more advanced courses.
example.tran: 实验室最近经过更新，可以上更高阶的课程了。

collins.def: Something that is at an advanced stage or level is at a late stage of development.

example.ex: 'Medicare' is available to victims of advanced kidney disease...
example.tran: 老年医疗保险也适用于肾病晚期患者。

example.ex: His ideas should be more advanced by the time the Committee meets in Edinburgh in October.
example.tran: 到委员会10月份在爱丁堡开会时，他的观点应该更为成熟了。

collins.def: If you say that someone is of advanced years or is advanced in age, you are saying in a polite way that they are old.

example.ex: The gentleman, despite his advanced years, helped Kathryn back to her seat.
example.tran: 这位绅士，尽管年事已高，仍然帮着凯瑟琳回到座位上。

collins.def: Departure or a departure is the act of going away from somewhere.

example.ex: ...the President's departure for Helsinki...
example.tran: 总统动身前往赫尔辛基

example.ex: They hoped this would lead to the departure of all foreign forces from the country...
example.tran: 他们希望这将驱使所有外国部队撤离该国。

collins.tran: 辞职;离职;（从某组织的）脱离
collins.def: The departure of a person from a job, or a member from an organization, is their act of leaving it or being forced to leave it.

example.ex: This would inevitably involve his departure from the post of Prime Minister...
example.tran: 这将不可避免地导致他辞去首相一职。

example.ex: Reihill's departure from the company is thought to follow disagreements with John Reihill Sr, who now controls the company.
example.tran: 赖希尔从公司的离职被认为是因为与现在掌管公司的老约翰·赖希尔意见不合。

collins.def: If someone does something different or unusual, you can refer to their action as a departure .

example.ex: Taylor announced another departure from practice in that England will train at Wembley...
example.tran: 泰勒再次一改常规地宣布英格兰队将在温布利球场进行训练。

example.ex: Now she's written a novel which is not a mystery and is a considerable departure from her previous work.
example.tran: 她现在创作了一部非推理小说，与她以前的作品大相径庭。

collins.def: Religion is belief in a god or gods and the activities that are connected with this belief, such as praying or worshipping in a building such as a church or temple.

example.ex: ...his understanding of Indian philosophy and religion...
example.tran: 他对印度哲学和宗教信仰的理解

example.ex: Do avoid potentially contentious subjects such as religion, sex or politics.
example.tran: 一定要避免可能引起争议的话题，如宗教、性和政治。

collins.def: A religion is a particular system of belief in a god or gods and the activities that are connected with this system.

example.ex: ...the Christian religion.
example.tran: 基督教

collins.def: If you say that someone has got religion, you are referring in a mocking way to the fact that they have suddenly decided to follow a particular religion.

example.ex: This guy got religion about a year back.
example.tran: 这家伙一年前信了教。

collins.tran: 不知道的；不了解的；未知的
collins.def: If something is unknown to you, you have no knowledge of it.

example.ex: An unknown number of demonstrators were arrested...
example.tran: 有数目不详的示威者遭到了逮捕。

example.ex: How did you expect us to proceed on such a perilous expedition, through unknown terrain...
example.tran: 你怎么能指望我们如此冒险地穿越未知的地域，继续这一探险？

collins.tran: 不认识的；不熟悉的；陌生的
collins.def: An unknown person is someone whose name you do not know or whose character you do not know anything about.

example.ex: Unknown thieves had forced their way into the apartment...
example.tran: 不知名的窃贼破门闯入了公寓。

example.ex: I could not understand how someone with so many awards could be unknown to me.
example.tran: 我想不通自己竟然不认识获了这么多奖的人。

collins.tran: 不出名的；无人知晓的；未获公众认可的
collins.def: An unknown person is not famous or publicly recognized.

example.ex: He was an unknown writer.
example.tran: 他是个名不见经传的作家。

example.ex: ...a popular environment where both established and unknown artists can meet, talk and drink.
example.tran: 成名和未成名的艺术家都可以聚会、聊天及喝酒的一处热门场所

collins.tran: 从未发生的；从未存在的
collins.def: If you say that a particular problem or situation is unknown, you mean that it never occurs.

example.ex: A hundred years ago coronary heart disease was virtually unknown in Europe and America.
example.tran: 在100年前冠心病几乎不存在于欧洲和美洲。

collins.tran: （总称）未知事物，不为人知的地方
collins.def: The unknown refers generally to things or places that people do not know about or understand.

example.ex: Ignorance of people brings fear, fear of the unknown.
example.tran: 人们的无知会带来恐惧，对未知事物的恐惧。

collins.tran: 貌似的；表面上的；似乎真实的
collins.def: An apparent situation, quality, or feeling seems to exist, although you cannot be certain that it does exist.

example.ex: I was a bit depressed by our apparent lack of progress...
example.tran: 我对我们看似缓慢的进展感到有些沮丧。

example.ex: There is at last an apparent end to the destructive price war.
example.tran: 这场惨烈的价格战貌似终于结束了。

collins.def: If something is apparent to you, it is clear and obvious to you.

example.ex: It has been apparent that in other areas standards have held up well...
example.tran: 显然，这些标准在其他地区执行得很好。

example.ex: The presence of a star is already apparent in the early film.
example.tran: 在早期影片中已经显露出了明星相。

collins.def: If you say that something happens for no apparent reason, you cannot understand why it happens.

example.ex: The person may become dizzy for no apparent reason.
example.tran: 这类人可能会莫名其妙地感到头晕。

means: 寡廉鲜耻的，恣意放荡的

collins.tran: (场所或建筑物)舍弃不用的，无人居住的
collins.def: An abandoned place or building is no longer used or occupied.

example.ex: All that digging had left a network of abandoned mines and tunnels.
example.tran: 东挖西掘后留下了一片废弃的矿坑。

example.ex: ...abandoned buildings that become a breeding ground for crime.
example.tran: 沦为了犯罪温床的弃置楼群

collins.def: A supermarket is a large shop which sells all kinds of food and some household goods.

example.ex: Most of us do our food shopping in the supermarket...
example.tran: 我们大多数人去超市购买食品。

example.ex: How do those prawns find their way from Norway to the supermarket shelf?
example.tran: 这些对虾是如何从挪威跑到超市货架上来的呢？

collins.def: To restore a situation or practice means to cause it to exist again.

example.ex: The army has recently been brought in to restore order...
example.tran: 最近军队被调来重整秩序。

example.ex: As they smiled at each other, harmony was restored again...
example.tran: 他们彼此微笑的时候，又恢复了往日的和睦。

collins.def: To restore someone or something to a previous condition means to cause them to be in that condition once again.

example.ex: We will restore her to health but it may take time...
example.tran: 我们会让她恢复健康，但可能需要一些时间。

example.ex: He said the ousted president must be restored to power...
example.tran: 他说被赶下台的总统必须重新掌权。

collins.def: When someone restores something such as an old building, painting, or piece of furniture, they repair and clean it, so that it looks like it did when it was new.

example.ex: ...experts who specialise in examining and restoring ancient parchments.
example.tran: 专门致力于检查和修复古代羊皮纸文稿的专家

example.ex: ...the beautifully restored old town square.
example.tran: 整修得很漂亮的古镇广场

collins.def: If something that was lost or stolen is restored to its owner, it is returned to them.

example.ex: The following day their horses and goods were restored to them...
example.tran: 第二天，马匹和货物都归还给了他们。

example.ex: The looted property was restored and the chargé d'affaires was told that the soldiers responsible had been arrested.
example.tran: 被劫财物已经物归原主，代办得知对此负有责任的士兵已被逮捕。

collins.def: You use seriously to indicate that you are not joking and that you really mean what you say.

example.ex: Seriously, I only smoke in the evenings.
example.tran: 真的，我只在晚上抽烟。

collins.tran: (用以询问对方的话是否是认真的)当真,真的.
collins.def: You say 'seriously' when you are surprised by what someone has said, as a way of asking them if they really mean it.

example.ex: 'I tried to chat him up at the general store.' He laughed. 'Seriously?'
example.tran: “我在杂货店里试图跟他搭讪来着。”他笑着说。“真的?”

collins.tran: 认真对待;把…看得很重要
collins.def: If you take someone or something seriously, you believe that they are important and deserve attention.

example.ex: It's hard to take them seriously in their pretty grey uniforms...
example.tran: 他们穿着帅气的灰色制服时，很难对他们郑重其事起来。

example.ex: The phrase was not meant to be taken seriously.
example.tran: 此话不必当真。

collins.def: If you have sympathy for someone who is in a bad situation, you are sorry for them, and show this in the way you behave towards them.

example.ex: We expressed our sympathy for her loss...
example.tran: 我们对她的损失表示同情。

example.ex: I have had very little help from doctors and no sympathy whatsoever...
example.tran: 我从医生那里没有得到什么帮助，也未获得丝毫同情。

collins.def: If you have sympathy with someone's ideas or opinions, you agree with them.

example.ex: I have some sympathy with this point of view...
example.tran: 我比较同意这个观点。

example.ex: Lithuania still commands considerable international sympathy for its cause...
example.tran: 立陶宛的事业仍然拥有相当的国际支持。

collins.def: If you take some action in sympathy with someone else, you do it in order to show that you support them.

example.ex: Several hundred workers struck in sympathy with their colleagues...
example.tran: 几百名工人罢工以声援他们的同事。

example.ex: Milne resigned in sympathy because of the way Donald had been treated.
example.tran: 米尔恩以辞职来抗议唐纳德所遭受的不公待遇。

collins.def: Luck or good luck is success or good things that happen to you, that do not come from your own abilities or efforts.

example.ex: I knew I needed a bit of luck to win...
example.tran: 我知道自己要赢需要点运气。

example.ex: The Sri Lankans have been having no luck with the weather...
example.tran: 斯里兰卡人在天气方面运气一直很差。

collins.def: Bad luck is lack of success or bad things that happen to you, that have not been caused by yourself or other people.

example.ex: I had a lot of bad luck during the first half of this season...
example.tran: 上半赛季我一直走背运。

example.ex: Randall's illness was only bad luck.
example.tran: 兰德尔生病纯粹是时运不济。

collins.def: If you ask someone the question 'Any luck?' or 'No luck?', you want to know if they have been successful in something they were trying to do.

example.ex: 'Any luck?' — 'No.'
example.tran: “成功了没？”——“没有。”

collins.def: You can say 'Bad luck', or 'Hard luck', to someone when you want to express sympathy to them.

example.ex: Well, hard luck, mate.
example.tran: 唉，真不走运，哥儿们。

collins.tran: 带来霉运/带来好运；不吉利/ 吉利
collins.def: If you say that something brings bad luck or brings someone good luck, you believe that it has an influence on whether good or bad things happen to them.

example.ex: Jean was extremely superstitious and believed the colour green brought bad luck.
example.tran: 琼十分迷信，她认为绿色不吉利。

collins.tran: （常指因缺钱而）遭遇厄运，时运不济
collins.def: If you describe someone as down on their luck, you mean that they have had bad experiences, often because they do not have enough money.

collins.tran: 碰巧的运气；运气的结果
collins.def: If you say that something is the luck of the draw, you mean that it is the result of chance and you cannot do anything about it.

example.ex: The luck of the draw meant the young lad had to face one of America's best players.
example.tran: 完全是运气使然，这位小伙子必须面对一位美国一流选手。

collins.def: If you say 'Good luck' or 'Best of luck' to someone, you are telling them that you hope they will be successful in something they are trying to do.

example.ex: He kissed her on the cheek. 'Best of luck!'
example.tran: 他吻了吻她的脸颊。“祝你好运！”

collins.def: You can say someone is in luck when they are in a situation where they can have what they want or need.

example.ex: You're in luck. The doctor's still in.
example.tran: 你真走运。医生还没走。

collins.def: If you say it is just your luck that something unpleasant has happened to you, you mean that this is quite normal because unpleasant things are always happening to you.

example.ex: It would be just his luck to miss the last boat.
example.tran: 他就这运气，误了最后一班船也毫不出奇。

collins.tran: 运气不好；不走运；不凑巧
collins.def: If you say that someone is out of luck, you mean that they cannot have something which they can normally have.

example.ex: 'What do you want, Roy? If it's  money, you're out of luck.'
example.tran: “你想要什么，罗伊？要钱的话，那你别指望了。”

collins.def: You can say 'No such luck' when you want to express your disappointment over something.

example.ex: He must have been hoping for a relaxed time. No such luck.
example.tran: 他一定是一直想放松一段时间，可就是没这个命。

collins.tran: 得寸进尺；冒不明智的风险
collins.def: If you say that someone is pushing their luck, you think they are taking a bigger risk than is sensible, and may get into trouble.

example.ex: I didn't dare push my luck too far and did not ask them to sign statements.
example.tran: 我不敢太过贪心不足，没有要他们签署声明。

collins.tran: 受幸运之神眷顾；福星高照
collins.def: If you say that luck was on someone's side, you mean that they succeeded in something by chance as well as by their own efforts or ability.

example.ex: Rick seems to have had luck on his side during his 12-year acting career.
example.tran: 在12年的演艺生涯中，里克好像总有福星高照。

collins.def: If someone tries their luck at something, they try to succeed at it, often when it is very difficult or there is little chance of success.

example.ex: She was going to try her luck at the Las Vegas casinos.
example.tran: 她打算去拉斯韦加斯的赌场碰碰运气。

collins.tran: 希望；但愿；运气好的话；一切顺利的话
collins.def: You can add with luck or with any luck to a statement to indicate that you hope that a particular thing will happen.

example.ex: We'll have a long talk and a good cry and then with any luck  we'll both feel better.
example.tran: 我们会一席长谈，大哭一场，但愿这样我们两个都会好过一点。

collins.def: A cruise is a holiday during which you travel on a ship or boat and visit a number of places.

example.ex: He and his wife were planning to go on a world cruise...
example.tran: 他和太太计划乘船环游世界。

example.ex: The next stop on this cruise is likely to be in Cornwall.
example.tran: 此次航游的下一站很可能是在康沃尔。

collins.def: If you cruise a sea, river, or canal, you travel around it or along it on a cruise.

example.ex: She wants to cruise the canals of France in a barge...
example.tran: 她想乘驳船游览法国的运河。

example.ex: During their summer holidays they cruised further afield to Normandy and Brittany.
example.tran: 暑期他们乘船到更远的诺曼底和布列塔尼游览。

collins.tran: (车、船或飞机)以平稳且舒适的速度行驶，缓慢行进
collins.def: If a car, ship, or aircraft cruises somewhere, it moves there at a steady comfortable speed.

example.ex: A black and white police car cruised past.
example.tran: 一辆黑白相间的警车缓慢驶过。

collins.tran: （球队或运动员）轻而易举赢得，轻取
collins.def: If a team or sports player cruises to victory, they win easily.

example.ex: Graf looked in awesome form as she cruised to an easy victory.
example.tran: 格拉芙轻松取胜，看上去状态极佳。

collins.tran: (在公共场所，尤指男同性恋者)寻找性伙伴，猎艳
collins.def: If a gay man is cruising, he is searching in public places for a sexual partner.

example.ex: ...gay men cruising on Clapham Common.
example.tran: 在克拉珀姆公地寻找性伙伴的男同性恋者

collins.def: A sum of money is an amount of money.

example.ex: Large sums of money were lost...
example.tran: 损失了大笔钱财。

example.ex: Even the relatively modest sum of £50,000 now seems beyond his reach.
example.tran: 现在即使是相对来说并不算多的 5 万英镑对他来说也是遥不可及的。

collins.def: A sum is a simple calculation in arithmetic.

example.ex: I can't do my sums.
example.tran: 我算不出来。

collins.def: In mathematics, the sum of two numbers is the number that is obtained when they are added together.

example.ex: The sum of all the angles of a triangle is 180 degrees.
example.tran: 三角形内角总和为 180 度。

collins.def: The sum of something is all of it.

example.ex: 'Public opinion' is only the sum of the views of thousands of people like yourself...
example.tran: “舆论”只是所有像你一样的成千上万人的意见的总和。

example.ex: The sum of evidence points to the crime resting on them...
example.tran: 所有证据都表明该犯罪乃他们所为。

collins.def: You use in sum to introduce a statement that briefly describes a situation.

example.ex: In sum, the two countries are now true economic partners...
example.tran: 总而言之，两国目前是真正的经济合作伙伴。

example.ex: It is a situation, in sum, devoid of logic.
example.tran: 总之，该情况毫无逻辑。

collins.tran: 个体相加不如集体的力量大;总体大于个体之和
collins.def: If you say that something is more than the sum of its parts or greater than the sum of its parts, you mean that it is better than you would expect from the individual parts, because the way they combine adds a different quality.

example.ex: As individual members' solo careers have proved, each band was greater than the sum of its parts.
example.tran: 成员单飞后的发展证明，每个乐队的成员只有组合在一起才能创造出更大的成功。

collins.tran: 科学上的;关于某一科学的
collins.def: Scientific is used to describe things that relate to science or to a particular science.

example.ex: Scientific research is widely claimed to be the source of the high standard of living in the US.
example.tran: 科学研究被普遍认为是美国高生活水准的源泉。

example.ex: ...the use of animals in scientific experiments.
example.tran: 将动物用于科学实验

collins.tran: 细致严谨的;使用科学方法的
collins.def: If you do something in a scientific way, you do it carefully and thoroughly, using experiments or tests.

example.ex: It's not a scientific way to test their opinions.
example.tran: 用这个方法来测试他们的意见不科学。

example.ex: ...the scientific study of capitalist development.
example.tran: 对资本主义发展细致严谨的研究

collins.def: If something is pale, it is very light in colour or almost white.

example.ex: Migrating birds filled the pale sky...
example.tran: 灰白的天空中满是迁徙的飞鸟。

example.ex: As we age, our skin becomes paler.
example.tran: 随着年龄的增长，我们的皮肤愈见苍白。

collins.def: If someone looks pale, their face looks a lighter colour than usual, usually because they are ill, frightened, or shocked.

example.ex: She looked pale and tired...
example.tran: 她看起来脸色苍白憔悴。

example.ex: He went deathly pale.
example.tran: 他面如死灰。

collins.def: If one thing pales in comparison with another, it is made to seem much less important, serious, or good by it.

example.ex: When someone you love has a life-threatening illness, everything else pales in comparison.
example.tran: 你爱的人得了致命疾病时，其他一切事情都显得不那么重要了。

example.ex: ...a soap opera against which other soaps pale into insignificance.
example.tran: 让其他同类剧相形见绌的肥皂剧

collins.def: If you think that someone's actions or behaviour are not acceptable, you can say that they are beyond the pale.

example.ex: This sort of thing really is quite beyond the pale.
example.tran: 这种事情真是不可接受。

example.ex: ...beyond the pale of acceptable human behaviour.
example.tran: 超出可接受的人类行为的范围

collins.def: Your expectations are your strong hopes or beliefs that something will happen or that you will get something that you want.

example.ex: Students' expectations were as varied as their expertise...
example.tran: 学生们的期望根据他们的专业各有不同。

example.ex: The car has been General Motors' most visible success story, with sales far exceeding expectations...
example.tran: 那种车是通用汽车公司有目共睹最成功的车型，销量远远超过预期。

collins.def: A person's expectations are strong beliefs which they have about the proper way someone should behave or something should happen.

example.ex: Stephen Chase had determined to live up to the expectations of the Company.
example.tran: 斯蒂芬·蔡斯决心不辜负公司的期望。

example.ex: ...the expectation that the grieving process should have a time limit on it.
example.tran: 希望悲痛情绪不要长久持续下去

collins.def: Reference to someone or something is the act of talking about them or mentioning them. A reference is a particular example of this.

example.ex: He made no reference to any agreement...
example.tran: 他没有提到什么协议。

example.ex: The crowd chanted 'No Poll Tax', a reference to the government's new local taxation system...
example.tran: 人群高呼“不要人头税”，指的是政府新确立的地方税收制度。

collins.def: Reference is the act of consulting someone or something in order to get information or advice.

example.ex: This might be done without reference to Parliament...
example.tran: 这件事情也许可以绕过国会直接进行。

example.ex: Please keep this sheet in a safe place for reference.
example.tran: 请把这张纸放在稳妥之处以备查阅。

collins.def: Reference books are ones that you look at when you need specific information or facts about a subject.

example.ex: There are several reference books which have been compiled to help you make your choice.
example.tran: 有几本参考书专门帮你作出选择。

example.ex: ...a useful reference work for teachers.
example.tran: 有用的教师参考书

collins.def: A reference is a word, phrase, or idea which comes from something such as a book, poem, or play and which you use when making a point about something.

example.ex: ...a reference from the Quran.
example.tran: 引自《古兰经》的引文

example.ex: ...historical references.
example.tran: 历史引证

collins.def: A reference is something such as a number or a name that tells you where you can obtain the information you want.

example.ex: ...a map reference...
example.tran: 地图索引

example.ex: Make a note of the reference number shown on the form.
example.tran: 把表格上的编码记下来。

collins.def: A reference is a letter that is written by someone who knows you and which describes your character and abilities. When you apply for a job, an employer might ask for references .

example.ex: The firm offered to give her a reference.
example.tran: 公司主动给她开具介绍信。

collins.tran: （求职等时的）推荐人，介绍人，证明人
collins.def: A reference is a person who gives you a reference, for example when you are applying for a job.

collins.tran: 引用，参照（某书或某作者）
collins.def: If you reference a particular book or writer, you make a precise reference to them in what you are saying or writing.

example.ex: It specifically referenced Hermann Noordung's classic 1928 book on this subject.
example.tran: 在这一问题上它特别参照了赫尔曼·诺丁1928年的经典之作。

collins.def: If you keep information for future reference, you keep it because it might be useful in the future.

example.ex: Read these notes carefully and keep them for future reference.
example.tran: 仔细阅读这些注释并将其保留下来以备将来之用。

collins.def: You use with reference to or in reference to in order to indicate what something relates to.

example.ex: I am writing with reference to your article on salaries for scientists...
example.tran: 我写此信是为了回应你那篇探讨科学家薪水的文章。

example.ex: I'm calling in reference to your series on prejudice.
example.tran: 我打电话是要谈谈你写的有关“偏见”的系列文章。

collins.def: You use altogether to emphasize that something has stopped, been done, or finished completely.

example.ex: When Artie stopped calling altogether, Julie found a new man...
example.tran: 当阿蒂彻底不再上门后，朱莉又找了个男人。

example.ex: His tour may have to be cancelled altogether...
example.tran: 他的旅行可能不得不彻底取消。

collins.tran: （用于形容词或副词前表示强调）显然，完全
collins.def: You use altogether in front of an adjective or adverb to emphasize a quality that someone or something has.

example.ex: The choice of language is altogether different...
example.tran: 对语言的选择完全是另一回事。

example.ex: Today's celebrations have been altogether more sedate...
example.tran: 今天的庆祝活动显然更加庄重。

collins.def: You use altogether to modify a negative statement and make it less forceful.

example.ex: We were not altogether sure that the comet would miss the Earth...
example.tran: 我们不能完全肯定彗星不会与地球相撞。

example.ex: The fashion business, he claims, not altogether convincingly, is more real than the film business...
example.tran: 他声称时尚业比电影业更真实，但他的话并不完全令人信服。

collins.def: You can use altogether to introduce a summary of what you have been saying.

example.ex: Altogether, it was a delightful town garden, peaceful and secluded.
example.tran: 总体上说，这是个令人愉快的城市花园，宁静而偏僻。

collins.def: If several amounts add up to a particular amount altogether, that amount is their total.

example.ex: Britain has a dozen warships in the area, with a total of five thousand military personnel altogether...
example.tran: 英国在该地区驻有12艘战舰，共有5,000名军人。

example.ex: Altogether seven inmates escaped by scaling a wall and climbing down scaffolding.
example.tran: 总共有7名犯人攀墙从脚手架上爬下来逃走了。

means: 值得尊敬的，值得推崇的

collins.tran: 与上帝（或宗教）有关的;神圣的
collins.def: If you describe something as holy, you mean that it is considered to be special because it is connected with God or a particular religion.

example.ex: To them, as to all Christians, this is a holy place.
example.tran: 对他们以及所有基督徒来说，这里是一处圣地。

example.ex: ...Yom Kippur, the holiest day in the Jewish calendar.
example.tran: 赎罪日，犹太历中最神圣的日子

collins.tran: 虔诚的;圣洁的;献身于宗教（或教会）的
collins.def: A holy person is a religious leader or someone who leads a religious life.

example.ex: The Indians think of him as a holy man, a combination of doctor and priest.
example.tran: 印度人把他视为圣人，他既是医生又是僧侣。

collins.tran: （表示惊讶、恐慌等）天啊，上帝啊
collins.def: Holy is used in exclamations such as 'Holy cow!' and 'Holy smoke!' to express an emotion such as surprise or panic.
Chocolate is a sweet hard food made from cocoa beans. It is usually brown in colour and is eaten as a sweet.

example.ex: ...a bar of chocolate...
example.tran: 一块巧克力

example.ex: Do you want some chocolate?
example.tran: 你要巧克力吗？

collins.tran: (通常用热牛奶调制的)巧克力热饮
collins.def: Chocolate or hot chocolate is a drink made from a powder containing chocolate. It is usually made with hot milk.

example.ex: ...a small cafeteria where the visitors can buy tea, coffee and chocolate...
example.tran: 为游客提供茶、咖啡和巧克力热饮的小餐馆

example.ex: I sipped the hot chocolate she had made.
example.tran: 我小口喝着她调制的巧克力热饮。

collins.def: Chocolates are small sweets or nuts covered with a layer of chocolate. They are usually sold in a box.

example.ex: ...a box of chocolates...
example.tran: 一盒巧克力糖

example.ex: Here, have a chocolate.
example.tran: 来，吃块巧克力糖。

collins.def: Chocolate is used to describe things that are dark brown in colour.

example.ex: The curtains and the coverlet of the bed were chocolate velvet...
example.tran: 窗帘和床罩是深棕色天鹅绒的。

example.ex: She placed the chocolate-colored coat beside the case.
example.tran: 她将深棕色大衣放在手提箱旁。

collins.def: A tower is a tall, narrow building, that either stands alone or forms part of another building such as a church or castle.

example.ex: ...an eleventh century castle with 120-foot high towers.
example.tran: 带有 120 英尺高塔的 11 世纪城堡

example.ex: ...the Leaning Tower of Pisa.
example.tran: 比萨斜塔

collins.tran: (比周围的人或物)高出许多；屹立
collins.def: Someone or something that towers over surrounding people or things is a lot taller than they are.

example.ex: He stood up and towered over her...
example.tran: 他站起身来，比她高出许多。

example.ex: At school, a girl may tower over most boys her age…
example.tran: 在学校，一个女孩可能比她同龄的大多数男孩子都要高出许多。

collins.tran: (无线电或电视信号的)发射塔
collins.def: A tower is a tall structure that is used for sending radio or television signals.

example.ex: Troops are still in control of the television and radio tower.
example.tran: 军队仍然控制着电视和广播发射塔。

collins.def: A tower is the same as a tower block .

example.ex: ...his design for a new office tower in Frankfurt.
example.tran: 他为法兰克福一栋新写字楼所作的设计

collins.def: A tower is a tall box that contains the main parts of a computer, such as the hard disk and the drives.

collins.tran: (在危难时)可依靠的人，主心骨，支柱
collins.def: If you refer to someone as a tower of strength, you appreciate them because they give you a lot of help, support, and encouragement when you have problems or are in a difficult situation.

example.ex: Pat was a tower of strength to our whole family.
example.tran: 帕特是我们全家人的主心骨。

collins.def: A medal is a small metal disc which is given as an award for bravery or as a prize in a sporting event.

means: 给（织物）做防护处理，使防水（或防火等）

collins.def: Proof is a fact, argument, or piece of evidence which shows that something is definitely true or definitely exists.

example.ex: You have to have proof of residence in the state of Texas, such as a Texas ID card...
example.tran: 你必须有在得克萨斯州的居住证明，比如得克萨斯身份证。

example.ex: This is not necessarily proof that he is wrong...
example.tran: 这不一定就证明他是错的。

collins.def: In publishing, the proofs of a book, magazine, or article are a first copy of it that is printed so that mistakes can be corrected before more copies are printed and published.

example.ex: I'm correcting the proofs of the Spanish edition right now.
example.tran: 我正在校正西班牙语版本的校样。

collins.def: Proof is used after a number of degrees or a percentage, when indicating the strength of a strong alcoholic drink such as whisky.

example.ex: ...a glass of Wild Turkey bourbon: 101 degrees proof.
example.tran: 一杯威特基波旁威士忌：酒精度为101°

collins.tran: 不能穿透的；耐…的；能防…的
collins.def: If something or someone is proof against a particular thing, they cannot be damaged, harmed, or affected by it.

example.ex: The fortress was proof against the techniques of attack then in use...
example.tran: 该防御工事能抵御当时所使用的各种进攻手段。

example.ex: His papers were proof against all but the most expert of scrutinies.
example.tran: 他的论文几乎可以经受住最专业的审查。

collins.tran: 典型的例证；活生生的例子
collins.def: If you say that someone is living proof of something, you mean that their actions or personal qualities show that a particular fact is true or that a particular quality exists.

example.ex: He is living proof that some players just get better with age.
example.tran: 有些运动员年纪越大状态越好，他就是个活生生的例子。

collins.def: To be proof positive of a particular fact or quality means to be evidence that it is true or that it exists.

example.ex: The Windermere Golf Club is proof positive that golf and ecology can co-exist in perfect harmony.
example.tran: 温德米尔高尔夫俱乐部证明了高尔夫和生态能完全和谐共存。

collins.def: Your profile is the outline of your face as it is seen when someone is looking at you from the side.

example.ex: His handsome profile was turned away from us.
example.tran: 他英俊的侧影从我们眼前转开了。

collins.def: If you see someone in profile, you see them from the side.

example.ex: This picture shows the girl in profile.
example.tran: 这张照片照的是女孩的侧面。

collins.def: A profile of someone is a short article or programme in which their life and character are described.

example.ex: A newspaper published profiles of the candidates' wives.
example.tran: 一家报纸刊登了几位候选人夫人的简介。

collins.def: To profile someone means to give an account of that person's life and character.

example.ex: Tamar Golan, a Paris-based journalist, profiles the rebel leader.
example.tran: 驻巴黎记者塔玛·戈兰对反叛者的首领进行了介绍。

collins.tran: 高调/低调；高姿态/低姿态
collins.def: If someone has a high profile, people notice them and what they do. If you keep a low profile, you avoid doing things that will make people notice you.

example.ex: ...a move that would give Egypt a much higher profile in the upcoming peace talks...
example.tran: 能使埃及在未来的和谈中更加引人关注的举动

example.ex: Football is a high profile business...
example.tran: 足球是一个引人注目的产业。

collins.def: In animals and plants, tissue consists of cells that are similar to each other in appearance and that have the same function.

example.ex: As we age we lose muscle tissue...
example.tran: 肌肉组织会随着我们日趋衰老而萎缩。

example.ex: Athletes have hardly any fatty tissue…
example.tran: 运动员几乎没有什么脂肪组织。

collins.tran: (用于包装易损物品的)薄纸，绵纸
collins.def: Tissue or tissue paper is thin paper that is used for wrapping things that are easily damaged, such as objects made of glass or china.
A tissue is a piece of thin soft paper that you use to blow your nose.

example.ex: ...a box of tissues.
example.tran: 一盒面巾纸

collins.def: A shareholder is a person who owns shares in a company.

example.ex: ...a shareholders' meeting.
example.tran: 股东大会

collins.def: A drama is a serious play for the theatre, television, or radio.

example.ex: He acted in radio dramas.
example.tran: 他在广播剧中扮演角色。

collins.tran: 戏剧;戏剧艺术;戏剧事业
collins.def: You use drama to refer to plays in general or to work that is connected with plays and the theatre, such as acting or producing.

example.ex: He knew nothing of Greek drama...
example.tran: 他对希腊戏剧一无所知。

example.ex: She met him when she was at drama school.
example.tran: 她在戏剧学校上学时认识了他。

collins.tran: 戏剧性事件;戏剧性情节
collins.def: You can refer to a real situation which is exciting or distressing as drama .

example.ex: There was none of the drama and relief of a hostage release...
example.tran: 丝毫没有释放人质时的那种激动和如释重负的感觉。

example.ex: For all its drama, the event was not unexpected.
example.tran: 虽然这件事带有戏剧性，但并不意外。

collins.def: If someone is victimized, they are deliberately treated unfairly.

example.ex: He felt the students had been victimized because they'd  voiced opposition to the government.
example.tran: 他觉得学生们受到迫害是因为他们表达了对政府的不满。

means: 相对：放在某事物对面以对比或平衡

collins.def: If you are opposed to something, you disagree with it or disapprove of it.

example.ex: I am utterly opposed to any form of terrorism...
example.tran: 我坚决反对任何形式的恐怖主义。

example.ex: We are strongly opposed to the presence of America in this region.
example.tran: 我们强烈反对美国在该地区的存在。

collins.tran: 对立的；对抗的；相对的；相反的
collins.def: You say that two ideas or systems are opposed when they are opposite to each other or very different from each other.

example.ex: ...people with policies almost diametrically opposed to his own...
example.tran: 提出与他几乎截然相反的政策的人

example.ex: This was a straight conflict of directly opposed aims.
example.tran: 这是完全对立的目标之间的正面冲突。

collins.def: You use as opposed to when you want to make it clear that you are talking about one particular thing and not something else.

example.ex: We ate in the restaurant, as opposed to the bistro.
example.tran: 我们是在餐厅吃的饭，而不是在小饭馆。

collins.def: If a person or company employs you, they pay you to work for them.

example.ex: The company employs 18 staff...
example.tran: 公司雇用了18名员工。

example.ex: More than 3,000 local workers are employed in the tourism industry...
example.tran: 3,000余名当地人受雇于旅游业。

collins.def: If you employ certain methods, materials, or expressions, you use them.

example.ex: The tactics the police are now to employ are definitely uncompromising.
example.tran: 警方目前即将采取的策略明显很强硬。

example.ex: ...the vocabulary that she employs.
example.tran: 她使用的词汇

collins.def: If your time is employed in doing something, you are using the time you have to do that thing.

example.ex: Your time could be usefully employed in attending to professional matters...
example.tran: 你可以有效地利用时间处理一些专业问题。

example.ex: The journalists would be much better employed in trying to explain to us how the astronomical legal costs of the cases can be justified.
example.tran: 记者们最好花时间向我们说明为什么诉讼费高得惊人。

collins.def: If you are in the employ of someone or something, you work for them.

example.ex: Others hinted that he was in the employ of the KGB...
example.tran: 其他人暗示他受雇于克格勃。

example.ex: Those in his employ were careful never to enrage him.
example.tran: 在他手底下干活的人都非常小心绝不去触怒他。

collins.tran: (美国、澳大利亚等国的)参议员
collins.def: A senator is a member of a political Senate, for example in the United States or Australia.
Expansion is the process of becoming greater in size, number, or amount.

example.ex: ...the rapid expansion of private health insurance.
example.tran: 个人健康保险的迅速发展

example.ex: ...a new period of economic expansion...
example.tran: 经济发展的新时期

collins.def: If you contribute to something, you say or do things to help to make it successful.

example.ex: The three sons also contribute to the family business...
example.tran: 这3个儿子也为家族事业做出了贡献。
