example.ex: I believe that each of us can contribute to the future of the world...
example.tran: 我相信我们每一个人都能够对世界的未来有所贡献。

collins.def: To contribute money or resources to something means to give money or resources to help pay for something or to help achieve a particular purpose.

example.ex: The US is contributing $4 billion in loans, credits and grants...
example.tran: 美国将提供40亿美元的信贷和赠款。

example.ex: They say they would like to contribute more to charity, but money is tight this year...
example.tran: 他们说他们很想捐献更多的钱支持慈善事业，但是今年的钱非常紧张。

collins.tran: 促成;促使；是导致…的原因之一
collins.def: If something contributes to an event or situation, it is one of the causes of it.

example.ex: The report says design faults in both the vessels contributed to the tragedy...
example.tran: 报告说两艘船存在的设计缺陷也促成了这场悲剧的发生。

example.ex: Stress, both human and mechanical, may also be a contributing factor.
example.tran: 来自人的和机械方面的压力可能也是一个因素。

collins.def: If you contribute to a magazine, newspaper, or book, you write things that are published in it.

example.ex: I was asked to contribute to a newspaper article making predictions for the new year...
example.tran: 我受邀为报纸撰写一篇文章，对新的一年进行预测。

example.ex: Frank Deford is a contributing editor for Vanity Fair magazine.
example.tran: 弗兰克·德福特是杂志《名利场》的特约编辑。

collins.def: Cooking is food which has been cooked.

example.ex: The menu is based on classic French cooking.
example.tran: 菜单是以经典的法国菜为主。

example.ex: ...Mom's home cooking.
example.tran: 妈妈做的家常菜

collins.def: Cooking ingredients or equipment are used in cookery.

example.ex: Finely slice the cooking apples.
example.tran: 把烹调用的苹果切成薄片。

example.ex: ...cooking chocolate.
example.tran: 烹调用的巧克力

collins.def: Courage is the quality shown by someone who decides to do something difficult or dangerous, even though they may be afraid.

example.ex: General Lewis Mackenzie has impressed everyone with his authority and personal courage...
example.tran: 刘易斯·麦肯奇将军的威信和勇气给所有人留下了深刻的印象。

example.ex: They do not have the courage to apologise for their actions.
example.tran: 他们没有勇气为自己的行为道歉。

collins.tran: 有勇气做自己认为正确的事
collins.def: If you have the courage of your convictions, you have the confidence to do what you believe is right, even though other people may not agree or approve.

example.ex: Developers should have the courage of their convictions and stick to what they do best.
example.tran: 研发人员应该对自己充满信心，坚持做自己最擅长的事。

collins.def: If you stroke someone or something, you move your hand slowly and gently over them.

example.ex: Carla, curled up on the sofa, was smoking a cigarette and stroking her cat...
example.tran: 卡拉正蜷缩在沙发上，一边吸着烟，一边轻抚着她的猫咪。

example.ex: She walked forward and embraced him and stroked his tousled white hair.
example.tran: 她走上前拥抱他并轻抚他凌乱的白发。

collins.def: If someone has a stroke, a blood vessel in their brain bursts or becomes blocked, which may kill them or make them unable to move one side of their body.

example.ex: He had a minor stroke in 1987, which left him partly paralysed.
example.tran: 他 1987 年曾患轻度中风，之后就半身不遂了。

collins.def: The strokes of a pen or brush are the movements or marks that you make with it when you are writing or painting.

example.ex: Fill in gaps by using short, upward strokes of the pencil.
example.tran: 用铅笔向上短短地勾画几道来填充空白。

collins.tran: 划水动作;划桨动作;(游泳或划船的)一次划水
collins.def: When you are swimming or rowing, your strokes are the repeated movements that you make with your arms or the oars.

example.ex: I turned and swam a few strokes further out to sea...
example.tran: 我转身向海里又游了几下。

example.ex: The boatmen accompany the stroke of their oars with the sound of their voices.
example.tran: 船夫们一边划桨一边喊号子。

collins.def: A swimming stroke is a particular style or method of swimming.

example.ex: She spent hours practising the breast stroke.
example.tran: 她花了数小时练习蛙泳。

collins.def: The strokes of a clock are the sounds that indicate each hour.

example.ex: On the stroke of 12, fireworks suddenly exploded into the night.
example.tran: 12 点的钟声刚敲响，焰火便在夜空中绽放。

collins.def: In sports such as tennis, baseball, cricket, and golf, a stroke is the action of hitting the ball.

example.ex: Compton was sending the ball here, there, and everywhere with each stroke.
example.tran: 康普顿一会将球打到这里，一会打到那里，每一拍的落点都不同。

collins.def: A stroke of luck or good fortune is something lucky that happens.

example.ex: It didn't rain, which turned out to be a stroke of luck.
example.tran: 天没下雨，结果成了件幸事。

collins.def: A stroke of genius or inspiration is a very good idea that someone suddenly has.

example.ex: At the time, his appointment seemed a stroke of genius.
example.tran: 当时，对他的任命犹如神来之笔。

collins.def: If something happens at a stroke or in one stroke, it happens suddenly and completely because of one single action.

example.ex: The disease wiped out 40 million rabbits at a stroke...
example.tran: 该疾病一下子就使 4,000 万只兔子丧命。

example.ex: How can Britain reduce its prison population in one stroke?
example.tran: 英国如何能一下子减少其监狱服刑人数?

collins.def: If someone does not do a stroke of work, they are very lazy and do no work at all.

example.ex: I never did a stroke of work at college.
example.tran: 我在上大学时懒得要命。

collins.def: A virus is a kind of germ that can cause disease.

example.ex: There are many different strains of flu virus.
example.tran: 流感病毒有很多不同类型。

example.ex: ...HIV, the virus believed to cause AIDS. HIV
example.tran: ，一种据信会引发艾滋病的病毒

collins.def: In computer technology, a virus is a program that introduces itself into a system, altering or destroying the information stored in the system.

example.ex: Hackers are said to have started a computer virus.
example.tran: 据说黑客们已经开始传播一种新的电脑病毒。

collins.def: If you await someone or something, you wait for them.

example.ex: Very little was said as we awaited the arrival of the chairman...
example.tran: 我们等候主席到来的时候都没怎么说话。

example.ex: He's awaiting trial, which is expected to begin early next year.
example.tran: 他在等候审判，预计明年初开始。

collins.tran: 即将发生于；将降临到…身上
collins.def: Something that awaits you is going to happen or come to you in the future.

example.ex: A nasty surprise awaited them in Rosemary Lane.
example.tran: 在罗斯玛丽巷，一起严重的意外事件正等待着他们。

collins.def: Agricultural means involving or relating to agriculture.

example.ex: ...agricultural land.
example.tran: 农田

example.ex: ...corn and other agricultural products.
example.tran: 玉米和其他农产品

collins.tran: （地区、社会）以农业为主的，农业高度发达的
collins.def: An agricultural place or society is one in which agriculture is important or highly developed.

example.ex: ...traditional agricultural societies.
example.tran: 传统的农耕社会

collins.def: Sudden means happening quickly and unexpectedly.

example.ex: He had been deeply affected by the sudden death of his father-in-law...
example.tran: 岳父的猝死使他十分伤心。

example.ex: 'I hope,' the stranger said, 'that the sudden change of venue did not inconvenience you.'...
example.tran: 那位陌生人说：“我希望突然改变地点不会给您带来不便。”

collins.def: If something happens all of a sudden, it happens quickly and unexpectedly.

example.ex: All of a sudden she didn't look sleepy any more.
example.tran: 她突然看起来一点都不困了。

collins.def: A client of a professional person or organization is a person or company that receives a service from them in return for payment.

example.ex: ...a solicitor and his client...
example.tran: 律师和他的委托人

example.ex: The company required clients to pay substantial fees in advance.
example.tran: 公司要求客户预付一大笔费用。

means: 古风，古希腊和古罗马艺术风格

collins.def: An antique is an old object such as a piece of china or furniture which is valuable because of its beauty or rarity.

example.ex: ...a genuine antique.
example.tran: 一件古董真品

example.ex: ...antique silver jewellery...
example.tran: 古董银首饰

collins.def: Fraud is the crime of gaining money or financial benefits by a trick or by lying.

example.ex: He was jailed for two years for fraud and deception...
example.tran: 他因为诈骗和欺诈入狱服刑两年。

example.ex: Tax frauds are dealt with by the Inland Revenue.
example.tran: 税务欺诈由国内税务局负责处理。

collins.tran: 骗子;诈骗者;骗人的东西
collins.def: A fraud is something or someone that deceives people in a way that is illegal or dishonest.

example.ex: Unfortunately the portraits were frauds...
example.tran: 不幸的是这些肖像都是骗人的。

example.ex: He believes many 'psychics' are frauds who rely on perception and subtle deception.
example.tran: 他认为许多“通灵者”都是骗子，他们都是靠直觉和巧妙的骗术蒙人。

collins.def: If you call someone or something a fraud, you are criticizing them because you think that they are not genuine, or are less good than they claim or appear to be.

example.ex: ...all those fashion frauds who think they are being original by raiding the tired old styles of the  '60s.
example.tran: 所有那些抄袭 60 年代的过时风格却自认为具有原创性的时尚造假者

means: 不常有的乐趣（或享受、优势）

collins.def: Luxury is very great comfort, especially among beautiful and expensive surroundings.

example.ex: By all accounts he leads a life of considerable luxury...
example.tran: 据说他的生活颇为奢侈。

example.ex: She was brought up in an atmosphere of luxury and wealth.
example.tran: 她在锦衣玉食的环境中长大。

collins.def: A luxury is something expensive which is not necessary but which gives you pleasure.

example.ex: A week by the sea is a luxury they can no longer afford...
example.tran: 到海边度假一周成了他们再也消费不起的一种奢侈。

example.ex: Telephones are still a luxury in some parts of Spain, Portugal, and Greece.
example.tran: 在西班牙、葡萄牙和希腊的一些地方，电话仍然是奢侈品。

collins.def: A luxury item is something expensive which is not necessary but which gives you pleasure.

example.ex: He could not afford luxury food on his pay...
example.tran: 靠自己的工资他买不起奢侈的食品。

example.ex: He rode on the president's luxury train through his own state.
example.tran: 他乘坐总统的豪华列车经过自己所在的州。

collins.tran: 不常有的乐趣；难得的享受
collins.def: A luxury is a pleasure which you do not often have the opportunity to enjoy.

example.ex: Hot baths are my favourite luxury...
example.tran: 泡个热水澡是我的最大乐事。

example.ex: We were going to have the luxury of a free weekend, to rest and do whatever we pleased.
example.tran: 我们将有一个难得空闲的周末，可以休息，还可以高兴干什么就干什么。

collins.tran: （尤指报纸头版的）标题，大字标题
collins.def: A headline is the title of a newspaper story, printed in large letters at the top of the story, especially on the front page.

example.ex: The Daily Mail has the headline 'The Voice of Conscience'...
example.tran: 《每日邮报》的头版标题为“良知的声音”。

example.ex: I'm sick of reading headlines involving the Kennedys in sex scandals.
example.tran: 关于肯尼迪家族性丑闻的新闻标题都让我读得腻烦了。

collins.tran: （广播或电视里的）新闻提要，简明新闻
collins.def: The headlines are the main points of the news which are read on radio or television.

example.ex: I'm Claudia Polley with the news headlines.
example.tran: 我是克劳迪娅·波利，下面是新闻提要。

collins.def: If a newspaper or magazine article is headlined a particular thing, that is the headline that introduces it.

example.ex: The article was headlined 'Tell us the truth'.
example.tran: 文章题为“告诉我们真相”。

collins.def: If someone headlines a show, they are the main performer in it.

example.ex: Sir Cliff Richard headlined the event.
example.tran: 克利夫·理查德爵士担任本次活动的主角。

collins.def: Someone or something that hits the headlines or grabs the headlines gets a lot of publicity from the media.

example.ex: El Salvador first hit the world headlines at the beginning of the 1980s...
example.tran: 萨尔瓦多在20世纪80年代初首次成为世人关注的新闻焦点。

example.ex: In sport, it's usually men who grab the headlines.
example.tran: 在体育方面，新闻人物通常是男性。

collins.tran: 职位（或地位）较低的；年资较浅的
collins.def: A junior official or employee holds a low-ranking position in an organization or profession.

example.ex: Junior and middle-ranking civil servants have pledged to join the indefinite strike.
example.tran: 基层和中层公务员已承诺要加入到无限期罢工中来。

example.ex: ...a junior minister attached to the prime minister's office.
example.tran: 在总理公署任职的助理部长

collins.def: If you are someone's junior, you are younger than they are.

example.ex: She now lives with actor Denis Lawson, 10 years her junior.
example.tran: 她现在与比她小10岁的演员丹尼斯·劳森同居。

collins.tran: 小（用于男子名后以区别于家族中同名的长辈，缩略形式为Jr）
collins.def: Junior is sometimes used after the name of the younger of two men in a family who have the same name, sometimes in order to prevent confusion. The abbreviation Jr is also used.

example.ex: His son, Arthur Ochs Junior, is expected to succeed him as publisher.
example.tran: 他的儿子，小阿瑟·奥克斯，有望子承父业继续从事出版。

collins.tran: （美国高中或大学的）三年级学生
collins.def: In the United States, a student in the third year of a high school or university course is called a junior.

example.ex: Their youngest daughter Amy's a junior at the University of Evansville in Indiana...
example.tran: 他们的小女儿埃米是印第安纳州埃文斯维尔大学三年级的学生。

example.ex: It was the summer before his junior year in high school.
example.tran: 那是他升入高三前的那个夏天。

collins.def: A spark is a tiny bright piece of burning material that flies up from something that is  burning.

example.ex: The fire gradually got bigger and bigger. Sparks flew off in all directions.
example.tran: 火越燃越烈，火星四溅。

collins.def: A spark is a flash of light caused by electricity. It often makes a loud sound.

example.ex: He passed an electric spark through a mixture of gases.
example.tran: 他让一束电火花穿过了一团混合气体。

collins.def: If something sparks, sparks of fire or light come from it.

example.ex: The wires were sparking above me...
example.tran: 电线在我头顶上方冒着火花。

example.ex: I stared into the flames of the fire as it sparked to life.
example.tran: 火光在闪烁，我注视着熊熊燃烧的烈焰。

collins.def: If a burning object or electricity sparks a fire, it causes a fire.

example.ex: A dropped cigarette may have sparked the fire.
example.tran: 可能是丢弃的烟头导致了这场大火。

collins.def: A spark of a quality or feeling, especially a desirable one, is a small but noticeable amount of it.

example.ex: His music lacked that vital spark of imagination...
example.tran: 他的音乐缺少非常关键的那一点灵感。

example.ex: Even Oliver felt a tiny spark of excitement.
example.tran: 连奥利弗都感到一丝兴奋。

collins.def: If one thing sparks another, the first thing causes the second thing to start happening.

example.ex: What was it that sparked your interest in motoring?
example.tran: 是什么让你对开车产生了兴趣？

example.ex: The proposals are expected to spark heated debate.
example.tran: 这些提议估计会引起激烈的争论。

collins.def: If sparks fly between people, they discuss something in an excited or angry way.

example.ex: They are not afraid to tackle the issues or let the sparks fly when necessary.
example.tran: 他们不怕应对这些问题，也不怕必要时来一番激烈的争论。

collins.tran: 演员（单数形式的actor通常指男演员，但有些女演员喜欢被称为actor而不是actress)
collins.def: An actor is someone whose job is acting in plays or films. 'Actor' in the singular usually refers to a man, but some women who act prefer to be called 'actors' rather than 'actresses'.

example.ex: His father was an actor in the Cantonese Opera Company...
example.tran: 他的父亲是粤剧团的演员。

example.ex: You have to be a very good actor to play that part.
example.tran: 要想演那个角色，你必须是个非常出色的演员。

means: 当（尤指船上的）工作人员
当（尤指船上的）工作人员

collins.tran: (飞机、轮船、飞船等上的)全体工作人员
collins.def: The crew of a ship, an aircraft, or a spacecraft is the people who work on and operate it.

example.ex: The mission for the crew of the space shuttle Endeavour is essentially over...
example.tran: “奋进号”航天飞机上全体机组人员的任务基本上已经完成了。

example.ex: Despite their size, these vessels carry small crews, usually of around twenty men...
example.tran: 这些船虽然体积庞大，但能够承载的船员却很少，通常为20人左右。

collins.tran: (有专门技术的)一组工作人员
collins.def: A crew is a group of people with special technical skills who work together on a task or project.

example.ex: ...a two-man film crew making a documentary...
example.tran: 由两人组成的纪录片摄制组

example.ex: A paramedic ambulance crew went to the accident scene but were unable to save Mrs Wilson.
example.tran: 一组急救护理人员赶到事故现场，但没能救活威尔逊太太。

collins.def: If you crew a boat, you work on it as part of the crew.

example.ex: She was already a keen and experienced sailor, having crewed in both Merlin and Grayling...
example.tran: 在“默林”号和“格雷林”号上工作过以后，她已经是一名头脑敏捷、经验丰富的水手了。

example.ex: There were to be five teams of three crewing the boat.
example.tran: 该船上将有5组工作人员，每组3人。

collins.def: You can use crew to refer to a group of people you disapprove of.

example.ex: ...the motley crew of failed and aspiring actors who comprised the 'distinguished guests'...
example.tran: “贵宾”由一群形形色色的演员组成，有的郁郁不得志，有的胸怀抱负

example.ex: This crew of killers and life-wreckers are headed by the mad but cunning Nino Brown.
example.tran: 这个残害生命的杀人团伙以疯狂而狡猾的尼诺·布朗为首。

collins.def: Something that stretches over an area or distance covers or exists in the whole of that area or distance.

example.ex: The procession stretched for several miles...
example.tran: 游行队伍长达数英里。

example.ex: He had burns that stretched from his neck to his hips.
example.tran: 他从脖子到臀部均被烧伤。

collins.def: A stretch of road, water, or land is a length or area of it.

example.ex: It's a very dangerous stretch of road...
example.tran: 这是一段非常危险的路。

example.ex: This stretch of Lost River was broader and deeper.
example.tran: 洛斯特里弗的这片水域又宽又深。

collins.def: When you stretch, you put your arms or legs out straight and tighten your muscles.

example.ex: He yawned and stretched...
example.tran: 他打了个呵欠，伸了伸懒腰。

example.ex: Try stretching your legs and pulling your toes upwards...
example.tran: 试着双腿伸直并且向上拉伸脚趾。

collins.def: A stretch of time is a period of time.

example.ex: He was fluent in French, having spent stretches of time in Southern France.
example.tran: 他曾在法国南部呆过一段时间，法语流利。

example.ex: ...after an 18-month stretch in the army...
example.tran: 在部队生活了 18 个月后

collins.def: If an event or activity stretches or is stretched into a further period of time, it continues into that period, which is later than expected.

example.ex: ...as anti-abortion protests stretched into their second week...
example.tran: 随着反堕胎抗议进入第二周

example.ex: The talks could be stretched into the summer of 1993.
example.tran: 该谈判可能会延续至 1993 年夏天。

collins.tran: (从一个时间)持续(至另一个时间)
collins.def: If something stretches from one time to another, it begins at the first time and ends at the second, which is longer than expected.

example.ex: ...a working day that stretches from seven in the morning to eight at night.
example.tran: 从早上 7 点持续到晚上 8 点的工作日

collins.def: If a group of things stretch from one type of thing to another, the group includes a wide range of things.

example.ex: ...a trading empire, with interests that stretched from chemicals to sugar.
example.tran: 从化学制品到食糖均有涉足的贸易帝国

collins.def: When something soft or elastic stretches or is stretched, it becomes longer or bigger as well as thinner, usually because it is pulled.

example.ex: The cables are designed not to stretch...
example.tran: 该电缆不能拉伸。

example.ex: Ease the pastry into the corners of the tin, making sure you don't stretch it.
example.tran: 将油酥面团小心地移至烤盘的各角，注意不要把它拉长。

collins.def: Stretch fabric is soft and elastic and stretches easily.

example.ex: ...stretch fabrics such as Lycra.
example.tran: 莱卡等有弹性的织物

example.ex: ...stretch cotton swimsuits.
example.tran: 弹力棉制泳衣

collins.def: If you stretch an amount of something or if it stretches, you make it last longer than it usually would by being careful and not wasting any of it.

example.ex: They're used to stretching their budgets...
example.tran: 他们习惯于精打细算。

example.ex: During his senior year his earnings stretched far enough to buy an old car.
example.tran: 他上年纪时省下的收入足够买一辆旧车了。

collins.tran: 刚能够节约下来(或支付)
collins.def: If your resources can stretch to something, you can just afford to do it.

example.ex: She suggested to me that I might like to start regular savings and I said Well, I don't know whether I can stretch to that.
example.tran: 她建议我可以开始定期存钱，我说我还不知道钱是不是够花呢。

collins.def: If something stretches your money or resources, it uses them up so you have hardly enough for your needs.

example.ex: The drought there is stretching American resources...
example.tran: 那里的旱灾正在耗尽美国的财力物力。

example.ex: Public expenditure was being stretched to the limit by having to support 3 million unemployed people.
example.tran: 因为要救济 300 万失业人口，公共支出即将被耗尽。

collins.tran: 使竭尽所能;使全力以赴;使拿出全部本领
collins.def: If you say that a job or task stretches you, you mean that you like it because it makes you work hard and use all your energy and skills so that you do not become bored or achieve less than you should.

example.ex: I'm trying to move on and stretch myself with something different...
example.tran: 我正想换工作，想尝试点不一样的事情来挑战一下自己。

example.ex: They criticised the quality of teaching, claiming pupils were not stretched enough.
example.tran: 他们批评教学质量太差，声称没有使学生们发挥出潜质。

collins.tran: (通常指为够到某东西而)尽量伸长手臂
collins.def: If you are at full stretch, your arm is straight and extended as far as possible, usually because you are trying to reach something that is almost too far away.

example.ex: He offered his lighter at full stretch.
example.tran: 他伸长胳膊把打火机递了过去。

collins.def: If you are at full stretch, you are using the maximum amount of effort or energy.

example.ex: Everyone would be working at full stretch.
example.tran: 每个人都将全力以赴。

collins.tran: 任凭怎么想也(不);再怎么说也(不)
collins.def: If you say that something is not true or possible by any stretch of the imagination, you are emphasizing that it is completely untrue or absolutely impossible.

example.ex: Her husband was not a womaniser by any stretch of the imagination...
example.tran: 她老公绝对不是个拈花惹草的人。

example.ex: By no stretch of the imagination could his speech be described as impersonal.
example.tran: 他的演讲再怎么说也不缺乏人情味。

collins.tran: (久坐之后)散散步，活动活动腿脚
collins.def: If you stretch your legs, you go for a short walk, usually after you have been sitting down for a long time.

example.ex: I stopped at the square and got out to stretch my legs.
example.tran: 我在广场处停下来，下车活动活动腿脚。

collins.tran: 牵强附会;勉强说得过去
collins.def: If you stretch a point, you describe something in a way which is not accurate, although it may be partly true.

example.ex: It is stretching a point to call this censorship.
example.tran: 把这称为审查有点儿牵强。

collins.def: Planning is the process of deciding in detail how to do something before you actually start to do it.

example.ex: The trip needs careful planning...
example.tran: 这趟行程需要周密计划。

example.ex: The new system is still in the planning stages.
example.tran: 新体系仍处于规划阶段。

collins.def: Planning is control by the local government of the way that land is used in an area and of what new buildings are built there.

example.ex: ...a masterpiece of 18th-century town planning...
example.tran: 18世纪城镇规划的杰作

example.ex: He supported the planning authority in refusing the application because of pressures on the Green Belt.
example.tran: 他支持城镇规划部门拒绝该项申请，因为这会给绿化带带来损害。

collins.def: Someone or something that is tall has a greater height than is normal or average.

example.ex: Being tall can make you feel incredibly self-confident...
example.tran: 个子高会使你感觉极其自信。

example.ex: She was a young woman, fairly tall and fairly slim...
example.tran: 她是个身材修长的年轻女子。

collins.def: You use tall to ask or talk about the height of someone or something.

example.ex: How tall are you?...
example.tran: 你多高？

example.ex: I'm only 5ft tall, and I look younger than my age...
example.tran: 我才 5 英尺高，显得比实际年龄小。

collins.tran: 难办的事情;棘手的问题
collins.def: If something is a tall order, it is very difficult.

example.ex: Financing your studies may seem like a tall order, but there is plenty of help available.
example.tran: 学费的筹措可能看似一个大难题，好在你可以获得许多帮助。

collins.def: If you say that someone walks tall, you mean that they behave in a way that shows that they have pride in themselves and in what they are doing.

means: 射中接近靶心部分的一发

collins.def: The inner parts of something are the parts which are contained or are enclosed inside the other parts, and which are closest to the centre.

example.ex: She got up and went into an inner office...
example.tran: 她起身进了里间办公室。

example.ex: Wade stepped inside and closed the inner door behind him.
example.tran: 韦德走进去，随手带上了里面的门。

collins.def: Your inner feelings are feelings which you have but do not show to other people.

example.ex: Loving relationships will give a child an inner sense of security...
example.tran: 亲昵关系会给予孩子内心一种安全感。

example.ex: Michael needed to express his inner tensions.
example.tran: 迈克尔需要宣泄一下他内心的紧张。

means: 集中起来的，经过浓缩的

collins.def: If you concentrate on something, or concentrate your mind on it, you give all your attention to it.

example.ex: It was up to him to concentrate on his studies and make something of himself...
example.tran: 是否能专心学习并取得一定成就要靠他自己。

example.ex: Water companies should concentrate on reducing waste instead of building new reservoirs...
example.tran: 自来水公司应该集中精力减少水浪费，而不是修建新水库。

collins.def: If something is concentrated in an area, it is all there rather than being spread around.

example.ex: Italy's industrial districts are concentrated in its north-central and north-eastern regions...
example.tran: 意大利的工业区集中在该国中北部和东北部地区。

example.ex: Most development has been concentrated in and around cities.
example.tran: 土地开发主要集中在城市及周边地区。

collins.def: Concentrate is a liquid or substance from which water has been removed in order to make it stronger, or to make it easier to store.

example.ex: ...orange juice made from concentrate.
example.tran: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

collins.def: If you say that an unpleasant fact or situation concentrates someone's mind, you mean that it makes them think clearly, because they are aware of the serious consequences if they do not.

example.ex: A term in prison will concentrate his mind wonderfully.
example.tran: 一想到要被判刑，他的头脑就会变得非常清醒。

collins.def: The Bible is the holy book on which the Jewish and Christian religions are based.
A Bible is a copy of the Bible.
If someone describes a book or magazine about their job or interest as their bible, they mean that it is the best and most useful book about the subject.

example.ex: ...the photographer's bible — Amateur Photographer.
example.tran: 摄影师的宝典——《业余摄影师》

collins.def: If you have an understanding of something, you know how it works or know what it means.

example.ex: They have to have a basic understanding of computers in order to use the advanced technology.
example.tran: 要想利用先进技术，他们必须先对计算机有个基本的了解。

collins.tran: 能谅解的；宽容的；通情达理的
collins.def: If you are understanding towards someone, you are kind and forgiving.

example.ex: Her boss, who was very understanding, gave her time off...
example.tran: 她的老板很通情达理，准了她的假。

example.ex: Fortunately for John, he had an understanding wife.
example.tran: 幸运的是，约翰有一个通情达理的妻子。

collins.def: If you show understanding, you show that you realize how someone feels or why they did something, and are not hostile towards them.

example.ex: We would like to thank them for their patience and understanding.
example.tran: 我们要感谢他们的耐心和理解。

collins.def: If there is understanding between people, they are friendly towards each other and trust each other.

example.ex: There was complete understanding between Wilson and myself.
example.tran: 我和威尔逊之间完全能够彼此理解，相互信任。

collins.def: An understanding is an informal agreement about something.

example.ex: We had not set a date for marriage but there was an understanding between us.
example.tran: 我们还没有确定结婚的日子，不过我们对此有一致的想法。

collins.def: If you say that it is your understanding that something is the case, you mean that you believe it to be the case because you have heard or read that it is.

example.ex: It is my understanding that this torture has been going on for many years...
example.tran: 据我了解，这种折磨已经持续很多年了。

example.ex: Our understanding is that they wanted to be in Washington.
example.tran: 我们的理解是，他们想呆在华盛顿。

collins.def: If you agree to do something on the understanding that something else will be done, you do it because you have been told that the other thing will definitely be done.

example.ex: Kevin had treatment on the understanding that he would attempt to overcome his drinking problem.
example.tran: 凯文接受了治疗，但条件是他要努力克服自身的酗酒问题。

collins.def: An initiative is an important act or statement that is intended to solve a problem.

example.ex: Government initiatives to help young people have been inadequate...
example.tran: 政府在积极帮助年轻人方面做得还不够。

example.ex: There's talk of a new peace initiative.
example.tran: 传闻有可能提出新的和平倡议。

collins.def: In a fight or contest, if you have the initiative, you are in a better position than your opponents to decide what to do next.

example.ex: We have the initiative; we intend to keep it...
example.tran: 我们拥有主动权;我们不打算放弃它。

example.ex: He paused enough to consider the options but never so long as to lose the initiative.
example.tran: 他停顿了一会儿权衡自己有哪些选项,但并没有久到丧失主动权。

collins.def: If you have initiative, you have the ability to decide what to do next and to do it, without needing other people to tell you what to do.

example.ex: She was disappointed by his lack of initiative.
example.tran: 她对他缺少进取心感到失望。

example.ex: ...workers who are able to sort out problems on their own initiative.
example.tran: 能主动解决问题的工人

collins.tran: 采取主动;首先采取行动
collins.def: If you take the initiative in a situation, you are the first person to act, and are therefore able to control the situation.

example.ex: We must take the initiative in the struggle to end the war...
example.tran: 为尽早结束战争,我们必须抢先行动。

example.ex: She knew she had to take the initiative and maintain an aggressive game throughout.
example.tran: 她知道自己必须采取主动，并且始终保持咄咄逼人的态势。

collins.def: Strategic means relating to the most important, general aspects of something such as a military operation or political policy, especially when these are decided in advance.

example.ex: ...the new strategic thinking which NATO leaders produced at the recent London summit...
example.tran: 北约领导人在最近召开的伦敦首脑会议上提出的新的战略思想

example.ex: ...a strategic plan for reducing the rate of infant mortality...
example.tran: 降低婴儿死亡率的战略计划

collins.def: Strategic weapons are very powerful missiles that can be fired only after a decision to use them has been made by a political leader.

example.ex: ...strategic nuclear weapons.
example.tran: 战略性核武器

collins.tran: (位置)具有战略意义的，重要的，合适的
collins.def: If you put something in a strategic position, you place it cleverly in a position where it will be most useful or have the most effect.

example.ex: ...the marble benches Eve had placed at strategic points throughout the gardens, where the views were spectacular.
example.tran: 伊芙在各花园景色迷人的地方巧妙安置的大理石长凳

collins.def: Wealth is the possession of a large amount of money, property, or other valuable things. You can also refer to a particular person's money or property as their wealth .

example.ex: Economic reform has brought relative wealth to peasant farmers...
example.tran: 经济改革给农民带来了相对的财富。

example.ex: His own wealth grew.
example.tran: 他的个人财富在增长。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something has a wealth of good qualities or things, you are emphasizing that they have a very large number or amount of them.

example.ex: ...such a wealth of creative expertise...
example.tran: 如此丰富的创造性专门技能

example.ex: The city boasts a wealth of beautiful churches.
example.tran: 这座城市拥有众多美丽的教堂。

collins.def: If you abandon a place, thing, or person, you leave the place, thing, or person permanently or for a long time, especially when you should not do so.

example.ex: He claimed that his parents had abandoned him...
example.tran: 他声称父母遗弃了他。

example.ex: The road is strewn with abandoned vehicles.
example.tran: 道路上满是弃置的车辆。

collins.tran: 中途放弃，中止（活动、工作等）
collins.def: If you abandon an activity or piece of work, you stop doing it before it is finished.

example.ex: The authorities have abandoned any attempt to distribute food...
example.tran: 当局中止了分发食物的尝试。

example.ex: The scheme's investors, fearful of bankruptcy, decided to abandon the project.
example.tran: 因为担心破产，该计划的投资者决定放弃这个项目。

collins.def: If you abandon an idea or way of thinking, you stop having that idea or thinking in that way.

example.ex: Logic had prevailed and he had abandoned the idea.
example.tran: 最终理智占了上风，他打消了那个念头。

collins.def: If you abandon yourself to an emotion, you think about it a lot and feel it strongly, especially when other people might think you are wrong to do so.

example.ex: We are scared to abandon ourselves to our feelings in case we seem weak or out of control.
example.tran: 我们不敢放纵自己的情感，以免显得太过软弱或缺乏自制。

collins.def: If you say that someone does something with abandon, you mean that they behave in a wild, uncontrolled way and do not think or care about how they should behave.

example.ex: He has spent money with gay abandon...
example.tran: 他肆意挥霍钱财。

example.ex: Their permissiveness toward their children reflects the wild abandon of their own lives.
example.tran: 他们对孩子的放任折射出他们自身生活的放浪形骸。

collins.def: If people abandon ship, they get off a ship because it is sinking.

example.ex: The officers and crew prepared to abandon ship in an orderly fashion.
example.tran: 全体船员秩序井然地准备弃船。

collins.def: A lesson is a fixed period of time when people are taught about a particular subject or taught how to do something.

example.ex: It would be his last French lesson for months...
example.tran: 这将是他以后几个月里的最后一堂法语课。

example.ex: Johanna took piano lessons.
example.tran: 约翰娜上了钢琴课。

collins.def: You use lesson to refer to an experience which acts as a warning to you or an example from which you should learn.

example.ex: There's still one lesson to be learned from the crisis—we all need to better understand the thinking of the other side.
example.tran: 从这次危机中我们还可以吸取一个教训——我们都需要更好地了解对方的想法。

collins.def: In a church service, the lesson is a short piece of text which is read aloud from the bible.

example.ex: The Rev. Nicola Judd read the lesson.
example.tran: 尼古拉·贾德牧师选读了经文。

means: 保护人，培养者，养成所，发祥地
[植]保护树，[虫]保护虫，保育虫，[动]世代交替的无性期的个体

collins.def: A nurse is a person whose job is to care for people who are ill.

example.ex: She had spent 29 years as a nurse...
example.tran: 她做了29年的护士。

example.ex: Patients were dying because of an acute shortage of nurses.
example.tran: 因为护理人员严重不足，患者生命垂危。

collins.def: If you nurse someone, you care for them when they are ill.

example.ex: All the years he was sick my mother had nursed him...
example.tran: 他生病的这些年来，我妈妈一直照料着他。

example.ex: She rushed home to nurse her daughter back to health.
example.tran: 她赶回家去，要照顾女儿恢复健康。

collins.def: If you nurse an illness or injury, you allow it to get better by resting as much as possible.

example.ex: We're going to go home and nurse our colds.
example.tran: 我们打算回家调养感冒。

collins.tran: 怀有，抱有(强烈的希望、愿望等)
collins.def: If you nurse an emotion or desire, you feel it strongly for a long time.

example.ex: Jane still nurses the pain of rejection...
example.tran: 简仍因遭到拒绝而痛苦。

example.ex: He had nursed an ambition to lead his own big orchestra.
example.tran: 他一直有一个梦想，希望能指挥一支自己的顶级管弦乐队。

collins.def: A nurse is a person who is trained to look after young children.

example.ex: Every morning she got up early with the children and the nurse.
example.tran: 每天早晨，她和孩子、保姆一起早早起床。

collins.def: When a baby nurses or when its mother nurses it, it feeds by sucking milk from its mother's breast.

example.ex: Most authorities recommend letting the baby nurse whenever it wants.
example.tran: 大部分权威人士建议婴儿饿了就随时喂奶。

example.ex: ...young women nursing babies...
example.tran: 给孩子喂奶的年轻妈妈

collins.def: The welfare of a person or group is their health, comfort, and happiness.

example.ex: I do not think he is considering Emma's welfare...
example.tran: 我认为他没有考虑到埃玛的幸福。

example.ex: He was the head of a charity for the welfare of children.
example.tran: 他是一个儿童福利慈善机构的负责人。

collins.def: Welfare services are provided to help with people's living conditions and financial problems.

example.ex: Child welfare services are well established and comprehensive...
example.tran: 儿童福利机构发展成熟，体系完善。

example.ex: He has urged complete reform of the welfare system.
example.tran: 他极力主张对福利制度进行彻底改革。

collins.def: In the United States, welfare is money that is paid by the government to people who are unemployed, poor, or sick.

example.ex: States such as Michigan and Massachusetts are making deep cuts in welfare...
example.tran: 诸如密歇根和马萨诸塞等州正在大幅削减社会保障金。

example.ex: If she does find a job through the training program she may have less money than now when she's on welfare.
example.tran: 如果她在培训后真的找到份工作，那她的收入可能还不如她现在领的社会保障金多。

means: 诉讼程序，（议会的）议事程序

collins.def: A procedure is a way of doing something, especially the usual or correct way.

example.ex: A biopsy is usually a minor surgical procedure...
example.tran: 活组织检查通常是一个很小的外科手术。

example.ex: Police insist that Michael did not follow the correct procedure in applying for a visa...
example.tran: 警方坚持称迈克尔没有按照正确的程序申请签证。

collins.tran: (尤指挂在墙上展示的)画框，镜框
collins.def: The frame of a picture or mirror is the wood, metal, or plastic that is fitted around it, especially when it is displayed or hung on a wall.

example.ex: Estelle kept a photograph of her mother in a silver frame on the kitchen mantelpiece.
example.tran: 埃丝特尔把母亲的一张镶银框的照片挂在厨房壁炉台上。

example.ex: ...a pair of picture frames.
example.tran: 一对画框

collins.def: The frame of an object such as a building, chair, or window is the arrangement of wooden, metal, or plastic bars between which other material is fitted, and which give the object its strength and shape.

example.ex: He supplied housebuilders with modern timber frames...
example.tran: 他给房屋建筑商提供了现代的木构架。

example.ex: With difficulty he released the mattress from the metal frame, and groped beneath it...
example.tran: 他费了很大力气才把床垫从金属架上移开，然后在下面摸索。

collins.def: The frames of a pair of glasses are all the metal or plastic parts of it, but not the lenses.

example.ex: He was wearing new spectacles with gold wire frames.
example.tran: 他戴了一副新的金边眼镜。

collins.def: You can refer to someone's body as their frame, especially when you are describing the general shape of their body.

example.ex: Their belts are pulled tight against their bony frames.
example.tran: 他们的腰带紧紧裹着瘦骨嶙峋的身体。

collins.def: A frame of cinema film is one of the many separate photographs that it consists of.

example.ex: Standard 8mm projects at 16 frames per second.
example.tran: 标准的 8 毫米的胶片每秒放映16 组镜头。

collins.def: A frame building is one in which pieces of wood form the most important part of the structure, rather than bricks or stone.

example.ex: He lives in a white-painted frame house behind a picket fence up in Connecticut.
example.tran: 他住在康涅狄格州北部一个漆成白色的木制房子里，屋子前面竖着尖桩篱栅。

collins.def: When a picture or photograph is framed, it is put in a frame.

example.ex: The picture is now ready to be mounted and framed...
example.tran: 这幅画现在可以装裱加框了。

example.ex: On the wall is a large framed photograph.
example.tran: 墙上挂着一张大幅的镶框照片。

collins.def: If an object is framed by a particular thing, it is surrounded by that thing in a way that makes the object more striking or attractive to look at.

example.ex: The swimming pool is framed by tropical gardens...
example.tran: 泳池周围都是栽种热带花卉的花园。

example.ex: An elegant occasional table is framed in the window.
example.tran: 一张雅致的供重大活动使用的餐桌被摆放在橱窗里。

collins.tran: 创设，拟定，制定(规则、计划或体系)
collins.def: If someone frames something such as a set of rules, a plan, or a system, they create and develop it.

example.ex: After the war, a convention was set up to frame a constitution.
example.tran: 战后，为制定宪法组织了一次会议。

collins.def: If someone frames something in a particular style or kind of language, they express it in that way.

example.ex: The story is framed in a format that is part thriller, part love story...
example.tran: 情节的展开模式既像惊险小说，又像爱情故事。

example.ex: He framed this question three different ways in search of an answer.
example.tran: 为了寻求答案，他以 3 种不同方式提出了这个问题。

collins.def: If someone frames an innocent person, they make other people think that that person is guilty of a crime, by lying or inventing evidence.

example.ex: I need to find out who tried to frame me...
example.tran: 我得找出是谁企图诬陷我。

example.ex: He claimed that he had been framed by the police.
example.tran: 他声称自己被警察设计陷害了。

collins.tran: 在…考虑范围内;有机会成为…
collins.def: If someone is in the frame for something such as a job or position, they are being considered for it.

example.ex: We need a win to keep us in the frame for the title.
example.tran: 要想保住夺冠希望，我们还需要再赢一场比赛。

means: [常作复数]（人生事件中的）时运

collins.def: You can refer to a large sum of money as a fortune or a small fortune to emphasize how large it is.

example.ex: We had to eat out all the time. It ended up costing a fortune...
example.tran: 我们不得不总在外面吃饭，结果花了很多钱。

example.ex: He made a small fortune in the London property boom.
example.tran: 他在伦敦房产升温的时候发了一笔小财。

collins.def: Someone who has a fortune has a very large amount of money.

example.ex: He made his fortune in car sales...
example.tran: 他靠卖车发了财。

example.ex: Having spent his rich wife's fortune, the Major ended up in a debtors' prison.
example.tran: 花光了他有钱老婆的财产之后，这位少校最后被关进了债务人监狱。

collins.def: Fortune or good fortune is good luck. Ill fortune is bad luck.

example.ex: Government ministers are starting to wonder how long their good fortune can last.
example.tran: 政府部长们开始怀疑他们的好运还能够持续多久。

collins.def: If you talk about someone's fortunes or the fortunes of something, you are talking about the extent to which they are doing well or being successful.

example.ex: The electoral fortunes of the Liberal Democratic party may decline...
example.tran: 自由民主党的选举运势可能会下降。

example.ex: She kept up with the fortunes of the Reeves family...
example.tran: 她一直关注着里夫斯家族的兴衰。

collins.def: If you talk about the way someone or something is treated by fortune, you are referring to the good or bad luck that they have.

example.ex: He is certainly being smiled on by fortune.
example.tran: 现在他一定是得到了命运的垂青。

collins.def: When someone tells your fortune, they tell you what they think will happen to you in the future, which they say is shown, for example, by the lines on your hand.

collins.tran: 关怀体贴的;关心照顾的；有同情心的
collins.def: If someone is caring, they are affectionate, helpful, and sympathetic.

example.ex: He is a lovely boy, very gentle and caring.
example.tran: 他是个可爱的男孩,非常温柔体贴。

example.ex: ...a loving, caring husband.
example.tran: 爱意绵绵、知冷知热的丈夫

collins.tran: (职业)护理的，关怀的，照顾他人的
collins.def: The caring professions are those such as nursing and social work that are involved with looking after people who are ill or who need help in coping with their lives.

example.ex: The course is also suitable for those in the caring professions.
example.tran: 本门课程同样适合护理业从业人士学习。

example.ex: ...the caring services.
example.tran: 护理服务

collins.def: If you appoint someone to a job or official position, you formally choose them for it.

example.ex: It made sense to appoint a banker to this job...
example.tran: 指派一位银行家做这份工作是明智之举。

example.ex: The commission appointed a special investigator to conduct its own inquiry...
example.tran: 委员会委派了一个特别调查员自行调查。

collins.def: If someone lives in a particular place or with a particular person, their home is in that place or with that person.

example.ex: She has lived here for 10 years...
example.tran: 她在这里住了10年了。

example.ex: She always said I ought to live alone...
example.tran: 她总说我应该一个人住。

collins.def: If you say that someone lives in particular circumstances or that they live a particular kind of life, you mean that they are in those circumstances or that they have that kind of life.

example.ex: We lived quite grandly...
example.tran: 我们生活得非常快乐。

example.ex: Compared to people living only a few generations ago, we have greater opportunities to have a good time...
example.tran: 比起上几辈人，我们有更多机会享受生活。

collins.def: If you say that someone lives for a particular thing, you mean that it is the most important thing in their life.

example.ex: He lived for his work.
example.tran: 他为工作而活。

collins.def: To live means to be alive. If someone lives to a particular age, they stay alive until they are that age.

example.ex: He's got a terrible disease and will not live long...
example.tran: 他已身患重疾，时日无多。

example.ex: A perennial is a plant that lives indefinitely...
example.tran: 多年生植物是指能存活很多年的植物。

collins.def: If people live by doing a particular activity, they get the money, food, or clothing they need by doing that activity.

example.ex: ...the last indigenous people to live by hunting...
example.tran: 最后一个狩猎为生的土著民族

example.ex: These crimes were committed largely by professional criminals who lived by crime.
example.tran: 这些罪案大都是由以犯罪为生的职业罪犯制造的。

collins.def: If you live by a particular rule, belief, or ideal, you behave in the way in which it says you should behave.

example.ex: They live by the principle that we are here to add what we can to life, not to get what we want from it.
example.tran: 他们恪守着这样的原则：我们来到世上是要为生活做贡献，而不是从中索取。

collins.def: If a person or occasion lives in someone's mind or in history, they are remembered for a long time.

example.ex: The memory of that will live with me for many years to come...
example.tran: 那个记忆将会伴随我多年。

example.ex: His name will live in history as one of the greatest bowlers of all time...
example.tran: 他将会作为史上最伟大的板球投手之一而留名青史。

collins.def: If you say that someone lives and breathes a particular subject or activity, you are emphasizing that they are extremely enthusiastic about it.

example.ex: He has lived and breathed polo since he was seven.
example.tran: 他从7岁开始就一直热衷于马球。

collins.def: If you tell someone that they haven't lived unless they experience a particular thing, you are telling them that thing is extremely good and should be experienced.

example.ex: If you have never been to an opera, you haven't  lived...
example.tran: 要是从来没看过歌剧，那就枉过此生了。

example.ex: You haven't lived until you've used their new micro system.
example.tran: 要是没用过他们新的微系统，这辈子就算白活了。

collins.def: You can use expressions such as to live in fear and to live in terror to indicate that someone is always thinking about an unpleasant or frightening event, because they think that it might happen.

example.ex: One in 10 Californians is unemployed and thousands more live in fear of losing their jobs.
example.tran: 十分之一的加利福尼亚人没有工作，还有数以千计的人成天提心吊胆地害怕失去工作。

collins.tran: 自己活也让别人活；互相宽容；互不干扰
collins.def: You say live and let live as a way of saying that you should let other people behave in the way that they want to and not criticize them for behaving differently from you.
If you live it up, you have a very enjoyable and exciting time, for example by going to lots of parties or going out drinking with friends.

example.ex: There is no reason why you couldn't live it up once in a while.
example.tran: 偶尔放纵一下也无妨。

collins.def: If you nod, you move your head downwards and upwards to show that you are answering 'yes' to a question, or to show agreement, understanding, or approval.

example.ex: 'Are you okay?' I asked. She nodded and smiled...
example.tran: “你没事吧?”我问她。她点点头，笑了。

example.ex: David said nothing, but simply nodded, as if understanding perfectly...
example.tran: 戴维什么都没说，只是点点头，好像完全理解了。

collins.def: If you nod in a particular direction, you bend your head once in that direction in order to indicate something or to give someone a signal.

example.ex: 'Does it work?' he asked, nodding at the piano...
example.tran: “它能用吗？”他边问边朝钢琴方向扬了下头。

example.ex: She nodded towards the drawing room. 'He's in there.'...
example.tran: 她朝客厅方向扬了扬头说：“他在那里面。”

collins.tran: (用于打招呼或告别)点头，点头招呼
collins.def: If you nod, you bend your head once, as a way of saying hello or goodbye.

example.ex: All the girls nodded and said 'Hi'...
example.tran: 所有的女孩都点头招呼道：“嗨!”

example.ex: Tom nodded a greeting but didn't  say anything...
example.tran: 汤姆点头致意，但什么都没说。

collins.def: In football, if a player nods the ball in a particular direction, they hit the ball there with their head.

example.ex: Taylor leapt up to nod the ball home...
example.tran: 泰勒跳起来头球破门。

example.ex: Brian McClair nodded in his twenty-third goal of the season.
example.tran: 布赖恩·麦克莱尔头球攻入了自己本赛季第23粒进球。

collins.def: If you give someone the nod, you give them permission to do something.

example.ex: 'Keep him outside till I give you the nod.'
example.tran: “没我同意，别让他进来。”

collins.tran: (建议)一致接受地，毫无异议地
collins.def: If a proposal is accepted on the nod, it is accepted without being questioned or argued about.

example.ex: He has always argued that the party cannot be seen to let the treaty through on the nod...
example.tran: 他一直争辩，不能眼看着该党让此条约毫无异议地通过。

example.ex: Big issues are going through on the nod.
example.tran: 重大议题将会一致通过。

collins.def: If there is a shortage of something, there is not enough of it.

example.ex: A shortage of funds is preventing the UN from monitoring relief...
example.tran: 资金短缺使联合国无法督导救援工作。

example.ex: Vietnam is suffering from food shortage...
example.tran: 越南正遭受食物短缺之苦。

collins.def: An inquiry is a question which you ask in order to get some information.

example.ex: He made some inquiries and discovered she had gone to the Continent...
example.tran: 他打听了一番，发现她已经去了欧陆。

example.ex: After a brief inquiry about the Christmas holiday, he returned to the subject of music.
example.tran: 简短地问了一下圣诞假期之后,他又回到了音乐的话题上。

collins.def: An inquiry is an official investigation.

example.ex: This is the most difficult and shocking murder inquiry I have had to open in the last 25 years...
example.tran: 这是 25 年来我所展开的最困难、最令人震惊的谋杀调查。

example.ex: The Democratic Party has called for an independent inquiry into the incident.
example.tran: 民主党要求对事件展开独立调查。

collins.def: Inquiry is the process of asking about or investigating something in order to find out more about it.

example.ex: The investigation has suddenly switched to a new line of inquiry.
example.tran: 调查突然转向了一条新的线索。

collins.def: If you say that someone is helping the police with their inquiries, you mean that the police are questioning them about a crime, but have not yet charged them with it.

example.ex: Two men were helping police with their inquiries at Salisbury last night.
example.tran: 两名男子昨天夜里在索尔兹伯里接受了警方盘问。

collins.def: If you invest in something, or if you invest a sum of money, you use your money in a way that you hope will increase its value, for example by paying it into a bank, or buying shares or property.

example.ex: They intend to invest directly in shares...
example.tran: 他们打算直接投资股票。

example.ex: He invested all our profits in gold shares...
example.tran: 他把我们所有的收益都投资在黄金股上了。

collins.def: When a government or organization invests in something, it gives or lends money for a purpose that it considers useful or profitable.

example.ex: ...the British government's failure to invest in an integrated transport system.
example.tran: 英国政府未能给综合交通系统的建设投入资金

example.ex: ...the European Investment Bank, which invested £100 million in Canary Wharf...
example.tran: 向卡纳里码头投资了1亿英镑的欧洲投资银行

collins.def: If you invest in something useful, you buy it, because it will help you to do something more efficiently or more cheaply.

example.ex: The company invested thousands in an electronic order-control system...
example.tran: 公司耗资数千购买了一套电子订单管理系统。

example.ex: The easiest way to make ice cream yourself is to invest in an ice cream machine.
example.tran: 自己制作冰激凌的最简单的办法就是买一台冰激凌机。

collins.def: If you invest time or energy in something, you spend a lot of time or energy on something that you consider to be useful or likely to be successful.

example.ex: I would rather invest time in Rebecca than in the kitchen.
example.tran: 我宁愿把时间花在丽贝卡身上也不愿花在厨房里。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is invested with a particular quality, you mean that they seem to have that quality.

example.ex: The buildings are invested with a nation's history...
example.tran: 这些建筑承载着一个国家的历史。

example.ex: A tsar was a living icon, invested with deep historical and religious significance.
example.tran: 沙皇曾是活着的圣像,具有深远的历史和宗教意义。

collins.def: To invest someone with rights or responsibilities means to give them those rights or responsibilities legally or officially.

example.ex: The constitution had invested him with certain powers.
example.tran: 宪法授予他某些权力。

means: 有创意的，创新的，创造的

collins.tran: (尤指在艺术方面)有创造力的，有想象力的
collins.def: A creative person has the ability to invent and develop original ideas, especially in the arts.

example.ex: Like so many creative people he was never satisfied.
example.tran: 像许多富于创造力的人一样，他从不满足。

example.ex: ...her obvious creative talents.
example.tran: 她显而易见的创作才能

collins.def: Creative activities involve the inventing and making of new kinds of things.

example.ex: ...creative writing...
example.tran: 创造性写作

example.ex: ...creative arts...
example.tran: 创作型艺术

collins.def: If you use something in a creative way, you use it in a new way that produces interesting and unusual results.

example.ex: ...his creative use of words.
example.tran: 他对词语的创造性运用

collins.def: A creative is someone whose job is to be creative, especially someone who creates advertisements.

example.ex: Along with scores of other advertising creatives, he will be taking part in an exhibition at the Saatchi gallery.
example.tran: 他将和许多广告创意人员一起参加在萨奇画廊举行的画展。

collins.tran: (通常指因位置改变而)消失,不见
collins.def: If you say that someone or something disappears, you mean that you can no longer see them, usually because you or they have changed position.

example.ex: The black car drove away from them and disappeared...
example.tran: 那辆黑色轿车驶离了他们的视线。

example.ex: Clive disappeared into a room by himself...
example.tran: 克莱夫独自一人进了屋。

collins.def: If someone or something disappears, they go away or are taken away somewhere where nobody can find them.

example.ex: ...a Japanese woman who disappeared thirteen years ago...
example.tran: 一个 13 年前失踪的日本女人

example.ex: Janet's husband and sister noticed that small kitchen objects were disappearing with increasing regularity.
example.tran: 珍妮特的丈夫和她的姐姐发现厨房里的小物件经常不翼而飞，而且次数愈发频繁。

collins.def: If something disappears, it stops existing or happening.

example.ex: The immediate security threat has disappeared.
example.tran: 直接的安全威胁已不复存在了。

collins.def: An immediate result, action, or reaction happens or is done without any delay.

example.ex: These tragic incidents have had an immediate effect...
example.tran: 这些悲剧性事件造成的后果即刻显现。

example.ex: My immediate reaction was just disgust.
example.tran: 我当时的第一反应就是反感。

collins.def: Immediate needs and concerns exist at the present time and must be dealt with quickly.

example.ex: Relief agencies say the immediate problem is not a lack of food, but transportation.
example.tran: 救援机构称最紧迫的问题不是食物匮乏,而是运输不畅。

collins.def: The immediate person or thing comes just before or just after another person or thing in a sequence.

example.ex: In the immediate aftermath of the riots, a mood of hope and reconciliation sprang up...
example.tran: 暴乱过后紧接着出现了期待未来与盼望和解的气氛。

example.ex: His immediate superior, General Geichenko, had singled him out for special mention.
example.tran: 他的直接上级盖琴科将军特别提到了他。

collins.def: You use immediate to describe an area or position that is next to or very near a particular place or person.

example.ex: Only a handful had returned to work in the immediate vicinity...
example.tran: 仅有几个人回到临近地区工作。

example.ex: I was seated at Sauter's immediate left.
example.tran: 我紧挨着索特左手边坐着。

collins.def: Your immediate family are the members of your family who are most closely related to you, for example your parents, children, brothers, and sisters.

example.ex: The presence of his immediate family is obviously having a calming effect on him.
example.tran: 他的直系亲属都在场,这显然起到了让他镇定的作用。

collins.def: Written is the past participle of write .
A written test or piece of work is one which involves writing rather than doing something practical or giving spoken answers.

example.ex: Learners may have to take a written exam before they pass their driving test...
example.tran: 学员在通过驾照考试前可能得参加笔试。

example.ex: Amy discovered that the theoretical and written work came easily to her.
example.tran: 埃米发现理论和笔头作业对她来说十分容易。

collins.tran: (协议、规定、法律等)成文的，书面的
collins.def: A written agreement, rule, or law has been officially written down.

example.ex: The newspaper broke a written agreement not to sell certain photographs...
example.tran: 这家报纸违反了不出售某些摄影作品的书面协议。

example.ex: We're waiting for written confirmation from the Americans.
example.tran: 我们在等美国人的书面确认。

collins.def: A witness to an event such as an accident or crime is a person who saw it.

example.ex: Witnesses to the crash say they saw an explosion just before the disaster...
example.tran: 空难目击者称，就在灾难发生之前他们看见飞机发生了爆炸。

example.ex: No witnesses have come forward.
example.tran: 没有目击证人站出来。

collins.def: If you witness something, you see it happen.

example.ex: Anyone who witnessed the attack should call the police...
example.tran: 目睹这次袭击的人都应向警方报告。

example.ex: It was the quickest swimming lesson I'd ever witnessed.
example.tran: 这是我所见过的最速成的游泳课。

collins.def: A witness is someone who appears in a court of law to say what they know about a crime or other event.

example.ex: In the next three or four days, eleven witnesses will be called to testify.
example.tran: 接下来的三四天里，将传唤11名证人出庭作证。

collins.def: A witness is someone who writes their name on a document that you have signed, to confirm that it really is your signature.

collins.tran: 为(文件的签署)作证;连署
collins.def: If someone witnesses your signature on a document, they write their name after it, to confirm that it really is your signature.

example.ex: Ask a friend to witness your signature.
example.tran: 请一位朋友给你的签名作证。

collins.def: If you say that a place, period of time, or person witnessed a particular event or change, you mean that it happened in that place, during that period of time, or while that person was alive.

example.ex: India has witnessed many political changes in recent years...
example.tran: 印度近年来经历了很多政治变动。

example.ex: The year 1886 witnessed the first extended translation into English of the writings of Eliphas Levi...
example.tran: 1886年，埃利法斯·莱维的作品第一次有了长篇英译本。

collins.def: You use witness to introduce an example of what you have just been talking about.

example.ex: Americans are a generous people: witness the increase in charitable giving, even during the recession.
example.tran: 美国人是个慷慨的民族：即使是在经济萧条时期，慈善捐赠也在不断增加，这便是明证。

collins.tran: 是…的见证人;是…的目击者
collins.def: If you are witness to something, you see it happen.

example.ex: Too often children are witness to a disturbing amount of violence.
example.tran: 孩子们经常会目睹暴力事件,其数量之多令人不安。

collins.def: If a person or thing bears witness to something, they show or say that it exists or happened.

example.ex: Many of these poems bear witness to his years spent in India and China...
example.tran: 这些诗中有很多见证了他在印度和中国度过的岁月。

example.ex: Many veterans believe it is their job to bear witness to the horrors of war that they personally experienced.
example.tran: 很多老兵认为他们有职责为他们亲身经历的战争的恐怖作证。

means: 问（某人）有没有胆量（做某事）

collins.def: If you do not dare to do something, you do not have enough courage to do it, or you do not want to do it because you fear the consequences. If you dare to do something, you do something which requires a lot of courage.

example.ex: Since he was stuck in a lift a year ago he hasn't dared to get back into one...
example.tran: 自从一年前被困在电梯里之后，他就再也没敢乘过电梯。

example.ex: Most people hate Harry but they don't dare to say so...
example.tran: 大多数人都对哈里敢怒不敢言。

collins.tran: 向…挑战;激…（做）；问…有没有胆量（做）
collins.def: If you dare someone to do something, you challenge them to prove that they are not frightened of doing it.

example.ex: Over coffee, she lit a cigarette, her eyes daring him to comment...
example.tran: 喝咖啡时，她点燃了一支烟，用挑衅的眼神看着他，谅他也不敢吭声。

example.ex: I dare you to sit through forty-five minutes with someone like Vincent!
example.tran: 我想你绝不敢和文森特这样的人一起坐上 45 分钟！

collins.def: A dare is a challenge which one person gives to another to do something dangerous or frightening.

example.ex: He'd do pretty much anything on a dare...
example.tran: 别人一激他，他就几乎什么事都做得出来。

example.ex: When found, the children said they'd run away for a dare.
example.tran: 找到这些孩子时，他们说自己是受了激将才出走的。

collins.def: If you say to someone 'don't you dare' do something, you are telling them not to do it and letting them know that you are angry.

example.ex: Don't speak to me like that. Don't you dare...
example.tran: 不要那样跟我讲话。我不允许！

example.ex: Allen, don't you dare go anywhere else, you hear?
example.tran: 艾伦，其他地方哪儿都不准去，听到了吗？

collins.tran: （表示震惊和愤怒) 你竟敢，你怎么敢
collins.def: You say 'how dare you'' when you are very shocked and angry about something that someone has done.

example.ex: How dare you pick up the phone and listen in on my conversations!...
example.tran: 你竟敢拿起电话偷听我的谈话！

example.ex: Suddenly the peace was destroyed by someone shouting, 'Get back! Go away! How dare you!'
example.tran: 突然平静被打破了，就听见有人在喊：“滚回去！滚开！大胆！”

collins.def: You use 'dare I say it' when you know that what you are going to say will disappoint or annoy someone.

example.ex: Politicians usually attract younger women, dare I say it, because of the status they have in society.
example.tran: 恕我直言，由于政客的社会地位，他们通常容易吸引一些年轻的女性。

collins.def: You can use 'I dare say' or 'I daresay' before or after a statement to indicate that you believe it is probably true.

example.ex: I dare say that the computer would provide a clear answer to that...
example.tran: 想必计算机能就其给出一个清楚的答案。

example.ex: People always think I'm a fool, and I dare say they're right...
example.tran: 人们总认为我是个傻瓜，想必他们是对的。

collins.def: Membership of an organization is the state of being a member of it.

example.ex: The country has also been granted membership of the World Trade Organisation...
example.tran: 这个国家也被准予加入世界贸易组织。

example.ex: He sent me a membership form...
example.tran: 他寄给我一份入会登记表。

collins.tran: 全体会员(或成员);全体会员(或成员)人数
collins.def: The membership of an organization is the people who belong to it, or the number of people who belong to it.

example.ex: The European Builders Confederation has a membership of over 350,000 building companies.
example.tran: 欧洲建筑商联合会拥有逾35万家建筑公司会员。

example.ex: ...organizations with huge memberships.
example.tran: 会员队伍庞大的组织

collins.def: Something that consists of particular things or people is formed from them.

example.ex: Breakfast consisted of porridge served with butter.
example.tran: 早餐是麦片粥配佐餐黄油。

example.ex: Her crew consisted of children from Devon and Cornwall.
example.tran: 她的团队由来自德文郡和康沃尔郡的孩子们组成。

collins.def: Something that consists in something else has that thing as its main or only part.

example.ex: His work as a consultant consisted in advising foreign companies on the siting of new factories.
example.tran: 作为一名顾问，他的工作是为外国公司在新厂选址问题上提供建议。

example.ex: ...Baudelaire's idea that genius consists in the ability to summon up childhood.
example.tran: 波德莱尔认为天才在于唤起童年的能力的观点

means: 调准（望远镜等），对准，校正，校准（机械等）

collins.tran: 改变（行为或观点）以适应;调节;习惯
collins.def: When you adjust to a new situation, you get used to it by changing your behaviour or your ideas.

example.ex: We have been preparing our fighters to adjust themselves to civil society...
example.tran: 我们一直在培训我们的战士，以使他们适应普通的社会生活。

example.ex: I felt I had adjusted to the idea of being a mother very well...
example.tran: 我感到自己已经完全接受了当妈妈的想法。

collins.def: If you adjust something, you change it so that it is more effective or appropriate.

example.ex: To attract investors, Panama has adjusted its tax and labour laws.
example.tran: 为吸引投资者，巴拿马调整了税法和劳动法。

collins.tran: 整理（衣服）；校正，校准（机器）
collins.def: If you adjust something such as your clothing or a machine, you correct or alter its position or setting.

example.ex: She adjusted her head scarf fussily...
example.tran: 她小题大做地整了整头巾。

example.ex: Liz adjusted her mirror and then edged the car out of its parking bay.
example.tran: 莉兹调了调后视镜，将车子挪出了停车位。

collins.def: If you adjust your vision or if your vision adjusts, the muscles of your eye or the pupils alter to cope with changes in light or distance.

example.ex: He stopped to try to adjust his vision to the faint starlight...
example.tran: 他停下脚步试着让眼睛适应微弱的星光。

example.ex: We stood in the doorway until our eyes adjusted...
example.tran: 我们站在门口直到眼睛适应了光线的变化。

collins.def: A merger is the joining together of two separate companies or organizations so that they become one.

example.ex: ...a merger between two of Britain's biggest trades unions.
example.tran: 英国两个最大的工会的合并

example.ex: ...the proposed merger of two Japanese banks.
example.tran: 合并两家日本银行的建议

collins.def: A yacht is a large boat with sails or a motor, used for racing or pleasure trips.

example.ex: His 36ft yacht sank suddenly last summer.
example.tran: 他那36英尺长的游艇去年夏天突然沉没了。

example.ex: ...a round-the-world yacht race.
example.tran: 环球帆船比赛

collins.tran: (尤用于讨论政治事务时)国家
collins.def: You can refer to countries as states, particularly when you are discussing politics.

example.ex: Mexico is a secular state and does not have diplomatic relations with the Vatican...
example.tran: 墨西哥是个世俗国家，和梵蒂冈没有外交关系。

example.ex: Some weeks ago I recommended to EU member states that we should have discussions with the Americans.
example.tran: 几周前，我曾向欧盟成员国提议我们应该和美国人进行磋商。

collins.def: Some large countries such as the USA are divided into smaller areas called states .

example.ex: Leaders of the Southern states are meeting in Louisville.
example.tran: 南部一些州的领导正在路易斯维尔开会。

collins.def: The USA is sometimes referred to as the States .
You can refer to the government of a country as the state .

example.ex: The state does not collect enough revenue to cover its expenditure...
example.tran: 该国政府入不敷出。

example.ex: Eastern Europe shows that worker-owned factories can be as inefficient as state-owned ones.
example.tran: 东欧的经验表明，工人所有的工厂可能和国有工厂一样效率低下。

collins.def: State industries or organizations are financed and organized by the government rather than private companies.

example.ex: ...reform of the state social-security system.
example.tran: 对国家社会保障制度的改革

collins.def: A state occasion is a formal one involving the head of a country.

example.ex: ...the Queen's three-day state visit to France.
example.tran: 女王对法国为期 3 天的国事访问

collins.def: When you talk about the state of someone or something, you are referring to the condition they are in or what they are like at a particular time.

example.ex: For the first few months after Daniel died, I was in a state of clinical depression...
example.tran: 丹尼尔去世后的最初几个月里，我一直处于临床抑郁症的状态。

example.ex: When we moved here the walls and ceiling were in an awful state...
example.tran: 我们刚搬到这里时，墙和房顶都破旧不堪。

collins.tran: (以口头或书面形式正式或明确地)声称，宣称，声明
collins.def: If you state something, you say or write it in a formal or definite way.

example.ex: Clearly state your address and telephone number...
example.tran: 清楚地报上你的地址和电话号码。

example.ex: The police report stated that he was arrested for allegedly assaulting his wife...
example.tran: 警方的报告称，他因涉嫌殴打妻子而被捕。

collins.tran: (因精神或健康状态不佳而)不适宜(做某事)
collins.def: If you say that someone is not in a fit state to do something, you mean that they are too upset or ill to do it.

example.ex: When you left our place, you weren't in a fit state to drive.
example.tran: 你离开我们家时已经开不了车了。

collins.def: If you are in a state or if you get into a state, you are very upset or nervous about something.

example.ex: I was in a terrible state because nobody could understand why I had this illness...
example.tran: 我极度焦虑不安，因为谁也不知道为什么我会得这个病。

example.ex: People will work themselves up into a state about anything.
example.tran: 人们总会沉不住气，为任何事感到担忧。

collins.tran: (重要人物的遗体)停放供瞻仰
collins.def: If the dead body of an important person lies in state, it is publicly displayed for a few days before it is buried.
If you kiss someone, you touch them with your lips to show affection or sexual desire, or to greet them or say goodbye.

example.ex: She leaned up and kissed him on the cheek...
example.tran: 她倾身向前亲吻了他的面颊。

example.ex: She kissed me hard on the mouth...
example.tran: 她深深地吻了我的嘴。

collins.def: If you kiss something, you touch it lightly with your lips, usually as a sign of respect.

example.ex: The men stepped forward to kiss the hand of their mentor...
example.tran: 这些男子走上前去轻吻他们导师的手。

example.ex: She bowed her head and kissed the Archbishop's ring.
example.tran: 她低下头轻吻大主教的戒指。

collins.def: If you say that something kisses another thing, you mean that it touches that thing very gently.

example.ex: The wheels of the aircraft kissed the runway.
example.tran: 飞机的轮子轻触跑道。

collins.def: If you blow someone a kiss or blow a kiss, you touch the palm of your hand lightly with your lips, and then blow across your hand towards the person, in order to show them your affection.

example.ex: Maria blew him a kiss...
example.tran: 玛丽亚给了他一个飞吻。

example.ex: Amy blew a kiss from the door.
example.tran: 埃米在门口做了个飞吻的动作。

collins.tran: 任其失去；放弃；承认对…无能为力
collins.def: If you say that you kiss something goodbye or kiss goodbye to something, you accept the fact that you are going to lose it, although you do not want to.

example.ex: I felt sure I'd have to kiss my dancing career goodbye.
example.tran: 我明确感觉到我将不得不与我的舞蹈生涯说再见了。

collins.def: Worse is the comparative of bad .
Worse is the comparative of badly .

collins.tran: (用于构成以 bad 和 badly 开头的复合形容词的比较级，如 badly off 的比较级是 worse off )
collins.def: Worse is used to form the comparative of compound adjectives beginning with 'bad' and 'badly.' For example, the comparative of 'badly off' is 'worse off'.
If a situation goes from bad to worse, it becomes even more unpleasant or unsatisfactory.

example.ex: For the past couple of years my life has gone from bad to worse.
example.tran: 过去几年来，我的生活每况愈下。

collins.tran: 不妨(做某事);(做某事)不失明智之举
collins.def: If you tell someone that they could do worse than do a particular thing, you are advising them that it would be quite a good thing to do.

example.ex: Scientists in search of a challenging career could do worse than consider forensic science.
example.tran: 寻求富有挑战性的事业的科学家不妨考虑一下法医学。

collins.tran: 向着更坏(或更糟的)情况(转变)
collins.def: If a situation changes for the worse, it becomes more unpleasant or more difficult.

example.ex: The grandparents sigh and say how things have changed for the worse.
example.tran: 爷爷奶奶叹着气说情况变得如何如何糟糕。

collins.tran: 受到/未受到…的伤害(或不良影响)
collins.def: If a person or thing is the worse for something, they have been harmed or badly affected by it. If they are none the worse for it, they have not been harmed or badly affected by it.

example.ex: Father came home from the pub very much the worse for drink...
example.tran: 父亲从酒吧回到家里，乱撒酒疯。

example.ex: They are all apparently fit and well and none the worse for the fifteen hour journey.
example.tran: 他们的身体状况显然都很好，15个小时的行程没有给他们带来不适。

collins.tran: (常于口语与非正式书面语中代替 until)
collins.def: In spoken English and informal written English, till is often used instead of until .

example.ex: They had to wait till Monday to ring the bank manager...
example.tran: 他们必须等到周一才能给银行经理打电话。

example.ex: I've survived till now, and will go on doing so without help from you.
example.tran: 我一直努力活到了现在，而且没有你的帮助也能继续活下去。

collins.tran: (商店等处的)现金出纳机，收银机
collins.def: In a shop or other place of business, a till is a counter or cash register where money is kept, and where customers pay for what they have bought.

example.ex: ...long queues at tills that make customers angry.
example.tran: 收银台前令顾客恼火的长队

collins.tran: (收银机中的)钱柜，放钱的抽屉
collins.def: A till is the drawer of a cash register, in which the money is kept.

example.ex: He checked the register. There was money in the till.
example.tran: 他查看了一下收银机的抽屉，里面有钱。

collins.def: When people till land, they prepare the earth and work on it in order to grow crops.

example.ex: Workers were singing as they tilled the rice paddy fields.
example.tran: 劳动者们一边耕犁稻田一边唱歌。

example.ex: ...freshly tilled fields.
example.tran: 刚犁过的田地

collins.def: Someone's  boyfriend is a man or boy with whom they are having a romantic or sexual relationship.

example.ex: ...Brenda and her boyfriend Anthony...
example.tran: 布兰达和她的男友安东尼

example.ex: I don't know if she's got a boyfriend or not.
example.tran: 我不知道她有没有男朋友。

collins.def: Diplomatic means relating to diplomacy and diplomats.

example.ex: ...before the two countries resume full diplomatic relations...
example.tran: 在两国恢复全面的外交关系之前

example.ex: Efforts are being made to avert war and find a diplomatic solution...
example.tran: 各方正在为避免战争、寻求外交解决途径而作出积极的努力。

collins.tran: 有手腕的;讲究策略的;圆滑的;婉转的
collins.def: Someone who is diplomatic is able to be careful to say or do things without offending people.

example.ex: She is very direct. I tend to be more diplomatic, I suppose.
example.tran: 她人很直，我觉得我更婉转一些。

collins.def: Educational matters or institutions are concerned with or relate to education.

example.ex: ...the British educational system.
example.tran: 英国的教育体制

example.ex: ...pupils with special educational needs.
example.tran: 需要特殊教育的学生

collins.tran: 有教育意义的;教育性的
collins.def: An educational experience teaches you something.

example.ex: The staff should make sure the kids have an enjoyable and educational day.
example.tran: 老师们应该确保孩子们度过愉快而有教育意义的一天。

means: 丑闻，丑名，丑事，丑行，丢脸的事件，舞弊案件，耻辱

collins.def: A scandal is a situation or event that is thought to be shocking and immoral and that everyone knows about.

example.ex: ...a financial scandal.
example.tran: 金融丑闻

collins.tran: 流言蜚语;关于丑闻的传言;谣言
collins.def: Scandal is talk about the shocking and immoral aspects of someone's behaviour or something that has happened.

example.ex: He loved gossip and scandal...
example.tran: 他喜欢说三道四，散布谣言。

example.ex: These mothers often abandoned their children because of fear of scandal.
example.tran: 这些母亲经常会因为害怕流言蜚语而抛弃自己的孩子。

collins.tran: 令人气愤的事;不像话的事;可耻的行为
collins.def: If you say that something is a scandal, you are angry about it and think that the people responsible for it should be ashamed.

example.ex: It is a scandal that a person can be stopped for no reason by the police.
example.tran: 警察能无缘无故拦人，这真是令人愤慨的行径。

collins.def: If you squeeze something, you press it firmly, usually with your hands.

example.ex: He squeezed her arm reassuringly...
example.tran: 他安慰地捏了捏她的胳膊。

example.ex: Dip the bread briefly in water, then squeeze it dry.
example.tran: 将面包在水里快速蘸一下，然后将它挤干。

collins.tran: 压榨，挤出(液体或软的东西)
collins.def: If you squeeze a liquid or a soft substance out of an object, you get the liquid or substance out by pressing the object.

example.ex: Joe put the plug in the sink and squeezed some detergent over the dishes.
example.tran: 乔用塞子塞住水槽，往盘子上挤了点洗涤剂。

example.ex: ...freshly squeezed lemon juice.
example.tran: 新榨的柠檬汁

collins.tran: (常因害怕或保护眼睛而)紧闭(双眼)
collins.def: If you squeeze your eyes shut or if your eyes squeeze shut, you close them tightly, usually because you are frightened or to protect your eyes from something such as strong sunlight.

example.ex: Nancy squeezed her eyes shut and prayed...
example.tran: 南希紧闭双眼祈祷着。

example.ex: If you keep your eyes squeezed shut, you'll miss the show...
example.tran: 如果一直紧闭双眼，你就要错过精彩的表演了。

collins.def: If you squeeze a person or thing somewhere or if they squeeze there, they manage to get through or into a small space.

example.ex: They lowered him gradually into the cockpit. Somehow they squeezed him in the tight space, and strapped him in...
example.tran: 他们将他慢慢向下放入驾驶舱，设法将他塞进了狭小的空间，并给他系好安全带。

example.ex: Many break-ins are carried out by youngsters who can squeeze through tiny windows.
example.tran: 很多入室盗窃案都是年轻人干的，他们可以从狭小的窗口钻进去。

collins.def: If you say that getting a number of people into a small space is a squeeze, you mean that it is only just possible for them all to get into it.

example.ex: It was a squeeze in the car with five of them...
example.tran: 车里坐了他们 5 个人，很拥挤。

example.ex: The lift holds six people at a squeeze.
example.tran: 电梯里挤一挤能容纳 6 个人。

collins.def: If you squeeze something out of someone, you persuade them to give it to you, although they may be unwilling to do this.

example.ex: The investigators complained about the difficulties of squeezing information out of residents...
example.tran: 调查人员抱怨说很难从居民身上获取信息。

example.ex: The company intends to squeeze further savings from its suppliers.
example.tran: 公司试图从供货商那里再省下一笔费用。

collins.def: If a government squeezes the economy, they put strict controls on people's ability to borrow money or on their own departments' freedom to spend money, in order to control the country's rate of inflation.

example.ex: The government will squeeze the economy into a severe recession to force inflation down...
example.tran: 政府将紧缩经济，使之出现严重衰退，以此迫使通货膨胀率下降。

example.ex: Defense experts say joint projects are increasingly squeezed by budget pressures.
example.tran: 国防专家说合作项目正迫于预算压力越来越受到压缩。

collins.def: Someone's squeeze is their boyfriend or girlfriend.

example.ex: Jack showed off his latest squeeze at the weekend.
example.tran: 周末杰克炫耀了一番自己新交的女朋友。

collins.tran: （人或物）典雅的，雅致的，优美的
collins.def: If you describe a person or thing as elegant, you mean that they are pleasing and graceful in appearance or style.

example.ex: Patricia looked beautiful and elegant as always.
example.tran: 帕特里夏一如既往地美丽优雅。

example.ex: ...an elegant restaurant.
example.tran: 雅致的餐厅

collins.tran: （文字、想法、计划等）简洁的，简练的，巧妙的
collins.def: If you describe a piece of writing, an idea, or a plan as elegant, you mean that it is simple, clear, and clever.

example.ex: The document impressed me with its elegant simplicity.
example.tran: 那份文件的简洁明了给我留下了深刻印象。

means: 最活跃或最激烈的部分

collins.def: Something that is thick has a large distance between its two opposite sides.

example.ex: For breakfast I had a thick slice of bread and syrup...
example.tran: 早餐我吃了一片厚厚的涂了糖浆的面包。

example.ex: He wore glasses with thick rims...
example.tran: 他戴了一副厚框眼镜。

collins.def: You can use thick to talk or ask about how wide or deep something is.

example.ex: The folder was two inches thick...
example.tran: 那个文件夹有两英寸厚。

example.ex: How thick are these walls?
example.tran: 这些墙有多厚？

collins.tran: 浓的;密的;密集的;茂密的
collins.def: If something that consists of several things is thick, it has a large number of them very close together.

example.ex: She inherited our father's thick, wavy hair...
example.tran: 她继承了我们父亲那头浓密的卷发。

example.ex: They walked through thick forest.
example.tran: 他们徒步穿越了茂密的森林。

collins.def: If something is thick with another thing, the first thing is full of or covered with the second.

example.ex: The air is thick with acrid smoke from the fires...
example.tran: 空气中弥漫着火灾产生的刺鼻浓烟。

example.ex: She ate scones thick with butter.
example.tran: 她吃了一些涂满了黄油的烤饼。

collins.def: Thick clothes are made from heavy cloth, so that they will keep you warm in cold weather.

example.ex: In the winter she wears thick socks, Wellington boots and gloves...
example.tran: 冬天，她穿着厚袜子和橡胶雨靴，戴着手套。

example.ex: She wore a thick tartan skirt and a red cashmere sweater.
example.tran: 她穿了一条厚厚的格子呢裙和一件红色羊绒衫。

collins.tran: (烟、雾、云)浓的，混浊的，能见度低的
collins.def: Thick smoke, fog, or cloud is difficult to see through.

example.ex: The smoke was bluish-black and thick...
example.tran: 那烟黑中带蓝，而且很浓。

example.ex: It wasn't very thick fog.
example.tran: 雾不算很浓。

collins.def: Thick liquids are fairly stiff and solid and do not flow easily.

example.ex: They had to battle through thick mud to reach construction workers...
example.tran: 他们只好挣扎着穿过厚厚的泥巴去找建筑工人。

example.ex: The sauce is thick and rich so don't bother trying to diet.
example.tran: 这个酱汁又浓又香，别费劲节食了。

collins.tran: (声音)不清楚的，沙哑的，低沉的
collins.def: If someone's voice is thick, they are not speaking clearly, for example because they are ill, upset, or drunk.

example.ex: When he spoke his voice was thick with bitterness.
example.tran: 他说话时，声音低沉，充满痛苦。

collins.def: A thick accent is very obvious and easy to identify.

example.ex: He answered our questions in English but with a thick accent...
example.tran: 他用英语回答了我们的问题，不过口音很重。

example.ex: 'What do you want?' a teenage girl demanded in a thick German accent.
example.tran: “你想要什么？”一个十几岁少女操着一口浓重的德国口音问道。

collins.def: If you describe someone as thick, you think they are stupid.

example.ex: How could she have been so thick?
example.tran: 她怎么能蠢到那个地步？

collins.tran: 大量而迅速地;接二连三地
collins.def: If things happen thick and fast, they happen very quickly and in large numbers.

example.ex: The rumours have been coming thick and fast...
example.tran: 谣言接二连三地传来。

example.ex: Distress calls were pouring in thick and fast from all over the area.
example.tran: 求救电话从该地区各地蜂拥而至。

collins.def: If you are in the thick of an activity or situation, you are very involved in it.

example.ex: I enjoy being in the thick of things...
example.tran: 我喜欢全身心投入到事情当中。

example.ex: Peterson suddenly found himself in the thick of desperate fighting.
