example.tran: 彼得森突然发现自己身陷一场殊死搏斗中。

collins.tran: 不顾艰难险阻;历尽千辛万苦
collins.def: If you do something through thick and thin, you do it although the conditions or circumstances are very bad.

example.ex: She'd stuck by Bob through thick and thin...
example.tran: 她对鲍勃不离不弃，甘苦与共。

example.ex: I will go on loving James through thick and thin no matter what happens.
example.tran: 不管发生什么，不管经历多少艰辛，我都会一直爱着詹姆斯。

collins.def: When you whisper, you say something very quietly, using your breath rather than your throat, so that only one person can hear you.

example.ex: 'Keep your voice down,' I whispered...
example.tran: 我轻声说：“小声点儿。”

example.ex: She sat on Rossi's knee as he whispered in her ear...
example.tran: 她坐在罗西的膝盖上，听他低声耳语。

collins.def: If people whisper about a piece of information, they talk about it, although it might not be true or accurate, or might be a secret.

example.ex: Today, we no longer gasp when we hear a teenage girl is pregnant or whisper about unmarried couples who live together...
example.tran: 今天，我们听到未成年少女怀孕时不会再感到惊讶，也不会再去私下谈论谁谁未婚同居。

example.ex: It is whispered that he intended to resign...
example.tran: 据传他打算辞职。

collins.tran: 发出低沉而轻微的声音；沙沙（或飒飒）作响
collins.def: If something whispers, it makes a low quiet sound which can only just be heard.

example.ex: The cold breeze moved through the bushes around him, whispering just loud enough to obscure the chanting...
example.tran: 冷飕飕的风吹动着他周边的矮树丛，沙沙声刚好盖过了吟唱的声音。

example.ex: The car's tires whispered through the puddles.
example.tran: 穿过水坑时汽车的轮胎发出呜呜声。

collins.def: A plot is a secret plan by a group of people to do something that is illegal or wrong, usually against a person or a government.

example.ex: Security forces have uncovered a plot to overthrow the government...
example.tran: 安全部队揭露了一起推翻政府的阴谋。

example.ex: He was responding to reports of an assassination plot against him.
example.tran: 他正就有关针对他的暗杀阴谋的报道作出回应。

collins.def: If people plot to do something or plot something that is illegal or wrong, they plan secretly to do it.

example.ex: Prosecutors in the trial allege the defendants plotted to overthrow the government...
example.tran: 检方在审判中指称被告密谋推翻政府。

example.ex: The military were plotting a coup...
example.tran: 军方正在策划一场政变。

collins.def: When people plot a strategy or a course of action, they carefully plan each step of it.

example.ex: Yesterday's meeting was intended to plot a survival strategy for the party...
example.tran: 昨天的会议旨在制订使该党能够继续存在下去的策略。

example.ex: For the next five years she plotted her career.
example.tran: 她规划了自己今后5年的职业。

collins.def: The plot of a film, novel, or play is the connected series of events which make up the story.

collins.tran: （尤指作特殊用途的）一小块（土地）
collins.def: A plot of land is a small piece of land, especially one that has been measured or marked out for a special purpose, such as building houses or growing vegetables.

example.ex: I thought that I'd buy myself a small plot of land and build a house on it...
example.tran: 我想我该给自己买一小块地，在上面建一座房子。

example.ex: The bottom of the garden was given over to vegetable plots.
example.tran: 花园的尽头留作了菜地。

collins.def: When someone plots something on a graph, they mark certain points on it and then join the points up.

example.ex: We plot about eight points on the graph.
example.tran: 我们在图表上绘制出大约8个点的曲线。

collins.tran: （在地图上）标绘出（飞机、船舶的位置或航线）
collins.def: When someone plots the position or course of a plane or ship, they mark it on a map using instruments to obtain accurate information.

example.ex: We were trying to plot the course of the submarine.
example.tran: 我们试图标绘出潜艇的航线图。

collins.def: If someone plots the progress or development of something, they make a diagram or a plan which shows how it has developed in order to give some indication of how it will develop in the future.

example.ex: They used a computer to plot the movements of everyone in the building.
example.tran: 他们使用了一台计算机绘制这座建筑里每个人的活动图表。

collins.def: If someone loses the plot, they become confused and do not know what they should do.

example.ex: The Tories have lost the plot on law and order.
example.tran: 保守党人在治安问题上不知所措。

collins.def: Tennis is a game played by two or four players on a rectangular court. The players use an oval bat with strings across it to hit a ball over a net across the middle of the court.
The yen is the unit of currency used in Japan.

example.ex: She's got a part-time job for which she earns 2,000 yen a month.
example.tran: 她有一份月收入2,000日元的兼职工作。

collins.def: If you have a yen to do something, you have a strong desire to do it.

example.ex: Mike had a yen to try cycling...
example.tran: 迈克非常想试试骑自行车。

example.ex: He's a natural with any kind of engine but he has an unfortunate yen for speed.
example.tran: 他天生对各种发动机就非常在行，但却过分追求速度。

collins.def: If something is urgent, it needs to be dealt with as soon as possible.

example.ex: There is an urgent need for food and water...
example.tran: 现在亟需食物和水。

example.ex: He had urgent business in New York.
example.tran: 他在纽约有急事。

collins.def: If you speak in an urgent way, you show that you are anxious for people to notice something or to do something.

example.ex: His voice was low and urgent...
example.tran: 他的嗓音低沉而急切。

example.ex: His mother leaned forward and spoke to him in urgent undertones.
example.tran: 他母亲身子前倾，小声而急切地跟他说话。

collins.def: Publicity is information or actions that are intended to attract the public's attention to someone or something.

example.ex: Much advance publicity was given to the talks...
example.tran: 对于这次会谈有很多前期报道。

example.ex: ...government publicity campaigns...
example.tran: 政府宣传活动

collins.def: When the news media and the public show a lot of interest in something, you can say that it is receiving publicity.

example.ex: The case has generated enormous publicity in Brazil.
example.tran: 这个案件已经在巴西引起了极大的关注。

example.ex: ...the renewed publicity over the Casey affair.
example.tran: 对凯西事件的再次关注

collins.def: Precisely means  accurately and exactly.

example.ex: Nobody knows precisely how many people are still living in the camp...
example.tran: 没有人确切知道还有多少人仍住在露营地。

example.ex: The meeting began at precisely 4.00 p.m...
example.tran: 会议于下午4点整开始。

collins.tran: 正好，恰恰，确实地（表示强调）
collins.def: You can use precisely to emphasize that a reason or fact is the only important one there is, or that it is obvious.

example.ex: Children come to zoos precisely to see captive animals...
example.tran: 孩子们到动物园就是为了看圈养的动物。

example.ex: That is precisely the result the system is designed to produce.
example.tran: 那恰恰是设计该系统时所希望达到的结果。

collins.def: You can say 'precisely'  to confirm in an emphatic way that what someone has just said is true.

example.ex: 'Did you find yourself wondering what went wrong?' — 'Precisely.'
example.tran: “你是不是自己也在想哪儿出了问题？”——“确实如此。”

means: 〈美〉冬季到南部做工的流动工人

collins.def: A tourist is a person who is visiting a place for pleasure and interest, especially when they are on holiday.

example.ex: ...foreign tourists...
example.tran: 外国游客

example.ex: Blackpool is the top tourist attraction in England.
example.tran: 布莱克浦是英国的顶级旅游胜地。

collins.def: If one thing is unlike another thing, the two things have different qualities or characteristics from each other.

example.ex: This was a foreign country, so unlike San Jose...
example.tran: 这是外国，与圣何塞很不一样。

example.ex: She was unlike him in every way except for her coal black eyes.
example.tran: 她除了那双乌黑的眼睛外，跟他没有一点儿相像。

collins.def: You can use unlike to contrast two people, things, or situations, and show how they are different.

example.ex: Unlike aerobics, walking entails no expensive fees for classes or clubs.
example.tran: 散步不像有氧健身操那样需要交纳昂贵的费用来参加健身班或俱乐部。

collins.tran: 与…平时不同；不像…平常那样
collins.def: If you describe something that a particular person has done as being unlike them, you mean that you are surprised by it because it is not typical of their character or normal behaviour.

example.ex: It was so unlike him to say something like that, with such intensity, that I was astonished...
example.tran: 他一反常态用如此强烈的语气说出那番话，着实让我吃惊。

example.ex: 'We'll all be arrested!'  Thomas yelled, which was most unlike him.
example.tran: “我们都会被抓的！” 托马斯大声嚷道，跟平时的他判若两人。

collins.def: A demonstration is a march or gathering which people take part in to show their opposition to something or their support for something.

example.ex: Riot police broke up a demonstration by students.
example.tran: 防暴警察驱散了示威的学生。

example.ex: ...mass demonstrations.
example.tran: 群众性示威

collins.def: A demonstration of something is a talk by someone who shows you how to do it or how it works.

example.ex: ...a cookery demonstration.
example.tran: 烹饪示范

example.ex: ...demonstrations of new products.
example.tran: 新产品的演示

collins.def: A demonstration of a fact or situation is a clear proof of it.

example.ex: This is a clear demonstration of how technology has changed...
example.tran: 这清楚地表明了技术已有了怎样的进步。

example.ex: This was a very practical demonstration of why the Army trained people to be disciplined.
example.tran: 这很实际地说明了为什么军队要将士兵训练得遵规守纪。

collins.def: A demonstration of a quality or feeling is an expression of it.

example.ex: There's been no public demonstration of opposition to the President.
example.tran: 没有人对总统公开表示反对。

example.ex: ...physical demonstrations of affection.
example.tran: 身体上的亲昵

collins.def: A harbour is an area of the sea at the coast which is partly enclosed by land or strong walls, so that boats can be left there safely.

example.ex: She led us to a room with a balcony overlooking the harbour...
example.tran: 她把我们领进了一个带阳台的房间，从那里可以俯瞰海港。

example.ex: The ship was permitted to tie up in Boston harbour.
example.tran: 该船获准在波士顿港口停泊。

collins.tran: 心怀，怀藏，怀有（情感、想法或秘密）
collins.def: If you harbour an emotion, thought, or secret, you have it in your mind over a long period of time.

example.ex: He might have been murdered by a former client or someone harbouring a grudge...
example.tran: 他可能已经被以前的客户或某个对他怀恨在心的人谋杀了。

example.ex: Townsend harbours no regrets.
example.tran: 汤森心中无怨无悔。

collins.def: If a person or country harbours someone who is wanted by the police, they let them stay in their house or country and offer them protection.

example.ex: Accusations of harbouring suspects were raised against the former Hungarian leadership.
example.tran: 匈牙利前领导层被指控窝藏嫌犯。

collins.def: If someone or something weighs a particular amount, this amount is how heavy they are.

example.ex: It weighs nearly 27 kilos (about 65 pounds)...
example.tran: 它重近27千克(约65磅)。

example.ex: This little ball of gold weighs a quarter of an ounce...
example.tran: 这个小金球重0.25盎司。

collins.def: If you weigh something or someone, you measure how heavy they are.

example.ex: The scales can be used to weigh other items such as parcels.
example.tran: 这台秤可以用来称包裹等其他物品。

collins.def: If you weigh the facts about a situation, you consider them very carefully before you make a decision, especially by comparing the various facts involved.

example.ex: She weighed her options...
example.tran: 她在各种选择间权衡斟酌。

example.ex: He is weighing the possibility of filing criminal charges against the doctor...
example.tran: 他正在仔细考虑对那个医生提起刑事诉讼的可能性。

collins.def: If you weigh your words, you think very carefully before you say something.

example.ex: He said the words very slowly, as if weighing each one of them.
example.tran: 他说话非常慢，好像每个字都要仔细斟酌。

collins.def: If a problem weighs on you, it makes you worried or unhappy.

example.ex: The separation weighed on both of them...
example.tran: 分离使他们两人都十分苦恼。

example.ex: She knows how your brother's disappearance weighs upon you.
example.tran: 她知道你哥哥的失踪让你有多忧虑。

collins.def: Something that weighs heavily in a situation has a strong influence or important effect on it.

example.ex: Current economic hardships weigh heavily in young women's decisions to find salaried work...
example.tran: 目前的经济困难大大影响着年轻妇女在寻找有薪水的工作时的决定。

example.ex: Human life weighed more with him than purity of policy...
example.tran: 人类生命对他而言比政策的纯洁性更重要。

means: （衣服、音乐等方面）时髦的，赶时髦的
使…的髋关节脱臼，损伤…的髋部

collins.def: Your hips are the two areas at the sides of your body between the tops of your legs and your waist.

example.ex: Tracey put her hands on her hips and sighed.
example.tran: 特蕾西双手叉腰叹了口气。

collins.def: You refer to the bones between the tops of your legs and your waist as your hips .
If you say that someone is hip, you mean that they are very modern and follow all the latest fashions, for example in clothes and ideas.

example.ex: ...a hip young character with tight-cropped blond hair and stylish glasses.
example.tran: 留着一头毛寸金发、戴着时尚眼镜的时髦青年

collins.def: A hip is a rosehip .

collins.tran: （表示欣赏或赞许的呼声）好啊！加油！万岁！
collins.def: If a large group of people want to show their appreciation or approval of someone, one of them says 'Hip hip' and they all shout 'hooray'.

collins.tran: 鲁莽行事;轻举妄动;信口开河
collins.def: If you say that someone shoots from the hip or fires from the hip, you mean that they react to situations or give their opinion very quickly, without stopping to think.

example.ex: Judges don't have to shoot from the hip. They have the leisure to think, to decide.
example.tran: 法官们不必贸然行事。他们可以不慌不忙地去思考，去决定。

collins.def: Intelligence is the quality of being intelligent or clever.

example.ex: She's a woman of exceptional intelligence.
example.tran: 她是个有着非凡智慧的女子。

collins.def: Intelligence is the ability to think, reason, and understand instead of doing things automatically or by instinct.

example.ex: Nerve cells, after all, do not have intelligence of their own.
example.tran: 毕竟,神经细胞自身并没有智力。

collins.def: Intelligence is information that is gathered by the government or the army about their country's enemies and their activities.

example.ex: She first moved into the intelligence services 22 years ago...
example.tran: 22年前她初次进入情报部门。

example.ex: The purpose of intelligence is to provide information on how the enemy can be beaten...
example.tran: 谍报的目的是提供如何打败敌人的信息。

collins.def: Someone who is vulnerable is weak and without protection, with the result that they are easily hurt physically or emotionally.

example.ex: Old people are particularly vulnerable members of our society.
example.tran: 老年人是社会中尤为明显的弱势群体。

collins.tran: 易感染（某种疾病）的；易患病的
collins.def: If a person, animal, or plant is vulnerable to a disease, they are more likely to get it than other people, animals, or plants.

example.ex: People with high blood pressure are especially vulnerable to diabetes...
example.tran: 有高血压的人尤其易患糖尿病。

example.ex: Plants that are growing vigorously are less likely to be vulnerable to disease.
example.tran: 生命力强的植物不容易得病。

collins.tran: 易受伤害的;易受影响的
collins.def: Something that is vulnerable can be easily harmed or affected by something bad.

example.ex: Their tanks would be vulnerable to attack from the air...
example.tran: 他们的坦克易受到空袭。

example.ex: ...a table showing which cars are most  vulnerable to theft...
example.tran: 易被盗车辆一览表

collins.def: If you shut something such as a door or if it shuts, it moves so that it fills a hole or a space.

example.ex: Just make sure you shut the gate after you...
example.tran: 进来后务必关上大门。

example.ex: The screen door shut gently.
example.tran: 纱门轻轻关上了。

collins.def: If you shut your eyes, you lower your eyelids so that you cannot see anything.

example.ex: Lucy shut her eyes so she wouldn't see it happen.
example.tran: 露西闭上了眼睛，这样就不会看到它发生了。

collins.def: If your mouth shuts or if you shut your mouth, you place your lips firmly together.

example.ex: Daniel's mouth opened, and then shut again...
example.tran: 丹尼尔嘴巴张了张又合上了。

example.ex: He opened and shut his mouth, unspeaking.
example.tran: 他张了张嘴，欲言又止。

collins.tran: (使)(商店、酒吧等公共场所)关门，停止营业，休息
collins.def: When a store, bar, or other public building shuts or when someone shuts it, it is closed and you cannot use it until it is open again.

example.ex: There is a tendency to shut museums or shops at a moment's notice...
example.tran: 现在博物馆或商店有一种说关就关的趋势。

example.ex: Shops usually shut from noon-3pm, and stay open late...
example.tran: 商店通常中午到下午 3 点关门，然后营业到很晚。

collins.tran: 故意忽视;故意不予理会;对…视若罔闻
collins.def: If you say that someone shuts their eyes to something, you mean that they deliberately ignore something which they should deal with.

example.ex: We shut our eyes to the plainest facts, refusing to admit the truth...
example.tran: 我们对最浅显的事实视而不见，拒绝承认真相。

example.ex: She was shutting her eyes to reality, just as she had done after Matthew died.
example.tran: 她不肯正视现实，跟她在马修去世后的表现如出一辙。

collins.def: If someone tells you to keep your mouth shut about something, they are telling you not to let anyone else know about it.

example.ex: I don't have to tell you how important it is for you to keep your mouth shut about all this...
example.tran: 我不用告诉你，你自己也知道对所有这些事保密有多重要了吧。

example.ex: He paid my brother to kill Norton and keep his mouth shut.
example.tran: 他花钱雇我兄弟去杀了诺顿并给了他封口费。

collins.def: If you keep your mouth shut, you do not express your opinions about something, even though you would like to.

example.ex: If she had kept her mouth shut she would still have her job now.
example.tran: 如果她当时保持沉默的话，她现在工作也就不会丢。

collins.def: If someone tells you to shut your mouth or shut your face, they are telling you very rudely to stop talking.

example.ex: 'Oi, shut your mouth and have respect for elders,' Langda said to the boy.
example.tran: “喂， 闭嘴，对长者要尊重，”兰达对那男孩说。

collins.def: Your CV is a brief written account of your personal details, your education, and the jobs you have had. You can send a CV when you are applying for a job. CV is an abbreviation for (缩略 =) 'curriculum vitae'.

example.ex: Send them a copy of your CV.
example.tran: 给他们寄一份你的简历。

means: 小修道院院长，大修道院的副院长

collins.def: You use prior to indicate that something has already happened, or must happen, before another event takes place.

example.ex: He claimed he had no prior knowledge of the protest...
example.tran: 他声称自己事先并不知道这次抗议的事。

example.ex: The Constitution requires the president to seek the prior approval of Congress for military action...
example.tran: 宪法规定总统在采取军事行动之前必须获得国会同意。

collins.tran: （所有权、责任）更重要的，优先的
collins.def: A prior claim or duty is more important than other claims or duties and needs to be dealt with first.

example.ex: The firm I wanted to use had prior commitments.
example.tran: 我想选用的这家公司已有约在先。

collins.tran: 小修道院院长；大修道院副院长
collins.def: A prior is a monk who is in charge of a priory or a monk who is the second most important person in a monastery.
If something happens prior to a particular time or event, it happens before that time or event.

example.ex: Prior to his Japan trip, he went to New York...
example.tran: 在去日本之前，他去了纽约。

example.ex: A man seen hanging around the area prior to the shooting could have been involved.
example.tran: 在枪杀案发生之前，有人目睹一位男子在这附近游荡，该男子可能与此案有关。

collins.def: If you make a suggestion, you put forward an idea or plan for someone to think about.

example.ex: The dietitian was helpful, making suggestions as to how I could improve my diet...
example.tran: 这位营养学家就如何改善饮食给我提出了些建议，对我很有帮助。

example.ex: Perhaps he'd followed her suggestion of a stroll to the river...
example.tran: 也许他已经听从了她的建议去河边散步了。

collins.def: A suggestion is something that a person says which implies that something is the case.

example.ex: We reject any suggestion that the law needs amending...
example.tran: 对于任何暗示该法律需要修改的观点我们都拒绝接受。

example.ex: There are suggestions that he might be supported by the Socialists.
example.tran: 有人认为他可能会受到社会党的支持。

collins.def: If there is no suggestion that something is the case, there is no reason to think that it is the case.

example.ex: There is no suggestion whatsoever that the two sides are any closer to agreeing...
example.tran: 没有任何迹象表明双方将会达成一致。

example.ex: There is absolutely no suggestion of any mainstream political party involvement.
example.tran: 没有任何依据表明有任何主要政党参与其中。

collins.def: If there is a suggestion of something, there is a slight amount or sign of it.

example.ex: ...that fashionably faint suggestion of a tan.
example.tran: 略带一点流行的古铜色

example.ex: ...a firm, well-sprung mattress with not one suggestion of a sag.
example.tran: 结实、没有一点凹陷的高弹力床垫

collins.def: Suggestion means giving people a particular idea by associating it with other ideas.

example.ex: The power of suggestion is very strong.
example.tran: 暗示的力量是无比强大的。

collins.def: A saving is a reduction in the amount of time or money that is used or needed.

example.ex: Fill in the form below and you will be making a saving of £6.60 on a one-year subscription.
example.tran: 填写以下表格，全年订阅即可为您节省 6.60英镑。

example.ex: ...a program of household savings on energy use.
example.tran: 家庭节能计划

collins.tran: (尤指在银行和购屋互助协会的)储蓄款，存款;积蓄
collins.def: Your savings are the money that you have saved, especially in a bank or a building society.

example.ex: Her savings were in the Post Office Savings Bank.
example.tran: 她的钱存在邮政储蓄银行里。

example.ex: ...a savings account.
example.tran: 储蓄账户

collins.def: The personnel of an organization are the people who work for it.

example.ex: Five other US military personnel were killed in various incidents...
example.tran: 另有5名美军士兵死于各种意外。

example.ex: There has been very little renewal of personnel in higher education...
example.tran: 从事高等教育的人员新老更替极其缓慢。

collins.def: Personnel is the department in a large company or organization that deals with employees, keeps their records, and helps with any problems they might have.

example.ex: Her first job was in personnel.
example.tran: 她的第一份工作是人事方面的。

collins.def: If you win someone's approval for something that you ask for or suggest, they agree to it.

example.ex: ...efforts to win congressional approval for an aid package for Moscow...
example.tran: 为获得国会准许向莫斯科提供一揽子援助而付出的努力

example.ex: The chairman has also given his approval for an investigation into the case...
example.tran: 主席也已同意对此案进行调查。

collins.def: Approval is a formal or official statement that something is acceptable.

example.ex: The testing and approval of new drugs will be speeded up.
example.tran: 新药品的检测和审批速度将会加快。

collins.def: If someone or something has your approval, you like and admire them.

example.ex: His son had an obsessive drive to gain his father's approval...
example.tran: 他儿子非常渴望得到父亲的嘉许。

example.ex: The president's approval rating had risen.
example.tran: 总统的支持率上升了。

collins.def: If a person or organization gives something their seal of approval or their stamp of approval, they officially say that they like it or think it is acceptable.

example.ex: Ministers have put their seal of approval on the proposal...
example.tran: 部长们已经批准了该提案。

example.ex: Last November the commission gave its stamp of approval to the deal.
example.tran: 去年11月，委员会核准了这宗交易。

means: 到处，处处，无论什么地方

collins.def: You use everywhere to refer to a whole area or to all the places in a particular area.

example.ex: Working people everywhere object to paying taxes...
example.tran: 各地的工薪族都反对缴税。

example.ex: We went everywhere together...
example.tran: 我们一起去各个地方。

collins.def: You use everywhere to refer to all the places that someone goes to.

example.ex: Bradley is still accustomed to travelling everywhere in style...
example.tran: 布拉德利仍然保持着每次出行必派头十足的习惯。

example.ex: Everywhere he went he was introduced as the current United States Open Champion.
example.tran: 他所到之处人们都介绍他是本届美国公开赛的冠军。

collins.def: You use everywhere to emphasize that you are talking about a large number of places, or all possible places.

example.ex: I saw her picture everywhere...
example.tran: 我到处都可以看见她的照片。

example.ex: I looked everywhere. I couldn't find him.
example.tran: 我到处都找了，就是找不到他。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is everywhere, you mean that they are present in a place in very large numbers.

example.ex: There were cartons of cigarettes everywhere...
example.tran: 到处都是香烟盒。

example.ex: Clothes were everywhere; hanging out of drawers, strewn across the floor, even spilling from the wastepaper basket.
example.tran: 到处都是衣服：挂在抽屉上、扔在地上、甚至堆在废纸篓里。

collins.tran: 部分地；不完全地；在某种程度上
collins.def: You use partly to indicate that something happens or exists to some extent, but not completely.

example.ex: It's partly my fault...
example.tran: 这在一定程度上是我的错。

example.ex: He let out a long sigh, mainly of relief, partly of sadness...
example.tran: 他长叹一口气，主要是因为如释重负，也有一部分是因为伤心。

collins.def: Someone's lover is someone who they are having a sexual relationship with but are not married to.

example.ex: Every Thursday she would meet her lover Leon...
example.tran: 每周四她都会和情人利昂幽会。

example.ex: He and Liz became lovers soon after they first met.
example.tran: 他和莉兹初次见面后不久就成了情侣。

collins.def: If you are a lover of something such as animals or the arts, you enjoy them very much and take great pleasure in them.

example.ex: She is a great lover of horses and horse racing...
example.tran: 她热爱马匹和赛马。

example.ex: Are you an opera lover?
example.tran: 你是歌剧发烧友吗？

collins.def: You can refer to the beginning, cause, or source of something as its origin or origins .

example.ex: ...theories about the origin of life...
example.tran: 有关生命起源的各种理论

example.ex: The disorder in military policy had its origins in Truman's first term...
example.tran: 军事政策的混乱可追溯到杜鲁门的第一届任期。

collins.def: When you talk about a person's origin or origins, you are referring to the country, race, or social class of their parents or ancestors.

example.ex: Thomas has not forgotten his humble origins.
example.tran: 托马斯没有忘记自己卑微的出身。

example.ex: ...people of Asian origin...
example.tran: 亚裔民众

collins.def: An offering is something that is specially produced to be sold.

example.ex: It was very, very good, far better than vegetarian offerings in many a posh restaurant.
example.tran: 这道菜真是人间美味，远远超过很多豪华餐厅的素食菜品。

collins.def: An offering is a gift that people offer to their God or gods as a form of worship.

example.ex: ...the holiest of the Shinto rituals, where offerings are made at night to the great Sun.
example.tran: 神道教仪式中最神圣的时刻，即在晚间祭祀“天照大神”太阳神

collins.def: If a part of your body is painful, it hurts because it is injured or because there is something wrong with  it.

example.ex: Her glands were swollen and painful...
example.tran: 她腺体肿痛。

example.ex: Sampras awaits the results of a bone scan on a painful left shin.
example.tran: 桑普拉斯等待着疼痛的左腿胫骨的骨骼扫描结果。

collins.tran: （病、伤、手术等）令人疼痛的，引起疼痛的
collins.def: If something such as an illness, injury, or operation is painful, it causes you a lot of physical pain.

example.ex: ...a painful back injury...
example.tran: 疼痛的背伤

example.ex: Sunburn is painful and potentially dangerous.
example.tran: 晒伤不仅疼，还有潜在危险。

collins.tran: （情形、记忆或经历）痛苦的，难受的，恼人的
collins.def: Situations, memories, or experiences that are painful are difficult and unpleasant to deal with, and often make you feel sad and upset.

example.ex: Remarks like that brought back painful memories...
example.tran: 那样的话勾起了痛苦的回忆。

example.ex: ...the painful transition to democracy...
example.tran: 向民主的艰难转变

collins.def: If a performance or interview is painful, it is so bad that it makes you feel embarrassed for the people taking part in it.

example.ex: The interview was painful to watch.
example.tran: 观看那次访谈让人难堪。

collins.tran: 不幸的是；遗憾的是；令人失望的是
collins.def: You can use unfortunately to introduce or refer to a statement when you consider that it is sad or disappointing, or when you want to express regret.

example.ex: Unfortunately, my time is limited...
example.tran: 可惜的是，我的时间有限。

example.ex: Unfortunately for the Prince, his title brought obligations as well as privileges...
example.tran: 可惜对于王子来说，封号赋予他特权的同时也给他带来了义务。

collins.def: The appointment of a person to a particular job is the choice of that person to do it.

example.ex: His appointment to the Cabinet would please the right-wing.
example.tran: 他被任命为内阁成员会让右翼党派很高兴。

example.ex: ...his appointment as foreign minister in 1985.
example.tran: 在1985年他被委任为外交部长

collins.def: An appointment is a job or position of responsibility.

example.ex: Mr Fay is to take up an appointment as a researcher with the Royal Society.
example.tran: 费伊先生将担任皇家学会研究员的职务。

collins.def: If you have an appointment with someone, you have arranged to see them at a particular time, usually in connection with their work or for a serious purpose.

example.ex: She has an appointment with her accountant...
example.tran: 她和她的会计约好了见面。

example.ex: I made an appointment to see a specialist.
example.tran: 我约好去见一位专家。

collins.def: If something can be done by appointment, people can arrange in advance to do it at a particular time.

example.ex: Viewing is by appointment only.
example.tran: 参观须事先预约。

collins.def: An allegation is a statement saying that someone has done something wrong.

example.ex: The company has denied the allegations...
example.tran: 公司否认了这些指控。

example.ex: Allegations of brutality and theft have been levelled at the army.
example.tran: 有人指责军队中存在着野蛮暴行和盗窃行为。

collins.def: The constitution of a country or organization is the system of laws which formally states people's rights and duties.

example.ex: The king was forced to adopt a new constitution which reduced his powers.
example.tran: 国王被迫采用了削弱其权力的新宪法。

example.ex: ...the American Constitution...
example.tran: 《美国宪法》

collins.def: Your constitution is  your health.

example.ex: He must have an extremely strong constitution...
example.tran: 他的体格必定极其强壮。

example.ex: I've always had the constitution of an ox.
example.tran: 我一向体壮如牛。

means: 纪实与虚构相结合的电影

collins.tran: (大团体中的)派系，派别，小集团
collins.def: A faction is an organized group of people within a larger group, which opposes some of the ideas of the larger group and fights for its own ideas.

example.ex: A peace agreement will be signed by the leaders of the country's warring factions.
example.tran: 该国各敌对派系领导人将签署和平协议。

collins.def: Faction is also used to describe argument and disagreement within a group of people.

example.ex: Faction and self-interest appear to be the norm.
example.tran: 派系之争和自私自利看来非常普遍。

collins.def: A routine is the usual series of things that you do at a particular time. A routine is also the practice of regularly doing things in a fixed order.

example.ex: The players had to change their daily routine and lifestyle...
example.tran: 这些运动员不得不改变他们的日常生活习惯和方式。

example.ex: They include the floor exercises as a regular part of their fitness routine...
example.tran: 他们把自由体操做为日常健身运动的固定环节。

collins.def: You use routine to describe activities that are done as a normal part of a job or process.

example.ex: ...a series of routine medical tests...
example.tran: 一系列常规的医疗检查

example.ex: The operator has to be able to carry out routine maintenance of the machine.
example.tran: 操作员必须能对机器进行日常维护。

collins.tran: 普通的;平常的;一般的;乏味的
collins.def: A routine situation, action, or event is one which seems completely ordinary, rather than interesting, exciting, or different.

example.ex: So many days are routine and uninteresting, especially in winter.
example.tran: 许多日子都过得平淡乏味，尤其是在冬天。

example.ex: ...this routine thriller about a CIA man and a KGB operative.
example.tran: 这部关于一个中情局特工和一个克格勃特务的平淡无奇的惊悚片

collins.def: You use routine to refer to a way of life that is uninteresting and ordinary, or hardly ever changes.

example.ex: ...the mundane routine of her life...
example.tran: 她平淡乏味的生活

example.ex: Family holidays are meant to be a break from routine.
example.tran: 家庭假日就是从平淡的日常生活中解脱一下。

collins.def: A routine is a computer program, or part of a program, that performs a specific function.

example.ex: ... an installation routine.
example.tran: 一个安装程序

collins.tran: （演出中的）一组笑话（或谈话等），一套动作
collins.def: A routine is a short sequence of jokes, remarks, actions, or movements that forms part of a longer performance.

example.ex: ... like a Marx Brothers routine.
example.tran: 像马克思兄弟风格的搞笑套路

example.ex: ...an athletic dance routine.
example.tran: 一套体育舞蹈动作

collins.def: Something that is comprehensive includes everything that is needed or relevant.

example.ex: The Rough Guide to Nepal is a comprehensive guide to the region.
example.tran: 《尼泊尔概况》是一本全面介绍该地区的旅游指南。

collins.def: In Britain, a comprehensive is a state school in which children of all abilities are taught together.

example.ex: ...Birmingham's inner-city comprehensives...
example.tran: 伯明翰旧城区的综合中学

example.ex: She taught French at Cheam Comprehensive in South London.
example.tran: 她在伦敦南部的奇姆综合中学教法语。

collins.tran: 大量的;相当程度的;重大的
collins.def: Substantial means large in amount or degree.

example.ex: The party has just lost office and with it a substantial number of seats...
example.tran: 该党刚刚竞选失利，同时还失去了许多席位。

example.ex: That is a very substantial improvement in the present situation.
example.tran: 在当前形势下这是一个非常巨大的进步。

collins.tran: (建筑物)大而坚固的，结实的，牢固的
collins.def: A substantial building is large and strongly built.

example.ex: ...those fortunate enough to have a fairly substantial property to sell.
example.tran: 那些有相当多的固定资产可出售的幸运儿

collins.def: To stimulate something means to encourage it to begin or develop further.

example.ex: America's priority is rightly to stimulate its economy...
example.tran: 美国的首要任务自然是刺激经济。

example.ex: The Russian health service has stimulated public interest in home cures.
example.tran: 俄罗斯的公共医疗服务已经激起了公众对家庭治疗的兴趣。

collins.def: If you are stimulated by something, it makes you feel full of ideas and enthusiasm.

example.ex: Bill was stimulated by the challenge...
example.tran: 这个挑战让比尔热情高涨。

example.ex: I was stimulated to examine my deepest thoughts.
example.tran: 我深受启发，开始审视自己内心深处的想法。

collins.def: If something stimulates a part of a person's body, it causes it to move or start working.

example.ex: Exercise stimulates the digestive and excretory systems...
example.tran: 锻炼能促进消化和排泄系统的活动。

example.ex: The production of melanin in the skin is stimulated by exposure to the sun...
example.tran: 皮肤暴露在阳光下就很容易生成黑色素。

collins.def: A portrait is a painting, drawing, or photograph of a particular person.

example.ex: Lucian Freud has been asked to paint a portrait of the Queen.
example.tran: 卢西恩·弗洛伊德已受邀为女王画肖像画。

example.ex: ...the English portrait painter Augustus John.
example.tran: 英格兰肖像画家奥古斯塔斯·约翰

collins.def: A portrait of a person, place, or thing is a verbal description of them.

example.ex: ...this gripping, funny portrait of Jewish life in 1950s London.
example.tran: 这段扣人心弦、令人捧腹的对伦敦20世纪50年代犹太人生活的描写

collins.def: The temperature of something is a measure of how hot or cold it is.

example.ex: The temperature soared to above 100 degrees in the shade...
example.tran: 阴凉处的温度骤升至100 多度。

example.ex: The temperature of the water was about 40 degrees...
example.tran: 水温大约 40 度。

collins.def: Your temperature is the temperature of your body. A normal temperature is about 37˚ centigrade.

example.ex: His temperature continued to rise alarmingly.
example.tran: 他的体温还在上升，令人担忧。

collins.def: You can use temperature to talk about the feelings and emotions that people have in particular situations.

example.ex: There's also been a noticeable rise in the political temperature.
example.tran: 政治气氛也明显升温了。

collins.def: If something is at room temperature, its temperature is neither hot nor cold.

example.ex: Stir the parsley into the potatoes and serve at room temperature.
example.tran: 把欧芹拌入土豆里，放至常温后再端上桌。

collins.def: If you are running a temperature or if you have a temperature, your temperature is higher than it usually is.

example.ex: He began to run an extremely high temperature...
example.tran: 他开始发高烧。

example.ex: Little Constance had a temperature that day.
example.tran: 小康斯坦丝那天发烧了。

collins.def: If you take someone's temperature you use an instrument called a thermometer to measure the temperature of their body in order to see if they are ill.

example.ex: He will probably take your child's temperature too.
example.tran: 他很可能也会量量你家孩子的体温。

collins.def: Grass is a very common plant consisting of large numbers of thin, spiky, green leaves that cover the surface of the ground.

example.ex: Small things stirred in the grass around the tent...
example.tran: 一些小东西在帐篷四周的草丛里窸窸窣窣地动着。

example.ex: The lawn contained a mixture of grasses.
example.tran: 草坪上生长着各种青草。

collins.def: If you talk about the grass, you are referring to an area of ground that is covered with grass, for example in your garden.

example.ex: In the old days, there were strict fines for walking on the grass or missing a study period...
example.tran: 过去，踩踏草坪或旷课都会被重金处罚。

example.ex: I'm going to cut the grass.
example.tran: 我要去修剪草坪了。

collins.def: Grass is the same as marijuana .

example.ex: I started smoking grass when I was about sixteen.
example.tran: 我大约16岁的时候开始吸大麻。

collins.def: If you say that one person grasses on another, the first person tells the police or other authorities about something criminal or wrong which the second person has done.

example.ex: His wife wants him to grass on the members of his own gang...
example.tran: 妻子要他向警方告发他所在团伙的成员。

example.ex: He was repeatedly attacked by other inmates, who accused him of grassing.
example.tran: 他屡遭指责他告密的其他囚犯的殴打。

collins.def: A grass is someone who tells the police or other authorities about criminal activities that they know about.

collins.tran: 草是那边绿；这山望着那山高
collins.def: If you say the grass is greener somewhere else, you mean that other people's situations always seem better or more attractive than your own, but may not really be so.

example.ex: He was very happy with us but wanted to see if the grass was greener elsewhere.
example.tran: 他对我们感到十分满意，但还想看看是否有更合适的人选。

collins.def: If you say that someone is being put out to grass, you mean they are no longer being employed because they are considered to be too old or no longer useful.

example.ex: The Prime Minister refused to be put out to grass. Asked if he would quit, he replied: 'The answer is No'.
example.tran: 首相拒绝被解除职务，当问到他是否会辞职时，他说，“我的回答是不。”

means: 命中注定的事（尤指坏事）

collins.def: Fate is a power that some people believe controls and decides everything that happens, in a way that cannot be prevented or changed. You can also refer to the fates .

example.ex: I see no use quarrelling with fate.
example.tran: 我看不出和命运抗争有什么用。

example.ex: ...the fickleness of fate...
example.tran: 命运的无常

collins.def: A person's or thing's fate is what happens to them.

example.ex: The Russian Parliament will hold a special session later this month to decide his fate...
example.tran: 俄罗斯议会本月晚些时候将举行特别会议决定他的命运。

example.ex: He seems for a moment to be again holding the fate of the country in his hands...
example.tran: 他似乎在一瞬间又一次将国家的命运握在了手中。

collins.def: If something seals a person's or thing's fate, it makes it certain that they will fail or that something unpleasant will happen to them.

example.ex: The call for a boycott could be enough to seal the fate of next week's general election...
example.tran: 抵制选举的呼吁足以注定下周大选失败的命运。

example.ex: And yesterday the Zoo's fate was sealed, largely due to two months of ever-dwindling entrance figures.
example.tran: 昨日，伦敦动物园面临着关闭的命运，主要因为两个月来游客数量持续下滑。

collins.def: If you renew an activity, you begin it again.

example.ex: He renewed his attack on government policy towards Europe...
example.tran: 他重新开始对政府的欧洲政策进行抨击。

example.ex: He believes the peace talks will be renewed soon...
example.tran: 他相信和平谈判不久将会重新开始。

collins.def: If you renew a relationship with someone, you start it again after you have not seen them or have not been friendly with them for some time.

example.ex: When the two men met again after the war they renewed their friendship...
example.tran: 两个人在战争结束后再次见面时重归于好。

example.ex: In December 1989 Syria renewed diplomatic relations with Egypt.
example.tran: 1989年12月,叙利亚和埃及重新建立了外交关系。

collins.tran: 延长(执照、合同等)的有效期;使续签
collins.def: When you renew something such as a licence or a contract, you extend the period of time for which it is valid.

example.ex: Larry's landlord threatened not to renew his lease...
example.tran: 拉里的房东威胁说不跟他续租。

example.ex: The job was for a fixed term and the contract is not being renewed.
example.tran: 这个工作有固定期限，而且合同不能续签。

collins.tran: 使（受到损毁或丢失后)重获新生
collins.def: You can say that something is renewed when it grows again or is replaced after it has been destroyed or lost.

example.ex: Cells are being constantly renewed.
example.tran: 细胞不断再生。

example.ex: ...a renewed interest in public transport systems.
example.tran: 对公交系统重新产生的兴趣

collins.def: If you stir a liquid or other substance, you move it around or mix it in a container using something such as a spoon.

example.ex: Stir the soup for a few seconds...
example.tran: 将汤搅和几秒钟。

example.ex: There was Mrs Bellingham, stirring sugar into her tea...
example.tran: 贝林厄姆太太正在那里将糖搅进茶里。

collins.tran: (因不舒服)稍稍活动;(睡醒前)挪动身体
collins.def: If you stir, you move slightly, for example because you are uncomfortable or beginning to wake up.

example.ex: Eileen shook him, and he started to stir...
example.tran: 艾琳晃了晃他，他开始醒过来。

example.ex: The two women lay on their backs, not stirring.
example.tran: 两名妇女一动不动地仰面躺着。

collins.def: If you do not stir from a place, you do not move from it.

example.ex: She had not stirred from the house that evening...
example.tran: 她那天晚上没有离开过那座房子。

example.ex: There's something you could study without stirring from this room.
example.tran: 有些东西你不用离开这个房间也可以学习。

collins.def: If something stirs or if the wind stirs it, it moves gently in the wind.

example.ex: Palm trees stir in the soft Pacific breeze...
example.tran: 棕榈树在太平洋和煦的微风中轻轻地摇动。

example.ex: Not a breath of fresh air stirred the long white curtains.
example.tran: 连一丝风也没有，白色的长窗帘一动不动。

collins.def: If you stir yourself, or if something stirs you into action, you move in order to start doing something.

example.ex: Stir yourself! We've got a visitor...
example.tran: 动起来！有客人来了。

example.ex: You can't even stir yourself to have a drink with them...
example.tran: 你甚至都懒得去和他们喝一杯。

collins.tran: 打动;激起，激发(强烈的感情)
collins.def: If something stirs you, it makes you react with a strong emotion.

example.ex: The voice, less coarse now, stirred her as it had then...
example.tran: 现在那声音已不那么刺耳，它又如当年一样让她怦然心动。

example.ex: I was intrigued by him, stirred by his intellect.
example.tran: 我被他的聪明才智所打动，对他产生了好奇心。

collins.tran: (回忆、感情或情绪)产生，苏醒，萌动;引发;唤起
collins.def: If a particular memory, feeling, or mood stirs or is stirred in you, you begin to think about it or feel it.

example.ex: Then a memory stirs in you and you start feeling anxious...
example.tran: 接着一段回忆涌上心头，你开始感到焦虑不安。

example.ex: Amy remembered the anger he had stirred in her...
example.tran: 埃米还记得他曾怎样惹自己生气。

collins.def: If an event causes a stir, it causes great excitement, shock, or anger among people.

example.ex: His film has caused a stir in America.
example.tran: 他的电影已在美国引起了轰动。

collins.tran: 受到轻微影响;小受打击
collins.def: If you say that someone has been shaken but not stirred by an experience, you mean that they have been slightly disturbed or emotionally affected by it, but not deeply enough to change their behaviour or way of thinking.

example.ex: A clash with America over farm subsidies had left the Europeans and their common agricultural policy shaken but not stirred.
example.tran: 在农场补贴问题上和美国之间的冲突使得欧洲人以及其共同的农业政策略受冲击。

means: 膝毯，披肩，围巾，围脖，头巾，罩衫，外套，大衣
缠绕，盘绕（通常与 over, around 等连用）

collins.def: When you wrap something, you fold paper or cloth tightly round it to cover it completely, for example in order to protect it or so that you can give it to someone as a present.

example.ex: Harry had carefully bought and wrapped presents for Mark to give them...
example.tran: 哈里精心购置了礼物又仔细包好，让马克交给他们。

example.ex: Mexican Indians used to wrap tough meat in leaves from the papaya tree.
example.tran: 墨西哥印第安人过去常用番木瓜树叶把难嚼的肉包起来。

collins.def: Wrap is the material that something is wrapped in.

example.ex: I tucked some plastic wrap around the sandwiches to keep them from getting stale.
example.tran: 我用塑料包装纸把三明治裹起来，防止变质。

example.ex: ...gift wrap.
example.tran: 礼品包装纸

collins.def: When you wrap something such as a piece of paper or cloth round another thing, you put it around it.

example.ex: She wrapped a handkerchief around her bleeding palm...
example.tran: 她用手绢将流血的手掌包扎起来。

example.ex: Then she stood up, wrapping her coat around her angrily...
example.tran: 然后她站了起来，怒气冲冲地穿上大衣。

collins.tran: 用(手臂、指头或腿)围紧;用…绕住
collins.def: If someone wraps their arms, fingers, or legs around something, they put them firmly around it.

example.ex: He wrapped his arms around her.
example.tran: 他紧紧搂住她。

collins.def: A wrap is a piece of clothing which women wear round their shoulders, either to keep them warm when wearing an evening dress, or for decoration over a coat.

collins.tran: 保密，秘而不宣（常指待日后宣布）
collins.def: If you keep something under wraps, you keep it secret, often until you are ready to announce it at some time in the future.

example.ex: The bids were submitted in May and were meant to have been kept under wraps until October...
example.tran: 标书5月份递交，本欲10月份才予以公布。

example.ex: The date and venue of the game must remain under wraps...
example.tran: 比赛的时间和地点必须保密。

collins.def: Beer is a bitter alcoholic drink made from grain.

example.ex: He sat in the kitchen drinking beer...
example.tran: 他坐在厨房里喝啤酒。

example.ex: We have quite a good range of beers.
example.tran: 我们有多种多样的啤酒。

collins.tran: (事实、局势或经历)不悦的，沮丧的，有害的
collins.def: A fact, situation, or experience that is negative is unpleasant, depressing, or harmful.

example.ex: The news from overseas is overwhelmingly negative...
example.tran: 来自海外的消息特别不容乐观。

example.ex: All this had an extremely negative effect on the criminal justice system.
example.tran: 这一切对刑事司法制度产生了极坏的影响。

collins.def: If someone is negative or has a negative attitude, they consider only the bad aspects of a situation, rather than the good ones.

example.ex: When asked for your views about your current job, on no account must you be negative about it...
example.tran: 被问及你对自己目前工作的看法时，无论如何不要流露出消极情绪。

example.ex: Why does the media present such a negative view of this splendid city?
example.tran: 媒体为什么对这座光彩夺目的城市持如此悲观的看法？

collins.tran: (回答或决定)否定的，表示否认的
collins.def: A negative reply or decision indicates the answer 'no'.

example.ex: Dr Velayati gave a vague but negative response...
example.tran: 韦拉亚提医生给了一个含糊而否定的回答。

example.ex: Upon a negative decision, the applicant loses the protection offered by Belgian law...
example.tran: 一旦得到否定裁决，申请人就失去了比利时法律的保护。

collins.tran: 否定词;否定语;否定表示
collins.def: A negative is a word, expression, or gesture that means 'no' or 'not'.

example.ex: In the past we have heard only negatives when it came to following a healthy diet.
example.tran: 说到遵循健康饮食习惯，我们过去听到的都是否定的说法。

collins.def: In grammar, a negative clause contains a word such as 'not', 'never', or 'no-one'.

collins.tran: (医学检查或科学试验)呈阴性的，结果为否定的
collins.def: If a medical test or scientific test is negative, it shows no evidence of the medical condition or substance that you are looking for.

example.ex: So far 57 have taken the test and all have been negative.
example.tran: 到目前为止，参加测试的有57人，测试结果均呈阴性。

example.ex: ...negative test results.
example.tran: 阴性测试结果

collins.def: In photography, a negative is an image that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark. Negatives are made from a camera film, and are used to print photographs.
A negative charge or current has the same electrical charge as an electron.

example.ex: Stimulate the site of greatest pain with a small negative current.
example.tran: 以微弱负电流刺激疼得最厉害的部位。

collins.def: A negative number, quantity, or measurement is less than zero.

example.ex: The weakest students can end up with a negative score.
example.tran: 最差的学生可能会以负分收场。

collins.def: If an answer is in the negative, it is 'no' or means 'no'.

example.ex: The Council answered those questions in the negative...
example.tran: 委员会对那些问题的答复是否定的。

example.ex: Seventy-nine voted in the affirmative, and none in the negative.
example.tran: 79人投赞成票，没有人投反对票。

collins.def: If a sentence is in the negative, it contains a word such as 'not', 'never', or 'no-one'.

example.ex: 'I went' in the negative is 'I did not go'.
example.tran: I went (我去了)的否定式是 I did not go (我没去)。

collins.tran: 首要的；最主要的；最重要的
collins.def: Principal means first in order of importance.

example.ex: The principal reason for my change of mind is this.
example.tran: 这是我改变主意的最主要原因。

example.ex: ...the country's principal source of foreign exchange earnings...
example.tran: 这个国家最主要的外汇收入来源

collins.tran: （中小学）校长；（英国）大学校长，学院院长
collins.def: The principal of a school, or in Britain the principal of a college, is the person in charge of the school or college.

example.ex: Donald King is the principal of Dartmouth High School.
example.tran: 唐纳德·金是达特茅斯中学的校长。

collins.def: If you say that something is not necessarily the case, you mean that it may not be the case or is not always the case.

example.ex: Anger is not necessarily the most useful or acceptable reaction to such events...
example.tran: 对于这种事，发火不见得是最有用或最能被接受的反应。

example.ex: Speed and safety are not necessarily incompatible...
example.tran: 速度和安全未必不相容。

collins.def: If you say that something necessarily happens or is the case, you mean that it has to happen or be the case and cannot be any different.

example.ex: The most desirable properties necessarily command astonishingly high prices...
example.tran: 最值得拥有的财产必然要价不菲。

example.ex: Tourism is an industry that has a necessarily close connection with governments.
example.tran: 旅游业是与政府有着必然的密切联系的产业。

collins.tran: (尤指词典中给出的)定义，释义
collins.def: A definition is a statement giving the meaning of a word or expression, especially in a dictionary.

example.ex: There is no general agreement on a standard definition of intelligence...
example.tran: “智力”一词目前还没有一个普遍认可的标准释义。

example.ex: My definition of a good hospice is one where some of the patients start feeling too good to die.
example.tran: 我对“好的晚期病人安养院”的定义是一个能让一些病人开始感到生有所恋的地方。

collins.def: Definition is the quality of being clear and distinct.

example.ex: Give your brows extra definition with Outdoor Girl's Eyebrow Pencil in Brown...
example.tran: 用“户外女孩”品牌的棕色眉笔更加清晰地勾勒出眉形。

example.ex: The speakers criticised his new programme for lack of definition.
example.tran: 几位发言者批评他的新方案不够清楚明确。

collins.def: A smooth surface has no roughness, lumps, or holes.

example.ex: ...a rich cream that keeps skin soft and smooth.
example.tran: 能让皮肤永葆柔嫩光滑的营养霜

example.ex: ...a smooth surface such as glass...
example.tran: 如玻璃般光滑的表面

collins.tran: 稠度均匀的;细腻匀和的;不结块的
collins.def: A smooth liquid or mixture has been mixed well so that it has no lumps.

example.ex: Continue whisking until the mixture looks smooth and creamy...
example.tran: 一直搅拌，直至混合物变得均匀细腻。

example.ex: Blend the cornflour to a smooth paste with a little cold water.
example.tran: 加入少量的凉水，将玉米粉搅拌成均匀的糊状。

collins.tran: (葡萄酒、威士忌或咖啡等)醇和的，不烈的，不苦的
collins.def: If you describe a drink such as wine, whisky, or coffee as smooth, you mean that it is not bitter and is pleasant to drink.

example.ex: This makes the whiskeys much smoother.
example.tran: 这样一来，威士忌就醇和多了。

collins.def: A smooth line or movement has no sudden breaks or changes in direction or speed.

example.ex: This exercise is done in one smooth motion.
example.tran: 这个练习一气呵成。

example.ex: ...the smooth curve of the trunk.
example.tran: 树干流畅的曲线

collins.tran: (骑马、航行等)平稳的，顺顺当当的
collins.def: A smooth ride, flight, or sea crossing is very comfortable because there are no unpleasant movements.

example.ex: The active suspension system gives the car a very smooth ride.
example.tran: 这个主动悬架系统使汽车行驶起来非常平稳。

collins.def: You use smooth to describe something that is going well and is free of problems or trouble.

example.ex: Political hopes for a swift and smooth transition to democracy have been dashed...
example.tran: 迅速而顺利地过渡到民主体制的政治希望破灭了。

example.ex: A number of problems marred the smooth running of this event.
example.tran: 一些问题搅乱了这一事件的顺利进展。

collins.tran: 故作殷勤有礼的;精明圆滑的;圆通的
collins.def: If you describe a man as smooth, you mean that he is extremely smart, confident, and polite, often in a way that you find rather unpleasant.

example.ex: Twelve extremely good-looking, smooth young men have been picked as finalists...
example.tran: 12 名特别漂亮精明的青年男子被选为参加决赛的选手。

example.ex: He was the smoothest and probably the most powerful chief of staff in political memory.
example.tran: 在人们关于政治人物的记忆里，他是最精明、可能也是最有权势的参谋长。

collins.def: If you smooth something, you move your hands over its surface to make it smooth and flat.

example.ex: She stood up and smoothed down her frock...
example.tran: 她站起身，抹平了裙子。

example.ex: Bardo smoothed his moustache.
example.tran: 巴多抚了抚胡子。

collins.def: If you smooth something somewhere, you use your hands to spread it there.

example.ex: She smoothed the lotion across his shoulder blades...
example.tran: 她在他的肩胛骨上抹了乳液。

example.ex: His fingers smoothed the hair back from her face.
example.tran: 他用手把她脸上的头发捋到脑后。

collins.def: If you smooth the path or smooth the way towards something, you make it easier or more likely to happen.

example.ex: Their talks were aimed at smoothing the path towards a treaty to limit long-range weapons.
example.tran: 他们的会谈旨在为缔结限制远程武器条约铺平道路。

collins.tran: 既能享乐也能吃苦;是好是歹一起承受
collins.def: If you say that someone has to take the rough with the smooth, you mean that they have to accept the unpleasant or difficult things that happen as well as the pleasant things.
If you are given promotion or a promotion in your job, you are given a more important job or rank in the organization that you work for.

example.ex: Consider changing jobs or trying for promotion.
example.tran: 考虑换个工作或者争取升职。

example.ex: ...rewarding outstanding employees with promotions to higher-paid posts.
example.tran: 将出色的员工提升到薪水更高的职位作为奖励

collins.tran: （尤指通过广告进行的）促销，推广，推销
collins.def: A promotion is an attempt to make a product or event popular or successful, especially by advertising.

example.ex: During 1984, Remington spent a lot of money on advertising and promotion...
example.tran: 1984年，雷明顿公司在广告和促销方面花费了大量的资金。

example.ex: Ask about special promotions and weekend deals too.
example.tran: 也问一问特别促销和周末特价的情况。

collins.def: Wooden objects are made of wood.

example.ex: ...the shop's bare brick walls and faded wooden floorboards.
example.tran: 商店裸露的砖墙和褪色的木地板

collins.tran: (演员)呆板的，死板的，无活力的
collins.def: If you describe an actor as wooden, you are critical of them because their performance is not at all lively or natural.

In America, baseball is a game played by two teams of nine players. Each player from one team hits a ball with a bat and then tries to run around three bases and get to the home base before the other team can get the ball back.
A baseball is a small hard ball which is used in the game of baseball.
If you are afraid of someone or afraid to do something, you are frightened because you think that something very unpleasant is going to happen to you.

example.ex: She did not seem at all afraid...
example.tran: 她毫无惧色。

example.ex: I was afraid of the other boys...
example.tran: 我害怕其他的男孩们。

collins.def: If you are afraid for someone else, you are worried that something horrible is going to happen to them.

example.ex: She's afraid for her family in Somalia.
example.tran: 她为身在索马里的家人担心。

collins.def: If you are afraid that something unpleasant will happen, you are worried that it may happen and you want to avoid it.

example.ex: I was afraid that nobody would believe me...
example.tran: 我担心没有人会相信我。

example.ex: The Government is afraid of losing the election...
example.tran: 现届政府担心会在选举中落败。

collins.tran: （用以道歉或婉转地提出异议）很抱歉，很遗憾，恐怕
collins.def: If you want to apologize to someone or to disagree with them in a polite way, you can say I'm afraid.

example.ex: We don't have anything like that, I'm afraid...
example.tran: 我们恐怕没有那样的东西。

example.ex: I'm afraid I can't help you...
example.tran: 恐怕我帮不了你。

collins.def: When you get rid of something that you do not want or do not like, you take action so that you no longer have it or suffer from it.

example.ex: The owner needs to get rid of the car for financial reasons...
example.tran: 因为经济原因，车主必须把汽车处理掉。

example.ex: There's corruption, and we're going to get rid of it...
example.tran: 存在贪污腐败现象，我们将予以清除。

collins.def: If you get rid of someone who is causing problems for you or who you do not like, you do something to prevent them affecting you any more, for example by making them leave.

example.ex: He believed that his manager wanted to get rid of him for personal reasons...
example.tran: 他认为经理是出于个人原因想开除他。

example.ex: You seem in rather a hurry to get rid of me.
example.tran: 看起来你急于想摆脱我。

collins.def: If you rid a place or person of something undesirable or unwanted, you succeed in removing it completely from that place or person.

example.ex: The proposals are an attempt to rid the country of political corruption...
example.tran: 这些提议试图使这个国家摆脱政治腐败。

example.ex: The new vaccine may rid the world of one of its most terrifying diseases.
example.tran: 这种新疫苗可能会消除世界上最可怕的一种疾病。

collins.def: If you rid yourself of something you do not want, you take action so that you no longer have it or are no longer affected by it.

example.ex: Why couldn't he ever rid himself of those thoughts, those worries?
example.tran: 为什么他总是无法摆脱那些想法和担忧?

example.ex: ...the country's efforts to rid itself of poverty and hunger.
example.tran: 该国为了消除贫困和饥饿而作出的努力

collins.def: If you are rid of someone or something that you did not want or that caused problems for you, they are no longer with you or causing problems for you.

example.ex: The family had sought a way to be rid of her and the problems she had caused them.
example.tran: 这家人已经找到一个方法摆脱她以及她给他们带来的问题。

collins.def: If you say that someone is well rid of someone, you think it is good that the person has gone because you did not like them or you think they caused a lot of problems.

example.ex: It seems to me your wife was a shallow woman and you're well rid of her.
example.tran: 在我看来你妻子是一个浅薄的女人，幸好你离开了她。

collins.def: Stocks are shares in the ownership of a company, or investments on which a fixed amount of interest will be paid.

example.ex: ...the buying and selling of stocks and shares...
example.tran: 证券和股票买卖

example.ex: As stock prices have dropped, so too has bank capital.
example.tran: 随着股价下跌，银行资本也减少了。

collins.def: A company's stock is the amount of money which the company has through selling shares.

example.ex: Two years later, when Compaq went public, their stock was valued at $38 million...
example.tran: 康柏公司两年后上市时，他们的股本为 3,800 万美元。

example.ex: The Fisher family holds 40% of the stock.
example.tran: 费希尔家族持有 40%的股份。

collins.def: If a shop stocks particular goods, it keeps a supply of them to sell.

example.ex: The shop stocks everything from cigarettes to recycled loo paper.
example.tran: 商店货品齐全，从香烟到再生厕纸应有尽有。

collins.def: A shop's stock is the total amount of goods which it has available to sell.

example.ex: We took the decision to withdraw a quantity of stock from sale.
example.tran: 我们决定将一批存货下架。

collins.def: If you stock something such as a cupboard, shelf, or room, you fill it with food or other things.

example.ex: I worked stocking shelves in a grocery store...
example.tran: 我在一家杂货店工作，负责为货架上货。

example.ex: Some families stocked their cellars with food and water...
example.tran: 有些家庭在地窖里储备了食品和水。

collins.def: If you have a stock of things, you have a supply of them stored in a place ready to be used.

example.ex: I keep a stock of cassette tapes describing various relaxation techniques...
example.tran: 我收集了一些介绍各种放松技巧的卡带。

example.ex: Stocks of ammunition were running low.
example.tran: 弹药的库存正在减少。

collins.def: The stock of something is the total amount of it that is available in a particular area.

example.ex: ...the stock of accommodation available to be rented.
example.tran: 可供租赁的住房储备量

collins.def: If you are from a particular stock, you are descended from a particular group of people.

example.ex: We are both from working class stock.
example.tran: 我们俩都出身于工人家庭。

example.ex: ...blacks, Asians and people of Mediterranean stock.
example.tran: 黑人、亚洲人和地中海沿岸高加索人的后裔

collins.tran: (尤指经过特殊饲养的)家畜，牲畜
collins.def: Stock are cattle, sheep, pigs, or other animals which are kept by a farmer, usually ones which have been specially bred.

example.ex: I am carefully selecting the breeding stock...
example.tran: 我正在精心挑选种畜。

example.ex: His herd of 170 dairy cattle and 200 young stock are kept on the land.
example.tran: 他那170头奶牛和200头乳牛都在那块地上圈养。

collins.tran: (回答、说法或做事方式)老一套的，陈腐的
collins.def: A stock answer, expression, or way of doing something is one that is very commonly used, especially because people cannot be bothered to think of something new.

example.ex: My boss had a stock response — 'If it ain't broke, don't fix it!'...
example.tran: 我上司总是这一句——“别没事找事！”

example.ex: National security is the stock excuse for keeping things confidential.
example.tran: 国家安全常被用作对一些事情保密的挡箭牌。

collins.def: Stock is a liquid, usually made by boiling meat, bones, or vegetables in water, that is used to give flavour to soups and sauces.
In former times, the stocks were an instrument of punishment. A criminal's hands and legs were locked into holes in a wooden frame while people threw things at them.
If goods are in stock, a shop has them available to sell. If they are out of stock, it does not.

example.ex: Check that your size is in stock...
example.tran: 查查你的尺码是否有货。

example.ex: Lemon and lime juice were both temporarily out of stock.
example.tran: 柠檬汁和酸橙汁暂时都缺货。

collins.tran: 作出整体估量;全面分析
collins.def: If you take stock, you pause to think about all the aspects of a situation or event before deciding what to do next.

example.ex: It was time to take stock of the situation...
example.tran: 是时候统观一下形势了。

example.ex: I was forty, the age when people take stock and change their lives.
example.tran: 我已年届不惑，到了该全面审视自己并改变生活的年龄了。

collins.def: If a company or business person makes an acquisition, they buy another company or part of a company.

example.ex: ...the acquisition of a profitable paper recycling company.
example.tran: 对一家效益好的纸张回收公司的收购

example.ex: ...the number of mergers and acquisitions made by Europe's 1,000 leading firms.
example.tran: 欧洲1,000家龙头企业的合并和收购案例的数目

collins.def: If you make an acquisition, you buy or obtain something, often to add to things that you already have.

example.ex: How did you go about making this marvellous acquisition then?
example.tran: 那么你是怎么买到这一绝品的？

example.ex: ...the President's recent acquisition of a helicopter.
example.tran: 总统最近添置的直升机

collins.def: You can use acquisition to refer to an object that you buy or obtain, often to add to things that you already have.

example.ex: From her wardrobe Laura took her latest acquisition, a bright red dress.
example.tran: 劳拉从衣柜里拿出了她最近的购物战果，一件鲜红色连衣裙。

collins.def: The acquisition of a skill or a particular type of knowledge is the process of learning it or developing it.

example.ex: ...language acquisition.
example.tran: 语言习得

collins.def: A cable is a thick wire, or a group of wires inside a rubber or plastic covering, which is used to carry electricity or electronic signals.

example.ex: ...overhead power cables.
example.tran: 高架电缆

example.ex: ...strings of coloured lights with weatherproof cable.
example.tran: 搭在防风雨的绝缘电线上的串串彩灯

collins.def: A cable is a kind of very strong, thick rope, made of wires twisted together.

example.ex: ...the heavy anchor cable...
example.tran: 沉重的锚链

example.ex: Steel cable will be used to replace worn ropes.
example.tran: 将用钢缆替换磨损的绳索。

collins.def: Cable is used to refer to television systems in which the signals are sent along underground wires rather than by radio waves.

example.ex: They ran commercials on cable systems across the country...
example.tran: 他们在全国的有线电视网上投放商业广告。

example.ex: The channel is only available on cable.
example.tran: 这个频道只有有线电视才能收看。

collins.def: A cable is the same as a telegram .

example.ex: She sent a cable to her mother.
example.tran: 她给母亲发了封电报。

collins.def: If you cable someone, you send them a message in the form of a telegram.

example.ex: 'Don't do it again,' Franklin cabled her when he got her letter...
example.tran: 富兰克林收到她的信后给她拍了封电报,说:“别再那么做了。”

example.ex: She had to decide whether or not to cable the news to Louis.
example.tran: 她得决定要不要将这个消息电告路易斯。

collins.def: If a country, a city, or someone's home is cabled, cables and other equipment are put in place so that the people there can receive cable television.

example.ex: In France, 27 major cities are soon to be cabled...
example.tran: 法国有27座大城市不久将安装有线电视。

example.ex: In the UK, 254,000 homes are cabled.
example.tran: 在英国,有254,000户住户安装了有线电视。

collins.tran: (尤指选票或比分的)差额，差数
collins.def: A margin is the difference between two amounts, especially the difference in the number of votes or points between the winner and the loser in an election or other contest.

example.ex: They could end up with a 50-point winning margin...
example.tran: 他们最终可能会以50分的优势获胜。

example.ex: The Sunday Times remains the brand leader by a huge margin...
example.tran: 《星期日泰晤士报》仍以巨大的优势稳居报业龙头的地位。

collins.def: The margin of a written or printed page is the empty space at the side of the page.

example.ex: She added her comments in the margin.
example.tran: 她在页边的空白处写下了评语。

collins.def: If there is a margin for something in a situation, there is some freedom to choose what to do or decide how to do it.

example.ex: The money is collected in a straightforward way with little margin for error...
example.tran: 钱是直接筹集上来的，不太容易出错。

example.ex: These charges can carry prison terms of up to five years, though there's a wide margin of discretion...
example.tran: 尽管量刑幅度很大，但是这些指控仍面临长达5年的刑期。

collins.def: The margin of a place or area is the extreme edge of it.

example.ex: ...the low coastal plain along the western margin...
example.tran: 沿着西部边缘的地势低平的沿海平原

example.ex: These islands are on the margins of human habitation.
example.tran: 这些岛屿位于人类聚居地的边缘。

collins.tran: （社会、群体或活动中的）边缘地位，非主体地位
collins.def: To be on the margins of a society, group, or activity means to be among the least typical or least important parts of it.

example.ex: Students have played an important role in the past, but for the moment, they're on the margins.
example.tran: 学生过去曾经发挥了重要的作用，不过现在他们变得无足轻重了。

example.ex: ...signs of the party's rapid retreat to the political margins.
example.tran: 该党在政治上迅速失势的种种迹象

collins.def: A pick-up or a pick-up truck is a small truck with low sides that can be easily loaded and unloaded.
A pick-up in trade or in a country's economy is an improvement in it.

example.ex: ...a pick-up in the housing market...
example.tran: 房地产市场的回暖

example.ex: The economy remains deep in recession with few signs of a pick-up.
example.tran: 经济仍深陷衰退之中，几乎没有好转的迹象。

collins.def: A pick-up takes place when someone picks up a person or thing that is waiting to be collected.

example.ex: The company had pick-up points in most cities...
example.tran: 这家公司在大部分城市都有提货点。

example.ex: Trains will operate from Waterloo with a pick-up stop at Ashford.
example.tran: 火车从滑铁卢站出发，途中会在阿什福德站停靠上人。

collins.tran: （以发生性关系为目的的）搭识，搭讪
collins.def: When a pick-up takes place, someone talks to a person in a friendly way in the hope of having a casual sexual relationship with them.

example.ex: They had come to the world's most famous pick-up joint.
example.tran: 他们已来到了世界上最著名的调情场所。

collins.def: Immigration is the coming of people into a country in order to live and work there.

example.ex: The government has decided to tighten its immigration policy.
example.tran: 政府决定实施更加严格的移民政策。

example.ex: ...immigration into Europe.
example.tran: 移居欧洲

collins.def: Immigration or immigration control is the place at a port, airport, or international border where officials check the passports of people who wish to come into the country.
If you recruit people for an organization, you select them and persuade them to join it or work for it.

example.ex: The police are trying to recruit more black and Asian officers...
example.tran: 警方正在试图招募更多黑人和亚裔警官。

example.ex: In recruiting students to Computer Systems Engineering, the University looks for evidence of all-round ability...
example.tran: 在招收计算机系统工程专业的学生时，这个大学看重的是学生的综合能力。

collins.def: A recruit is a person who has recently joined an organization or an army.

collins.tran: 惊奇的;惊讶的;觉得奇怪的;感觉意外的
collins.def: If you are surprised at something, you have a feeling of surprise, because it is unexpected or unusual.

example.ex: This lady was genuinely surprised at what happened to her pet...
example.tran: 这位女士对发生在自己宠物身上的事感到非常惊讶。

example.ex: Chang seemed surprised to find the big living-room empty...
example.tran: 张看到偌大的客厅里空无一人，似乎很惊讶。

means: 变迁，变化，变换，替换，更换，掉换，更易，代用

collins.def: If you shift something or if it shifts, it moves slightly.

example.ex: He stopped, shifting his cane to his left hand...
example.tran: 他停了下来，将手杖移到左手。

example.ex: He shifted from foot to foot...
example.tran: 他从一只脚换到另一只脚。

collins.tran: (意见、情况、政策)有所变动，稍作改变;使发生些许变化
collins.def: If someone's opinion, a situation, or a policy shifts or is shifted, it changes slightly.

example.ex: Attitudes to mental illness have shifted in recent years...
example.tran: 最近几年对精神病的态度已有所改变。

example.ex: The emphasis should be shifted more towards Parliament.
example.tran: 重点应更多地转向议会。

collins.def: If someone shifts the responsibility or blame for something onto you, they unfairly make you responsible or make people blame you for it, instead of them.

example.ex: It was a vain attempt to shift the responsibility for the murder to somebody else...
example.tran: 试图将谋杀的罪责转嫁给他人是徒劳的。

example.ex: Their husbands try to shift the blame by accusing them of having 'suspicious minds'.
example.tran: 她们的丈夫指责她们“疑心太重”，试图以此来推诿责任。

collins.def: If a shop or company shifts goods, they sell goods that are difficult to sell.

example.ex: Some suppliers were selling at a loss to shift stock.
example.tran: 一些供应商赔本销售存货。

collins.def: If you shift gears in a car, you put the car into a different gear.

collins.tran: 轮班;当班时间;轮班职工
collins.def: If a group of factory workers, nurses, or other people work shifts, they work for a set period before being replaced by another group, so that there is always a group working. Each of these set periods is called a shift. You can also use shift to refer to a group of workers who work together on a particular shift.

example.ex: His father worked shifts in a steel mill.
example.tran: 他父亲是一家炼钢厂的轮班工人。

example.ex: ...workers coming home from the afternoon shift...
example.tran: 上完下午班回家的工人们

collins.tran: （政党等团体中的）强硬派，拒不妥协者
collins.def: The hardliners in a group such as a political party are the people who support a strict, fixed set of ideas that are often extreme, and who refuse to accept any change in them.

example.ex: Unionist hardliners warned the U.S. President he would not be welcome...
example.tran: 统一派强硬分子警告美国总统，他是不会受欢迎的。

collins.def: In Britain, a penny is one hundredth of a pound, or a coin worth this amount of money.

example.ex: Cider also goes up by a penny a pint while sparkling wine will cost another eight pence a bottle.
example.tran: 苹果酒每品脱也涨了1便士，而汽酒则每瓶涨了8便士。

example.ex: ...a shiny newly minted penny.
example.tran: 新铸造的锃亮的1便士硬币

collins.tran: 便士（英国1971年前使用的硬币，价值1/12先令）
collins.def: A penny is a British coin used before 1971 that was worth one twelfth of a shilling.
A penny is one cent, or a coin worth one cent.

example.ex: Unleaded gasoline rose more than a penny a gallon.
example.tran: 无铅汽油每加仑涨了1分多。

collins.def: If you say, for example, that you do not have a penny, or that something does not cost a penny, you are emphasizing that you do not have any money at all, or that something did not cost you any money at all.

example.ex: From the day you arrive at my house, you need not spend a single penny...
example.tran: 从你到我家那天起，你就一个子儿也不用花。

example.ex: The Brilliantons paid their rent on time and did not owe him a penny...
example.tran: 布里连顿夫妇按时交纳租金，一个子儿也不欠他的。

collins.tran: 恍然大悟；茅塞顿开；突然回过神来
collins.def: If you say the penny dropped, you mean that someone suddenly understood or realized something.

example.ex: 'Did he know who you are?' — 'I think so. I think the penny dropped.'
example.tran: “他知道你是谁吗？”——“我想是的。我觉得他是突然想到的。”

collins.def: If someone says that they are going to spend a penny, they mean that they are going to go to the toilet.
Things that are said to be two a penny or ten a penny are not valuable or interesting because they are very common and easy to find.

example.ex: Leggy blondes are two a penny in Hollywood.
example.tran: 在好莱坞，长腿金发美女遍地都是。

collins.tran: 物有所值；一分钱不白花
collins.def: If you say that something or someone is worth every penny, you mean that they are worth all the money that is spent on them.

example.ex: The operation cost £100,000 and it was worth every penny...
example.tran: 那次手术花了10万英镑，但是花得非常值。

example.ex: The directors of this company feel he's worth every penny.
example.tran: 这家公司的主管们觉得他值得栽培。

collins.tran: 巩固(地位);增强，加强(实力)
collins.def: If something strengthens a person or group or if they strengthen their position, they become more powerful and secure, or more likely to succeed.

example.ex: ...the new constitution, which strengthens the government and enables it to balance and check the powers of parliament and president...
example.tran: 巩固了政府的地位并使其能够制衡国会和总统权力的新宪法

example.ex: To strengthen his position in Parliament, he held talks with leaders of the Peasant Party...
example.tran: 为巩固其在国会中的地位，他曾与农民党的领导人进行多次会谈。

collins.tran: 支持，强化(论点或论据);使更有说服力
collins.def: If something strengthens a case or argument, it supports it by providing more reasons or evidence for it.

example.ex: He does not seem to be familiar with research which might have strengthened his own arguments.
example.tran: 他对那些本可以为他的观点提供佐证的研究似乎并不熟悉。

collins.tran: (使)(经济、工业)坚挺，壮大;(使)(货币)升值
collins.def: If a currency, economy, or industry strengthens, or if something strengthens it, it increases in value or becomes more successful.

example.ex: The dollar strengthened against most other currencies...
example.tran: 美元相对大多数其他货币都升值了。

example.ex: If the Government wants to save the Pound it should start by strengthening the British economy.
example.tran: 如果政府想让英镑保值，那么首先就应该加强英国的经济。

collins.tran: 加强，加大(法律、措施)的力度;(使)变得更严格
collins.def: If a government strengthens laws or measures or if they strengthen, they are made more severe.

example.ex: I am also looking urgently at how we can strengthen the law...
example.tran: 我也在急切地关注我们该如何加强法制。

example.ex: Community leaders want to strengthen controls at external frontiers...
example.tran: 社区领导想要加强对小区外围的管理。

collins.tran: 增强(决心或毅力);使更具信心;使更加坚定
collins.def: If something strengthens you or strengthens your resolve or character, it makes you more confident and determined.

example.ex: Any experience can teach and strengthen you, but particularly the more difficult ones...
example.tran: 任何经历都能使你从中受益并让你变得坚强，而那些比较艰难的经历尤其如此。

example.ex: This merely strengthens our resolve to win the league...
example.tran: 这只会更加坚定我们赢得联赛的决心。

collins.tran: 增进(关系或联系);(使)变得更紧密
collins.def: If something strengthens a relationship or link, or if a relationship or link strengthens, it makes it closer and more likely to last for a long time.

example.ex: It will draw you closer together, and it will strengthen the bond of your relationship...
example.tran: 这将使你们走得更近，并将增进你们之间的关系。

example.ex: His visit is intended to strengthen ties between the two countries...
example.tran: 他此次访问旨在增进两国间的关系。

collins.tran: 加强，加深(印象、感情、信念);(使)变得比较深刻;(使)坚定
collins.def: If something strengthens an impression, feeling, or belief, or if it strengthens, it becomes greater or affects more people.

example.ex: His speech strengthens the impression he is the main power in the organization...
example.tran: 他的演讲让人更加确信他才是该组织的主心骨。

example.ex: Every day of sunshine strengthens the feelings of optimism...
example.tran: 每天晒太阳让人心情更加开朗。

collins.def: If something strengthens your body or a part of your body, it makes it healthier, often in such a way that you can move or carry heavier things.

example.ex: Cycling is good exercise. It strengthens all the muscles of the body...
example.tran: 骑自行车是一项不错的锻炼方式。它能使身体各部分的肌肉更强健。

example.ex: Yoga can be used to strengthen the immune system.
example.tran: 瑜伽能增强人体免疫系统。

collins.def: If something strengthens an object or structure, it makes it able to be treated roughly or able to support heavy weights, without being damaged or destroyed.

example.ex: The builders will have to strengthen the existing joists with additional timber.
example.tran: 施工人员将不得不另外用木料加固现有的托梁。

collins.def: If the wind, current, or other force strengthens, it becomes faster or more powerful.

example.ex: As it strengthened the wind was veering southerly...
example.tran: 风越刮越大，逐渐转为南风。

example.ex: There was a short sharp shower followed by a strengthening breeze.
example.tran: 一场短时强阵雨后风势渐长。

collins.def: When one firm or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its own goods in preference to those of the other firm or country. You can also say that two firms or countries compete .

example.ex: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various store cards...
example.tran: 长久以来，这些银行一直在与美国运通公司的信用卡以及各式各样的商场赊购卡竞争。

example.ex: The stores will inevitably end up competing with each other in their push for increased market shares...
example.tran: 在努力争取更大的市场份额的过程中，这些商场最终将不可避免地相互展开竞争。

collins.def: If you compete with someone for something, you try to get it for yourself and stop the other person getting it. You can also say that two people compete for something.

example.ex: Kangaroos compete with sheep and cattle for sparse supplies of food and water...
example.tran: 袋鼠与牛羊争夺稀少的食物和水。

example.ex: Schools should not compete with each other or attempt to poach pupils...
example.tran: 学校之间不应该相互竞争，也不应该企图挖走彼此的学生。

collins.def: If you compete in a contest or a game, you take part in it.

example.ex: He will be competing in the London-Calais-London race...
example.tran: 他将参加伦敦至加来的航海往返赛。

example.ex: Dubbed foreign language films will not be allowed to compete for best film...
example.tran: 外国译制片不得参加最佳影片的角逐。

means: 台球、普尔和斯诺克击（球）入袋

collins.def: A pot is a deep round container used for cooking stews, soups, and other food.

example.ex: ...metal cooking pots.
example.tran: 金属炒锅

collins.def: You can use pot to refer to a teapot or coffee pot.

example.ex: There's tea in the pot.
example.tran: 壶里有茶。

collins.def: A pot is a cylindrical container for jam, paint, or some other thick liquid.

example.ex: Hundreds of jam pots lined her scrubbed shelves.
example.tran: 她那擦得干干净净的架子上排列着几百个果酱罐。

collins.def: A pot is the same as a flowerpot .
If you pot a young plant, or part of a plant, you put it into a container filled with soil, so it can grow there.

example.ex: Pot the cuttings individually.
example.tran: 把插条分别栽入盆中。

example.ex: ...potted plants.
example.tran: 盆栽植物

collins.def: Pot is sometimes used to refer to the drugs cannabis and marijuana.
If you have pots of money, you have a lot of it.

example.ex: He must have pots of money.
example.tran: 他一定有很多钱。

collins.tran: （一盘纸牌游戏中各玩家所下的）赌注总额，全部赌注
collins.def: In a card game, the pot is the money from all the players which the winner of the game will take as a prize.
You can refer to a fund consisting of money from several people as the pot .

example.ex: I've taken some money from the pot for wrapping paper.
example.tran: 我已从公共基金里拿了一些钱买包装纸。

collins.def: Someone who has a pot has a round, fat stomach which sticks out, either because they eat or drink too much, or because they have had very little to eat for some time.
A pot is a deep bowl which a small child uses instead of a toilet.
In the games of snooker and billiards, if you pot a ball, you succeed in hitting it into one of the pockets.

example.ex: He did not pot a ball for the next two frames.
example.tran: 他在接下来的两局中一杆未进。

collins.tran: （因无人照料或经营）垮掉，没落，衰落；荒废
collins.def: If something goes to pot, it loses all its good qualities because nobody looks after it or works at it.

example.ex: The neighbourhood really is going to pot.
example.tran: 这个街区确实在走向败落。

collins.def: If you take pot luck, you decide to do something even though you do not know what you will get as a result.

example.ex: If you haven't made an appointment, take pot luck and knock on the door...
example.tran: 如果你没有预约，就敲门试试运气吧。

example.ex: He scorns the 'pot-luck' approach.
