collins.def: If something such as costs are cut to the bone, they are reduced to the minimum possible.

example.ex: It has survived by cutting its costs to the bone...
example.tran: 它通过最大限度地降低运营成本生存了下来。

example.ex: Profit margins have been slashed to the bone in an attempt to keep turnover moving.
example.tran: 为了维持资金周转，利润率已被降为最低。

collins.def: You use to the bone to indicate that you are very deeply affected by something. For example, if you feel chilled to the bone, your whole body feels extremely cold, often because you have had a shock.

example.ex: What I saw chilled me to the bone.
example.tran: 我看到的景象令我不寒而栗。

collins.tran: （书面语中用于表示在交谈时作出回应或引起他人注意或表示惊讶、失望）啊
collins.def: Ah is used in writing to represent a noise that people make in conversation, for example to acknowledge or draw attention to something, or to express surprise or disappointment.

example.ex: I'm meeting Anna Langenbach. Ah, this seems to be the train now...
example.tran: 我要去见安娜·朗根巴赫。啊，这像是我要乘坐的火车了。

example.ex: Ah, so many questions, so little time.
example.tran: 啊，这么多问题，这么短的时间。

means: Common Agricultural Policy （欧共体）共同农业政策

collins.def: A cap is a soft, flat hat with a curved part at the front which is called a peak. Caps are usually worn by men and boys.

example.ex: ...a dark blue baseball cap.
example.tran: 深蓝色棒球帽

collins.def: A cap is a special hat which is worn as part of a uniform.

example.ex: ...a frontier guard in olive-grey uniform and a peaked cap.
example.tran: 身穿橄榄灰制服、头戴大盖帽的边境哨兵

collins.tran: 使入选国家(足球、橄榄球、板球等)队
collins.def: If a sports player is capped, they are chosen to represent their country in a team game such as football, rugby, or cricket.

example.ex: Rees, 32, has been capped for England 23 times.
example.tran: 里斯,32岁,曾经23次入选英格兰队。

example.ex: ...England's most capped rugby union player.
example.tran: 入选英格兰国家队次数最多的橄榄球协会运动员

collins.def: If a sports player represents their country in a team game such as football, rugby, or cricket, you can say that they have been awarded a cap .

example.ex: Mark Davis will win his first cap for Wales in Sunday's Test match against Australia.
example.tran: 星期天对阵澳大利亚的国际锦标赛,马克·戴维斯将首次代表威尔士国家队出战。

collins.tran: 首次入选国家队的选手
collins.def: You can refer to someone who is representing their country for the first time in a team game such as football, rugby, or cricket, as a new cap .

example.ex: The only new cap is Llanelli's 20-year-old left-wing Wayne Proctor.
example.tran: 唯一初次入选国家队的选手是来自拉内利的20岁左边锋韦恩·普罗克特。

collins.tran: (政府)限制(组织或地方议会的支出)，限定（预算）
collins.def: If the government caps an organization, council, or budget, it limits the amount of money that the organization or council is allowed to spend, or limits the size of the budget.

example.ex: The Secretary of State for Environment has the power to cap councils which spend excessively...
example.tran: 环境大臣有权限定那些铺张浪费的委员会的支出。

example.ex: Nearly half of all local councils face being capped.
example.tran: 所有地方议会有将近一半的开销将受到限制。

collins.def: The cap of a bottle is its lid.

example.ex: She unscrewed the cap of her water bottle and gave him a drink.
example.tran: 她拧开水瓶盖,让他喝了一口。

collins.def: A cap is a circular rubber device that a woman places inside her vagina to prevent herself from becoming pregnant.
If you cap one thing with another, you put the other thing on top.

example.ex: They had capped the roof with plywood.
example.tran: 他们在房顶上加盖了胶合板。

example.ex: ...homemade scones capped with cream.
example.tran: 涂有奶油的自制烤饼

collins.def: If someone says that a good or bad event caps a series of events, they mean it is the final event in the series, and the other events were also good or bad.

example.ex: The unrest capped a weekend of right-wing attacks on foreigners.
example.tran: 周末右翼分子对外国人的攻击最终演变成了这场骚乱。

collins.def: If someone's teeth are capped, covers are fixed over them so that they look better.

example.ex: He suddenly smiled, revealing teeth that had recently been capped...
example.tran: 他突然笑了出来,露出了刚箍过的牙。

example.ex: I had my teeth capped.
example.tran: 我戴了牙套。

collins.def: A cap is a small amount of explosive that is wrapped in paper. Caps are often used in toy guns.

collins.tran: 谦卑地索要；毕恭毕敬地请求
collins.def: If you go cap in hand to someone, you ask them very humbly to give you something or to do something for you.

example.ex: He has been given the unenviable task of going round, cap in hand, to various generous companies.
example.tran: 他被分配了一个苦差，要点头哈腰地去拜访那些愿意掏钱资助的公司。

collins.def: Vol. is used as a written abbreviation for (书面缩略=) volume when you are referring to one or more books in a series of books.
Something that is thin is much narrower than it is long.

example.ex: A thin cable carries the signal to a computer...
example.tran: 一根细电缆将信号传送给一台计算机。

example.ex: James's face was thin, finely boned, and sensitive.
example.tran: 詹姆斯面部瘦削，轮廓分明，容易过敏。

collins.def: A person or animal that is thin has no extra fat on their body .

example.ex: He was a tall, thin man with grey hair...
example.tran: 他是个瘦高个，头发灰白。

example.ex: He is small and very thin and has pale-white skin.
example.tran: 他个头瘦小，肤色苍白。

collins.def: Something such as paper or cloth that is thin is flat and has only a very small distance between its two opposite surfaces.

example.ex: ...a small, blue-bound book printed in fine type on thin paper...
example.tran: 一本用纸轻薄、字体精细的蓝皮小书

example.ex: A thin layer of topsoil was swept away.
example.tran: 薄薄的一层表土被冲走了。

collins.def: Liquids that are thin are weak and watery.

example.ex: The soup was thin and clear, yet mysteriously rich...
example.tran: 汤又稀又清，味道却出奇地浓。

example.ex: They are stirring huge pots of rice and thin vegetable soup over a fire made of charcoal.
example.tran: 他们搅动着架在木炭火堆上的大罐米饭和蔬菜清汤。

collins.def: A crowd or audience that is thin does not have many people in it.

example.ex: The crowd, which had been thin for the first half of the race, had now grown considerably.
example.tran: 比赛前半段观众还稀稀拉拉的，这时明显增多了。

collins.tran: (微笑)冷淡的，牵强的，不幽默的
collins.def: A thin smile is one that is not friendly or humorous.

example.ex: All she could manage was a thin, wan smile.
example.tran: 她极力挤出了一丝勉强的苦笑。

collins.def: Thin clothes are made from light cloth and are not warm to wear.

example.ex: Her gown was thin, and she shivered, partly from cold.
example.tran: 她的礼服很薄，浑身在发抖，一半是冻的。

collins.tran: (论点、解释)浅薄的，不足信的，说服力差的
collins.def: If you describe an argument or explanation as thin, you mean that it is weak and difficult to believe.

example.ex: However, the evidence is thin and, to some extent, ambiguous...
example.tran: 然而，这个证据难以令人信服，而且有点模棱两可。

example.ex: Even if the optimists' theory is true, it still seems a thin argument against reform.
example.tran: 就算乐观主义者的理论是对的，还是不足以阻止改革的进行。

collins.def: A voice or sound that is thin is high-pitched and not very loud.

example.ex: Her thin voice rose high in complaint.
example.tran: 她抱怨时抬高了尖细的嗓音。

collins.def: If someone's hair is described as thin, they do not have a lot of hair.

example.ex: She had pale thin yellow hair she pulled back into a bun.
example.tran: 她把一头稀疏的浅黄色头发向后梳，挽成了个圆髻。

collins.def: When you thin something or when it thins, it becomes less crowded because people or things have been removed from it.

example.ex: It would have been better to have thinned the trees over several winters rather than all at one time...
example.tran: 当初要是分几个冬天疏剪树木，会比一下子疏剪完效果好。

example.ex: By midnight the crowd had thinned.
example.tran: 半夜时分，人群渐渐散去了。

collins.tran: 使（调味汁或液体）变稀薄;使变淡
collins.def: To thin a sauce or liquid means to make it weaker and more watery by adding another liquid to it.

example.ex: It may be necessary to thin the sauce slightly...
example.tran: 可能有必要将酱汁稍稍稀释一下。

example.ex: Aspirin thins the blood, letting it flow more easily through narrowed blood vessels.
example.tran: 阿司匹林可以稀释血液，使其在变窄的血管里更顺畅地流动。

collins.def: If a man's hair is thinning, it has begun to fall out.

example.ex: His hair is thinning and his skin has lost all hint of youth.
example.tran: 他的头发开始脱落，皮肤也老化了。

collins.def: If someone's patience, for example, is wearing thin, they are beginning to become impatient or angry with someone.

example.ex: Parliament has not yet begun to combat the deepening economic crisis, and public patience is wearing thin.
example.tran: 议会还没有着手应对日益严重的经济危机，公众日渐失去了耐心。

collins.def: You use in spite of to introduce a fact which makes the rest of the statement you are making seem surprising.

example.ex: Josef Krips at the State Opera hired her in spite of the fact that she had never sung on stage...
example.tran: 尽管她从未在舞台上演唱过，国家歌剧院的约瑟夫·克里普斯还是聘用了她。

example.ex: Their love of life comes in spite of, almost in defiance of, considerable hardship.
example.tran: 尽管面临众多的艰难困苦，他们还是几乎义无反顾地表现出了对生活的热爱。

collins.def: If you do something in spite of yourself, you do it although you did not really intend to or expect to.

example.ex: The blunt comment made Richard laugh in spite of himself...
example.tran: 这番率直的话让理查德不由自主地大笑起来。

example.ex: She was deeply moved and in spite of herself could not help showing it.
example.tran: 她被深深地打动了，禁不住为之动容。

collins.def: If you do something cruel out of spite, you do it because you want to hurt or upset someone.

example.ex: I refused her a divorce, out of spite I suppose...
example.tran: 我拒绝和她离婚，就是为了出口恶气。

example.ex: Never had she met such spite and pettiness.
example.tran: 她从未见过这样的怨恨和偏狭。

collins.def: If you do something cruel to spite someone, you do it in order to hurt or upset them.

example.ex: Pantelaras was giving his art collection away for nothing, to spite Marie and her husband.
example.tran: 潘特拉拉斯将自己的艺术藏品全都无偿捐了出去，存心要激怒玛丽和她的丈夫。

collins.def: An examination is a formal test that you take to show your knowledge or ability in a particular subject, or to obtain a qualification.
If you have a medical examination, a doctor looks at your body, feels it, or does simple tests in order to check how healthy you are.

collins.tran: 过剩;剩余;过剩量;剩余额
collins.def: If there is a surplus of something, there is more than is needed.

example.ex: Germany suffers from a surplus of teachers.
example.tran: 德国遭遇了教师过剩的问题。

collins.def: Surplus is used to describe something that is extra or that is more than is needed.

example.ex: Few people have large sums of surplus cash...
example.tran: 几乎没人手头很富裕。

example.ex: I sell my surplus birds to a local pet shop...
example.tran: 我把多余的鸟卖给当地的宠物商店。

collins.def: If a country has a trade surplus, it exports more than it imports.

example.ex: Japan's annual trade surplus is in the region of 100 billion dollars.
example.tran: 日本每年的贸易顺差额在 1,000 亿美元左右。

collins.def: If a government has a budget surplus, it has spent less than it received in taxes.

example.ex: Norway's budget surplus has fallen from 5.9% in 1986 to an expected 0.1% this year.
example.tran: 挪威的预算盈余已经从 1986 年的 5.9%降至今年预计的 0.1%。

collins.def: A conviction is a strong belief or opinion.

example.ex: It is our firm conviction that a step forward has been taken...
example.tran: 我们坚信已经向前迈进了一步。

example.ex: Their religious convictions prevented them from taking up arms.
example.tran: 由于宗教信仰的原因，他们不会拿起武器进行反抗。

collins.def: If you have conviction, you have great confidence in your beliefs or opinions.

example.ex: 'We shall, sir,' said Thorne, with conviction.
example.tran: “我们会的，先生，”索恩坚定地说。

collins.def: If something carries conviction, it is likely to be true or likely to be believed.

example.ex: Nor did his denial carry conviction.
example.tran: 他的否认也没有说服力。

collins.def: If someone has a conviction, they have been found guilty of a crime in a court of law.

example.ex: He will appeal against his conviction...
example.tran: 他会对判决提起上诉。

example.ex: The man was known to the police because of previous convictions.
example.tran: 因为有犯罪前科，警察们都认识这个人。

collins.def: If someone permits something, they allow it to happen. If they permit you to do something, they allow you to do it.

example.ex: He can let the court's decision stand and permit the execution...
example.tran: 他有权维持法庭判决，批准死刑生效。

example.ex: The guards permitted me to bring my camera and tape recorder...
example.tran: 卫兵准许我带相机和录音机。

collins.def: A permit is an official document which says that you may do something. For example you usually need a permit to work in a foreign country.

example.ex: The majority of foreign nationals working here have work permits...
example.tran: 大多数在这里工作的外国人都有工作许可证。

example.ex: He has to apply for a permit, and we have to find him a job.
example.tran: 他必须要申请工作许可证，我们得给他找份工作。

collins.def: If a situation permits something, it makes it possible for that thing to exist, happen, or be done or it provides the opportunity for it.

example.ex: He sets about creating an environment that just doesn't permit experiment, it encourages it...
example.tran: 他着手营造一种不仅可以进行试验而且鼓励进行试验的环境。

example.ex: Try to go out for a walk at lunchtime, if the weather permits...
example.tran: 只要天气不太差，中午尽量出去散散步。

collins.def: If you permit yourself something, you allow yourself to do something that you do not normally do or that you think you probably should not do.

example.ex: Captain Bowen permitted himself one cigar a day...
example.tran: 鲍恩上尉破例允许自己每天抽一支雪茄。

example.ex: Only once in his life had Douglas permitted himself to lose control of his emotions.
example.tran: 道格拉斯一生中只有一次情绪失控。

collins.def: You can use permit me when you are about to say something or to make a suggestion.

example.ex: Permit me to give you some advice...
example.tran: 请允许我给你提点建议。

example.ex: Permit me to offer you my sincere congratulations.
example.tran: 谨致衷心祝贺。

means: [语音学、韵律学]音量（指元音或音节的长短）

collins.def: A quantity is an amount that you can measure or count.

example.ex: ...a small quantity of water.
example.tran: 少量的水

example.ex: ...vast quantities of food...
example.tran: 大量食品

collins.def: Things that are produced or available in quantity are produced or available in large amounts.

example.ex: After some initial problems, acetone was successfully produced in quantity...
example.tran: 解决了最初的一些问题之后，终于成功地制造出了大量丙酮。

example.ex: But even with those databases, the sheer quantity of data can still cause problems.
example.tran: 可是即便有了那些数据库，数据的数量之大仍然会带来问题。

collins.def: You can use quantity to refer to the amount of something that there is, especially when you want to contrast it with its quality.

example.ex: ...the less discerning drinker who prefers quantity to quality...
example.tran: 不求质、但求量的不那么识货的饮酒者

example.ex: In terms of quantity, production grew faster than ever before.
example.tran: 从数量上看，产量增长的速度比以往任何时期都要快。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is an unknown quantity, you mean that not much is known about what they are like or how they will behave.

example.ex: He is an unknown quantity for his rivals.
example.tran: 对于对手们而言，他是个未知数。

collins.def: Preparation is the process of getting something ready for use or for a particular purpose or making arrangements for something.

example.ex: Rub the surface of the wood in preparation for the varnish...
example.tran: 打磨木头的表面，为刷清漆做准备。

example.ex: Few things distracted the Pastor from the preparation of his weekly sermons...
example.tran: 几乎没有什么事情能使牧师在准备每周的布道时分神。

collins.tran: 准备工作；预备工作；筹备工作
collins.def: Preparations are all the arrangements that are made for a future event.

example.ex: The United States is making preparations for a large-scale airlift of 1,200 American citizens...
example.tran: 美国正在为运送1,200名美国公民的大规模空运做准备。

example.ex: Final preparations are under way for celebrations to mark German unification.
example.tran: 纪念德国统一的庆典活动正在做最后的准备工作。

collins.tran: （食物、医药、化妆品的）制剂，配制品
collins.def: A preparation is a mixture that has been prepared for use as food, medicine, or a cosmetic.

example.ex: ...anti-ageing creams and sensitive-skin preparations.
example.tran: 抗衰老面霜和敏感性皮肤适用的护肤制剂

collins.tran: 相对而言;比较起来;某种程度上
collins.def: Relatively means to a certain degree, especially when compared with other things of the same kind.

example.ex: The sums needed are relatively small...
example.tran: 需要的金额相对较小。

example.ex: I like to think I'm relatively easy to get along with.
example.tran: 我愿意认为自己相对比较容易相处。

collins.def: Resistance to something such as a change or a new idea is a refusal to accept it.

example.ex: The US wants big cuts in European agricultural export subsidies, but this is meeting resistance.
example.tran: 美国想大幅度削减欧洲农业出口补贴，但此举遭到了抵制。

collins.def: Resistance to an attack consists of fighting back against the people who have attacked you.

example.ex: The troops are encountering stiff resistance...
example.tran: 军队遭遇了顽强抵抗。

example.ex: Police in riot gear cleared the noisy demonstrators, who offered no resistance.
example.tran: 身穿防暴服的警察驱散了喧闹的游行者，没有遇到抵抗。

collins.def: The resistance of your body to germs or diseases is its power to remain unharmed or unaffected by them.

example.ex: This disease is surprisingly difficult to catch as most people have a natural resistance to it.
example.tran: 由于多数人对这种病具有天然免疫力，所以发病率低得出奇。

collins.def: Wind or air resistance is a force which slows down a moving object or vehicle.

example.ex: The design of the bicycle has managed to reduce the effects of wind resistance and drag.
example.tran: 这种自行车的设计成功地减少了风的阻力和摩擦力。

collins.def: In electrical engineering or physics, resistance is the ability of a substance or an electrical circuit to stop the flow of an electrical current through it.

example.ex: ...materials that lose all their electrical resistance.
example.tran: 电阻为零的材料

collins.tran: （被他国军队占领或被专制政府统治的国家中的）抵抗组织，地下组织
collins.def: In a country which is occupied by the army of another country, or which has a very harsh and strict government, the resistance is an organized group of people who are involved in illegal activities against the people in power.

example.ex: They managed to escape after being arrested by the resistance.
example.tran: 他们被抵抗组织抓住后又设法逃脱了。

collins.tran: 阻力最小的路线;最容易的途径
collins.def: If you take the line of least resistance in a situation, you do what is easiest, even though you think that it may not be the right thing to do. In American English, you usually talk about the path of least resistance .

example.ex: They would rather take the line of least resistance than become involved in arguments.
example.tran: 他们倾向采用阻力最小的方案，不愿卷入纷争。

collins.def: A mask is a piece of cloth or other material, which you wear over your face so that people cannot see who you are, or so that you look like someone or something else.

example.ex: The gunman, whose mask had slipped, fled.
example.tran: 面罩掉落的持枪歹徒逃之夭夭了。

example.ex: ...actors wearing masks.
example.tran: 戴面具的演员们

collins.tran: （防细菌或有害物质的）防护面罩,面具，口罩
collins.def: A mask is a piece of cloth or other material that you wear over all or part of your face to protect you from germs or harmful substances.

example.ex: You must wear goggles and a mask that will protect you against the fumes...
example.tran: 为了免受烟雾危害，你必须戴上护目镜和面罩。

example.ex: She wore a surgical mask and rubber gloves while she worked with the samples.
example.tran: 她处理样品的时候戴着手术口罩和橡胶手套。

collins.tran: (掩盖真实感情或性格的)伪装，掩饰
collins.def: If you describe someone's behaviour as a mask, you mean that they do not show their real feelings or character.

example.ex: His mask of detachment cracked, and she saw for an instant an angry and violent man.
example.tran: 他冷静超然的伪装破碎了，一瞬间她的面前出现了一个愤怒而又狂暴的男人。

collins.def: A mask is a thick cream or paste made of various substances, which you spread over your face and leave for some time in order to improve your skin.

example.ex: This mask leaves your complexion feeling soft and supple.
example.tran: 这种面膜能使你的皮肤变得柔软细嫩。

collins.def: If you mask your feelings, you deliberately do not show them in your behaviour, so that people cannot know what you really feel.

example.ex: Dena lit a cigarette, trying to mask her agitation.
example.tran: 德娜点燃了一根烟，试图掩饰不安。

collins.def: If one thing masks another, it prevents people from noticing or recognizing  the other thing.

example.ex: A thick grey cloud masked the sun...
example.tran: 一片厚厚的乌云遮住了太阳。

example.ex: Too much salt masks the true flavour of the food...
example.tran: 太多的盐会盖住食物本来的味道。

collins.tran: 防卫;保安措施;安全工作
collins.def: Security refers to all the measures that are taken to protect a place, or to ensure that only people with permission enter it or leave it.

example.ex: They are now under a great deal of pressure to tighten their airport security...
example.tran: 他们现在承受着加强机场安保措施的巨大压力。

example.ex: Strict security measures are in force in the capital.
example.tran: 首都采取了严密的安全措施。

collins.def: A feeling of security is a feeling of being safe and free from worry.

example.ex: He loves the security of a happy home life...
example.tran: 他喜欢幸福家庭生活所带来的安全感。

example.ex: If an alarm gives you that feeling of security, then it's worth carrying.
example.tran: 如果带着闹钟让你感到心里踏实，那就值得携带。

collins.def: If something is security for a loan, you promise to give that thing to the person who lends you money, if you fail to pay the money back.

example.ex: The central bank will provide special loans, and the banks will pledge the land as security.
example.tran: 中央银行会提供特殊贷款，而这些银行会以土地作为抵押。

collins.def: Securities are stocks, shares, bonds, or other certificates that you buy in order to earn regular interest from them or to sell them later for a profit.

example.ex: National banks can package their own mortgages and underwrite them as securities.
example.tran: 国家银行能够合并自己的抵押贷款并以证券形式包销。

example.ex: ...US government securities and bonds.
example.tran: 美国政府证券和债券

collins.def: To prompt someone to do something means to make them decide to do it.

example.ex: Japan's recession has prompted consumers to cut back on buying cars...
example.tran: 日本经济的不景气使得消费者在购买车辆上减少了开支。

example.ex: The need for villagers to control their own destinies has prompted a new plan.
example.tran: 村民们想要掌握自己的命运，这促成了一项新的计划。

collins.tran: 鼓励，提示（说话者）；给（演员）提词
collins.def: If you prompt someone when they stop speaking, you encourage or help them to continue. If you prompt an actor, you tell them what their next line is when they have forgotten what comes next.

example.ex: 'Go on,' the therapist prompted him...
example.tran: “接着说，”医生鼓励他道。

example.ex: How exactly did he prompt her, Mr Markham?
example.tran: 确切地说，他是怎样提示她的，马卡姆先生？

collins.tran: 迅速的；即刻的；立即的；及时的
collins.def: A prompt action is done without any delay.

example.ex: It is not too late, but prompt action is needed.
example.tran: 现在还不算晚，但是需要立即采取行动。

example.ex: ...an inflammation of the eyeball which needs prompt treatment.
example.tran: 需要立即治疗的眼球炎症

collins.def: If you are prompt to do something, you do it without delay or you are not late.

example.ex: You have been so prompt in carrying out all these commissions...
example.tran: 你执行所有这些命令可真够迅速的。

example.ex: We didn't worry because they were always so prompt with their rental payment.
example.tran: 我们不担心，因为他们交租金总是非常及时。

collins.def: Something that is limited is not very great in amount, range, or degree.

example.ex: They may only have a limited amount of time to get their points across...
example.tran: 他们可能只有有限的时间来说明自己的意思。

example.ex: Shops have a very limited selection.
example.tran: 商店里的选择非常有限。

collins.def: A limited company is one whose owners are legally responsible for only a part of any money that it may owe if it goes bankrupt.

example.ex: They had plans to turn the club into a limited company...
example.tran: 他们计划将这个俱乐部变为一家股份有限公司。

example.ex: He is the founder of International Sports Management Limited.
example.tran: 他是国际体育管理有限公司的创始人。

collins.def: The founder of an institution, organization, or building is the person who got it started or caused it to be built, often by providing the necessary money.

example.ex: He was one of the founders of the university's medical faculty.
example.tran: 他是该大学医学院的创建人之一。

collins.def: If something such as a plan or project founders, it fails because of a particular point, difficulty, or problem.

example.ex: The talks have foundered, largely because of the reluctance of some members of the government to do a deal with criminals.
example.tran: 对话已经破裂了，原因主要是因为一些政府成员不愿意和犯罪分子达成协议。

collins.def: If a ship founders, it fills with water and sinks.

example.ex: Three ships foundered in heavy seas.
example.tran: 三艘船在波涛汹涌的海面上沉没了。

collins.def: A charter is a formal document describing the rights, aims, or principles of an organization or group of people.

example.ex: ...Article 50 of the United Nations Charter.
example.tran: 《联合国宪章》第50款

example.ex: ...the Social Charter of workers' rights.
example.tran: 保障劳工权利的《社会宪章》

collins.def: A charter plane or boat is one which is hired for use by a particular person or group and which is not part of a regular service.

example.ex: ...the last charter plane carrying out foreign nationals.
example.tran: 运送外国侨民出境的最后一架包机

example.ex: ...frequent charter flights to Spain.
example.tran: 到西班牙的定期包机航班

collins.tran: (个人、团体)包租，租用(飞机、船只等)
collins.def: If a person or organization charters a plane, boat, or other vehicle, they hire it for their own use.

example.ex: He chartered a jet to fly her home from California to Switzerland...
example.tran: 他包了架喷气式飞机把她从加利福尼亚送回瑞士家里。

example.ex: Yesterday, a cargo ship chartered by the UN arrived in the capital carrying 1,550 tons of rice.
example.tran: 昨天，一艘联合国租用的货船到达首都，船上载有1,550吨大米。

collins.def: If you describe a decision or policy as a charter for someone or something you disapprove of, you mean that it is likely to help or encourage them.

example.ex: They described the Home Office scheme as a 'charter for cheats'...
example.tran: 他们称内政部的方案是“对诈骗的纵容”。

example.ex: They condemned the white paper as a charter for centralisation and selective education.
example.tran: 他们谴责白皮书是在怂恿中央集权和精英教育。

collins.def: A cake is a sweet food made by baking a mixture of flour, eggs, sugar, and fat in an oven. Cakes may be large and cut into slices or small and intended for one person only.

example.ex: ...a piece of cake...
example.tran: 一块蛋糕

example.ex: Would you like some chocolate cake?
example.tran: 来点巧克力蛋糕怎么样?

collins.def: Food that is formed into flat round shapes before it is cooked can be referred to as cakes .

example.ex: ...fish cakes.
example.tran: 鱼饼

example.ex: ...home-made potato cakes.
example.tran: 自家做的土豆饼

collins.def: A cake of soap is a small block of it.

example.ex: ...a small cake of lime-scented soap.
example.tran: 一小块青柠味香皂

collins.def: If something such as blood or mud cakes, it changes from a thick liquid to a dry layer or lump.

example.ex: The blood had begun to cake and turn brown.
example.tran: 血开始结块变黑。

collins.tran: 二者兼得;鱼与熊掌兼得
collins.def: If you think that someone wants the benefits of doing two things when it is only reasonable to expect the benefits of doing one, you can say that they want to have their cake and eat it .

example.ex: What he wants is a switch to a market economy in a way which does not reduce people's standard of living. To many this sounds like wanting to have his cake and eat it.
example.tran: 他想要转型为市场经济,同时又不降低人们的生活水平。在许多人看来,这是想要鱼与熊掌兼得。

collins.tran: 非常抢手;非常畅销;热销
collins.def: If things are selling like hot cakes, a lot of people are buying them.

example.ex: Books on the Royal Family are selling like hot cakes.
example.tran: 有关皇室的书卖得正火。

collins.tran: 小事一桩，易如反掌，小菜一碟（常用于安慰别人）
collins.def: If you think something is very easy to do, you can say it is a piece of cake. People often say this to stop someone feeling worried about doing something they have to do.

example.ex: Getting rid of him will be a piece of cake...
example.tran: 摆脱掉他就是小事一桩。

example.ex: Just another surveillance job, old chap. Piece of cake to somebody like you.
example.tran: 老伙计,只不过又是一份盯梢的活。对你这样的人来说还不是小菜一碟。

collins.tran: (愚蠢、无礼、自私的行为）非常过分，极其讨厌
collins.def: If someone has done something very stupid, rude, or selfish, you can say that they take the cake or that what they have done takes the cake, to emphasize your surprise at their behaviour.
Someone who is mad has a mind that does not work in a normal way, with the result that their behaviour is very strange.

example.ex: She was afraid of going mad.
example.tran: 她担心自己会疯掉。

example.ex: ...the mad old lady from down the street.
example.tran: 沿街走来的那位精神失常的老太太

collins.def: You use mad to describe people or things that you think are very foolish.

example.ex: You'd be mad to work with him again...
example.tran: 你要再和他一起工作那简直是疯了。

example.ex: Isn't that a rather mad idea?
example.tran: 那难道不是一个愚蠢透顶的想法吗？

collins.def: If you say that someone is mad, you mean that they are very angry.

example.ex: You're just mad at me because I don't want to go...
example.tran: 因为我不想去，你就对我火冒三丈。

example.ex: I'm pretty mad about it, I can tell you.
example.tran: 告诉你，我对这件事感到非常恼火。

collins.def: If you are mad about or mad on something or someone, you like them very much indeed.

example.ex: She's not as mad about sport as I am...
example.tran: 她不像我对体育那么痴迷。

example.ex: He's mad about you...
example.tran: 他很迷恋你。

collins.def: Mad behaviour is wild and uncontrolled.

example.ex: You only have an hour to complete the game so it's a mad dash against the clock...
example.tran: 你只有一个小时来完成这场比赛，所以得铆足劲头争分夺秒。

example.ex: The audience went mad.
example.tran: 观众们十分狂热。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something drives you mad, you mean that you find them extremely annoying.

example.ex: There are certain things he does that drive me mad...
example.tran: 他的某些举动让我很生气。

example.ex: This itching is driving me mad.
example.tran: 这种瘙痒简直快把我折磨疯了。

collins.def: If you do something like mad, you do it very energetically or enthusiastically.

example.ex: He was weight training like mad.
example.tran: 他在拼命地进行负重训练。

collins.def: Someone's rank is the position or grade that they have in an organization.

example.ex: He eventually rose to the rank of captain...
example.tran: 他终于升职当上了船长。

example.ex: The former head of counter-intelligence had been stripped of his rank and privileges.
example.tran: 反情报机构的前任长官被革职并剥夺了特权。

collins.tran: （尤指社会地位高的）阶级，地位
collins.def: Someone's rank is the social class, especially the high social class, that they belong to.

example.ex: Each rank of the peerage was represented...
example.tran: 每个贵族阶级都有代表。

example.ex: He must be treated as a hostage of high rank, not as a common prisoner.
example.tran: 必须把他当成高级人质来对待，而不能像对待普通囚犯那样。

collins.def: If an official organization ranks someone or something 1st, 5th, or 50th, for example, they calculate that the person or thing has that position on a scale. You can also say that someone or something ranks 1st, 5th, or 50th, for example.

example.ex: The report ranks the UK 20th out of 22 advanced nations...
example.tran: 报告中把英国排在22个先进国家中的第20位。

example.ex: He was at the time ranked 10th in the world and had a regular place in the Swedish Davis Cup team...
example.tran: 他那时世界排名第10，并且是瑞典戴维斯杯队的主力队员。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something ranks high or low on a scale or if you rank them high or low, you are saying how good or important you think they are.

example.ex: His prices rank high among those of other contemporary photographers...
example.tran: 在当代摄影师当中，他的要价很高。

example.ex: Investors ranked South Korea high among Asian nations...
example.tran: 在亚洲各国当中，投资者很看重韩国。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something ranks with a group of famous people or things, you mean that they are extremely good and should be included in that group.

example.ex: ...a performance of heroic calibre that must rank with the most memorable in international rugby...
example.tran: 必被列为国际橄榄球赛中最令人难忘的一场荡气回肠的比赛

example.ex: As a novel, Nineteen Eighty-four hardly ranks with the greats.
example.tran: 作为一部小说，《一九八四》很难被列为杰作。

collins.tran: （团体或组织的）全体成员;队伍
collins.def: The ranks of a group or organization are the people who belong to it.

example.ex: There were some misgivings within the ranks of the media too...
example.tran: 媒体内部也存在一些疑虑。

example.ex: The General Assembly welcomed five new members to its ranks.
example.tran: 联合国大会对5个新成员国的加入表示了欢迎。

collins.tran: 普通成员；（尤指军队的）普通士兵
collins.def: The ranks are the ordinary members of an organization, especially of the armed forces.

example.ex: Top military leaders say there have been reports of demoralization in the ranks...
example.tran: 最高军事指挥说有报告称士兵中出现了士气低落。

example.ex: Most store managers have worked their way up through the ranks.
example.tran: 大多数商店经理都是由普通店员干起，一步步升上来的。

collins.def: A rank of people or things is a row of them.

example.ex: Ranks of police in riot gear stood nervously by...
example.tran: 一队队防暴警察紧张待命。

example.ex: She continued to smile at the ranks of cameras on their doorstep.
example.tran: 她依旧对着门口的一排排照相机微笑着。

collins.def: A taxi rank is a place on a city street where taxis park when they are available for hire.

example.ex: The man led the way to the taxi rank...
example.tran: 那人带路来到了出租汽车候客处。

example.ex: He walked towards the first taxi on the rank.
example.tran: 他朝着停车处的第一辆出租车走去。

collins.def: You can use rank to emphasize a bad or undesirable quality that exists in an extreme form.

example.ex: He called it 'rank hypocrisy' that the government was now promoting equal rights.
example.tran: 他把目前政府提倡平等权利的举措称为“彻头彻尾的伪善”。

collins.tran: 臭气难闻的；（气味）令人恶心的
collins.def: You can describe something as rank when it has a strong and unpleasant smell.

example.ex: The kitchen was rank with the smell of drying uniforms.
example.tran: 厨房内充斥着烘干制服的难闻气味。

example.ex: ...the rank smell of unwashed clothes.
example.tran: 脏衣服所发出的臭味

collins.tran: （队伍、组织的成员等）违反指令，抗命
collins.def: If you say that a member of a group or organization breaks ranks, you mean that they disobey the instructions of their group or organization.

example.ex: 'Even the President's staunchest supporters have some issues where they simply must break ranks,' says Senator Lott...
example.tran: “即使是总统最忠实的拥护者在某些事情上也会不听指令，”参议员洛特说。

example.ex: Britain appears unlikely to break ranks with other members of the European Union.
example.tran: 英国看起来不会与欧盟的其他成员反目。

collins.tran: （在受到批评时）捐弃嫌隙而携手合作，抱成一团
collins.def: If you say that the members of a group close ranks, you mean that they are supporting each other only because their group is being criticized.

example.ex: Conservative MPs intend to put aside their differences over Europe and close ranks behind the Prime Minister...
example.tran: 保守党下院议员打算暂且搁置他们在欧洲问题上的分歧，团结起来支持首相。

example.ex: Institutions tend to close ranks when a member has been accused of misconduct.
example.tran: 当其中某成员被谴责失职时，机构往往会抱成一团。

collins.tran: 步…后尘；经历（他人）曾经历过的（尤指坏事）
collins.def: If you experience something, usually something bad, that other people have experienced, you can say that you have joined their ranks .

example.ex: Last month, 370,000 Americans joined the ranks of the unemployed...
example.tran: 上个月，有37万美国人加入了失业者的行列。

collins.tran: 成功可能性不大的参赛者
collins.def: If one of the people in a competition is described as a rank outsider, they are considered to have very little chance of winning.

example.ex: The rank outsiders, Cameroon, beat the defending champions, Argentina, by one goal to nil.
example.tran: 本不被看好的喀麦隆队却以1比0击败了卫冕冠军阿根廷队。

collins.tran: 运用职权，滥用权力（压制他人）
collins.def: If you say that someone in authority pulls rank, you mean that they unfairly force other people to do what they want because of their higher rank or position.

example.ex: The Captain pulled rank and made his sergeant row the entire way.
example.tran: 上校倚仗权势让他的中士划船划了一路。

collins.def: A symptom of an illness is something wrong with your body or mind that is a sign of the illness.

example.ex: One of the most common symptoms of schizophrenia is hearing imaginary voices.
example.tran: 精神分裂症的最常见的一个症状就是幻听。

example.ex: ...patients with flu symptoms...
example.tran: 有流感症状的病人

collins.def: A symptom of a bad situation is something that happens which is considered to be a sign of this situation.

example.ex: Your problem with keeping boyfriends is just a symptom of a larger problem: making and keeping friends...
example.tran: 你在维系同男友的关系时遭遇的困难暴露了一个更大的问题：如何结交朋友和维持友谊。

example.ex: The contradictory statements are symptoms of disarray in the administration.
example.tran: 这些互相矛盾的说法反映了管理的混乱。

collins.def: If you leap, you jump high in the air or jump a long distance.

example.ex: He had leapt from a window in the building and escaped...
example.tran: 他从大楼一个窗口跳出去跑了。

example.ex: The newsreels show him leaping into the air...
example.tran: 新闻短片里有他跳向空中的画面。

collins.def: If you leap somewhere, you move there suddenly and quickly.

example.ex: The two men leaped into the jeep and roared off...
example.tran: 两名男子跳上吉普车，疾驰而去。

example.ex: With a terrible howl, he leapt forward and threw himself into the water.
example.tran: 他狂吼一声，向前猛冲，纵身跳进水中。

collins.def: If a vehicle leaps somewhere, it moves there in a short sudden movement.

example.ex: The car leapt forward.
example.tran: 汽车向前飞驰。

collins.def: A leap is a large and important change, increase, or advance.

example.ex: The result has been a giant leap in productivity.
example.tran: 其结果是生产力的大幅提高。

example.ex: ...the leap in the unemployed from 35,000 to 75,000...
example.tran: 由35,000猛增至75,000的失业人数

collins.def: If you leap to a particular place or position, you make a large and important change, increase, or advance.

example.ex: Warwicks leap to third in the table, 31 points behind leaders Essex.
example.tran: 沃里克队在排名中蹿升至第3名，落后领先的埃塞克斯队31分。

collins.tran: （因吃惊、害怕、高兴等心脏）猛地跳动
collins.def: If you say that your heart leaps, you mean that you experience a sudden, very strong feeling of surprise, fear, or happiness.

example.ex: My heart leaped at the sight of her.
example.tran: 我见到她时心都要跳出来了。

collins.def: If you leap at a chance or opportunity, you accept it quickly and eagerly.

example.ex: The post of principal of the theatre school became vacant and he leapt at the chance.
example.tran: 戏剧学校校长一职出缺，他马上抓住了这个机会。

collins.tran: （改善或增长）非常迅速地，飞跃地
collins.def: You can use in leaps and bounds or by leaps and bounds to emphasize that someone or something is improving or increasing quickly and greatly.

example.ex: He's improved in leaps and bounds this season...
example.tran: 他今季的表现一日千里。

example.ex: The total number of species on the planet appears to be growing by leaps and bounds.
example.tran: 地球上的物种数目似乎正飞速增长。

collins.def: If you take a leap in the dark or a leap into the unknown, you do something without having any previous experience in that activity or knowledge of it.

example.ex: Prudent people are not going to take a leap in the dark...
example.tran: 小心谨慎的人是不会轻易冒险的。

example.ex: Once more he's making a leap into the unknown without a plan.
example.tran: 他再次毫无计划地乱闯。

collins.tran: (房屋等)不太大的，不算昂贵的，普通的
collins.def: A modest house or other building is not large or expensive.

example.ex: ...the modest home of a family who lived off the land...
example.tran: 靠土地过活的一户人家的简朴住房

example.ex: A one-night stay in a modest hotel costs around £35.
example.tran: 在普通的旅店里过一夜要花费约35英镑。

collins.tran: (数量、比率或改进程度)不太高的，适度的，适中的
collins.def: You use modest to describe something such as an amount, rate, or improvement which is fairly small.

example.ex: Swiss unemployment rose to the still modest rate of 0.7%...
example.tran: 瑞士的失业率上升到了0.7%，这个百分比仍然不算太高。

example.ex: The democratic reforms have been modest...
example.tran: 民主改革的力度并不太大。

collins.def: If you say that someone is modest, you approve of them because they do not talk much about their abilities or achievements.

example.ex: He's modest, as well as being a great player...
example.tran: 他是一名谦虚而伟大的运动员。

example.ex: Lord Carrington is modest about his achievements.
example.tran: 卡林顿勋爵对自己取得的成绩非常谦虚。

collins.tran: (女性或其衣着)端庄的，保守的;(行为)正派的，检点的
collins.def: You can describe a woman as modest when she avoids doing or wearing anything that might cause men to have sexual feelings towards her. You can also describe her clothes or behaviour as modest .

example.ex: Asian women are more modest and shy, yet they tend to have an inner force...
example.tran: 亚洲女性表现得更为端庄腼腆，却往往外柔内刚。

example.ex: Respect the local etiquete. Modest clothing is often preferable to revealing shorts and tight-fitting tops.
example.tran: 要尊重当地的礼节。朴素端庄的衣着往往比暴露的短裤和紧身上衣更合适。

collins.def: Compensation is money that someone who has experienced loss or suffering claims from the person or organization responsible, or from the state.

example.ex: He received one year's salary as compensation for loss of office...
example.tran: 他得到一年的工资作为失业补偿金。

example.ex: There should be compensation for British farmers hit by the slump in demand...
example.tran: 应该给受到需求锐减影响的英国农民提供补偿金。

collins.def: If something is some compensation for something bad that has happened, it makes you feel better.

example.ex: Helen gained some compensation for her earlier defeat by winning the final open class...
example.tran: 海伦在公开组决赛中取胜，这对她早先的失败算是一种补偿。

example.ex: Despite a reduction in earnings there are compensations in moving to the north-east where the quality of life is excellent...
example.tran: 尽管钱会挣得少一点，搬到生活质量高的东北部去还是有很多好处的。

collins.def: When you swim, you move through water by making movements with your arms and legs.

example.ex: She learned to swim when she was really tiny...
example.tran: 她很小的时候就学会了游泳。

example.ex: I went round to Jonathan's to see if he wanted to go swimming...
example.tran: 我去乔纳森那里看看他是否想去游泳。

collins.def: If you swim a race, you take part in a swimming race.

example.ex: She swam the 400 metres medley ten seconds slower than she did in 1980.
example.tran: 她 400 米混合泳的成绩比其 1980 年慢了 10 秒。

collins.def: If you swim a stretch of water, you keep swimming until you have crossed it.

example.ex: In 1875, Captain Matthew Webb became the first man to swim the English Channel.
example.tran: 1875年，马修·韦布船长成为横渡英吉利海峡的第一人。

collins.def: When a fish swims, it moves through water by moving its body.

example.ex: The barriers are lethal to fish trying to swim upstream.
example.tran: 这些障碍物对于想要往上游游动的鱼儿来说是致命的。

collins.tran: (通常指生病时觉得物体仿佛在)旋转，摇晃
collins.def: If objects swim, they seem to be moving backwards and forwards, usually because you are ill.

example.ex: Alexis suddenly could take no more: he felt too hot, he couldn't breathe, the room swam.
example.tran: 亚历克西斯突然觉得受不了了，他感到闷热，喘不上气，仿佛整间屋子在旋转。

collins.def: If your head is swimming, you feel unsteady and slightly ill.

example.ex: The musty aroma of incense made her head swim.
example.tran: 熏香发霉的气味令她感到头晕。

collins.def: If something is swimming in liquid or is swimming with liquid, it is surrounded by and covered with it.

example.ex: He polished off a large steak, salad, broccoli swimming in thick sauce, and half a litre of wine.
example.tran: 他狼吞虎咽地吃下了一大块牛排、很多色拉和浸着浓稠酱汁的花耶菜，还喝了半升红酒。

collins.def: You use overseas to describe things that involve or are in foreign countries, usually across a sea or an ocean.

example.ex: He has returned to South Africa from his long overseas trip.
example.tran: 他结束了漫长的海外旅行回到南非。

example.ex: ...overseas trade figures.
example.tran: 海外贸易额

collins.tran: （学生、游客等）来自海外的，来自外国的
collins.def: An overseas student or visitor comes from a foreign country, usually across a sea or an ocean.

example.ex: Every year nine million overseas visitors come to London.
example.tran: 每年有900万外国游客来伦敦观光。

collins.def: If you monitor something, you regularly check its development or progress, and sometimes comment on it.

example.ex: Officials had not been allowed to monitor the voting...
example.tran: 以前不允许官员监督投票。

example.ex: You need feedback to monitor progress.
example.tran: 你需要利用反馈信息来监控进展。

collins.tran: 监听(外国无线电广播等)
collins.def: If someone monitors radio broadcasts from other countries, they record them or listen carefully to them in order to obtain information.

example.ex: Peter Murray is in London and has been monitoring reports out of Monrovia.
example.tran: 彼得·默里一直在伦敦监听来自蒙罗维亚的新闻报道。

collins.def: A monitor is a machine that is used to check or record things, for example processes or substances inside a person's body.

example.ex: The heart monitor shows low levels of consciousness.
example.tran: 心脏监测器显示患者神志不清。

collins.def: A monitor is a screen which is used to display certain kinds of information, for example in airports or  television studios.

example.ex: He was watching a game of tennis on a television monitor.
example.tran: 他在看电视转播的网球赛。

collins.def: You can refer to a person who checks that something is done correctly, or that it is fair, as a monitor .

example.ex: Government monitors will continue to accompany reporters.
example.tran: 政府监督员将继续陪同记者。

example.ex: ...UN monitors overseeing Namibian independence.
example.tran: 监督纳米比亚独立情况的联合国核查员

collins.def: If a person or thing is capable of doing something, they have the ability to do it.

example.ex: He appeared hardly capable of conducting a coherent conversation...
example.tran: 他好像连话都说不清楚。

example.ex: The kitchen is capable of catering for several hundred people...
example.tran: 厨房能同时容纳数百人进餐。

collins.tran: 熟练的;胜任的;有能力的
collins.def: Someone who is capable has the skill or qualities necessary to do a particular thing well, or is able to do most things well.

example.ex: She's a very capable speaker...
example.tran: 她能说会道。

example.ex: Her husband was such a fine, capable man.
example.tran: 她丈夫又体贴又能干。

collins.def: Shame is an uncomfortable feeling that you get when you have done something wrong or embarrassing, or when someone close to you has.

example.ex: She felt a deep sense of shame...
example.tran: 她深感羞愧。

example.ex: They feel shame and guilt as though it is their fault...
example.tran: 他们觉得羞愧和内疚,就好像这是他们的错。

collins.def: If someone brings shame on you, they make other people lose their respect for you.

example.ex: I don't want to bring shame on the family name...
example.tran: 我不想玷污家族的名声。

example.ex: He committed suicide rather than face the shame of being linked to the scandal.
example.tran: 他选择了自杀,不愿面对牵扯进这桩丑闻所带来的耻辱。

collins.tran: 使羞愧;使惭愧;使难为情
collins.def: If something shames you, it causes you to feel shame.

example.ex: Her son's affair had humiliated and shamed her.
example.tran: 儿子的事让她感到难堪和羞愧。

collins.def: If you shame someone close to you, you make people lose their respect for that person, by behaving in an unacceptable way.

example.ex: I wouldn't shame my father by trying that.
example.tran: 我不会做那种事让我父亲丢脸。

collins.tran: 使…感到羞愧(而不得不做…)
collins.def: If you shame someone into doing something, you force them to do it by making them feel ashamed not to.

example.ex: He would not let neighbours shame him into silence...
example.tran: 邻居们试图想让他自感羞愧而从此闭口，他是不会乖乖就范的。

example.ex: Museums have now been shamed out of selling the treasures from their collections.
example.tran: 博物馆现在已经深感羞愧，不再变卖他们收藏的珍宝了。

collins.tran: 令人惋惜的事;让人遗憾的事
collins.def: If you say that something is a shame, you are expressing your regret about it and indicating that you wish it had happened differently.

example.ex: It's a crying shame that police have to put up with these mindless attacks...
example.tran: 警察得忍受这些无谓的攻击，真是太不像话了。

example.ex: They did not have enough money to adopt a child. It was such a shame.
example.tran: 他们没有足够的钱去收养一个孩子，真让人惋惜。

collins.def: You can use shame in expressions such as shame on you and shame on him to indicate that someone ought to feel shame for something they have said or done.

example.ex: He tried to deny it. Shame on him!
example.tran: 他还想抵赖，真不害臊！

collins.tran: 使自惭形秽;使相形见绌;使自愧不如
collins.def: If someone puts you to shame, they make you feel ashamed because they do something much better than you do.

example.ex: His playing really put me to shame.
example.tran: 他的表演真让我自惭形秽。

collins.def: If you celebrate, you do something enjoyable because of a special occasion or to mark someone's success.

example.ex: I was in a mood to celebrate...
example.tran: 我很想庆祝一下。

example.ex: Tom celebrated his 24th birthday two days ago.
example.tran: 汤姆两天前庆祝了他的24岁生日。

collins.def: If an organization or country is celebrating an anniversary, it has existed for that length of time and is doing something special because of it.

example.ex: The Society is celebrating its tenth anniversary this year.
example.tran: 这个协会今年将举办成立10周年庆典。

collins.def: When priests celebrate Holy Communion or Mass, they officially perform the actions and ceremonies that are involved.

example.ex: Pope John Paul celebrated mass today in a city in central Poland.
example.tran: 教皇保罗二世今天在波兰中部的一个城市主持了弥撒。

collins.def: When you ring someone, you telephone them.

example.ex: He rang me at my mother's...
example.tran: 他打电话到我妈妈家找我。

example.ex: If you'd like more information, ring the Hotline on 414 3929...
example.tran: 如果想了解更多信息，请拨打热线电话414 3929。

collins.def: When a telephone rings, it makes a sound to let you know that someone is phoning you.

example.ex: As soon as he got home, the phone rang...
example.tran: 他一回到家，电话就响了。

example.ex: The phone never stopped ringing.
example.tran: 这部电话一直响个不停。

collins.def: When you ring a bell or when a bell rings, it makes a sound.

example.ex: He heard the school bell ring...
example.tran: 他听见学校的铃声响了。

example.ex: The door was opened before she could ring the bell.
example.tran: 她还没来得及按门铃，门就开了。

collins.def: If you ring for something, you ring a bell to call someone to bring it to you. If you ring for someone, you ring a bell so that they will come to you.

example.ex: Shall I ring for a fresh pot of tea?...
example.tran: 要我按铃叫一壶新沏的茶水吗？

example.ex: He rang for the guard to let him out.
example.tran: 他按铃叫保安放他出去。

collins.def: If you say that a place is ringing with sound, usually pleasant sound, you mean that the place is completely filled with that sound.

example.ex: The whole place was ringing with music.
example.tran: 整个地方都回荡着音乐。

collins.tran: (说法、讨论、辩论等的)特性，特点
collins.def: You can use ring to describe a quality that something such as a statement, discussion, or argument seems to have. For example, if an argument has a familiar ring, it seems familiar.

example.ex: His proud boast of leading 'the party of low taxation' has a hollow ring.
example.tran: 他洋洋得意地吹嘘自己领导着“一个主张低税收的政党”，这听起来很空洞。

collins.def: If you say that someone rings the changes, you mean that they make changes or improvements to the way something is organized or done.

example.ex: Ring the changes by adding spices, dried fruit or olives.
example.tran: 加点香料、干果或橄榄以换换口味。

collins.tran: 记忆犹新;在耳边回响;在脑海中浮现
collins.def: If you say that someone's words ring in your ears or ring in your head, you mean that you remember them very clearly, usually when you would prefer to forget them.

example.ex: She shivered as the sound of that man's abuse rang in her ears.
example.tran: 她耳边回响起那个男人的辱骂气得浑身发抖。

collins.def: If you give someone a ring, you phone them.

example.ex: We'll give him a ring as soon as we get back.
example.tran: 我们一回来就会给他打电话。

collins.tran: (说法)听起来真实/听起来空洞
collins.def: If a statement rings true, it seems to be true or genuine. If it rings hollow, it does not seem to be true or genuine.

example.ex: Joanna's denial rang true...
example.tran: 乔安娜的否认听起来像是真的。

example.ex: The rumpus has made all the optimistic statements about unity and harmony ring a little hollow.
example.tran: 这一番吵闹使得所有关于团结和谐的乐观言论听起来都显得有几分空洞。

collins.def: In a military situation, a civilian is anyone who is not a member of the armed forces.

example.ex: The safety of civilians caught up in the fighting must be guaranteed.
example.tran: 必须保证陷入战斗中的平民的人身安全。

collins.tran: 民用的;平民的;非军用的
collins.def: In a military situation, civilian is used to describe people or things that are not military.

example.ex: ...the country's civilian population.
example.tran: 该国的平民人口

example.ex: ...civilian casualties.
example.tran: 平民伤亡

collins.def: If something frustrates you, it upsets or angers you because you are unable to do anything about the problems it creates.

example.ex: These questions frustrated me...
example.tran: 这些问题让我沮丧。

example.ex: Doesn't it frustrate you that audiences in the theatre are so restricted?
example.tran: 观众在剧场里要受到如此多的限制，这难道不令人恼火吗？

collins.def: If someone or something frustrates a plan or attempt to do something, they prevent it from succeeding.

example.ex: The government has deliberately frustrated his efforts to gain work permits for his foreign staff.
example.tran: 政府故意阻挠他为自己的外籍员工申请工作许可证的努力。

example.ex: ...her frustrated attempt to become governor.
example.tran: 她竞选州长的受挫之举

collins.tran: 基督教教士；（天主教）神父；（英国圣公会）牧师；（东正教）司铎
collins.def: A priest is a member of the Christian clergy in the Catholic, Anglican, or Orthodox church.

example.ex: He had trained to be a Catholic priest.
example.tran: 他受训成为了一名天主教神父。

collins.tran: （非基督教会的）教士，和尚，僧侣，祭司
collins.def: In many non-Christian religions a priest is a man who has particular duties and responsibilities in a place where people worship.

means: [俚语]疯子，怪人，政治狂人（尤指政治上持激进或极端主义态度、行为异常、不可思议的人）

collins.tran: 不理智的;愚蠢的;古怪的
collins.def: If you describe someone or something as crazy, you think they are very foolish or strange.

example.ex: People thought they were all crazy to try to make money from manufacturing...
example.tran: 人们认为他们简直是疯了，竟然想从制造业中赚钱。

example.ex: That's why he's got so caught up with this crazy idea about Mr. Trancas.
example.tran: 那就是为什么他对特兰卡斯先生一直有如此疯狂的想法。

collins.tran: 精神失常的;患精神病的
collins.def: Someone who is crazy is insane.

example.ex: If I sat home and worried about all this stuff, I'd go crazy...
example.tran: 如果整天坐在家里为这些事情担心，我会疯掉的。

example.ex: He strides around the room beaming like a crazy man.
example.tran: 他绕着房间大步地走着，像个疯子一样笑着。

collins.def: If you are crazy about something, you are very enthusiastic about it. If you are not crazy about something, you do not like it.

example.ex: He's still crazy about both his work and his hobbies...
example.tran: 他对工作和个人爱好依然保持狂热。

example.ex: I'm also not crazy about the initial terms of the deal.
example.tran: 我对该协议的最初条款也不太满意。

collins.def: If you are crazy about someone, you are deeply in love with them.

example.ex: None of that matters, because we're crazy about each other.
example.tran: 那些都不重要，因为我们深深地爱着对方。

collins.tran: 极度烦恼的;非常生气的
collins.def: If something or someone makes you crazy or drives you crazy, they make you extremely annoyed or upset.

example.ex: This sitting around is driving me crazy...
example.tran: 老这样坐着无所事事快让我发疯了。

example.ex: When Jock woke up and found you gone he went crazy.
example.tran: 乔克醒来发现你走了，他简直气疯了。

collins.def: You use like crazy to emphasize that something happens to a great degree.

example.ex: The stuff was selling like crazy...
example.tran: 这东西卖疯了。

example.ex: Some people can diet like crazy and not lose weight.
example.tran: 有些人拼命节食也不能减肥。

collins.def: If you feel proud, you feel pleased about something good that you possess or have done, or about something good that a person close to you has done.

example.ex: I felt proud of his efforts...
example.tran: 我为他的努力感到骄傲。

example.ex: They are proud that she is doing well at school...
example.tran: 他们为她出色的学习成绩感到骄傲。

collins.tran: 最值得夸耀的；最引以为荣的
collins.def: Your proudest moments or achievements are the ones that you are most proud of.

example.ex: This must have been one of the proudest moments of his busy and hard working life.
example.tran: 这一定是他劳碌工作的一生中最引以为荣的时刻之一。

collins.def: Someone who is proud has respect for themselves and does not want to lose the respect that other people have for them.

example.ex: He was too proud to ask his family for help and support...
example.tran: 他自尊心太强，不愿向家人寻求帮助和支持。

example.ex: We are a proud people. We are not used to begging or taking things.
example.tran: 我们是有自尊的民族。我们不习惯乞讨或接受施舍。

collins.tran: 骄傲的；傲慢的；妄自尊大的
collins.def: Someone who is proud feels that they are better or more important than other people.

example.ex: She was said to be proud and arrogant.
example.tran: 据说她傲慢自大。

collins.def: If one object stands proud of another object that it is attached to or next to, it extends beyond it.

example.ex: The handles stand proud of the doors of the car.
example.tran: 把手位于车门之外。

collins.tran: 盛情款待；给…以隆重待遇
collins.def: If someone does you proud, they treat you very well, for example by welcoming you and giving you good food and entertainment.

example.ex: The hotel has indeed done them proud.
example.tran: 这家宾馆的确对他们盛情款待。

collins.def: If a part of your body is bare, it is not covered by any clothing.

example.ex: She was wearing only a thin robe over a flimsy nightdress, and her feet were bare...
example.tran: 她只在薄如蝉翼的睡衣外套了一件薄睡袍，而且光着脚。

example.ex: She had bare arms and a bare neck.
example.tran: 她的胳臂和脖子都露在外面。

collins.def: A bare surface is not covered or decorated with anything.

example.ex: They would have liked bare wooden floors throughout the house.
example.tran: 他们本想在整个房间的木地板上都不铺地毯的。

collins.def: If a tree or a branch is bare, it has no leaves on it.

example.ex: ...an old, twisted tree, its bark shaggy, many of its limbs brittle and bare.
example.tran: 一棵虬枝盘绕的古树，树皮粗糙，很多枝杈光秃秃的，一折就断

collins.def: If a room, cupboard, or shelf is bare, it is empty.

example.ex: His fridge was bare apart from three very withered tomatoes...
example.tran: 除了三个蔫巴巴的西红柿，他的冰箱里什么也没有。

example.ex: He led me through to a bare, draughty interviewing room.
example.tran: 他把我带到了一间空荡荡的、有过堂风的会见室。

collins.def: An area of ground that is bare has no plants growing on it.

example.ex: That's probably the most bare, bleak, barren and inhospitable island  I've ever seen.
example.tran: 那可能是我见过的最荒凉的岛屿，荒无人烟，寸草不生。

collins.tran: （事实、细节等）最基本的，最重要的
collins.def: If someone gives you the bare facts or the barest details of something, they tell you only the most basic and important things.

example.ex: Newspaper reporters were given nothing but the bare facts by the Superintendent in charge of the investigation.
example.tran: 报社的记者们从负责这起调查的督察那里得到的只是一些最基本的情况。

collins.tran: 最少的；最低限度的；勉强的
collins.def: If you talk about the bare minimum or the bare essentials, you mean the very least that is necessary.

example.ex: The army would try to hold the western desert with a bare minimum of forces...
example.tran: 军队会用尽可能少的兵力扼守西部的沙漠。

example.ex: These are the bare essentials you'll need to dress your baby during the first few months.
example.tran: 这些是你的宝宝在头几个月里要穿的基本衣物。

collins.def: Bare is used in front of an amount to emphasize how small it is.

example.ex: Sales are growing for premium wines, but at a bare 2 percent a year.
example.tran: 高档酒的销量正在增长，但年增长率只有2％。

collins.def: If you bare something, you uncover it and show it.

example.ex: Walsh bared his teeth in a grin...
example.tran: 沃尔什露齿一笑。

example.ex: He bared his muscular, hairy chest for a women's  magazine.
example.tran: 他为一本女性杂志秀出了他那肌肉发达、毛发浓密的性感胸部。

collins.def: If someone does something with their bare hands, they do it without using any weapons or tools.

example.ex: Police believe the killer punched her to death with his bare hands...
example.tran: 警方认为她是被凶手活活用拳头打死的。

example.ex: Rescuers were using their bare hands to reach the trapped miners.
example.tran: 救援人员正徒手营救被困矿工。

collins.def: If you lay something bare, you uncover it completely so that it can then be seen.

example.ex: The clearing out of disused workshops laid bare thousands of Italianate glazed tiles.
example.tran: 清理废弃的车间时发现了成千上万块意大利风格的釉面砖。

collins.def: If you lay bare something or someone, you reveal or expose them.

example.ex: No one wants to expose themselves, lay their feelings bare.
example.tran: 没有人想自我剖白，将自己的情感公之于众。

collins.def: If you bare your soul, you tell someone your most secret thoughts and feelings.

example.ex: Few men would have bared their soul to a woman as he had.
example.tran: 很少有男人能像他一样对一个女人敞开心扉。

collins.def: When you say what happened or was the case originally, you are saying what happened or was the case when something began or came into existence, often to contrast it with what happened later.

example.ex: The plane has been kept in service far longer than originally intended...
example.tran: 这架飞机已经超期服役很长时间了。

example.ex: France originally refused to sign the treaty...
example.tran: 最初法国拒绝签署该条约。

collins.def: If you say that something is a mess or in a mess, you think that it is in an untidy state.

example.ex: The house is a mess...
example.tran: 屋里一片狼藉。

example.ex: The wrong shampoo can leave curly hair in a tangled mess...
example.tran: 不合适的洗发水会使卷发纠结成乱糟糟的一团。

collins.def: If you say that a situation is a mess, you mean that it is full of trouble or problems. You can also say that something is in a mess .

example.ex: I've made such a mess of my life.
example.tran: 我把自己的生活弄得一团糟。

example.ex: ...the many reasons why the economy is in such a mess...
example.tran: 经济陷入如此困境的众多原因

collins.def: A mess is something liquid or sticky that has been accidentally dropped on something.

example.ex: Finally, making a dreadful mess, they devour the fruit...
example.tran: 最后，他们狼吞虎咽地吃起了水果，果汁滴得到处都是。

example.ex: I'll clear up the mess later.
example.tran: 我呆会儿会把滴落的水擦干净。

collins.def: The mess at a military base or military barracks is the building in which members of the armed forces can eat or relax.

example.ex: ...a party at the officers' mess...
example.tran: 在军官餐厅举行的聚会

example.ex: He hurried to the Mess to find the control officer.
example.tran: 他匆忙赶到餐厅去找指挥官。

collins.def: If you substitute one thing for another, or if one thing substitutes for another, it takes the place or performs the function of the other thing.

example.ex: They were substituting violence for dialogue...
example.tran: 他们在用暴力取代对话。

example.ex: You could always substitute a low-fat soft cheese...
example.tran: 你总是可以代之以低脂肪的软奶酪。

collins.def: A substitute is something that you have or use instead of something else.

example.ex: She is seeking a substitute for the very man whose departure made her cry.
example.tran: 那个男人的离去令她伤心痛哭，她正想找一个人填补内心的空缺。

example.ex: ...tests on humans to find a blood substitute made from animal blood.
example.tran: 为从动物血液中提取人血的替代品而在人体上进行的试验

collins.tran: 令人满意的替代物;与之媲美的事物
collins.def: If you say that one thing is no substitute for another, you mean that it does not have certain desirable features that the other thing has, and is therefore unsatisfactory. If you say that there is no substitute for something, you mean that it is the only thing which is really satisfactory.

example.ex: The printed word is no substitute for personal discussion with a great thinker...
example.tran: 阅读印在纸上的内容远不如与伟大的思想家面对面探讨那般受益。

example.ex: There is no substitute for practical experience.
example.tran: 实践经验是无法替代的。

collins.def: In team games such as football, a substitute is a player who is brought into a match to replace another player.

example.ex: Coming on as a substitute, he scored four crucial goals for Cameroon.
example.tran: 作为替补队员上场的他为喀麦隆队打入了四粒关键进球。

collins.def: A detective is someone whose job is to discover what has happened in a crime or other situation and to find the people involved. Some detectives work in the police force and others work privately.

example.ex: Detectives are appealing for witnesses who may have seen anything suspicious...
example.tran: 探员呼吁看到任何可疑情况的人进行举报。

example.ex: She hired a private detective in an attempt to find her daughter.
example.tran: 她雇了一名私人侦探，试图找到自己的女儿。

collins.tran: （用于警察头衔）(英国英语中常用于 constable，sergeant 等词前）侦探，（美国英语中单独使用)警探
collins.def: In Britain 'detective' is used before words such as 'constable' or 'sergeant', and in the U.S. the word 'detective' is used on its own, to indicate that a police officer is a member of the department concerned with investigating crimes.

example.ex: ...Detective Inspector Ian Mosley.
example.tran: 伊恩·莫斯利探长

example.ex: ..Detective Nardosa of the New York City Police Department.
example.tran: 纽约市警察局的纳尔多萨警探

collins.def: A detective novel or story is one in which a detective tries to solve a crime.
If you do some detective work, you do something to find out more about a subject or situation that puzzles you.

example.ex: Despite careful detective work, many items have never been recovered.
example.tran: 尽管进行了悉心探查，许多物品还是一直没有找回。

collins.def: If you relax or if something relaxes you, you feel more calm and less worried or tense.

example.ex: I ought to relax and stop worrying about it...
example.tran: 我应该放松一下，不要再担心它了。

example.ex: For the first time since his arrival he relaxed slightly...
example.tran: 自从他来了之后这是他第一次稍微放松一点儿。

collins.def: When a part of your body relaxes, or when you relax it, it becomes less stiff or firm.

example.ex: Massage is used to relax muscles, relieve stress and improve the circulation...
example.tran: 按摩可以使肌肉放松，缓解压力和促进血液循环。

example.ex: His face relaxes into a contented smile.
example.tran: 他面部肌肉放松下来，露出了满意的微笑。

collins.def: If you relax your grip or hold on something, you hold it less tightly than before.

example.ex: He gradually relaxed his grip on the arms of the chair.
example.tran: 他紧握椅子扶手的手逐渐松开了。

collins.tran: 放宽，放松，削弱(规定或控制)
collins.def: If you relax a rule or your control over something, or if it relaxes, it becomes less firm or strong.

example.ex: Rules governing student conduct relaxed somewhat in recent years...
example.tran: 近年来约束学生行为的规定有所放宽。

example.ex: How much can the President relax his grip over the nation?...
example.tran: 总统可以对国家的控制放松到什么样的程度？

means: [经济学]按生活指数调整（工资、价格等）

collins.def: An index is a system by which changes in the value of something and the rate at which it changes can be recorded, measured, or interpreted.

example.ex: ...the UK retail price index.
example.tran: 英国零售价格指数

example.ex: ...economic indices.
example.tran: 经济指数

collins.def: An index is an alphabetical list that is printed at the back of a book and tells you on which pages important topics are referred to.

example.ex: Curiously, the word 'gay' does not occur in the index...
example.tran: 奇怪的是,gay这个词没有出现在索引当中。

example.ex: There's even a special subject index.
example.tran: 甚至有一个专项索引。

collins.def: If you index a book or a collection of information, you make an alphabetical list of the items in it.

example.ex: This vast archive has been indexed and made accessible to researchers...
example.tran: 这个存量巨大的档案室的所有文件都已编了索引,可供研究人员使用。

example.ex: Painters and sculptors are indexed separately...
example.tran: 画家和雕刻家被分开，分别做了索引。

collins.tran: 使(与…)相应挂钩;使指数化
collins.def: If a quantity or value is indexed to another, a system is arranged so that it increases or decreases whenever the other one increases or decreases.

example.ex: Minimum pensions and wages are to be indexed to inflation.
example.tran: 最低养老金和最低工资要与通货膨胀挂钩。

collins.def: If one thing is an index of another, it indicates what the other thing will be like.

example.ex: Weeds are an index to the character of the soil.
example.tran: 杂草是反映土壤特征的一个指标。

collins.def: In mathematics, indices are the little numbers that show how many times you must multiply a number by itself. In the equation 32 = 9, the number 2 is an index.
A grave is a place where a dead person is buried.

example.ex: They used to visit her grave twice a year.
example.tran: 他们以前每年去她的墓前凭吊两次。

collins.def: You can refer to some-one's death as their grave or to death as the grave .

example.ex: ...drinking yourself to an early grave...
example.tran: 纵酒而自折其寿

example.ex: Most men would rather go to the grave than own up to feelings of dependency.
example.tran: 大多数男人宁死都不愿承认有依赖感。

collins.def: A grave event or situation is very serious, important, and worrying.

example.ex: He said that the situation in his country is very grave...
example.tran: 他说他的国家情况十分危急。

example.ex: I have grave doubts that the documents tell the whole story.
example.tran: 我对这些文件能否说明所有的问题深表怀疑。

collins.def: A grave person is quiet and serious in their appearance or behaviour.

example.ex: William was up on the roof for some time and when he came down he looked grave...
example.tran: 威廉在屋顶上呆了一段时间，他下来的时候面色凝重。

example.ex: Anxiously, she examined his unusually grave face.
example.tran: 她忐忑不安地审视着他异常严肃的脸色。

collins.def: In some languages such as French, a grave accent is a symbol that is placed over a vowel in a word to show how the vowel is pronounced. For example, the word 'mère' has a grave accent over the first 'e'
If you say that someone is digging their own grave, you are warning them that they are doing something foolish or dangerous that will cause their own failure.

example.ex: The magazine isn't trying to ruin his career, the man's digging his own grave by refusing an interview.
example.tran: 这份杂志并非想断送他的事业，而他拒绝接受采访就是在自毁前程。

collins.def: If you say that someone who is dead would turn in their grave at something that is happening now, you mean that they would be very shocked or upset by it, if they were alive.

example.ex: Darwin must be turning in his grave at the thought of what is being perpetrated in his name.
example.tran: 一想到冒他之名所做下的那些事，达尔文在九泉之下一定不得安宁。

collins.def: Editorial means involved in preparing a newspaper, magazine, or book for publication.

example.ex: He has been on the editorial staff of 'Private Eye' since 1963...
example.tran: 自1963年以来，他一直是《第三只眼》杂志的编辑。

example.ex: I went to the editorial board meetings when I had the time.
example.tran: 我一有空就去参加编委会会议。

collins.tran: （报纸、杂志、电视节目等）立场（或观点等）的;社论（式）的
collins.def: Editorial means involving the attitudes, opinions, and contents of something such as a newspaper, magazine, or television programme.

example.ex: We are not about to change our editorial policy.
example.tran: 我们不会改变我们的社论方针。

collins.def: An editorial is an article in a newspaper which gives the opinion of the editor or owner on a topic or item of news.

example.ex: In an editorial, The Independent suggests the victory could turn nasty.
example.tran: 《独立报》在一篇社论中暗示这场胜利可能会变味。

collins.def: An editorial on television or radio is an item which gives the opinion of the network or radio station.
An assessment is a consideration of someone or something and a judgment about them.

example.ex: There is little assessment of the damage to the natural environment...
example.tran: 几乎未对自然环境破坏程度作出评估。

example.ex: The tests are supposed to provide a basis for the assessment of children...
example.tran: 这些测试应该可以为评价儿童提供一个基础。

collins.def: An assessment of the amount of money that something is worth or that should be paid is a calculation or estimate of the amount.

example.ex: Price Waterhouse have traced the losses to lenders' inflated assessments of mortgaged property.
example.tran: 普华永道会计师事务所已经查明损失源于贷方对按揭财产估值过高。

example.ex: ...income assessment.
example.tran: 收入评估

collins.def: An achievement is something which someone has succeeded in doing, especially after a lot of effort.

example.ex: Reaching this agreement so quickly was a great achievement...
example.tran: 如此快速达成这项协定是一大伟绩。

example.ex: The Conference will be a celebration of women's achievements.
example.tran: 该会议将成为对女性成就的一曲赞歌。

collins.def: Achievement is the process of achieving something.

example.ex: Only the achievement of these goals will bring lasting peace.
example.tran: 只有达成这些目标才会带来持久的和平。

means: 狡猾的，欺骗（性）的，可疑的，不光明的

collins.def: Someone or something that is funny is amusing and likely to make you smile or laugh.

example.ex: Wade was smart and not bad-looking, and he could be funny when he wanted to...
example.tran: 韦德脑子聪明，相貌也不难看，而且如果他愿意的话还很风趣。

example.ex: I'll tell you a funny story.
example.tran: 我来给你讲一个有趣的故事。

collins.tran: 古怪的;奇怪的;令人困惑的
collins.def: If you describe something as funny, you think it is strange, surprising, or puzzling.

example.ex: Children get some very funny ideas sometimes!...
example.tran: 小孩子的想法有时候真是稀奇古怪！

example.ex: There's something funny about him...
example.tran: 他有点儿古怪。

collins.def: If you feel funny, you feel slightly ill.

example.ex: My head had begun to ache and my stomach felt funny.
example.tran: 我的头开始疼起来，胃也有些不舒服。

collins.tran: (报刊上的)幽默漫画,滑稽连环漫画
collins.def: The funnies are humorous drawings or a series of humorous drawings in a newspaper or magazine.

collins.tran: 不端行为;见不得人的勾当
collins.def: Funny business is dishonest or unacceptable behaviour.

example.ex: ...an inquiry into funny business in Ireland's biggest export industry.
example.tran: 对爱尔兰最大的出口行业违规行为的调查

collins.def: If you yield to someone or something, you stop resisting them.

example.ex: Will she yield to growing pressure for her to retire?...
example.tran: 面对要求其隐退的压力越来越大，她会屈服吗？

example.ex: I yielded to an impulse...
example.tran: 我没有忍住冲动。

collins.def: If you yield something that you have control of or responsibility for, you allow someone else to have control or responsibility for it

example.ex: He may yield control...
example.tran: 他可能会放弃控制权。

example.ex: The President is now under pressure to yield power to the republics.
example.tran: 总统现在面临着让权给共和党人的压力。

collins.def: If one thing yields to another thing, it is replaced by this other thing.

example.ex: Boston's traditional drab brick was slow to yield to the modern glass palaces of so many American urban areas.
example.tran: 波士顿传统而单调的砖石建筑并没有迅速被许多美国城市地区流行的现代玻璃大厦所取代。

collins.def: If a moving person or a vehicle yields, they slow down or stop in order to allow other people or vehicles to pass in front of them.

example.ex: When entering a trail or starting a descent, yield to other skiers.
example.tran: 进入滑雪道或开始下滑时，要给其他滑雪者让路。

example.ex: ...examples of common signs like No Smoking or Yield.
example.tran: “请勿吸烟”或“让行”之类的常见标志的例子

collins.def: If something yields, it breaks or moves position because force or pressure has been put on it.

example.ex: The door yielded easily when he pushed it.
example.tran: 他一推，门就开了。

collins.def: If an area of land yields a particular amount of a crop, this is the amount that is produced. You can also say that a number of animals yield a particular amount of meat.

example.ex: Last year 400,000 acres of land yielded a crop worth $1.75 billion.
example.tran: 去年40万英亩的土地产值达17.5亿美元。

collins.def: A yield is the amount of food produced on an area of land or by a number of animals.

example.ex: ...improving the yield of the crop...
example.tran: 提高农作物产量

example.ex: Polluted water lessens crop yields.
example.tran: 受污染的水源会降低农作物产量。

collins.tran: （税收或投资）产生，带来（收益或效益）
collins.def: If a tax or investment yields an amount of money or profit, this money or profit is obtained from it.

example.ex: It yielded a profit of at least $36 million.
example.tran: 它带来了至少3,600万美元的收益。

collins.def: A yield is the amount of money or profit produced by an investment.

example.ex: ...a yield of 4%...
example.tran: 4%的收益

example.ex: The high yields available on the dividend shares made them attractive to private investors.
example.tran: 红利股票的高收益率对私人投资者极具吸引力。

collins.def: If something yields a result or piece of information, it produces it.

example.ex: This research has been in progress since 1961 and has yielded a great number of positive results...
example.tran: 这项研究自1961年起一直在开展，已取得了不少积极成果。

example.ex: His trip to Melbourne had yielded a lot of information.
example.tran: 他的墨尔本之行让他大开眼界。

means: 以低沉而有回响的声音发出

collins.def: If there is a boom in the economy, there is an increase in economic activity, for example in the amount of things that are being bought and sold.

example.ex: An economic boom followed, especially in housing and construction...
example.tran: 接着出现了经济繁荣，尤其是在房地产业和建筑业。

example.ex: The 1980s were indeed boom years.
example.tran: 20世纪80年代是真正的繁荣时期。

collins.tran: （数量的）增长；（频率的）加快；成功
collins.def: A boom in something is an increase in its amount, frequency, or success.

example.ex: The boom in the sport's  popularity has meant more calls for stricter safety regulations...
example.tran: 该项体育运动的兴起意味着制定更加严格的安全规则的呼声更高了。

example.ex: Public transport has not been able to cope adequately with the travel boom.
example.tran: 公共交通系统还不能充分满足迅速发展的旅游业的需求。

collins.def: If the economy or a business is booming, the amount of things being bought or sold is increasing.

example.ex: By 1988 the economy was booming...
example.tran: 到1988年经济一直很繁荣。

example.ex: Sales are booming...
example.tran: 销售额在快速增长。

collins.def: On a boat, the boom is the long pole which is attached to the bottom of the sail and to the mast and which you move when you want to alter the direction in which you are sailing.

collins.tran: 浮木挡栅，水栅（用来阻挡溢出的油扩散）
collins.def: A boom is a large floating barrier that is used for stopping oil that has spilled from spreading.

collins.tran: （人)吼叫；（大炮或大鼓）发隆隆声
collins.def: When something such as someone's voice, a cannon, or a big drum booms, it makes a loud, deep sound that lasts for several seconds.

example.ex: 'Ladies,' boomed Helena, without a microphone, 'we all know why we're  here tonight.'...
example.tran: “女士们，”海伦娜大声喊道，没有用麦克风，“我们都知道今晚我们为什么来到这里。”

example.ex: Thunder boomed like battlefield cannons over Crooked Mountain.
example.tran: 雷声像战场上的炮声一样响彻克鲁克德山。

collins.def: If someone is living in exile, they are living in a foreign country because they cannot live in their own country, usually for political reasons.

example.ex: He is now living in exile in Egypt...
example.tran: 他目前流亡埃及。

example.ex: He returned from exile earlier this year.
example.tran: 今年早些时候他流亡归来。

collins.def: If someone is exiled, they are living in a foreign country because they cannot live in their own country, usually for political reasons.

example.ex: His second wife, Hilary, had been widowed, then exiled from South Africa...
example.tran: 他的第二任妻子希拉丽已经成了寡妇，后来又被驱逐出南非。

example.ex: They threatened to exile her in southern Spain.
example.tran: 他们威胁要将她流放到西班牙南部。

collins.def: An exile is someone who has been exiled.
If you say that someone has been exiled from a particular place or situation, you mean that they have been sent away from it or removed from it against their will.

example.ex: He has been exiled from the first team and forced to play in third team matches...
example.tran: 他被开除出甲级球队，被迫参加丙级球队的比赛。

example.ex: Michael was exiled to the kitchen for supper.
example.tran: 迈克尔被赶到厨房吃晚饭。

means: 体育运动的运动（代表）队
（对付某类犯罪活动的）警察队伍

collins.tran: (专门处理某类犯罪的)警察分队
collins.def: A squad is a section of a police force that is responsible for dealing with a particular type of crime.

example.ex: The building was evacuated and the bomb squad called...
example.tran: 大楼里进行了人员疏散，并叫来了拆弹小组。

example.ex: The club is under investigation by the fraud squad.
example.tran: 反诈骗调查组正在对该俱乐部进行调查。

collins.tran: (将从中挑选运动员组队参赛的)运动队，大名单
collins.def: A squad is a group of players from which a sports team will be chosen.

example.ex: Sean O'Leary has been named in the England squad to tour Argentina.
example.tran: 肖恩·奥利里已入选参加阿根廷巡回赛的英格兰队大名单。

collins.def: A squad of soldiers is a small group of them.

example.ex: ...a squad of commandos.
example.tran: 突击小分队

collins.def: Reading is the activity of reading books.

example.ex: I have always loved reading.
example.tran: 我一直喜欢读书。

example.ex: ...young people who find reading and writing difficult.
example.tran: 觉得阅读和写作很难的年轻人

collins.def: A reading is an event at which poetry or extracts from books are read to an audience.

example.ex: This year's event consisted of readings, lectures and workshops.
example.tran: 今年的活动包括读书会、讲座和研讨会。

example.ex: ...a poetry reading.
example.tran: 诗歌朗诵会

collins.def: Your reading of a word, text, or situation is the way in which you understand or interpret it.

example.ex: My reading of her character makes me feel that she was too responsible a person to do those things...
example.tran: 照我对她的性格的了解来看，她是个特别负责任的人，不会做出那些事情的。

example.ex: Local public housing authorities disagree with this reading of the law.
example.tran: 当地的公共住房管理当局不同意对该法律的这种解读。

collins.def: The reading on a measuring device is the figure or measurement that it shows.

example.ex: Once you have recorded the reading, shake the thermometer down to below 36 degrees...
example.tran: 一旦完成计数，把温度计标数甩到36度以下。

example.ex: The gauge must be giving a faulty reading.
example.tran: 量表的显示肯定有误。

collins.tran: （英国议会或美国国会讨论一项新法案以获通过的三步立法程序之一）议案宣读
collins.def: In the British Parliament or the US Congress, a reading is one of the three stages of introducing and discussing a new bill before it can be passed as law.

example.ex: The bill is expected to pass its second reading with a comfortable majority.
example.tran: 预计这项法案将以绝大多数赞成而通过议会第二次宣读。

collins.def: If you say that a book or an article makes interesting reading or makes for interesting reading, you mean that it is interesting to read.

example.ex: The list of drinks, a dozen pages long, makes fascinating reading...
example.tran: 酒水单一共有十几页长，读起来很有趣。

example.ex: The report, called 'Child Poverty and Deprivation in the UK', makes for depressing reading.
