example.tran: 题为“英国儿童的贫困状况”的报告让人读起来心情沉重。

means: （展览会，竞赛等的）全体评审员

collins.def: In a court of law, the jury is the group of people who have been chosen from the general public to listen to the facts about a crime and to decide whether the person accused is guilty or not.

example.ex: The jury convicted Mr Hampson of all offences.
example.tran: 陪审团裁定汉普森先生全部罪名成立。

example.ex: ...the tradition of trial by jury.
example.tran: 由陪审团审判的惯例

collins.tran: （竞赛的）评判委员会，裁判委员会
collins.def: A jury is a group of people who choose the winner of a competition.

example.ex: I am not surprised that the Booker Prize jury included it on their shortlist.
example.tran: 我毫不惊讶布克奖评委会将其列在入选名单中。

collins.tran: （某事）悬而未决，仍未达成定论
collins.def: If you say that the jury is out or that the jury is still out on a particular subject, you mean that people in general have still not made a decision or formed an opinion about that subject.

example.ex: The jury is out on whether or not this is true...
example.tran: 这是否属实仍未得出定论。

example.ex: The jury is still out on what kind of solutions we might undertake.
example.tran: 尚未确定我们可能采取何种解决办法。

means: （舰队或军队的）后方，后尾，殿后部队

collins.tran: （建筑物或车辆的）后部，后面，背面
collins.def: The rear of something such as a building or vehicle is the back part of it.

example.ex: He settled back in the rear of the taxi.
example.tran: 他靠坐在出租车的后排座上。

example.ex: ...a stairway in the rear of the building.
example.tran: 大楼后面的楼梯

collins.def: If you are at the rear of a moving line of people, you are the last person in it.

example.ex: Musicians played at the front and rear of the procession...
example.tran: 乐师们在队前和队尾表演。

example.ex: The Lord Mayor follows at the rear in his gilded coach.
example.tran: 市长大人坐在他阔气的马车里在后面跟着。

collins.def: Your rear is the part of your body that you sit on.

example.ex: I turned away from the phone to see Lewis pat a waitress on her rear.
example.tran: 我打完电话后转过头，看见刘易斯拍了拍一个女招待的屁股。

collins.def: If you rear children, you look after them until they are old enough to look after themselves.

example.ex: She reared sixteen children, six her own and ten her husband's...
example.tran: 她养大了16个孩子，其中6个是她亲生的，10个是她丈夫带来的。

example.ex: I was reared in east Texas.
example.tran: 我在得克萨斯州东部长大。

collins.def: If you rear a young animal, you keep and look after it until it is old enough to be used for work or food, or until it can look after itself.

example.ex: She spends a lot of time rearing animals.
example.tran: 她花费大量时间饲养动物。

collins.def: When a horse rears, it moves the front part of its body upwards, so that its front legs are high in the air and it is standing on its back legs.

example.ex: The horse reared and threw off its rider.
example.tran: 那匹马前蹄腾空向后仰，把骑手摔了下去。

collins.def: If you say that something such as a building or mountain rears above you, you mean that is very tall and close to you.

example.ex: The exhibition hall reared above me behind a high fence...
example.tran: 高高的围墙后面，展览大厅耸立在我面前。

example.ex: The mountains reared up on each side, steep and white.
example.tran: 两边的山峦高耸入云，山势陡峭，覆盖着积雪。

collins.def: If a person or vehicle is bringing up the rear, they are the last person or vehicle in a moving line of them.

example.ex: ...police motorcyclists bringing up the rear of the procession.
example.tran: 摩托骑警行进在队伍最后

collins.tran: （令人不快之物）显现，露头，显露
collins.def: If something unpleasant rears its head or rears its ugly head, it becomes visible or noticeable.

example.ex: The threat of strikes reared its head again this summer...
example.tran: 今年夏天又显现出了罢工的势头。

example.ex: The extreme right reared its ugly head in the 1980s.
example.tran: 极右势力在20世纪80年代有所抬头。

collins.def: A fence is a barrier between two areas of land, made of wood or wire supported by posts.

example.ex: Villagers say the fence would restrict public access to the hills.
example.tran: 村民们说这个围栏将限制公众进入山区。

collins.def: If you fence an area of land, you surround it with a fence.

example.ex: The first task was to fence the wood to exclude sheep...
example.tran: 第一项任务就是把树林围起来不让羊进去。

example.ex: Thomas was playing in a little fenced area full of sand.
example.tran: 托马斯在一小块围起来的满是沙子的地上玩耍。

collins.tran: (越野障碍赛或赛马中的)障碍物
collins.def: A fence in show jumping or horse racing is an obstacle or barrier that horses have to jump over.
A fence is a person who receives stolen property and then sells it.

example.ex: He originally acted as a fence for another gang before turning to burglary himself.
example.tran: 他开始时为另一个犯罪团伙销赃，后来就自己干起了抢劫。

collins.tran: 言和;重归于好;化干戈为玉帛
collins.def: If one country tries to mend fences with another, it tries to end a disagreement or quarrel with the other country. You can also say that two countries mend fences .

example.ex: Washington was last night doing its best to mend fences with the Europeans, saying it understood their concerns...
example.tran: 昨晚，华盛顿尽最大努力与欧洲各国修好，称理解其担忧。

example.ex: The two countries fought a border war a decade ago, but now they are mending fences.
example.tran: 10年前两国曾进行过边境战争，但现在正在重修旧好。

collins.def: If you sit on the fence, you avoid supporting a particular side in a discussion or argument.

example.ex: They are sitting on the fence and refusing to commit themselves...
example.tran: 他们保持中立,拒绝表态。

example.ex: He's not afraid of making decisions and is a man who never sits on the fence.
example.tran: 他不怕拍板，从不作骑墙派。

collins.def: If you fence something in, you surround it completely with a fence.

example.ex: He plans to fence in about 100 acres of his ranch five miles north of town.
example.tran: 他计划将他镇北 5 英里处的约 100 英亩牧场圈起来。

collins.def: If you are fenced in by someone or something, they are so close to you that you are unable to move or leave.

example.ex: She was basically fenced in by what the military wanted to do...
example.tran: 军旅事务使她基本上无法脱身。

example.ex: He put his hand on the post behind her so that he had her fenced in and could look down on her.
example.tran: 他把手放在她身后的柱子上，这样就把她围在当中，可以低头看她了。

collins.def: Your neighbour is someone who lives near you.

example.ex: I got chatting with my neighbour in the garden.
example.tran: 我在花园里和邻居聊了一会。

collins.tran: 邻座;身边的人;邻近的人
collins.def: You can refer to the person who is standing or sitting next to you as your neighbour .

example.ex: The woman prodded her neighbour and whispered urgently in his ear.
example.tran: 那位女士捅了捅邻座，急切地在他耳边低语。

collins.def: You can refer to something which stands next to something else of the same kind as its neighbour .

example.ex: Each house was packed close behind its neighbour.
example.tran: 每幢房子都紧挨着前面的房子而立。

collins.def: A country's neighbour is a country that is next to it.

example.ex: ...the United States' northern neighbour, Canada.
example.tran: 美国北部的邻国，加拿大

collins.def: A cloud is a mass of water vapour that floats in the sky. Clouds are usually white or grey in colour.

example.ex: ...the varied shapes of the clouds...
example.tran: 云朵各种各样的形状

example.ex: The sky was almost entirely obscured by cloud.
example.tran: 天空几乎完全被云所遮蔽。

collins.def: A cloud of something such as smoke or dust is a mass of it floating in the air.

example.ex: The hens darted away on all sides, raising a cloud of dust.
example.tran: 一群母鸡四处乱窜，搅起一团尘土。

collins.tran: 把…搞糊涂;使难以理解；使无法正确判断
collins.def: If you say that something clouds your view of a situation, you mean that it makes you unable to understand the situation or judge it properly.

example.ex: Perhaps anger had clouded his vision, perhaps his judgment had been faulty...
example.tran: 可能是愤怒蒙蔽了他的眼睛，也可能是他判断有误。

example.ex: In his latter years religious mania clouded his mind.
example.tran: 晚年的时候，对宗教的狂热让他丧失心智。

collins.def: If you say that something clouds a situation, you mean that it makes it unpleasant.

example.ex: The atmosphere has already been clouded by the BJP's anger at the media.
example.tran: 印度人民党怒斥媒体，已经破坏了气氛。

collins.tran: (眼神或脸色)阴沉，忧郁；使看起来阴沉（或忧郁）
collins.def: If your eyes or face cloud or if sadness or anger clouds them, your eyes or your face suddenly show sadness or anger.

example.ex: Trish's face clouded with disappointment...
example.tran: 翠茜一脸失望。

example.ex: As he looked at Katherine, great sorrow clouded his eyes.
example.tran: 他看着凯瑟琳，满眼忧伤。

collins.def: If glass clouds or if moisture clouds it, tiny drops of water cover the glass, making it difficult to see through.

example.ex: The mirror clouded beside her cheek...
example.tran: 她面颊边的镜子变得模糊不清。

example.ex: I run the water very hot, clouding the mirror.
example.tran: 我把水开得很热，水汽模糊了镜面。

collins.def: If you say that someone has their head in the clouds, you are criticizing them because they are ignoring or are unaware of the problems associated with a situation.
If you say that someone is on cloud nine, you are emphasizing that they are very happy.

example.ex: When Michael was born I was on cloud nine.
example.tran: 迈克尔出生的时候，我都乐得找不着北了。

collins.def: If someone is under a cloud, people have a poor opinion of them because of something they have done.

example.ex: The military are under a cloud for killing civilians while breaking up a demonstration.
example.tran: 军方因在平息示威活动时杀死了无辜平民而备受指责。

collins.def: Your mood is the way you are feeling at a particular time. If you are in a good mood, you feel cheerful. If you are in a bad mood, you feel angry and impatient.

example.ex: He is clearly in a good mood today...
example.tran: 明摆着，他今天心情不错。

example.ex: When he came back, he was in a foul mood...
example.tran: 他回来时，心情糟透了。

collins.def: If someone is in a mood, the way they are behaving shows that they are feeling angry and impatient.

example.ex: She was obviously in a mood.
example.tran: 她显然情绪不佳。

collins.def: The mood of a group of people is the way that they think and feel about an idea, event, or question at a particular time.

example.ex: The government seemed to be in tune with the popular mood...
example.tran: 政府似乎和民众的意愿是一致的。

example.ex: They largely misread the mood of the electorate.
example.tran: 他们很大程度上误读了选民的意图。

collins.def: The mood of a place is the general impression that you get of it.

example.ex: First set the mood with music...
example.tran: 首先用音乐烘托气氛。

example.ex: I wanted different moods in each room.
example.tran: 我想让每个房间都感觉不一样。

collins.def: In grammar, the mood of a clause is the way in which the verb forms are used to show whether the clause is, for example, a statement, a question, or an instruction.
A monthly event or publication happens or appears every month.

example.ex: Many people are now having trouble making their monthly house payments...
example.tran: 现在很多人在支付房款月供上都有困难。

example.ex: Kidscape runs monthly workshops for teachers.
example.tran: 基德斯克普负责组织每月一次的教师研讨班。

collins.def: You can refer to a publication that is published monthly as a monthly .

example.ex: ...Scallywag, a London satirical monthly.
example.tran: 伦敦讽刺月刊《无赖汉》

example.ex: ...the Nairobi Law Monthly.
example.tran: 《内罗毕法律月刊》

collins.def: Monthly quantities or rates relate to a period of one month.

example.ex: The monthly rent for a two-bedroom flat would be £953.33...
example.tran: 双卧室的公寓每月房租是953.33英镑。

example.ex: Monthly interest costs vary.
example.tran: 每个月的利息费用都不一样。

collins.tran: (置于过去分词或形容词前)新近，最近
collins.def: Newly is used before a past participle or an adjective to indicate that a particular action is very recent, or that a particular state of affairs has very recently begun to exist.

example.ex: She was young at the time, and newly married.
example.tran: 她那时年龄不大，刚结婚。

example.ex: ...the newly independent countries of Africa and Asia.
example.tran: 非洲和亚洲新独立的国家

collins.def: If you owe money to someone, they have lent it to you and you have not yet paid it back. You can also say that the money is owing .

example.ex: The company owes money to more than 60 banks...
example.tran: 这家公司欠下60多家银行的债。

example.ex: Blake already owed him nearly £50...
example.tran: 布莱克已经欠他将近50英镑了。

collins.tran: 应把…归因（于）；应把…归功（于）
collins.def: If someone or something owes a particular quality or their success to a person or thing, they only have it because of that person or thing.

example.ex: I always suspected she owed her first job to her friendship with Roger...
example.tran: 我一直怀疑她仗着自己是罗杰的朋友才得到第一份工作。

example.ex: He owed his survival to his strength as a swimmer...
example.tran: 他是因为水性好才幸免于难的。

collins.def: If you say that you owe a great deal to someone or something, you mean that they have helped you or influenced you a lot, and you feel very grateful to them.

example.ex: As a professional composer I owe much to Radio 3...
example.tran: 作为一名职业作曲家，我十分感激第三电台。

example.ex: He's been fantastic. I owe him a lot.
example.tran: 他真是个大好人，我欠他太多了。

collins.def: If you say that something owes a great deal to a person or thing, you mean that it exists, is successful, or has its particular form mainly because of them.

example.ex: The island's present economy owes a good deal to whisky distilling...
example.tran: 该岛当前的经济发展主要归功于蒸馏法酿造威士忌酒行业。

example.ex: Mrs Allen's style of cooking owes much to her mother-in-law.
example.tran: 艾伦太太的烹饪风格很大程度上承传于她的婆婆。

collins.tran: 应该给予（某人感激、尊重、忠诚等）
collins.def: If you say that you owe someone gratitude, respect, or loyalty, you mean that they deserve it from you.

example.ex: Perhaps we owe these people more respect...
example.tran: 也许我们应该给予这些人更多的尊重。

example.ex: I owe you an apology. You must have found my attitude very annoying...
example.tran: 我应该向你道歉。你一定觉得我的态度很恶劣吧。

collins.tran: 应该为（某人做）；有必要为（某人做）
collins.def: If you say that you owe it to someone to do something, you mean that you should do that thing because they deserve it.

example.ex: I can't go. I owe it to him to stay...
example.tran: 我不能走。看在他的分上我也该留下来。

example.ex: You owe it to yourself to get some professional help...
example.tran: 你应该为了自己寻求专业人士的帮助。

collins.def: You use owing to when you are introducing the reason for something.

example.ex: He was out of work owing to a physical injury...
example.tran: 他因为受伤而失业了。

example.ex: Owing to staff shortages, there was no restaurant car on the train.
example.tran: 由于缺人手，这趟火车上没有餐车。

means: 混合(mix的过去式和过去分词)

collins.def: If you have mixed feelings about something or someone, you feel uncertain about them because you can see both good and bad points about them.

example.ex: I came home from the meeting with mixed feelings...
example.tran: 开完会回到家里，我心里百感交集。

example.ex: There has been a very mixed reaction to the decision.
example.tran: 对于这个决定的反应非常不一致。

collins.tran: (人)混合的，混杂的，形形色色的
collins.def: A mixed group of people consists of people of many different types.

example.ex: I found a very mixed group of individuals some of whom I could relate to and others with whom I had very little in common...
example.tran: 我发现这群人各不相同，有些人还合得来，我能够理解，其他那些则和我几乎没有共同之处。

example.ex: The community is very mixed, not least because there are plenty of small industrial enterprises.
example.tran: 这个社区的成员非常复杂，尤其是因为这里有许多小型的工业企业。

collins.def: Mixed is used to describe something that involves people from two or more different races.

example.ex: ...a woman of mixed race...
example.tran: 混血女子

example.ex: She had attended a racially mixed school.
example.tran: 她曾在一所由多种族学生组成的学校读书。

collins.tran: 男女同校的;男女合住的
collins.def: Mixed education or accommodation is intended for both males and females.

example.ex: Girls who have always been at a mixed school know how to stand up for themselves...
example.tran: 一直上男女混合学校的女孩知道如何去维护自己的利益。

example.ex: The spa has 6 indoor pools, 2 for women only, 2 for men only, and 2 for mixed bathing.
example.tran: 这个温泉有6个室内池子，其中2个仅供女士，2个仅供男士，其余2个可以男女共用。

collins.def: Mixed is used to describe something which includes or consists of different things of the same general kind.

example.ex: ...a small mixed salad...
example.tran: 一小份什锦色拉

example.ex: The mixed forest is cut commercially but is also carefully conserved to look good.
example.tran: 这片混合林用于商业砍伐，但与此同时也进行妥善维护以保持景观。

means: 求助于或诉诸某事物，采取某手段或方法应急或作为对策
热闹场所，娱乐场，度假胜地

collins.def: If you resort to a course of action that you do not really approve of, you adopt it because you cannot see any other way of achieving what you want.

example.ex: His punishing work schedule had made him resort to drugs...
example.tran: 异常紧张的工作安排使他开始吸毒。

example.ex: Some schools have resorted to recruiting teachers from overseas.
example.tran: 有些学校不得不开始从海外招收老师。

collins.def: If you achieve something without resort to a particular course of action, you succeed without carrying out that action. To have resort to a particular course of action means to have to do that action in order to achieve something.

example.ex: Congress has a responsibility to ensure that all peaceful options are exhausted before resort to war.
example.tran: 国会有责任确保只有在所有和平手段都不奏效的情况下才会诉诸战争。

collins.def: A resort is a place where a lot of people spend their holidays.

example.ex: ...the ski resorts.
example.tran: 滑雪胜地

collins.def: If you do something as a last resort, you do it because you can find no other way of getting out of a difficult situation or of solving a problem.

example.ex: Nuclear weapons should be used only as a last resort...
example.tran: 不到万不得已时不能选择使用核武器。

example.ex: As a last resort you may have to accept their point of view.
example.tran: 最终，你可能不得不接受他们的观点。

collins.def: You use in the last resort when stating the most basic or important fact that will still be true in a situation whatever else happens.

example.ex: They would in the last resort support their friends whatever they did.
example.tran: 无论他们的朋友做了什么，他们最终都会支持他们的朋友。

collins.def: Something that is enormous is extremely large in size or amount.

example.ex: The main bedroom is enormous...
example.tran: 主卧室非常大。

example.ex: There is, of course, an enormous amount to see.
example.tran: 当然有很多可看的。

collins.def: You can use enormous to emphasize the great degree or extent of something.

example.ex: It was an enormous disappointment.
example.tran: 真是让人万分失望。

example.ex: ...his enormous capacity for brutality.
example.tran: 他的穷凶极恶

collins.def: If you quit your job, you choose to leave it.

example.ex: He quit his job as an office boy in Athens...
example.tran: 他辞去了在雅典当办公室勤杂工的工作。

example.ex: He figured he would quit before Johnson fired him.
example.tran: 他估计自己会在约翰逊炒他鱿鱼之前先辞职。

collins.def: If you quit an activity or quit doing something, you stop doing it.

example.ex: A nicotine spray can help smokers quit the habit without putting on weight...
example.tran: 尼古丁喷雾剂能够帮助吸烟者在不增加体重的同时戒烟。

example.ex: I was trying to quit smoking at the time.
example.tran: 当时我正在努力戒烟。

collins.def: If you quit a place, you leave it completely and do not go back to it.

example.ex: ...the idea that humans might one day quit the earth to colonise other planets...
example.tran: 人类有朝一日可能会离开地球到其他星球定居繁衍的想法

example.ex: Police were called when he refused to quit the building.
example.tran: 他拒绝离开那座大楼，于是人们叫来了警察。

collins.def: If you say that you are going to call it quits, you mean that you have decided to stop doing something or being involved in something.

example.ex: They raised $630,000 through listener donations, and then called it quits...
example.tran: 他们通过听众捐款的方式筹集了63万美元后宣告结束。

example.ex: You can decide whether there is hope in working for mutual happiness, or if you should call it quits.
example.tran: 你可以决定是否有希望为双方共同的幸福努力，或者就此一刀两断。

collins.def: To have a reputation for something means to be known or remembered for it.

example.ex: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
example.tran: 艾丽斯·芒罗以文风沉郁闻名。

example.ex: ...Barcelona's reputation as a design-conscious, artistic city.
example.tran: 巴塞罗那作为一个具有设计意识的艺术城市的声誉

collins.def: Something's or someone's reputation is the opinion that people have about how good they are. If they have a good reputation, people think they are good.

example.ex: This college has a good academic reputation...
example.tran: 这所大学有良好的学术声誉。

example.ex: The stories ruined his reputation.
example.tran: 这些传闻把他的名誉全毁了。

collins.def: If you know someone by reputation, you have never met them but you have heard of their reputation.

example.ex: She was by reputation a good organiser.
example.tran: 听说她的组织能力很强。

means: （因省钱、省时或省力等而）收效大的

collins.def: If something or someone is efficient, they are able to do tasks successfully, without wasting time or energy.

example.ex: With today's more efficient contraception women can plan their families and careers.
example.tran: 如今有了更加有效的避孕方法，女性便可以规划她们的家庭和事业。

collins.def: A celebration is a special enjoyable event that people organize because something pleasant has happened or because it is someone's birthday or anniversary.

example.ex: I can tell you, there was a celebration in our house that night.
example.tran: 告诉你，那天晚上我家开了个庆祝会。

example.ex: ...his eightieth birthday celebrations.
example.tran: 他80大寿的庆祝活动

collins.def: The celebration of something is praise and appreciation which is given to it.

example.ex: This was not a memorial service but a celebration of his life...
example.tran: 这不是在开追悼会，而是在颂扬他的一生。

example.ex: He sees the poem as a celebration of human love.
example.tran: 他认为，这首诗是对人世间爱的赞美。

collins.def: A planet's atmosphere is the layer of air or other gases around it.

example.ex: ...dangerous levels of pollution in the Earth's atmosphere...
example.tran: 地球大气层污染程度严重

example.ex: The Partial Test-Ban Treaty bans nuclear testing in the atmosphere.
example.tran: 《部分禁止核试验条约》禁止在大气层中进行核试验。

collins.def: The atmosphere of a place is the air that you breathe there.

example.ex: These gases pollute the atmosphere of towns and cities.
example.tran: 这些气体污染了城镇的空气。

collins.def: The atmosphere of a place is the general impression that you get of it.

example.ex: Pale wooden floors and plenty of natural light add to the relaxed atmosphere...
example.tran: 淡色木地板和充足的自然光平添了几分轻松的氛围。

example.ex: There's still an atmosphere of great hostility and tension in the city.
example.tran: 强烈的敌对和紧张气氛依然笼罩着这座城市。

collins.def: If a place or an event has atmosphere, it is interesting.

example.ex: The old harbour is still full of atmosphere and well worth visiting.
example.tran: 这座古老的港口依然充满了情趣，颇值得一游。

means: 从异地移入的动物[植物]

collins.def: An immigrant is a person who has come to live in a country from some other country.

example.ex: ...illegal immigrants.
example.tran: 非法移民

example.ex: ...immigrant visas.
example.tran: 移民签证

collins.tran: （尤指向水中）纵身投入，一头进入
collins.def: If something or someone plunges in a particular direction, especially into water, they fall, rush, or throw themselves in that direction.

example.ex: At least 50 people died when a bus plunged into a river...
example.tran: 一辆公共汽车栽进河里，造成至少50人丧生。

example.ex: He ran down the steps to the pool terrace and plunged in.
example.tran: 他跑下台阶来到泳池露台，纵身跳进池里。

collins.def: If you plunge an object into something, you push it quickly or violently into it.

example.ex: A soldier plunged a bayonet into his body...
example.tran: 一名士兵将刺刀插进了他的身体。

example.ex: She plunged her face into a bowl of cold water...
example.tran: 她把脸扎进一盆凉水里。

collins.def: If a person or thing is plunged into a particular state or situation, or if they plunge into it, they are suddenly in that state or situation.

example.ex: The government's political and economic reforms threaten to plunge the country into chaos...
example.tran: 政府的政治和经济改革可能会使国家陷入混乱局面。

example.ex: 8,000 homes were plunged into darkness as electricity cables crashed down...
example.tran: 由于电缆损毁，8,000户家庭顿时落入一片黑暗之中。

collins.def: If you plunge into an activity or are plunged into it, you suddenly get very involved in it.

example.ex: The two men plunged into discussion...
example.tran: 两位男士立即投入到讨论中。

example.ex: The prince should be plunged into work...
example.tran: 王子应该积极参与工作。

collins.def: If an amount or rate plunges, it decreases quickly and suddenly.

example.ex: His weight began to plunge...
example.tran: 他的体重开始锐减。

example.ex: The Pound plunged to a new low on the foreign exchange markets yesterday...
example.tran: 昨天在外汇市场上英镑骤跌至新低。

collins.tran: 决定冒险尝试；采取断然行动
collins.def: If you take the plunge, you decide to do something that you consider difficult or risky.

example.ex: If you have been thinking about buying shares, now could be the time to take the plunge.
example.tran: 如果你一直在考虑购买股票，现在或许是采取行动的最好时机。

means: （尤指房间、烟囱、炉子等供暖系统中的）（小股）气流
（设计、草图、提纲或版本）正在起草中的，草拟的

collins.def: A draft is an early version of a letter, book, or speech.

example.ex: I rewrote his rough draft, which was published under my name...
example.tran: 我把他的草稿重新改写，并以我的名字发表了。

example.ex: I faxed a first draft of this article to him.
example.tran: 我将这篇文章的初稿传真给他了。

collins.def: When you draft a letter, book, or speech, you write the first version of it.

example.ex: He drafted a standard letter to the editors...
example.tran: 他起草了一份给编辑的标准信函。

example.ex: The legislation was drafted by House Democrats.
example.tran: 法律由众议院民主党草拟。

collins.def: If you are drafted, you are ordered to serve in the armed forces, usually for a limited period of time.

example.ex: During the Second World War, he was drafted into the US Army...
example.tran: 二战期间，他应征加入了美国陆军。

example.ex: He wasn't drafted for the war; he volunteered for the Navy.
example.tran: 他不是因为这次战争才被征召入伍的，他是自愿加入海军的。

collins.def: If people are drafted into a place, they are moved there to do a particular job.

example.ex: Extra police have been drafted into the town after the violence...
example.tran: 暴乱过后又有警力被抽调到了该镇。

example.ex: The manager will make a special plea to draft the player into his squad as a replacement.
example.tran: 主教练将特别要求抽调这位运动员到他的队里做替补。

collins.def: The draft is the practice of ordering people to serve in the armed forces, usually for a limited period of time.

example.ex: ...his effort to avoid the draft.
example.tran: 他试图逃避兵役

collins.def: A draft is a written order for payment of money by a bank, especially from one bank to another.

example.ex: The money was payable by a draft drawn by the home...
example.tran: 这笔钱可凭国内承兑的汇票支付。

example.ex: Ten days later Carmen received a bank draft for a plane ticket.
example.tran: 10 天后卡门收到了一张用于购买机票的银行汇票。

means: 使（新闻、报道等）带有倾向性

collins.def: An angle is the difference in direction between two lines or surfaces. Angles are measured in degrees.

example.ex: The boat is now leaning at a 30 degree angle.
example.tran: 船正以30度角倾斜。

collins.tran: （两条线或两个平面相交的）夹角，边角
collins.def: An angle is the shape that is created where two lines or surfaces join together.

example.ex: ...the angle of the blade.
example.tran: 刀口的夹角

example.ex: ...brackets to adjust the steering wheel's angle.
example.tran: 用于调整方向盘角度的支架

collins.def: An angle is the direction from which you look at something.

example.ex: Thanks to the angle at which he stood, he could just see the sunset...
example.tran: 由于站的位置视角好，他刚好能看见日落。

example.ex: His face will be discreetly concealed by camera angles.
example.tran: 通过调整照相机的角度，他的脸将被巧妙地遮住。

collins.tran: 角度；观点；立场；侧重点；倾向性
collins.def: You can refer to a way of presenting something or thinking about it as a particular angle .

example.ex: We had to do the scene over and over again, from different angles...
example.tran: 我们不得不翻来覆去地从不同的角度拍这个场面。

example.ex: He was considering the idea from all angles.
example.tran: 他正从各个角度考虑这个想法。

collins.def: If someone is angling for something, they are trying to get it without asking for it directly.

example.ex: It sounds as if he's just angling for sympathy.
example.tran: 听起来好像他只是在博取同情。

collins.def: If you angle something or if it angles in a particular direction, it faces or points in that direction.

example.ex: You can open the slats for a bright light or angle them for more shade...
example.tran: 可以调节百叶窗使光线亮一些，也可以暗一些。

example.ex: The path angled downhill and northwards...
example.tran: 小路向山下伸展，然后向北延伸。

collins.def: If something is at an angle, it is leaning in a particular direction so that it is not straight, horizontal, or vertical.

example.ex: An iron bar stuck out at an angle...
example.tran: 一根铁棍斜伸出来。

example.ex: The wall's at a slight angle.
example.tran: 这面墙有点歪。

means: 实际上，实质上，事实上，几乎

collins.tran: 几乎;实际上;事实上;差不多
collins.def: You can use virtually to indicate that something is so nearly true that for most purposes it can be regarded as true.

example.ex: Virtually all cooking was done over coal-fired ranges...
example.tran: 差不多所有的烹饪都是在燃煤灶上进行的。

example.ex: It would have been virtually impossible to research all the information.
example.tran: 要对所有的信息进行分析研究几乎是不可能的。

collins.def: Banking is the business activity of banks and similar institutions.

collins.tran: （常指逐渐或反复）削弱，损害（情感、体制等）
collins.def: If you undermine something such as a feeling or a system, you make it less strong or less secure than it was before, often by a gradual process or by repeated efforts.

example.ex: Offering advice on each and every problem will undermine her feeling of being adult...
example.tran: 对每个问题都给出建议会令她觉得自己不像个成年人。

example.ex: Western intelligence agencies are accused of trying to undermine the government.
example.tran: 西方情报机构被指责企图动摇该政府的统治。

collins.tran: （常指间接地）削弱，损害，动摇（某人的地位或权威）
collins.def: If you undermine someone or undermine their position or authority, you make their authority or position less secure, often by indirect methods.

example.ex: She undermined him and destroyed his confidence in his own talent...
example.tran: 她暗中打击他，让他对自己的才华信心全无。

example.ex: The conversations were designed to undermine her authority so she felt that she could no longer work for the company.
example.tran: 这些谈话有意削弱她的威信，这样她会觉得自己在公司干不下去。

collins.tran: 破坏，损害（某人的努力或成功的机会）
collins.def: If you undermine someone's efforts or undermine their chances of achieving something, you behave in a way that makes them less likely to succeed.

example.ex: The continued fighting threatens to undermine efforts to negotiate an agreement...
example.tran: 持续的战斗会破坏希望通过谈判来达成协议的努力。

example.ex: I don't want to do something that would undermine the chances of success.
example.tran: 我不想做会影响成功机会的事情。

means: the North Atlantic Treaty Organization北大西洋公约组织

collins.def: NATO is an international organization which consists of the USA, Canada, Britain, and other European countries, all of whom have agreed to support one another if they are attacked. NATO is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'North Atlantic Treaty Organization'.

example.ex: NATO says it will keep a reduced number of modern nuclear weapons to guarantee peace.
example.tran: 北约宣称将削减现代核武器的数量并将其维持在这一水平，以保障和平。

collins.def: When you lock something such as a door, drawer, or case, you fasten it, usually with a key, so that other people cannot open it.

example.ex: Are you sure you locked the front door?...
example.tran: 你确定锁了前门吗？

example.ex: Wolfgang moved along the corridor towards the locked door at the end.
example.tran: 沃尔夫冈走向过道尽头锁着的那扇门。

collins.def: The lock on something such as a door or a drawer is the device which is used to keep it shut and prevent other people from opening it. Locks are opened with a key.

example.ex: At that moment he heard Gill's key turning in the lock of the door...
example.tran: 那一刻，他听见吉尔的钥匙开启门锁的声音。

example.ex: An intruder forced open a lock on French windows at the house.
example.tran: 有人强行撬开落地窗上的锁闯入屋里。

collins.tran: 把… 锁起妥藏；把…关起来
collins.def: If you lock something or someone in a place, room, or container, you put them there and fasten the lock.

example.ex: Her maid locked the case in the safe...
example.tran: 她的女佣把箱子锁进保险柜里。

example.ex: They beat them up and locked them in a cell.
example.tran: 他们殴打了他们，并把他们锁在一间囚室里。

collins.def: If you lock something in a particular position or if it lock there, it is held or fitted firmly in that position.

example.ex: He leaned back in the swivel chair and locked his fingers behind his head...
example.tran: 他仰靠在转椅上，十指交叉枕在脑后。

example.ex: There was a whine of hydraulics as the undercarriage locked into position.
example.tran: 随着液压系统嘎吱一声响，起落架进入了锁定位置。

collins.def: On a canal or river, a lock is a place where walls have been built with gates at each end so that boats can move to a higher or lower section of the canal or river, by gradually changing the water level inside the gates.
A lock of hair is a small bunch of hairs on your head that grow together and curl or curve in the same direction.

example.ex: She brushed a lock of hair off his forehead.
example.tran: 她撩开他脑门上的一绺头发。

collins.def: Your locks are your hair.

example.ex: ...women with long, wavy locks.
example.tran: 留着长长卷发的女人们

collins.def: If something or someone is kept under lock and key, they are in a container or room which has been securely locked.

example.ex: The books were normally kept under lock and key in the library vault...
example.tran: 这些书一般妥善锁藏在图书馆的地窖里。

example.ex: He is currently under lock and key at Eastmoor secure unit in Leeds.
example.tran: 他眼下被关押在利兹的伊斯特穆尔保安部。

collins.def: Ancient means belonging to the distant past, especially to the period in history before the end of the Roman Empire.

example.ex: They believed ancient Greece and Rome were vital sources of learning.
example.tran: 他们认为古代希腊罗马是知识的重要发源地。

collins.def: Ancient means very old, or having existed for a long time.

example.ex: ...ancient Jewish tradition.
example.tran: 古老的犹太传统

example.ex: ...ancient fishing rights.
example.tran: 由来已久的捕鱼权

collins.tran: 古代人；（尤指）古希腊人，古罗马人
collins.def: The ancients are the people of an old civilization, especially classical Greece or Rome.

example.ex: The ancients knew more than we do about the heavens.
example.tran: 古代人对于上天比我们知道得多。

collins.tran: （法令或法规的）修正条款，修正案
collins.def: An amendment is a section that is added to a law or rule in order to change it.

example.ex: ...an amendment to the defense bill.
example.tran: 防御法案的修正案

example.ex: ...a constitutional amendment...
example.tran: 宪法修正条款

collins.def: An amendment is a change that is made to a piece of writing.
Midnight is twelve o'clock in the middle of the night.

example.ex: It was well after midnight by the time Anne returned to her apartment...
example.tran: 安妮回到寓所的时候早就过了午夜。

example.ex: The entrance gates were locked at midnight.
example.tran: 大门午夜时上锁。

collins.def: Midnight is used to describe something which happens or appears at midnight or in the middle of the night.

example.ex: It is totally out of the question to postpone the midnight deadline...
example.tran: 想要推迟午夜的最后期限是完全不可能的。

example.ex: Well we did have a midnight feast, me and my sister.
example.tran: 我和姐姐的确在半夜大吃了一顿。

collins.tran: 开夜车;挑灯夜战;工作(或读书)至深夜
collins.def: If someone is burning the midnight oil, they are staying up very late in order to study or do some other work.

example.ex: Chris is asleep after burning the midnight oil trying to finish his article.
example.tran: 克里斯为了写完文章挑灯夜战，现在已经睡着了。

means: 梗概，大纲，提纲，草稿，要点，主要原则
外形，轮廓，轮廓线，轮廓画法，略图（画法）

collins.def: If you outline an idea or a plan, you explain it in a general way.

example.ex: The mayor outlined his plan to clean up the town's image...
example.tran: 市长概述了他整顿市容的计划。

example.ex: The methods outlined in this book are only suggestions.
example.tran: 本书概括的一些方法仅供参考。

collins.def: An outline is a general explanation or description of something.

example.ex: Following is an outline of the survey findings...
example.tran: 以下是调查结果概要。

example.ex: The proposals were given in outline by the Secretary of State.
example.tran: 国务卿对提议进行了简要的概述。

collins.tran: （因背后的光线）显示…的轮廓（或外形）
collins.def: You say that an object is outlined when you can see its general shape because there is light behind it.

example.ex: The Ritz was outlined against the lights up there...
example.tran: 高悬的灯光映照出里兹饭店的轮廓。

example.ex: It was a beautiful sight outlined above the starry sky.
example.tran: 星空之上映衬出美景。

collins.def: The outline of something is its general shape, especially when it cannot be clearly seen.

example.ex: He could see only the hazy outline of the goalposts.
example.tran: 他只能看见球门柱模糊的轮廓。

collins.tran: 优先事项；最重要的事；当务之急
collins.def: If something is a priority, it is the most important thing you have to do or deal with, or must be done or dealt with before everything else you have to do.

example.ex: Being a parent is her first priority...
example.tran: 做好母亲是她的头等大事。

example.ex: The government's priority is to build more power plants...
example.tran: 政府的首要任务是建造更多的发电站。

collins.def: If you give priority to something or someone, you treat them as more important than anything or anyone else.

example.ex: The school will give priority to science, maths and modern languages...
example.tran: 学校将重点发展理科、数学和现代语言。

example.ex: The proposals deserve support as they give priority to the needs of children.
example.tran: 这些提议值得拥护，因为它们优先考虑了儿童的需求。

collins.def: If something takes priority or has priority over other things, it is regarded as being more important than them and is dealt with first.

example.ex: The fight against inflation took priority over measures to combat the deepening recession...
example.tran: 抵制通货膨胀比抑制日益加剧的经济衰退更为重要。

example.ex: I disagree with the premise that economic development has priority over the environment.
example.tran: 我不赞成经济发展应优先于环境保护这个前提。

collins.def: Honour means doing what you believe to be right and being confident that you have done what is right.

example.ex: The officers died faithful to Poland and to the honour of a soldier...
example.tran: 这些军官至死都忠于波兰，坚守了军人气节。

example.ex: I do not believe I can any longer serve with honour as a member of your government.
example.tran: 我认为自己再也无法问心无愧地在你的政府中任职。

collins.def: An honour is a special award that is given to someone, usually because they have done something good or because they are greatly respected.

example.ex: Most of the high honours usually go to long-serving MPs loyal to the government...
example.tran: 大多数的高级荣誉通常都会授予忠于政府的资深议员。

example.ex: He was showered with honours—among them an Oscar.
example.tran: 他赢得了众多荣誉——其中包括一项奥斯卡奖。

collins.def: If someone is honoured, they are given public praise or an award for something they have done.

example.ex: Two American surgeons were last week honoured with the Nobel Prize for Medicine and Physiology...
example.tran: 两位美国外科医生上周获得了诺贝尔医学和生理学奖。

example.ex: Mr Reddy has been honoured by the Pope by being made a knight of St Gregory.
example.tran: 雷迪先生被教皇授予“圣格列高利骑士”的荣誉称号。

collins.def: If you describe doing or experiencing something as an honour, you mean you think it is something special and desirable.

example.ex: Five other cities had been competing for the honour of staging the Games...
example.tran: 还有其他5个城市为赢得该届运动会的主办权一直在进行角逐。

example.ex: Tchaikovsky was given a state funeral—the first commoner to be granted this honour...
example.tran: 柴可夫斯基得到了国葬待遇——他是首位获此殊荣的平民。

collins.tran: 使感到荣幸;使引以为荣
collins.def: If you say that you would be honoured to do something, you are saying very politely and formally that you would be pleased to do it. If you say that you are honoured by something, you are saying that you are grateful for it and pleased about it.

example.ex: Peter Alliss says he would be honoured to be asked...
example.tran: 彼得·艾利斯说若受邀约自己将感到非常荣幸。

example.ex: It's a very flattering offer, and I'm honoured by your confidence in me.
example.tran: 这个提议让我受宠若惊，能得到您的信任我感到很荣幸。

collins.def: To honour someone means to treat them or regard them with special attention and respect.

example.ex: Her Majesty later honoured the Headmaster with her presence at lunch...
example.tran: 女王陛下随后出席了午宴，以表示对校长的尊重。

example.ex: Those right-wing people who most honour their monarch see no reason for any apology.
example.tran: 那些对君主最为尊崇的右翼人士认为没有理由作出道歉。

collins.def: If you honour an arrangement or promise, you do what you said you would do.

example.ex: The two sides agreed to honour a new ceasefire...
example.tran: 双方同意执行新的停火协议。

example.ex: Mr Ashkenazy has informed us that he will be unable to honour his contract with Symphony Hall to perform the piano recital.
example.tran: 阿什克纳齐先生已通知我们，他将无法履行和交响音乐厅签订的钢琴独奏演出合同。

collins.def: Honours is a type of university degree which is of a higher standard than a pass or ordinary degree.

example.ex: ...an honours degree in business studies.
example.tran: 商学荣誉学位

collins.tran: （美国对法官、市长等的尊称）阁下，大人（当面称呼时用 your honour，其他场合提及时用 his honour 或 her honour）
collins.def: Judges, and mayors in the United States, are sometimes called your honour or referred to as his honour or her honour .

example.ex: I bring this up, your honor, because I think it is important to understand the background of the defendant.
example.tran: 法官大人，我之所以提及此事，是因为我觉得了解被告的背景十分重要。

example.ex: ...His Honour Judge Brodrick.
example.tran: 布罗德里克法官大人

collins.def: If someone does the honours at a social occasion or public event, they act as host or perform some official function.

example.ex: A well-known television personality did the honours at the official opening of the show.
example.tran: 一位著名的电视明星主持了该次展览的正式开幕典礼。

collins.def: If something is arranged in honour of a particular event, it is arranged in order to celebrate that event.

example.ex: The Foundation is holding a dinner at the Museum of American Art in honour of the opening of their new show.
example.tran: 该基金会将在美国艺术博物馆举办宴会，庆祝新展览的开幕。

collins.def: If something is arranged or happens in someone's honour, it is done specially to show appreciation of them.

example.ex: He will attend an outdoor concert in his honour in the centre of Paris...
example.tran: 他将出席在巴黎市中心特地为他举办的一场露天音乐会。

example.ex: The United Nations has issued a stamp in honour of Captain Alfred Dreyfus.
example.tran: 联合国发行了一枚纪念阿尔弗雷德·德雷富斯上尉的邮票。

collins.tran: （信息、测量、数据或仪器等）精确的，准确的
collins.def: Accurate information, measurements, and statistics are correct to a very detailed level. An accurate instrument is able to give you information of this kind.

example.ex: Police have stressed that this is the most accurate description of the killer to date...
example.tran: 警方强调这是迄今对凶手最精确的描述。

example.ex: This may provide a quick and accurate way of monitoring the amount of carbon dioxide in the air...
example.tran: 这也许能提供一个监测空气中二氧化碳含量的既快又准的方法。

collins.def: An accurate statement or account gives a true or fair judgment of something.

example.ex: I think it may take sometime before we can have an accurate assessment of the damage...
example.tran: 我认为我们对损失作出准确的估算可能需要一段时间。

example.ex: They were accurate in their prediction that he would change her life drastically.
example.tran: 他们预测得没错，他使她的生活发生了翻天覆地的变化。

collins.def: You can use accurate to describe the results of someone's actions when they do or  copy something correctly or exactly.

example.ex: Marks were given for accurate spelling and punctuation.
example.tran: 因拼写及标点正确而得分。

example.ex: ...his maliciously accurate imitation of Hubert de Burgh.
example.tran: 他对休伯特·德伯格到位的恶搞模仿

collins.tran: （武器、投掷）精准的；（人）射击（或投掷）准的
collins.def: An accurate weapon or throw reaches the exact point or target that it was intended to reach. You can also describe a person as accurate if they fire a weapon or throw something in this way.

example.ex: The rifle was extremely accurate...
example.tran: 这把步枪准头极高。

example.ex: The pilots, however, were not as accurate as they should be.
example.tran: 然而飞行员并不像他们该达到的水平那样精准。

means: 指挥的，根据命令（或要求）而作的

collins.def: If someone in  authority commands you to do something, they tell you that you must do it.

example.ex: He commanded his troops to attack...
example.tran: 他命令部队发起进攻。

example.ex: 'Get in your car and follow me,' he commanded...
example.tran: “上你自己的车，跟在我后面。”他命令道。

collins.tran: 博得，赢得，拥有(尊重、服从等)
collins.def: If you command something such as respect or obedience, you obtain it because you are popular, famous, or important.

example.ex: ...an excellent physician who commanded the respect of all his colleagues...
example.tran: 赢得所有同事尊敬的优秀的内科医生

example.ex: There is no limit to what can be achieved here because of the fantastic support we command.
example.tran: 由于赢得了极大的支持，我们将无往不胜。

collins.def: If an army or country commands a place, they have total control over it.

example.ex: The Royal Navy would command the seas...
example.tran: 皇家海军会控制所有海域。

example.ex: Yemen commands the strait at the southern end of the Red Sea.
example.tran: 也门完全控制着红海南端的海峡。

collins.def: An officer who commands part of an army, navy, or air force is responsible for controlling and organizing it.

example.ex: ...the French general who commands the UN troops in the region...
example.tran: 统率该地区联合国部队的法国将军

example.ex: He didn't just command. He personally fought in several heavy battles.
example.tran: 他不仅仅发号施令，还身先士卒参加了几次激战。

collins.def: In the armed forces, a command is a group of officers who are responsible for organizing and controlling part of an army, navy, or air force.

example.ex: He had authorisation from the military command to retaliate...
example.tran: 他得到军事指挥部授权，准备反击。

example.ex: The army's supreme command has said the army will withdraw, provided the other side does so also.
example.tran: 陆军最高司令部说如果对方撤退，他们的部队也要撤退。

collins.tran: （某一指挥官统率的）部队，兵团，军区
collins.def: In the armed forces, a command is a group of soldiers that a particular officer is in charge of.

example.ex: There would continue to be a joint command of US and Saudi forces operating within Saudi borders.
example.tran: 美国军队和沙特军队共同组成的联合部队将继续在沙特阿拉伯境内实施军事行动。

example.ex: ...the Strategic Air Command.
example.tran: 战略空军司令部

collins.def: In computing, a command is an instruction that you give to a computer.
If someone has command of a situation, they have control of it because they have, or seem to have, power or authority.

example.ex: Whoever was waiting for them there had command of the situation...
example.tran: 在那边等候他们的人控制了局势。

example.ex: Mr Baker would take command of the campaign...
example.tran: 贝克先生会负责这次运动。

collins.def: Your command of something, such as a foreign language, is your knowledge of it and your ability to use this knowledge.

example.ex: His command of English was excellent.
example.tran: 他精通英语。

example.ex: ...a singer with a natural command of melody.
example.tran: 天生乐感很好的歌手

collins.tran: 居高临下;俯瞰;清楚地看到
collins.def: If a place commands a view, especially an impressive one, you can see the view clearly from that place. If a person commands a view of something, they can see it clearly from where they are.

example.ex: The house commanded some splendid views of Delaware Bay.
example.tran: 从这座房子可以俯瞰到特拉华湾壮丽的景致。

example.ex: ...a point of rock, from which we could command a view of the loch.
example.tran: 可以对整个海峡一览无遗的布满岩石的岬角

collins.tran: (技术或资源)可运用自如，充分运用，可支配
collins.def: If you have a particular skill or particular resources at your command, you have them and can use them fully.

example.ex: He came from the Sudan without a word of English at his command...
example.tran: 他来自苏丹地区，一句英语都不会。

example.ex: The country should have the right to defend itself with all legal means at its command.
example.tran: 国家有权运用一切合法手段保卫自身安全。

collins.def: If you are in command or in command of yourself, you are relaxed and able to react and behave in the way that you want to.

example.ex: Nixon looked comfortable and in command...
example.tran: 尼克松看上去镇定自若。

example.ex: The man appeared to be in complete command of himself.
example.tran: 那个男人看上去神态自如。

means: （染色体上基因排列的）遗传图

collins.def: A map is a drawing of a particular area such as a city, a country, or a continent, showing its main features as they would appear if you looked at them from above.

example.ex: He unfolded the map and set it on the floor...
example.tran: 他打开地图，放在了地板上。

example.ex: Have you got a map of the city centre?
example.tran: 你有市中心的地图吗？

collins.def: A map is a drawing that gives special information about an area.

example.ex: ...geological maps, books and atlases.
example.tran: 地质图、书籍与地图册

example.ex: ...weather maps on television.
example.tran: 电视上的气象图

collins.def: To map an area means to make a map of it.

example.ex: ...a spacecraft which is using radar to map the surface of Venus.
example.tran: 使用雷达绘制金星表面地图的宇宙飞船

example.ex: ...better mapping of the ocean  floor.
example.tran: 对海底地形的更精确绘制

collins.def: If you say that someone or something put a person, thing, or place on the map, you approve of the fact that they made it become well-known and important.

example.ex: ...the attempts of the Edinburgh Festival's organisers to put C.P. Taylor firmly on the map...
example.tran: 爱丁堡艺术节的组织者们为使C.P.泰勒名扬四海所作的努力

example.ex: This could put cider back on the map as one of our great national drinks.
example.tran: 这样可以让苹果酒再度名扬四方，成为我们重要的国酒之一。

means: 被（烟、感情等）熏[压]倒，使受不了

collins.def: If you overcome a problem or a feeling, you successfully deal with it and control it.

example.ex: Molly had fought and overcome her fear of flying...
example.tran: 莫莉已经努力克服了对飞行的恐惧。

example.ex: Find a way to overcome your difficulties.
example.tran: 找出办法战胜困难。

collins.tran: （感情上）受到极大影响，承受不起
collins.def: If you are overcome by a feeling or event, it is so strong or has such a strong effect that you cannot think clearly.

example.ex: The night before the test I was overcome by fear and despair...
example.tran: 考试前的晚上，恐惧和绝望让我内心无比惊慌。

example.ex: A dizziness overcame him, blurring his vision.
example.tran: 他感到一阵眩晕，眼前发黑。

collins.def: If you are overcome by smoke or a poisonous gas, you become very ill or die from breathing it in.

example.ex: The residents were trying to escape from the fire but were overcome by smoke.
example.tran: 居民试图逃离火场，却被浓烟熏倒了。

collins.def: Someone who is healthy is well and is not suffering from any illness.

example.ex: Most of us need to lead more balanced lives to be healthy and happy...
example.tran: 我们中大多数人需要过更为平衡的生活，以保持健康和快乐。

example.ex: She had a normal pregnancy and delivered a healthy child.
example.tran: 她正常妊娠，生了个健康的孩子。

collins.tran: 显示健康的;反映健康的
collins.def: If a feature or quality that you have is healthy, it makes you look well or shows that you are well.

example.ex: ...the glow of healthy skin.
example.tran: 健康的肤色

example.ex: ...young adults with healthy appetites.
example.tran: 食欲旺盛的年轻人

collins.tran: 有益于健康的;促进健康的
collins.def: Something that is healthy is good for your health.

example.ex: ...a great healthy outdoor pursuit.
example.tran: 对健康大有裨益的室外活动

example.ex: ...a healthy diet.
example.tran: 有益于健康的饮食

collins.tran: （机构或体系）兴旺的，运作良好的
collins.def: A healthy organization or system is successful.

example.ex: ...an economically healthy socialist state.
example.tran: 经济繁荣的社会主义国家

collins.def: A healthy amount of something is a large amount that shows success.

example.ex: He predicts a continuation of healthy profits in the current financial year.
example.tran: 他预计本财年能继续保持可观的利润。

example.ex: ...a healthy bank account.
example.tran: 巨额账户

collins.def: If you have a healthy attitude about something, you show good sense.

example.ex: She has a refreshingly healthy attitude to work...
example.tran: 她对工作持一种明智态度，令人耳目一新。

example.ex: It's very healthy to be afraid when there's something to be afraid of.
example.tran: 不逞匹夫之勇是很明智的。

collins.def: Retail is the activity of selling goods direct to the public, usually in small quantities.

example.ex: ...retail stores...
example.tran: 零售店

example.ex: Retail sales grew just 3.8 percent last year.
example.tran: 去年零售额只上升了3.8%。

collins.def: If something is sold retail, it is sold in ordinary shops direct to the public.
If an item in a shop retails at or for a particular price, it is on sale at that price.

example.ex: It originally retailed at £23.50.
example.tran: 它原来的零售价格是23.50英镑。

collins.def: If someone retails a story or event, they tell it to someone else, often in detail and in an exciting way.

example.ex: Mr Hastings gleefully retailed the story to Mr Anderson over lunch.
example.tran: 黑斯廷斯先生在午宴上兴致勃勃地把这个故事向安德森先生详述了一遍。

collins.tran: 总统职位；总裁职位；主席职位
collins.def: The presidency of a country or organization is the position of being the president or the period of time during which someone is president.

example.ex: Britain will support him as a candidate for the presidency of the organisation...
example.tran: 英国会支持他竞选这个组织的主席职位。

example.ex: Poverty had declined during his presidency.
example.tran: 在他担任总统期间，贫困人口减少了。

collins.def: Cheese is a solid food made from milk. It is usually white or yellow.

example.ex: ...bread and cheese.
example.tran: 涂了奶酪的面包

example.ex: ...cheese sauce...
example.tran: 奶酪酱

collins.def: Someone who has a very important job or position can be referred to as a big cheese .

example.ex: He is a big cheese in the Art Fraud Squad.
example.tran: 他是反艺术诈骗专案组的重要人物。

example.ex: ...big cheeses from the State Department.
example.tran: 国务院来的大人物

collins.def: If someone tells you to say 'cheese' when they are taking your photograph, they are indicating that they want you to smile.

means: （英格兰、威尔士和北爱尔兰由议员选举产生的）镇长

collins.def: The mayor of a town or city is the person who has been elected to represent it for a fixed period of time or, in some places, to run its government.
If you chop something, you cut it into pieces with strong downward movements of a knife or an axe.

example.ex: Chop the butter into small pieces...
example.tran: 把黄油切成小片。

example.ex: Chop the onions very finely...
example.tran: 把洋葱切碎。

collins.def: A chop is a small piece of meat cut from the ribs of a sheep or pig.

example.ex: ...grilled lamb chops.
example.tran: 烤羊排

collins.def: When people chop and change, they keep changing their minds about what to do or how to act.

example.ex: Don't ask me why they have chopped and changed so much.
example.tran: 别问我为什么他们一会儿一个主意。

collins.tran: 将被取消(或关闭);(人)将被解雇
collins.def: If something is for the chop or is going to get the chop, it is going to be stopped or closed. If someone is for the chop, they are going to lose their job or position.

example.ex: He won't say which programmes are for the chop...
example.tran: 他不愿说哪些项目将被毙掉。

example.ex: I was both disappointed and amazed when I got the chop from the Wales team.
example.tran: 我被威尔士队解聘时，既失望又错愕。

collins.def: An infection is a disease caused by germs or bacteria.

example.ex: Ear infections are common in pre-school children...
example.tran: 耳部感染在学前儿童中很常见。

example.ex: Exactly which bacteria cause the infection is still unknown.
example.tran: 到底是什么细菌引起的感染还不清楚。

collins.def: A bunch of people is a group of people who share one or more characteristics or who are doing something together.

example.ex: My neighbours are a bunch of busybodies...
example.tran: 我的邻居们是一群爱管闲事的人。

example.ex: We were a pretty inexperienced bunch of people really...
example.tran: 我们事实上是一些相当没有经验的人。

collins.def: A bunch of flowers is a number of flowers with their stalks held or tied together.

example.ex: He had left a huge bunch of flowers in her hotel room.
example.tran: 他在她宾馆房间里留下了一大束花。

collins.def: A bunch of bananas or grapes is a group of them growing on the same stem.

example.ex: Lili had fallen asleep clutching a fat bunch of grapes.
example.tran: 莉莉手里抓着一大串葡萄睡着了。

collins.def: A bunch of keys is a set of keys kept together on a metal ring.

example.ex: George took out a bunch of keys and went to work on the complicated lock.
example.tran: 乔治掏出一串钥匙，上前去鼓捣那把结构复杂的锁。

collins.def: A bunch of things is a number of things, especially a large number.

example.ex: We did a bunch of songs together.
example.tran: 我们一起唱了很多首歌。

collins.def: If a girl has her hair in bunches, it is parted down the middle and tied on each side of her head.
If clothing bunches around a part of your body, it forms a set of creases around it.

example.ex: She clutches the sides of her skirt until it bunches around her waist.
example.tran: 她捏着裙子的两侧，直到裙子在她腰部打起了褶。

collins.tran: 同类中最好的；出类拔萃者；精华
collins.def: If you say someone or something is the best of the bunch or the pick of the bunch, you mean they are the best of a group of people or things.

example.ex: I watched every game of the World Cup and Craig was the pick of the bunch.
example.tran: 我观看了世界杯的每场比赛，克雷格是表现最出色的。

collins.def: When people or animals breathe, they take air into their lungs and let it out again. When they breathe smoke or a particular kind of air, they take it into their lungs and let it out again as they breathe.

example.ex: He stood there breathing deeply and evenly...
example.tran: 他站在那儿均匀地深呼吸。

example.ex: Always breathe through your nose...
example.tran: 要一直用鼻子呼吸。

collins.def: If someone breathes something, they say it very quietly.

example.ex: 'You don't  understand,' he breathed.
example.tran: “你不明白。”他低声说道。

collins.def: If you do not breathe a word about something, you say nothing about it, because it is a secret.

example.ex: He never breathed a word about our conversation.
example.tran: 关于我们的谈话他只字未提。

collins.tran: 将（生气、信心或兴奋）注入；为…带来
collins.def: If someone breathes life, confidence, or excitement into something, they improve it by adding this quality.

example.ex: It is the readers who breathe life into a newspaper with their letters.
example.tran: 是读者通过来信给报纸带来了生气。

collins.def: If you let wine breathe, you open the bottle to allow the air to get in and improve its flavour before you drink it.

example.ex: Red wines should be allowed to 'breathe' if possible before drinking.
example.tran: 如果可能的话，在饮用红酒前应该先开瓶透透气。

collins.def: When someone breathes their last, they die.
If you say that something illustrates a situation that you are drawing attention to, you mean that it shows that the situation exists.

example.ex: The example of the United States illustrates this point...
example.tran: 美国的例子证明了这一点。

example.ex: This change is neatly illustrated by what has happened to the Arab League...
example.tran: 这种变化鲜明地体现在阿拉伯联盟所发生的事件上。

collins.tran: (用例子、故事或图表)说明,阐明
collins.def: If you use an example, story, or diagram to illustrate a point, you use it show that what you are saying is true or to make your meaning clearer.

example.ex: Let me give another example to illustrate this difficult point...
example.tran: 我再举个例子来说明这个难点。

example.ex: Throughout, she illustrates her analysis with excerpts from discussions.
example.tran: 自始至终,她摘引讨论内容来阐明她的分析。

collins.def: If you illustrate a book, you put pictures, photographs or diagrams into it.

example.ex: She went on to art school and is now illustrating a book...
example.tran: 她后来读了艺术学校,现在正在为一本书画插图。

example.ex: He has illustrated the book with black-and-white photographs.
example.tran: 他为那本书配了一些黑白照片插图。

collins.def: Noise is a loud or unpleasant sound.

example.ex: There was too much noise in the room and he needed peace...
example.tran: 屋子里太吵闹，他需要安静。

example.ex: The noise of bombs and guns was incessant...
example.tran: 炸弹和枪炮接连不断。

collins.def: A noise is a sound that someone or something makes.

example.ex: Sir Gerald made a small noise in his throat.
example.tran: 杰拉尔德爵士从喉咙里发出了点儿声音。

example.ex: ...birdsong and other animal noises...
example.tran: 鸟鸣声和其他动物的声音

collins.def: If someone makes noises of a particular kind about something, they say things that indicate their attitude to it in a rather indirect or vague way.

example.ex: The President took care to make encouraging noises about the future...
example.tran: 总统小心谨慎地表达了他对未来的乐观态度。

example.ex: His mother had also started making noises about it being time for him to leave home.
example.tran: 他妈妈也开始旁敲侧击，暗示他应该离家独立了。

collins.def: If you say that someone makes the right noises or makes all the right noises, you think that they are showing concern or enthusiasm about something because they feel they ought to rather than because they really want to.

example.ex: But at the annual party conference he always made the right noises...
example.tran: 但在每年政党会议上，他总是随声附和。

example.ex: He was making all the right noises about multi-party democracy and human rights.
example.tran: 他假意支持多党民主和人权问题。

collins.def: An error is something you have done which is considered to be incorrect or wrong, or which should not have been done.

example.ex: NASA discovered a mathematical error in its calculations...
example.tran: 美国国家航空航天局在它的计算结果中发现了一个数学错误。

example.ex: MPs attacked lax management and errors of judgment.
example.tran: 议员们抨击管理的松散和判断的失误。

collins.def: If you do something in error or if it happens in error, you do it or it happens because you have made a mistake, especially in your judgment.

example.ex: The plane was shot down in error by a NATO missile.
example.tran: 一枚北约的导弹误将那架飞机击落。

collins.def: If someone sees the error of their ways, they realize or admit that they have made a mistake or behaved badly.

example.ex: I wanted an opportunity to talk some sense into him and try to make him see the error of his ways.
example.tran: 我想找个机会开导他一下，好让他认识到自己做错了。

collins.def: Anybody means the same as anyone .
An activist is a person who works to bring about political or social changes by campaigning in public or working for an organization.

example.ex: The police say they suspect the attack was carried out by animal rights activists.
example.tran: 警方说他们怀疑袭击是由动物权益保护的积极分子们发动的。

means: 吸引住：吸引…的兴趣或注意力

collins.def: If you grip something, you take hold of it with your hand and continue to hold it firmly.

example.ex: She gripped the rope.
example.tran: 她紧紧抓住绳索。

collins.def: A grip is a firm, strong hold on something.

example.ex: His strong hand eased the bag from her grip.
example.tran: 他强有力的手迫使她松开了握紧袋子的双手。

collins.def: Someone's grip on something is the power and control they have over it.

example.ex: The president maintains an iron grip on his country...
example.tran: 总统牢牢地控制着他的国家。

example.ex: Tony Blair last night tightened his grip on Labour mps with new powers to root out troublemakers.
example.tran: 昨晚，托尼·布莱尔利用新赋予的权力铲除了制造事端者，加强了对工党议员的控制。

collins.def: If something grips you, it affects you very strongly.

example.ex: Pain gripped him...
example.tran: 他感到一阵剧痛。

example.ex: The entire community has been gripped by fear.
example.tran: 恐惧笼罩着整个社区。

collins.def: If you are gripped by something such as a story or a series of events, your attention is concentrated on it and held by it.

example.ex: The nation is gripped by the dramatic story.
example.tran: 举国上下都为那个戏剧性的故事牵动着。

collins.def: If things such as shoes or car tyres have grip, they do not slip.

example.ex: ...a new way of reinforcing rubber which gives car tyres better grip.
example.tran: 加固橡胶以增强车胎抓地力的新方法

collins.def: A grip is a bag that is smaller than a suitcase, and that you use when you are travelling.
If you get to grips with a problem or if you come to grips with it, you consider it seriously, and start taking action to deal with it.

example.ex: The government's first task is to get to grips with the economy.
example.tran: 政府的首要任务是处理好经济问题。

collins.tran: （使自己）镇定下来；控制住（自己）
collins.def: If you get a grip on yourself, you make an effort to control or improve your behaviour or work.
If a person, group, or place is in the grip of something, they are being severely affected by it.

example.ex: Britain is still in the grip of recession.
example.tran: 英国依然没有摆脱经济衰退。

example.ex: ...a region in the grip of severe drought.
example.tran: 受大旱严重影响的地区

collins.tran: 效率降低；失去信心；驾驭不住
collins.def: If you lose your grip, you become less efficient and less confident, and less able to deal with things.
If you say that someone has a grip on reality, you mean they recognize the true situation and do not have mistaken ideas about it.

example.ex: Shakur loses his fragile grip on reality and starts blasting away at friends and foe alike.
example.tran: 沙库尔丧失了对形势仅存的一点判断，无论对敌对友都开始大加挞伐。

means: 用发行长期债券的方法来收回短期债券

collins.tran: (政府或机构提供的)资金，款项，拨款
collins.def: Funding is money which a government or organization provides for a particular purpose.

example.ex: They hope for government funding for the scheme...
example.tran: 他们希望政府为这个计划提供资金。

example.ex: Many colleges have seen their funding cut.
example.tran: 许多学院的经费都遭到了削减。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is awful, you dislike that person or thing or you think that they are not very good.

example.ex: We met and I thought he was awful...
example.tran: 我们见了面，我觉得他很讨人厌。

example.ex: I couldn't stand London! Bloody awful place.
example.tran: 我在伦敦再也呆不下去了！简直是个糟糕至极的地方。

collins.tran: 使人不愉快的；令人震惊的；可怕的；极坏的
collins.def: If you say that something is awful, you mean that it is extremely unpleasant, shocking, or bad.

example.ex: Her injuries were massive. It was awful...
example.tran: 她遍体鳞伤。太可怕了。

example.ex: Some of their offences are so awful they would chill the blood.
example.tran: 他们的一些罪行骇人听闻，简直令人毛骨悚然。

collins.def: If you look or feel awful, you look or feel ill.

example.ex: I hardly slept at all and felt pretty awful...
example.tran: 我基本上没睡，觉得很难受。

example.ex: I looked awful and felt quite shaky.
example.tran: 我貌似生病了，觉得很虚弱。

collins.def: You can use awful with noun groups that refer to an amount in order to emphasize how large that amount is.

example.ex: I've got an awful lot of work to do.
example.tran: 我有一大堆事情要做。

collins.tran: （与表示特征的形容词连用，用于强调）极度地，非常
collins.def: You can use awful with adjectives that describe a quality in order to emphasize that particular quality.

example.ex: Gosh, you're awful pretty...
example.tran: 天哪，你太漂亮了！

example.ex: You know, 10 years sounds like an awful long time.
example.tran: 你知道，10年听起来遥遥无期。

collins.def: A drum is a musical instrument consisting of a skin stretched tightly over a round frame. You play a drum by beating it with sticks or with your hands.
A drum is a large cylindrical container which is used to store fuel or other substances.

example.ex: ...an oil drum.
example.tran: 油桶

example.ex: ...a drum of chemical waste.
example.tran: 一桶化学废料

collins.def: A drum is a hollow cylindrical structure which is part of a machine, for example a washing machine.

collins.tran: （缠绕电线或绳索的）卷筒,转筒
collins.def: A drum is a circular object on which wire or rope is wound and kept.

example.ex: He had found a drum of electric cable.
example.tran: 他发现了一卷电缆。

collins.tran: 有规律地敲击（使发出连续的击打声）
collins.def: If something drums on a surface, or if you drum something on a surface, it hits it regularly, making a continuous beating sound.

example.ex: He drummed his fingers on the leather top of his desk...
example.tran: 他用手指连续敲击他的皮革桌面。

example.ex: Rain drummed on the roof of the car.
example.tran: 雨嘀嘀嗒嗒地敲打着车顶。

collins.def: If someone beats the drum or bangs the drum for something, they support it strongly.

example.ex: The trade secretary disagreed but promised to 'bang the drum for industry'.
example.tran: 贸易部长并不同意，但是答应会“为产业界摇旗呐喊”。

means: 红利，股息，利息，（破产时清算的）分配金

collins.def: A dividend is the part of a company's profits which is paid to people who have shares in the company.

example.ex: The first quarter dividend has been increased by nearly 4 per cent.
example.tran: 第一季度的股息增长了近 4%。

collins.def: If something pays dividends, it brings advantages at a later date.

example.ex: Steps taken now to maximise your health will pay dividends later on.
example.tran: 现在采取措施增强体质会使你日后受益。

collins.def: The withdrawal of something is the act or process of removing it, or ending it.

example.ex: ...withdrawal of friendship...
example.tran: 绝交

example.ex: If you experience any unusual symptoms after withdrawal of the treatment then contact your doctor.
example.tran: 如果停止治疗后你感觉有任何异常症状，要即刻就医。

collins.def: Someone's withdrawal from an activity or an organization is their decision to stop taking part in it.

example.ex: ...his withdrawal from government in 1946.
example.tran: 他1946年退出政府

collins.def: A withdrawal is an amount of money that you take from your bank account.

collins.tran: （对所说的话或声明的）撤回，收回
collins.def: The withdrawal of a remark or statement that you have made is the act of saying that you want people to ignore it.

example.ex: The charity says it wants a withdrawal of the comments.
example.tran: 该慈善机构称希望收回所作评论。

collins.def: Withdrawal is the period during which someone feels ill after they have stopped taking a drug which they were addicted to.

example.ex: Withdrawal from heroin is actually like a severe attack of gastric flu.
example.tran: 戒断海洛因的过程实际上就像患了一场严重的胃肠型流感。

collins.def: Withdrawal is behaviour in which someone prefers to be alone and does not want to talk to other people.

example.ex: ...an inability to cope with emotional problems except by retreating into withdrawal.
example.tran: 无法应对情感问题，只能消极避世

means: 通讯中用以代表字母 u 的词

collins.def: A uniform is a special set of clothes which some people, for example soldiers or the police, wear to work in and which some children wear at school.

example.ex: The town police wear dark blue uniforms and flat caps...
example.tran: 镇上的警察穿着深蓝色制服，戴着鸭舌帽。

example.ex: Philippe was in uniform, wearing a pistol holster on his belt...
example.tran: 菲利普身着制服，腰带上别着手枪皮套。

collins.def: You can refer to the particular style of clothing which a group of people wear to show they belong to a group or a movement as their uniform.

example.ex: Mark's is the uniform of the young male traveller — green Army trousers, T-shirt and shirt.
example.tran: 马克一身年轻男性旅行者的典型行头——绿军裤、T恤外加衬衫。

collins.tran: （同一物）始终如一的，均匀的，划一的
collins.def: If something is uniform, it does not vary, but is even and regular throughout.

example.ex: Chips should be cut into uniform size and thickness...
example.tran: 土豆条要切得大小厚薄均匀。

example.ex: All flowing water, though it appears to be uniform, is actually divided into extensive inner surfaces, or layers, moving against one another...
example.tran: 所有流动的水看似一成不变，但实际上内部分成许多广延的面，或者说层，彼此逆向移动。

collins.tran: （不同物）全都相同的，一律的，清一色的
collins.def: If you describe a number of things as uniform, you mean that they are all the same.

example.ex: Along each wall stretched uniform green metal filing cabinets...
example.tran: 每面墙边都一溜摆着相同的绿色金属档案柜。

example.ex: Shrimp are raised in long uniform ponds, frozen in the nearby packing plant and shipped north.
example.tran: 虾放养在清一色的长池子里，再送到附近的包装车间冷冻，最后用船运往北方。

collins.def: If you are reluctant to do something, you are unwilling to do it and hesitate before doing it, or do it slowly and without enthusiasm.

example.ex: Mr Spero was reluctant to ask for help...
example.tran: 斯佩罗先生不愿意寻求帮助。

example.ex: The police are very reluctant to get involved in this sort of thing.
example.tran: 警方很不愿意卷入这类事情。

collins.def: When you come to a conclusion, you decide that something is true after you have thought about it carefully and have considered all the relevant facts.

example.ex: Over the years I've come to the conclusion that she's a very great musician...
example.tran: 这些年来，我得出的结论是她是一位非常伟大的音乐家。

example.ex: I have tried to give some idea of how I feel — other people will no doubt draw their own conclusions.
example.tran: 我试着说了一些我的感受，其他人无疑会有他们自己的结论。

collins.def: The conclusion of something is its ending.

example.ex: At the conclusion of the programme, I asked the children if they had any questions they wanted to ask me.
example.tran: 节目结束的时候，我问孩子们有没有问题想问我。

collins.def: The conclusion of a treaty or a business deal is the act of arranging it or agreeing it.

example.ex: ...the expected conclusion of a free-trade agreement between Mexico and the United States.
example.tran: 墨西哥与美国之间自由贸易协定的如期签订

collins.tran: 必然会发生的事;事先料定的结局
collins.def: You can refer to something that seems certain to happen as a foregone conclusion .

example.ex: It was a foregone conclusion that I would end up in the same business as him...
example.tran: 早已注定我最终会和他干同一行。

example.ex: The championship result was almost a foregone conclusion.
example.tran: 锦标赛的结果差不多在意料之中。

collins.def: You say 'in conclusion' to indicate that what you are about to say is the last thing that you want to say.

example.ex: In conclusion, walking is a cheap, safe, enjoyable and readily available form of exercise.
example.tran: 总而言之，散步是一种廉价、安全、愉快的锻炼方式，而且随时随地都可以进行。

collins.tran: 匆忙地下判断;草率地下结论
collins.def: If you say that someone jumps to a conclusion, you are critical of them because they decide too quickly that something is true, when they do not know all the facts.

example.ex: I didn't want her to jump to the conclusion that the divorce was in any way her fault...
example.tran: 我不想让她草率地断定离婚完全是她的错。

example.ex: Forgive me. I shouldn't be jumping to conclusions.
example.tran: 原谅我，我不该草率地下结论。

collins.def: Your consciousness is your mind and your thoughts.

example.ex: That idea has been creeping into our consciousness for some time.
example.tran: 不知不觉间，那种想法在我们脑海里渐渐形成已经有一段时间了。

collins.def: The consciousness of a group of people is their set of ideas, attitudes, and beliefs.

example.ex: The Greens were the catalysts of a necessary change in the European consciousness.
example.tran: 绿党促使欧洲人的观念发生了必要的改变。

collins.tran: (对特定主题或观点的)关注，意识
collins.def: You use consciousness to refer to an interest in and knowledge of a particular subject or idea.

example.ex: Her political consciousness sprang from  her upbringing when her father's illness left the family short of money.
example.tran: 她的政治意识源于她的成长经历，那时因为父亲生病，家境窘迫。

collins.def: Consciousness is the state of being awake rather than being asleep or unconscious. If someone loses consciousness, they become unconscious, and if they regain consciousness, they become conscious after being unconscious.

example.ex: She banged her head and lost consciousness...
example.tran: 她撞到了头，失去了知觉。

example.ex: He drifted in and out of consciousness.
example.tran: 他时而清醒，时而昏迷。

means: 基础的，基本的，根本的，重要的，原始的，主要的，十分重大的
原理，原则，基本，根本，基础

collins.tran: 基本的;根本的;主要的;基础的
collins.def: You use fundamental to describe things, activities, and principles that are very important or essential. They affect the basic nature of other things or are the most important element upon which other things depend.

example.ex: Our constitution embodies all the fundamental principles of democracy...
example.tran: 我们的宪法体现了民主的所有基本原则。

example.ex: A fundamental human right is being withheld from these people...
example.tran: 这些人被剥夺了一项最基本的人权。

collins.tran: 根本性的;固有的;根深蒂固的
collins.def: You use fundamental to describe something which exists at a deep and basic level, and is therefore likely to continue.

example.ex: But on this question, the two leaders have very fundamental differences...
example.tran: 但在这个问题上，两位领导人有着根本性的分歧。

example.ex: Amnesty says there are fundamental flaws in their military justice system.
example.tran: 国际特赦组织称他们的军事司法体系存在着根本性的缺陷。

collins.def: If one thing is fundamental to another, it is absolutely necessary to it, and the second thing cannot exist, succeed, or be imagined without it.

example.ex: He believes better relations with China are fundamental to the well-being of the area...
example.tran: 他相信和中国建立更加良好的关系对这一地区的繁荣发展至关重要。

example.ex: The method they pioneered remains fundamental to research into the behaviour of nerve cells.
example.tran: 他们首创的方法在神经细胞活动的研究中一直是不可或缺的。

collins.def: You can use fundamental to show that you are referring to what you consider to be the most important aspect of a situation, and that you are not concerned with less important details.

example.ex: The fundamental problem lies in their inability to distinguish between reality and invention...
example.tran: 最根本的问题在于他们无法分清现实和虚构。

example.ex: It was not simply a practical matter, but a fundamental question of principle.
example.tran: 那不仅仅是个实际问题，更是一个根本性的原则问题。

collins.def: Fundamental research into a subject is concerned with gaining knowledge about the subject itself, rather than its practical aspects.

example.ex: Industry leaders want scientists to engage in fundamental research, not applied research.
example.tran: 行业领袖希望科学家从事基础性研究，而非应用性研究。

collins.tran: 正确地；准确地；令人满意地
collins.def: If something is done properly, it is done in a correct and satisfactory way.

example.ex: You're too thin. You're not eating properly...
example.tran: 你太瘦了。你的饮食不合理。

example.ex: There needs to be a properly informed public debate.
example.tran: 有必要让公众在充分知情的状况下展开辩论。

collins.tran: 适宜地；合适地；得体地；恰当地
collins.def: If someone behaves properly, they behave in a way that is considered acceptable and not rude.

example.ex: He's a spoilt brat and it's about time he learnt to behave properly...
example.tran: 他是个被宠坏的孩子，是该学些规矩了。

example.ex: They will be concerned to do the right thing — to dress properly, for instance.
example.tran: 他们需要注意行为是否恰当——比如说，穿着得体。

collins.def: An invitation is a written or spoken request to come to an event such as a party, a meal, or a meeting.

example.ex: ...an invitation to lunch...
example.tran: 共进午餐的邀请

example.ex: The Syrians have not yet accepted an invitation to attend...
example.tran: 叙利亚人还没有接到出席邀请。

collins.def: An invitation is the card or paper on which an invitation is written or printed.

example.ex: Hundreds of invitations are being sent out this week.
example.tran: 本周将寄出数百份请柬。

example.ex: ...gold embossed invitation cards.
example.tran: 烫金的请柬

collins.def: If you believe that someone's action is likely to have a particular result, especially a bad one, you can refer to the action as an invitation to that result.

example.ex: ...a war that most liberal Democrats regarded as an invitation to disaster...
example.tran: 一场大部分自由民主党人认为会招致灾难的战争

example.ex: Don't leave your shopping on the back seat of your car —  it's an open invitation to a thief.
example.tran: 别把买的东西放在汽车后座上——那会招来小偷的。

means: （无家可归者或受虐待者的）收容所

collins.tran: (躲避恶劣天气或危险的)遮蔽物，庇护处，掩体
collins.def: A shelter is a small building or covered place which is made to protect people from bad weather or danger.

example.ex: The city's bomb shelters were being prepared for possible air raids.
example.tran: 为防御可能发生的空袭，该城市正在建防空洞。

example.ex: ...a bus shelter.
example.tran: 公共汽车候车亭

collins.tran: (尤指躲避恶劣天气或危险的)遮蔽，庇护，掩蔽
collins.def: If a place provides shelter, it provides you with a place to stay or live, especially when you need protection from bad weather or danger.

example.ex: The number of families seeking shelter rose by 17 percent...
example.tran: 寻求避难的家庭户增加了 17％。

example.ex: Although horses do not generally mind the cold, shelter from rain and wind is important.
example.tran: 尽管马一般不怕冷，但是一定要有个能遮风挡雨的马棚。

collins.def: A shelter is a building where homeless people can sleep and get food.

example.ex: ...a shelter for homeless women.
example.tran: 收留无家可归的妇女的收容所

collins.def: If you shelter in a place, you stay there and are protected from bad weather or danger.

example.ex: ...a man sheltering in a doorway...
example.tran: 藏在门口的一名男子

example.ex: Twelve Cubans left the embassy after sheltering there for several days.
example.tran: 12 名古巴人在大使馆藏身了几天后离开了。

collins.def: If a place or thing is sheltered by something, it is protected by that thing from wind and rain.

example.ex: ...a wooden house, sheltered by a low pointed roof.
example.tran: 一所有着低矮的尖顶遮风挡雨的木房子

collins.tran: 为(受到警察或其他人追捕的人)提供避难所;窝藏;庇护
collins.def: If you shelter someone, usually someone who is being hunted by police or other people, you provide them with a place to stay or live.

example.ex: A neighbor sheltered the boy for seven days.
example.tran: 一个邻居收留了这个男孩在他家藏了 7 天。

example.ex: ...people sheltering illegal immigrants.
example.tran: 为非法移民提供庇护的人们

collins.def: An assembly is a large group of people who meet regularly to make decisions or laws for a particular region or country.

example.ex: ...the campaign for the first free election to the National Assembly.
example.tran: 呼吁国民议会召开首次自由选举的运动

example.ex: ...an assembly of party members from the Russian republic.
example.tran: 俄罗斯共和国的党员代表大会

collins.def: An assembly is a group of people gathered together for a particular purpose.

example.ex: ...an assembly of women Olympic gold-medal winners...
example.tran: 奥林匹克金牌女性获得者的集会

example.ex: He waited until complete quiet settled on the assembly.
example.tran: 他一直等到集会的人群完全安静下来。

collins.def: When you refer to rights of assembly or restrictions on assembly, you are referring to the legal right that people have to gather together.

example.ex: The US Constitution guarantees free speech, freedom of assembly and equal protection...
example.tran: 美国宪法保证言论自由、集会自由和受到平等保护的权利。

example.ex: They were accused of unlawful assembly.
example.tran: 他们被控非法集会。

collins.def: In a school, assembly is a gathering of all the teachers and pupils at the beginning of every school day.

example.ex: By 9, the juniors are in the hall for assembly.
example.tran: 到9点时，三年级学生都在大厅里等待参加晨会。

example.ex: ...a long room with a stage at one end for assemblies.
example.tran: 一端设有早会用的高台的狭长房间

collins.def: The assembly of a machine, device, or object is the process of fitting its different parts together.

example.ex: For the rest of the day, he worked on the assembly of an explosive device.
example.tran: 在那天余下的时间里，他继续组装爆炸装置。

example.ex: ...workers at Sao Paulo's car assembly plants.
example.tran: 圣保罗汽车装配厂的工人
