collins.def: Nerves are long thin fibres that transmit messages between your brain and other parts of your body.

example.ex: ...spinal nerves.
example.tran: 脊神经

example.ex: ...in cases where the nerve fibres are severed.
example.tran: 在一些神经纤维被割断的病例中

collins.def: If you refer to someone's nerves, you mean their ability to cope with problems such as stress, worry, and danger.

example.ex: Jill's nerves are stretched to breaking point...
example.tran: 吉尔的神经绷紧到了极点。

example.ex: I can be very patient, and then I can burst if my nerves are worn out.
example.tran: 我很有耐心，可如果我的承受力到了极限，我就撑不住了。

collins.def: You can refer to someone's feelings of anxiety or tension as nerves .

example.ex: I just played badly. It wasn't nerves.
example.tran: 我只是打得很糟，不是紧张造成的。

collins.def: Nerve is the courage that you need in order to do something difficult or dangerous.

example.ex: The brandy made him choke, but it restored his nerve...
example.tran: 虽说白兰地呛了他一下，却让他恢复了勇气。

example.ex: He never got up enough nerve to meet me.
example.tran: 他从没有足够的胆量来见我。

collins.tran: 使鼓起勇气;使振作精神
collins.def: If you nerve yourself to do something difficult or frightening, you prepare yourself for it by trying to be brave.

example.ex: I nerved myself to face the pain.
example.tran: 我鼓足勇气去面对痛苦。

collins.def: If someone or something gets on your nerves, they annoy or irritate you.

example.ex: Lately he's  not done a bloody thing and it's getting on my nerves.
example.tran: 近来他没有干任何坏事，这让我心神不定起来。

collins.def: If you say that someone has a nerve or has the nerve to do something, you are criticizing them for doing something which you feel they had no right to do.

example.ex: They've got a nerve, complaining about our behaviour...
example.tran: 他们竟敢对我们的行为表示不满。

example.ex: He had the nerve to ask me to prove who I was.
example.tran: 他竟敢要求我证明我自己的身份。

collins.def: If you hold your nerve or keep your nerve, you remain calm and determined in a difficult situation.

example.ex: He held his nerve to beat Andre Agassi in a five-set thriller on Court One...
example.tran: 他镇定自若，在1号场地惊心动魄的5盘3胜对决中击败了安德鲁·阿加西。

example.ex: We need to keep our nerve now.
example.tran: 我们现在需要保持镇静。

collins.tran: 紧张不安地度日;神经紧张
collins.def: If someone is living on their nerves, they are continually worried and anxious about the situation that they are in.

example.ex: Eileen, mother of three, had been living on her nerves for some considerable time.
example.tran: 艾琳是3个孩子的母亲，已有相当一段时间总是感到紧张不安。

collins.tran: 失去勇气;变得胆怯;惊慌失措
collins.def: If you lose your nerve, you suddenly panic and become too afraid to do something that you were about to do.

example.ex: The bomber had lost his nerve and fled.
example.tran: 放炸弹的人没了胆子，逃之夭夭。

collins.def: If you say that you have touched a nerve or touched a raw nerve, you mean that you have accidentally upset someone by talking about something that they feel strongly about or are very sensitive about.

example.ex: Alistair saw Henry shrink, as if the words had touched a nerve...
example.tran: 阿利斯泰尔看到亨利向后缩了一下，好像那些话触到了他的痛处。

example.ex: The mere mention of John had touched a very raw nerve indeed.
example.tran: 提到约翰就真的让人心痛。

collins.def: Potatoes are quite round vegetables with brown or red skins and white insides. They grow under the ground.

collins.tran: 棘手的问题；烫手山芋；意见不一的复杂问题
collins.def: You can refer to a difficult subject that people disagree on as a hot potato .

example.ex: ...a political hot potato such as abortion.
example.tran: 类似堕胎这样政治上的烫手山芋

collins.def: Someone who is blind is unable to see because their eyes are damaged.

example.ex: I started helping him run the business when he went blind...
example.tran: 他失明以后，我就开始帮他打理生意。

example.ex: How would you explain colour to a blind person?
example.tran: 你如何向盲人解释颜色？

collins.def: If something blinds you, it makes you unable to see, either for a short time or permanently.

example.ex: The sun hit the windscreen, momentarily blinding him.
example.tran: 太阳照在挡风玻璃上，晃得他一时看不见东西。

collins.tran: 暂时看不见的；双眼模糊的；目眩的
collins.def: If you are blind with something such  as tears or a bright light, you are unable to see for a short time because of the tears or light.

example.ex: Her mother groped for the back of the chair, her eyes blind with tears.
example.tran: 她妈妈泪眼蒙眬地伸手去摸椅背。

collins.tran: 看不到的；视而不见的；没有意识到的
collins.def: If you say that someone is blind to a fact or a situation, you mean that they ignore it or are unaware of it, although you think that they should take notice of it or be aware of it.

example.ex: David's good looks and impeccable manners had always made her blind to his faults...
example.tran: 戴维英俊的长相和完美的举止总是让她对他的缺点视而不见。

example.ex: All the time I was blind to your suffering.
example.tran: 一直以来，我都没有意识到你遭受的痛苦。

collins.tran: 使无法意识到；使无视；使无法认清
collins.def: If something blinds you to the real situation, it prevents you from realizing that it exists or from understanding it properly.

example.ex: He never allowed his love of Australia to blind him to his countrymen's faults.
example.tran: 他从来不会因为对澳大利亚的热爱而看不到自己同胞的缺点。

collins.tran: （信仰或行动）盲目的，不理智的
collins.def: You can describe someone's  beliefs or actions as blind when you think that they seem to take no notice of important facts or behave in an unreasonable way.

example.ex: ...her blind faith in the wisdom of the Church...
example.tran: 她对教会智慧的盲目信仰

example.ex: Lesley yelled at him with blind, hating rage.
example.tran: 莱斯莉心生愤恨，盛怒之下对他大嚷大叫。

collins.tran: （拐角）不在视线中的，看不见的
collins.def: A blind corner is one that you cannot see round because something is blocking your view.

example.ex: He tried to overtake three cars on a blind corner and crashed head-on into a lorry.
example.tran: 他试图在一个死角处超过前面的三辆车，结果一头撞在了一辆卡车上。

collins.tran: 无窗的；无门的；没有开口的；封死的
collins.def: A blind wall or building is one which has no windows or doors.

example.ex: I remembered a huddle of stone buildings with blind walls.
example.tran: 我记得一片没有窗户的石头建筑。

collins.def: A blind is a roll of cloth or paper which you can pull down over a window as a covering.

collins.tran: 对…视而不见；对…假装看不见
collins.def: If you say that someone is turning a blind eye to something bad or illegal that is happening, you mean that you think they are pretending not to notice that it is happening so that they will not have to do anything about it.

example.ex: Teachers are turning a blind eye to pupils smoking at school, a report reveals today...
example.tran: 今日一篇报道称，老师们对学生在学校抽烟睁一只眼闭一只眼。

example.ex: I can't turn a blind eye when someone is being robbed.
example.tran: 当有人遭到抢劫时，我不能视而不见。

collins.tran: 平常的；普通的；一般的；平凡的
collins.def: Ordinary people or things are normal and not special or different in any way.

example.ex: I strongly suspect that most ordinary people would agree with me...
example.tran: 我坚定地认为绝大部分老百姓会赞同我的观点。

example.ex: It has 25 calories less than ordinary ice cream...
example.tran: 它所含热量比普通的冰激凌少了25卡路里。

collins.def: If you describe someone or something as ordinary, you mean they are not special or interesting in any way and may be rather dull.

example.ex: I'm just a very ordinary, boring normal guy...
example.tran: 我只是一个颇为平庸无趣的普通人。

example.ex: Your life since then must have seemed very ordinary.
example.tran: 你的生活从那时起一定非常平淡无奇。

collins.tran: 不寻常的；非凡的；特殊的
collins.def: Something that is out of the ordinary is unusual or different.

example.ex: The boy's knowledge was out of the ordinary...
example.tran: 这个男孩懂得的知识非比寻常。

example.ex: I've noticed nothing out of the ordinary.
example.tran: 我没注意到什么特别之处。

collins.def: If you engage in an activity, you do it or are actively involved with it.

example.ex: I have never engaged in the drug trade...
example.tran: 我从未参与过毒品交易。

example.ex: You can engage in croquet on the south lawn.
example.tran: 你可以参加南边草坪上的槌球游戏。

collins.def: If something engages you or your attention or interest, it keeps you interested in it and thinking about it.

example.ex: They never learned skills to engage the attention of the others.
example.tran: 他们从未学过吸引他人注意的技巧。

collins.def: If you engage someone in conversation, you have a conversation with them.

example.ex: They tried to engage him in conversation...
example.tran: 他们试图跟他交谈。

example.ex: We want to engage recognized leaders in discussion.
example.tran: 我们想和公认的领袖们进行讨论。

collins.def: If you engage with something or with a group of people, you get involved with that thing or group and feel that you are connected with it or have real contact with it.

example.ex: She found it hard to engage with office life...
example.tran: 她发现很难适应办公室生活。

example.ex: She had vowed to go out of her way to engage with the Irish people at local community level.
example.tran: 她已经发誓要努力和当地的爱尔兰人建立关系。

collins.def: If you engage someone to do a particular job, you appoint them to do it.

example.ex: We engaged the services of a recognised engineer...
example.tran: 我们雇用了一个公认的杰出工程师。

example.ex: He had been able to engage some staff.
example.tran: 他已经能够雇用一些员工。

collins.def: When a part of a machine or other mechanism engages or when you engage it, it moves into a position where it fits into something else.

example.ex: Press the lever until you hear the catch engage.
example.tran: 压下挡杆，直到听到挡挂好。

example.ex: ...a lesson in how to engage the four-wheel drive.
example.tran: 如何使四轮驱动啮合的课程

collins.def: When a military force engages the enemy, it attacks them and starts a battle.

example.ex: It could engage the enemy beyond the range of hostile torpedoes.
example.tran: 从这可以避开敌方鱼雷区对敌人发动进攻。

collins.tran: 妙极的;惹人喜爱的;了不起的
collins.def: If you describe something or someone as incredible, you like them very much or are impressed by them, because they are extremely or unusually good.

example.ex: The wildflowers will be incredible after this rain...
example.tran: 这场雨过后,野花会变得美不胜收。

example.ex: Thanks for taking me, I had an incredible time...
example.tran: 谢谢你带我去,我玩得非常开心。

collins.tran: 不可思议的;难以置信的
collins.def: If you say that something is incredible, you mean that it is very unusual or surprising, and you cannot believe it is really true, although it may be.

example.ex: It seemed incredible that people would still want to play football during a war...
example.tran: 在战时人们仍然想踢足球,这似乎不可思议。

example.ex: We should not dismiss as lies the incredible stories that children may tell us.
example.tran: 我们不应把孩子们告诉我们的一些不可思议的故事当成谎话而不予理睬。

collins.def: You use incredible to emphasize the degree, amount, or intensity of something.

example.ex: We import an incredible amount of cheese from the Continent...
example.tran: 我们从欧洲大陆进口数量惊人的奶酪。

example.ex: There was an incredible din...
example.tran: 声音异常嘈杂。

collins.def: Your birthday is the anniversary of the date on which you were born.

means: （考虑到故事、报告、报道等的夸张或偏见等）不全信

collins.def: A discount is a reduction in the usual price of something.

example.ex: They are often available at a discount...
example.tran: 它们经常进行打折销售。

example.ex: Full-time staff get a 20 per cent discount.
example.tran: 全职员工享受 20% 的折扣。

collins.def: If a shop or company discounts an amount or percentage from something that they are selling, they take the amount or percentage off the usual price.

example.ex: This has forced airlines to discount fares heavily in order to spur demand...
example.tran: 这迫使航空公司对机票大幅打折来刺激需求。

example.ex: Tour prices are being discounted as much as 33%.
example.tran: 旅行价格打了 6.7 折之多。

collins.tran: 认为(某种思想、事实、理论)不重要;不全信;认为…不相关
collins.def: If you discount an idea, fact, or theory, you consider that it is not true, not important, or not relevant.

example.ex: However, traders tended to discount the rumor...
example.tran: 然而，商人往往不相信这一谣传。

example.ex: This theory has now been discounted.
example.tran: 这个理论被打了折扣。

collins.def: A pilot is a person who is trained to fly an aircraft.

example.ex: He spent seventeen years as an airline pilot.
example.tran: 他当了17年的航空公司飞行员。

example.ex: ...fighter pilots of the British Royal Air Force.
example.tran: 英国皇家空军的战斗机飞行员

collins.def: A pilot is a person who steers a ship through a difficult stretch of water, for example the entrance to a harbour.

collins.tran: 驾驶（飞机等）；为（船舶）引航
collins.def: If someone pilots an aircraft or ship, they act as its pilot.

example.ex: He piloted his own plane part of the way to Washington.
example.tran: 乘私人飞机去华盛顿的路上，有一段行程是他自己驾驶的。

collins.tran: 试验性的方案；试点性的项目
collins.def: A pilot scheme or a pilot project is one which is used to test an idea before deciding whether to introduce it on a larger scale.

example.ex: The service is being expanded following the success of a pilot scheme.
example.tran: 在试验性方案获得成功后，这项服务正在推广中。

example.ex: ...a ten-year pilot project backed by the trade and industry department.
example.tran: 由贸易和工业部支持的为期10年的试点项目

collins.def: If a government or organization pilots a programme or a scheme, they test it, before deciding whether to introduce it on a larger scale.

example.ex: The trust is looking for 50 schools to pilot a programme aimed at teenage pupils preparing for work.
example.tran: 该信托基金机构正在寻找50所学校，以试行一个旨在帮助青少年学生做就业准备的项目。

collins.tran: 使（新的法律或议案）顺利通过
collins.def: If a government minister pilots a new law or bill through parliament, he or she makes sure that it is introduced successfully.

example.ex: We are now piloting through Parliament a new strategy to tackle youth crime.
example.tran: 我们正促使议会顺利通过解决青少年犯罪问题的一项新策略。

collins.def: A pilot or a pilot episode is a single television programme that is shown in order to find out whether a particular series of programmes is likely to be popular.

example.ex: A pilot episode of Nothing's Impossible has already been filmed.
example.tran: 《一切皆有可能》的试播集已拍摄出来了。

collins.tran: （煤气灶具、锅炉等用于引火的）常燃小火
collins.def: A pilot is the pilot light on a gas cooker or stove, boiler, or fire.

collins.tran: 行为准则;规则;法典;法规
collins.def: A code is a set of rules about how people should behave or about how something must be done.

example.ex: ...Article 159 of the Turkish Penal Code.
example.tran: 《土耳其刑法法典》第159条

example.ex: ...local building codes.
example.tran: 地方建筑法规

collins.def: A code is a system of replacing the words in a message with other words or symbols, so that nobody can understand it unless they know the system.

example.ex: They used elaborate secret codes, as when the names of trees stood for letters...
example.tran: 他们使用了复杂的暗号，比如用树的名称代表字母。

example.ex: If you can't remember your number, write it in code in a diary.
example.tran: 如果记不住自己的号码，可以用代码记在日记簿里。

collins.def: A code is a group of numbers or letters which is used to identify something, such as a postal address or part of a telephone system.

example.ex: Callers dialing the wrong area code will not get through.
example.tran: 打电话的人如果拨错区号，就无法接通。

collins.def: A code is any system of signs or symbols that has a meaning.

example.ex: It will need different microchips to reconvert the digital code back into normal TV signals.
example.tran: 把数字信号重新转换回通常的电视信号需要另外的微芯片。

collins.def: The genetic code of a person, animal or plant is the information contained in DNA which determines the structure and function of cells, and the inherited characteristics of all living things.

example.ex: Scientists provided the key to understanding the genetic code that determines every bodily feature.
example.tran: 科学家们找到了破解决定各种身体特征的遗传密码的密钥。

collins.def: To code something means to give it a code or to mark it with its code.

example.ex: He devised a way of coding every statement uniquely...
example.tran: 他设计了一种把每句话进行独特编码的方法。

example.ex: The machines were coded so we could tell them apart.
example.tran: 机器都编了号，便于我们区分。

collins.def: Computer code is a system or language for expressing information and instructions in a form which can be understood by a computer.

means: 〈口〉公文柜，（分类记事的）备忘记事簿

collins.def: The organizer of an event or activity is the person who makes sure that the necessary arrangements are made.

example.ex: The organisers of the demonstration concede that they hadn't sought permission for it...
example.tran: 游行示威的组织者承认他们并未申请批准这次活动。

example.ex: ...his campaign organisers who are canvassing for last minute support...
example.tran: 为他作最后一刻游说以获取支持的竞选组织者

collins.tran: （行动或情形）不公正的，不公平的
collins.def: An unfair action or situation is not right or fair.

example.ex: She was awarded £5,000 in compensation for unfair dismissal...
example.tran: 她获判5,000英镑，作为遭到无理解雇的补偿。

example.ex: America decided that imported steel had an unfair advantage over steel made at home...
example.tran: 美国认定进口钢铁相对于国产钢铁具有不公平的优势。

collins.tran: （制度或情形）不公平的，不平等的
collins.def: An unfair system or situation does not give equal treatment or equal opportunities to everyone involved.

example.ex: The American plane makers continue to accuse Airbus of unfair competition...
example.tran: 美国飞机制造商继续指控空中客车公司不正当竞争。

example.ex: Some have been sentenced to long prison terms after unfair trials.
example.tran: 有些人被冤判长期徒刑。

collins.def: Furniture consists of large objects such as tables, chairs, or beds that are used in a room for sitting or lying on or for putting things on or in.

example.ex: Each piece of furniture in their home suited the style of the house.
example.tran: 他们家里的每件家具都和房子的风格相得益彰。

collins.tran: 被认作当然的人(或事物);习以为常的人(或事物)
collins.def: If you describe someone or something as part of the furniture, you are suggesting that they have been somewhere such as their place of work for such a long time that it is hard to imagine that place without them.

means: 在历史上重要的，有历史影响的

collins.tran: 历史(性）的;具有重大历史意义的
collins.def: Something that is historic is important in history, or likely to be considered important at some time in the future.

example.ex: ...the historic changes in Eastern Europe.
example.tran: 东欧的历史性变革

example.ex: ...a fourth historic election victory.
example.tran: 第4次具有重大历史意义的竞选胜利

collins.def: An actress is a woman whose job is acting in plays or films.

example.ex: She's a very great dramatic actress.
example.tran: 她是一个非常了不起的戏剧演员。

collins.tran: 使快乐；给…以娱乐；使有兴趣
collins.def: If a performer, performance, or activity entertains you, it amuses you, interests you, or gives you pleasure.

example.ex: ...games and ideas to entertain children...
example.tran: 带给孩子们快乐的游戏和想法

example.ex: They were entertained by top singers, dancers and celebrities...
example.tran: 顶级歌手、舞蹈演员和名人们给他们带来娱乐。

collins.def: If you entertain people, you provide food and drink for them, for example when you have invited them to your house.

example.ex: I don't like to entertain guests anymore...
example.tran: 我再也不想招待客人了。

example.ex: You weren't allowed to entertain men in your rooms even with a chaperone...
example.tran: 即使你有监护人陪同，也不允许在房间里招待男性。

collins.tran: 考虑，心存，怀有（主意、建议等）
collins.def: If you entertain an idea or suggestion, you allow yourself to consider it as possible or as worth thinking about seriously.

example.ex: I feel how foolish I am to entertain doubts...
example.tran: 我竟然心存怀疑，真是太愚蠢了。

example.ex: I wouldn't entertain the idea of such an unsociable job.
example.tran: 我不会考虑从事这种不跟人打交道的工作。

collins.def: When people or organizations such as banks lend you money, they give it to you and you agree to pay it back at a future date, often with an extra amount as interest.

example.ex: The bank is reassessing its criteria for lending money...
example.tran: 银行正重新评估其贷款标准。

example.ex: I had to lend him ten pounds to take his children to the pictures.
example.tran: 我只好借给他10英镑，让他带孩子们去看电影。

collins.def: If you lend something that you own, you allow someone to have it or use it for a period of time.

example.ex: Will you lend me your jacket for a little while?...
example.tran: 你能把上衣借给我穿一会儿吗？

example.ex: He had lent the bungalow to the Conrads for a couple of weeks.
example.tran: 他把那间平房借给康拉德一家住了两三个星期。

collins.def: If you lend your support to someone or something, you help them with what they are doing or with a problem that they have.

example.ex: He was approached by the organisers to lend support to a benefit concert...
example.tran: 主办方找过他，希望他能对慈善音乐会给予支持。

example.ex: Stipe attended yesterday's news conference to lend his support.
example.tran: 斯蒂普出席了昨天的新闻发布会以示支持。

collins.tran: 使适合；使有帮助；使易遭受
collins.def: If something lends itself to a particular activity or result, it is easy for it to be used for that activity or to achieve that result.

example.ex: The room lends itself well to summer eating with its light, airy atmosphere.
example.tran: 这个房间又亮堂又通风，夏天在此用餐最合适不过。

collins.def: If something lends a particular quality to something else, it adds that quality to it.

example.ex: Enthusiastic applause lent a sense of occasion to the proceedings...
example.tran: 热烈的掌声给活动平添了几分隆重的色彩。

example.ex: A more relaxed regime and regular work lends the inmates a dignity not seen in other prisons.
example.tran: 由于管理较为宽松而且经常从事劳动，这里的囚犯因此多了一份其他监狱的囚犯所没有的尊严感。

collins.def: If something is missing, it is not in its usual place, and you cannot find it.

example.ex: It was only an hour or so later that I discovered that my gun was missing...
example.tran: 仅仅约一个小时之后，我发现我的枪不见了。

example.ex: The playing cards had gone missing.
example.tran: 扑克牌不见了。

collins.tran: 被去除的；缺损的；缺掉的
collins.def: If a part of something is missing, it has been removed or has come off, and has not been replaced.

example.ex: Three buttons were missing from his shirt.
example.tran: 他的衬衫掉了3枚纽扣。

collins.def: If you say that something is missing, you mean that it has not been included, and you  think that it should have been.

example.ex: What is missing, however, is an internal, artistic cohesion...
example.tran: 不过，缺乏的是一种内在的艺术凝聚力。

example.ex: She had given me an incomplete list. One name was missing from it.
example.tran: 她给我的名单并不完整，有一个名字漏掉了。

collins.def: Someone who is missing cannot be found, and it is not known whether they are alive or dead.

example.ex: Five people died in the explosion and more than one thousand were injured. One person is still missing.
example.tran: 爆炸中有5人死亡，1,000多人受伤，1人至今下落不明。

means: （戏剧、建筑等）王政复辟时期的
王政复辟（指1660年英王查理二世复辟）

collins.tran: 王政复辟（指1660年英王查理二世复辟）
collins.def: The Restoration was the event in 1660 when Charles the Second became King of England, Scotland, and Ireland after a period when there had been no King or Queen.

collins.tran: （戏剧、建筑等）王政复辟时期的
collins.def: Restoration is used to refer to the style of drama and architecture that was popular during and just after the rule of Charles the Second in England.

example.ex: ...a Restoration comedy.
example.tran: 王政复辟时期的喜剧

collins.tran: 巨大的;庞大的;厚重的;强大的
collins.def: Something that is massive is very large in size, quantity, or extent.

example.ex: There was evidence of massive fraud.
example.tran: 有证据表明是巨额欺诈。

example.ex: ...massive air attacks...
example.tran: 大规模空袭

collins.tran: (疾病)非常严重的，十分危急的
collins.def: If you describe a medical condition as massive, you mean that it is extremely serious.

example.ex: He died six weeks later of a massive heart attack.
example.tran: 六周后他因严重的心脏病发作去世。

collins.tran: （足球、板球、曲棍球等运动的）球场
collins.def: A pitch is an area of ground that is marked out and used for playing a game such as football, cricket, or hockey.

example.ex: There was a swimming-pool, cricket pitches, playing fields...
example.tran: 有一个游泳池、几个板球场和运动场。

example.ex: Their conduct both on and off the pitch was excellent.
example.tran: 他们场上场下都表现出众。

collins.tran: （通常指仔细瞄准后用力）投，掷，扔，抛
collins.def: If you pitch something somewhere, you throw it with quite a lot of force, usually aiming it carefully.

example.ex: Simon pitched the empty bottle into the lake.
example.tran: 西蒙把空瓶子扔到湖里。

collins.def: To pitch somewhere means to fall forwards suddenly and with a lot of force.

example.ex: The movement took him by surprise, and he pitched forward...
example.tran: 这一动使他冷不防地向前摔倒。

example.ex: Alan staggered sideways, pitched head-first over the low wall and fell into the lake...
example.tran: 艾伦身子倒向一侧，一头栽过矮墙，跌进了湖里。

collins.def: If someone is pitched into a new situation, they are suddenly forced into it.

example.ex: They were being pitched into a new adventure...
example.tran: 他们正被抛入一场新的冒险。

example.ex: This could pitch the government into confrontation with the workforce.
example.tran: 这有可能把政府推向与工人正面交锋的境地。

collins.tran: （棒球或跑柱式棒球运动中）把（球）投给击球员
collins.def: In the game of baseball or rounders, when you pitch the ball, you throw it to the batter for them to hit it.

example.ex: We passed long, hot afternoons pitching a baseball.
example.tran: 我们通过投棒球玩打发了一个个漫长、炎热的下午。

collins.def: The pitch of a sound is how high or low it is.

example.ex: He raised his voice to an even higher pitch.
example.tran: 他把音调抬得更高了。

collins.def: If a sound is pitched at a particular level, it is produced at the level indicated.

example.ex: His cry is pitched at a level that makes it impossible to ignore...
example.tran: 他的哭喊声之大让人没法不理睬。

example.ex: His voice was pitched high, the words muffled by his crying...
example.tran: 他的声音很高，嘴里的话因哭泣而含混不清。

collins.tran: 把…定（在特定的水平、难易程度等上）
collins.def: If something is pitched at a particular level or degree of difficulty, it is set at that level.

example.ex: I think the material is pitched at too high a level for our purposes...
example.tran: 我想相对于我们的意图来说，内容定得过难了。

example.ex: The government has pitched High Street interest rates at a new level.
example.tran: 政府已设定了新的商业利率水平。

collins.def: If something such as a feeling or a situation rises to a high pitch, it rises to a high level.

example.ex: I feel very sorry for the competitors who have all worked themselves up to a very high pitch for this first day...
example.tran: 我为第一天就已耗费相当大体力的参赛者感到非常惋惜。

example.ex: Tension has reached such a pitch that the armed forces say soldiers may have to use their weapons to defend themselves against local people.
example.tran: 紧张关系已达白热化程度，武装部队说士兵有可能不得不使用武器保护自己不受当地民众的伤害。

collins.def: If you pitch your tent, or pitch camp, you put up your tent in a place where you are going to stay.

example.ex: He had pitched his tent in the yard...
example.tran: 他在院子里搭起了帐篷。

example.ex: At dusk we pitched camp in the middle of nowhere.
example.tran: 黄昏时分，我们在茫茫荒野中扎了营。

collins.tran: （船只在海浪中）上下颠簸，纵摇
collins.def: If a boat pitches, it moves violently up and down with the movement of the waves when the sea is rough.

example.ex: The ship is pitching and rolling in what looks like about fifteen foot seas.
example.tran: 这只船在看起来约有15英尺高的海浪中上下左右颠簸。

collins.def: Pitch is a black substance that is sticky when it is hot and very hard when it is dry. Pitch is used on the bottoms of boats and on the roofs of houses to prevent water getting in.

example.ex: The timbers of similar houses were painted with pitch.
example.tran: 类似房屋所用的栋木刷了沥青。

collins.def: If someone makes a pitch for something, they try to persuade people to do or buy it.

example.ex: The President speaks in New York today, making another pitch for his economic program...
example.tran: 总统今天在纽约发表讲话，再一次为他的经济计划作宣传。

example.ex: Prue invited the magazine's editor to lunch and made her pitch.
example.tran: 普吕邀请该杂志的编辑共进午餐，推销自己的点子。

collins.def: Your self is your basic personality or nature, especially considered in terms of what you are really like as a person.

example.ex: You're looking more like your usual self...
example.tran: 你现在看上去较像你平时的样子了。

example.ex: She was back to her old self again.
example.tran: 她又恢复了老样子。

collins.def: A person's self is the essential part of their nature which makes them different from everyone and everything else.

example.ex: I want to explore and get in touch with my inner self...
example.tran: 我想认真探寻、了解内心的自我。

example.ex: The face is the true self visible to others.
example.tran: 这副面孔是他人所能见到的自我真实的一面。

collins.tran: 巨大的；特大的；极其重要的
collins.def: Something that is described as giant is much larger or more important than most others of its kind.

example.ex: ...Italy's giant car maker, Fiat.
example.tran: 意大利汽车生产巨头菲亚特公司

example.ex: ...a giant oak table.
example.tran: 巨大的橡木桌

collins.def: Giant is often used to refer to any large, successful business organization or country.

example.ex: ...Japanese electronics giant Sony.
example.tran: 日本电子业巨头索尼公司

example.ex: ...one of Germany's  industrial giants, Daimler-Benz.
example.tran: 德国工业巨头之一，戴姆勒—奔驰公司

collins.tran: （尤指古代传说中虚构的）巨人
collins.def: A giant is an imaginary person who is very big and strong, especially one mentioned in old stories.

example.ex: ...a Nordic saga of giants.
example.tran: 北欧的巨人传奇

collins.tran: 伟人；巨子；高大健壮的人
collins.def: You can refer to someone, especially a man, as a giant, if they seem important or powerful or if they are big and strong.

example.ex: He has enormous charisma. He is a giant of a man...
example.tran: 他有超凡的个人魅力，是个伟人。

example.ex: The biggest man in the patrol, a giant of a man, lifted Mattie on to his shoulders.
example.tran: 巡逻队中块头最大的那个彪形大汉将玛蒂举起来放到自己的肩上。

collins.tran: 卓越人物；大师；才华超群的人
collins.def: You can refer to someone such as a famous musician or writer as a giant, if they are regarded as one of the most important or successful people in their field.

example.ex: ...the giant of opera, Luciano Pavarotti...
example.tran: 歌剧界巨擘卢恰诺·帕瓦罗蒂

example.ex: He was without question one of the giants of Japanese literature.
example.tran: 毋庸置疑，他是日本的文学巨匠之一。

collins.def: A subsidy is money that is paid by a government or other authority in order to help an industry or business, or to pay for a public service.

example.ex: European farmers are planning a massive demonstration against farm subsidy cuts...
example.tran: 欧洲农场主正策划一场抗议削减农场补贴的大规模示威游行。

example.ex: They've also slashed state subsidies to utilities and transportation.
example.tran: 他们还大幅削减了对公共事业和交通运输的政府补贴。

means: 有…轮子的汽车（或自行车等）

collins.def: The wheels of a vehicle are the circular objects which are fixed underneath it and which enable it to move along the ground.

example.ex: The car wheels spun and slipped on some oil on the road.
example.tran: 路面上有些油，汽车车轮经过时直打滑。

collins.def: A wheel is a circular object which forms a part of a machine, usually a moving part.

example.ex: ...an eighteenth century mill with a water wheel.
example.tran: 一个带有水轮的18世纪磨粉机

collins.def: The wheel of a car or other vehicle is the circular object that is used to steer it. The wheel is used in expressions to talk about who is driving a vehicle. For example, if someone is at the wheel of a car, they are driving it.

example.ex: My co-pilot suddenly grabbed the wheel...
example.tran: 我的副驾驶突然抓住了方向盘。

example.ex: Curtis got behind the wheel and they started back toward the cottage...
example.tran: 由柯蒂斯开车，他们启程返回小屋。

collins.def: People sometimes refer to a car as wheels .

example.ex: 'Do you own a house?' — 'No. But I have wheels.'
example.tran: “你有房吗？”——“没有，但我有车。”

collins.def: If you wheel an object that has wheels somewhere, you push it along.

example.ex: He wheeled his bike into the alley at the side of the house...
example.tran: 他把自行车推进了房子旁的小巷中。

example.ex: They wheeled her out on the stretcher.
example.tran: 他们用担架床把她推了出去。

collins.def: If something such as a group of animals or birds wheels, it moves in a circle.

example.ex: A flock of crows wheeled overhead.
example.tran: 一群乌鸦在头顶上盘旋。

collins.tran: (因惊讶、震惊或生气)突然转身
collins.def: If you wheel around, you turn around suddenly where you are standing, often because you are surprised, shocked, or angry.

example.ex: He wheeled around to face her...
example.tran: 他突然转过身来面对她。

example.ex: She wheeled sharply and headed for the check-out counter.
example.tran: 她突然转身，朝收银台走去。

collins.tran: (尤指多次发生相同的情形)命运之轮
collins.def: You use wheel in expressions such as the wheel of fortune to refer to the changes that take place in life, especially when you are referring to the fact that the same situations occur more than once.

example.ex: The wheel of fortune will swing round again; in politics, it always does...
example.tran: 风水会轮流转；在政治上，它总是如此。

example.ex: In his view the wheel of history could not be turned back.
example.tran: 在他看来历史的车轮不能倒退。

collins.def: People talk about the wheels of an organization or system to mean the way in which it operates.

example.ex: He knows the wheels of administration turn slowly.
example.tran: 他知道行政机关办事效率低。

collins.tran: (各种影响、原因和行动交织在一起的)错综复杂的情况
collins.def: If you say that there are wheels within wheels, you mean that there are a number of different influences, reasons, and actions which together make a situation complicated and difficult to understand.

example.ex: Our culture is more complex than he knows. Wheels within wheels.
example.tran: 我们的文化比他所知道的要复杂得多，相当庞杂。

means: 看片机（把幻灯片等放大观看的装置）

collins.def: Viewers are people who watch television, or who are watching a particular programme on television.

example.ex: These programmes are each watched by around 19 million viewers every week.
example.tran: 这些电视节目的观众各自都在每周1,900万左右。

collins.def: A viewer is someone who is looking carefully at a picture or other interesting object.

example.ex: ... the relationship between the art object and the viewer.
example.tran: 艺术品与其观赏者之间的关系

collins.def: A viewer is a device shaped like a box with a lens in one side. It is used for looking at transparent colour photographs.

example.ex: This special viewer is simple to use and comes with 70 full-colour slides.
example.tran: 这个特别的观片器操作简单，配有70张全彩幻灯片。

collins.def: A layer of a material or substance is a quantity or piece of it that covers a surface or that is between two other things.

example.ex: A fresh layer of snow covered the street...
example.tran: 街上覆盖了一层新雪。

example.ex: ...the depletion of the ozone layer...
example.tran: 臭氧层的损耗

collins.def: If something such as a system or an idea has many layers, it has many different levels or parts.

example.ex: ...an astounding ten layers of staff between the factory worker and the chief executive...
example.tran: 工厂工人和首席执行官之间10个等级的巨大差距

example.ex: Critics and the public puzzle out the layers of meaning in his photos.
example.tran: 评论界和公众揭开了他照片中的重重深意。

collins.def: If you layer something, you arrange it in layers.

example.ex: Layer the potatoes, asparagus and salmon in the tin...
example.tran: 把土豆、芦笋和大麻哈鱼分层装入罐头内。

example.ex: By lifting and layering her hair, Michael created a lighter frame for her face.
example.tran: 通过把头发往上梳，增加层次感，迈克尔让她的脸型显得更为柔和。

collins.def: If you have faith in someone or something, you feel confident about their ability or goodness.

example.ex: She had placed a great deal of faith in Mr Penleigh...
example.tran: 她对彭利先生极其信任。

example.ex: People have lost faith in the British Parliament.
example.tran: 人们已经对英国议会失去了信任。

collins.def: A faith is a particular religion, for example Christianity, Buddhism, or Islam.

example.ex: England shifted officially from a Catholic to a Protestant faith in the 16th century.
example.tran: 英格兰于 16 世纪正式由天主教改信新教。

collins.def: Faith is strong religious belief in a particular God.

example.ex: Umberto Eco's loss of his own religious faith is reflected in his novels.
example.tran: 翁贝托·艾柯个人宗教信仰的丧失反映在了他的小说里。

collins.def: If you break faith with someone you made a promise to or something you believed in, you stop acting in a way that supports them.

example.ex: If we don't, we're breaking faith with our people!
example.tran: 如果我们不这样，就是对我们的人民背信弃义！

collins.tran: 真诚地;真心实意地;好意地
collins.def: If you do something in good faith, you seriously believe that what you are doing is right, honest, or legal, even though this may not be the case.

example.ex: This report was published in good faith but we regret any confusion which may have been caused.
example.tran: 我们发表这篇报道的初衷是好的，但对可能已造成的混乱深感歉意。

collins.def: If you keep faith with someone you have made a promise to or something you believe in, you continue to support them even when it is difficult to do so.

example.ex: He has made one of the most powerful American films of the year by keeping faith with his radical principles.
example.tran: 他秉承自己一贯的激进风格，制作出了本年度美国最有感染力的影片之一。

means: 存在或发生于种族之间的

collins.tran: 种族的；种族间的；人种的
collins.def: Racial describes things relating to people's race.

example.ex: ...the protection of national and racial minorities.
example.tran: 对少数民族和少数人种的保护

example.ex: ...the elimination of racial discrimination.
example.tran: 消除种族歧视

collins.def: You can refer to people as folk or folks .

example.ex: Country folk can tell you that there are certain places which animals avoid...
example.tran: 老乡会告诉你有些地方动物是不会去的。

example.ex: These are the folks from the local TV station.
example.tran: 这些是当地电视台来的人。

collins.def: You can refer to your close family, especially your mother and father, as your folks .

example.ex: I've been avoiding my folks lately.
example.tran: 我近来一直在避开家人。

collins.tran: (与人交谈时的称呼)大伙儿，诸位
collins.def: You can use folks as a term of address when you are talking to several people.

example.ex: 'It's a question of money, folks,' I announced...
example.tran: “诸位，这是一个钱的问题，”我郑重其事地说。

example.ex: This is it, folks: the best record guide in the business.
example.tran: 就是这个，伙计们，业内最好的唱片指南。

collins.def: Folk art and customs are traditional or typical of a particular community or nation.

example.ex: ...South American folk art.
example.tran: 南美洲的民间艺术

example.ex: ...traditional Chinese folk medicine.
example.tran: 传统的中国民间医术

collins.def: Folk music is music which is traditional or typical of a particular community or nation.

example.ex: ...Irish folk music.
example.tran: 爱尔兰民间音乐

collins.def: Folk can be used to describe something that relates to the beliefs and opinions of ordinary people.

example.ex: Jack was a folk hero in the Greenwich Village bars...
example.tran: 在格林尼治村的酒吧里杰克是人们心目中的英雄。

example.ex: Folk psychology comes closer to the obvious truth than the most sophisticated theories.
example.tran: 比起最复杂的理论，大众心理学更接近那些显而易见的事实。

collins.tran: 使精疲力竭;使疲惫不堪
collins.def: If something exhausts you, it makes you so tired, either physically or mentally, that you have no energy left.

example.ex: Don't exhaust him...
example.tran: 不要把他累坏了。

example.ex: He took to walking long distances in an attempt to physically exhaust himself.
example.tran: 他开始长距离步行，试图耗尽自己的体力。

collins.def: If you exhaust something such as money or food, you use or finish it all.

example.ex: We have exhausted all our material resources...
example.tran: 我们已经耗尽了所有的物资。

example.ex: They said that food supplies were almost exhausted.
example.tran: 他们说供应的食物几乎快要吃完了。

collins.tran: 详尽地讨论;详尽无遗地论述
collins.def: If you have exhausted a subject or topic, you have talked about it so much that there is nothing more to say about it.

example.ex: She and Chantal must have exhausted the subject of babies and clothes.
example.tran: 她和尚塔尔肯定已经充分讨论过宝宝和衣服的问题。

collins.def: The exhaust or the exhaust pipe is the pipe which carries the gas out of the engine of a vehicle.
Exhaust is the gas or steam that is produced when the engine of a vehicle is running.

example.ex: ...the exhaust from a car engine...
example.tran: 汽车发动机排放的尾气

example.ex: The city's streets are filthy and choked with exhaust fumes.
example.tran: 那座城市的街道肮脏不堪，弥漫着令人窒息的废气。

collins.def: If you knock on something such as a door or window, you hit it, usually several times, to attract someone's attention.

example.ex: She went directly to Simon's apartment and knocked on the door...
example.tran: 她直奔西蒙的房间，敲了敲门。

example.ex: Knock at my window at eight o'clock and I'll be ready...
example.tran: 8点钟敲我的窗，我会准备好的。

collins.tran: 碰，撞；（尤指）碰倒，撞倒，敲动
collins.def: If you knock something, you touch or hit it roughly, especially so that it falls or moves.

example.ex: She accidentally knocked the tea tin off the shelf...
example.tran: 她不小心把架子上的茶叶罐碰了下来。

example.ex: The baby was knocked from his father's arms...
example.tran: 婴儿被从他父亲的怀中撞落。

collins.def: If someone knocks two rooms or buildings into one, or knocks them together, they make them form one room or building by removing a wall.

example.ex: They decided to knock the two rooms into one...
example.tran: 他们决定把两间屋子打通连成一间。

example.ex: The spacious kitchen was achieved by knocking together three small rooms.
example.tran: 这个宽敞的厨房是由3个小屋子打通连成的。

collins.tran: 把…撞击到（某个位置）；把…打成（某种状态）
collins.def: To knock someone into a particular position or condition means to hit them very hard so that they fall over or become unconscious.

example.ex: The third wave was so strong it knocked me backwards...
example.tran: 第3波浪太大了，把我打了回去。

example.ex: They were knocked to the ground and robbed of their wallets...
example.tran: 他们被打倒在地并被抢走了钱包。

collins.tran: 使失去（某种品质或特征）
collins.def: To knock a particular quality or characteristic out of someone means to make them lose it.

example.ex: The stories of his links with the actress had knocked the fun out of him...
example.tran: 有关他与那位女演员有关系的传闻使他很不开心。

example.ex: When they first joined for training many were starry eyed about just sailing around the world. We soon knocked that out of them...
example.tran: 在他们参加培训之初，很多人还只是对环球航行抱有天真的想法。我们很快便使他们消除了那种想法。

collins.def: If something knocks, it makes a repeated sharp banging noise.

example.ex: His old truck, knocking and smoking, pulled down the road and out of sight.
example.tran: 他那辆旧卡车一边冒着烟一边哐里哐啷地沿路向前驶去，直到驶出了视线。

collins.def: If you knock something or someone, you criticize them and say unpleasant things about them.

example.ex: I'm not knocking them: if they want to do it, it's up to them...
example.tran: 我不是批评他们：想不想做那件事取决于他们。

example.ex: Never knock charter flights; they are opening up the world for budget-conscious travellers.
example.tran: 绝不要挑剔包机航班；他们使精打细算的乘客能够去往世界各地。

collins.def: If someone receives a knock, they have an unpleasant experience which prevents them from achieving something or which causes them to change their attitudes or plans.

example.ex: What they said was a real knock to my self-confidence...
example.tran: 他们的话是对我自信心的一次重大打击。

example.ex: The art market has suffered some severe knocks during the past two years.
example.tran: 在过去的两年间，艺术品市场遭受了严重的打击。

collins.tran: （尤指以相貌）给…留下深刻印象，使…倾倒
collins.def: To knock them dead means to impress people a great deal, especially with your appearance.

example.ex: Glamorous make-up is best reserved for days when you want to go all out to knock  'em dead.
example.tran: 魅惑彩妆最好留到你竭力想把所有人都迷倒的时候。

collins.def: If you tell someone to knock it off, you are telling them to stop doing something that is annoying you.

example.ex: Will you just knock it off!
example.tran: 别闹了！

collins.def: If you flee from something or someone, or flee a person or thing, you escape from them.

example.ex: He slammed the bedroom door behind him and fled...
example.tran: 他把卧室房门重重地关上，然后逃跑了。

example.ex: He fled to Costa Rica to avoid military service.
example.tran: 他逃到了哥斯达黎加以逃避服兵役。

collins.def: When people dance for enjoyment or to entertain others, you can refer to this activity as dancing .

example.ex: All the schools have music and dancing as part of the curriculum...
example.tran: 所有学校都设有音乐和舞蹈课。

example.ex: Let's go dancing tonight.
example.tran: 我们今晚去跳舞吧。

collins.def: Accommodation is used to refer to buildings or rooms where people live or stay.

example.ex: The government will provide temporary accommodation for up to three thousand people...
example.tran: 政府将给多达3,000人提供临时住处。

example.ex: Prices start at £1,095 per person, including flights, hotel accommodation and various excursions...
example.tran: 起价为单人1,095英镑，包括机票、旅店住宿和各种出游费用。

collins.tran: （楼房或交通工具内的）空间，座位，铺位
collins.def: Accommodation is space in buildings or vehicles that is available for certain things, people, or activities.

example.ex: The school occupies split-site accommodation on the main campus...
example.tran: 该学院分散在主校区不同地点。

example.ex: Some trains carry bicycles, but accommodation is restricted so a reservation is essential.
example.tran: 有些火车可以运载自行车，但因空间有限需要提前预订。

collins.def: An accommodation is an agreement between different people which enables them to exist together without trouble.

example.ex: His instinct would be to seek a new accommodation with the nationalists...
example.tran: 他本能的反应会是寻求与民族主义者取得新的和解。

example.ex: Religions, to survive, must make accommodations with the larger political structures that nurture them.
example.tran: 为了生存，宗教必须同其赖以存在的更大的政治体系相调和。

collins.def: If you have access to a building or other place, you are able or allowed to go into it.

example.ex: The facilities have been adapted to give access to wheelchair users.
example.tran: 这些设施已经改造过以方便轮椅使用者进入。

example.ex: Scientists have only recently been able to gain access to the area...
example.tran: 科学家直到最近才得以进入该地区。

collins.tran: 查阅（或使用）的机会（或权利）
collins.def: If you have access to something such as information or equipment, you have the opportunity or right to see it or use it.

example.ex: ...a Code of Practice that would give patients right of access to their medical records.
example.tran: 允许病人查看自己病历的职业准则

example.ex: ...whether one has access to a dish and the other accoutrements needed to watch satellite TV.
example.tran: 是否能使用碟型卫星天线以及其他观看卫星电视所需要的装备

collins.tran: 接近（或面见）的机会（或权利）
collins.def: If you have access to a person, you have the opportunity or right to see them or meet them.

example.ex: He was not allowed access to a lawyer.
example.tran: 他未被获准见律师。

example.ex: My ex-wife deliberately sabotages my access to the children.
example.tran: 我的前妻蓄意阻挠我见孩子。

collins.def: If you access something, especially information held on a computer, you succeed in finding or obtaining it.

example.ex: You've illegally accessed and misused confidential security files.
example.tran: 你已经非法访问并盗用了机密的安全文件。

collins.def: An operator is a person who connects telephone calls at a telephone exchange or in a place such as an office or hotel.

example.ex: He dialled the operator and put in a call for Rome.
example.tran: 他拨了接线员的号，让他接通一个到罗马的电话。

collins.def: An operator is a person who is employed to operate or control a machine.

example.ex: ...computer operators.
example.tran: 计算机操作员

collins.def: An operator is a person or a company that runs a business.

example.ex: ...'Tele-Communications', the nation's largest cable TV operator.
example.tran: 全国最大的有线电视运营商“电视通信公司”

collins.tran: 精明圆滑的人；善于取巧的人
collins.def: If you call someone a good operator, you mean that they are skilful at achieving what they want, often in a slightly dishonest way.

example.ex: He was a smart operator. Don't underestimate him.
example.tran: 他这个人精明圆滑，可别小瞧了他。

example.ex: ...one of the shrewdest political operators in the Arab World.
example.tran: 阿拉伯世界最精明狡猾的政客之一

collins.def: An adviser is an expert whose job is to give advice to another person or to a group of people.

example.ex: In Washington, the President and his advisers spent the day in meetings.
example.tran: 在华盛顿，总统和他的顾问们一整天都在开会。

example.ex: ...a careers adviser.
example.tran: 职业顾问

means: 给（窗户或房间）装上帘子

collins.def: Curtains are large pieces of material which you hang from the top of a window.

example.ex: Her bedroom curtains were drawn.
example.tran: 她卧室的窗帘拉上了。

collins.def: Curtains are pieces of very thin material which you hang in front of windows in order to prevent people from seeing in.
In a theatre, the curtain is the large piece of material that hangs in front of the stage until a performance begins.

example.ex: The curtain rises toward the end of the Prelude.
example.tran: 序曲将近结束时帷幕升起来了。

collins.def: You can refer to something as a curtain when it is thick and difficult to see through or get past.

example.ex: ...a curtain of cigarette smoke...
example.tran: 烟幕

example.ex: He saw something dark disappear behind the curtain of leaves.
example.tran: 他看到一个黑漆漆的东西从浓密的树叶后消失了。

collins.def: If something brings down the curtain on an event or situation, it causes or marks the end of it.

example.ex: Management changes are under way that will finally bring down the curtain on Lord Forte's extraordinary working life.
example.tran: 正在进行的管理层变更将最终为福特勋爵辉煌的职业生涯画上句号。

collins.def: A pure substance is not mixed with anything else.

example.ex: ...a carton of pure orange juice.
example.tran: 一盒纯橙汁

collins.tran: 纯净的；洁净的；不含有害物质的
collins.def: Something that is pure is clean and does not contain any harmful substances.

example.ex: In remote regions, the air is pure and the crops are free of poisonous insecticides.
example.tran: 在偏远地区，空气很纯净，庄稼也不施用有毒的杀虫剂。

example.ex: ...demands for purer and cleaner river water.
example.tran: 需要更纯净、更清洁的河水

collins.def: If you describe something such as a colour, a sound, or a type of light as pure, you mean that it is very clear and represents a perfect example of its type.

example.ex: ...flowers in a whole range of blues with the occasional pure white.
example.tran: 各种深深浅浅的蓝色花朵，偶尔有纯白色花朵点缀其间

collins.def: If you describe a form of art or a philosophy as pure, you mean that it is produced or practised according to a standard or form that is expected of it.

example.ex: Nicholson never swerved from his aim of making pure and simple art.
example.tran: 尼科尔森始终坚持创作纯粹简单的艺术，从未动摇过。

collins.tran: （科学或研究）纯理论的，抽象的
collins.def: Pure science or pure research is concerned only with theory and not with how this theory can be used in practical ways.

example.ex: Physics isn't just about pure science with no immediate applications...
example.tran: 物理学并非只是一门不能直接运用的纯科学。

example.ex: They did not approach their subject solely as a matter of 'pure' theory.
example.tran: 他们并没有把他们的学科完全当作一门“纯”理论学科来对待。

collins.def: Pure means complete and total.

example.ex: The old man turned to give her a look of pure surprise...
example.tran: 老人转身十分惊奇地看了她一眼。

example.ex: To sleep on my own and not hear the boys snore or grunt was pure bliss.
example.tran: 自己一个人睡、不用听男孩们的鼾声或咕哝声简直是幸福极了。

collins.def: A person, especially a woman, who is described as pure is considered to be morally good, especially because they have no sexual experience or sexual thoughts.

example.ex: She was baptized and she was pure and clean of sin.
example.tran: 接受了洗礼的她纯洁无瑕。

collins.tran: 完全的；纯粹的；不折不扣的
collins.def: You use pure and simple to emphasize that the thing you are mentioning is the only thing that is involved or that should be considered.

example.ex: It's blackmail, pure and simple.
example.tran: 这纯粹是敲诈。

means: （畜、禽、鱼）剥皮（或去毛、鳞）、去内脏及分割加工好的
动词dress的过去式和过去分词

collins.tran: 穿着衣服的;穿着整齐的
collins.def: If you are dressed, you are wearing clothes rather than being naked or wearing your night clothes. If you get dressed, you put on your clothes.

example.ex: He was fully dressed, including shoes...
example.tran: 他穿戴整齐,鞋都穿好了。

example.ex: He went into his bedroom to get dressed.
example.tran: 他进卧室穿衣服。

collins.def: If you are dressed in a particular way, you are wearing clothes of a particular colour or kind.

example.ex: ...a tall thin woman dressed in black.
example.tran: 一个穿着黑衣服的瘦高女子

example.ex: ...a tall, elegantly dressed man.
example.tran: 一个穿着考究的高个男子

collins.tran: 打扮得引人注目;打扮得花枝招展;衣着光鲜
collins.def: If someone is dressed to kill, they are wearing very smart or fashionable clothes because they want people to notice them and think they are attractive.

example.ex: ...a solitary blonde, beautiful, haughty and dressed to kill.
example.tran: 一位漂亮孤傲、打扮时髦的金发女郎

means: 牵连的事务，复杂的情况

collins.def: Your involvement in something is the fact that you are taking part in it.

example.ex: You have no proof of my involvement in anything...
example.tran: 你没有证据证明我参与了任何活动。

example.ex: She disliked his involvement with the group and disliked his friends.
example.tran: 她不喜欢他与那帮人交往,也不喜欢他的朋友。

collins.def: Involvement is the enthusiasm that you feel when you care deeply about something.

example.ex: Ben has always felt a deep involvement with animals.
example.tran: 本对动物总是有着深厚的感情。

collins.def: An involvement is a close relationship between two people, especially if they are not married to each other.

example.ex: They were very good friends but there was no romantic involvement...
example.tran: 他们是非常要好的朋友，却没有任何暧昧关系。

example.ex: Mahler was also known for his passionate involvements outside marriage.
example.tran: 马勒也因为其轰轰烈烈的婚外情而出名。

collins.def: An exhibition is a public event at which pictures, sculptures, or other objects of interest are displayed, for example at a museum or art gallery.

example.ex: ...an exhibition of expressionist art.
example.tran: 表现派艺术展览会

example.ex: ...an exhibition on the natural history of the area.
example.tran: 该地区自然历史的展览会

collins.def: An exhibition of a particular skilful activity is a display or example of it that people notice or admire.

example.ex: He responded in champion's style by treating the fans to an exhibition of power and speed.
example.tran: 他向崇拜者展示了他的力量和速度，表现得颇有冠军风范。

collins.tran: (令人焦虑或不快的)习惯，经常性行为，倾向
collins.def: A tendency is a worrying or unpleasant habit or action that keeps occurring.

example.ex: The army has become increasingly restless over the mounting separatist tendencies of the northern republics.
example.tran: 军方对于北方几个共和国不断加剧的分裂倾向感到越来越不安。

example.ex: ...the government's tendency towards secrecy in recent years.
example.tran: 近年来政府的保密倾向

collins.def: A tendency is a part of your character that makes you behave in an unpleasant or worrying way.

example.ex: He is spoiled, arrogant and has a tendency towards snobbery...
example.tran: 他被宠坏了，傲慢无礼，而且经常自命不凡。

example.ex: Helen had been struggling against suicidal tendencies.
example.tran: 海伦一直在压制心里的自杀念头。

means: 初次露面，初次表演，首次出场，处女秀

collins.tran: (表演者或运动员的）首次登台，初次露面；（歌手的）首次录音
collins.def: The debut of a performer or sports player is their first public performance, appearance, or recording.

example.ex: Dundee United's Dave Bowman makes his international debut.
example.tran: 邓迪联队的戴夫·鲍曼首次亮相国际比赛。

example.ex: ...her debut album 'Sugar Time'.
example.tran: 她的首张专辑《甜蜜时光》

collins.def: To generate something means to cause it to begin and develop.

example.ex: The Employment Minister said the reforms would generate new jobs.
example.tran: 劳工大臣表示，改革将带来新的就业机会。

example.ex: ...the excitement generated by the changes in Eastern Europe.
example.tran: 东欧变革引起的骚动

collins.def: To generate a form of energy or power means to produce it.

example.ex: The company, New England Electric, burns coal to generate power.
example.tran: 新英格兰电力公司用煤发电。

means: [橄榄球] 触地得分后得附加分

collins.def: If one thing is converted or converts into another, it is changed into a different form.

example.ex: The signal will be converted into digital code.
example.tran: 信号会被转变为数字代码。

example.ex: ...naturally occurring substances which the body can convert into vitamins.
example.tran: 自然产生的能被身体转化成维生素的物质

collins.def: If someone converts a room or building, they alter it in order to use it for a different purpose.

example.ex: By converting the loft, they were able to have two extra bedrooms.
example.tran: 把阁楼改造一下，他们就可以多出两间卧室。

example.ex: ...the entrepreneur who wants to convert County Hall into an hotel...
example.tran: 想把市政厅改建成旅馆的企业家

collins.def: If you convert a vehicle or piece of equipment, you change it so that it can use a different fuel.

example.ex: Save money by converting your car to unleaded...
example.tran: 将车改装一下，使用无铅汽油，这样可以省钱。

example.ex: The programme to convert every gas burner in Britain took 10 years.
example.tran: 完成对英国所有煤气灶的改造花了10年时间。

collins.def: If you convert a quantity from one system of measurement to another, you calculate what the quantity is in the second system.

example.ex: Converting metric measurements to U.S. equivalents is easy.
example.tran: 将公制计量换算成美制计量非常简单。

collins.tran: (使)改变宗教（或政治）信仰;(使)皈依;(使)归附
collins.def: If someone converts you, they persuade you to change your religious or political beliefs. You can also say that someone converts to a different religion.

example.ex: If you try to convert him, you could find he just walks away...
example.tran: 如果你试图改变他的信仰，他就会走开。

example.ex: He was a major influence in converting Godwin to political radicalism...
example.tran: 戈德温变成政治激进主义者主要是受他的影响。

collins.tran: 皈依者;归附者;改变信仰者
collins.def: A convert is someone who has changed their religious or political beliefs.

example.ex: She, too, was a convert to Roman Catholicism.
example.tran: 她也皈依了天主教。

example.ex: ...a Muslim convert now known as Yusuf Islam.
example.tran: 现以优素福·伊斯兰这个名字为大家熟知的伊斯兰教皈依者

collins.def: If someone converts you to something, they make you very enthusiastic about it.

example.ex: He quickly converted me to the joys of cross-country skiing.
example.tran: 他很快就使我迷上了越野滑雪。

collins.tran: 刚迷上…的人;最近开始热衷于…的人
collins.def: If you describe someone as a convert to something, you mean that they have recently become very enthusiastic about it.

example.ex: ...recent converts to vegetarianism.
example.tran: 最近开始热衷于素食主义的人

collins.def: A photographer is someone who takes photographs as a job or hobby.

example.ex: ...a group of TV cameramen and press photographers.
example.tran: 一群电视台的摄影师和报社摄影记者

example.ex: ...a keen amateur photographer with a special interest in natural history subjects.
example.tran: 对博物学题材有特殊兴趣的业余摄影爱好者

collins.def: A lease is a legal agreement by which the owner of a building, a piece of land, or something such as a car allows someone else to use it for a period of time in return for money.

example.ex: He took up a 10 year lease on the house at Rossie Priory.
example.tran: 他签了一份10年租约，租下了罗茜大宅的房子。

collins.def: If you lease property or something such as a car from someone or if they lease it to you, they allow you to use it in return for regular payments of money.

example.ex: He went to Toronto, where he leased an apartment...
example.tran: 他去了多伦多，在那儿租了一间公寓。

example.ex: She hopes to lease the building to students...
example.tran: 她希望把房子租给学生。

collins.tran: （较昔日更加）焕发生机；重振雄风
collins.def: If you say that someone or something has been given a new lease of life, you are emphasizing that they are much more lively or successful than they have been in the past.

example.ex: The operation has given me a new lease of life.
example.tran: 手术使我重获新生。

collins.def: If you are anxious to do something or anxious that something should happen, you very much want to do it or very much want it to happen.

example.ex: Both the Americans and the Russians are anxious to avoid conflict in South Asia...
example.tran: 美国人和俄罗斯人都迫切希望避免在南亚发生冲突。

example.ex: He is anxious that there should be no delay...
example.tran: 他非常希望不会出现延误。

collins.def: If you are anxious, you are nervous or worried about something.

example.ex: The foreign minister admitted he was still anxious about the situation in the country...
example.tran: 外交部长承认对于该国的局势他仍然颇感忧虑。

example.ex: A friend of mine is a very anxious person.
example.tran: 我的一个朋友是个非常容易焦虑不安的人。

collins.tran: （时间或局势）紧张的，令人焦虑的，让人担忧的
collins.def: An anxious time or situation is one during which you feel nervous and worried.

example.ex: The Prime Minister faces anxious hours before the votes are counted tomorrow night.
example.tran: 在明晚计票完成之前，首相将面临数小时的煎熬等待。

collins.tran: (信件、包裹等的)递送，投递，运送
collins.def: Delivery or a delivery is the bringing of letters, parcels, or other goods to someone's house or to another place where they want them.

example.ex: Please allow 28 days for delivery...
example.tran: 递送将需要 28 天的时间。

example.ex: It is available at £108, including VAT and delivery.
example.tran: 其价格为 108 英镑，包括增值税和送货费在内。

collins.tran: 递送之物;投递之物;运送之物
collins.def: A delivery of something is the goods that are delivered.

example.ex: I got a delivery of fresh eggs this morning.
example.tran: 我今天早上收到了送来的新鲜鸡蛋。

collins.def: A delivery person or service delivers things to a place.

example.ex: ...a pizza delivery man.
example.tran: 比萨饼递送员

example.ex: ...Interflora, the flower delivery service.
example.tran: 国际花商联盟，鲜花速递服务机构

collins.def: You talk about someone's delivery when you are referring to the way in which they give a speech or lecture.

example.ex: His speeches were magnificently written but his delivery was hopeless.
example.tran: 他的发言稿写得非常精彩，但他的演讲风格真是无可救药。

collins.def: Delivery is the process of giving birth to a baby.

example.ex: In the end, it was an easy delivery: a fine baby boy...
example.tran: 分娩过程最终非常顺利，生了个健康的男婴。

example.ex: Premature birth is three times more likely for twins, and delivery at 36 to 38 weeks is normal.
example.tran: 双胞胎的早产率要比一般的高出两倍，在36到38周之间分娩很正常。

collins.def: An injured person or animal has physical damage to part of their body, usually as a result of an accident or fighting.

example.ex: The other injured man had a superficial stomach wound...
example.tran: 另一名受伤男子是腹部的皮外伤。

example.ex: Many of them will have died because they were so badly injured.
example.tran: 他们中很多人会因伤势过重而死亡。

collins.def: If you have injured feelings, you feel upset because you believe someone has been unfair or unkind to you.

example.ex: ...a look of injured pride.
example.tran: 自尊心受到伤害的表情

example.ex: ...compensation for injured feelings.
example.tran: 精神损失赔偿

collins.def: A pact is a formal agreement between two or more people, organizations, or governments to do a particular thing or to help each other.

example.ex: Last month he signed a new non-aggression pact with Germany...
example.tran: 上个月，他与德国签订了新的互不侵犯条约。

example.ex: The other two opposition parties cannot agree on an electoral pact between themselves.
example.tran: 另外两个反对党之间无法就选举达成协议。

collins.def: Boots are shoes that cover your whole foot and the lower part of your leg.

example.ex: He sat in a kitchen chair, reached down and pulled off his boots...
example.tran: 他坐到厨房的椅子上，俯身脱掉了靴子。

example.ex: He was wearing riding pants, high boots, and spurs.
example.tran: 他穿着马裤和长筒靴，靴上带着马刺。

collins.tran: (步行、运动等时穿的）厚底短筒靴
collins.def: Boots are strong, heavy shoes which cover your ankle and which have thick soles. You wear them to protect your feet, for example when you are walking or taking part in sport.

example.ex: The soldiers' boots resounded in the street...
example.tran: 士兵的军靴声在街上回荡。

example.ex: Equip yourself with stout walking boots and sticks.
example.tran: 你自己要准备好结实的步行靴和拐杖。

collins.def: If you boot something such as a ball, you kick it hard.

example.ex: He booted the ball 40 yards back up field...
example.tran: 他一脚踢出40码远，把球踢回前场。

example.ex: One guy booted the door down.
example.tran: 一个人猛地踹倒了门。

collins.def: The boot of a car is a covered space at the back or front, in which you carry things such as luggage and shopping.

example.ex: He opened the boot to put my bags in...
example.tran: 他打开行李箱把我带的包放了进去。

example.ex: Harris got a rope from the car boot.
example.tran: 哈里斯从汽车行李箱里拿出一条绳子。

collins.def: To boot a car means to fit a Denver boot to one of its wheels so that it cannot be driven away.

example.ex: 'If we're gettin' booted, we sure as hell ain't leavin' it for the locals.'
example.tran: “如果我们的车轮被锁住，我们绝不会把车留给当地人。”

collins.def: If you get the boot or are given the boot, you are told that you are not wanted any more, either in your job or by someone you are having a relationship with.

example.ex: She was a disruptive influence, and after a year or two she got the boot...
example.tran: 她总是影响正常的工作，一两年后便被解雇了。

example.ex: His girl gave him the boot.
example.tran: 他被女友抛弃了。

collins.tran: （在某人已感到虚弱或苦恼时）说刻薄伤人的话，落井下石
collins.def: If someone puts the boot in, they attack another person by saying something cruel, often when the person is already feeling weak or upset.
You can say to boot to emphasize that you have added something else to something or to a list of things that you have just said.

example.ex: He is making money and receiving free advertising to boot!
example.tran: 他既挣了钱，又做了免费的广告！

example.ex: They have to be thin, attractive and well-dressed to boot.
example.tran: 她们必须得既苗条又迷人，而且一定要打扮漂亮。

means: 联系(associate的过去式和过去分词)
（用于联合企业的名称）联合的

collins.def: If one thing is associated with another, the two things are connected with each other.

example.ex: These symptoms are particularly associated with migraine headaches.
example.tran: 这些症状尤其与偏头痛相关。

collins.tran: （用于公司名称）联合的，联营的
collins.def: Associated is used in the name of a company that is made up of a number of smaller companies which have joined together.

example.ex: ...the Associated Press.
example.tran: 美联社

collins.def: Morals are principles and beliefs concerning right and wrong behaviour.

example.ex: ...Western ideas and morals...
example.tran: 西方的思想和道德规范

example.ex: They have no morals.
example.tran: 他们没有一点品行。

collins.def: Moral means relating to beliefs about what is right or wrong.

example.ex: She describes her own moral dilemma in making the film.
example.tran: 她讲述了拍摄这部电影过程中她在道义上所面临的两难选择。

example.ex: ...matters of church doctrine and moral teaching.
example.tran: 教会教义和道德教化的事情

collins.tran: （勇气或职责）道义上的;基于道德规范的
collins.def: Moral courage or duty is based on what you believe is right or acceptable, rather than on what the law says should be done.

example.ex: The Government had a moral, if not a legal duty to pay compensation.
example.tran: 政府即使没有法律责任，在道义上也有责任来赔偿。

example.ex: ...his moral courage and sane defence of his philosophy.
example.tran: 他的道德勇气和对自己观点明智的辩护

collins.def: A moral person behaves in a way that is believed by most people to be good and right.

example.ex: The people who will be on the  committee are moral, cultured, competent people.
example.tran: 进入委员会的人要品行端正，有文化，有能力。

collins.def: If you give someone moral support, you encourage them in what they are doing by expressing approval.

example.ex: Moral as well as financial support was what the West should provide.
example.tran: 西方国家应该提供道义支持和经济援助。

collins.tran: (由故事、事件引出的)道德训诫，寓意
collins.def: The moral of a story or event is what you learn from it about how you should or should not behave.

example.ex: I think the moral of the story is let the buyer beware...
example.tran: 我想这个故事的寓意是提醒购物者当心。

example.ex: The moral is that, once cooked, they look the same and taste every bit as good.
example.tran: 由此可知，烹饪后，它们的味道和品相都别无二致。

collins.def: In the United States, an attorney or attorney at law is a lawyer.

example.ex: ...a prosecuting attorney.
example.tran: 检察官

collins.def: If you acquire something, you buy or obtain it for yourself, or someone gives it to you.

example.ex: General Motors acquired a 50% stake in Saab for about $400m...
example.tran: 通用汽车公司以大约4亿美元的价格购得了萨博汽车公司50%的股份。

example.ex: I recently acquired some wood from a holly tree...
example.tran: 最近我从一棵冬青树上弄了些木料。

collins.def: If you acquire something such as a skill or a habit, you learn it, or develop it through your daily life or experience.

example.ex: I've never acquired a taste for wine...
example.tran: 我一向喝不惯葡萄酒。

example.ex: Having read the book, she will be able to pass on the acquired knowledge to trainee teachers.
example.tran: 读完此书，她便能将从书中所得传授给实习教师。

collins.def: If someone or something acquires a certain reputation, they start to have that reputation.

example.ex: He has acquired a reputation as this country's premier solo violinist.
example.tran: 他已经赢得了该国首席小提琴独奏家的名誉。

collins.tran: 后天养成的爱好;培养出来的兴趣
collins.def: If you describe something as an acquired taste, you mean that a lot of people do not like it when they first experience it, but often start to like it more when they get to know it better.

example.ex: Broad beans are very much an acquired taste...
example.tran: 要慢慢适应才能吃得惯蚕豆。

example.ex: Living alone is an acquired taste.
example.tran: 独处是一种修得的境界。

collins.def: Therapy is the treatment of someone with mental or physical illness without the use of drugs or operations.

example.ex: In therapy, she began to let go of her obsession with Mike...
example.tran: 在接受治疗的过程中，她开始逐渐从对迈克的迷恋中解脱出来。

example.ex: He is having therapy to conquer his phobia.
example.tran: 他在接受治疗以克服自己的恐惧症。

collins.tran: (针对某人特定病情的)治疗方案，治疗方法
collins.def: A therapy is a particular treatment of someone with a particular illness.

example.ex: ...hormonal therapies.
example.tran: 激素疗法

example.ex: ...conventional drug therapy.
example.tran: 常规药物疗法

means: （比赛等）通过作弊预先安排好结果的
固定( fix的过去式和过去分词)

collins.def: You use fixed to describe something which stays the same and does not or cannot vary.

example.ex: They issue a fixed number of shares that trade publicly...
example.tran: 他们发行一定数量的可公开交易的股票。

example.ex: ...a world without fixed laws...
example.tran: 没有固定法规的世界

collins.tran: (观念或看法)顽固的，固执的，一成不变的
collins.def: If you say that someone has fixed ideas or opinions, you mean that they do not often change their ideas and opinions, although perhaps they should.

example.ex: ...people who have fixed ideas about things.
example.tran: 对事物看法一成不变的人

collins.tran: (笑容)僵硬的，呆板的,皮笑肉不笑的
collins.def: If someone has a fixed smile on their face, they are smiling even though they do not feel happy or pleased.

example.ex: I had to go through the rest of the evening with a fixed smile on my face.
example.tran: 晚会剩下的时间里，我只好脸上挂着一副僵硬的笑容。

collins.tran: 无固定住所的;居无定所的
collins.def: Someone who is of no fixed address, or in British English no fixed abode, does not have a permanent place to live.

example.ex: They are not able to get a job interview because they have no fixed address...
example.tran: 因为居无定所，他们无法得到工作面试的机会。

example.ex: He's of no fixed abode and we found him on the streets.
example.tran: 他居无定所，我们发现他流落街头。

collins.def: If you feel guilty, you feel unhappy because you think that you have done something wrong or have failed to do something which you should have done.

example.ex: I feel so guilty, leaving all this to you...
example.tran: 把这些事都留给你去做，我真感到过意不去。

example.ex: When she saw me she looked guilty.
example.tran: 她见到我时一脸歉疚。

collins.def: Guilty is used of an action or fact that you feel guilty about.

example.ex: Many may be keeping it a guilty secret...
example.tran: 许多人或许保守着这个罪恶的秘密。

example.ex: I leave with a guilty sense of relief.
example.tran: 我带着一种罪恶的解脱感离开。

collins.def: If someone is guilty of a crime or offence, they have committed that crime or offence.

example.ex: They were found guilty of murder...
example.tran: 他们被判谋杀罪成立。

example.ex: He pleaded guilty to causing actual bodily harm.
example.tran: 他承认确实犯有人身伤害罪。

collins.def: If someone is guilty of doing something wrong, they have done that thing.

example.ex: He claimed Mr Brooke had been guilty of a 'gross error of judgment'...
example.tran: 他宣称布鲁克先生犯有“判断失误的重大过错”。

example.ex: They will consider whether or not he has been guilty of serious professional misconduct.
example.tran: 他们将考虑他是否犯有玩忽职守的重大过失。

collins.def: Traffic refers to all the vehicles that are moving along the roads in a particular area.

example.ex: There was heavy traffic on the roads...
example.tran: 道路上车流拥挤。

example.ex: Traffic was unusually light for that time of day.
example.tran: 对于一天中的那个时间段而言，来往车辆少得有些不寻常。

collins.tran: (海上、铁路或空中的)交通，通行;(客、货)运输量
collins.def: Traffic refers to the movement of ships, trains, or aircraft between one place and another. Traffic also refers to the people and goods that are being transported.

example.ex: Air traffic had returned to normal...
example.tran: 空中交通已恢复正常。

example.ex: The railways will carry a far higher proportion of freight traffic...
example.tran: 铁路将承担比例高得多的货运量。

collins.tran: (毒品、赃物等的)非法买卖，非法交易
collins.def: Traffic in something such as drugs or stolen goods is an illegal trade in them.

example.ex: Traffic in illicit drugs was now worth some 500 thousand million dollars a year.
example.tran: 如今每年非法毒品的交易值约在 5,000 亿美元。

collins.def: Someone who traffics in something such as drugs or stolen goods buys and sells them even though it is illegal to do so.

example.ex: The president said illegal drugs are hurting the entire world and anyone who traffics in them should be brought to justice.
example.tran: 总统称毒品正在危害整个世界，任何非法贩卖毒品的人都应依法受到惩处。

means: 孪生儿之一，双胞胎之一
两个相像的人或物之一
尤用于英国)使结成姊妹城市
使（两人或两事物）紧密结合

collins.tran: 双胞胎之一;孪生儿之一
collins.def: If two people are twins, they have the same mother and were born on the same day.

example.ex: Sarah was looking after the twins...
example.tran: 萨拉当时正在照管那对双胞胎。

example.ex: I think there are many positive aspects to being a twin…
example.tran: 我认为身为双胞胎中的一个有很多积极方面。

collins.def: Twin is used to describe a pair of things that look the same and are close together.

example.ex: ...the twin spires of the cathedral.
example.tran: 大教堂的那对尖塔

example.ex: ...the world's largest twin-engined aircraft.
example.tran: 世界上最大的双引擎飞机

collins.def: Twin is used to describe two things or ideas that are similar or connected in some way.

example.ex: ...the twin concepts of liberty and equality...
example.tran: 自由与平等这两个密切相关的概念

example.ex: Nothing was done to save these women from the twin evils of begging or the workhouse.
example.tran: 没有采取任何措施把这些妇女从乞讨或济贫院这两大相似的灾难中拯救出来。

collins.tran: 使结成友好地区;使结为特殊关系
collins.def: When a place or organization in one country is twinned with a place or organization in another country, a special relationship is formally established between them.

example.ex: Five Polish banks are to be twinned with counterparts in Western Europe...
example.tran: 5 家波兰银行将和 5 家西欧银行结为姐妹银行。

example.ex: The borough is twinned with Kasel in Germany.
example.tran: 该自治市与德国的卡瑟尔市结成了友好城市。

collins.def: Twin towns or cities are twinned with each other.

example.ex: This led Zagreb's twin town, Mainz, to donate £70,000-worth of high-quality equipment.
example.tran: 这使得萨格勒布的友好城市美因茨捐赠了价值 7 万英镑的高品质装备。

collins.tran: 主要的；首要的；最为重要的
collins.def: You use prime to describe something that is most important in a situation.

example.ex: Political stability, meanwhile, will be a prime concern...
example.tran: 同时，政治稳定性将放在首位。

example.ex: It could be a prime target for guerrilla attack...
example.tran: 这可能是游击队进攻的主要目标。

collins.tran: 优质的；一流的；上等的；最好的
collins.def: You use prime to describe something that is of the best possible quality.

example.ex: It was one of the City's prime sites, near the Stock Exchange.
example.tran: 这是伦敦最好的地段之一，离证券交易所很近。

collins.tran: 最典型的；最有代表性的
collins.def: You use prime to describe an example of a particular kind of thing that is absolutely typical.

example.ex: The prime example is Macy's, once the undisputed king of California retailers.
example.tran: 最典型的例子是梅西百货，它曾经是加利福尼亚无可争辩的零售巨头。

collins.tran: 全盛时期；最活跃时期；最成功时期
collins.def: If someone or something is in their prime, they are at the stage in their existence when they are at their strongest, most active, or most successful.

example.ex: Maybe I'm just coming into my prime now...
example.tran: 也许我现在正要步入事业辉煌期。

example.ex: She was in her intellectual prime...
example.tran: 在智力上，她正处于壮年。

collins.def: If you prime someone to do something, you prepare them to do it, for example by giving them information about it beforehand.

example.ex: Claire wished she'd primed Sarah beforehand...
example.tran: 克莱尔真希望她事先指点过萨拉。

example.ex: Arnold primed her for her duties...
example.tran: 阿诺德事先让她熟悉了自己的任务。

collins.def: If someone primes a bomb or a gun, they prepare it so that it is ready to explode or fire.

example.ex: He was priming the bomb to go off in an hour's time...
example.tran: 他正在装炸弹，设定为在一个小时之内爆炸。

example.ex: Tom keeps a primed 10-foot shotgun in his office.
example.tran: 汤姆在办公室放了一支装了子弹的10英尺长的猎枪。

collins.def: A muscle is a piece of tissue inside your body which connects two bones and which you use when you make a movement.

example.ex: Keeping your muscles strong and in tone helps you to avoid back problems...
example.tran: 保持肌肉强壮发达有利于预防背部疾病。

example.ex: He is suffering from a strained thigh muscle...
example.tran: 他的大腿肌肉拉伤了，疼得很。

collins.def: If you say that someone has muscle, you mean that they have power and influence, which enables them to do difficult things.

example.ex: Eisenhower used his muscle to persuade Congress to change the law...
example.tran: 艾森豪威尔用他的影响力说服国会修改了该项法律。

example.ex: In one town, all the women were urged to remove their money from the banks on an allotted day, to demonstrate women's financial muscle.
example.tran: 在某市，所有的女性都被建议在指定日期从银行取走她们的钱，以展示女性群体的经济实力。

collins.def: If a group, organization, or country flexes its muscles, it does something to impress or frighten people, in order to show them that it has power and is considering using it.

example.ex: The Fair Trade Commission has of late been flexing its muscles, cracking down on cases of corruption.
example.tran: 公平交易委员会最近在显示威力，严厉打击腐败事件。

collins.def: If you say that someone did not move a muscle, you mean that they stayed absolutely still.

example.ex: He stood without moving a muscle, unable to believe what his eyes saw so plainly.
example.tran: 他站在那里一动不动，不能相信眼前如此清清楚楚看到的一切。

collins.def: Publishing is the profession of publishing books.

example.ex: I had a very high-powered job in publishing.
example.tran: 我曾在出版业担任要职。

collins.def: Panic is a very strong feeling of anxiety or fear, which makes you act without thinking carefully.

example.ex: An earthquake hit the capital, causing panic among the population...
example.tran: 首都发生了地震，引发民众恐慌。

example.ex: I phoned the doctor in a panic, crying that I'd lost the baby.
example.tran: 我惊慌失措地给医生打电话，哭着说我的孩子没了。

collins.tran: 恐慌局面；人心惶惶的状态
collins.def: Panic or a panic is a situation in which people are affected by a strong feeling of anxiety.

example.ex: There was a moment of panic in Britain as it became clear just how vulnerable the nation was...
example.tran: 一时间，英国出现了大恐慌，因为人们清楚地看到了英国有多么不堪一击。

example.ex: I'm in a panic about getting everything done in time...
example.tran: 我一阵手忙脚乱，想及时做完所有事情。

collins.def: If you panic or if someone panics you, you suddenly feel anxious or afraid, and act quickly and without thinking carefully.

example.ex: Guests panicked and screamed when the bomb exploded...
example.tran: 炸弹爆炸后，客人们惊慌失措，尖声惊叫。

example.ex: The unexpected and sudden memory briefly panicked her...
example.tran: 突然间莫名涌起的回忆让她心头一紧。

means: 用手势表现，表达或指导

collins.def: A gesture is a movement that you make with a part of your body, especially your hands, to express emotion or information.

example.ex: Sarah made a menacing gesture with her fist...
example.tran: 萨拉用拳头做了一个威胁性的动作。

example.ex: He throws his hands open in a gesture which clearly indicates his relief.
example.tran: 他摊开双手，明确表示他已如释重负。

collins.tran: （表明态度或意图的）姿态，表示
collins.def: A gesture is something that you say or do in order to express your attitude or intentions, often something that you know will not have much effect.

example.ex: He questioned the government's commitment to peace and called on it to make a gesture of good will...
example.tran: 他对政府致力和平的承诺提出质疑，并呼吁政府做出友好的表示。

example.ex: There's not greater gesture of love than having someone's name tattooed on your body...
example.tran: 没有比将某人姓名文到身上更绝妙的示爱方式了。

collins.tran: 打手势；用手势表示；用动作示意
collins.def: If you gesture, you use movements of your hands or head in order to tell someone something or draw their attention to something.

example.ex: I gestured towards the boathouse, and he looked inside...
example.tran: 我朝船库方向示意，他便往里面瞧了瞧。

example.ex: He gestures, gesticulates, and moves with the grace of a dancer.
example.tran: 他举手投足之间流露出舞者的优雅。

collins.def: Whilst means the same as the conjunction while .
Shoes are objects which you wear on your feet. They cover most of your foot and you wear them over socks or stockings.

example.ex: ...a pair of shoes...
example.tran: 一双鞋

example.ex: Low-heeled comfortable shoes are best...
example.tran: 舒服的低跟鞋子最好了。

collins.def: A shoe is the same as a horseshoe .
When a blacksmith shoes a horse, they fix horseshoes onto its feet.

example.ex: Blacksmiths spent most of their time repairing tools and shoeing horses...
example.tran: 铁匠大部分时间都在修理工具和钉马掌。

example.ex: He helped his father by holding the horses steady while they were being shod.
example.tran: 他父亲给马钉掌时他就帮忙将马抓牢。

collins.def: If you fill someone's shoes or step into their shoes, you take their place by doing the job they were doing.

example.ex: No one has been able to fill his shoes...
example.tran: 目前还没人能接替他的位置。

example.ex: Now that Chris is gone she wants me to step into his shoes.
example.tran: 既然克里斯走了，她就想让我接替他的位置。

collins.def: If you talk about being in someone's shoes, you talk about what you would do or how you would feel if you were in their situation.

example.ex: I wouldn't want to be in his shoes.
example.tran: 我可不想处在他那样的处境。

collins.def: If a company, industry, or service that is owned by the state is privatized, the government sells it and makes it a private company.

example.ex: The water boards are about to be privatized.
example.tran: 水务委员会将实行私有化。

example.ex: ...a pledge to privatise the rail and coal industries.
example.tran: 将铁路和煤炭工业私有化的保证

collins.def: If you load a vehicle or a container, you put a large quantity of things into it.

example.ex: The three men seemed to have finished loading the truck...
example.tran: 这3名男子似乎已把东西往卡车上装载完毕。

example.ex: Mr. Dambar had loaded his plate with lasagne...
example.tran: 丹巴尔先生盛了一大盘千层面。
