collins.def: A load is something, usually a large quantity or heavy object, which is being carried.

example.ex: He drove by with a big load of hay...
example.tran: 他载着一大车干草驶过。

example.ex: He was carrying a very heavy load.
example.tran: 他身上背着沉甸甸的东西。

collins.def: A load is a quantity of clothes or sheets which need washing and which are washed together in a washing machine.

example.ex: I put another load in the washing machine.
example.tran: 我把另一堆衣服放进洗衣机。

collins.def: If you refer to a load of people or things or loads of them, you are emphasizing that there are a lot of them.

example.ex: I've got loads of money...
example.tran: 我有大把的钱。

example.ex: His people came up with a load of embarrassing information...
example.tran: 他的部下亮出一大堆令人尴尬的资料来。

collins.def: When someone loads a weapon such as a gun, they put a bullet or missile in it so that it is ready to use.

example.ex: I knew how to load and handle a gun...
example.tran: 我知道怎么上子弹，也知道枪怎么用。

example.ex: He carried a loaded gun...
example.tran: 他带了一把子弹上膛的枪。

collins.tran: 把（胶卷、磁带等）装入；将（数据）载入
collins.def: To load a camera or other piece of equipment means to put film, tape, or data into it so that it is ready to use.

example.ex: A photographer from the newspaper was loading his camera with film...
example.tran: 那家报纸的一名摄影师正往相机里装胶卷。

example.ex: A technician loads a video tape into one of the machines...
example.tran: 一名技师把一盒录影带装进其中一台机器。

collins.def: You can refer to the amount of work you have to do as a load .

example.ex: She's taking some of the load off the secretaries.
example.tran: 她在给秘书们减轻一些工作量。

collins.def: The load of a system or piece of equipment, especially a system supplying electricity or a computer, is the extent to which it is being used at a particular time.

example.ex: An efficient bulb may lighten the load of power stations...
example.tran: 一个节能灯泡也许就能减轻发电站的负荷。

example.ex: Several processors can share the load of handling data in a single program.
example.tran: 几个处理器可共同分担处理一个程序数据的负荷。

collins.def: The load on something is the amount of weight that is pressing down on it or the amount of strain that it is under.

example.ex: Some of these chairs have flattened feet which spread the load on the ground...
example.tran: 这些椅子中有的是平脚的，这样可分散地面所受的压力。

example.ex: High blood pressure imposes an extra load on the heart.
example.tran: 高血压会给心脏增加额外的负担。

collins.def: If a container leaks, there is a hole or crack in it which lets a substance such as liquid or gas escape. You can also say that a container leaks a substance such as liquid or gas.

example.ex: The roof leaked...
example.tran: 屋顶漏雨。

example.ex: The gas had apparently leaked from a cylinder...
example.tran: 气体似乎由一汽缸漏出。

collins.def: A leak is a crack, hole, or other gap that a substance such as a liquid or gas can pass through.

example.ex: ...a leak in the radiator...
example.tran: 暖气片上的一条裂缝

example.ex: In May engineers found a leak in a hydrogen fuel line.
example.tran: 5月份工程师们在一条氢燃料管线上发现一条裂隙。

collins.def: If a secret document or piece of information leaks or is leaked, someone lets the public know about it.

example.ex: Last year, a civil servant was imprisoned for leaking a document to the press...
example.tran: 去年，一名公务员因向报界泄露了一份文件而被判入狱。

example.ex: He revealed who leaked a confidential police report...
example.tran: 他说出了泄露警方机密报告内容的人。

collins.def: You say that someone is lucky when they have something that is very desirable or when they are in a very desirable situation.

example.ex: I am luckier than most. I have a job...
example.tran: 我比大部分人幸运。我有份工作。

example.ex: I consider myself the luckiest man on the face of the Earth...
example.tran: 我认为自己是地球上最幸运的人。

collins.def: Someone who is lucky seems to always have good luck.

example.ex: Some people are born lucky aren't they?...
example.tran: 有人生来就有福气，不是吗？

example.ex: He had always been lucky at cards.
example.tran: 他打牌的手气向来很好。

collins.def: If you describe an action or experience as lucky, you mean that it was good or successful, and that it happened by chance and not as a result of planning or preparation.

example.ex: They admit they are now desperate for a lucky break...
example.tran: 他们承认现在急盼幸运之神的降临。

example.ex: He was lucky that it was only a can of beer that knocked him on the head.
example.tran: 算他命大，砸到他脑袋上的只是一罐啤酒。

collins.tran: 吉祥的；吉利的；带来（或预示）好运的
collins.def: A lucky object is something that people believe helps them to be successful.

example.ex: He did not have on his other lucky charm, a pair of green socks.
example.tran: 他没把另一件吉祥物，一双绿色的袜子，穿在脚上。

collins.def: If you say that someone will be lucky to do or get something, you mean that they are very unlikely to do or get it, and will definitely not do or get any more than that.

example.ex: You'll be lucky if you get any breakfast...
example.tran: 你能吃到早饭就已经算幸运了。

example.ex: Those remaining in work will be lucky to get the smallest of pay increases...
example.tran: 那些仍在工作的人，有那么一点点儿加薪就要算是运气了。

collins.tran: 值得庆幸；额手称庆；自认为幸运
collins.def: If you say that someone can count themselves lucky, you mean that the situation they are in or the thing that has happened to them is better than it might have been or than they might have expected.

example.ex: She counted herself lucky to get a job in one of Edinburgh's department stores...
example.tran: 能在爱丁堡一家百货公司找到工作，她觉得自己很幸运。

example.ex: At the end of two days, you may count yourself lucky that you don't have to live here.
example.tran: 两天过后，你就会庆幸自己不用住在这里。

collins.tran: （表示轻微的妒忌或惊讶）幸运的家伙
collins.def: You can use lucky in expressions such as 'Lucky you' and 'Lucky devil' when you are slightly jealous of someone else's good luck or success, or surprised at it.

example.ex: 'The thing about Mr Kemp is that he always treats me like a lady.' — 'Lucky old you.'
example.tran: “问题是，肯普先生向来把我当淑女看待。”——“你真幸运。”

collins.def: If you strike lucky or strike it lucky, you have some good luck.

example.ex: You may strike lucky and find a sympathetic and helpful clerk, but, there again, you might not.
example.tran: 走运的话，你可能赶上一位有同情心、乐于助人的职员。但话又说回来，你也可能没这运气。

collins.tran: 事不过三；第三次一定行
collins.def: If you say that it is third time lucky for someone, you mean that they have tried to do a particular thing twice before and that this time they will succeed.

example.ex: I've had two runners-up medals with Monaco and AC Milan, but I hope it will be third time lucky and I get a winners' medal with Rangers.
example.tran: 我为摩纳哥队、AC米兰队效力时两次都只拿到了亚军，但是事不过三，我希望能为流浪者队拿下一个冠军。

collins.tran: 极佳的;卓越的;质量极高的
collins.def: If something is superb, its quality is very good indeed.

example.ex: There is a superb 18-hole golf course 6 miles away...
example.tran: 6 英里外有一个一流的 18 洞高尔夫球场。

example.ex: The waters are crystal clear and offer a superb opportunity for swimming.
example.tran: 这片水域水质清澈，是游泳的绝佳场所。

collins.tran: (信心、控制力、技巧)非同一般的，超凡的
collins.def: If you say that someone has superb confidence, control, or skill, you mean that they have very great confidence, control, or skill.

example.ex: With superb skill he managed to make a perfect landing.
example.tran: 他凭借超凡的技术实现了完美着陆。

collins.tran: 志愿者;义务工作者;义工
collins.def: A volunteer is someone who does work without being paid for it, because they want to do it.

example.ex: She now helps in a local school as a volunteer three days a week...
example.tran: 目前她在当地的一家学校做志愿工作，一周去3天。

example.ex: Mike was a member of the local volunteer fire brigade.
example.tran: 迈克是当地消防队的一名志愿消防员。

collins.tran: 自告奋勇者;主动做事者
collins.def: A volunteer is someone who offers to do a particular task or job without being forced to do it.

example.ex: Right. What I want now is two volunteers to come down to the front...
example.tran: 好了，现在我需要两个自告奋勇的人到前面来。

example.ex: Any volunteers?
example.tran: 有没有人自告奋勇？

collins.def: If you volunteer to do something, you offer to do it without being forced to do it.

example.ex: Aunt Mary volunteered to clean up the kitchen...
example.tran: 玛丽阿姨主动要求清扫厨房。

example.ex: He volunteered for the army in 1939...
example.tran: 1939年他志愿参军。

collins.def: If you volunteer information, you tell someone something without being asked.

example.ex: The room was quiet; no one volunteered any further information...
example.tran: 房间很安静，无人主动提供更多的信息。

example.ex: 'They  were both great supporters of Franco,' Ryle volunteered...
example.tran: “他们都是佛朗哥的忠实支持者，”赖尔主动说道。

collins.def: A volunteer is someone who chooses to join the armed forces, especially during a war, as opposed to someone who is forced to join by law.

example.ex: They fought as volunteers with the Afghan guerrillas...
example.tran: 他们作为志愿军和阿富汗的游击队员并肩作战。

example.ex: Victory in the civil war had been achieved by a mainly volunteer army.
example.tran: 一支主要由志愿军组成的队伍取得了内战的胜利。

collins.def: You use dear to describe someone or something that you feel affection for.

example.ex: Mrs Cavendish is a dear friend of mine...
example.tran: 卡文迪什夫人是我的一位亲密朋友。

example.ex: At last I am back at my dear little desk.
example.tran: 我终于回到了我那张可爱的小桌子旁。

collins.tran: 对…来说心爱的;在…（心中）宝贵的
collins.def: If something is dear to you or dear to your heart, you care deeply about it.

example.ex: His family life was very dear to him...
example.tran: 他很珍视自己的家庭生活。

example.ex: This is a subject very dear to the hearts of academics up and down the country.
example.tran: 这个话题举国上下的学者都非常关切。

collins.tran: (用于表示喜爱或带有屈尊俯就意味的称呼中）亲爱的;小…
collins.def: You use dear in expressions such as 'my dear fellow', 'dear girl', or 'my dear Richard' when you are addressing someone whom you know and are fond of. You can also use expressions like this in a rude way to indicate that you think you are superior to the person you are addressing.

example.ex: Of course, Toby, my dear fellow, of course...
example.tran: 当然，托比，我亲爱的朋友，当然。

example.ex: Take as long as you like, dear boy.
example.tran: 小伙子，随你花多长时间都行。

collins.tran: (用于信函抬头的名字或头衔前）亲爱的，尊敬的
collins.def: Dear is written at the beginning of a letter, followed by the name or title of the person you are writing to.

example.ex: Dear Peter, I have been thinking about you so much during the past few days...
example.tran: 亲爱的彼得，过去的这几天里我一直都在想你。

collins.tran: 尊敬的先生/尊敬的女士(英国英语中用于正式信函的开头，美国英语中则用 Sir 或 Madam)
collins.def: In British English, you begin formal letters with 'Dear Sir' or 'Dear Madam'. In American English, you begin them with 'Sir' or 'Madam'.

example.ex: 'Dear sir,' she began.
example.tran: “尊敬的先生，”她开头写道。

collins.def: You can call someone dear as a sign of affection.

example.ex: You're a lot like me, dear...
example.tran: 亲爱的，你很多地方都很像我。

example.ex: 'Good night, my dears,' she called to us as we closed her door behind us.
example.tran: “晚安，我亲爱的孩子们，”我们关上她的房门时她对我们说道。

collins.tran: (表示伤心、失望或吃惊）啊呀，哎哟，天哪
collins.def: You can use dear in expressions such as 'oh dear', 'dear me', and 'dear, dear' when you are sad, disappointed, or surprised about something.

example.ex: 'Oh dear, oh dear.' McKinnon sighed. 'You, too.'
example.tran: “哎呀，哎呀！”麦金农叹息道，“你也一样。”

example.ex: Outside, Bruce glanced at his watch: 'Dear me, nearly one o'clock.'
example.tran: 出了门，布鲁斯瞥了一眼自己的手表，“天哪，快一点了。”

collins.def: You can call someone a dear when you are fond of them and think that they are nice.

example.ex: He's such a dear.
example.tran: 他人真好。

collins.def: If you say that something is dear, you mean that it costs a lot of money, usually more than you can afford or more than you think it should cost.

example.ex: CDs here are much dearer than in the States...
example.tran: 这儿的 CD 价格比美国那边贵多了。

example.ex: They're too dear.
example.tran: 它们的价格太高了。

collins.tran: 使…付出巨大代价;使…饱尝苦头
collins.def: If something that someone does costs them dear, they suffer a lot as a result of it.

example.ex: Such complacency is costing the company dear.
example.tran: 这种自满情绪正使公司付出沉重代价。

collins.def: You use actual to emphasize that you are referring to something real or genuine.

example.ex: The segments are filmed using either local actors or the actual people involved...
example.tran: 这些片断是由当地的演员或真实的当事人参与拍摄的。

example.ex: Officials admit the actual number of AIDS victims is much higher than statistics reflect.
example.tran: 官员们承认艾滋病患者的实际数量比统计所显示的数字要大得多。

collins.tran: （用于对比主次方面）真正的，实际的
collins.def: You use actual to contrast the important aspect of something with a less important aspect.

example.ex: She had compiled pages of notes, but she had not yet gotten down to doing the actual writing...
example.tran: 她已编写了数页注释，但还未开始真正意义上的写作。

example.ex: The exercises in this chapter can guide you, but it will be up to you to do the actual work.
example.tran: 这一章的练习能给你指导，但实际的工作还得靠你自己完成。

collins.def: An offence is a crime that breaks a particular law and requires a particular punishment.

example.ex: Thirteen people have been charged with treason — an offence which can carry the death penalty...
example.tran: 13人被控犯有叛国罪——一种可处死刑的罪行。

example.ex: In Britain the Consumer Protection Act makes it a criminal offence to sell goods that are unsafe.
example.tran: 英国的《消费者保护法》规定销售不安全物品属刑事犯罪行为。

collins.def: Offence or an offence is behaviour which causes people to be upset or embarrassed.

example.ex: The book might be published without creating offense...
example.tran: 出版这本书可能不会引起人们的反感。

example.ex: Privilege determined by birth is an offence to any modern sense of justice.
example.tran: 与生俱来的特权是对现代公正意识的亵渎。

collins.tran: （体育运动中的）进攻队，进攻方
collins.def: In sports such as American football or basketball, the offense is the team which has possession of the ball and is trying to score.

example.ex: Between plays the coach was talking to the offense in the huddle.
example.tran: 中场时，这位教练对围拢一圈的进攻队员进行战术指导。

collins.def: If you cause offence or give offence to someone, you say or do something rude which upsets or embarrasses them.

example.ex: It says the photograph is likely cause distress and offence to the public...
example.tran: 上面说这张照片可能引起公众的忧虑和反感。

example.ex: We have had our differences and I'm sorry if it has caused offence.
example.tran: 我们有过一些分歧，如有得罪我很抱歉。

collins.def: Some people say 'no offence' to make it clear that they do not want to upset you, although what they are saying may seem rather rude.

example.ex: Dad, you need a bath. No offence.
example.tran: 爸爸，别见怪，不过你该洗澡了。

collins.tran: （常指不必要地）(对…)生气，(因…)见怪
collins.def: If someone takes offence at something you say or do, they feel upset, often unnecessarily, because they think you are being rude to them.

example.ex: She never takes offence at anything...
example.tran: 什么事都不会让她生气。

example.ex: Never had she seen him so tense, so quick to take offence as he had been in recent weeks.
example.tran: 她从未见过他像最近几周这样高度紧张，动不动就生气。

collins.def: If you criticize someone or something, you express your disapproval of them by saying what you think is wrong with them.

example.ex: His mother had rarely criticized him or any of her children...
example.tran: 他母亲很少指责他或她的任何孩子。

example.ex: The minister criticised the police for failing to come up with any leads...
example.tran: 部长批评警方没能找到任何线索。

collins.def: Make-up consists of things such as lipstick, eye shadow, and powder which some women put on their faces to make themselves look more attractive or which actors use to change or improve their appearance.

example.ex: Normally she wore little make-up...
example.tran: 她一般不怎么化妆。

example.ex: She checked her makeup one last time, and then walked out with a spring in her step.
example.tran: 她最后检查了一下妆容，然后步履轻盈地走了出去。

collins.def: Some-one's make-up is their nature and the various qualities in their character.

example.ex: There was some fatal flaw in his makeup, and as time went on he lapsed into long silences or became off-hand.
example.tran: 他的性格有致命的缺陷，随着时间的推移，他陷入了久久的沉默，或者变得漠然。

collins.def: The make-up of something consists of its different parts and the way these parts are arranged.

example.ex: The ideological make-up of the unions is now radically different from what it had been.
example.tran: 协会的思想观念与过去截然不同。

example.ex: ...the chemical make-up of the oceans and atmosphere.
example.tran: 海洋与大气的化学构造

collins.def: A secretary is a person who is employed to do office work, such as typing letters, answering phone calls, and arranging meetings.

collins.tran: (工会、政党、俱乐部等的)干事,书记员
collins.def: The secretary of an organization such as a trade union, a political party, or a club is its official manager.

example.ex: My grandfather was secretary of the Scottish Miners' Union.
example.tran: 我的祖父是苏格兰矿工工会干事。

collins.def: The secretary of a company is the person who has the legal duty of keeping the company's records.
Secretary is used in the titles of ministers and officials who are in charge of main government departments.

example.ex: ...the British Foreign Secretary.
example.tran: 英国外交大臣

example.ex: ...Defense Secretary Caspar Weinberger.
example.tran: 国防部长卡斯珀·温伯格

collins.def: A warning is something which is said or written to tell people of a possible danger, problem, or other unpleasant thing that might happen.

example.ex: The minister gave a warning that if war broke out, it would be catastrophic...
example.tran: 部长警告说，战争一旦爆发将会是灾难性的。

example.ex: He was killed because he ignored a warning to put stronger cords on his parachute...
example.tran: 他忽视了降落伞上要求使用更结实的绳索的警告信息，因而命丧黄泉。

collins.def: A warning is an advance notice of something that will happen, often something unpleasant or dangerous.

example.ex: The soldiers opened fire without warning...
example.tran: 士兵们在没有发出警告的情况下开了枪。

example.ex: With no warning, he was fired from his job...
example.tran: 他没有受到任何警告，就被解雇了。

collins.def: Warning actions or signs give a warning.

example.ex: She ignored the warning signals...
example.tran: 她忽视了一些预警信号。

example.ex: Some fog warning signs had been put up with flashing yellow lights.
example.tran: 一些配有黄色闪光灯的大雾警示标志立了起来。

collins.tran: （尤指在钱财上）慷慨的，大方的
collins.def: A generous person gives more of something, especially money, than is usual or expected.

example.ex: German banks are more generous in their lending...
example.tran: 德国银行的借贷条件更为宽松。

example.ex: The gift is generous by any standards.
example.tran: 无论以哪个标准来衡量，这都是一份厚礼。

collins.tran: 宽厚的；仁慈的；宽宏大量的
collins.def: A generous person is friendly, helpful, and willing to see the good qualities in someone or something.

example.ex: He was always generous in sharing his enormous knowledge...
example.tran: 他从不吝啬与人分享自己渊博的知识。

example.ex: He was generous enough to congratulate his successor on his decision.
example.tran: 他十分大度地祝贺他的继任者做出了决定。

collins.def: A generous amount of something is much larger than is usual or necessary.

example.ex: ...a generous six weeks of annual holiday...
example.tran: 充裕的6个星期长的年假

example.ex: He should be able to keep his room tidy with the generous amount of storage space.
example.tran: 有那么宽绰的储物空间，他应该可以保持房间的整齐。

means: 选购：为寻找商品或便宜货而逛商店
到处寻找：为得到某物而寻找它
逛（某一个商店）或（在某一个商店）买东西

collins.def: When you do the shopping, you go to shops and buy things.

example.ex: I'll do the shopping this afternoon.
example.tran: 今天下午我会去买东西。

collins.tran: 从商店购买来的东西(尤指食品)
collins.def: Your shopping is the things that you have bought from shops, especially food.

example.ex: We put the shopping away.
example.tran: 我们把买回来的东西放好。

collins.def: Soil is the substance on the surface of the earth in which plants grow.

example.ex: We have the most fertile soil in Europe.
example.tran: 我们拥有欧洲最肥沃的土地。

example.ex: ...regions with sandy soils.
example.tran: 沙土地区

collins.def: You can use soil in expressions like British soil to refer to a country's territory.

example.ex: The issue of foreign troops on Turkish soil is a sensitive one.
example.tran: 在土耳其领土上驻扎外国军队这个问题非常敏感。

collins.def: If you soil something, you make it dirty.

example.ex: Young people don't want to do things that soil their hands...
example.tran: 年轻人不愿做那些容易弄脏手的事情。

example.ex: He raised his eyes slightly as though her words might somehow soil him.
example.tran: 他略略地抬了抬眼皮，仿佛她的话会不小心玷污了他。

means: 将滑艇拖到小屋前面的岸边

collins.def: A beach is an area of sand or stones beside the sea.

example.ex: ...a beautiful sandy beach...
example.tran: 美丽的沙滩

example.ex: I just want to lie on the beach in the sun.
example.tran: 我只想躺在海滩上晒晒太阳。

collins.def: If something such as a boat beaches, or if it is beached, it is pulled or forced out of the water and onto land.

example.ex: We beached the canoe, running it right up the bank...
example.tran: 我们把独木舟径直划到岸边，并拖上岸。

example.ex: The boat beached on a mud flat...
example.tran: 船搁浅在一片淤泥滩上。

collins.def: If you weaken something or if it weakens, it becomes less strong or less powerful.

example.ex: The recession has weakened so many firms that many can no longer survive...
example.tran: 经济衰退使许多公司实力大损，不少难以为继。

example.ex: The Prime Minister's opponents believe that her authority has been fatally weakened...
example.tran: 首相的反对者认为她的权威已经受到致命削弱。

collins.def: If your resolve weakens or if something weakens it, you become less determined or less certain about taking a particular course of action that you had previously decided to take.

example.ex: I looked at the list and felt my resolve weakening...
example.tran: 我看着名单，觉得自己的决心正在动摇。

example.ex: Jennie weakened, and finally relented...
example.tran: 詹妮的态度有所缓和，最终软了下来。

collins.def: If something weakens you, it causes you to lose some of your physical strength.

example.ex: Malnutrition obviously weakens the patient.
example.tran: 营养不良明显导致病人身体虚弱。

collins.def: If something weakens an object, it does something to it which causes it to become less firm and more likely to break.

example.ex: A bomb blast had weakened an area of brick on the back wall...
example.tran: 一颗炸弹爆炸使后墙的一片砖发生了松动。

example.ex: Never dry underwear over direct heat; it will weaken the fabric.
example.tran: 不要直接加热烘干内衣，那样会损坏布料。

collins.def: A musician is a person who plays a musical instrument as their job or hobby.

example.ex: He was a brilliant musician.
example.tran: 他是一位才华横溢的音乐家。

example.ex: ...one of Britain's best known rock musicians.
example.tran: 英国最知名的摇滚乐手之一

means: 永久（性）的，永恒的，不变的，耐久的，持久的，经久的

collins.def: Something that is permanent lasts for ever.

example.ex: Heavy drinking can cause permanent damage to the brain...
example.tran: 酗酒能造成永久性大脑损伤。

example.ex: ...a permanent solution to the problem...
example.tran: 该问题一劳永逸的解决办法

collins.tran: （尤指问题或困难）不断出现的，一直存在的
collins.def: You use permanent to describe situations or states that keep occurring or which seem to exist all the time; used especially to describe problems or difficulties.

example.ex: ...a permanent state of tension...
example.tran: 长久以来的紧张局势

example.ex: They feel under permanent threat...
example.tran: 他们觉得一直处于威胁之下。

collins.def: A permanent employee is one who is employed for an unlimited length of time.

example.ex: At the end of the probationary period you will become a permanent employee.
example.tran: 试用期结束后,你将成为长期雇员。

example.ex: ...a permanent job.
example.tran: 固定工作

collins.def: Your permanent home or your permanent address is the one at which you spend most of your time or the one that you return to after having stayed in other places.

example.ex: York Cottage was as near to a permanent home as the children knew...
example.tran: 在孩子们眼中,约克小屋最像一个安定的家。

example.ex: They had no permanent address.
example.tran: 他们没有固定居所。

collins.def: A permanent is a treatment where a hair stylist curls your hair and treats it with a chemical so that it stays curly for several months.
If a country holds a referendum on a particular policy, they ask the people to vote on the policy and show whether or not they agree with it.

example.ex: Estonia said it too planned to hold a referendum on independence.
example.tran: 爱沙尼亚称其也计划就独立问题进行全民公决。

means: 以某种方式，用某种方法
<非正>不知怎么地，不知道怎样，不晓得什么缘故

collins.tran: 不知怎样;用某种方法;不知什么缘故;不知怎的
collins.def: You use somehow to say that you do not know or cannot say how something was done or will be done.

example.ex: We'll  manage somehow, you and me. I know we will...
example.tran: 我和你，我们总能应付过去的。我知道我们会的。

example.ex: Channel 4 arrived and somehow created a different role for television...
example.tran: 第四频道开播了，它在某种程度上为电视创造了一个不同的角色。

collins.tran: 独立电视公司(英国的一个商业电视集团)
collins.def: ITV refers to the group of British commercial television companies that broadcasts programmes on one channel. ITV is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'Independent Television'.

example.ex: ITV has set its sights on winning a younger and more upmarket audience.
example.tran: 独立电视公司已着眼于赢得更年轻、更高端的观众群。

collins.def: ITV is the television channel that is run by ITV.

example.ex: The first episode will be shown tomorrow at 10.40pm on ITV.
example.tran: 第一集将于明晚 10 点 40 分在独立电视频道播出。

example.ex: ...ITV viewers.
example.tran: 独立电视频道的观众

collins.def: A van is a small or medium-sized road vehicle with one row of seats at the front and a space for carrying goods behind.
A van is a railway carriage, often without windows, which is used to carry luggage, goods, or mail.

example.ex: In the guard's van lay my tin trunk.
example.tran: 我的铁皮箱放在了卫兵的行李车厢中。

collins.def: A hill is an area of land that is higher than the land that surrounds it.

example.ex: We trudged up the hill to the stadium.
example.tran: 我们费力地爬到山上的体育场。

example.ex: ...Maple Hill.
example.tran: 梅普尔山

collins.tran: 人老珠黄;在走下坡路;在衰退中;过气
collins.def: If you say that someone is over the hill, you are saying rudely that they are old and no longer fit, attractive, or capable of doing useful work.

example.ex: He doesn't take kindly to suggestions that he is over the hill.
example.tran: 他不爱听别人说他风光不再。

collins.def: A designer is a person whose job is to design things by making drawings of them.

example.ex: Carolyne is a fashion designer.
example.tran: 卡罗琳是一名时装设计师。

collins.tran: (服装、品牌等)由著名设计师设计的，标有设计师姓名的
collins.def: Designer clothes or designer labels are expensive, fashionable clothes made by a famous designer, rather than being made in large quantities in a factory.

example.ex: He wears designer clothes and drives an antique car...
example.tran: 他穿着著名设计师设计的服装，开着一部古董车。

example.ex: People want to buy designer labels for snob value.
example.tran: 人们想买名牌是为了满足虚荣心。

collins.def: You can use designer to describe things that are worn or bought because they are fashionable.

example.ex: Tousled hair and designer stubble are chic...
example.tran: 乱蓬蓬的头发和时兴的胡茬都很新潮。

example.ex: Designer beers and trendy wines have replaced the good old British pint.
example.tran: 时尚的啤酒和流行的葡萄酒已经取代了老牌的英国啤酒。

collins.def: Pepper is a hot-tasting spice which is used to flavour food.

example.ex: Season with salt and pepper.
example.tran: 用盐和胡椒调味。

example.ex: ...freshly ground black pepper.
example.tran: 新磨的黑胡椒粉

collins.def: A pepper, or in American English a bell pepper, is a hollow green, red, or yellow vegetable with seeds inside it.

collins.tran: （小物体）密集地击打，连续击打
collins.def: If something is peppered with small objects, a lot of those objects hit it.

example.ex: He was wounded in both legs and severely peppered with shrapnel...
example.tran: 他两条腿都挂彩了，人也被如雨的弹片炸成重伤。

example.ex: Suddenly the garden was peppered with pellets.
example.tran: 突然间花园遭到扫射。

collins.def: If something is peppered with things, it has a lot of those things in it or on it.

example.ex: While her English was correct, it was peppered with French phrases...
example.tran: 她的英语语法上没错，但是里面夹杂着很多法语短语。

example.ex: Outside, the road was peppered with glass...
example.tran: 屋外，马路上尽是些玻璃碴。

means: 不常见的，不普通的，难得的，罕有的
异乎寻常的，例外的，奇异的

collins.tran: 不寻常的；不常见的；罕见的
collins.def: If something is unusual, it does not happen very often or you do not see it or hear it very often.

example.ex: They have replanted many areas with rare and unusual plants...
example.tran: 他们在许多地方重新种上了珍稀植物。

example.ex: To be appreciated as a parent is quite unusual.
example.tran: 可怜天下父母心。

collins.tran: 异于常人的；与众不同的；不同凡响的
collins.def: If you describe someone as unusual, you think that they are interesting and different from other people.

example.ex: He was an unusual man with great business talents.
example.tran: 此人不同凡响，具有异常敏锐的商业头脑。

collins.def: If you cancel something that has been arranged, you stop it from happening. If you cancel an order for goods or services, you tell the person or organization supplying them that you no longer wish to receive them.

example.ex: The Russian foreign minister yesterday cancelled his visit to Washington...
example.tran: 俄罗斯外交部长昨天取消了对华盛顿的访问。

example.ex: Many trains have been cancelled and a limited service is operating on other lines...
example.tran: 多趟列车被取消,其他线路上运行的班次也很有限。

collins.tran: 废除,废止(文件、保险单);免除(债务)
collins.def: If someone in authority cancels a document, an insurance policy, or a debt, they officially declare that it is no longer valid or no longer legally exists.

example.ex: He intends to try to leave the country, in spite of a government order cancelling his passport...
example.tran: 尽管政府已经下令吊销他的护照，他还是试图要离开该国。

example.ex: She learned her insurance had been canceled by Pacific Mutual Insurance Company...
example.tran: 她得知自己的保险已经被太平洋互助保险公司中止了。

collins.def: To cancel a stamp or a cheque means to mark it to show that it has already been used and cannot be used again.

example.ex: The new device can also cancel the check after the transaction is complete.
example.tran: 交易完成后,这种新设备也能注销支票。

example.ex: ...cancelled stamps.
example.tran: 盖销（邮）票

collins.def: Butter is a soft yellow substance made from cream. You spread it on bread or use it in cooking.

example.ex: ...bread and butter...
example.tran: 面包和黄油

example.ex: Pour the melted butter into a large mixing bowl.
example.tran: 把熔化的黄油倒在一个搅拌用的大碗里。

collins.def: If you butter something such as bread or toast, you spread butter on it.

example.ex: She spread pieces of bread on the counter and began buttering them.
example.tran: 她把几片面包摆在台上，开始抹黄油。

example.ex: ...buttered scones.
example.tran: 抹过黄油的烤饼

collins.tran: 明白自己的利益所在；善于为自己打算
collins.def: If you say that someone knows what side their bread is buttered on, you mean that they know what to do or who to please in order to stay in a good situation or to avoid a bad one.

example.ex: These chaps know what side their bread's buttered on.
example.tran: 这些家伙知道怎样做对他们有利。

means: 使…向远方延伸，把…延展到远处

collins.def: Remote areas are far away from cities and places where most people live, and are therefore difficult to get to.

example.ex: Landslides have cut off many villages in remote areas.
example.tran: 滑坡使边远地区的许多村庄与外界隔绝。

example.ex: ...a remote farm in the Yorkshire dales.
example.tran: 位于约克郡山谷的一个偏僻的农场

collins.def: The remote past or remote future is a time that is many years distant from the present.

example.ex: Slabs of rock had slipped sideways in the remote past, and formed this hole.
example.tran: 在久远的过去，岩石板滑落到周边，从而形成了这个洞。

collins.tran: 关系不紧密的;关系疏远的;相距甚远的
collins.def: If something is remote from a particular subject or area of experience, it is not relevant to it because it is very different.

example.ex: This government depends on the wishes of a few who are remote from the people...
example.tran: 这个政府按照远离民众的少数人的意愿行事。

example.ex: Teenagers are forced to study subjects that seem remote from their daily lives.
example.tran: 青少年被迫学习和他们的日常生活关系不大的学科。

collins.tran: (可能性或机会)渺茫的，微乎其微的
collins.def: If you say that there is a remote possibility or chance that something will happen, you are emphasizing that there is only a very small chance that it will happen.

example.ex: I use a sunscreen whenever there is even a remote possibility that I will be in the sun...
example.tran: 不论何时只要有一点可能暴露在阳光下，我就会用防晒霜。

example.ex: The chances of his surviving are pretty remote.
example.tran: 他生还的机会非常渺茫。

collins.tran: 冷漠的;冷淡的;与人疏远的;清高的
collins.def: If you describe someone as remote, you mean that they behave as if they do not want to be friendly or closely involved with other people.

example.ex: She looked so beautiful, and at the same time so remote.
example.tran: 她相貌如此美丽，同时又如此清高不群。

collins.def: If you sacrifice something that is valuable or important, you give it up, usually to obtain something else for yourself or for other people.

example.ex: She sacrificed family life to her career...
example.tran: 她为事业舍弃了家庭。

example.ex: Her husband's pride was a small thing to sacrifice for their children's security...
example.tran: 为了孩子们的安全，舍弃她丈夫的尊严不算什么。

collins.def: To sacrifice an animal or person means to kill them in a special religious ceremony as an offering to a god.

example.ex: The priest sacrificed a chicken...
example.tran: 祭司用一只鸡作祭品。

example.ex: Two white bulls were sacrificed and a feast was held.
example.tran: 献祭了两头白牛，并举行了盛宴。

means: （就某事与某人）达成协议，（与某人）商定（某事）(with a person about 或 for a thing)

collins.def: If you arrange an event or meeting, you make plans for it to happen.

example.ex: She arranged an appointment for Friday afternoon at four-fifteen...
example.tran: 她在星期五下午4点15分安排了一次会面。

example.ex: This time it was a friend ringing to try to arrange a fishing trip in Scotland...
example.tran: 这次是一个朋友打来电话，想组织一次到苏格兰的钓鱼旅行。

collins.def: If you arrange with someone to do something, you make plans with them to do it.

example.ex: I've arranged to see him on Friday morning...
example.tran: 我已安排好星期五上午见他。

example.ex: It was arranged that the party would gather for lunch in the Royal Garden Hotel...
example.tran: 已经和这一行人说好将在皇家花园宾馆吃午餐。

collins.def: If you arrange something for someone, you make it possible for them to have it or to do it.

example.ex: I will arrange for someone to take you round...
example.tran: 我会安排人带你转转。

example.ex: The hotel manager will arrange for a babysitter...
example.tran: 宾馆经理会安排人照看婴儿。

collins.def: If you arrange things somewhere, you place them in a particular position, usually in order to make them look attractive or tidy.

example.ex: When she has a little spare time she enjoys arranging dried flowers...
example.tran: 她稍有空闲便喜欢摆弄干花。

example.ex: He started to arrange the books in piles...
example.tran: 他开始将书成堆摆放。

collins.def: If a piece of music is arranged by someone, it is changed or adapted so that it is suitable for particular instruments or voices, or for a particular performance.

example.ex: The songs were arranged by another well-known bass player, Ron Carter.
example.tran: 另一位著名的低音提琴演奏家罗恩·卡特改编了这些歌曲。

collins.def: Found is the past tense and past participle of find .
When an institution, company, or organization is founded by someone or by a group of people, they get it started, often by providing the necessary money.

example.ex: The Independent Labour Party was founded in Bradford on January 13, 1893...
example.tran: 独立工党1893年1月13日在布拉德福德成立。

example.ex: He founded the Centre for Journalism Studies at University College Cardiff...
example.tran: 他在加的夫大学学院成立了新闻学研究中心。

collins.def: When a town, important building, or other place is founded by someone or by a group of people, they cause it to be built.

example.ex: The town was founded in 1610.
example.tran: 这个镇建于 1610 年。

collins.tran: 激烈的；猛烈的；充满敌意的
collins.def: In a bitter argument or conflict, people argue very angrily or fight very fiercely.

example.ex: ...the scene of bitter fighting during the Second World War.
example.tran: 第二次世界大战期间激烈的战斗场面

example.ex: ...a bitter attack on the Government's failure to support manufacturing...
example.tran: 对政府支持制造业不力的猛烈抨击

collins.def: If someone is bitter after a disappointing experience or after being treated unfairly, they continue to feel angry about it.

example.ex: She is said to be very bitter about the way she was sacked...
example.tran: 据说，她对自己被以如此方式解雇而感到愤愤不平。

example.ex: His long life was marked by bitter personal and political memories.
example.tran: 他漫长的一生充满了关于个人生活和政治生涯的苦涩记忆。

collins.tran: （经历或感觉）令人非常失望的，痛苦的，辛酸的
collins.def: A bitter experience makes you feel very disappointed. You can also use bitter to emphasize feelings of disappointment.

example.ex: I think the decision was a bitter blow from which he never quite recovered...
example.tran: 我想这个决定对他是个沉重的打击，从此以后他一蹶不振。

example.ex: A great deal of bitter experience had taught him how to lose gracefully...
example.tran: 大量惨痛的经历让他学会了如何坦然面对失败。

collins.def: Bitter weather, or a bitter wind, is extremely cold.

example.ex: Outside, a bitter east wind was accompanied by flurries of snow.
example.tran: 外面，刺骨的东风伴着阵阵小雪。

example.ex: ...after spending a night in the bitter cold.
example.tran: 在严寒中度过一夜之后

collins.def: A bitter taste is sharp, not sweet, and often slightly unpleasant.

example.ex: The leaves taste rather bitter.
example.tran: 这些叶子味道相当苦。

example.ex: ...as the wine ages, losing its bitter harshness, and becoming softer and smoother.
example.tran: 年深日久，酒会褪去辣味，口感变得醇和起来

collins.def: Bitter is a kind of beer that is light brown in colour.

example.ex: ...a pint of bitter.
example.tran: 一品脱苦啤酒

collins.def: If you say that you will continue doing something to the bitter end, especially something difficult or unpleasant, you are emphasizing that you will continue doing it until it is completely finished.

example.ex: The guerrillas would fight to the bitter end, he said, in order to achieve their main goal.
example.tran: 他说，游击队员会为实现主要目标而战斗到底。

collins.def: If you install a piece of equipment, you fit it or put it somewhere so that it is ready to be used.

example.ex: They had installed a new phone line in the apartment.
example.tran: 他们已经在公寓里装上了新的电话线。

collins.def: If someone is installed in a new job or important position, they are officially given the job or position, often in a special ceremony.

example.ex: A new Catholic bishop was installed in Galway yesterday...
example.tran: 昨天在戈尔韦任命了一位新的天主教主教。

example.ex: Professor Sawyer was formally installed as President last Thursday...
example.tran: 索耶教授上周四被正式任命为校长。

collins.def: If you install yourself in a particular place, you settle there and make yourself comfortable.

example.ex: Before her husband's death she had installed herself in a modern villa.
example.tran: 丈夫去世之前她已经在一所现代化别墅里安顿下来了。

collins.def: If you are made-up, you are wearing make-up such as powder or eye shadow.

example.ex: She was made-up and ready to go...
example.tran: 她化好妆，准备出发。

example.ex: She was beautifully made-up, beautifully groomed...
example.tran: 她妆容艳丽，服饰华美。

collins.def: A made-up word, name, or story is invented, rather than really existing or being true.

example.ex: It looks like a made-up word.
example.tran: 这个词似乎是自造的。

collins.def: If you are made-up, you are happy.

example.ex: I'll be made up if I get in the top five, that would be great.
example.tran: 要是能进入前五名我会非常高兴，那样就太好了。

collins.def: A rally is a large public meeting that is held in order to show support for something such as a political party.

example.ex: About three thousand people held a rally to mark international human rights day...
example.tran: 大约3,000人举行了一场大会来庆祝国际人权日。

example.ex: Supporters of the policy are reported to be gathering in Delhi for a mass rally.
example.tran: 有报道说这项政策的拥护者要齐聚德里召开群众集会。

collins.def: When people rally to something or when something rallies them, they unite to support it.

example.ex: His supporters have rallied to his defence...
example.tran: 他的拥护者团结起来为他辩护。

example.ex: He rallied his own supporters for a fight.
example.tran: 他把自己的拥护者召集起来准备斗争。

collins.def: When someone or something rallies, they begin to recover or improve after having been weak.

example.ex: He rallied enough to thank his doctors...
example.tran: 他身体好得差不多了，于是去感谢他的医生。

example.ex: Markets began to rally worldwide.
example.tran: 世界各地的市场开始复苏。

collins.def: A rally is a competition in which vehicles are driven over public roads.

example.ex: Carlos Sainz of Spain has won the New Zealand Motor Rally.
example.tran: 西班牙人卡洛斯·赛恩斯在新西兰摩托车公路大赛中夺冠。

example.ex: ...an accomplished rally driver.
example.tran: 技术精湛的公路赛车手

collins.tran: （网球、羽毛球、壁球等的）连续对打
collins.def: A rally in tennis, badminton, or squash is a continuous series of shots that the players exchange without stopping.

example.ex: ...a long rally.
example.tran: 长时间的连续对打

collins.tran: (相互之间的)友谊，友情，朋友关系
collins.def: A friendship is a relationship between two or more friends.

example.ex: Giving advice when it's not called for is the quickest way to end a good friendship...
example.tran: 在别人不需要的时候提供建议是葬送好友关系的最快方式。

example.ex: She struck up a close friendship with Desiree during the week of rehearsals...
example.tran: 在排练的一周里她和德西蕾建立了亲密的友谊。

collins.def: You use friendship to refer in a general way to the state of being friends, or the feelings that friends have for each other.

example.ex: ...a hobby which led to a whole new world of friendship and adventure.
example.tran: 打开了一片充满友谊和冒险的全新天地的爱好

collins.def: If you have someone's friendship, they are your friend.

example.ex: He had the friendship of Terry Jones and the respect of John Cleese...
example.tran: 他得到了特里·琼斯的友谊和约翰·克利斯的尊敬。

example.ex: Steve really values your friendship more than anything else.
example.tran: 史蒂夫真的把你的友谊看得比其他任何东西都重要。

collins.def: Friendship is a relationship between two countries in which they help and support each other.

example.ex: The President set the targets for the future to promote friendship with East Europe...
example.tran: 总统确定了在未来加强同东欧的互助的目标。

example.ex: They were reaching out the hand of friendship to their former adversaries of the Cold War...
example.tran: 他们向从前冷战时期的对手伸出友谊之手。

collins.def: If you opt for something, or opt to do something, you choose it or decide to do it in preference to anything else.

example.ex: Depending on your circumstances you may wish to opt for one method or the other...
example.tran: 依据自身情况的不同，你可能希望选择这种或那种方法。

example.ex: Our students can also opt to stay in residence.
example.tran: 我们的学生也可以选择住校。

means: （木偶的）牵线，操纵绳，背后操纵的势力，秘密引线，秘密策略

collins.def: A wire is a long thin piece of metal that is used to fasten things or to carry electric current.

example.ex: ...fine copper wire.
example.tran: 细铜丝

example.ex: ...gadgets which detect electrical wires, pipes and timbers in walls.
example.tran: 探测墙内电线、管道和木材的小装置

collins.def: A wire is a cable which carries power or signals from one place to another.

example.ex: I ripped out the telephone wire that ran through to his office.
example.tran: 我把通到他办公室的电话线拔掉了。

example.ex: ...the voltage of the overhead wires.
example.tran: 头顶上方电线的电压

collins.def: If you wire something such as a building or piece of equipment, you put wires inside it so that electricity or signals can pass into or through it.

example.ex: ...learning to wire and plumb the house herself...
example.tran: 她学着自己给房子布线走管

example.ex: Lamps should be safely wired...
example.tran: 电灯布线要安全稳妥。

collins.def: A wire is the same as a telegram .
If you wire a person, you send them a telegram.

example.ex: He wired the chairman immediately...
example.tran: 他马上给主席发了电报。

example.ex: They wired back a long list of books...
example.tran: 他们用电报发回了一长串书单。

collins.def: If you wire an amount of money to a person or place, you tell a bank to send it to the person or place using a telegram message.

example.ex: I'm wiring you some money...
example.tran: 我要给你汇些钱。

example.ex: They arranged to wire the money from the United States...
example.tran: 他们安排从美国汇款。

collins.def: If something goes to the wire, it continues until the last possible moment.

example.ex: Negotiators again worked right down to the wire to reach an agreement.
example.tran: 谈判人员又是直到最后时刻才达成了协议。

collins.def: When a hot liquid boils or when you boil it, bubbles appear in it and it starts to change into steam or vapour.

example.ex: I stood in the kitchen, waiting for the water to boil...
example.tran: 我站在厨房，等着水烧开。

example.ex: Boil the water in the saucepan and add the sage...
example.tran: 把平底锅里的水烧开，然后加入鼠尾草。

collins.tran: 使（水壶或锅里的水）烧开
collins.def: When you boil a kettle or pan, or put it on to boil, you heat the water inside it until it boils.

example.ex: He had nothing to do but boil the kettle and make the tea...
example.tran: 他除了烧水沏茶以外无事可做。

example.ex: Marianne put the kettle on to boil.
example.tran: 玛丽安娜放上水壶烧开水。

collins.tran: （水壶或平底锅里的水）烧开，沸腾
collins.def: When a kettle or pan is boiling, the water inside it has reached boiling point.

example.ex: Is the kettle boiling?
example.tran: 壶里的水开了吗？

collins.def: When you boil food, or when it boils, it is cooked in boiling water.

example.ex: Boil the chick peas, add garlic and lemon juice...
example.tran: 把鹰嘴豆放在开水中煮，并加入大蒜和柠檬汁。

example.ex: I'd peel potatoes and put them on to boil.
example.tran: 我要削掉土豆皮然后把它们煮熟。

collins.def: If you are boiling with anger, you are very angry.

example.ex: I used to be all sweetness and light on the outside, but inside I would be boiling with rage.
example.tran: 我过去常常是外表看上去轻松愉快，而内心却怒火中烧。

collins.def: A boil is a red, painful swelling on your skin, which contains a thick yellow liquid called pus.
When you bring a liquid to the boil, you heat it until it boils. When it comes to the boil, it begins to boil.

example.ex: Put water, butter and lard into a saucepan and bring slowly to the boil.
example.tran: 把水、黄油和猪油倒入平底锅，然后慢火煮沸。

collins.def: A substance is a solid, powder, liquid, or gas with particular properties.

example.ex: There's absolutely no regulation of cigarettes to make sure that they don't include poisonous substances...
example.tran: 根本没有法规来确保香烟不含有毒物质。

example.ex: The substance that's causing the problem comes from the barley.
example.tran: 引起该问题的物质来自大麦。

collins.def: Substance is the quality of being important or significant.

example.ex: It's questionable whether anything of substance has been achieved...
example.tran: 是否已经取得了任何实质性进展还是个问题。

example.ex: Syria will attend only if the negotiations deal with issues of substance.
example.tran: 只有在谈判涉及重大问题时叙利亚才会参加。

collins.tran: 主旨;要点;实质;基本内容
collins.def: The substance of what someone says or writes is the main thing that they are trying to say.

example.ex: The substance of his discussions doesn't really matter.
example.tran: 他讨论的要点实际上根本不重要。

collins.def: If you say that something has no substance, you mean that it is not true.

example.ex: There is no substance in any of these allegations.
example.tran: 这些指控都毫无根据。

collins.tran: 财力雄厚的;有权有势的；有影响力的
collins.def: A person of substance has a lot of money, power, or influence.

example.ex: ...mature men of substance.
example.tran: 有钱有势的成熟男人

means: 表情，脸色，态度，腔调，声调

collins.def: The expression of ideas or feelings is the showing of them through words, actions, or artistic activities.

example.ex: Laughter is one of the most infectious expressions of emotion...
example.tran: 笑是最具感染力的情感表达方式之一。

example.ex: From Cairo came expressions of regret at the attack.
example.tran: 开罗对此次攻击表示遗憾。

collins.def: Your expression is the way that your face looks at a particular moment. It shows what you are thinking or feeling.

example.ex: The civil servant's expression, however, did not change, not so much as by a flicker...
example.tran: 然而，那位公务员的表情还是那样，丝毫没变。

example.ex: Levin sat there, an expression of sadness on his face...
example.tran: 莱文坐在那里，神情悲伤。

collins.tran: （表演、歌唱或演奏时的）情感表现
collins.def: Expression is the showing of feeling when you are acting, singing, or playing a musical instrument.

example.ex: I don't sing perfectly in tune, but I think I put more expression into my lyrics than a lot of other singers do.
example.tran: 我唱歌不是特别合拍，但我认为我唱得比其他很多歌手都更富感情。

collins.def: An expression is a word or phrase.

example.ex: She spoke in a quiet voice but used remarkably coarse expressions.
example.tran: 她说话声音很小，但是用了些特别粗俗的字眼儿。

collins.def: In mathematics, an expression is a symbol or equation which represents a quantity or problem.

example.ex: This forms the basis for our mathematical expression for the electric field.
example.tran: 这是电场数学表达式的基础。

collins.def: Belief is a feeling of certainty that something exists, is true, or is good.

example.ex: One billion people throughout the world are Muslims, united by belief in one god.
example.tran: 全世界有10亿穆斯林，共同的一神信仰将他们团结在一起。

example.ex: ...a belief in personal liberty.
example.tran: 对个人自由的信仰

collins.tran: （对宗教或政治的）信仰，观点，看法
collins.def: Your religious or political beliefs are your views on religious or political matters.

example.ex: He refuses to compete on Sundays because of his religious beliefs.
example.tran: 出于宗教信仰，他拒绝在礼拜天进行比赛。

collins.def: If it is your belief that something is the case, it is your strong opinion that it is the case.

example.ex: It is our belief that improvements in health care will lead to a stronger, more prosperous economy.
example.tran: 我们坚信，改善医疗保健会使经济更加繁荣昌盛。

collins.def: You use beyond belief to emphasize that something is true to a very great degree or that it happened to a very great degree.

example.ex: We are devastated, shocked beyond belief...
example.tran: 我们极为震惊，无法相信所发生的一切。

example.ex: Her son's skin improved beyond belief.
example.tran: 她儿子的皮肤得到了难以置信的改善。

collins.tran: 和人们一般的认识相反；和一般看法相反
collins.def: You use contrary to popular belief to introduce a statement that is the opposite to what is thought to be true by most ordinary people.

example.ex: Contrary to popular belief, there is no evidence that what you look like makes much difference to your life.
example.tran: 和人们一般的看法相反，没有证据表明面相对人生有多大影响。

collins.def: If you do one thing in the belief that another thing is true or will happen, you do it because you think, usually wrongly, that it is true or will happen.

example.ex: Civilians had broken into the building, apparently in the belief that it contained food.
example.tran: 平民百姓闯进了大楼，显然他们误以为里面有食物。

collins.def: You use moreover to introduce a piece of information that adds to or supports the previous statement.

example.ex: She saw that there was indeed a man immediately behind her. Moreover, he was observing her strangely...
example.tran: 她看见真有一个男的紧跟在她身后，而且在怪异地注视自己。

example.ex: The young find everything so simple. The young, moreover, see it as their duty to be happy and do their best to be so.
example.tran: 年轻人觉得每件事都那么简单;而且，他们把幸福视为自己的责任，并努力去实现幸福。

collins.def: A belt is a strip of leather or cloth that you fasten round your waist.

example.ex: He wore a belt with a large brass buckle.
example.tran: 他系着一条带大铜扣的腰带。

collins.def: A belt in a machine is a circular strip of rubber that is used to drive moving parts or to move objects along.

example.ex: The turning disc is connected by a drive belt to an electric motor.
example.tran: 转盘由一根传动带与电机相连。

collins.def: A belt of land or sea is a long, narrow area of it that has some special feature.

example.ex: Miners in Zambia's northern copper belt have gone on strike...
example.tran: 赞比亚北部铜矿带的矿工已经罢工了。

example.ex: Behind him was a belt of trees, and behind the trees hills and fields.
example.tran: 在他身后是一片树林，树林后面是小山和田地。

collins.def: If someone belts you, they hit you very hard.

example.ex: 'Is it right she belted old George in the gut?'  she asked.
example.tran: “她真的把老乔治痛打了一顿？”她问。

collins.def: If you belt somewhere, you move or travel there very fast.

example.ex: We belted down Iveagh Parade to where the motor was.
example.tran: 我们沿着艾维格大街一路飞奔到汽车那儿。

collins.tran: （表示柔道或空手道级别的）段，带
collins.def: If someone is or has a belt of a particular colour in judo or karate, they have reached the standard which that colour represents.

example.ex: He is a black belt in karate.
example.tran: 他是空手道黑带选手。

collins.def: Something that is below the belt  is cruel and unfair.

example.ex: Do you think it's a bit below the belt what they're  doing?
example.tran: 你觉得他们的做法是不是有点儿不太光明正大？

example.ex: ...this kind of below-the-belt discrimination.
example.tran: 这种不公正的歧视

collins.tran: 勒紧裤腰带；紧缩开支；节衣缩食
collins.def: If you have to tighten your belt, you have to spend less money and manage without things because you have less money than you used to have.

example.ex: Clearly, if you are spending more than your income, you'll need to tighten your belt.
example.tran: 明摆着，要是你入不敷出，你就得省着点了。

collins.def: If you have something under your belt, you have already achieved it or done it.

example.ex: Clare is now a full-time author with six books, including four novels, under her belt.
example.tran: 克莱尔现在是全职作家，著有6本书，其中有4部小说。

collins.def: When a person or a vehicle halts or when something halts them, they stop moving in the direction they were going and stand still.

example.ex: They halted at a short distance from the house...
example.tran: 他们在离房子不远处停了下来。

example.ex: The engine note changed as the aircraft landed, taxied and halted...
example.tran: 发动机的声音随着飞机着陆、滑行和停下一直在变化。

collins.tran: （使）（生长、发展、活动等）停止（或中止）
collins.def: When something such as growth, development, or activity halts or when you halt it, it stops completely.

example.ex: Striking workers halted production at the auto plant yesterday...
example.tran: 罢工工人于昨日停止了汽车厂的生产。

example.ex: He criticised the government for failing to halt economic decline...
example.tran: 他批评政府未能遏止经济下滑。

collins.tran: （军队口令）立定！站住！停止前进！
collins.def: 'Halt!' is a military order to stop walking or marching and stand still.

example.ex: The colonel ordered 'Halt!'
example.tran: 上校命令道：“立定！”

collins.tran: （只有小型站台、无建筑物的)小火车站
collins.def: A halt is a very small station on a country railway line, which often consists only of a short platform and no building.
If someone calls a halt to something such as an activity, they decide not to continue with it or to end it immediately.

example.ex: The Russian government had called a halt to the construction of a new project in the Rostov region.
example.tran: 俄罗斯政府已叫停了罗斯托夫地区的一个新工程。

collins.def: If someone or something comes to a halt, they stop moving.

example.ex: Sofia and Alex came to a halt and both tried to regain their breath...
example.tran: 索菲娅和亚历克斯停了下来，两人都想喘口气。

example.ex: The elevator creaked to a halt at the ground floor.
example.tran: 电梯嘎吱一声停在了一层。

collins.tran: （使）（生长、发展、活动等）完全停止
collins.def: If something such as growth, development, or activity comes or grinds to a halt or is brought to a halt, it stops completely.

example.ex: Her political career came to a halt in December 1988...
example.tran: 她的政治生涯于1988年12月画上了句号。

example.ex: Air traffic in Poland has been brought to a halt by an air traffic controllers' strike.
example.tran: 由于航空调度员罢工，波兰的空中交通已完全瘫痪。

collins.def: A contrast is a great difference between two or more things which is clear when you compare them.

example.ex: ...the contrast between town and country...
example.tran: 城乡差别

example.ex: The two visitors provided a startling contrast in appearance...
example.tran: 这两位访客的外表截然不同。

collins.def: You say by contrast or in contrast, or in contrast to something, to show that you are mentioning a very different situation from the one you have just mentioned.

example.ex: The private sector, by contrast, has plenty of money to spend...
example.tran: 相比之下，私营部门就有很多钱可供开销。

example.ex: In contrast, the lives of girls in well-to-do families were often very sheltered...
example.tran: 相反，生活在富裕家庭的女孩子通常都备受呵护。

collins.tran: 与…截然不同;与…对比鲜明
collins.def: If one thing is in contrast to another, it is very different from it.

example.ex: His public statements have always been in marked contrast to those of his son...
example.tran: 他和他儿子在公开场合的言论总是截然不同。

example.ex: That is in stark contrast to the situation during the 1970 oil crisis.
example.tran: 那和1970年石油危机时的情形完全不同。

collins.tran: 截然不同的事物;差异明显的事物
collins.def: If one thing is a contrast to another, it is very different from it.

example.ex: The boy's room is a complete contrast to the guest room.
example.tran: 这个男孩的房间和客房截然不同。

example.ex: ...a country of great contrasts.
example.tran: 一个截然不同的国家

collins.def: If you contrast one thing with another, you point out or consider the differences between those things.

example.ex: She contrasted the situation then with the present crisis...
example.tran: 她将当时的情况和目前的危机进行对比。

example.ex: Contrast that approach with what goes on in most organizations...
example.tran: 将那个方法和大多数机构现行的做法进行对比。

collins.tran: 截然不同;有明显差异;对比鲜明
collins.def: If one thing contrasts with another, it is very different from it.

example.ex: Johnson's easy charm contrasted sharply with the prickliness of his boss...
example.tran: 约翰逊的亲和力和他老板易怒的性格形成了鲜明的对比。

example.ex: Paint the wall in a contrasting colour.
example.tran: 把这面墙刷成对比鲜明的颜色。

collins.tran: (照片、电视图像、画作等的)颜色反差，明暗对比
collins.def: Contrast is the degree of difference between the darker and lighter parts of a photograph, television picture, or painting.

example.ex: ...a television with brighter colours, better contrast, and digital sound.
example.tran: 颜色更为鲜艳、图像对比度更高、具备数字音响效果的电视

collins.def: Your earnings are the sums of money that you earn by working.

example.ex: Average weekly earnings rose by 1.5% in July...
example.tran: 7月份的平均周薪增长了1.5%。

example.ex: He was satisfied with his earnings as an accountant.
example.tran: 他对自己会计师的收入很满意。

collins.tran: （尤指专业或实用的）技巧，技能
collins.def: Know-how is knowledge of the methods or techniques of doing something, especially something technical or practical.

example.ex: He hasn't got the know-how to run a farm.
example.tran: 他没有经营农场的专业知识。

example.ex: ...technical know-how.
example.tran: 专业技术知识

means: 把高尔夫球打到穴边而未进去

collins.def: Your lips are the two outer parts of the edge of your mouth.

example.ex: Wade stuck the cigarette between his lips.
example.tran: 韦德把香烟叼在嘴里。

collins.tran: 唇状物；边缘；（容器等的）嘴
collins.def: The lip of something such as a container or a high area of land is its edge.

example.ex: ...the lip of the jug.
example.tran: 壶嘴

example.ex: ...the lip of Mount Etna's smouldering crater.
example.tran: 埃特纳火山冒着烟的火山口

collins.tran: 咬嘴唇（以按下怒气或抑制痛苦等）
collins.def: If you bite your lip, you try very hard not to show the anger or distress that you are feeling.

example.ex: She bit her lip as she recalled the words he'd thrown at her.
example.tran: 回想起他甩给她的那些话，她咬了咬唇。

collins.tran: 大家都说的；大家都在谈论的
collins.def: If you say that something is on everyone's  lips, you mean that a lot of people seem to be interested in it and are talking about it.

example.ex: A reporter asks the president the question on everyone's lips: 'Do you anticipate being re-appointed?'...
example.tran: 一名记者向总裁提了大家都想问的问题：“您觉得自己会再获任命吗？”

example.ex: He is the guy whose name is on everyone's lips at the moment.
example.tran: 他就是那个现在大家都在谈论的人。

collins.tran: （在想到美好的事物或尝到好东西时）舔嘴唇
collins.def: If you lick your lips, you move your tongue across your lips as you think about or taste something pleasant.

example.ex: They licked their lips in anticipation...
example.tran: 他们舔舔嘴唇，满怀期待。

example.ex: We swallowed the chocolates in one gulp, licking our lips.
example.tran: 我们一口吞下了巧克力，满意地咂着嘴。

collins.def: If you tell someone that your lips are sealed, you are promising them that you will keep a secret that they have told you.

example.ex: As for anything told to me in confidence, well, my lips are sealed.
example.tran: 至于私底下告诉我的任何事情，我会守口如瓶的。

collins.def: If you say that someone is keeping a stiff upper lip, you mean that they are not showing any emotion even though it is difficult for them not to.
Magic is the power to use supernatural forces to make impossible things happen, such as making people disappear or controlling events in nature.

example.ex: They believe in magic...
example.tran: 他们相信巫术。

example.ex: ...the use of magic to combat any adverse powers or influences...
example.tran: 利用法术与强敌或敌对势力作战

collins.def: You can use magic when you are referring to an event that is so wonderful, strange, or unexpected that it seems as if supernatural powers have caused it. You can also say that something happens as if by magic or like magic .

example.ex: All this was supposed to work magic...
example.tran: 这一切被认为会创造奇迹。

example.ex: The picture will now appear, as if by magic!
example.tran: 这幅画立刻就会出现，好像变魔术一般！

collins.tran: (似)用魔法变成的;(似)用魔术变出的
collins.def: You use magic to describe something that does things, or appears to do things, by magic.

example.ex: So it's a magic potion?
example.tran: 那么，这是个神药？

example.ex: ...the magic ingredient that helps to keep skin looking smooth.
example.tran: 有助于保持肌肤光滑的奇效成分

collins.def: Magic is the art and skill of performing mysterious tricks to entertain people, for example by making things appear and disappear.

example.ex: His secret hobby: performing magic tricks.
example.tran: 他私底下有变戏法的嗜好。

collins.def: If you refer to the magic of something, you mean that it has a special mysterious quality which makes it seem wonderful and exciting to you and which makes you feel happy.

example.ex: It infected them with some of the magic of a lost age...
example.tran: 逝去的岁月让他们平添了几分魅力。

example.ex: There can be a magic about love that defies all explanation...
example.tran: 爱情的魔力也许根本无法解释。

collins.def: If you refer to a person's magic, you mean a special talent or ability that they have, which you admire or consider very impressive.

example.ex: The fighter believes he can still regain some of his old magic.
example.tran: 这位斗士相信自己仍然可以恢复从前的一些魔力。

collins.tran: （数目、词语等）重要的，关键的，举足轻重的
collins.def: You can use expressions such as the magic number and the magic word to indicate that a number or word is the one which is significant or desirable in a particular situation.

example.ex: ...their quest to gain the magic number of 270 electoral votes on Election Day.
example.tran: 在大选之日他们对胜败攸关的270张选票的争取

example.ex: ...the magic word that opened doors onto private worlds.
example.tran: 开启私人世界的咒语

collins.tran: 立见奇效的;立竿见影的
collins.def: Magic is used in expressions such as there is no magic formula and there is no magic solution to say that someone will have to make an effort to solve a problem, because it will not solve itself.

example.ex: There is no magic formula for producing winning products...
example.tran: 获奖电影的制作没有捷径可取。

example.ex: There is no magic cure.
example.tran: 灵丹妙药并不存在。

collins.tran: 极好的;了不起的;非常棒的
collins.def: If you say that something is magic, you think it is very good or enjoyable.

example.ex: It was magic—one of the best days of my life.
example.tran: 真是太棒了——这是我生命中最美好的一天。

collins.def: Historical people, situations, or things existed in the past and are considered to be a part of history.

example.ex: ...an important historical figure.
example.tran: 重要的历史人物

example.ex: ...the historical impact of Western capitalism on the world...
example.tran: 西方资本主义对世界历史的影响

collins.tran: （书籍、电影或图片）描述历史的，基于史实的
collins.def: Historical books, films, or pictures describe or represent people, situations, or things that existed in the past.

example.ex: He is writing a historical novel about nineteenth-century France.
example.tran: 他正在写一本描述19世纪法国的历史小说。

example.ex: ...another great Eisenstein historical film.
example.tran: 爱森斯坦的另一部杰出的历史片

collins.def: Historical information, research, and discussion is related to the study of history.

example.ex: ...historical records.
example.tran: 史籍

example.ex: ...modern historical research.
example.tran: 现代史学研究

collins.tran: 历史背景的;历史视角的
collins.def: If you look at an event within a historical context, you look at what was happening at that time and what had happened previously, in order to judge the event and its importance.

example.ex: It was this kind of historical context that Morris brought to his work...
example.tran: 莫里斯的作品正是基于这样一种历史背景。

example.ex: The Telegraph puts the union in a historical perspective.
example.tran: 《电讯报》从历史的角度对该工会进行了报道。

collins.def: A detailed report or plan contains a lot of details.

example.ex: Yesterday's letter contains a detailed account of the decisions...
example.tran: 昨天的那封信里有对这些决议的详细说明。

example.ex: I started drawing up more detailed budgets.
example.tran: 我开始起草更详尽的预算方案。

collins.def: A cat is a furry animal that has a long tail and sharp claws. Cats are often kept as pets.
Cats are lions, tigers, and other wild animals in the same family.
If you let the cat out of the bag, you tell people about something that was being kept secret. You often do this by mistake.

collins.tran: 好奇害死猫；事不关己，不要打听
collins.def: You say 'Curiosity killed the cat' in order to tell someone that they should not try to find out about something which does not concern them.

example.ex: 'All right, I've been reading it. So what?' — 'Curiosity killed the cat, that's what.'
example.tran: “好了好了，我是一直在读这个。那又怎么样？”——“不怎么样，只是好奇心，惹祸根。”

collins.def: If you look like something the cat dragged in or brought in, you are very untidy or dirty.

example.ex: I must look like something the cat dragged in.
example.tran: 我当时看上去一定很邋遢。

collins.tran: (打斗、竞赛中)玩猫戏老鼠，戏弄，捉弄
collins.def: In a fight or contest, if one person plays cat and mouse, or a game of cat and mouse, with the other, the first person tries to confuse or deceive the second in order to defeat them.

example.ex: After three hours of playing cat and mouse, they threatened to open fire on our vessel, so we stopped...
example.tran: 玩了3个小时的猫捉老鼠后，他们威胁说要向我们的船上开火，所以我们就停了下来。

example.ex: It's a cat-and-mouse game to him.
example.tran: 对他说来，就是一场猫捉老鼠的游戏。

collins.tran: 引起纷争;挑起轩然大波
collins.def: If you put the cat among the pigeons or set the cat among the pigeons, you cause fierce argument or discussion by doing or saying something.

example.ex: The bank is poised to put the cat among the pigeons this morning by slashing the cost of borrowing.
example.tran: 今天早上银行准备大幅下调贷款利率，这将引起轩然大波。

collins.def: If you say 'There's no room to swing a cat' or 'You can't swing a cat', you mean that the place you are talking about is very small or crowded.

example.ex: It was described as a large, luxury mobile home, but there was barely room to swing a cat.
example.tran: 那个活动房被形容为宽敞豪华，可事实上几乎连转身的地儿都没有。

collins.def: Intervention is the act of intervening in a situation.

example.ex: ...the role of the United States and its intervention in the internal affairs of many countries.
example.tran: 美国扮演的角色以及其对多国内政的干涉

example.ex: ...military interventions.
example.tran: 军事干涉

collins.def: A person who is attractive is pleasant to look at.

example.ex: She's a very attractive woman...
example.tran: 她是个妩媚动人的女子。

example.ex: I thought he was very attractive and obviously very intelligent...
example.tran: 我觉得他魅力非凡，才智过人。

collins.def: Something that is attractive has a pleasant appearance or sound.

example.ex: The flat was small but attractive, if rather shabby...
example.tran: 虽然有些老旧，这仍不失为一个漂亮的小公寓。

example.ex: The creamy white flowers are attractive in the spring.
example.tran: 在春天，这种乳白色的花朵分外迷人。

collins.tran: 吸引人的;值得拥有（或做）的
collins.def: You can describe something as attractive when it seems worth having or doing.

example.ex: Co-operation was more than just an attractive option, it was an obligation...
example.tran: 合作不仅仅是诱人的选择，它也是一种责任。

example.ex: Smoking is still attractive to many young people who see it as glamorous.
example.tran: 吸烟对很多年轻人还是很有诱惑力，他们觉得这让自己显得魅力十足。

means: 喇嘛（中国西藏或蒙古的佛教僧侣）

collins.def: A lama is a Buddhist priest or monk.

example.ex: It takes twenty to twenty-five years of study and meditation to qualify as a lama.
example.tran: 要学习和静修20到25年才有资格成为喇嘛。

means: 安静下来，平静下来，镇静下来

collins.def: A calm person does not show or feel any worry, anger, or excitement.

example.ex: She is usually a calm and diplomatic woman...
example.tran: 她通常沉着而老练。

example.ex: Try to keep calm and just tell me what happened...
example.tran: 镇静点,告诉我出了什么事。

collins.def: If you calm someone, you do something to make them feel less angry, worried, or excited.

example.ex: The ruling party's veterans know how to calm their critics...
example.tran: 执政党的老牌政治家们知道怎样让批评他们的人安静下来。

example.ex: Tranquilliser drugs were used to calm the deportees...
example.tran: 使用了镇静剂来让被放逐者们安静下来。

collins.def: Calm is used to refer to a quiet, still, or peaceful atmosphere in a place.

example.ex: The house projects an atmosphere of calm and order.
example.tran: 这栋房子透着一种宁静和整齐感。

example.ex: ...the rural calm of Grand Rapids, Michigan.
example.tran: 密歇根州大急流城田园般的宁静

collins.def: If someone says that a place is calm, they mean that it is free from fighting or public disorder, when trouble has recently occurred there or had been expected.

example.ex: The city of Sarajevo appears relatively calm today.
example.tran: 萨拉热窝城今天显得相对平静些。

collins.def: To calm a situation means to reduce the amount of trouble, violence, or panic there is.

example.ex: Officials hoped admitting fewer foreigners would calm the situation...
example.tran: 官员们希望通过减少外国人入境的数量来使局势平定下来。

example.ex: Mr Beazer tried to calm the protests by promising to keep the company's base in Pittsburgh.
example.tran: 比泽先生承诺仍将公司总部设在匹兹堡,以求平息抗议。

collins.def: If the sea or a lake is calm, the water is not moving very much and there are no big waves.

example.ex: ...as we slid into the calm waters of Cowes Harbour.
example.tran: 当我们缓缓驶入考斯港平静的水面时

collins.def: Calm weather is pleasant weather with little or no wind.

example.ex: Tuesday was a fine, clear and calm day.
example.tran: 星期二天气晴朗,没有刮风。

collins.tran: (帆船比赛中的)静风,风平浪静
collins.def: In sailing, a flat calm or a dead calm is a condition of the sea or the weather in which there is very little wind or movement of the water.

example.ex: ...during flat calms when the water is crystal clear...
example.tran: 在风平浪静、水清澈见底时

example.ex: We had the whole gamut of wind from a dead calm to a force 10 gale.
example.tran: 我们这里什么风都有,从风平浪静到十级大风。

collins.def: When the sea calms, it becomes still because the wind stops blowing strongly. When the wind calms, it stops blowing strongly.

example.ex: Dawn came, the sea calmed but the cold was as bitter as ever.
example.tran: 破晓之际,海面平静了下来,但是寒冷依旧。

collins.def: To calm a pain or an itch means to reduce it or get rid of it.

example.ex: ...more traditional methods of soothing the skin and calming the itch.
example.tran: 更加传统的护肤止痒方法

collins.def: You can use the calm before the storm to refer to a quiet period in which there is little or no activity, before a period in which there is a lot of trouble or intense activity.
Something that is underground is below the surface of the ground.

example.ex: Solid low-level waste will be disposed of deep underground...
example.tran: 放射性水平低的固体废料将做地下深埋处理。

example.ex: The plane hit so hard that one engine was buried 16 feet underground.
example.tran: 飞机猛烈撞击地面，致使一个引擎陷到了地下16英尺处。

collins.def: The underground in a city is the railway system in which electric trains travel below the ground in tunnels.

example.ex: ...a woman alone in the underground waiting for a train...
example.tran: 独自在地铁里等车的女子

example.ex: He crossed London by underground...
example.tran: 他乘地铁穿过伦敦。

collins.tran: （反抗敌人或暴政的）地下组织，秘密组织
collins.def: In a country which is controlled by an enemy or has a harsh government, the underground is an organized group of people who are involved in illegal activities against the people in power.

example.ex: These US dollars were smuggled into the country during the war, to aid the underground.
example.tran: 战争期间，这些美元被偷运到该国，用以资助那里的地下组织。

collins.def: Underground groups and activities are secret because their purpose is to oppose the government and they are illegal.

example.ex: ...the underground Kashmir Liberation Front...
example.tran: 秘密的克什米尔解放阵线

example.ex: They are accused of organising and financing an underground youth movement.
example.tran: 他们被指控组织并资助地下青年运动。

collins.def: If you go underground, you hide from the authorities or the police because your political ideas or activities are illegal.

example.ex: After the violent clashes of 1981 they either went underground or left the country.
example.tran: 经历了1981年的激烈冲突之后，他们或转入地下，或离开了该国。

example.ex: ...opposition leaders, who are working underground because of the threat of arrest.
example.tran: 面临被捕危险不得不秘密开展工作的反对派领导人

collins.def: Worst is the superlative of bad .
Worst is the superlative of badly .
The worst is the most unpleasant or unfavourable thing that could happen or does happen.

example.ex: Though mine safety has much improved, miners' families still fear the worst...
example.tran: 尽管矿井的安全状况有了很大改善，矿工的家属仍然害怕最糟的情况会发生。

example.ex: The country had come through the worst of the recession.
example.tran: 该国已经度过了经济衰退最糟糕的时期。

collins.tran: (用于构成以 bad 和 badly 开头的复合形容词的最高级，如badly-affected的最高级是worst-affected)
collins.def: Worst is used to form the superlative of compound adjectives beginning with 'bad' and 'badly'. For example, the superlative of 'badly-affected' is 'worst-affected'.
You say worst of all to indicate that what you are about to mention is the most unpleasant or has the most disadvantages out of all the things you are mentioning.

example.ex: The people most closely affected are the passengers who were injured and, worst of all, those who lost relatives.
example.tran: 受影响最大的是受伤的乘客，那些失去亲人的乘客尤为甚。

collins.def: You use at worst or at the worst to indicate that you are mentioning the worst thing that might happen in a situation.

example.ex: At best Nella would be an invalid; at worst she would die...
example.tran: 内拉往好里说会落下残疾，往坏处说可能会生命不保。

example.ex: At the worst he would be there by the following night.
example.tran: 最不济他会在第二天晚上之前到那儿。

collins.tran: 在（心情、境况）最糟糕的时候
collins.def: When someone is at their worst, they are as unpleasant, bad, or unsuccessful as it is possible for them to be.

example.ex: This was their mother at her worst. Her voice was strident, she was ready to be angry at anyone.
example.tran: 这是他们的母亲情绪最坏之时，她说话咄咄逼人，随时会对任何人发火。

collins.tran: 如果发生最坏的情况（if worst comes to worst 主要用于美国英语）
collins.def: You use if the worst comes to the worst to say what you might do if a situation develops in the most unfavourable way possible. The form if worst comes to worst is also used, mainly in American English.

example.ex: If the worst comes to the worst I guess I can always ring Jean...
example.tran: 到了一筹莫展的时候，我想我总还是能给琼打电话。

example.ex: He was asked whether he would walk out if the worst came to the worst.
example.tran: 他被问到如果发生最坏的情况他是否会退席。

collins.tran: 不择手段；使出一切手段;有什么手段尽管使出来
collins.def: If someone does their worst, they do everything unpleasant that they can possibly do. You can say 'do your worst' to show someone that you are not frightened of what they may do.

example.ex: I think it was dangerous to say: look, we've got an army now — do your worst.
example.tran: 我觉得要是说“瞧，我们现在有一大群人——你有什么手段尽管使出来吧”，可能会引起麻烦。

collins.def: The practical aspects of something involve real situations and events, rather than just ideas and theories.

example.ex: We can offer you practical suggestions on how to increase the fibre in your daily diet...
example.tran: 我们能就如何增加你日常饮食中的纤维素量提供实际的建议。

example.ex: This practical guidebook teaches you about relaxation, coping skills, and time management.
example.tran: 这本实用的旅行指南教给你放松的方法、处理问题的技巧以及如何安排时间。

collins.tran: （人）明智的，注重实效的，务实的
collins.def: You describe people as practical when they make sensible decisions and deal effectively with problems.

example.ex: You were always so practical, Maria...
example.tran: 玛丽亚，你以前一向很注重实效。

example.ex: How could she be so practical when he'd just told her something so shattering?...
example.tran: 他刚把这么令人震惊的事情告诉她，她怎么会如此理智呢？

collins.tran: （意见和方法）切实有效的，可行的
collins.def: Practical ideas and methods are likely to be effective or successful in a real situation.

example.ex: Although the causes of cancer are being uncovered, we do not yet have any practical way to prevent it...
example.tran: 虽然癌症的病因正被逐步揭开，但我们尚未有任何切实可行的办法来预防它。

example.ex: It is not easy to make practical suggestions for helping her.
example.tran: 要提出切实可行的建议帮助她并不容易。

collins.tran: （衣物等）实用的，适合特定用途的
collins.def: You can describe clothes and things in your house as practical when they are suitable for a particular purpose rather than just being fashionable or attractive.

example.ex: Our clothes are lightweight, fashionable, practical for holidays.
example.tran: 我们的服装轻便、时尚，并且很适合度假时穿。

collins.tran: 实验课；实践课；实验考核
collins.def: A practical is an examination or a lesson in which you make things or do experiments rather than simply writing answers to questions.
If you dump something somewhere, you put it or unload it there quickly and carelessly.

example.ex: We dumped our bags at the nearby Grand Hotel and hurried towards the market...
example.tran: 我们把包扔在附近的格兰德酒店后就匆匆赶往集市。

example.ex: He got my haversack from the cab and dumped it at my feet.
example.tran: 他把我的背包从出租车上取来丢到我脚下。

collins.def: If something is dumped somewhere, it is put or left there because it is no longer wanted or needed.

example.ex: The getaway car was dumped near a motorway tunnel...
example.tran: 逃亡用的车被丢弃在高速公路隧道附近。

example.ex: A million tonnes of untreated sewage is dumped into the sea...
example.tran: 一百万吨未经处理的污水被倾倒进了海里。

collins.def: A dump is a place where rubbish is left, for example on open ground outside a town.

example.ex: ...companies that bring their rubbish straight to the dump...
example.tran: 将其废弃物直接运送至垃圾场的公司

example.ex: The walled garden was used as a dump.
example.tran: 带围墙的花园被用作了垃圾场。

collins.tran: 肮脏的地方;乱七八糟的地方
collins.def: If you say that a place is a dump, you think it is ugly and unpleasant to live in or visit.

example.ex: 'What a dump!' Christabel said, standing in the doorway of the youth hostel.
example.tran: “真够脏乱的！”克丽丝特布尔站在青年旅社的门口说道。

collins.tran: (军队中粮食、武器等的)临时堆积处,临时仓库
collins.def: A dump is a place where an army stores food and weapons temporarily while it is stationed in a particular place.

collins.tran: 不再支持,摒弃(政策、想法等)
collins.def: To dump something such as an idea, policy, or practice means to stop supporting or using it.

example.ex: Ministers believed it was vital to dump the poll tax before the election.
example.tran: 大臣们认为在大选前停止征收人头税至关重要。

collins.tran: (通常指为占领海外市场)倾销,抛售
collins.def: If a firm or company dumps goods, it sells large quantities of them at prices far below their real value, usually in another country, in order to gain a bigger market share or to keep prices high in the home market.

example.ex: It produces more than it needs, then dumps its surplus onto the world market.
example.tran: 当产量超过需求时,过剩的产品便倾销到世界市场。

collins.tran: 与…断绝关系;与…结束关系
collins.def: If you dump someone, you end your relationship with them.

example.ex: I thought he was going to dump me for another girl...
example.tran: 我以为他要为了另一个女孩而和我分手。

example.ex: She was dumped by her long-term lover after five years...
example.tran: 5 年后她被相恋多年的恋人抛弃了。

collins.def: If you say that a parent dumps a child with someone, you are criticizing the parent for leaving the child to be looked after by that person.

example.ex: I was sometimes dumped with my grandmother or left with highly unsuitable au pairs...
example.tran: 有时我被扔给奶奶照看，或者被交给毫无经验的临时保姆。

example.ex: He can't cope and dumps his two teenage boys on them to be looked after.
example.tran: 他应付不过来，只能将他那两个十来岁的儿子交给他们代为照看。

collins.def: To dump computer data or memory means to copy it from one storage system onto another, such as from disk to magnetic tape.

example.ex: It can take a couple of hours to dump a thousand telephone numbers into a 128k EPROM pack...
example.tran: 将 1,000 个电话号码转存到一个128k的EPROM芯片要花好几个小时。

example.ex: All the data is then dumped into the main computer.
example.tran: 所有数据随后被转存至主计算机。

collins.tran: 转存信息库;转储数据库
collins.def: A dump is a list of the data that is stored in a computer's memory at a particular time. Dumps are often used by computer programmers to find out what is causing a problem with a program.

example.ex: ...a screen dump.
example.tran: 屏幕转储

collins.def: If someone dumps on you, they treat you very badly and unfairly.

example.ex: He was a nice guy, Mona. He didn't dump on me.
example.tran: 莫娜,他是个不错的家伙,没有亏待我。

collins.tran: 郁闷的;沮丧的;闷闷不乐的
collins.def: If you are down in the dumps, you are feeling very depressed and miserable.

example.ex: She's feeling a bit down in the dumps and needs cheering up.
example.tran: 她情绪有点低落，需要振奋起来。

collins.def: A shirt is a piece of clothing that you wear on the upper part of your body. Shirts have a collar, sleeves, and buttons down the front.

means: 改变…的基因（或遗传）结构

collins.def: An engineer is a person who uses scientific knowledge to design, construct, and maintain engines and machines or structures such as roads, railways, and bridges.

collins.tran: 机械修理工;电气修理工；技师
collins.def: An engineer is a person who repairs mechanical or electrical devices.

example.ex: They send a service engineer to fix the disk drive.
example.tran: 他们派出维修人员来修磁盘驱动器。

collins.def: An engineer is a person who is responsible for maintaining the engine of a ship while it is at sea.

collins.tran: 设计制造（车辆、桥梁、建筑物等）
collins.def: When a vehicle, bridge, or building is engineered, it is planned and constructed using scientific methods.

example.ex: Many of Kuwait's spacious freeways were engineered by W S Atkins.
