example.tran: 科威特有很多宽阔的高速公路是阿特金斯集团设计建造的。

example.ex: ...the car's better designed and engineered rivals.
example.tran: 比那款轿车的设计和制造更为精良的竞争车型

collins.def: If you engineer an event or situation, you arrange for it to happen, in a clever or indirect way.

example.ex: He could stand no more and engineered an escape...
example.tran: 他无法再忍受，便策划了出逃。

example.ex: This boom has been engineered by the Chancellor for short-term political reasons.
example.tran: 这片繁荣景象是总理为了短期政治利益而精心安排的。

means: 引起…的疼痛（或痛苦、苦恼等）
聪明伶俐地，轻快地，漂亮地

collins.def: Smart people and things are pleasantly neat and clean in appearance.

example.ex: He was smart and well groomed but not good looking...
example.tran: 他仪容整洁，穿戴漂亮，就是人长得不好看。

example.ex: I was dressed in a smart navy blue suit.
example.tran: 我身穿一套帅气的藏青色西服。

collins.def: You can describe someone who is clever as smart .

example.ex: He thinks he's smarter than Sarah is...
example.tran: 他认为自己比萨拉聪明。

example.ex: Buying expensive furniture is not necessarily the smartest move to make.
example.tran: 购买昂贵的家具不见得就是最明智之举。

collins.def: A smart place or event is connected with wealthy and fashionable people.

example.ex: ...smart London dinner parties.
example.tran: 气派不凡的伦敦晚宴

example.ex: ...a smart residential district.
example.tran: 豪华的住宅区

collins.tran: (炸弹、武器等)灵巧的,精密制导的
collins.def: Smart bombs and weapons are guided by computers and lasers so that they hit their targets accurately.

collins.tran: (身体的某个部位或伤口)剧痛，刺痛
collins.def: If a part of your body or a wound smarts, you feel a sharp stinging pain in it.

example.ex: My eyes smarted from the smoke.
example.tran: 我的眼睛被烟薰得很疼。

collins.tran: (因批评、失败等)感到不高兴，感到难受
collins.def: If you are smarting from something such as criticism or failure, you feel upset about it.

example.ex: The Americans were still smarting from their defeat in the Vietnam War...
example.tran: 美国人仍然对越南战争的失败耿耿于怀。

example.ex: He is still smarting over criticism of his victorious but clumsy performance.
example.tran: 他还在为别人批评他尽管最终胜出但表现笨拙感到闷闷不乐。

collins.def: The smart set is a group of fashionable and wealthy people.

example.ex: ...Spago, favourite eating place of the Los Angeles smart set.
example.tran: 思派古——洛杉矶的时尚富人最喜欢光顾的用餐之地

collins.def: Commerce is the activities and procedures involved in buying and selling things.

example.ex: They have made their fortunes from industry and commerce.
example.tran: 他们靠工商业发了财。

collins.def: Someone who is gentle is kind, mild, and calm.

example.ex: My son was a quiet and gentle man who liked sports and enjoyed life...
example.tran: 我儿子是个安静温和的人，喜欢运动和享受生活。

example.ex: Michael's voice was gentle and consoling.
example.tran: 迈克尔的嗓音轻柔而且抚慰人心。

collins.def: Gentle actions or movements are performed in a calm and controlled manner, with little force.

example.ex: ...a gentle game of tennis...
example.tran: 不激烈的网球比赛

example.ex: His movements were gentle and deliberate.
example.tran: 他的动作舒缓而从容。

collins.tran: （天气）温和的； （尤指风）和煦的，微弱的
collins.def: If you describe the weather, especially the wind, as gentle, you mean it is pleasant and calm and not harsh or violent.

example.ex: The blustery winds of spring had dropped to a gentle breeze.
example.tran: 呼啸的春风已经减弱，成了习习的微风。

collins.def: A gentle slope or curve is not steep or severe.

example.ex: ...gentle, rolling meadows...
example.tran: 缓缓起伏的牧场

example.ex: There were two passes over 13,000 feet but the slopes were gentle.
example.tran: 有两个超过13,000英尺的山口，但坡度平缓。

collins.def: A gentle heat is a fairly low heat.

example.ex: Cook for 30 minutes over a gentle heat.
example.tran: 用文火煮30分钟。

means: 圣人般的人（指特别善良、仁爱或有耐性的人）
（因其生死言行而被基督教会追封的）圣人

collins.tran: (基督教正式追封的)圣徒，圣人
collins.def: A saint is someone who has died and been officially recognized and honoured by the Christian church because his or her life was a perfect example of the way Christians should live.

example.ex: Every parish was named after a saint.
example.tran: 每个教区都以某位圣徒的名字命名。

example.ex: ...Saint John.
example.tran: 圣约翰

collins.tran: 至善的人;极有耐心的人;道德高尚的人;圣人般的人
collins.def: If you refer to a living person as a saint, you mean that they are extremely kind, patient, and unselfish.

example.ex: My girlfriend is a saint to put up with me.
example.tran: 能够忍受我，我的女朋友真的很有耐心。

means: 使欣喜( delight的过去式和过去分词)

collins.def: If you are delighted, you are extremely pleased and excited about something.

example.ex: I know Frank will be delighted to see you...
example.tran: 我知道弗兰克见到你会很高兴的。

example.ex: He said that he was delighted with the public response.
example.tran: 他说公众的反应让他欣喜。

collins.def: If someone invites or asks you to do something, you can say that you would be delighted to do it, as a way of showing that you are very willing to do it.

example.ex: 'You must come to Tinsley's graduation party.' — 'I'd be delighted.'
example.tran: “你一定要来参加廷斯利的毕业聚会。”——“我很乐意。”

collins.def: Elsewhere means in other places or to another place.

example.ex: Almost 80 percent of the state's residents were born elsewhere...
example.tran: 该州居民中几乎有80%出生在异地。

example.ex: They were living rather well, in comparison with people elsewhere in the world...
example.tran: 和世界上其他地方的人相比，他们生活得相当好。

collins.def: Digital systems record or transmit information in the form of thousands of very small signals.

example.ex: The new digital technology would allow a rapid expansion in the number of TV channels.
example.tran: 新的数字技术将会使电视频道的数量迅速增加。

collins.def: Digital devices such as watches or clocks give information by displaying numbers rather than by having a pointer which moves round a dial.

example.ex: ...a digital display.
example.tran: 数字显示

collins.def: You use barely to say that  something is only just true or only just the case.

example.ex: Anastasia could barely remember the ride to the hospital...
example.tran: 阿纳斯塔西娅几乎记不起来怎么去的医院。

example.ex: It was 90 degrees and the air conditioning barely cooled the room...
example.tran: 当时气温达到了90度，空调也不能让房间凉快多少。

collins.def: If you say that one thing had barely happened when something else happened, you mean that the first event was followed immediately by the second.

example.ex: The Boeing 767 had barely taxied to a halt before its doors were flung open...
example.tran: 这架波音767刚刚停住，它的舱门就弹开了。

example.ex: Barely had the bulldozers started when Museum of London archaeologists swooped.
example.tran: 推土机刚一启动，伦敦博物馆的考古学家们就蜂拥而至了。

collins.def: A species is a class of plants or animals whose members have the same main characteristics and are able to breed with each other.

example.ex: Pandas are an endangered species...
example.tran: 熊猫是濒危物种。

example.ex: There are several thousand species of trees here.
example.tran: 这里有几千种树。

means: 得到或接受某部分东西

collins.def: If you participate in an activity, you take part in it.

example.ex: They expected him to participate in the ceremony...
example.tran: 他们希望他参加典礼。

example.ex: Over half the population of this country participate in sport.
example.tran: 这个国家一半以上的人口参加体育锻炼。

means: （使）疲劳（ tire的过去式和过去分词）

collins.def: If you are tired, you feel that you want to rest or sleep.

example.ex: Michael is tired and he has to rest after his long trip.
example.tran: 迈克尔累了，他在长途旅行以后必须休息。

collins.tran: (身体部位)显出倦意的，感到疲乏的
collins.def: You can describe a part of your body as tired if it looks or feels as if you need to rest it or to sleep.

example.ex: Cucumber is good for soothing tired eyes…
example.tran: 黄瓜有助于舒缓眼部疲劳。

example.ex: My arms are tired, and my back is tense.
example.tran: 我的胳膊很累，背部肌肉紧绷得难受。

collins.def: If you are tired of something, you do not want it to continue because you are bored of it or unhappy with it.

example.ex: I am tired of all the speculation...
example.tran: 我厌烦了所有的推测。

example.ex: I was tired of being a bookkeeper.
example.tran: 我厌倦了当簿记员。

collins.def: If you describe something as tired, you are critical of it because you have heard it or seen it many times.

example.ex: I didn't want to hear another one of his tired excuses...
example.tran: 我不想听他的又一个老掉牙的借口。

example.ex: What we see at Westminster is a tired old ritual.
example.tran: 我们在威斯敏斯特教堂看到的是一种经年不变的古旧仪式。

collins.def: Unemployment is the fact that people who want jobs cannot get them.

example.ex: ...an area that had the highest unemployment rate in western Europe...
example.tran: 西欧失业率最高的地区

example.ex: Unemployment is so damaging both to individuals and to communities.
example.tran: 失业对个人和社会都有极大的负面影响。

collins.def: You use exactly before an amount, number, or position to emphasize that it is no more, no less, or no different from what you are stating.

example.ex: Each corner had a guard tower, each of which was exactly ten meters in height...
example.tran: 每个角落都有一座警戒塔，每座警戒塔正好10米高。

example.ex: Agnew's car pulled into the driveway at exactly five o'clock...
example.tran: 阿格纽的车在5点整驶入了车道。

collins.tran: 确实如此/并非如此;正是/不完全是
collins.def: If you say 'Exactly', you are agreeing with someone or emphasizing the truth of what they say. If you say 'Not exactly', you are telling them politely that they are wrong in part of what they are saying.

example.ex: Eve nodded, almost approvingly. 'Exactly.'...
example.tran: 伊芙几乎赞同地点了点头。“确实如此。”

example.ex: 'We don't know the answer to that.' — 'Exactly — so shut up and stop speculating.'...
example.tran: “我们不知道那个问题的答案。”——“就是——那就闭嘴，别瞎猜。”

collins.def: You use not exactly to indicate that a meaning or situation is slightly different from what people think or expect.

example.ex: He's not exactly homeless, he just hangs out in this park.
example.tran: 确切来说他并不算是无家可归，他只是老在这个公园里转悠。

collins.def: You can use not exactly to show that you mean the opposite of what you are saying.

example.ex: This was not exactly what I wanted to hear...
example.tran: 这根本不是我想听到的。

example.ex: Sailing is not exactly cheap.
example.tran: 帆船运动根本就不便宜。

collins.tran: （用于问句中，表示不赞成）到底，具体
collins.def: You use exactly with a question to show that you disapprove of what the person you are talking to is doing or saying.

example.ex: What exactly do you mean?...
example.tran: 你到底什么意思?

example.ex: Exactly what are you looking for?
example.tran: 你到底在找什么？

collins.tran: （尤指受到某种思想、经验影响的）思考方法，态度，观点，角度
collins.def: A particular perspective is a particular way of thinking about something, especially one that is influenced by your beliefs or experiences.

example.ex: He says the death of his father 18 months ago has given him a new perspective on life...
example.tran: 他说18个月前父亲的去世让他对人生有了新的认识。

example.ex: ...two different perspectives on the nature of adolescent development...
example.tran: 对青少年成长发育特点的两种不同观点

collins.tran: 正确/不正确地看待（或判断）
collins.def: If you get something in perspective or into perspective, you judge its real importance by considering it in relation to everything else. If you get something out of perspective, you fail to judge its real importance in relation to everything else.

example.ex: Remember to keep things in perspective...
example.tran: 记住要客观看待事物。

example.ex: It helps to put their personal problems into perspective...
example.tran: 这有助于正确看待他们的个人问题。

collins.def: Perspective is the art of making some objects or people in a picture look further away than others.
To resolve a problem, argument, or difficulty means to find a solution to it.

example.ex: We must find a way to resolve these problems before it's too late...
example.tran: 我们必须及时找到解决这些问题的方法。

example.ex: They hoped the crisis could be resolved peacefully.
example.tran: 他们希望这场危机能够得到和平解决。

collins.def: If you resolve to do something, you make a firm decision to do it.

example.ex: She resolved to report the matter to the hospital's nursing manager...
example.tran: 她决定把这件事汇报给医院的护士长。

example.ex: She resolved that, if Mimi forgot this promise, she would remind her.
example.tran: 她决定，如果米米忘记了这个承诺，她就提醒她。

collins.def: Resolve is determination to do what you have decided to do.

example.ex: This will strengthen the American public's resolve to go to war.
example.tran: 这会坚定美国公众诉诸战争的决心。

collins.def: If you resolve something into a clearer form, or if it resolves into a clearer form, its shape or the different parts it contains become clear.

example.ex: ...like a musician resolving a confused mass of sound into melodic or harmonic order...
example.tran: 就像音乐家那样将混乱嘈杂的声音变成优美和谐的旋律

example.ex: Each of the spirals of light resolved into points.
example.tran: 每一束螺旋光都分解成了光点。

means: 风俗，习惯，惯例，生活方式

collins.def: The manner in which you do something is the way that you do it.

example.ex: She smiled again in a friendly manner...
example.tran: 她又友好地微笑了一下。

example.ex: I'm a professional and I have to conduct myself in a professional manner...
example.tran: 我是专业人士，必须以专业的态度行事。

collins.def: If something is done in the manner of something else, it is done in the style of that thing.

example.ex: It's a satire somewhat in the  manner of Dickens...
example.tran: 这部讽刺作品有点狄更斯的风格。

example.ex: We kissed each other's cheeks in the European manner.
example.tran: 我们按欧洲人的方式互相亲吻了面颊。

collins.def: Someone's manner is the way in which they behave and talk when they are with other people, for example whether they are polite, confident, or bad-tempered.

example.ex: His manner was self-assured and brusque...
example.tran: 他态度傲慢无礼。

example.ex: Her manner offstage, like her manner on, is somewhat surly.
example.tran: 她台下和台上的举止如出一辙，都有些粗暴无礼。

collins.def: If someone has good manners, they are polite and observe social customs. If someone has bad manners, they are impolite and do not observe these customs.

example.ex: He dressed well and had impeccable manners...
example.tran: 他衣冠楚楚，待人接物无可挑剔。

example.ex: The manners of many doctors were appalling...
example.tran: 许多医生态度恶劣。

collins.tran: 各种各样的;形形色色的
collins.def: If you refer to all manner of objects or people, you are talking about objects or people of many different kinds.

example.ex: Mr Winchester is impressively knowledgeable about all manner of things.
example.tran: 温切斯特先生知识广博，通晓万事。

example.ex: ...her pictures of all manner of wildlife.
example.tran: 她为各种各样的野生动植物拍摄的照片

collins.tran: 不妨说;也可以说;从某种意义上说
collins.def: You say in a manner of speaking to indicate that what you have just said is true, but not absolutely or exactly true.

example.ex: An attorney is your employee, in a manner of speaking...
example.tran: 律师也可以说是你的雇员。

example.ex: 'You said she was a poor widow lady!' — 'In a manner of speaking she is,' Alison said.
example.tran: “你说过她是个可怜的寡妇！”——“从某种意义上说，她就是，”艾利森说。

collins.tran: （指人或物非同寻常或未知的）什么样的
collins.def: You use what manner of to suggest that the person or thing you are about to mention is of an unusual or unknown kind.

example.ex: There was much curiosity about what manner of man he was...
example.tran: 他究竟是什么样的人，大家都十分好奇。

example.ex: What manner of place is this?
example.tran: 这到底是个什么地方？

collins.def: When you make a journey, you travel from one place to another.

example.ex: There is an express service from Paris which completes the journey to Bordeaux in under 4 hours.
example.tran: 从巴黎有快车前往波尔多，全程不到4个小时。

collins.def: You can refer to a person's experience of changing or developing from one state of mind to another as a journey.

example.ex: How do we go about embarking on this  'inner journey' to understand ourselves?...
example.tran: 我们该如何开始这个“心灵历程”来了解自己呢？

example.ex: My films try to describe a journey of discovery, both for myself and the watcher.
example.tran: 我的电影试图为我自己也为观众描述一个自我发现的心灵之旅。

collins.def: If you journey somewhere, you travel there.

example.ex: In February 1935, Naomi journeyed to the United States for the first time...
example.tran: 1935年2月，娜奥米第一次来到美国旅行。

example.ex: She has journeyed on horseback through Africa and Turkey.
example.tran: 她骑马游历了非洲和土耳其。

collins.def: A delegation is a group of people who have been sent somewhere to have talks with other people on behalf of a larger group of people.

example.ex: ...a delegation from Somaliland...
example.tran: 来自索马里兰的代表团

example.ex: He was sent to New York as part of the Dutch delegation to the United Nations.
example.tran: 他作为出席联合国会议的荷兰代表团成员被派往纽约。

means: （有特殊用途或专属某人的）豪华寓所

collins.tran: （通常指在同一楼层的）公寓套房
collins.def: An apartment is a set of rooms for living in, usually on one floor of a large building.

example.ex: Christina has her own apartment, with her own car.
example.tran: 克里斯蒂娜有自己的公寓和汽车。

example.ex: ...bleak cities of concrete apartment blocks.
example.tran: 到处是水泥公寓楼群的沉闷的城市

collins.tran: （国王、王后、总统等要人居住的）套间，套房
collins.def: The apartments of an important person such as a king, queen, or president are a set of large rooms which are used by them.

example.ex: ...the private apartments of the Prince of Wales at St James's Palace.
example.tran: 威尔士亲王在圣詹姆斯宫的私人套房

means: gross domestic product 国内生产总值

collins.def: In economics, a country's GDP is the total value of goods and services produced within a country in a year, not including its income from investments in other countries. GDP is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'gross domestic product'.

explain: /'lɒbɪ//'lɑbi/ - n. 前厅, 厅堂 - 议会休息室 - 游说议员的团体 - vt. & vi. 向…进行游说[疏通] 名 词: lobbyer or 名 词: lobbyism

means: 中间，中庸，[生]培养基，培养液，颜料溶解液，[数]中数，平均，[逻]中名辞

collins.def: If something is of medium size, it is neither large nor small, but approximately half way between the two.

example.ex: A medium dose produces severe nausea within hours...
example.tran: 中等剂量几小时之内会引发严重的恶心。

example.ex: He was of medium height with blond hair and light blue eyes.
example.tran: 他中等身材，金发碧眼。

collins.def: You use medium to describe something which is average in degree or amount, or approximately half way along a scale between two extremes.

example.ex: Foods that contain only medium levels of sodium are bread, cakes, milk, butter and margarine.
example.tran: 含钠量仅为中等水平的食物有面包、蛋糕、牛奶、黄油和人造黄油。

example.ex: ...a sweetish, medium-strength beer.
example.tran: 中度甜啤酒

collins.def: If something is of a medium colour, it is neither light nor dark, but approximately half way between the two.

example.ex: Andrea has medium brown hair, grey eyes and very pale skin...
example.tran: 安德烈娅有着深浅适中的棕发、灰色的眼睛和十分白皙的皮肤。

example.ex: When violet is added to the medium blue a particularly striking, warm coloration is created.
example.tran: 在中蓝色中加入蓝紫色就形成了一种格外鲜艳夺目的暖色。

collins.def: A medium is a way or means of expressing your ideas or of communicating with people.

example.ex: In Sierra Leone, English is used as the medium of instruction for all primary education...
example.tran: 在塞拉利昂，基础教育阶段全部用英语授课。

example.ex: But Artaud was increasingly dissatisfied with film as a medium.
example.tran: 但是阿尔托对电影这种表现方式越来越不满。

collins.def: A medium is a substance or material which is used for a particular purpose or in order to produce a particular effect.

example.ex: Blood is the medium in which  oxygen is carried to all parts of the body...
example.tran: 血液是将氧气输送到人体各个部位的媒介。

example.ex: Hyatt has found a way of creating these qualities using the more permanent medium of oil paint.
example.tran: 海厄特已经找到产生这些特性的方法，那就是利用油彩这种更加持久的材料。

collins.tran: (自称能够在死者与生者之间传递信息的)巫师，灵媒
collins.def: A medium is a person who claims to be able to contact and speak to people who are dead, and to pass messages between them and people who are still alive.
If you strike or find a happy medium between two extreme and opposite courses of action, you find a sensible way of behaving that is somewhere between the two extremes.

example.ex: I still aim to strike a happy medium between producing football that's worth watching and getting results...
example.tran: 我仍致力于打造这样一种球风——既具观赏性，又能得分，两全其美。

example.ex: It's very difficult to strike a happy medium and make it right for everybody.
example.tran: 找到皆大欢喜的折中办法颇有难度。

collins.def: The existence of something is the fact that it is present in the world as a real thing.

example.ex: ...the existence of other galaxies...
example.tran: 其他星系的存在

example.ex: The Congress of People's Deputies in effect voted itself out of existence...
example.tran: (苏联)人民代表大会的投票在事实上终结了自身的存在。

collins.tran: （尤指逆境中的）生活，生活方式
collins.def: You can refer to someone's way of life as an existence, especially when they live under difficult conditions.

example.ex: You may be stuck with a miserable existence for the rest of your life...
example.tran: 你可能一辈子都要过着悲惨的生活。

example.ex: Their day-to-day existence was routine.
example.tran: 他们的日常生活很平淡。

collins.def: A politician's opponents are other politicians who belong to a different party or who have different aims or policies.

example.ex: ...Mr Kennedy's opponent in the leadership contest...
example.tran: 与肯尼迪先生争夺领导权的对手

example.ex: He described the detention without trial of political opponents as a cowardly act.
example.tran: 他称未经审判就将政敌关押起来是懦夫之举。

collins.def: In a sporting contest, your opponent is the person who is playing against you.

example.ex: Norris twice knocked down his opponent in the early rounds of the fight...
example.tran: 诺里斯在前几个回合中两次击倒对手。

example.ex: He's the best opponent I've come across this season, a great player.
example.tran: 他是我本赛季遇到的最出色的对手，一位了不起的运动员。

collins.def: The opponents of an idea or policy do not agree with it and do not want it to be carried out.

example.ex: ...opponents of the spread of nuclear weapons...
example.tran: 反对核武器扩散的人士

example.ex: He became an outspoken opponent of the old Soviet system.
example.tran: 他成为旧的苏联体制直言不讳的抨击者。

collins.def: Your vision of a future situation or society is what you imagine or hope it would be like, if things were very different from the way they are now.

example.ex: I have a vision of a society that is free of exploitation and injustice...
example.tran: 我希望建立一个没有剥削和不公的社会。

example.ex: That's my vision of how the world could be...
example.tran: 那是我对未来世界的想象。

collins.def: If you have a vision of someone in a particular situation, you imagine them in that situation, for example because you are worried that it might happen, or hope that it will happen.

example.ex: He had a vision of Cheryl, slumped on a plastic chair in the waiting-room...
example.tran: 他想象谢里尔瘫坐在候诊室的一把塑料椅子上。

example.ex: Maybe you had visions of being surrounded by happy, smiling children.
example.tran: 也许你曾幻想过被快乐嬉笑的孩子所包围的情景。

collins.def: A vision is the experience of seeing something that other people cannot see, for example in a religious experience or as a result of madness or taking drugs.

example.ex: It was on 24th June 1981 that young villagers first reported seeing the Virgin Mary in a vision.
example.tran: 1981年6月24日那天，年轻的村民们首次报告说看到了圣母马利亚的幻象。

collins.def: Your vision is your ability to see clearly with your eyes.

example.ex: It causes blindness or serious loss of vision...
example.tran: 这能导致失明或视力严重受损。

example.ex: In spite of his otherwise excellent vision, he found he was colour-blind.
example.tran: 尽管他视力很好，他却发现自己是个色盲。

collins.def: Your vision is everything that you can see from a particular place or position.

example.ex: Jane blocked Cross's vision and he could see nothing...
example.tran: 简挡住了克罗斯的视线，他什么也看不见。

example.ex: I saw other indistinct shapes that stayed out of vision.
example.tran: 我看见另有一些模糊的影子晃了一下就不见了。

collins.def: A theme in a piece of writing, a talk, or a discussion is an important idea or subject that runs through it.

example.ex: The theme of the conference is renaissance Europe...
example.tran: 大会的主题是文艺复兴时期的欧洲。

example.ex: 'That's another element in choosing a style of writing, you see,' he says, returning to his main theme...
example.tran: “瞧，那是选择写作风格时要考虑的又一个因素，”他又回到了主题上。

collins.tran: (艺术品、文学作品的)主题，中心思想
collins.def: A theme in an artist's work or in a work of literature is an idea in it that the artist or writer develops or repeats.

example.ex: The novel's central theme is the perennial conflict between men and women...
example.tran: 小说的主题是男人和女人之间永无休止的冲突。

example.ex: This painting points to another recurring theme in Munch's work.
example.tran: 这幅画体现了蒙克作品中另一个常见的主题。

collins.def: A theme is a short simple tune on which a piece of music is based.

example.ex: ...variations on themes from Mozart's The Magic Flute.
example.tran: 莫扎特的《魔笛》中主旋律的变奏曲

collins.tran: (电影、电视节目、广播节目的)主题音乐，主题曲
collins.def: Theme music or a theme song is a piece of music that is played at the beginning and end of a film or of a television or radio programme.

example.ex: ...the theme from Dr Zhivago...
example.tran: 电影《日瓦戈医生》的主题曲

example.ex: The BBC used Vangelis's Chariots of Fire as its Olympic theme tune in 1984.
example.tran: BBC 选用了范吉利斯的《火战车》作为其 1984 年奥运节目的主题音乐。

collins.tran: （艺术作品的）陈列室，展览馆；画廊
collins.def: A gallery is a place that has permanent exhibitions of works of art in it.

example.ex: ...an art gallery.
example.tran: 美术馆

example.ex: ...the National Gallery.
example.tran: 国家美术馆

collins.tran: 私人画店；私人画廊（或画室）
collins.def: A gallery is a privately owned building or room where people can look at and buy works of art.

example.ex: The painting is in the gallery upstairs.
example.tran: 那幅画在楼上的画廊里。

collins.tran: （大厅的）楼座，边座，楼上旁听席
collins.def: A gallery is an area high above the ground at the back or at the sides of a large room or hall.

example.ex: A crowd already filled the gallery.
example.tran: 楼座已经挤满了人。

collins.tran: （剧场或音乐厅中通常票价最低的）顶层楼座
collins.def: The gallery in a theatre or concert hall is an area high above the ground that usually contains the cheapest seats.

example.ex: They had been forced to find cheap tickets in the gallery.
example.tran: 他们不得已买了顶层楼座的廉价票。

means: 从事文学研究（或写作）的

collins.def: Literary means concerned with or connected with the writing, study, or appreciation of literature.

example.ex: Her literary criticism focuses on the way great literature suggests ideas...
example.tran: 她的文学批评集中关注的是伟大的文学作品表达思想的方式。

example.ex: She's the literary editor of the 'Sunday Review'.
example.tran: 她是《星期天评论》的文学编辑。

collins.tran: （词语、表达方式等）书面的，书卷气的
collins.def: Literary words and expressions are often unusual in some way and are used to create a special effect in a piece of writing such as a poem, speech, or novel.
Protein is a substance found in food and drink such as meat, eggs, and milk. You need protein in order to grow and be healthy.

example.ex: Fish was a major source of protein for the working man.
example.tran: 鱼肉曾是劳动者的主要蛋白质来源。

example.ex: ...a high protein diet.
example.tran: 高蛋白饮食

collins.tran: 聪明的;聪颖的;智商高的
collins.def: Someone who is clever is intelligent and able to understand things easily or plan things well.

example.ex: He's a very clever man...
example.tran: 他非常聪明。

example.ex: My sister was always a lot cleverer than I was...
example.tran: 我妹妹向来比我聪明许多。

collins.def: A clever idea, book, or invention is extremely effective and shows the skill of the people involved.

example.ex: ...a clever and gripping novel.
example.tran: 构思巧妙、扣人心弦的小说

example.ex: A colleague of mine in Milan devised the following very clever little experiment.
example.tran: 我在米兰的一个同事设计了下面这个非常巧妙的小实验。

collins.tran: 聪明过头的;过分聪明的
collins.def: If someone is too clever by half, they are very clever and they show their cleverness in a way that annoys other people.

example.ex: His many admirers describe him as clever: his enemies as too clever by half.
example.tran: 崇拜他的人很多说他聪明;恨他的人则说他聪明过了头。

collins.def: A column is a tall, often decorated cylinder of stone which is built to honour someone or forms part of a building.

example.ex: ...a London landmark, Nelson's Column in Trafalgar Square.
example.tran: 伦敦的标志性建筑，特拉法尔加广场上的纳尔逊将军纪念柱

collins.def: A column is something that has a tall narrow shape.

example.ex: The explosion sent a column of smoke thousands of feet into the air.
example.tran: 爆炸在空中形成了几千英尺高的烟柱。

collins.def: A column is a group of people or animals which moves in a long line.

example.ex: There were reports of columns of military vehicles appearing on the  streets.
example.tran: 有报道说几队军用车辆出现在街头。

collins.def: On a printed page such as a page of a dictionary, newspaper, or printed chart, a column is one of two or more vertical sections which are read downwards.

example.ex: We had stupidly been looking at the wrong column of figures...
example.tran: 我们稀里糊涂，看串了数字栏。

example.ex: In The Dictionary of Quotations, there are no fewer than one and a half columns devoted to 'kiss'.
example.tran: 在《引语词典》中，“亲吻”这一条目不下一栏半。

collins.def: In a newspaper or magazine, a column is a section that is always written by the same person or is always about the same topic.

example.ex: His name features frequently in the social columns of the tabloid newspapers...
example.tran: 他的名字频繁地出现在各种小报社会专栏的显著位置上。

example.ex: She also writes a regular column for the Times Educational Supplement.
example.tran: 她也定期为《泰晤士报高等教育增刊》写专栏文章。

collins.def: You use considering to indicate that you are thinking about a particular fact when making a judgment or giving an opinion.

example.ex: He must be hoping, but considering the situation in June he may hoping for too much too soon...
example.tran: 他一定心存希望，但是考虑到6月份的情形，他可能期望得过多过快了。

example.ex: The former hostage is in remarkably good shape considering his ordeal.
example.tran: 想想人质曾遭受的折磨，获救后其身体状况已经是出奇地好了。

collins.def: You use considering that to indicate that you are thinking about a particular fact when making a judgment or giving an opinion.

example.ex: Considering that you are no longer involved with this man, your response is a little extreme.
example.tran: 考虑到你已经与这个男人划清了界限，你的反应有一点儿过头。

collins.tran: 通盘考虑;从各方面考虑
collins.def: When you are giving an opinion or making a judgment, you can use considering to suggest that you have thought about all the circumstances, and often that something has succeeded in spite of these circumstances.

example.ex: I think you're pretty safe, considering.
example.tran: 总的说来，我认为你的处境很安全。

means: （潜水员过快浮出水面造成的）减压病

collins.def: When you bend, you move the top part of your body downwards and forwards. Plants and trees also bend .

example.ex: I bent over and kissed her cheek...
example.tran: 我俯身亲吻了她的脸颊。

example.ex: Turn the pot if the plants show signs of bending towards the light...
example.tran: 如果花草有向阳性，就把花盆转一下。

collins.def: When you bend your head, you move your head forwards and downwards.

example.ex: Rick appeared, bending his head a little to clear the top of the door.
example.tran: 里克到了，进门时为了避开门楣稍微低了下头。

collins.tran: 弯曲（手臂、腿等）；（手臂、腿等）弯曲
collins.def: When you bend a part of your body such as your arm or leg, or when it bends, you change its position so that it is no longer straight.

example.ex: These cruel devices are designed to stop prisoners bending their legs...
example.tran: 这些残酷的刑具是用来阻止犯人弯腿的。

example.ex: As you walk faster, you will find the arms bend naturally and more quickly.
example.tran: 走快时，你会发现手臂会自然弯曲，而且频率会更快。

collins.def: If you bend something that is flat or straight, you use force to make it curved or to put an angle in it.

example.ex: Bend the bar into a horseshoe...
example.tran: 把铁条弯成马蹄形。

example.ex: She'd cut a jagged hole in the tin, bending a knife in the process.
example.tran: 她在罐头上曲里拐弯地划了个口，其间还弄弯了一把小刀。

collins.def: When a road, beam of light, or other long thin thing bends, or when something bends it, it changes direction to form a curve or angle.

example.ex: The road bent slightly to the right...
example.tran: 这条路稍微朝右弯。

example.ex: Glass bends light of different colours by different amounts.
example.tran: 玻璃对不同颜色的光的折射量不同。

collins.def: A bend in a road, pipe, or other long thin object is a curve or angle in it.

example.ex: The crash occurred on a sharp bend.
example.tran: 撞车发生在一个急转弯处。

example.ex: ...an historic town nestling in a bend of the river.
example.tran: 一个坐落在河曲处的历史名镇

collins.def: If someone bends to your wishes, they believe or do something different, usually when they do not want to.

example.ex: Congress has to bend to his will...
example.tran: 国会不得不屈从于他的意志。

example.ex: Do you think she's likely to bend on her attitude to Europe?
example.tran: 你认为她会改变对欧洲的态度吗？

collins.tran: 曲解，通融，篡改（规则、法律等）
collins.def: If you bend rules or laws, you interpret them in a way that allows you to do something they would not normally allow you to do.

example.ex: A minority of officers were prepared to bend the rules.
example.tran: 少数官员准备篡改规则。

collins.def: If you bend the truth or bend the facts, you say something that is not exactly true.

example.ex: Sometimes we bend the truth a little in order to spare them the pain of the real facts.
example.tran: 有时我们会稍微变动一下事实，以免他们知道实情会太痛苦。

collins.def: If you say that someone is bending over backwards to be helpful or kind, you are emphasizing that they are trying very hard to be helpful or kind.

example.ex: People are bending over backwards to please customers.
example.tran: 人们正使出浑身解数取悦顾客。

collins.tran: 使非常恼火；使极为恼怒
collins.def: If you say that someone or something drives you round the bend, you mean that you dislike them and they annoy or upset you very much.

example.ex: And can you make that tea before your fidgeting drives me completely round the bend.
example.tran: 你能不能把那壶茶泡好？瞧你坐立不安的样子，真要把我惹急了。

collins.def: If you say that someone is round the bend, you mean that they do foolish or silly things.

example.ex: People thought I was round the bend.
example.tran: 人们以为我疯了。

collins.def: A cinema is  a place where people go to watch films for entertainment.

example.ex: The country has relatively few cinemas.
example.tran: 相对来讲，这个国家几乎没有几家电影院。

collins.def: You can talk about the cinema when you are talking about seeing a film in a cinema.

example.ex: I can't remember the last time we went to the cinema...
example.tran: 我记不得上次我们去看电影是什么时候了。

example.ex: They decided to spend an evening at the cinema.
example.tran: 他们决定晚上去看电影。

collins.def: Cinema is the business and art of making films.

example.ex: Contemporary African cinema has much to offer in its vitality and freshness.
example.tran: 当代非洲电影在活力和新颖性上颇足称道。

example.ex: ...in the early days of cinema.
example.tran: 电影业的早期

collins.def: If you watch someone or something, you look at them, usually for a period of time, and pay attention to what is happening.

example.ex: The man was standing in his doorway watching him...
example.tran: 那个男人站在门口盯着他看。

example.ex: He watched the barman prepare the beer he had ordered...
example.tran: 他看着酒吧招待员备好他点的啤酒。

collins.tran: 看，观看(电视节目、比赛等)
collins.def: If you watch something on television or an event such as a sports match, you spend time looking at it, especially when you see it from the beginning to the end.

example.ex: I'd stayed up late to watch the film...
example.tran: 我熬夜看了那场电影。

example.ex: They spent a great deal of time watching television.
example.tran: 他们很多时间都看电视了。

collins.tran: 对…保持关注;掌握…的情况
collins.def: If you watch a situation or event, you pay attention to it or you are aware of it, but you do not influence it.

example.ex: Human rights groups have been closely watching the case...
example.tran: 人权组织一直在密切关注此案。

example.ex: Annoyed commuters could only watch as the departure time ticked by.
example.tran: 随着发车时间一点点过去，恼怒的上班族只能干瞪眼。

collins.tran: 照看，看护(尤指孩子或动物)
collins.def: If you watch people, especially children or animals, you are responsible for them, and make sure that they are not in danger.

example.ex: Parents can't be expected to watch their children 24 hours a day.
example.tran: 父母不可能每天24小时照看孩子。

collins.def: If you watch someone, you follow them secretly or spy on them.

example.ex: Ella was scared that someone was watching her...
example.tran: 有个人一直在监视埃拉，这让她很害怕。

example.ex: I always had the feeling we were being watched.
example.tran: 我总感觉我们被监视了。

collins.def: If you tell someone to watch a particular person or thing, you are warning them to be careful that the person or thing does not get out of control or do something unpleasant.

example.ex: You really ought to watch these quiet types...
example.tran: 你真的应该留神这些寡言少语的人。

example.ex: If you're watching the calories, don't have mayonnaise.
example.tran: 如果你在意卡路里的摄入量，就不要吃蛋黄酱。

collins.def: A watch is a period of carefully looking and listening, often while other people are asleep and often as a military duty, so that you can warn them of danger or an attack.

example.ex: I had the first watch that May evening.
example.tran: 我第一次执行警戒任务是在那个五月的晚上。

collins.def: If someone keeps watch, they look and listen all the time, while other people are asleep or doing something else, so that they can warn them of danger or an attack.

example.ex: Jose, as usual, had climbed a tree to keep watch.
example.tran: 乔斯像往常一样爬到树上放哨。

collins.def: If you keep watch on events or a situation, you pay attention to what is happening, so that you can take action at the right moment.

example.ex: US officials have been keeping close watch on the situation.
example.tran: 美国官员一直密切注意着事态的发展。

collins.def: You say 'watch it' in order to warn someone to be careful, especially when you want to threaten them about what will happen if they are not careful.

example.ex: 'Now watch it, Patsy,' the Sergeant told her.
example.tran: “留点神，帕齐。”中士提醒她。

collins.tran: （通常指军队夜间的）警戒，值夜
collins.def: If someone is on watch, they have the job of carefully looking and listening, often while other people are asleep and often as a military duty, so that they can warn them of danger or an attack.

example.ex: Apart from two men on watch in the engine-room, everyone was asleep.
example.tran: 除了两个人在机房值班外，其他人都在睡觉。

collins.def: If you are on the watch for something, you are expecting it to happen and you therefore pay attention to events so that you will notice it when it does happen.

example.ex: Environmentalists will be on the watch for damage to wildlife.
example.tran: 环境保护主义者将会密切关注对野生动物造成的伤害。

collins.tran: 受到保卫;受到监视;被密切关注
collins.def: If someone is being kept under watch, they are being guarded or observed all the time.
You say to someone 'you watch' or 'just watch' when you are predicting that something will happen, and you are very confident that it will happen as you say.

example.ex: You watch. Things will get worse before they get better.
example.tran: 看着吧，事情在好转之前会先恶化。

means: 队伍单行行进时拉长或产生间隔

collins.def: The tail of an animal, bird, or fish is the part extending beyond the end of its body.

example.ex: The cattle were swinging their tails to disperse the flies.
example.tran: 那些牛甩动着尾巴驱赶苍蝇。

example.ex: ...a black dog with a long tail.
example.tran: 长尾黑狗

collins.def: You can use tail to refer to the end or back of something, especially something long and thin.

example.ex: ...the horizontal stabilizer bar on the plane's tail...
example.tran: 飞机尾部的水平尾翼

example.ex: Elsie tugged her husband's coat tail.
example.tran: 埃尔西用力拉了拉她丈夫外套的后摆。

collins.def: If a man is wearing tails, he is wearing a formal jacket which has two long pieces hanging down at the back.
To tail someone means to follow close behind them and watch where they go and what they do.

example.ex: Officers had tailed the gang from London during a major undercover inquiry...
example.tran: 在一次重大的秘密调查行动中，警察从伦敦就盯上了那帮匪徒。

example.ex: He trusted her so little that he had her tailed.
example.tran: 他十分不信任她，所以派人跟踪她。

collins.def: A tail is someone who is paid to watch and to follow another person.

example.ex: He checked behind. No tail.
example.tran: 他看看身后——没有人跟着。

collins.def: If you toss a coin and it comes down tails, you can see the side of it that does not have a picture of a head on it.
If you say that the tail is wagging the dog, you mean that a small or unimportant part of something is becoming too important and is controlling the whole thing.

example.ex: Past TV deals have seen the tail wagging the dog. Now football clubs feel they are equal partners with TV.
example.tran: 以往和电视台的交易中，足球俱乐部就已经有过喧宾夺主的记录。现在，他们更是觉得可以和电视台平起平坐了。

collins.tran: （由于失败或羞愧）夹着尾巴，垂头丧气
collins.def: If you say that you have your tail between your legs, you are emphasizing that you feel defeated and ashamed.

example.ex: His team retreated last night with tails tucked firmly between their legs.
example.tran: 昨晚，他的队伍灰溜溜地退场了。

collins.def: If you turn tail, you turn and run away.

example.ex: I turned tail and fled in the direction of the main house.
example.tran: 我掉头就跑，朝主屋方向逃去。

collins.def: If someone is innocent, they did not commit a crime which they have been accused of.

example.ex: He was sure that the man was innocent of any crime...
example.tran: 他确信那个男人没有犯任何罪。

example.ex: The police knew from day one that I was innocent.
example.tran: 警方一开始就知道我是无辜的。

collins.tran: 天真的;幼稚的;不谙世故的
collins.def: If someone is innocent, they have no experience or knowledge of the more complex or unpleasant aspects of life.

example.ex: They seemed so young and innocent...
example.tran: 他们看起来如此少不更事。

example.ex: He's curiously innocent about what this means to other people.
example.tran: 关于这对其他人意味着什么,他一无所知，这一点颇不寻常。

collins.def: Innocent people are those who are not involved in a crime or conflict, but are injured or killed as a result of it.

example.ex: All those wounded were innocent victims...
example.tran: 所有伤者都是无辜的受害人。

example.ex: The war was killing innocent women and children.
example.tran: 战争夺走了许多无辜妇女和儿童的生命。

collins.tran: 没有恶意的;无冒犯之意的
collins.def: An innocent question, remark, or comment is not intended to offend or upset people, even if it does so.

example.ex: It was a perfectly innocent question.
example.tran: 那是个完全没有恶意的问题。

collins.tran: (戏剧或音乐表演的)提示，暗示，尾白
collins.def: In the theatre or in a musical performance, a performer's cue is something another performer says or does that is a signal for them to begin speaking, playing, or doing something.

example.ex: The actors not performing sit at the side of the stage in full view, waiting for their cues...
example.tran: 还未轮到演出的演员坐在舞台旁边能看得一清二楚的地方，等待着他们的出场提示。

example.ex: I had never known him miss a cue.
example.tran: 我从没见过他错过提示。

collins.tran: 给(演员)暗示(或提示);为…提示
collins.def: If one performer cues another, they say or do something which is a signal for the second performer to begin speaking, playing, or doing something.

example.ex: He read the scene, with Seaton cueing him.
example.tran: 在西顿的提示下，他念了这一场的台词。

collins.def: If you say that something that happens is a cue for an action, you mean that people start doing that action when it happens.

example.ex: That was the cue for several months of intense bargaining...
example.tran: 那意味着几个月的激烈谈判开始了。

example.ex: That was Nicholas's cue to ask for another chocolate chip cookie.
example.tran: 那表示尼古拉斯还想要一块巧克力曲奇。

collins.def: A cue is a long, thin wooden stick that is used to hit the ball in games such as snooker, billiards, and pool.

example.ex: Their youngest brother was nine when he picked up a cue for the first time.
example.tran: 他们最年轻的弟弟第一次玩台球时才9岁。

collins.tran: 恰好在这时;就在这时候
collins.def: If you say that something happened on cue or as if on cue, you mean that it happened just when it was expected to happen, or just at the right time.

example.ex: Kevin arrived right on cue to care for Harry...
example.tran: 凯文到的正是时候，可以照顾哈丽。

example.ex: 'It's almost eight o'clock.' As if on cue the bell in the chapel began to toll for Matins.
example.tran: “快8点了。”恰好在这时小教堂晨祷的钟声敲响了。

collins.def: If you take your cue from someone or something, you do something similar in a particular situation.

example.ex: Taking his cue from his companion, he apologized for his earlier display of temper.
example.tran: 他也学着像同伴那样，为先前发脾气道歉。

collins.def: To transform something into something else means to change or convert it into that thing.

example.ex: Your metabolic rate is the speed at which your body transforms food into energy...
example.tran: 新陈代谢率是身体把食物转换为能量的速度。

example.ex: Delegates also discussed transforming them from a guerrilla force into a regular army.
example.tran: 代表们还讨论了把他们从游击队武装改造为正规军的问题。

collins.tran: 改善;使改观;使改头换面
collins.def: To transform something or someone means to change them completely and suddenly so that they are much better or more attractive.

example.ex: The Minister said the Urban Development Corporation was now transforming the area...
example.tran: 部长声称城市开发公司如今正使该地区改头换面。

example.ex: A cheap table can be transformed by an interesting cover…
example.tran: 一块趣味盎然的桌布就能使一张廉价桌子面目一新。

collins.def: The text of a book is the main part of it, rather than the introduction, pictures, or notes.

example.ex: The text is precise and informative.
example.tran: 正文内容准确，信息量大。

collins.def: Text is any written material.

example.ex: The machine can recognise handwritten characters and turn them into printed text...
example.tran: 这种机器能够识别手写字体，并将其转化为打印文本。

example.ex: A CD-ROM can store more than 250,000 pages of typed text.
example.tran: 一张只读光盘能存储25万多页键入的文本。

collins.tran: (讲演、广播、录音的)文字稿，原稿
collins.def: The text of a speech, broadcast, or recording is the written version of it.

example.ex: A spokesman said a text of Dr Runcie's speech had been circulated to all of the bishops.
example.tran: 一位发言人说，朗西博士的演讲稿已经分发给所有主教了。

collins.tran: (尤指科学或学术方面的)文献，文本
collins.def: A text is a book or other piece of writing, especially one connected with science or learning.

example.ex: Her text is believed to be the oldest surviving manuscript by a female physician.
example.tran: 她的文献据信是现存最古老的、由女性内科医生留下的手稿。

collins.tran: (尤指学校课堂使用的)课文，课文录音;(考卷上的)选文，录音材料
collins.def: A text is a written or spoken passage, especially one that is used in a school or university for discussion or in an examination.

example.ex: I'll read the text aloud first...
example.tran: 我先朗读一下课文。

example.ex: His early plays are set texts in universities.
example.tran: 他早期的戏剧作品现在是大学指定课文。

collins.def: A text is the same as a text message .

example.ex: I borrowed my wife's mobile phone last week and a text arrived from another man.
example.tran: 我上周借我老婆的手机用，收到一个男人发来的短信。

collins.def: If you text someone, you send them a text message on a mobile phone.

example.ex: Mary texted me when she got home.
example.tran: 玛丽到家后给我发了条短信。

collins.def: You use easily to emphasize that something is very likely to happen, or is very likely to be true.

example.ex: It could easily be another year before the economy starts to show some improvement.
example.tran: 很可能还要再等一年经济才会开始出现好转。

example.ex: ...an ancient barn that is easily the length of two tennis courts.
example.tran: 很可能有两个网球场那么长的一个古代畜棚

collins.def: You use easily to say that something happens more quickly or more often than is usual or normal.

example.ex: He had always cried very easily...
example.tran: 他总是动不动就哭鼻子。

example.ex: They have nightmares, they startle easily.
example.tran: 他们做噩梦，经常从梦中惊醒。

collins.def: Parliamentary is used to describe things that are connected with a parliament or with Members of Parliament.

example.ex: He used his influence to make sure she was not selected as a parliamentary candidate.
example.tran: 他利用自己的影响力阻挠她当选议员候选人。

collins.def: Ibid is used in books and journals to indicate that a piece of text taken from somewhere else is from the same source as the previous piece of text.

means: 使人兴奋的，令人激动的

collins.tran: 令人兴奋的;令人激动的;刺激的
collins.def: If something is exciting, it makes you feel very happy or enthusiastic.

example.ex: The race itself is very exciting...
example.tran: 比赛本身非常刺激。

example.ex: This voyage was the most exciting adventure of their lives...
example.tran: 这次旅行是他们人生中最刺激的冒险经历。

collins.def: If someone reminds you of a fact or event that you already know about, they say something which makes you think about it.

example.ex: So she simply welcomed him and reminded him of the last time they had met...
example.tran: 于是她只是对他表示欢迎，并且提醒说他们上次见过面。

example.ex: I had to remind myself that being confident is not the same as being perfect!
example.tran: 我得提醒自己表现得自信和表现得完美并不是一回事！

collins.tran: 让我提醒你…/我能提醒你…
collins.def: You use remind in expressions such as Let me remind you that and May I remind you that to introduce a piece of information that you want to emphasize. It may be something that the hearer already knows about or a new piece of information. Sometimes these expressions can sound unfriendly.

example.ex: 'Let me remind you,' said Marianne, 'that Manchester is also my home town.'...
example.tran: “让我来提醒你，”玛丽安娜说，“曼彻斯特也是我的家乡。”

example.ex: May I remind you that the care of your health is a religious duty...
example.tran: 我可以提醒你呵护自己的健康是一项宗教责任吗？

collins.tran: 提醒(某人做某事);使想起(做某事)
collins.def: If someone reminds you to do a particular thing, they say something which makes you remember to do it.

example.ex: Can you remind me to buy a bottle of Martini?...
example.tran: 你能提醒我买一瓶马提尼酒吗？

example.ex: The note was to remind him about something he had to explain to one of his students.
example.tran: 这张字条是要提醒他得向他的一个学生解释某件事情。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something reminds you of another person or thing, you mean that they are similar to the other person or thing and that they make you think about them.

example.ex: She reminds me of the wife of the pilot who used to work for you...
example.tran: 她让我想到过去为你工作的飞行员的妻子。

example.ex: This reminds me of Christmas parties.
example.tran: 这让我想起圣诞聚会。

means: 完全或相当令人满意的
目标，高尚的、有价值的原则或目标

collins.def: An ideal is a principle, idea, or standard that seems very good and worth trying to achieve.

example.ex: ...the bohemian ideals of truth, beauty, freedom and love.
example.tran: 崇信真、美、自由与爱的波西米亚式理想

example.ex: I tried to live up to my ideal of myself.
example.tran: 我努力活出理想的自我。

collins.def: Your ideal of something is the person or thing that seems to you to be the best possible example of it.

example.ex: ...the Japanese ideal of beauty...
example.tran: 日本人理想中的美人形象

example.ex: Throughout his career she remained his feminine ideal.
example.tran: 在他整个职业生涯中，她一直是他心中完美女性的代表。

collins.def: The ideal person or thing for a particular task or purpose is the best possible person or thing for it.

example.ex: She decided that I was the ideal person to take over the job...
example.tran: 她认定我是接手这份工作的最佳人选。

example.ex: I really love the area and see it as an ideal place to start my managerial career...
example.tran: 我真的很喜欢那个地区，把它视为开创我管理事业的理想之地。

collins.def: An ideal society or world is the best possible one that you can imagine.

example.ex: We do not live in an ideal world...
example.tran: 我们并非生活在完美的世界里。

example.ex: In an ideal world, there would be no such thing as rubbish...
example.tran: 在一个理想世界中，不会有垃圾之类的东西。

collins.def: Vegetables are plants such as cabbages, potatoes, and onions which you can cook and eat.

example.ex: A good general diet should include plenty of fresh vegetables.
example.tran: 良好的日常饮食应该包含大量的新鲜蔬菜。

example.ex: ...traditional Caribbean fruit and vegetables.
example.tran: 加勒比地区传统的水果和蔬菜

collins.def: Vegetable matter comes from plants.

example.ex: ...compounds, of animal, vegetable or mineral origin.
example.tran: 动物源性、植物源性或矿物源性的化合物

example.ex: ...decayed vegetable matter.
example.tran: 腐烂的植物质

collins.def: If someone refers to a brain-damaged person as a vegetable, they mean that the person cannot move, think, or speak.
You use ultimate to describe the final result or aim of a long series of events.

example.ex: He said it is still not possible to predict the ultimate outcome...
example.tran: 他说现在还无法预料最终的结局。

example.ex: The ultimate aim is to expand the network further.
example.tran: 最终目的是为了进一步拓展该网络。

collins.tran: 最根本的；最基础的；最原始的
collins.def: You use ultimate to describe the original source or cause of something.

example.ex: Plants are the ultimate source of all foodstuffs...
example.tran: 植物是所有食物的最根本来源。

example.ex: The ultimate cause of what's happened seems to have been the advertising campaign.
example.tran: 出事的最根本原因似乎在于那场广告宣传活动。

collins.tran: 最重要的；最强大的；至高的
collins.def: You use ultimate to describe the most important or powerful thing of a particular kind.

example.ex: ...the ultimate power of the central government...
example.tran: 中央政府的至高权力

example.ex: Of course, the ultimate authority remained the presidency...
example.tran: 当然，拥有最高权力者依然是总统。

collins.tran: 极端的；极度的；令人极其不快的
collins.def: You use ultimate to describe the most extreme and unpleasant example of a particular thing.

example.ex: Being removed from his post during operations is the ultimate humiliation for a ship's captain.
example.tran: 在执行任务的过程中被免职，这对一位船长来说是莫大的耻辱。

example.ex: Treachery was the ultimate sin...
example.tran: 背叛是最不可饶恕的罪孽。

collins.def: You use ultimate to describe the best possible example of a particular thing.

example.ex: He is the ultimate English gentleman...
example.tran: 他是最最典型的英国绅士。

example.ex: Caviar and oysters on ice are generally considered the ultimate luxury foods.
example.tran: 一般认为，鱼子酱和冰镇牡蛎是顶级美味。

collins.def: The ultimate in something is the best or most advanced example of it.

example.ex: Ballet is the ultimate in human movement...
example.tran: 芭蕾舞在人类的动作中可谓优雅至极。

example.ex: This hotel is the ultimate in luxury...
example.tran: 该酒店极尽奢华。

collins.def: When you fry food, you cook it in a pan that contains hot fat or oil.

example.ex: Fry the breadcrumbs until golden brown.
example.tran: 把面包屑炸成金褐色为止。

example.ex: ...fried rice.
example.tran: 炒饭

collins.def: Fry are very small, young fish.
Fries are the same as French fries.

collins.tran: (尤指为尽快做好便饭)煎一下，炸一下
collins.def: If you fry up food, you fry it, especially in order to make a quick, casual meal.

example.ex: I fried up the beef...
example.tran: 我把牛肉煎了一下。

example.ex: She cuts and fries the mixture up into a potato doughnut called Quin-Kuria.
example.tran: 她把混料切好后放进油里炸成一种叫做Quin-Kuria 的土豆炸面圈。

means: （尤指因行为不很明智）使陷入危险

collins.def: A compromise is a situation in which people accept something slightly different from what they really want, because of circumstances or because they are considering the wishes of other people.

example.ex: Encourage your child to reach a compromise between what he wants and what you want...
example.tran: 鼓励孩子在他的愿望和你的愿望之间找到一个折中点。

example.ex: Be ready and willing to make compromises between your needs and those of your partner...
example.tran: 时刻准备好并乐意在自己与伴侣的需求之间作出让步。

collins.def: If you compromise with someone, you reach an agreement with them in which you both give up something that you originally wanted. You can also say that two people or groups compromise .

example.ex: The government has compromised with its critics over monetary policies...
example.tran: 政府已经就货币政策向批评人士作出让步。

example.ex: 'Nine,' said I. 'Nine thirty,' tried he. We compromised on 9.15...
example.tran: “9点。”我说。“9点半。”他试着说。于是我们各让一步，定在了9点一刻。

collins.tran: 使（自己）声誉受损;违背(信念)
collins.def: If someone compromises themselves or compromises their beliefs, they do something which damages their reputation for honesty, loyalty, or high moral principles.

example.ex: ...members of the government who have compromised themselves by co-operating with the emergency committee...
example.tran: 因与紧急委员会合作而使自己名誉受损的政府成员

example.ex: He would rather shoot himself than compromise his principles.
example.tran: 他宁愿一枪打死自己也不愿违背自己的原则。

collins.def: A hook is a bent piece of metal or plastic that is used for catching or holding things, or for hanging things up.

example.ex: One of his jackets hung from a hook.
example.tran: 他的一件夹克衫挂在衣钩上。

example.ex: ...curtain hooks...
example.tran: 窗帘挂钩

collins.def: If you hook one thing to another, you attach it there using a hook. If something hooks somewhere, it can be hooked there.

example.ex: Paul hooked his tractor to the car and pulled it to safety.
example.tran: 保罗把自己的拖拉机挂在汽车上，然后把它拉到了安全的地方。

example.ex: ...one of those can openers that hooked onto the wall.
example.tran: 那些挂在墙上的开罐器中的一个

collins.def: If you hook your arm, leg, or foot round an object, you place it like a hook round the object in order to move it or hold it.

example.ex: She latched on to his arm, hooking her other arm around a tree...
example.tran: 她拽住他的胳膊不放，另一只胳膊抱紧一棵树。

example.ex: I hooked my left arm over the side of the dinghy.
example.tran: 我用左臂钩住小划艇的船舷。

collins.def: If you hook a fish, you catch it with a hook on the end of a line.

example.ex: At the first cast I hooked a huge fish.
example.tran: 第一次抛下钓线，我就钓了一条大鱼。

collins.def: A hook is a short sharp blow with your fist that you make with your elbow bent, usually in a boxing match.

example.ex: Lewis desperately needs to keep clear of Ruddock's big left hook.
example.tran: 刘易斯无论如何得躲开拉多克凌厉的左钩拳才行。

collins.def: If you are hooked into something, or hook into something, you get involved with it.

example.ex: I'm guessing again now because I'm not hooked into the political circles...
example.tran: 我现在又是在猜测了，因为我没有涉足政界。

example.ex: Eager to hook into a career but can't find one right for you?
example.tran: 急于干一番事业，但又找不到适合自己的？

collins.def: If you hook into the Internet, you make a connection with the Internet on a particular occasion so that you can use it.

example.ex: ...an interactive media tent where people will be able to hook into the internet.
example.tran: 人们可以上网的互动式媒体帐篷区

collins.def: If someone gets off the hook or is let off the hook, they manage to get out of the awkward or unpleasant situation that they are in.

example.ex: Government officials accused of bribery and corruption get off the hook with monotonous regularity...
example.tran: 被指控贪污受贿的政府官员无一例外总能脱身。

example.ex: His opponents have no intention of letting him off the hook until he agrees to leave office immediately.
example.tran: 在他同意马上离职之前，他的对手不打算放过他。

collins.def: If you take a phone off the hook, you take the receiver off the part that it normally rests on, so that the phone will not ring.
If your phone is ringing off the hook, so many people are trying to telephone you that it is ringing constantly.

example.ex: Since war broke out, the phones at donation centers have been ringing off the hook.
example.tran: 自从战争爆发以来，捐赠中心的电话就一直响个不停。

collins.def: Pride is a feeling of satisfaction which you have because you or people close to you have done something good or possess something good.

example.ex: ...the sense of pride in a job well done...
example.tran: 做好一项工作的自豪感

example.ex: We take pride in offering you the highest standards...
example.tran: 我们为向您提供最高标准的服务而感到自豪。

collins.def: Pride is a sense of the respect that other people have for you, and that you have for yourself.

example.ex: Davis had to salvage his pride...
example.tran: 戴维斯必须得挽回他的自尊。

example.ex: It was a severe blow to Kendall's pride.
example.tran: 这严重地打击了肯德尔的自尊心。

collins.def: Someone's pride is the feeling that they have that they are better or more important than other people.

example.ex: His pride may still be his downfall.
example.tran: 他的傲慢可能还会毁了他。

collins.tran: 为…感到自豪；对…感到得意
collins.def: If you pride yourself on a quality or skill that you have, you are very proud of it.

example.ex: Smith prides himself on being able to organise his own life...
example.tran: 史密斯对能够把自己的生活安排得井井有条感到很得意。

example.ex: Doyle prides himself on his accuracy.
example.tran: 道尔为自己的准确无误感到自豪。

collins.def: A pride of lions is a group of lions that live together.
Someone or something that is your pride and joy is very important to you and makes you feel very happy.

example.ex: The bike soon became his pride and joy.
example.tran: 这辆自行车很快就成了他的骄傲。

collins.tran: 首要地位；最重要的地位
collins.def: If something takes pride of place, it is treated as the most important thing in a group of things.

example.ex: A three-foot-high silver World Championship cup takes pride of place near a carved wooden chair...
example.tran: 一个3英尺高的世界锦标赛银质奖杯放在一把木雕椅附近，位置非常显眼。

example.ex: The manifesto gives pride of place to job creation.
example.tran: 这项宣言将创造工作机会放在首位。

collins.tran: 放下自尊；忍气吞声；放下架子
collins.def: If you swallow your pride, you decide to do something even though you think it will cause you to lose some respect.

example.ex: No doubt his old mother would now swallow her pride and go and live with Gladys.
example.tran: 无疑，他的老母亲如今只能放下身价，去和格拉迪斯住在一起。

means: 十三岁到十九岁的少年

collins.tran: 青少年，十几岁的人(指从 13 到 19 岁)
collins.def: A teenager is someone who is between thirteen and nineteen years old.

example.ex: As a teenager he attended Tulse Hill Senior High School.
example.tran: 十几岁时，他上了塔尔斯山高中。

collins.def: Rays of light are narrow beams of light.

example.ex: ...the first rays of light spread over the horizon...
example.tran: 地平线上出现的第一缕曙光

example.ex: It can be seen clearly in a ray of sunlight or under a lamp...
example.tran: 它在阳光或灯光下清晰可见。

collins.def: A ray of hope, comfort, or other positive quality is a small amount of it that you welcome because it makes a bad situation seem less bad.

example.ex: They could provide a ray of hope amid the general business and economic gloom...
example.tran: 在普遍的商业和经济低潮中，他们能带来一线希望。

example.ex: The one ray of sunlight in this depressing history is her meeting and falling in love with Martin.
example.tran: 在这段阴郁的时期，遇到并爱上马丁成为她唯一的一丝慰藉。

collins.def: A ray is a fairly large sea fish which has a flat body, eyes on the top of its body, and a long tail.

means: 骑手，骑马的人，善于骑马的人，骑师
附文，附加条附加条款款

collins.tran: 骑师;骑手;骑马(或自行车、摩托车)的人
collins.def: A rider is someone who rides a horse, a bicycle, or a motorcycle as a hobby or job. You can also refer to someone who is riding a horse, a bicycle, or a motorcycle as a rider.

example.ex: She is a very good and experienced rider...
example.tran: 她是一位经验丰富的优秀骑师。

example.ex: As we came out of the stables, a rider came towards us.
example.tran: 当我们走出马厩的时候，一个人骑着马向我们走了过来。

collins.def: A rider is a statement that is added to another statement, especially one which contains a change, an explanation, or further information.

example.ex: Mr Casey said he could see no necessity to add any rider on the use of firearms by police...
example.tran: 凯西先生说他觉得没有必要增加任何有关警察使用枪支的附加条款。

example.ex: America conventionally attaches a rider to Israeli aid, to the effect that it must not be used in the occupied territories.
example.tran: 美国按照惯例在对以色列的援助中提出了附加条款，大意是该援助不能用于被占领地区。

collins.def: Breakfast is the first meal of the day. It is usually eaten in the early part of the morning.

example.ex: What's  for breakfast?
example.tran: 早餐吃什么？

example.ex: ...breakfast cereal.
example.tran: 谷类早餐食品

collins.def: A cooked breakfast or a hot breakfast is a breakfast that consists of cooked food, such as bacon and eggs.
When you breakfast, you have breakfast.

example.ex: All the ladies breakfasted in their rooms.
example.tran: 所有女士都在她们的房间里吃早餐。

collins.def: A transaction is a piece of business, for example an act of buying or selling something.
When you sigh, you let out a deep breath, as a way of expressing feelings such as disappointment, tiredness, or pleasure.

example.ex: Michael sighed wearily...
example.tran: 迈克尔疲惫地叹了口气。

example.ex: Roberta sighed with relief...
example.tran: 罗伯塔松了口气。

collins.def: If you sigh something, you say it with a sigh.

example.ex: 'Oh, sorry. I forgot.' — 'Everyone forgets,' the girl sighed.
example.tran: “哦，对不起，我忘了。”——“每个人都有忘事的时候，”那女孩叹着气说道。

collins.def: If the wind sighs through a place, it moves through the place with a sound like a sigh.

example.ex: The wind sighed through the valley.
example.tran: 风在山谷里呼啸而过。

collins.def: If people breathe or heave a sigh of relief, they feel happy that something unpleasant has not happened or is no longer happening.

example.ex: There was a big sigh of relief once the economic reform plan was agreed...
example.tran: 经济改革计划一获批准，人们都大大舒了一口气。

example.ex: There was an audible sigh of relief in Washington when the foreign ministers decided to postpone the meeting.
example.tran: 各国外长决定推迟会议后，华盛顿如释重负。

collins.def: A GP is a doctor who does not specialize in any particular area of medicine, but who has a medical practice in which he or she treats all types of illness. GP is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'general practitioner'.

example.ex: Her husband called their local GP.
example.tran: 她的丈夫打电话叫来了当地的全科医生。

means: 遗失，失去（ lose的过去式和过去分词）
（使）失去（所需要的东西，尤指钱）

collins.def: Lost is the past tense and past participle of lose .
If you are lost or if you get lost, you do not know where you are or are unable to find your way.

example.ex: Barely had I set foot in the street when I realised I was lost...
example.tran: 我在街上没走几步就意识到自己迷路了。

example.ex: I took a wrong turn and we got lost in the mountains.
example.tran: 我拐错了弯，我们便在山里迷了路。

collins.def: If something is lost, or gets lost, you cannot find it, for example because you have forgotten where you put it.

example.ex: ...a lost book...
example.tran: 一本找不着的书

example.ex: My paper got lost...
example.tran: 我的论文丢了。

collins.def: If you feel lost, you feel very uncomfortable because you are in an unfamiliar situation.

example.ex: Of the funeral he remembered only the cold, the waiting, and feeling very lost...
example.tran: 关于葬礼，他只记得那冷冷的天，那久久的等候和那种茫然若失的感觉。

example.ex: I feel lost and lonely in a strange town alone.
example.tran: 在陌生的城镇里只身一人，我感到不知所措、孤单寂寞。

collins.tran: 迷惘的；无目标的；无方向的
collins.def: If you describe a person or group of people as lost, you think that they do not have a clear idea of what they want to do or achieve.

example.ex: They are a lost generation in search of an identity.
example.tran: 他们属于迷惘的一代，想要找寻自我。

collins.def: If you describe something as lost, you mean that you no longer have it or it no longer exists.

example.ex: ...their lost homeland.
example.tran: 他们失去的祖国

example.ex: ...a lost job or promotion...
example.tran: 失去的工作或晋升机会

collins.def: You use lost to refer to a period or state of affairs that existed in the past and no longer exists.

example.ex: He seemed to pine for his lost youth...
example.tran: 他似乎很怀念逝去的青春。

example.ex: They are links to a lost age.
example.tran: 它们是与一个逝去的年代相联系的纽带。

collins.def: If something is lost, it is not used properly and is considered wasted.

example.ex: Fox is not bitter about the lost opportunity to compete in the Games...
example.tran: 福克斯并没有对错过了参赛机会感到不忿。

example.ex: The advantage is lost.
example.tran: 错失优势。

collins.def: If you tell someone to get lost, you are telling them in a very rude way to go away.
If advice or a comment is lost on someone, they do not understand it or they pay no attention to it.

example.ex: The meaning of that was lost on me...
example.tran: 那意思我没听懂。

example.ex: This was a neighborhood where clearly you could be murdered for a pack of cigarettes, a fact that was not lost on me.
example.tran: 显然，在这个街区你可能会因为一包香烟而遭人杀害。这个事实我不是没注意到。

collins.def: If you are lost in thought, you give all your attention to what you are thinking about and do not notice what is going on around you.

example.ex: She was silent for a while, lost in thought, staring at the books littering the room.
example.tran: 一时间她默不作声，直想得入了神，双眼直愣愣地盯着房间里扔得到处都是的书。

collins.tran: 没有…就不开心；没有…就不知所措
collins.def: If you say that you would be lost without someone or something, you mean that you would be unhappy or unable to work properly without them.

example.ex: I'd be lost without you here...
example.tran: 没有你在这里我都不知怎么办好。

example.ex: I love the game and I'd be lost without golf now.
example.tran: 我热爱高尔夫，如果现在没有了它，我的生活就失去了乐趣。

collins.def: A poet is a person who writes poems.

example.ex: He was a painter and poet.
example.tran: 他既是画家又是诗人。

collins.def: A woman's breasts are the two soft, round parts on her chest that can produce milk to feed a baby.

example.ex: She wears a low-cut dress which reveals her breasts...
example.tran: 她穿了一件露乳沟的低胸连衣裙。

example.ex: As my newborn cuddled at my breast, her tiny fingers stroked my skin.
example.tran: 我刚出生的宝宝蜷伏在我胸前，细小的手指触碰着我的肌肤。

collins.def: A person's breast is the upper part of his or her chest.

example.ex: He struck his breast in a dramatic gesture.
example.tran: 他动作夸张地捶打着自己的胸膛。

collins.def: The breast is often considered to be the part of your body where your emotions are.

example.ex: The verse rose up to fire his breast with inspiration...
example.tran: 这首诗激发了他的灵感。

example.ex: The battle roared; a sound calculated to arouse the sublimest emotions in the breast of the soldier.
example.tran: 战场上吼声震天，意在唤起士兵们最昂扬的斗志。

collins.def: A bird's breast is the front part of its body.

example.ex: The cock's breast is tinged with chestnut.
example.tran: 这只公鸡胸部羽毛呈浅栗色，带有白色细条纹。

collins.def: The breast of a shirt, jacket, or coat is the part which covers the top part of the chest.

example.ex: He moved out from beneath an awning, reaching for something inside the breast of his overcoat...
example.tran: 他离开遮阳篷，手伸进大衣前胸部找东西。

example.ex: He reached into his breast pocket for his cigar case.
example.tran: 他把手伸进胸前口袋里拿雪茄烟盒。

collins.def: You can refer to piece of meat that is cut from the front of a bird or lamb as breast.

example.ex: ...a chicken breast with vegetables.
example.tran: 鸡脯肉拌蔬菜

example.ex: ...breast of lamb.
example.tran: 羊胸肉

collins.def: If you say that someone beats their breast, you are emphasizing that they are very angry or upset about something, or that they are pretending to be very angry or upset about it.

example.ex: The president beat his breast and called that deal a mistake.
example.tran: 总裁捶胸顿足，称那是个错误的交易。

collins.def: If you make a clean breast of something, you tell someone the truth about yourself or about something wrong that you have done.

example.ex: I might as well make a clean breast of it. I have been living as a woman since 1975.
example.tran: 我还是坦白的好。我从1975起就变成女人了。

collins.tran: (以手势、声音、行动等发出的)信号，暗号
collins.def: A signal is a gesture, sound, or action which is intended to give a particular message to the person who sees or hears it.

example.ex: They fired three distress signals...
example.tran: 他们发射了3次求救信号。

example.ex: As soon as it was dark, Mrs Evans gave the signal...
example.tran: 天一黑，埃文斯夫人就发出了信号。

collins.tran: (用手势、声音等)发信号，发暗号，示意
collins.def: If you signal to someone, you make a gesture or sound in order to send them a particular message.

example.ex: The United manager was to be seen frantically signalling to McClair...
example.tran: 一会儿可以看到曼联主教练拼命地朝麦克莱尔示意。

example.ex: He stood up, signalling to the officer that he had finished with his client...
example.tran: 他站起身，向警察示意他和他的当事人已经谈完了。

collins.def: If an event or action is a signal of something, it suggests that this thing exists or is going to happen.

example.ex: Kurdish leaders saw the visit as an important signal of support...
example.tran: 库尔德领导人将这次访问视作一种表示支持的重要信号。

example.ex: The first warning signals came in March...
example.tran: 第一次警示出现在3月份。

collins.def: If someone or something signals an event, they suggest that the event is happening or likely to happen.

example.ex: She will be signalling massive changes in energy policy...
example.tran: 她将暗示能源政策会有重大变化。

example.ex: Britain was signalling its readiness to have the embargo lifted...
example.tran: 英国表示愿意取消贸易禁令。

collins.def: A signal is a piece of equipment beside a railway, which indicates to train drivers whether they should stop the train or not.

collins.tran: (传输信息的无线电、光波或电流)信号
collins.def: A signal is a series of radio waves, light waves, or changes in electrical current which may carry information.

example.ex: ...high-frequency radio signals.
example.tran: 高频无线电信号

collins.def: You use signal to describe a success or failure when you are emphasizing the fact that it has occurred and are indicating that the consequences are significant.

example.ex: His final round was a signal triumph in a career marked by many sweet moments.
example.tran: 最后一场比赛的胜利在他充满欣喜的职业生涯中具有非凡的意义。

example.ex: ...John Major's signal failure to grab America's attention.
example.tran: 约翰·梅杰显然没有能够引起美国的注意

collins.def: Analysis is the process of considering something carefully or using statistical methods in order to understand it or explain it.

example.ex: Her criteria defy analysis...
example.tran: 她的标准让人搞不明白。

example.ex: We did an analysis of the way that government money has been spent in the past.
example.tran: 我们分析了政府资金过去的使用情况。

collins.def: Analysis is the scientific process of examining something in order to find out what it consists of.

example.ex: They collect blood samples for analysis at a national laboratory...
example.tran: 他们采集血样供一个国家实验室进行分析。

example.ex: Jacobsen based his conclusion on an analysis of the decay of samarium-147 into neodymium-143.
example.tran: 雅各布森得出的结论是基于对钐-147衰变成钕-143所作的分析。

collins.def: An analysis is an explanation or description that results from considering something carefully.

example.ex: ...coming up after the newscast, an analysis of President Bush's domestic policy.
example.tran: 在新闻报道之后是对布什总统国内政策的解读

collins.def: You use the expression in the final analysis or in the last analysis to indicate that the statement you are making is the most important or basic aspect of an issue.

example.ex: I'm on the right track and I think in the final analysis people will understand that...
example.tran: 我的思路对头，我认为最终人们会明白的。

example.ex: Violence in the last analysis produces more violence.
example.tran: 暴力最终会产生更多的暴力。

collins.tran: 未经加工的;天然状态的
collins.def: Raw materials or substances are in their natural state before being processed or used in manufacturing.

example.ex: We import raw materials and energy and export mainly industrial products.
example.tran: 我们进口原材料和能源，主要出口工业产品。

example.ex: ...two ships carrying raw sugar from Cuba.
example.tran: 两艘来自古巴装有粗糖的船

collins.def: Raw food is food that is eaten uncooked, that has not yet been cooked, or that has not been cooked enough.

example.ex: ...a popular dish made of raw fish...
example.tran: 受欢迎的生鱼菜肴

example.ex: This versatile vegetable can be eaten raw or cooked...
example.tran: 这种蔬菜有多种吃法，既可生吃也可烹调后食用。

collins.def: If a part of your body is raw, it is red and painful, perhaps because the skin has come off or has been burnt.

example.ex: ...the drag of the rope against the raw flesh of my shoulders...
example.tran: 绳子摩擦着我蹭破了皮的肩头

example.ex: Her feet hurt and her hands were rubbed raw from unaccustomed work.
example.tran: 这种活儿她根本做不习惯，双脚疼痛，双手也蹭破了皮。

collins.tran: （情感）不加掩饰的，原始的，朴实的
collins.def: Raw emotions are strong basic feelings or responses which are not weakened by other influences.

example.ex: ...the raw passions of nationalism...
example.tran: 朴实的民族主义热情

example.ex: Her grief was still raw and he did not know how to help her.
example.tran: 她仍然沉浸在悲伤中，他不知道如何帮她才好。

collins.def: If you describe something as raw, you mean that it is simple, powerful, and real.

example.ex: ...the raw power of instinct.
example.tran: 本能的强大力量

example.ex: ...the raw vitality of his earlier painting.
example.tran: 他早期绘画的强大生命力

collins.def: Raw data is facts or information that has not yet been sorted, analysed, or prepared for use.

example.ex: Analyses were conducted on the raw data.
example.tran: 对原始数据进行了分析。

example.ex: ...a statistical model that fully adjusts the census's raw figures.
example.tran: 全面调整这项普查的原始数据的统计模型

collins.def: If you describe someone in a new job as raw, or as a raw recruit, you mean that they lack experience in that job.

example.ex: ...replacing experienced men with raw recruits...
example.tran: 用新手替代有经验的人

example.ex: Davies is still raw but his potential shows.
example.tran: 戴维斯还是新人，但已经显示出了他的潜力。

collins.def: Raw weather feels unpleasantly cold.

example.ex: Once they cleared the housetops, the wind was raw and biting.
example.tran: 他们清扫完屋顶后，寒风刺骨。

example.ex: ...a raw December morning.
example.tran: 12月一个阴冷的早上

collins.def: Raw sewage is sewage that has not been treated to make it cleaner.

example.ex: ...contamination of bathing water by raw sewage.
example.tran: 洗澡用水被未经处理的污水污染

collins.def: If you say that you are getting a raw deal, you mean that you are being treated unfairly.

example.ex: They feel that Quebec is getting a raw deal...
example.tran: 他们觉得魁北克省受到了不公平的待遇。

example.ex: I think women have a raw deal.
example.tran: 我认为妇女受到了不公正的待遇。

collins.tran: 未开化的；原生态的；处于蒙昧状态的；原原本本的
collins.def: You use in the raw to describe something that is in its true state, and has not been made civilized or respectable.

example.ex: This is nature in the raw...
example.tran: 这是自然的原生态。

example.ex: He also wanted to see Bangladesh in the raw...
example.tran: 他也想看看原生态的孟加拉国是什么样子。

collins.def: If you suspend something, you delay it or stop it from happening for a while or until a decision is made about it.

example.ex: The union suspended strike action this week...
example.tran: 这周工会暂停了罢工。

example.ex: A UN official said aid programs will be suspended until there's adequate protection for relief convoys.
example.tran: 一名联合国官员说将会暂停援助项目，直到援助车队能够得到充分的保护为止。

collins.def: If someone is suspended, they are prevented from holding a particular job or position for a fixed length of time or until a decision is made about them.

example.ex: Julie was suspended from her job shortly after the incident...
example.tran: 出事后不久，朱莉就被停职了。

example.ex: Buchanan was suspended for a year from Georgetown University after brawling with police...
example.tran: 布坎南因与警察发生肢体冲突而被乔治敦大学停学一年。

collins.def: If something is suspended from a high place, it is hanging from that place.

example.ex: ...a mobile of birds or nursery rhyme characters which could be suspended over the cot.
example.tran: 能悬挂在摇篮上方、由小鸟或童谣故事人物组成的风动玩具

example.ex: ...chandeliers suspended on heavy chains from the ceiling.
example.tran: 悬挂在天花板上、由粗重吊链吊着的枝形吊灯

collins.def: The moon is the object that you can often see in the sky at night. It goes round the Earth once every four weeks, and as it does so its appearance changes from a circle to part of a circle.

example.ex: ...the first man on the moon...
example.tran: 登上月球的第一人

example.ex: There will be no moon.
example.tran: 月亮不会出来了。

collins.def: A moon is an object similar to a small planet that travels around a planet.

example.ex: ...Neptune's large moon.
example.tran: 海王星的大卫星

collins.tran: 虚度光阴;懒散度日;闲逛
collins.def: If you are mooning around, you are spending time doing nothing in particular, for example because you feel unhappy or lazy, or are worried about something.

example.ex: Lettie was mooning around all  morning, doing nothing...
example.tran: 莱蒂混了一上午，什么也没干。

example.ex: My working days were spent mooning round his department, trying to sneak a chance encounter.
example.tran: 上班时我在他的部门转来转去，暗中寻找巧遇他的机会。

collins.def: If you moon at someone, you turn your back to them and show them your bare bottom.
If you say that something happens once in a blue moon, you are emphasizing that it does not happen very often at all.

example.ex: Once in a blue moon you get some problems.
example.tran: 极少会碰到麻烦。

collins.tran: 非常高兴;乐翻了天;狂喜
collins.def: If you say that you are over the moon, you mean that you are very pleased about something.
Joy is a feeling of great happiness.

example.ex: Salter shouted with joy.
example.tran: 索尔特欣喜地叫喊着。

example.ex: ...tears of joy.
example.tran: 喜悦的泪水

collins.tran: 令人高兴的事（或人）；乐事；乐趣
collins.def: A joy is something or someone that makes you feel happy or gives you great pleasure.

example.ex: One can never learn all there is to know about cooking, and that is one of the joys of being a chef...
example.tran: 钻研烹饪之道是永无止境的，这也是当厨师的乐趣之一。

example.ex: It was a joy to see her looking so well.
example.tran: 看到她气色这么好真叫人高兴。

collins.def: If you get no joy, you do not have success or luck in achieving what you are trying to do.

example.ex: They expect no joy from the vote itself...
example.tran: 他们对投票本身不抱任何希望。

example.ex: If you don't get any joy, get in touch with your local councillor.
example.tran: 如果你没得到任何结果，请和本地议员联系。

collins.def: If you say that someone is jumping for joy, you mean that they are very pleased or happy about something.

example.ex: He jumped for joy on being told the news.
example.tran: 得知这个消息，他高兴得手舞足蹈。

collins.def: A federation is a federal country.

example.ex: ...the Russian Federation.
example.tran: 俄罗斯联邦

collins.tran: (社团或组织的)同盟，联盟，联合会
collins.def: A federation is a group of societies or other organizations which have joined together, usually because they share a common interest.

example.ex: ...the British Athletic Federation...
example.tran: 英国田径总会

example.ex: The organization emerged from a federation of six national agencies.
example.tran: 该组织由 6 个全国性机构联合而成。

collins.def: A gap is a space between two things or a hole in the middle of something solid.

example.ex: He pulled the thick curtains together, leaving just a narrow gap.
example.tran: 他拉上厚厚的窗帘，仅留下一条狭窄的缝隙。

example.ex: ...the wind tearing through gaps in the window frames.
example.tran: 从窗框缝隙中呼啸而入的风

collins.def: A gap is a period of time when you are not busy or when you stop doing something that you normally do.

example.ex: There followed a gap of four years, during which William joined the Army.
example.tran: 随后的4年时间，威廉在陆军服役。

collins.def: If there is something missing from a situation that prevents it being complete or satisfactory, you can say that there is a gap .
