example.ex: She would joke about her appearance...
example.tran: 她会拿自己的长相开玩笑。

example.ex: Lorna was laughing and joking with Trevor...
example.tran: 洛娜边笑边和特雷弗打趣。

collins.def: A joke is something untrue that you tell another person in order to amuse yourself.

example.ex: It was probably just a joke to them, but it wasn't funny to me.
example.tran: 对他们而言，那可能仅仅是个恶作剧，但对我来说，它一点也不好笑。

collins.def: If you joke, you tell someone something that is not true in order to amuse yourself.

example.ex: Don't get defensive, Charlie. I was only joking...
example.tran: 别这么大戒心，查理。我只不过是开开玩笑。

example.ex: 'I wish you made as much fuss of me,' Vera joked.
example.tran: “我倒真希望你也能这么好好地关心我一下，”薇拉打趣道。

collins.tran: 荒唐可笑的事（或人）；笑料；笑柄
collins.def: If you say that something or someone is a joke, you think they are ridiculous and do not deserve respect.

example.ex: It's ridiculous, it's pathetic, it's a joke...
example.tran: 这真荒谬，简直是可悲、可笑。

example.ex: The police investigation was a joke. A total cover-up.
example.tran: 警方的调查简直荒唐可笑，完全是在掩盖真相。

collins.tran: （恼人或令人担心的事）不可理喻，使人无法接受
collins.def: If you say that an annoying or worrying situation is beyond a joke, you are emphasizing that it is worse than you think is fair or reasonable.

example.ex: Giving an arsonist a lighter is beyond a joke...
example.tran: 把打火机交给纵火犯简直是不可理喻。

example.ex: I'm not afraid of a fair fight but this is beginning to get beyond a joke.
example.tran: “我不怕公平地打上一架，但是这玩笑有点儿开过头了。”

collins.tran: 拿（严肃或悲惨的事情）开玩笑；对…一笑置之
collins.def: If you make a joke of something, you laugh at it even though it is in fact rather serious or sad.

example.ex: I wish I had your courage, Michael, to make a joke of it like that.
example.tran: 我真希望能有你那样的勇气，迈克尔，能把事情那么一笑置之。

collins.tran: 不是轻而易举的事；不是闹着玩的
collins.def: If you describe a situation as no joke, you are emphasizing that it is very difficult or unpleasant.

example.ex: Two hours on a bus is no joke, is it?
example.tran: 在公交车上坐上两个小时可不轻松，对吧？

collins.def: If you say that the joke is on a particular person, you mean that they have been made to look very foolish by something.

example.ex: 'For once,' he said, 'the joke's on me. And it's not very funny.'
example.tran: “他说：“这一次玩笑反而开到自己身上来了。这一点儿也不好玩。”

collins.tran: 开不起玩笑；经不起玩笑话
collins.def: If you say that someone cannot take a joke, you are criticizing them for getting upset or angry at something you think is funny.

example.ex: 'What's the matter with you, Simon?' Curly said. 'Can't  you take a joke?'
example.tran: “西蒙，你怎么回事？”柯利说。“你难道开不起玩笑么？”

collins.tran: （用于表示吃惊或认为不可理喻）你一定是在开玩笑吧
collins.def: You say you're  joking or you must be joking to someone when they have just told you something that is so surprising or unreasonable that you find it difficult to believe.

example.ex: You're joking. Are you serious?...
example.tran: 你准是在开玩笑。你是认真的吗？

example.ex: One hundred and forty quid for a pair of headphones, you've got to be joking!
example.tran: 一副耳机140英镑，你不是在开玩笑吧！

collins.def: If something spins or if you spin it, it turns quickly around a central point.

example.ex: The latest discs, used for small portable computers, spin 3600 times a minute...
example.tran: 用在小型便携式计算机上的最新光盘转速为每分钟 3,600 转。

example.ex: The Earth spins on its own axis...
example.tran: 地球绕着地轴自转。

collins.tran: (用甩干机或洗衣机)甩干（衣服），给…脱水
collins.def: When you spin washing, it is turned round and round quickly in a spin drier or a washing machine to get the water out.

example.ex: Just spin the washing and it's nearly dry.
example.tran: 只需要将洗好的衣物脱水，它就差不多干了。

collins.def: If your head is spinning, you feel unsteady or confused, for example because you are drunk, ill, or excited.

example.ex: My head was spinning from the wine...
example.tran: 我喝了葡萄酒后晕乎乎的。

example.ex: All those figures make my poor head spin.
example.tran: 那么多数字把我搞得头昏脑胀。

collins.tran: 带倾向性的解释(或说法)
collins.def: If someone puts a certain spin on an event or situation, they interpret it and try to present it in a particular way.

example.ex: He interpreted the vote as support for the constitution and that is the spin his supporters are putting on the results today.
example.tran: 他把这次投票解释为对宪法的支持，这也是他的支持者对今天的投票结果所作的解释。

example.ex: ...the wholly improper political spin given to the report, particularly by The New York Times.
example.tran: 报道中带有的根本不恰当的政治倾向，特别是《纽约时报》的报道

collins.def: In politics, spin is the way in which political parties try to present everything they do in a positive way to the public and the media.

example.ex: The public is sick of spin and tired of promises. It's time for politicians to act.
example.tran: 公众厌烦了那些有倾向性的报道和种种许诺。该是用政绩说话的时候了。

collins.def: If you go for a spin or take a car for a spin, you make a short journey in a car just to enjoy yourself.
If someone spins a story, they give you an account of something that is untrue or only partly true.

example.ex: He was surprised, and annoyed that she had spun a story which was too good to be condemned as a simple lie.
example.tran: 他很惊讶，也很生气，因为她编的故事太真实了，甚至不能被斥为一个简单的谎言。

collins.def: When people spin, they make thread by twisting together pieces of a fibre such as wool or cotton using a device or machine.

example.ex: Michelle will also spin a customer's wool fleece to specification at a cost of $2.25 an ounce.
example.tran: 米歇尔也会按顾客的要求为其纺羊毛呢，每盎司收费 2.25 美元。

collins.tran: (飞机的)螺旋式急遽下坠，向下旋冲
collins.def: If a plane goes into a spin, it falls very rapidly towards the ground in a spiral movement.

collins.tran: (网球或板球运动中球的）快速旋转，旋转运动
collins.def: In a game such as tennis or cricket, if you put spin on a ball, you deliberately make it spin rapidly when you hit it or throw it.
If you say that someone is in a spin or in a flat spin, you mean that they are confused and unable to act sensibly because of something that has happened.

example.ex: Poor Jane was in rather a spin about the party.
example.tran: 可怜的简对这次聚会真有些不知所措。

collins.def: Ownership of something is the state of owning it.

example.ex: On January 23rd, America decided to relax its rules on the foreign ownership of its airlines.
example.tran: 1月23日，美国决定放宽对外国持有美国航空公司所有权的管制规定。

example.ex: ...the growth of home ownership in Britain...
example.tran: 英国拥有房屋者人数的增加

collins.def: When older people retire, they leave their job and usually stop working completely.

example.ex: At the age when most people retire, he is ready to face a new career...
example.tran: 在大多数人都退休的年龄，他却准备好面对新的职业。

example.ex: Although their careers are important many said they plan to retire at 50...
example.tran: 虽然事业很重要，但很多人都说他们打算50岁退休。

collins.tran: （从体育运动中）退役;退出（比赛）
collins.def: When a sports player retires from their sport, they stop playing in competitions. When they retire from a race or a match, they stop competing in it.

example.ex: I have decided to retire from Formula One racing at the end of the season...
example.tran: 我已经决定在这个赛季末结束一级方程式赛车生涯。

example.ex: One of the most serious injuries was to Simon Littlejohn, who was forced to retire from the race with a leg injury.
example.tran: 伤势最重的人之一是西蒙·利特尔约翰，他腿部受伤，被迫退出了比赛。

collins.def: If you retire to another room or place, you go there.

example.ex: Eisenhower left the White House and retired to his farm in Gettysburg.
example.tran: 艾森豪威尔离开白宫，退隐到他在葛底斯堡的农场。

collins.def: When a jury in a court of law retires, the members of it leave the court in order to decide whether someone is guilty or innocent.

example.ex: The jury will retire to consider its verdict today.
example.tran: 陪审团今天将退庭商议裁决结果。

collins.def: When you retire, you go to bed.

example.ex: She retires early most nights, exhausted...
example.tran: 她大多数晚上都觉得精疲力尽，很早就睡了。

example.ex: Some time after midnight, he retired to bed.
example.tran: 午夜过后，他上床就寝。

means: 斗志昂扬的，富于战斗性的
富有战斗精神的人，斗士

collins.def: You use militant to describe people who believe in something very strongly and are active in trying to bring about political or social change, often in extreme ways that other people find unacceptable.

example.ex: Militant mineworkers in the Ukraine have voted for a one-day stoppage next month.
example.tran: 乌克兰激进的矿工们已经投票决定下个月罢工一天。

example.ex: ...one of the most active militant groups.
example.tran: 最为活跃的激进团体之一

collins.def: If something moves or is put onto an object or surface, it is then on that object or surface.

example.ex: I took my bags inside, lowered myself onto the bed and switched on the TV...
example.tran: 我把包拎进屋，往床上一倒，然后打开了电视机。

example.ex: Smear Vaseline on to your baby's skin to prevent soreness.
example.tran: 给孩子皮肤上抹些凡士林以防止肿痛。

collins.def: You can sometimes use onto to mention the place or area that someone moves into.

example.ex: The players emerged onto the field...
example.tran: 运动员入场了。

example.ex: ...when the photographer sets off onto the moors...
example.tran: 摄影师动身踏入高沼时

collins.def: You can use onto to introduce the place towards which a light or someone's look is directed.

example.ex: ...the metal part of the door onto which the sun had been shining...
example.tran: 在阳光照耀下闪闪发亮的门的金属部分

example.ex: The colours rotated round on a disc and were reflected onto the wall behind.
example.tran: 圆盘上色彩流转，反射到后面的墙上。

collins.def: You can use onto to introduce a place that you would immediately come to after leaving another place that you have just mentioned, because they are next to each other.

example.ex: ...windows opening onto carved black-wood balconies...
example.tran: 开向黑檀雕花阳台的窗户

example.ex: The door opened onto a lighted hallway.
example.tran: 这扇门通往亮着灯的走廊。

collins.def: When you change the position of your body, you use onto to introduce the part your body which is now supporting you.

example.ex: As he stepped backwards she fell onto her knees, then onto her face...
example.tran: 他向后退时，她双膝跪倒在地，接着迎面倒了下去。

example.ex: Puffing a little, Mabel shifted her weight onto her feet...
example.tran: 梅布尔喘了口气，把身体重心移到脚上。

collins.def: When you get onto a bus, train, or plane, you enter it in order to travel somewhere.

example.ex: As he got on to the plane, he asked me how I was feeling...
example.tran: 他上飞机时问我感觉如何。

example.ex: Who can fold up a pushchair, toddler and shopping and then get them all onto the bus?...
example.tran: 谁有那本事一手收起婴儿推车，一手抱着刚会走路的孩子，还得提着刚买的东西，然后挤上公共汽车？

collins.tran: （用于 hold，hang，cling 等动词后，表示抓紧或牢牢固定）在…上
collins.def: Onto is used after verbs such as 'hold', 'hang', and 'cling' to indicate what someone is holding firmly or where something is being held firmly.

example.ex: The reflector is held onto the sides of the spacecraft with a frame...
example.tran: 反射器通过支架牢牢地固定在航天器的侧面。

example.ex: She was conscious of a second man hanging on to the rail...
example.tran: 她意识到还有第二个人紧紧抓着栏杆。

collins.def: If people who are talking get onto a different subject, they begin talking about it.

example.ex: Let's get on to more important matters...
example.tran: 咱们谈谈更重要的事吧。

example.ex: So, if we could just move onto something else?
example.tran: 那么我们可不可以干脆谈点别的？

collins.tran: 成为（列表、系统等）的一部分
collins.def: You can sometimes use onto to indicate that something or someone becomes included as a part of a list or system.

example.ex: The Macedonian question had failed to get on to the agenda...
example.tran: 马其顿问题没能列入议事日程。

example.ex: The pill itself has changed a lot since it first came onto the market...
example.tran: 该药片本身自首次进入市场以来已经有了很大改变。

collins.def: If someone is onto something, they are about to discover something important.

example.ex: He leaned across the table and whispered to me, 'I'm really onto something.'...
example.tran: 他从桌上俯过身来对我低声说道：“我真的就快有重大发现了。”

example.ex: Archaeologists knew they were onto something big when they started digging.
example.tran: 考古学家在发掘之初就知道他们将有重大发现。

collins.tran: 发现（某人做坏事）；对…觉察；对…知悉
collins.def: If someone is onto you, they have discovered that you are doing something illegal or wrong.

example.ex: He did not want Pollard to become suspicious that he was now onto him...
example.tran: 他不想让波拉德怀疑他已察觉到其不轨行为。

example.ex: I had told people what he had been doing, so now the police were onto him.
example.tran: 我已将他的所作所为告诉了别人，因此现在警方正在追查他。

means: 沿着一小径或道路前进

collins.def: If you trace the origin or development of something, you find out or describe how it started or developed.

example.ex: The exhibition traces the history of graphic design in America from the 19th century to the present...
example.tran: 展览追溯了美国从19世纪至今的平面设计历史。

example.ex: I first went there to trace my roots, visiting my mum's home island of Jamaica…
example.tran: 我最初到那里是为了寻根，探访我妈妈的故乡牙买加岛。

collins.def: If you trace someone or something, you find them after looking for them.

example.ex: Police are anxious to trace two men seen leaving the house just before 8am...
example.tran: 早上将近8点时有人看到两名男子离开那所房子，警方急于找到他们。

example.ex: We are currently trying to trace the whereabouts of certain sums of money…
example.tran: 我们目前正试图找到某些钱款的下落。

collins.tran: (用手指或脚尖等在表面上)勾画…的轮廓，描绘，勾勒
collins.def: If you trace something such as a pattern or a shape, for example with your finger or toe, you mark its outline on a surface.

example.ex: I traced the course of the river on the map.
example.tran: 我在地图上勾勒出这条河的流向。

collins.tran: (把透明纸覆盖在底样上)映描，描摹
collins.def: If you trace a picture, you copy it by covering it with a piece of transparent paper and drawing over the lines underneath.

example.ex: She learned to draw by tracing pictures out of old storybooks.
example.tran: 她通过描摹旧故事书上的图画学会了画画。

collins.def: A trace of something is a very small amount of it.

example.ex: Wash them in cold water to remove all traces of sand...
example.tran: 用冷水冲洗它们以清除所有的沙子。

example.ex: He took great pains to write on his subject without a trace of sensationalism.
example.tran: 他尽力不带一丝哗众取宠的色彩来写作他的题材。

collins.def: A trace is a sign which shows you that someone or something has been in a place.

example.ex: The local church has traces of fifteenth-century frescoes…
example.tran: 当地教堂仍留有 15 世纪壁画的遗迹。

example.ex: There's been no trace of my aunt and uncle...
example.tran: 没有我姑姑、姑夫的踪迹。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something sinks without trace or sinks without a trace, you mean that they stop existing or stop being successful very suddenly and completely.

example.ex: The Social Democratic Party has sunk without trace at these elections...
example.tran: 社会民主党在这些选举中已销声匿迹。

example.ex: Pop groups are like Olympic swimmers — they hit gold once, then they sink without trace.
example.tran: 流行乐队就像奥林匹克游泳选手——拿到一次金牌后就无声无息了。

collins.def: If you make an assumption that something is true or will happen, you accept that it is true or will happen, often without any real proof.

example.ex: They have taken a wrong turning in their assumption that all men and women think alike...
example.tran: 他们错误地设想所有男女均见解一致。

example.ex: Dr Subroto questioned the scientific assumption on which the global warming theory is based...
example.tran: 苏布罗托博士质疑全球变暖理论所依据的科学假设。

collins.def: Someone's assumption of power or responsibility is their taking of it.

example.ex: The government have retained the support which greeted their assumption of power last March.
example.tran: 自从在刚过去的三月掌权以来，政府的支持率依旧未减。

means: 尤指关上或断裂的声音)啪嗒声

collins.tran: (使)咔嚓一声折断;(使)啪的一声绷断
collins.def: If something snaps or if you snap it, it breaks suddenly, usually with a sharp cracking noise.

example.ex: He shifted his weight and a twig snapped...
example.tran: 他挪了一下身体的重心，一根树枝咔嚓一声断了。

example.ex: The brake pedal had just snapped off...
example.tran: 刹车踏板刚刚啪的一声绷断了。

collins.tran: (使)发出吧嗒一声(合上或打开)
collins.def: If you snap something into a particular position, or if it snaps into that position, it moves quickly into that position, with a sharp sound.

example.ex: He snapped the notebook shut...
example.tran: 他啪的一声合上了笔记本。

example.ex: He snapped the cap on his ballpoint...
example.tran: 他吧嗒一声把笔帽扣在了圆珠笔上。

collins.def: If you snap your fingers, you make a sharp sound by moving your middle finger quickly across your thumb, for example in order to accompany music or to order someone to do something.

example.ex: She had millions of listeners snapping their fingers to her first single...
example.tran: 百万听众和着她第一首歌的节拍打着响指。

example.ex: He snapped his fingers, and Wilson produced a sheet of paper...
example.tran: 他打了个响指，威尔逊便递过一张纸来。

collins.tran: 恶声恶气地说;声色俱厉地说
collins.def: If someone snaps at you, they speak to you in a sharp, unfriendly way.

example.ex: 'Of course I don't know her,' Roger snapped...
example.tran: 罗杰恶声恶气地说：“我当然不认识她。”

example.ex: I'm sorry, Casey, I didn't mean to snap at you like that.
example.tran: 对不起，凯西，我不是有意要跟你凶的。

collins.tran: 突然精神崩溃;突然失控
collins.def: If someone snaps, or if something snaps inside them, they suddenly stop being calm and become very angry because the situation has become too tense or too difficult for them.

example.ex: He finally snapped when she prevented their children from visiting him one weekend...
example.tran: 当她不准孩子们在某个周末去看他的时候，他终于控制不住自己了。

example.ex: For the first and only time Grant's self-control snapped...
example.tran: 生平第一次也是唯一的一次，格兰特失控了。

collins.def: If an animal such as a dog snaps at you, it opens and shuts its jaws quickly near you, as if it were going to bite you.

example.ex: His teeth clicked as he snapped at my ankle...
example.tran: 它猛地朝我的脚脖子咬下去，牙齿还咔咔直响。

example.ex: The poodle yapped and snapped.
example.tran: 卷毛狗又吠又咬。

collins.tran: (决定、行动等)突然的，仓促的，鲁莽的
collins.def: A snap decision or action is one that is taken suddenly, often without careful thought.

example.ex: I think this is too important for a snap decision...
example.tran: 我认为，这件事非常重要，不能仓促作决定。

example.ex: It's important not to make snap judgments...
example.tran: 不要急于作出判断——这一点很重要。

collins.def: A snap is a photograph.

example.ex: ...a snap my mother took last year.
example.tran: 我母亲去年拍的照片

collins.def: If you snap someone or something, you take a photograph of them.

example.ex: He was the first ever non-British photographer to be invited to snap a royal.
example.tran: 他是有史以来第一个应邀为王室成员拍照的非英籍摄影师。

collins.tran: “捉对儿”(一种简单的扑克牌游戏，参加者轮流亮牌叠成一叠，争取在出现同点数或同人头的两张牌时，先喊snap以赢得整叠牌)
collins.def: Snap is a simple British card game in which the players take turns to put cards down on a pile, and try to be the first to shout 'snap' when two cards with the same number or picture are put down.

collins.tran: “哟！”(对两件物品相似之极发出的惊叹)
collins.def: You can say 'Snap!' as an expression of surprise when you realize that two things are the same or very similar, for example if you meet a friend wearing the same shirt as you.
A snap is the same as a snap fastener .
A bass is a man with a very deep singing voice.

example.ex: ...the great Russian bass Chaliapin.
example.tran: 伟大的俄罗斯男低音歌唱家夏利亚宾

collins.def: A bass drum, guitar, or other musical instrument is one that produces a very deep sound.

example.ex: ...bass guitarist Dee Murray.
example.tran: 低音吉他手迪伊·默里

collins.def: In popular music, a bass is a bass guitar or a double bass .

example.ex: They had a bass and a piano and a sax and percussion.
example.tran: 他们有一把低音吉他、一架钢琴、一管萨克斯和打击乐器。

example.ex: ...Dave Ranson on bass and Kenneth Blevins on drums...
example.tran: 戴夫·兰森弹低音吉他，肯尼思·布莱文斯打鼓

collins.tran: （立体声音响或收音机等的）低音部，低音部旋钮
collins.def: On a stereo system or radio, the bass is the ability to reproduce the lower musical notes. The bass is also the knob which controls this.

example.ex: ...larger models which will then give more bass and a higher fidelity sound.
example.tran: 能够听到更多低音和高保真音效的更大的型号

collins.def: Bass are edible fish that are found in rivers and the sea. There are several types of bass.

example.ex: They unloaded their catch of cod and bass.
example.tran: 他们把捕到的鳕鱼和鲈鱼卸下来。

means: 规定的，必须穿戴的，必须使用的

collins.def: Regulations are rules made by a government or other authority in order to control the way something is done or the way people behave.

example.ex: The European Union has proposed new regulations to control the hours worked by its employees...
example.tran: 欧盟已经就其雇员工作时间的控制问题拟定了新的规章。

example.ex: Under pressure from the American government, Fiat and other manufacturers obeyed the new safety regulations.
example.tran: 在美国政府的压力之下，菲亚特和其他汽车制造商同意遵守新的安全规定。

collins.tran: (常指通过规章制度进行的)调控，管理，控制
collins.def: Regulation is the controlling of an activity or process, usually by means of rules.

example.ex: Social services also have responsibility for the regulation of nurseries...
example.tran: 社会福利部门也有责任对托儿所进行管理。

example.ex: Some in the market now want government regulation in order to reduce costs.
example.tran: 现在一些市场人士希望政府实施调控，以降低成本。

collins.def: The work that you do for a living is the work that you do in order to earn the money that you need.

example.ex: Father never talked about what he did for a living...
example.tran: 父亲从不谈他的谋生之道。

example.ex: He earns his living doing all kinds of things.
example.tran: 他做各种各样的活计来谋生。

collins.tran: 生活质量；生活素质；生活（方式）
collins.def: You use living when you are talking about the quality of people's  daily lives.

example.ex: Olivia has always been a model of healthy living.
example.tran: 奥利维娅一向是健康生活的楷模。

example.ex: ...the stresses of urban living.
example.tran: 城市生活的压力

collins.def: You use living to talk about the places where people relax when they are not working.

example.ex: The spacious living quarters were on the second floor...
example.tran: 宽敞的生活区位于3楼。

example.ex: The study links the main living area to the kitchen.
example.tran: 书房把主要的生活区与厨房连在一起。

collins.def: The living are people who are alive, rather than people who have died.

example.ex: The young man is dead. We have only to consider the living.
example.tran: 这位年轻人已经死了。我们只能考虑在生之人。

collins.tran: 艰难度日，勉强糊口（美国英语中作scrape out a living或scratch out a living）
collins.def: If you say that someone scrapes a living or scratches a living, you mean that they manage to earn enough to live on, but it is very difficult. In American English, you say they scrape out a living or scratch out a living .

example.ex: He almost manages to scrape a living as an artist.
example.tran: 他靠当艺术家来勉强混口饭吃。

collins.def: Electricity is a form of energy that can be carried by wires and is used for heating and lighting, and to provide power for machines.

example.ex: We moved into a cabin with electricity but no running water...
example.tran: 我们搬进一栋通了电但没有自来水的小屋。

example.ex: The electricity had been cut off.
example.tran: 停电了。

collins.def: Someone who is prominent is important.

example.ex: ...a prominent member of the Law Society.
example.tran: 法律协会的重要成员

example.ex: ...the children of very prominent or successful parents.
example.tran: 杰出或成功人士的孩子

collins.tran: 显著的；突出的；鲜艳的；引人注目的
collins.def: Something that is prominent is very noticeable or is an important part of something else.

example.ex: Here the window plays a prominent part in the design.
example.tran: 这里窗户在设计中起着非常重要的作用。

example.ex: ...Romania's most prominent independent newspaper.
example.tran: 罗马尼亚最著名的独立报纸

collins.def: A guerrilla is someone who fights as part of an unofficial army, usually against an official army or police force.

example.ex: The guerrillas threatened to kill their hostages.
example.tran: 这些游击队员威胁要杀死人质。

example.ex: ...a guerrilla war.
example.tran: 游击战

collins.def: An economist is a person who studies, teaches, or writes about economics.
A businessman is a man who works in business.
Your teeth are the hard white objects in your mouth, which you use for biting and chewing.

example.ex: She had very pretty straight teeth...
example.tran: 她有一口漂亮整齐的牙齿。

example.ex: If a tooth feels very loose, your dentist may recommend that it's taken out.
example.tran: 如果某颗牙松动得很厉害，牙医会建议把它拔掉。

collins.tran: 齿状物;(梳子、锯、齿轮、拉链等的)齿
collins.def: The teeth of something such as a comb, saw, cog, or zip are the parts that stick out in a row on its edge.

example.ex: The front cog has 44 teeth.
example.tran: 前齿轮有 44 个齿。

collins.tran: (官方组织、法律等的)威力，效力
collins.def: If you say that something such as an official group or a law has teeth, you mean that it has power and is able to be effective.

example.ex: The opposition argues that the new council will be unconstitutional and without teeth...
example.tran: 反对派争辩说新委员会不但违反宪法，而且没有效力。

example.ex: The law must have teeth, and it must be enforced.
example.tran: 法律必须拥有效力，而且必须强制实施。

collins.def: Someone who is armed to the teeth is armed with a lot of weapons or with very effective weapons.

example.ex: Both sides were armed to the teeth.
example.tran: 双方都全副武装。

collins.tran: 获得初步经验(或训练);起步
collins.def: If you say that someone cut their teeth doing a particular thing, at a particular time, or in a particular place, you mean that that is how, when, or where they began their career and learned some of their skills.

example.ex: ...director John Glen, who cut his teeth on Bond movies...
example.tran: 从邦德电影开始初试牛刀的导演约翰·格伦

example.ex: He cut his teeth in the sixties as director of Edinburgh's Traverse Theatre.
example.tran: 他 60 年代刚出道时在爱丁堡特拉弗斯剧院担任导演。

collins.tran: 使人感到极其不舒服(或恼怒)
collins.def: If you say that something sets your teeth on edge, you mean that you find it extremely unpleasant or irritating.

example.ex: Their voices set your teeth on edge.
example.tran: 他们的声音让你浑身不舒服。

collins.tran: 奋力争取/竭尽全力阻止
collins.def: If you fight tooth and nail to do something, you do everything you can in order to achieve it. If you fight something tooth and nail, you do everything you can in order to prevent it.

example.ex: He fought tooth and nail to keep his job...
example.tran: 他竭尽全力保住自己的工作。

example.ex: Unions pledged to fight any compulsory redundancies 'tooth and nail'.
example.tran: 工会许诺会“竭尽所能地”阻止任何强制裁员。

collins.def: If you describe a task or activity as something you can get your teeth into, you mean that you like it because it is interesting, complex, and makes you think hard.

example.ex: This role gave her something to get her teeth into...
example.tran: 这一角色让她全情投入其中。

example.ex: They have to get involved and get their teeth into some police work.
example.tran: 他们必须参与进来，全力投入到一些警务工作中。

collins.def: If you do something in the teeth of a difficulty or danger, you do it in spite of the difficulty or danger.

example.ex: I was battling my way along the promenade in the teeth of a force ten gale...
example.tran: 我不顾十级大风沿着步行街挣扎前行。

example.ex: In the teeth of the longest recession since the 1930s, the company continues to perform well.
example.tran: 尽管面对 20 世纪 30 年代以来持续时间最长的经济衰退，这家公司却一直经营良好。

collins.tran: 满口谎话;睁着眼说瞎话
collins.def: If you say that someone is lying through their teeth, you are emphasizing that they are telling lies.
If you describe someone as long in the tooth, you are saying unkindly or humorously that they are old or getting old.

example.ex: Aren't I a bit long in the tooth to start being an undergraduate?
example.tran: 我现在才去读大学本科不是有点太老了吗？

collins.def: If you have a sweet tooth, you like sweet food very much.

example.ex: Add more honey if you have a sweet tooth.
example.tran: 如果你喜欢吃甜的就多加点蜂蜜。

collins.def: If a bad or undesirable situation is your fault, you caused it or are responsible for it.

example.ex: There was no escaping the fact: it was all his fault...
example.tran: 这全是他的错，这是无法回避的事实。

example.ex: A few borrowers will find themselves in trouble with their repayments through no fault of their own.
example.tran: 一些借款人会发现，他们还款遇到了麻烦，但根本不是由于自身的过失造成的。

collins.def: A fault is a mistake in what someone is doing or in what they have done.

example.ex: It is a big fault to think that you can learn how to manage people in business school.
example.tran: 以为在商学院能学会如何管理人是一大错误。

collins.def: A fault in someone or something is a weakness in them or something that is not perfect.

example.ex: His manners had always made her blind to his faults.
example.tran: 他的彬彬有礼总是使她对他的缺点视而不见。

example.ex: ...a short delay due to a minor technical fault...
example.tran: 一个技术上的小故障引起的短暂延误

collins.def: If you cannot fault someone, you cannot find any reason for criticizing them or the things that they are doing.

example.ex: You can't fault them for lack of invention...
example.tran: 你不能因为他们缺乏创新就指责他们。

example.ex: It is hard to fault the way he runs his own operation.
example.tran: 他经营自己公司的方式无可指摘。

collins.def: A fault is a large crack in the surface of the earth.

example.ex: ...the San Andreas Fault.
example.tran: 圣安德烈亚斯断层

collins.def: A fault in tennis is a service that is wrong according to the rules.
If someone or something is at fault, they are to blame or are responsible for a particular situation that has gone wrong.

example.ex: He could never accept that he had been at fault...
example.tran: 他怎么也无法承认是他的错。

example.ex: There are no indications that standard security arrangements were at fault.
example.tran: 没有迹象表明例行的保安措施存在问题。

collins.def: If you find fault with something or someone, you look for mistakes and complain about them.

example.ex: I was disappointed whenever the cook found fault with my work.
example.tran: 每当厨师挑剔我干的活儿时，我都非常沮丧。

collins.def: If you say that someone has a particular good quality to a fault, you are emphasizing that they have more of this quality than is usual or necessary.

example.ex: Jefferson was generous to a fault...
example.tran: 杰斐逊大方得过了头。

example.ex: Others will tell you that she is modest to a fault, funny, clever and warm.
example.tran: 别人会告诉你她有趣、聪明又热情，谦逊得过了头。

collins.tran: 警觉的；警惕的；留神的；机敏的
collins.def: If you are alert, you are paying full attention to things around you and are able to deal with anything that might happen.

example.ex: We all have to stay alert...
example.tran: 我们大家都必须保持警惕。

example.ex: He had been spotted by an alert neighbour.
example.tran: 一个警觉的邻居发现了他。

collins.tran: 充分意识到…的;完全感觉到…的
collins.def: If you are alert to something, you are fully aware of it.

example.ex: The bank is alert to the danger.
example.tran: 银行充分意识到了危险。

collins.def: An alert is a situation in which people prepare themselves for something dangerous that might happen soon.

example.ex: Due to a security alert, this train will not be stopping at Oxford Circus.
example.tran: 由于安全戒备的原因，该次列车在“牛津街口广场”站将不停留。

collins.tran: 向…报警；使警觉；使警惕；使注意
collins.def: If you alert someone to a situation, especially a dangerous or unpleasant situation, you tell them about it.

example.ex: He wanted to alert people to the activities of the group...
example.tran: 他想提醒人们小心该团体的活动。

example.ex: I was hoping he'd alert the police.
example.tran: 我当时希望他会报警。

collins.tran: 处于警戒状态;保持戒备
collins.def: If soldiers or police are on alert, they are ready to deal with anything that may happen.

example.ex: Soldiers and police have been put on alert.
example.tran: 士兵和警方都已进入警戒状态。

collins.def: If you are on the alert for something, you are ready to deal with it if it happens.

example.ex: They want to be on the alert for similar buying opportunities.
example.tran: 他们希望随时掌握有关类似购买机会的信息。

collins.def: If something is graded, its quality is judged, and it is often given a number or a name that indicates how good or bad it is.

example.ex: Dust masks are graded according to the protection they offer...
example.tran: 防尘口罩根据它们的防护效果分等级。

example.ex: South Point College does not grade the students' work.
example.tran: 南点学院不对学生的作业评分。

collins.def: The grade of a product is its quality, especially when this has been officially judged.

example.ex: ...a grade II listed building.
example.tran: 列入二级文物保护的建筑

collins.tran: （用数字或字母表示的）成绩，评分
collins.def: Your grade in an examination or piece of written work is the mark you get, usually in the form of a letter or number, that indicates your level of achievement.

example.ex: What grade are you hoping to get?...
example.tran: 你希望得到什么样的成绩？

example.ex: There was a lot of pressure on you to obtain good grades.
example.tran: 你背负了拿到高分的巨大压力。

collins.def: Your grade in a company or organization is your level of importance or your rank.

example.ex: Staff turnover is particularly high among junior grades.
example.tran: 基层职员的流动率特别高。

collins.def: In the United States, a grade is a group of classes in which all the children are of a similar age. When you are six years old you go into the first grade and you leave school after the twelfth grade.

example.ex: Mr White teaches first grade in south Georgia.
example.tran: 怀特先生在佐治亚州南部教一年级。

collins.def: A grade is a slope.

example.ex: She drove up a steep grade and then began the long descent into the desert.
example.tran: 她驾车开上一个陡坡，然后沿着长长的下坡路驶入沙漠。

collins.def: Someone's grade is their military rank.

example.ex: I was a naval officer, lieutenant junior grade.
example.tran: 我是一名海军中尉军官。

collins.def: If someone makes the grade, they succeed, especially by reaching a particular standard.

example.ex: She had a strong desire to be a dancer but failed to make the grade.
example.tran: 她非常渴望成为舞蹈演员，但却因为达不到标准而未能圆梦。

collins.def: If you hide something or someone, you put them in a place where they cannot easily be seen or found.

example.ex: He hid the bicycle in the hawthorn hedge...
example.tran: 他把自行车藏在山楂树篱中。

example.ex: They could see that I was terrified, and hid me until the coast was clear.
example.tran: 他们能看出我很害怕，就把我藏起来，直到没有危险了才让我出来。

collins.def: If you hide or if you hide yourself, you go somewhere where you cannot easily be seen or found.

example.ex: At their approach the little boy scurried away and hid...
example.tran: 他们走近时，小男孩急忙跑开藏了起来。

example.ex: They hid themselves behind a tree.
example.tran: 他们躲到一棵树后。

collins.def: If you hide your face, you press your face against something or cover your face with something, so that people cannot see it.

example.ex: She hid her face under the collar of his jacket and she started to cry...
example.tran: 她将脸埋在他外套的衣领下，开始哭了起来。

example.ex: He hid his face in his hands again, lost in his own thoughts.
example.tran: 他又用双手捂住脸，陷入了沉思。

collins.def: If you hide what you feel or know, you keep it a secret, so that no one knows about it.

example.ex: Lee tried to hide his excitement...
example.tran: 李试图掩饰自己的激动心情。

example.ex: I have absolutely nothing to hide, I have done nothing wrong...
example.tran: 我绝对没有什么好隐瞒的，我没有做错什么。

collins.def: If something hides an object, it covers it and prevents it from being seen.

example.ex: The man's heavy moustache hid his upper lip completely...
example.tran: 那个男人浓密的髭须完全遮住了他的上唇。

example.ex: The compound was hidden by trees and shrubs.
example.tran: 大院掩映在树木灌丛之中。

collins.tran: （狩猎或观察、拍摄野生动物等的）隐蔽处，藏身处
collins.def: A hide is a place which is built to look like its surroundings. Hides are used by people who want to watch or photograph animals and birds without being seen by them.
A hide is the skin of a large animal such as a cow, horse, or elephant, which can be used for making leather.

example.ex: ...the process of tanning animal hides.
example.tran: 鞣制兽皮的工序

example.ex: ...kangaroo hide.
example.tran: 袋鼠皮

collins.def: If you rely on someone or something, you need them and depend on them in order to live or work properly.

example.ex: They relied heavily on the advice of their professional advisers...
example.tran: 他们非常依赖职业咨询师提供的建议。

example.ex: The Association relies on member subscriptions for most of its income.
example.tran: 这个协会的收入大部分来自会员的入会费。

collins.def: If you can rely on someone to work well or to behave as you want them to, you can trust them to do this.

example.ex: I know I can rely on you to sort it out...
example.tran: 我相信你会把它解决好的。

example.ex: The Red Cross are relying on us.
example.tran: 红十字会信赖我们。

collins.tran: 警察部门；警察机关；警方
collins.def: The police are the official organization that is responsible for making sure that people obey the law.

example.ex: The police are also looking for a second car...
example.tran: 警方也在寻找另一辆车。

example.ex: Police say they have arrested twenty people following the disturbances...
example.tran: 警方说骚乱发生后他们已逮捕了20人。

collins.def: Police are men and women who are members of the official organization that is responsible for making sure that people obey the law.

example.ex: More than one hundred police have ringed the area.
example.tran: 这一地区已被上百名警察包围。

collins.def: If the police or military forces police an area or event, they make sure that law and order is preserved in that area or at that event.

example.ex: ...the tiny UN observer force whose job it is to police the border...
example.tran: 承担守卫边界职责的一小支联合国观察员部队

example.ex: The march was heavily policed.
example.tran: 出动了大批警察维持游行示威的秩序。

collins.def: If a person or group in authority polices a law or an area of public life, they make sure that what is done is fair and legal.

example.ex: ...IMRO, the self-regulatory body that polices the investment management business.
example.tran: 投资管理监管组织，监督投资管理业务的自律机构

collins.def: Autumn is the season between summer and winter when the weather becomes cooler and the leaves fall off the trees.

example.ex: We are always plagued by wasps in autumn.
example.tran: 每年秋天，我们这里总是黄蜂成灾。

collins.def: If you speculate about something, you make guesses about its nature or identity, or about what might happen.

example.ex: Critics of the project speculate about how many hospitals could be built instead...
example.tran: 对该项目持批评态度的人在推测如果改作他用不知可以建多少所医院。

example.ex: It would be unfair to Debby's family to speculate on the reasons for her suicide...
example.tran: 猜测黛比自杀的原因对她的家人来说是不公平的。

collins.def: If someone speculates financially, they buy property, stocks, or shares, in the hope of being able to sell them again at a higher price and make a profit.

example.ex: Big farmers are moving in, not in order to farm, but in order to speculate with rising land prices...
example.tran: 大农场主正在不断涌进来，不是为了耕作，而是要利用不断上涨的地价进行投机。

example.ex: The banks made too many risky loans which now can't be repaid, and they speculated in property whose value has now dropped.
example.tran: 各银行贷出去太多高风险贷款，目前无法收回，他们还进行地产投机，而地产的价值目前已经下跌了。

collins.def: When people are united about something, they agree about it and act together.

example.ex: Every party is united on the need for parliamentary democracy...
example.tran: 各党派一致认为有必要实行议会民主。

example.ex: A united effort is always more effective than an isolated complaint.
example.tran: 联合行动总是比单个人抱怨更有效。

collins.def: United is used to describe a country which has been formed from two or more states or countries.

example.ex: ...the first elections to be held in a united Germany for fifty eight years.
example.tran: 58年来第一次在一个统一的德国举行的选举

collins.def: United is used in the names of countries which are made up from several states or smaller countries.

example.ex: ...the United States of America.
example.tran: 美利坚合众国

collins.tran: （某事发生或某物坐落的）位置，场所
collins.def: A location is the place where something happens or is situated.

example.ex: The first thing he looked at was his  office's location...
example.tran: 他首先看的是自己办公室的位置。

example.ex: Macau's newest small luxury hotel has a beautiful location.
example.tran: 澳门最新的小型豪华饭店地理位置优美。

collins.tran: （某人或某物所在的确切）位置，地点
collins.def: The location of someone  or something is their exact position.

example.ex: She knew the exact location of The Eagle's headquarters.
example.tran: 她知道“飞鹰”总部的确切地点。

collins.def: A location is a place away from a studio where a film or part of a film is made.

example.ex: ...an art movie with dozens of exotic locations...
example.tran: 在众多异域之地取景的艺术片

example.ex: We're shooting on location.
example.tran: 我们正在拍摄外景。

collins.def: Entirely means completely and not just partly.

example.ex: ...an entirely new approach...
example.tran: 全新的方法

example.ex: Fraud is an entirely different matter...
example.tran: 欺诈完全是另外一回事。

collins.def: Entirely is also used to emphasize what you are saying.

example.ex: I agree entirely...
example.tran: 我完全同意。

example.ex: Oh, the whole episode was entirely his fault.
example.tran: 天啊，整件事完全是他的错。

collins.tran: （尤用于表示批评时）不是特别，并非完全
collins.def: People sometimes use the expression not entirely to reduce the force of a strong statement, especially a critical one.

example.ex: They are not entirely happy with his criticism of the president...
example.tran: 他对总统的批评并没有让他们特别高兴。

example.ex: We shall see that this is not entirely true...
example.tran: 我们会明白这并非全是真的。

means: 谷物粗粉（用作饲料或加工面粉）

collins.def: A meal is an occasion when people sit down and eat, usually at a regular time.

example.ex: She sat next to him throughout the meal...
example.tran: 用餐时她一直坐在他身旁。

example.ex: It's rare that I have an evening meal with my children.
example.tran: 我难得跟孩子们一起吃晚饭。

collins.def: A meal is the food you eat during a meal.

example.ex: The waiter offered him red wine or white wine with his meal...
example.tran: 侍者为他端上佐餐的红葡萄酒或者白葡萄酒。

example.ex: Fresh fish makes a delicious meal.
example.tran: 新鲜的鱼做菜非常美味。

collins.def: Meal is a rough powder made of crushed grain. It is used to make flour or animal food.

collins.tran: 花费过多的时间或精力做…;对…小题大做
collins.def: If you think someone is taking more time and energy to do something than is necessary, you can say that they are making a meal of it.

example.ex: Lawyers always make such a meal of the simplest little thing.
example.tran: 律师总是死抠细节。

collins.def: If you have a square meal, you have a large healthy meal.
A flexible object or material can be bent easily without breaking.

example.ex: ...brushes with long, flexible bristles.
example.tran: 鬃毛长而柔韧的毛笔

collins.tran: 易变通的;适应性强的;灵活的
collins.def: Something or someone that is flexible is able to change easily and adapt to different conditions and circumstances as they occur.

example.ex: Look for software that's flexible enough for a range of abilities.
example.tran: 寻找功能多、适用性强的软件。

example.ex: ...flexible working hours.
example.tran: 灵活的工作时间

collins.def: If you are keen on doing something, you very much want to do it. If you are keen that something should happen, you very much want it to happen.

example.ex: You're not keen on going, are you?...
example.tran: 你不太想去，是吗？

example.ex: Both companies were keen on a merger...
example.tran: 两家公司都很想合并。

collins.def: If you are keen on something, you like it a lot and are very enthusiastic about it.

example.ex: I got quite keen on the idea...
example.tran: 我对这个想法燃起了极大的热情。

example.ex: I wasn't too keen on physics and chemistry.
example.tran: 我对物理和化学不是太感喜爱。

collins.def: You use keen to indicate that someone has a lot of enthusiasm for a particular activity and spends a lot of time doing it.

example.ex: She was a keen amateur photographer.
example.tran: 她是业余摄影爱好者。

collins.def: If you describe someone as keen, you mean that they have an enthusiastic nature and are interested in everything that they do.

example.ex: He's a very keen student and works very hard...
example.tran: 他是个很好学的学生，学习非常努力。

example.ex: You're all very keen.
example.tran: 你们都很热心。

collins.def: A keen interest or emotion is one that is very intense.

example.ex: He had retained a keen interest in the progress of the work.
example.tran: 他对那项工作的进展一直很关心。

example.ex: ...his keen sense of loyalty.
example.tran: 他强烈的忠诚感

collins.def: If you are a keen supporter of a cause, movement, or idea, you support it enthusiastically.

example.ex: He's been a keen supporter of the Labour Party all his life...
example.tran: 他一生都是工党的热情拥护者。

example.ex: He is a keen advocate of park-and-ride schemes.
example.tran: 他是“停车再换乘”计划的热情拥护者。

collins.tran: 思维敏捷的；机灵的；机智的
collins.def: If you say that someone has a keen mind, you mean that they are very clever and aware of what is happening around them.

example.ex: They described him as a man of keen intellect...
example.tran: 他们把他描述成一个才思敏捷的人。

example.ex: Mr Walsh has a keen appreciation of the priorities of the electorate...
example.tran: 沃尔什先生深刻理解选民最为关注的事项。

collins.def: If you have a keen eye or ear, you are able to notice things that are difficult to detect.

example.ex: ...an amateur artist with a keen eye for detail...
example.tran: 对细节非常敏感的业余画家

example.ex: Brand's keen ear caught the trace of an accent.
example.tran: 布兰德敏锐的耳朵听出了口音。

collins.def: If you are keen on someone, you find them sexually attractive and want to get to know them better.

example.ex: Mick has always been very keen on Carla.
example.tran: 米克一直迷恋卡拉。

collins.def: A keen fight or competition is one in which the competitors are all trying very hard to win, and it is not easy to predict who will win.

example.ex: There is expected to be a keen fight in the local elections.
example.tran: 预计地方选举的竞争会非常激烈。

collins.def: Keen prices are low and competitive.

example.ex: The company negotiates very keen prices with their suppliers.
example.tran: 该公司通过讨价还价从供货商那里拿到了很低的价格。

collins.def: If someone keens, they cry out or make sounds to express their sorrow at someone's death.

example.ex: He tossed back his head and keened...
example.tran: 他仰天恸哭起来。

example.ex: Someone was making a low, keening noise.
example.tran: 有人正在低声哀泣。

collins.tran: 对…十分热衷；对…非常热情
collins.def: If you say that someone is mad keen on something, you are emphasizing that they are very enthusiastic about it.

example.ex: So you're not mad keen on science then?...
example.tran: 那么你对科学并不是太感兴趣了？

example.ex: She was mad keen to go.
example.tran: 她非常想去。

collins.def: You use fine to describe something that you admire and think is very good.

example.ex: There is a fine view of the countryside...
example.tran: 这里可以看到乡村的美景。

example.ex: This is a fine book.
example.tran: 这是一本好书。

collins.def: If you say that you are fine, you mean that you are in good health or reasonably happy.

example.ex: Lina is fine and sends you her love and best wishes.
example.tran: 莉娜身体很好，还让我转达她对你的爱和祝福。

collins.tran: 令人满意的;可以接受的
collins.def: If you say that something is fine, you mean that it is satisfactory or acceptable.

example.ex: The skiing is fine...
example.tran: 滑雪还行。

example.ex: Everything was going to be just fine...
example.tran: 一切都会好起来的。

collins.def: You say 'fine' or 'that's fine' to show that you do not object to an arrangement, action, or situation that has been suggested.

example.ex: If competition is the best way to achieve it, then, fine...
example.tran: 如果竞争是达到目标的最佳方式，那就这么着吧。

example.ex: If you don't want to give it to me, that's fine, I don't mind...
example.tran: 如果你不想把它给我，那可以，我不介意。

collins.def: Something that is fine is very delicate, narrow, or small.

example.ex: The heat scorched the fine hairs on her arms...
example.tran: 炙热烤焦了她手臂上的汗毛。

example.ex: The ship has come to rest on the fine sand.
example.tran: 这艘船停靠在细沙滩上。

collins.def: Fine objects or clothing are of good quality, delicate, and expensive.

example.ex: We waited in our fine clothes...
example.tran: 我们身着盛装等候。

example.ex: She'll wear fine jewellery wherever she goes.
example.tran: 无论到哪儿她都会佩戴精美的首饰。

collins.def: A fine detail or distinction is very delicate, small, or exact.

example.ex: The market likes the broad outline but is reserving judgment on the fine detail.
example.tran: 市场对这一整体设想表示出认可，但在具体细节上还未作出反应。

collins.def: A fine person is someone you consider good, moral, and worth admiring.

example.ex: I was with fine people doing a good job...
example.tran: 我和高尚的人们一起干着一份不错的工作。

example.ex: He was an excellent journalist and a very fine man.
example.tran: 他是位杰出的记者，为人也非常正派。

collins.def: When the weather is fine, the sun is shining and it is not raining.

example.ex: He might be doing a spot of gardening if the weather is fine.
example.tran: 天气晴朗的话，他也许会侍弄侍弄花草。

collins.def: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly.

example.ex: Mr Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
example.tran: 威廉斯先生是个保守派，主张政府应减少对商业的控制。

example.ex: ...the tax policy advocated by the Opposition.
example.tran: 反对党提倡的税收政策

collins.def: An advocate of a particular action or plan is someone who recommends it publicly.

example.ex: He was a strong advocate of free market policies and a multi-party system.
example.tran: 他是自由市场政策和多党派制度的坚决拥护者。

collins.def: An advocate is a lawyer who speaks in favour of someone or defends them in a court of law.
An advocate for a particular group is a person who works for the interests of that group.

example.ex: ...advocates for the homeless...
example.tran: 为无家可归的人谋利益者

example.ex: Animal rights advocates argue that zoos are really animal prisons and very often cruel.
example.tran: 动物权利保护者指出动物园实际上是动物的牢笼，经常很残酷地对待动物。

collins.def: A device is an object that has been invented for a particular purpose, for example for recording or measuring something.

example.ex: ...an electronic device that protects your vehicle 24 hours a day.
example.tran: 24小时保护车辆的电子装置

example.ex: ...a device that could measure minute quantities of matter...
example.tran: 能够测量微量物质的设备

collins.def: A device is a method of achieving something.

example.ex: They claim that military spending is used as a device for managing the economy.
example.tran: 他们声称军费开支是用来作为调控经济的手段的。

example.ex: ...the literary device of the metaphor.
example.tran: 隐喻的文学手法

collins.tran: 听任…自便;让…自行发展;不去管
collins.def: If you leave someone to their own devices, you leave them alone to do as they wish.

example.ex: Left to his own devices, Osborn is a fluent — and often original — guitarist.
example.tran: 任其自由发挥时，奥斯本是一个弹奏流畅、常常富有创意的吉他手。

means: [法]（原告的）申诉，（证人的）陈述，口供

collins.def: A declaration is an official announcement or statement.

example.ex: They will sign the declaration tomorrow...
example.tran: 他们明天将签署这份公告。

example.ex: The opening speeches sounded more like declarations of war than offerings of peace.
example.tran: 开场的几段讲话听上去更像是战争宣言而不是和平倡议。

collins.def: A declaration is a firm, emphatic statement which shows that you have no doubts about what you are saying.

example.ex: She needed time to adjust to Clive's  declaration.
example.tran: 她需要时间来适应克莱夫的表白。

example.ex: ...declarations of undying love.
example.tran: 至死不渝之爱的告白

collins.tran: (可用作法庭证据的）书面声明;报单
collins.def: A declaration is a written statement about something which you have signed and which can be used as evidence in a court of law.

example.ex: On the customs declaration, the sender labeled the freight as agricultural machinery...
example.tran: 在报关单上，寄货人将货物列为农用机械。

example.ex: They will ask you to sign a declaration allowing your doctor to disclose your medical details.
example.tran: 他们将要求你签署一份允许医生透露你的身体健康状况的书面声明。

collins.def: Psychological means concerned with a person's mind and thoughts.

example.ex: John received constant physical and psychological abuse from his father...
example.tran: 约翰不断遭到父亲身体和心理上的双重虐待。

example.ex: Robyn's loss of memory is a psychological problem, rather than a physical one.
example.tran: 罗宾的失忆是心理问题，而非生理问题。

collins.def: Psychological means relating to psychology.

example.ex: ...psychological testing.
example.tran: 心理测试

collins.def: A lake is a large area of fresh water, surrounded by land.

example.ex: They can go fishing in the lake...
example.tran: 他们可以在湖里钓鱼。

example.ex: The Nile flows from Lake Victoria in East Africa north to the Mediterranean Sea.
example.tran: 尼罗河由东非的维多利亚湖向北流至地中海。

collins.def: RC is an abbreviation for (缩略=) Roman Catholic .

example.ex: ...St Mary's RC Cathedral.
example.tran: 圣玛丽天主教大教堂

collins.def: If something expands or is expanded, it becomes larger.

example.ex: Engineers noticed that the pipes were not expanding as expected...
example.tran: 工程师注意到管道并没有如预期那样膨胀。

example.ex: The money supply expanded by 14.6 per cent in the year to September...
example.tran: 截至9月，当年的货币供应增加了14.6％。

collins.def: If something such as a business, organization, or service expands, or if you expand it, it becomes bigger and includes more people, goods, or activities.

example.ex: The popular ceramics industry expanded towards the middle of the 19th century...
example.tran: 到19世纪中期，大众制陶业得到了发展。

example.ex: The interest rate's coming down. I'll be able to expand or stay in business...
example.tran: 利率正在降低，我可以扩大公司或者维持经营。

means: 一张（通常指标准尺寸的纸）
（金属材料）制成薄板（或薄片）的，扎制成片的，片状的

collins.def: A sheet is a large rectangular piece of cotton or other cloth that you sleep on or cover yourself with in a bed.

example.ex: Once a week, a maid changes the sheets.
example.tran: 女仆每星期换一次床单。

example.ex: ...the luxury of silk sheets.
example.tran: 丝绸床单的奢华

collins.def: A sheet of paper is a rectangular piece of paper.

example.ex: ...a sheet of newspaper...
example.tran: 一张报纸

example.ex: I was able to fit it all on one sheet.
example.tran: 我能将全部内容都放在一页上。

collins.def: You can use sheet to refer to a piece of paper which gives information about something.

example.ex: ...information sheets on each country in the world.
example.tran: 有关世界各国信息的简要记录

collins.tran: (玻璃、金属、木头等的)大块薄片，薄板
collins.def: A sheet of glass, metal, or wood is a large, flat, thin piece of it.

example.ex: ...a cracked sheet of glass...
example.tran: 一片碎玻璃

example.ex: Overhead cranes were lifting giant sheets of steel...
example.tran: 高架起重机正吊起一块块巨大的钢板。

collins.tran: (覆盖在其他物体上的)一大片，一层
collins.def: A sheet of something is a thin wide layer of it over the surface of something else.

example.ex: ...a sheet of ice.
example.tran: 一层冰

example.ex: ...a blue-grey sheet of dust.
example.tran: 一层蓝灰色的灰尘

collins.tran: 一团，一片，一股(迅速移动的火或水)
collins.def: A sheet of fire or water is a fast-moving mass of it that is difficult to see through.

example.ex: The streets were now in one fierce sheet of flame...
example.tran: 街道上现在是一片火海。

example.ex: Sheets of rain slanted across the road.
example.tran: 倾盆大雨斜着打落在路上。

collins.def: In sailing, a sheet is a line or rope used for controlling the position of a sail on a boat.
A mill is a building in which grain is crushed to make flour.
A mill is a small device used for grinding something such as coffee beans or pepper into powder.

example.ex: ...a pepper mill.
example.tran: 胡椒碾磨器

collins.tran: (制造加工钢材、羊毛、棉花等的)工厂
collins.def: A mill is a factory used for making and processing materials such as steel, wool, or cotton.

example.ex: ...a steel mill.
example.tran: 钢铁厂

example.ex: ...a textile mill.
example.tran: 纺织厂

collins.tran: (用磨粉机)碾碎，磨碎(麦子、胡椒等)
collins.def: To mill something such as wheat or pepper means to grind it in a mill.

example.ex: They mill 1,000 tonnes of flour a day in every Australian state.
example.tran: 澳大利亚各州每天都要磨1,000吨面粉。

example.ex: ...freshly milled black pepper.
example.tran: 刚刚磨好的黑胡椒粉

means: 尖头物，爪，（晒衣用的）衣夹，（帽）挂
在…上钉木钉，用木钉[短桩]钉住

collins.def: A peg is a small hook or knob that is attached to a wall or door and is used for hanging things on.

example.ex: His work jacket hung on the peg in the kitchen.
example.tran: 他的工作服挂在厨房里的挂钩上。

collins.def: A peg is a small device which you use to fasten clothes to a washing line.
A peg is a small piece of wood or metal that is used for fastening something to something else.

example.ex: He builds furniture using wooden pegs instead of nails.
example.tran: 他用木楔子取代钉子制作家具。

example.ex: ...the noise of the hammer striking the steel pegs.
example.tran: 锤子敲击钢栓的噪音

collins.tran: 用销钉（或楔子、木栓）固定
collins.def: If you peg something somewhere or peg it down, you fix it there with pegs.

example.ex: ...trying to peg a double sheet on a washing line on a blustery day...
example.tran: 大风天试图用衣夹把双人床单固定在晾衣绳上

example.ex: Peg down netting over the top to keep out leaves.
example.tran: 用销钉在顶上加固防护网，防止叶子落入。

collins.tran: 限定（价格、数量等）；把…固定在一定水平；使与…挂钩
collins.def: If a price or amount of something is pegged at a particular level, it is fixed at that level.

example.ex: Its currency is pegged to the dollar...
example.tran: 其货币与美元挂钩。

example.ex: UK trading profits were pegged at £40 million...
example.tran: 英国的贸易利润固定在4,000万英镑。

collins.def: If you say that someone should be brought down a peg or be taken down a peg, you mean that they should be made to realize that they are not so important or wonderful as they think they are.

example.ex: We thought it was time they were brought down a peg or two...
example.tran: 我们认为是时候煞煞他们的嚣张气焰了。

example.ex: We'd have liked to see her taken down a peg, but not this way.
example.tran: 我们乐意看到她杀威风，但不是用这种方法。

collins.def: Off-the-peg clothes are made in large numbers and sent to shops, not made specially for a particular person.

example.ex: ...an off-the-peg two-piece suit...
example.tran: 两件套西服成衣

example.ex: Instead of dining in top restaurants and wearing expensive suits, he likes to eat hamburgers and buys clothes off the peg.
example.tran: 比起穿着昂贵的套装到高档饭店吃饭，他更喜欢吃汉堡、买成衣。

collins.def: If you describe someone as a square peg in a round hole, you mean that they are in a situation or doing something that does not suit them at all.

example.ex: Taylor is clearly the wrong man for the job — a square peg in a round hole.
example.tran: 泰勒明显不适合做这项工作——简直就是方枘圆凿。

means: （机械）结构，机械装置[作用]，（故事的）结构

collins.def: In a machine or piece of equipment, a mechanism is a part, often consisting of a set of smaller parts, which performs a particular  function.

example.ex: ...the locking mechanism...
example.tran: 锁定装置

example.ex: A bomb has been detonated by a special mechanism.
example.tran: 炸弹由一个专门装置引爆。

collins.def: A mechanism is a special way of getting something done within a particular system.

example.ex: There's no mechanism for punishing arms exporters who break the rules.
example.tran: 对违规的武器出口商实施惩罚尚无执行机制。

example.ex: ...the clumsy and ineffective mechanism of price controls.
example.tran: 方法笨拙、效率低下的价格控制机制

collins.tran: (人为生存、对付困境的)机制，行为方式
collins.def: A mechanism is a part of your behaviour that is automatic and that helps you to survive or to cope with a difficult situation.

example.ex: ...a survival mechanism, a means of coping with intolerable stress.
example.tran: 一种生存机制，一种应对无法承受的压力的方法

means: 使具有银色光泽，使变成银色

collins.def: Silver is a valuable pale grey metal that is used for making jewellery and ornaments.

example.ex: ...a hand-crafted brooch made from silver.
example.tran: 一枚手工银制胸针

example.ex: ...amber earrings set in silver.
example.tran: 镶琥珀的银耳环

collins.def: Silver consists of coins that are made from silver or that look like silver.

example.ex: ...the basement where £150,000 in silver was buried.
example.tran: 埋有 150,000 英镑银币的地下室

collins.def: You can use silver to refer to all the things in a house that are made of silver, especially the cutlery and dishes.

example.ex: He beat the rugs and polished the silver.
example.tran: 他拍打去地毯上的灰尘，还擦拭了银器。

collins.def: Silver is used to describe things that are shiny and pale grey in colour.

example.ex: He had thick silver hair which needed cutting.
example.tran: 他浓密的银发该理理了。

example.ex: ...a silver sports car...
example.tran: 一辆银色跑车

collins.def: A silver is the same as a silver medal .

example.ex: Britain went on to take bronze and then followed it up by winning silver in the World Cup.
example.tran: 英国斩获了铜牌，接下来又赢得了世界杯的银牌。

collins.def: The consequences of something are the results or effects of it.

example.ex: Her lawyer said she understood the consequences of her actions and was prepared to go to jail...
example.tran: 她的律师说她明白自己行为的后果，已有了入狱的心理准备。

example.ex: An economic crisis may have tremendous consequences for our global security.
example.tran: 一场经济危机可能严重影响到全球安定。

collins.def: If one thing happens and then another thing happens in consequence or as a consequence, the second thing happens as a result of the first.

example.ex: His death was totally unexpected and, in consequence, no plans had been made for his replacement...
example.tran: 他的死完全出乎意料，所以，根本没有安排替补人选。

example.ex: Maternity services were to be reduced in consequence of falling birth rates.
example.tran: 由于出生率下降，产科服务会随之削减。

collins.def: Something or someone of consequence is important or valuable. If something or someone is of no consequence, or of little consequence, they are not important or valuable.

example.ex: As an overseer, he suddenly found himself a person of consequence...
example.tran: 作为工头，他突然觉得自己是个重要人物。

example.ex: Where he is from is of no consequence to me.
example.tran: 他来自何方对我来说并不重要。

collins.def: If you tell someone that they must take the consequences or face the consequences, you warn them that something unpleasant will happen to them if they do not stop behaving in a particular way.

example.ex: These pilots must now face the consequences of their actions and be brought to trial...
example.tran: 这些飞行员现在必须为自己的行为承担后果，接受审判。

example.ex: If climate changes continue, we will suffer the consequences.
example.tran: 如果气候变化继续下去，我们将自食其果。

collins.def: A runner is a person who runs, especially for sport or pleasure.

example.ex: ...a marathon runner...
example.tran: 马拉松长跑选手

example.ex: I am a very keen runner and am out training most days.
example.tran: 我非常喜欢跑步，大多数时候都在户外训练。

collins.def: The runners in a horse race are the horses taking part.

example.ex: There are 18 runners in the top race of the day.
example.tran: 在当天最高级别的赛马中有18匹马参加。

collins.def: A drug runner or gun runner is someone who illegally takes drugs or guns into a country.

collins.tran: 送信人;信使;收账员;听差
collins.def: Someone who is a runner for a particular person or company is employed to take messages, collect money, or do other small tasks for them.

example.ex: ...a bookie's runner.
example.tran: 赌注经纪人的听差

collins.tran: (雪橇的)滑板;(冰鞋的)冰刀;(抽屉的)滑轨
collins.def: Runners are thin strips of wood or metal underneath something which help it to move smoothly.

example.ex: ...the runners of his sled.
example.tran: 他的雪橇的滑板

collins.def: On a plant, runners are long shoots that grow from the main stem and put down roots to form a new plant.

example.ex: ...strawberry runners.
example.tran: 草莓长匐茎

collins.def: A runner is a long narrow mat that is put on a piece of furniture or on the floor.

collins.tran: 匆匆离开;迅速逃离;溜掉
collins.def: If someone does a runner, they leave a place in a hurry, for example in order to escape arrest or to avoid paying for something.

example.ex: At this point, the accountant did a runner — with all my bank statements, expenses and receipts.
example.tran: 这个时候，会计溜了——带走了我所有的银行结算单、资金和收据。

means: 参加电台、电视节目的演出

collins.tran: （无线电或电视）广播；广播节目；电视节目
collins.def: A broadcast is a programme, performance, or speech on the radio or on television.

example.ex: In a broadcast on state radio the government also announced that it was willing to resume peace negotiations.
example.tran: 在国家电台的广播中，政府也声明愿意重新开始和平谈判。

collins.tran: （电台或电视台）广播，播出（节目）
collins.def: To broadcast a programme means to send it out by radio waves, so that it can be heard on the radio or seen on television.

example.ex: The concert will be broadcast live on television and radio...
example.tran: 音乐会将通过电视和广播现场直播。

example.ex: CNN also broadcasts in Europe.
example.tran: 美国有线新闻网也在欧洲播出节目。

collins.def: If you go abroad, you go to a foreign country, usually one which is separated from the country where you live by an ocean or a sea.

example.ex: I would love to go abroad this year, perhaps to the South of France.
example.tran: 我今年很想出国，可能是去法国南部。

example.ex: ...public opposition here and abroad...
example.tran: 国内外公众的反对

collins.tran: 在四下流传;广为流传地
collins.def: If there is a story or feeling abroad, people generally know about it or feel it.

example.ex: There'll still be a feeling abroad that this change has to be recognised.
example.tran: 人们还会普遍觉得这项变革早晚得接受。

collins.def: Rice consists of white or brown grains taken from a cereal plant. You cook rice and usually eat it with meat or vegetables.

example.ex: ...a meal consisting of chicken, rice and vegetables...
example.tran: 有鸡肉、米饭和蔬菜的一顿饭

example.ex: Thailand exports its fine rices around the world.
example.tran: 泰国将精米出口到世界各地。

means: （使）后退，（使）倒退( back的现在分词)
（用证据或理论来）证实（一种理论或主张）

collins.def: If someone has the backing of an organization or an important person, they receive support or money from that organization or person in order to do something.

example.ex: He said the president had the full backing of his government to negotiate a deal...
example.tran: 他说政府将全力支持总统通过谈判达成协议。

example.ex: Mr Bach set up his own consulting business with the backing of his old boss.
example.tran: 在以前老板的帮助下，巴赫先生成立了自己的咨询公司。

collins.def: A backing is a layer of something such as cloth that is put onto the back of something in order to strengthen or protect it.
The backing of a popular song is the music which is sung or played to accompany the main tune.

example.ex: Sharon also sang backing vocals for Barry Manilow...
example.tran: 莎伦也为巴里·马尼洛伴唱。

example.ex: Tapes provided the backing.
example.tran: 磁带伴奏。

collins.def: Someone who is brave is willing to do things which are dangerous, and does not show fear in difficult or dangerous situations.

example.ex: He was not brave enough to report the loss of the documents.
example.tran: 他没有勇气报告丢失了文件。

example.ex: ...images of brave people risking their lives to aid others.
example.tran: 冒着生命危险去帮助他人的勇士们的形象

collins.tran: （通常为达到某目标）勇敢面对
collins.def: If you brave unpleasant or dangerous conditions, you deliberately expose yourself to them, usually in order to achieve something.

example.ex: Thousands have braved icy rain to demonstrate their support.
example.tran: 数千人在寒冷的天气中冒雨赶来以示他们的支持。

collins.tran: （尤指善于作战的）印第安勇士
collins.def: A brave is a young Native American man, especially one who is good at fighting.
If someone is putting on a brave face or is putting a brave face on a difficult situation, they are pretending that they are happy or satisfied when they are not.

example.ex: He felt disappointed but he tried to put on a brave face...
example.tran: 他感到很失望，但还竭力强装欢笑。

example.ex: The White House tried to put a brave face on the job figures.
example.tran: 白宫面对就业数字强颜欢笑。

collins.def: Your objective is what you are trying to achieve.

example.ex: Our main objective was the recovery of the child safe and well...
example.tran: 我们的主要目标是将孩子安然无恙地找回来。

example.ex: His objective was to play golf and win.
example.tran: 他的目标是参加高尔夫球比赛并赢得胜利。

collins.def: Objective information is based on facts.

example.ex: He had no objective evidence that anything extraordinary was happening.
example.tran: 他没有客观证据表明正在发生什么不同寻常之事。

collins.tran: （观点）客观的，不带个人感情的，没有个人偏见的
collins.def: If someone is objective, they base their opinions on facts rather than on their personal feelings.

example.ex: I believe that a journalist should be completely objective...
example.tran: 我认为新闻记者不应当有丝毫偏见。

example.ex: I would really like to have your objective opinion on this.
example.tran: 我很想听听你对此事的客观见解。

collins.tran: （进行公开讨论或作决策的）专门小组
collins.def: A panel is a small group of people who are chosen to do something, for example to discuss something in public or to make a decision.

example.ex: He assembled a panel of scholars to advise him...
example.tran: 他组织了一个学者小组为他出谋划策。

example.ex: All the writers on the panel agreed Quinn's book should be singled out for special praise...
example.tran: 专门小组的所有作家一致认为奎因的书应该单独挑出来予以特别表扬。

collins.def: A panel is a flat rectangular piece of wood or other material that forms part of a larger object such as a door.

example.ex: ...the frosted glass panel set in the centre of the door.
example.tran: 门中间镶嵌的磨砂玻璃板

collins.def: A control panel or instrument panel is a board or surface which contains switches and controls to operate a machine or piece of equipment.

example.ex: The equipment was extremely sophisticated and was monitored from a central control-panel...
example.tran: 这台设备极为复杂，由中央控制面板进行监控。

example.ex: They had failed to recognise signs on their instrument panel indicating a serious problem.
example.tran: 他们没有注意到仪表板上显示的重大故障信号。

collins.tran: (问题、任务或困难)降临，使面临
collins.def: If you are confronted with a problem, task, or difficulty, you have to deal with it.

example.ex: She was confronted with severe money problems...
example.tran: 她面临严峻的资金问题。

example.ex: Ministers underestimated the magnitude of the task confronting them.
example.tran: 部长们低估了他们所面临的任务的艰巨性。

collins.def: If you confront a difficult situation or issue, you accept the fact that it exists and try to deal with it.

example.ex: We are learning how to confront death...
example.tran: 我们正在学习如何直面死亡。

example.ex: NATO countries have been forced to confront fundamental moral questions.
example.tran: 北约国家被迫正视基本的道德问题。

collins.tran: 使面对(有威胁性或困难的事)
collins.def: If you are confronted by something that you find threatening or difficult to deal with, it is there in front of you.

example.ex: I was confronted with an array of knobs, levers, and switches.
example.tran: 我面对的是一大堆旋钮、控制杆和开关。

collins.def: If you confront someone, you stand or sit in front of them, especially when you are going to fight, argue, or compete with them.

example.ex: She pushed her way through the mob and confronted him face to face...
example.tran: 她挤过骚动的人群，与他当面对峙。

example.ex: They don't hesitate to open fire when confronted by police...
example.tran: 他们遭遇警察时毫不犹豫地开火。

collins.def: If you confront someone with something, you present facts or evidence to them in order to accuse them of something.

example.ex: She had decided to confront Kathryn with what she had learnt...
example.tran: 她决定拿自己了解的事实与凯瑟琳当面对证。

example.ex: I could not bring myself to confront him about it...
example.tran: 我不忍心就这事和他对质。

collins.def: If something is visible, it  can be seen.

example.ex: The warning lights were clearly visible...
example.tran: 警示信号灯清晰可见。

example.ex: They found a bacterium visible to the human eye...
example.tran: 他们发现了一种肉眼可见的细菌。

collins.tran: 明显的;引人注目的;能认出的
collins.def: You use visible to describe something or someone that people notice or recognize.

example.ex: The most visible sign of the intensity of the crisis is unemployment...
example.tran: 预示危机严重程度的一个最显著的迹象就是失业情况。

example.ex: He was making a visible effort to control himself...
example.tran: 他明显是在努力控制自己的情绪。

collins.def: In economics, visible earnings are the money that a country makes as a result of producing goods, rather than from services such as banking and tourism.

example.ex: In the UK visible imports have traditionally been greater than visible exports.
example.tran: 在英国，传统上有形产品的进口一直大于出口。

means: 支配（词或短语的形式或用法）

collins.def: To govern a place such as a country, or its people, means to be officially in charge of the place, and to have responsibility for making laws, managing the economy, and controlling public services.

example.ex: They go to the polls on Friday to choose the people they want to govern their country...
example.tran: 星期五，他们去投票站投票选择他们所期望的国家管理者。

example.ex: Their citizens are very thankful they are not governed by a dictator.
example.tran: 他们的公民十分庆幸没有受独裁者的统治。

collins.def: If a situation or activity is governed by a particular factor, rule, or force, it is controlled by that factor, rule, or force.

example.ex: Marine insurance is governed by a strict series of rules and regulations...
example.tran: 关于海险有一系列严格的规章制度对其作了规定。

example.ex: The government has altered the rules governing eligibility for unemployment benefit.
example.tran: 政府已经修改了有关领取失业救济金资格的规章制度。

collins.tran: 遍及全世界地;世界各地地
collins.def: If something exists or happens worldwide, it exists or happens throughout the world.

example.ex: His books have sold more than 20 million copies worldwide...
example.tran: 他的书在全世界已经售出两千多万本。

example.ex: Every day the newspapers tell stories of children worldwide who are abused...
example.tran: 每天报纸都在讲述世界各地受虐儿童的故事。

collins.def: If someone makes a discovery, they become aware of something that they did not know about before.

example.ex: I felt I'd made an incredible discovery.
example.tran: 我觉得我有一个天大的发现。

example.ex: ...the discovery that both his wife and son are HIV positive.
example.tran: 查出他妻子和儿子艾滋病病毒检测都呈阳性

collins.def: If someone makes a discovery, they are the first person to find or become aware of a place, substance, or scientific fact that no one knew about before.

example.ex: In that year, two momentous discoveries were made.
example.tran: 那一年，有两个重大发现。

example.ex: ...the discovery of the ozone hole over the South Pole...
example.tran: 南极上空臭氧洞的发现

collins.tran: (对不为人知的演员、音乐人等的)发现
collins.def: If someone makes a discovery, they recognize that an actor, musician, or other performer who is not well-known has talent.

example.ex: His job is the discovery and promotion of new artists.
example.tran: 他的任务就是发现并推出艺术新人。

collins.def: When the discovery of people or objects happens, someone finds them, either by accident or as a result of looking for them.

example.ex: ...the discovery and destruction by soldiers of millions of marijuana plants.
example.tran: 士兵发现并销毁了大量大麻作物

collins.def: Ethnic means connected with or relating to different racial or cultural groups of people.

example.ex: ...a survey of Britain's ethnic minorities.
example.tran: 对英国少数民族的调查

example.ex: ...ethnic tensions.
example.tran: 种族关系紧张

collins.tran: 少数民族的；少数种族的
collins.def: You can use ethnic to describe people who belong to a particular racial or cultural group but who, usually, do not live in the country where most members of that group live.

example.ex: There are still several million ethnic Germans in Russia.
example.tran: 俄罗斯境内仍有数百万德国人。

collins.tran: （服饰、音乐、食物等）具有民族特色的，民族风味的
collins.def: Ethnic clothing, music, or food is characteristic of the traditions of a particular ethnic group, and different from what is usually found in modern Western culture.

example.ex: ...the original flavours of ethnic dishes.
example.tran: 民族特色菜肴的原汁原味

example.ex: ...a magnificent range of ethnic fabrics.
example.tran: 各式各样具有民族特色的织物

collins.def: If you borrow something that belongs to someone else, you take it or use it for a period of time, usually with their permission.

example.ex: Can I borrow a pen please? ...
example.tran: 我可以借支笔吗？

example.ex: He wouldn't  let me borrow his clothes.
example.tran: 他不愿我借他的衣服。

collins.def: If you borrow money from someone or from a bank, they give it to you and you agree to pay it back at some time in the future.

example.ex: Morgan borrowed £5,000 from his father to form the company 20 years ago...
example.tran: 20年前摩根从他父亲那里借了5,000英镑，成立了这家公司。

example.ex: It's so expensive to borrow from finance companies...
example.tran: 从信贷公司借钱利息非常高。

collins.def: If you borrow a book from a library, you take it away for a fixed period of time.

example.ex: I couldn't afford to buy any, so I borrowed them from the library.
example.tran: 我一本书也买不起，只好从图书馆借。

collins.def: If you borrow something such as a word or an idea from another language or from another person's work, you use it in your own language or work.

example.ex: I borrowed his words for my book's title...
example.tran: 我借用他的话作为我这本书的标题。

example.ex: Their engineers are happier borrowing other people's ideas than developing their own.
example.tran: 他们的工程师更乐于借用别人的观点，而不愿自我创新。

collins.tran: 捡回一条命；余下的光阴不多；好景不长
collins.def: Someone who is living on borrowed time or who is on borrowed time has continued to live or to do something for longer than was expected, and is likely to die or be stopped from doing it soon.

example.ex: Perhaps that illness, diagnosed as fatal, gave him a sense of living on borrowed time.
example.tran: 也许是那种被诊断为绝症的疾病让他有了时日无多之感。

collins.def: A connection is a relationship between two things, people, or groups.

example.ex: There was no evidence of a connection between BSE and the brain diseases recently confirmed in cats...
example.tran: 没有证据表明疯牛病与最近确诊的猫类脑病有关联。

example.ex: The police say he had no connection with the security forces...
example.tran: 警方说他与安全部队没有关系。

collins.tran: (电线或管道的)连接部分，接头
collins.def: A connection is a joint where two wires or pipes are joined together.

example.ex: Check all radiators for small leaks, especially round pipework connections.
example.tran: 检查所有的暖气片，看有没有小裂缝，尤其是管道连接处附近。

collins.tran: (公路、铁路或空中的)交通连接，交通线
collins.def: If a place has good road, rail, or air connections, many places can be directly reached from there by car, train, or plane.

example.ex: Fukuoka has excellent air and rail connections to the rest of the country.
example.tran: 福冈与国内其他城市之间有非常便捷的空运和铁路运输系统。

collins.def: If you get a connection at a station or airport, you catch a train, bus, or plane, after getting off another train, bus, or plane, in order to continue your journey.

example.ex: My flight was late and I missed the connection.
example.tran: 航班晚点，我没赶上转机。

collins.def: Your connections are the people who you know or are related to, especially when they are in a position to help you.

example.ex: She used her connections to full advantage.
example.tran: 她充分利用了自己的人脉。

collins.def: If you write or talk to someone in connection with something, you write or talk to them about that thing.

example.ex: I am writing in connection with Michael Shower's letter...
example.tran: 关于迈克尔·肖尔的来信，现复信如下。

example.ex: 13 men have been questioned in connection with the murder.
example.tran: 有13名男子因谋杀案受到盘问。

collins.tran: 关于这/那一点;在这/那方面
collins.def: You say in this connection or in that connection to indicate that what you are talking about is related to what you have just mentioned.

example.ex: It is the 100th anniversary of his death. We here are having very great celebrations in this connection.
example.tran: 今天是他逝世100周年纪念日，我们为此在这里举行盛大的纪念活动。

collins.def: Corruption is dishonesty and illegal behaviour by people in positions of authority or power.

example.ex: The President faces 54 charges of corruption and tax evasion...
example.tran: 总统面临54项腐败和逃税的指控。

example.ex: Distribution of food throughout the country is being hampered by inefficiency and corruption.
example.tran: 低效和腐败行为阻碍了食品在全国的分发。

collins.def: In linguistics, a corruption is a word that is derived from an earlier word, but which has become changed in some way.

example.ex: 'Morris' is an English corruption of 'Moorish', meaning North African.
example.tran: Morris 在英语中是 Moorish 的变体，意思是“北非的”。

means: National Health Service 英国国民健康保险制度

collins.def: NHS is an abbreviation for (缩略=) National Health Service .

example.ex: This vaccine is not normally provided free under the NHS...
example.tran: 这种疫苗在国民医疗保健系统中通常不是免费提供的。

example.ex: ...NHS patients.
example.tran: 享受国民医疗保健服务的患者

collins.def: If you are upset, you are unhappy or disappointed because something unpleasant has happened to you.

example.ex: After she died I felt very, very upset...
example.tran: 她去世之后，我非常非常难过。

example.ex: Marta looked upset...
example.tran: 玛尔塔一副沮丧的模样。

collins.tran: 使心烦意乱；使生气；使心情不好
collins.def: If something upsets you, it makes you feel worried or unhappy.

example.ex: The whole incident had upset me and my fiancee terribly...
example.tran: 整个事件搞得我和未婚妻都心烦意乱。

example.ex: She warned me not to say anything to upset him...
example.tran: 她警告我不要说任何让他不高兴的话。

collins.def: If events upset something such as a procedure or a state of affairs, they cause it to go wrong.

example.ex: ...a deal that would upset the balance of power in the world's gold markets...
example.tran: 一桩将会打破全球黄金市场均势的交易

example.ex: House prices are easily upset by factors which have nothing to do with property.
example.tran: 房价很容易受到与房产毫不相干的因素的干扰。

collins.def: If you upset an object, you accidentally knock or push it over so that it scatters over a large area.

example.ex: Don't upset the piles of sheets under the box.
example.tran: 不要把箱子下面那几叠床单弄乱了。

example.ex: ...bumping into him, and almost upsetting the ginger ale.
example.tran: 撞上了他，差点打翻了姜味汽水

collins.def: A stomach upset is a slight illness in your stomach caused by an infection or by something that you have eaten.

example.ex: Paul was unwell last night with a stomach upset...
example.tran: 保罗昨晚肚子不舒服。

example.ex: It wasn't anything serious. A mild stomach upset, that's all.
example.tran: 没什么大不了的。只是胃有点不舒服，没别的。

collins.def: A dish is a shallow container with a wide uncovered top. You eat and serve food from dishes and cook food in them.

example.ex: ...plastic bowls and dishes...
example.tran: 塑料碗碟

example.ex: Pile potatoes into a warm serving dish.
example.tran: 把土豆倒在一个保温的盛菜用的盘子里。

collins.def: The contents of a dish can be referred to as a dish of something.

example.ex: Nicholas ate a dish of spaghetti.
example.tran: 尼古拉斯吃了一盘意大利面条。

collins.def: Food that is prepared in a particular style or combination can be referred to as a dish .

example.ex: This dish is best served cold...
example.tran: 这菜最好凉着吃。

example.ex: There are plenty of vegetarian dishes to choose from.
example.tran: 有多道素菜可供选择。

collins.def: All the objects that have been used to cook, serve, and eat a meal can be referred to as the dishes .

example.ex: There were dirty dishes in the sink...
example.tran: 水槽里放着脏碗。

example.ex: He'd cooked dinner and washed the dishes.
example.tran: 他做了饭，还洗了碗。

collins.def: You can use dish to refer to anything that is round and hollow in shape with a wide uncovered top.

example.ex: ...a dish used to receive satellite broadcasts.
example.tran: 用来接收卫星广播的碟形卫星天线
