collins.def: If you do the dishes, you wash the dishes.

example.ex: I hate doing the dishes.
example.tran: 我讨厌洗碗。

means: 自大的，狂妄的，胆大妄为的
使相信，使确信(assure的过去式)
使相信，使确信(assure的过去式和过去分词)

collins.tran: 自信的；放松的；有把握的
collins.def: Someone who is assured is very confident and relaxed.

example.ex: He was infinitely more assured than in his more recent parliamentary appearances.
example.tran: 比起最近几次在国会中的露面，他表现得自信多了。

collins.def: If something is assured, it is certain to happen.

example.ex: Our victory is assured; nothing can stop us...
example.tran: 我们必胜，我们锐不可当。

example.ex: Yesterday, her future seemed assured.
example.tran: 昨天，她的未来似乎已经在握。

collins.tran: 确定的;信心十足的;志在必得的
collins.def: If you are assured of something, you are certain to get it or achieve it.

example.ex: Laura Davies is assured of a place in Europe's team...
example.tran: 劳拉·戴维斯确信能在欧洲队中占据一席之地。

example.ex: Bickerstaffe looks assured of being elected general secretary.
example.tran: 比克斯塔夫看上去对于当选总书记志在必得。

collins.def: If you say that someone can rest assured that something is the case, you mean that it is definitely the case, so they do not need to worry about it.

example.ex: Their parents can rest assured that their children's safety will be of paramount importance...
example.tran: 家长尽可放心，孩子们的安全将成为重中之重。

example.ex: Rest assured, he probably has rather more common sense than you realize.
example.tran: 放心吧，他知道的常识很可能比你以为的要多得多。

collins.def: You use rest assured when you want to emphasize your determination to do something.

example.ex: I will be seeing Mr and Mrs. Johnson. And rest assured I will tell them of your rudeness...
example.tran: 我将去见约翰逊夫妇。等着瞧吧，我一定会把你的无礼告诉他们。

example.ex: Rest assured, if you owe taxes, we will collect them.
example.tran: 不用多想，如果你欠税，我们会去收的。

collins.def: News is information about a recently changed situation or a recent event.

example.ex: We waited and waited for news of him...
example.tran: 我们左等右等，盼着他的消息。

example.ex: They still haven't had any news about when they'll be able to go home...
example.tran: 他们仍然没有何时能回家的消息。

collins.def: News is information that is published in newspapers and broadcast on radio and television about recent events in the country or world or in a particular area of activity.

example.ex: Foreign News is on Page 16...
example.tran: 国外新闻在16版。

example.ex: We'll also have the latest sports news...
example.tran: 我们也会收到最新的体育新闻。

collins.def: The news is a television or radio broadcast which consists of information about recent events in the country or the world.

example.ex: I heard all about the bombs on the news.
example.tran: 我从新闻广播里得知了关于炸弹的全部消息。

example.ex: ...the six o'clock news.
example.tran: 6点钟的新闻

collins.def: News is sometimes used in the names of newspapers.

example.ex: ...the New York Daily News.
example.tran: 《纽约每日新闻》

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is news, you mean that they are considered to be interesting and important at the moment, and that people want to hear about them on the radio and television and in newspapers.

example.ex: A murder was big news...
example.tran: 谋杀案是重大新闻事件。

example.ex: If you are a celebrity, you are headline news.
example.tran: 如果你是名人，你就是头条新闻。

collins.def: If you say that something is bad news, you mean that it will cause you trouble or problems. If you say that something is good news, you mean that it will be useful or helpful to you.

example.ex: The drop in travel is bad news for the airline industry...
example.tran: 旅游热降温对航空业来说是个坏消息。

example.ex: This new attitude is good news to AIDS activists.
example.tran: 这种新态度对艾滋病活动家来说是件好事。

collins.def: If you say that something is news to you, you mean that you did not previously know what you have just been told, especially when you are surprised or annoyed about it.

example.ex: I'd certainly tell you if I knew anything, but I don't. What you're saying is news to me.
example.tran: 如果我真知道什么的话，我肯定会告诉你，可我不知道。你现在说的我都没听过。

collins.def: If something belongs to you, you own it.

example.ex: The house had belonged to her family for three or four generations.
example.tran: 这套房子归她们家有三四代人了。

collins.def: You say that something belongs to a particular person when you are guessing, discovering, or explaining that it was produced by or is part of that person.

example.ex: The handwriting belongs to a male...
example.tran: 这是男性的笔迹。

example.ex: They established that the body belonged to a 15-year-old girl.
example.tran: 他们确定这是一具15岁女孩的尸体。

collins.def: If someone belongs to a particular group, they are a member of that group.

example.ex: I used to belong to a youth club.
example.tran: 我过去是一个青年俱乐部的成员。

collins.tran: 属于（某个类别、类型或群体）
collins.def: If something or someone belongs in or to a particular category, type, or group, they are of that category, type, or group.

example.ex: The judges could not decide which category it belonged in...
example.tran: 评委们无法判定它属于哪一类。

example.ex: I realized that he and I belonged to different worlds.
example.tran: 我意识到我和他不是一路人。

collins.def: If something belongs to a particular time, it comes from that time.

example.ex: The pictures belong to an era when there was a preoccupation with high society.
example.tran: 这些画出自一个人人向往上流社会的时代。

collins.def: If you say that something belongs to someone, you mean that person has the right to it.

example.ex: ...but the last word belonged to Rosanne.
example.tran: 但是最终决定权在罗莎娜手里

collins.def: If you say that a time belongs to a particular system or way of doing something, you mean that that time is or will be characterized by it.

example.ex: The future belongs to democracy.
example.tran: 未来属于民主。

collins.def: If a baby or child belongs to a particular adult, that adult is his or her parent or the person who is looking after him or her.

example.ex: He deduced that the two children belonged to the couple.
example.tran: 他推断这俩小孩是这对夫妇的。

collins.tran: 属于彼此（恋人用来表示亲密关系）
collins.def: When lovers say that they belong together, they are expressing their closeness or commitment to each other.

example.ex: I really think that we belong together...
example.tran: 我真的觉得我们属于彼此。

example.ex: He belongs with me.
example.tran: 他是我的。

collins.tran: 归属于（某地或某一情形）
collins.def: If a person or thing belongs in a particular place or situation, that is where they should be.

example.ex: You don't belong here...
example.tran: 你不属于这里。

example.ex: This piece really belongs in the concert hall...
example.tran: 这曲子很适合在音乐厅演奏。

collins.def: A specialist is a person who has a particular skill or knows a lot about a particular subject.

example.ex: If you are housebound, you can arrange for a home visit from a specialist adviser...
example.tran: 如果你出不了门，可以预约专家顾问上门就诊。

example.ex: Peckham, himself a cancer specialist, is well aware of the wide variations in medical practice.
example.tran: 佩卡姆本人是一名癌症专家，他非常了解不同治疗方法之间的巨大差异。

collins.def: You use typical to describe someone or something that shows the most usual characteristics of a particular type of person or thing, and is therefore a good example of that type.

example.ex: Cheney is everyone's image of a typical cop: a big white guy, six foot, 220 pounds...
example.tran: 切尼是每个人心目中典型的警察形象：大块头白人，6 英尺高，220磅重。

example.ex: Carole goes in for such typical schoolgirl pastimes as horse-riding and watching old films…
example.tran: 卡萝尔喜欢一些女生常玩的娱乐活动，例如骑马、看老电影等。

collins.tran: 特有的;独特的;显示特性的
collins.def: If a particular action or feature is typical of someone or something, it shows their usual qualities or characteristics.

example.ex: This reluctance to move towards a democratic state is typical of totalitarian regimes...
example.tran: 不愿朝民主制国家迈进是极权主义政权的特性。

example.ex: This is not typical of Chinese, but is a feature of the Thai language…
example.tran: 这不是汉语所特有的，而是泰语的一个特征。

collins.tran: (表示批评或抱怨)果不其然的，不出所料的，一贯如此的
collins.def: If you say that something is typical of a person, situation, or thing, you are criticizing them or complaining about them and saying that they are just as bad or disappointing as you expected them to be.

example.ex: She threw her hands into the air. 'That is just typical of you, isn't it?'
example.tran: 她挥舞着双手说，“只有你才干得出来，不是吗？”

example.ex: 'Typical!' Hattie slammed down the receiver. 'Absolutely typical!'
example.tran: “果不其然！”哈蒂重重摔下听筒。“真是果不其然啊！”

collins.def: Beans such as green beans, French beans, or broad beans are the seeds of a climbing plant or the long thin cases which contain those seeds.
Beans such as soya beans and kidney beans are the dried seeds of a bean plant.
Beans such as coffee beans or cocoa beans are the seeds of plants that are used to produce coffee, cocoa, and chocolate.
Beans are baked beans .

example.ex: ...sausage and beans.
example.tran: 香肠和烘豆

collins.def: If someone has not got a bean, they have no money at all.

example.ex: It's quite incredible to think that he now hasn't got a bean...
example.tran: 很难相信他现在身无分文。

example.ex: It doesn't cost a bean.
example.tran: 这一分钱也不用花。

collins.tran: 充满活力的；兴高采烈的；生机勃勃的
collins.def: If someone is full of beans, they are very lively and have a lot of energy and enthusiasm.

example.ex: Jem was full of beans after a long sleep.
example.tran: 杰姆好好睡了一觉之后又变得精力充沛了。

collins.def: If you spill the beans, you tell someone something that people have been trying to keep secret.

means: （派驻联合国等国际组织的）代表

collins.def: An ambassador is an important official who lives in a foreign country and represents his or her own country's interests there.

example.ex: ...the German ambassador to Poland.
example.tran: 德国驻波兰大使

collins.def: Your breath is the air that you let out through your mouth when you breathe. If someone has bad breath, their breath smells unpleasant.

example.ex: I could smell the whisky on his breath...
example.tran: 我能闻到他呼出的威士忌的味道。

example.ex: Smoking causes bad breath.
example.tran: 吸烟会导致口臭。

collins.def: When you take a breath, you breathe in once.

example.ex: He took a deep breath, and began to climb the stairs...
example.tran: 他深吸了一口气，然后开始爬楼梯。

example.ex: Gasping for breath, she leaned against the door...
example.tran: 她倚靠在门上，大口喘着气。

collins.def: If you say that there is not a breath of wind or air, you are emphasizing that there is no wind and the air is very still.

example.ex: Not even a breath of wind stirred the pine branches.
example.tran: 一丝风也没有，松树枝条纹丝不动。

collins.def: A breath of something, is a small amount of it.

example.ex: It was left to Martina to add a breath of common sense to the proceedings.
example.tran: 这件事交由马丁娜处理，她会使整个过程显得更符合情理一些。

collins.tran: （到室外）呼吸新鲜空气，透口气
collins.def: If you go outside for a breath of fresh air or for a breath of air, you go outside because it is unpleasantly warm indoors.

collins.tran: 令人耳目一新的事物；新鲜刺激的东西
collins.def: If you describe something new or different as a breath of fresh air, you mean that it makes a situation or subject more interesting or exciting.

example.ex: Her brisk treatment of an almost taboo subject was a breath of fresh air.
example.tran: 她把这个近乎禁忌的话题处理得很轻松，令人耳目一新。

collins.tran: 喘过气来；恢复正常呼吸
collins.def: When you get your breath back after doing something energetic, you start breathing normally again.

example.ex: I reached out a hand to steady myself against the house while I got my breath back.
example.tran: 我伸出一只手抵住墙壁撑着身子，让自己喘口气。

collins.def: When you catch your breath while you are doing something energetic, you stop for a short time so that you can start breathing normally again.

example.ex: He had stopped to catch his breath and make sure of his directions.
example.tran: 他曾停下来歇口气，同时确定一下方向。

collins.tran: （通常因为震惊）倒吸一口冷气
collins.def: If something makes you catch your breath, it makes you take a short breath of air, usually because it shocks you.

example.ex: Kenny caught his breath as Nikko nearly dropped the bottle.
example.tran: 尼科差点儿把瓶子摔了，这让肯尼倒吸了一口气。

collins.def: If you do not have time to draw breath, you do not have time to have a break from what you are doing.
If you hold your breath, you make yourself stop breathing for a few moments, for example because you are under water.

example.ex: I held my breath and sank under the water.
example.tran: 我屏住呼吸沉入水底。

collins.tran: 屏息静气（焦急或激动地等待）
collins.def: If you say that someone is holding their breath, you mean that they are waiting anxiously or excitedly for something to happen.

example.ex: The whole world holds its breath for this speech.
example.tran: 整个世界都屏住呼吸等待这一讲话。

collins.def: If you say that you won't hold your breath, you mean that you do not expect something to happen even though someone has suggested that it might.

example.ex: 'Next thing you know, I'll be dancing at your wedding,' he cried. 'Don't hold your breath,' my father replied.
example.tran: “你瞧，下一件事是，我会在你的婚礼上跳舞，”他大声说。“你休想，”我父亲答道。

collins.def: When someone takes their last breath, they die.

example.ex: His wife sat with him until he drew his last breath.
example.tran: 他的妻子坐在他跟前，直到他咽下最后一口气。

collins.tran: 喘不过气；上气不接下气
collins.def: If you are out of breath, you are breathing very quickly and with difficulty because you have been doing something energetic.

example.ex: There she was, slightly out of breath from running.
example.tran: 她在那儿，跑得有点儿喘不过气来。

collins.tran: 但同时/但紧接着（尤用于谴责某人的言论自相矛盾）
collins.def: You can use in the same breath or in the next breath to indicate that someone says two very different or contradictory things, especially when you are criticizing them.

example.ex: He hailed this week's arms agreement but in the same breath expressed suspicion about the motivations of the United States.
example.tran: 他为本周达成的武器协议而欢呼，但同时又对美国的动机表示怀疑。

collins.def: If you are short of breath, you find it difficult to breathe properly, for example because you are ill. You can also say that someone suffers from shortness of breath .

example.ex: She felt short of breath and flushed...
example.tran: 她感到呼吸困难，脸颊绯红。

example.ex: Any exercise that causes undue shortness of breath should be stopped.
example.tran: 任何导致呼吸出现困难的锻炼都应停止。

collins.tran: （美或惊讶得）令（人）喘不过气来；使（人）惊叹
collins.def: If you say that something takes your breath away, you are emphasizing that it is extremely beautiful or surprising.

example.ex: I heard this song on the radio and it just took my breath away.
example.tran: 我是从收音机里听到这首歌的，它令我惊叹不已。

collins.def: If you say something under your breath, you say it in a very quiet voice, often because you do not want other people to hear what you are saying.

example.ex: Walsh muttered something under his breath.
example.tran: 沃尔什小声嘟囔了一句。

collins.def: If someone says you are wasting your breath, they mean that the person you are talking to will not take any notice and so there is no point saying anything to them.

example.ex: The tone of her voice told him he was wasting his breath.
example.tran: 她的语气使他明白他是在白费口舌。

collins.def: If something ceases, it stops happening or existing.

example.ex: At one o'clock the rain had ceased.
example.tran: 一点时，雨已停了。

collins.def: If you cease to do something, you stop doing it.

example.ex: He never ceases to amaze me...
example.tran: 他总能给我惊喜。

example.ex: The secrecy about the President's condition had ceased to matter...
example.tran: 总统的健康状况已经没有保密的必要。

collins.def: If you cease something, you stop it happening or working.

example.ex: The Tundra Times, a weekly newspaper in Alaska, ceased publication this week.
example.tran: 阿拉斯加的周报《苔原时报》本周停刊了。

collins.tran: （尤用于生气时加强语气）该死的，讨厌的
collins.def: Bloody is used by some people to emphasize what they are saying, especially when they are angry.
If you describe a situation or event as bloody, you mean that it is very violent and a lot of people are killed.

example.ex: Forty-three demonstrators were killed in bloody clashes...
example.tran: 43名示威者在流血冲突中丧生。

example.ex: They came to power in 1975 after a bloody civil war.
example.tran: 在一场腥风血雨的内战之后，他们于1975年上台执政。

collins.def: You can describe someone or something as bloody if they are covered in a lot of blood.

example.ex: He was arrested last October still carrying a bloody knife...
example.tran: 去年10月他被捕时，身上还带着一把血迹斑斑的刀。

example.ex: Yulka's  fingers were bloody and cracked.
example.tran: 尤尔卡的手指折断了，鲜血直流。

collins.def: If you have bloodied part of your body, there is blood on it, usually because you have had an accident or you have been attacked.

example.ex: One of our children fell and bloodied his knee...
example.tran: 我们的一个孩子跌倒了，膝盖磕破了。

example.ex: She stared at her own bloodied hands, unable to think or move.
example.tran: 她盯着自己流血的双手，呆呆地愣住了。

collins.def: If someone or something is bloodied by an experience, they are hurt or damaged by it.

example.ex: She'd been bloodied in love...
example.tran: 她在爱情上一度伤痕累累。

example.ex: The reinsurance market has been bloodied by disasters in the U.S.
example.tran: 再保险市场因美国发生的灾难而遭受重创。

collins.tran: 麻布袋;粗布袋;厚纸袋;大口袋
collins.def: A sack is a large bag made of rough woven material. Sacks are used to carry or store things such as vegetables or coal.

example.ex: ...a sack of potatoes.
example.tran: 一袋土豆

collins.def: If your employers sack you, they tell you that you can no longer work for them because you have done something that they did not like or because your work was not good enough.

example.ex: Earlier today the Prime Minister sacked 18 government officials for corruption...
example.tran: 今天早些时候，首相解除了 18 名涉嫌贪污腐败的政府官员的职务。

example.ex: Science teacher James Wood was sacked for slapping a schoolboy.
example.tran: 理科教师詹姆斯·伍德因为掌掴一名男生而被开除。

collins.tran: 抢劫，洗劫，破坏(城镇或城市)
collins.def: When an army sacks a town or city, they destroy it, taking away all valuable things.

example.ex: In 1527 Imperial troops sacked the French ambassador's residence in Rome.
example.tran: 1527年，帝国军队洗劫了位于罗马的法国大使官邸。

collins.def: Some people refer to bed as the sack .

means: [诗歌用语]表露强烈感情，显示巨大热情

collins.def: Passion is strong sexual feelings towards someone.

example.ex: ...my passion for a dark-haired, slender boy named James.
example.tran: 我对一个名叫詹姆斯的黑头发高挑个儿男孩的热恋

example.ex: ...the expression of love and passion.
example.tran: 爱和情欲的表达

collins.def: Passion is a very strong feeling about something or a strong belief in something.

example.ex: He spoke with great passion.
example.tran: 他发表了热情洋溢的讲话。

example.ex: ...the passion and commitment of the Republican candidate.
example.tran: 共和党候选人的激情和奉献精神

collins.def: If you have a passion for something, you have a very strong interest in it and like it very much.

example.ex: She had a passion for gardening...
example.tran: 她酷爱园艺。

example.ex: His other great passion was Italy.
example.tran: 他酷爱的另一个国家是意大利。

means: 倾向于（某种观点、意见或态度等）（与to 或 toward连用）

collins.def: When you lean in a particular direction, you bend your body in that direction.

example.ex: Eileen leaned across and opened the passenger door...
example.tran: 艾琳倾身把后座门打开。

example.ex: He leaned forward to give her a kiss...
example.tran: 他前倾吻了她一下。

collins.def: If you lean on or against someone or something, you rest against them so that they partly support your weight. If you lean an object on or against something, you place the object so that it is partly supported by that thing.

example.ex: She was feeling tired and was glad to lean against him...
example.tran: 她正感到有些疲倦，因此很高兴可以靠在他身上。

example.ex: Lean the plants against a wall and cover the roots with peat...
example.tran: 把植物靠墙摆放，用泥煤盖住根部。

collins.def: If you describe someone as lean, you mean that they are thin but look strong and healthy.

example.ex: Like most athletes, she was lean and muscular...
example.tran: 跟大部分运动员一样，她身形清瘦，肌肉结实。

example.ex: She watched the tall, lean figure step into the car.
example.tran: 她看着那个瘦高个儿上了车。

collins.def: If meat is lean, it does not have very much fat.

example.ex: It is a beautiful meat, very lean and tender.
example.tran: 这块肉很好，又瘦又嫩。

example.ex: ...the leanest ground beef you can get.
example.tran: 买得到的最瘦的碎牛肉

collins.def: If you describe an organization as lean, you mean that it has become more efficient and less wasteful by getting rid of staff, or by dropping projects which were unprofitable.

example.ex: The value of the pound will force British companies to be leaner and fitter.
example.tran: 英镑目前的汇率将迫使英国公司厉行精兵简政。

example.ex: ...cutting corporate flab and building leaner companies.
example.tran: 削减企业赘肉，建立瘦身型公司

collins.def: If you describe periods of time as lean, you mean that people have less of something such as money or are less successful than they used to be.

example.ex: ...the lean years of the 1930s...
example.tran: 萧条的20世纪30年代

example.ex: With fewer tourists in town, the taxi trade is going through its leanest patch for 30 years.
example.tran: 随着城里游客的减少，出租车行业正遭受30年来最不景气的时期。

collins.def: If you rent something, you regularly pay its owner a sum of money in order to be able to have it and use it yourself.

example.ex: She rents a house with three other girls...
example.tran: 她和其他3个女孩合租一套房子。

example.ex: He left his hotel in a rented car.
example.tran: 他开着一辆租来的车离开了酒店。

collins.def: If you rent something to someone, you let them have it and use it in exchange for a sum of money which they pay you regularly.

example.ex: She rented rooms to university students.
example.tran: 她把房间租给了大学生。

collins.def: Rent is the amount of money that you pay regularly to use a house, flat, or piece of land.

example.ex: She worked to pay the rent while I went to college...
example.tran: 在我读大学期间，她打工挣钱来付租金。

example.ex: Traders in Marble Arch are facing huge rent increases.
example.tran: 大理石拱门的经销商们面临租金的大幅上涨。

collins.def: Rent is the past tense and past participle of rend .

means: 引发其他事件的一件事
发射或使爆炸（武器或爆炸性弹药）

collins.def: The trigger of a gun is a small lever which you pull to fire it.

example.ex: A man pointed a gun at them and pulled the trigger.
example.tran: 一名男子拿枪指着他们，接着扣动了扳机。

collins.def: The trigger of a bomb is the device which causes it to explode.

example.ex: ...trigger devices for nuclear weapons.
example.tran: 核武器的引爆器

collins.def: To trigger a bomb or system means to cause it to work.

example.ex: The thieves must have deliberately triggered the alarm and hidden inside the house...
example.tran: 盗贼肯定是故意触发了报警器，然后躲在房子里。

example.ex: The one thousand pound bomb was triggered by a wire.
example.tran: 那颗重达 1,000 磅的炸弹是由一根导线引爆的。

collins.def: If something triggers an event or situation, it causes it to begin to happen or exist.

example.ex: ...the incident which triggered the outbreak of the First World War...
example.tran: 导致第一次世界大战爆发的事件

example.ex: The current recession was triggered by a slump in consumer spending…
example.tran: 目前的经济衰退是由消费支出骤跌引起的。

collins.def: If something acts as a trigger for another thing such as an illness, event, or situation, the first thing causes the second thing to begin to happen or exist.

example.ex: Stress may act as a trigger for these illnesses.
example.tran: 压力可能会成为引发这些疾病的原因。

collins.def: Your imagination is the ability that you have to form pictures or ideas in your mind of things that are new and exciting, or things that you have not experienced.

example.ex: Antonia is a woman with a vivid imagination...
example.tran: 安东尼娅是个想象力丰富的女人。

example.ex: Alistair had a logical mind, and little imagination...
example.tran: 阿利斯泰尔逻辑思维能力很强,但缺乏想象力。

collins.def: Your imagination is the part of your mind which allows you to form pictures or ideas of things that do not necessarily exist in real life.

example.ex: Long before I ever went there, Africa was alive in my imagination.
example.tran: 早在我真正踏足之前很久,非洲就已在我的脑海中活灵活现了。

collins.tran: 吸引…的注意力;摄人魂魄;引人入胜
collins.def: If you say that someone or something captured your imagination, you mean that you thought they were interesting or exciting when you saw them or heard them for the first time.

example.ex: Italian football captured the imagination of the nation last season.
example.tran: 上个赛季意大利足球吸引了全国上下的注意。

collins.def: If you say that something stretches your imagination, you mean that it is good because it makes you think about things that you had not thought about before.

example.ex: Their films are exciting and really stretch the imagination.
example.tran: 他们的电影非常精彩且发人深省。

collins.def: If someone is tortured, another person deliberately causes them great pain over a period of time, in order to punish them or to make them reveal information.

example.ex: French police are convinced that she was tortured and killed...
example.tran: 法国警方确信她是被拷打致死。

example.ex: Three members of the group had been tortured to death…
example.tran: 该团体中有三个人被拷打致死。

collins.def: To torture someone means to cause them to suffer mental pain or anxiety.

example.ex: He would not torture her further by trying to argue with her...
example.tran: 他不愿与她争辩，让她更痛苦。

example.ex: She tortured herself with fantasies of Bob and his new girlfriend.
example.tran: 她想象着鲍勃和他的新女友在一起的情形，心里备受煎熬。

collins.tran: 折磨;痛苦;苦恼;引起痛苦(或苦恼)的事物
collins.def: If you say that something is torture or a torture, you mean that it causes you great mental or physical suffering.

example.ex: Waiting for the result was torture...
example.tran: 等待结果的过程是一种折磨。

example.ex: The friction of the sheets against his skin was torture…
example.tran: 被单摩擦着他的皮肤，简直像是酷刑。

collins.tran: （最优秀选手的）排名（表），名次表
collins.def: In many sports, the list of the best players made by an official organization is called the rankings.

example.ex: ...the 25 leading teams in the world rankings...
example.tran: 世界排名前25的队

example.ex: Goellner has shot up the rankings.
example.tran: 戈尔纳的排名迅速上升。

collins.def: Someone's ranking is their position in an official list of the best players of a sport.

example.ex: Agassi was playing well above his world ranking of 12.
example.tran: 阿加西的比赛表现大大超出了他在世界上第12位的排名。

collins.tran: （常指政治团体中的成员）首位的，最高级别的
collins.def: The ranking member of a group, usually a political group, is the most senior person in it.

example.ex: ...the ranking Republican on the senate intelligence committee.
example.tran: 参议院情报委员会中最资深的共和党人

example.ex: ...the ranking American diplomat in Baghdad.
example.tran: 美国在巴格达的首席外交官

collins.def: If you inspect something, you look at every part of it carefully in order to find out about it or check that it is all right.

example.ex: Elaine went outside to inspect the playing field...
example.tran: 伊莱恩走到外面查看操场。

example.ex: Cut the fruit in half and inspect the pips: if they are turning slightly brown it is ready for harvesting.
example.tran: 把果实切成两半，检查一下其中的籽：如果有点成棕色，那就该收获了。

collins.def: When an official inspects a place or a group of people, they visit it and check it carefully, for example in order to find out whether regulations are being obeyed.

example.ex: The Public Utilities Commission inspects us once a year...
example.tran: 公共事业委员会每年到我们这里视察一次。

example.ex: Each hotel is inspected and, if it fulfils certain criteria, is recommended.
example.tran: 会对每家旅馆都进行检查,如果它达到了一定的标准,就获得推荐。

collins.def: If you give someone assistance, you help them do a job or task by doing part of the work for them.

example.ex: Since 1976 he has been operating the shop with the assistance of volunteers...
example.tran: 从1976年开始，他就在志愿者的帮助下经营这个店。

example.ex: She can still come downstairs with assistance but she's very weak.
example.tran: 在有人搀扶的情况下她还是能够下楼的，但是很虚弱。

collins.tran: （以提供信息或意见的方式给予的）帮助，援助
collins.def: If you give someone assistance, you give them information or advice.

example.ex: Any assistance you could give the police will be greatly appreciated...
example.tran: 您提供的任何帮助警方都将万分感谢。

example.ex: Employees are being offered assistance in finding new jobs.
example.tran: 正在帮助雇员另觅新职。

collins.def: If someone gives a person or country assistance, they help them by giving them money.

example.ex: ...a viable programme of economic assistance...
example.tran: 切实可行的经济援助方案

example.ex: We shall offer you assistance with legal expenses up to $5,000.
example.tran: 我们将为您提供最高5,000美元的法律援助金。

collins.def: If something is done with the assistance of a particular thing, that thing is helpful or necessary for doing it.

example.ex: The translations were carried out with the assistance of a medical dictionary.
example.tran: 这些翻译是借助一本医学词典完成的。

collins.def: Someone or something that is of assistance to you is helpful or useful to you.

example.ex: He was of great assistance to me in researches for my books...
example.tran: 在我为写书所作的研究中，他提供了很大的帮助。

example.ex: Can I be of any assistance?
example.tran: 我能帮什么忙吗？

collins.def: If you come to someone's assistance, you take action to help them.

example.ex: They are appealing to the world community to come to Jordan's assistance...
example.tran: 他们正在呼吁国际社会向约旦伸出援手。

example.ex: Ben suffered a heart attack and Helen rushed to his assistance.
example.tran: 本心脏病犯了，海伦急忙赶过来帮忙。

collins.def: A fierce animal or person is very aggressive or angry.

example.ex: They look like the teeth of some fierce animal.
example.tran: 它们看上去像某种猛兽的牙齿。

collins.def: Fierce feelings or actions are very intense or enthusiastic, or involve great activity.

example.ex: Competition has been fierce to win a stake in Skoda...
example.tran: 争夺斯柯达股份的竞争极为激烈。

example.ex: The town was captured after a fierce battle with rebels at the weekend...
example.tran: 该镇在周末与叛乱分子一番激战后被攻占。

collins.def: Fierce conditions are very intense, great, or strong.

example.ex: The climbers were trapped by a fierce storm which went on for days.
example.tran: 登山者被一连几天的强风暴雨给困住了。

means: 用钻、挖或掘的方式打通

collins.def: If someone or something bores you, you find them dull and uninteresting.

example.ex: Dickie bored him all through the meal with stories of the Navy...
example.tran: 迪基吃饭时一直在讲海军的故事，让他不胜其烦。

example.ex: Life in the country bores me.
example.tran: 乡村生活令我生厌。

collins.tran: 使厌烦透顶；使烦得要命
collins.def: If someone or something bores you to tears ,bores you to death, or bores you stiff, they bore you very much indeed.

example.ex: ...a handsome engineer who bored me to tears with his tale of motorway maintenance
example.tran: 英俊的工程师不停地讲高速公路养护的故事，烦得我要命

example.ex: I dropped out of high school. It bored me to death.
example.tran: 我从中学退学了，那种学校生活令我烦得要死。

collins.tran: 令人厌烦的人；无趣的人
collins.def: You describe someone as a bore when you think that they talk in a very uninteresting way.

example.ex: There is every reason why I shouldn't enjoy his company — he's a bore and a fool.
example.tran: 我有充分的理由不愿和他在一起 —— 他又乏味又愚笨。

collins.tran: 令人生厌的事；无聊的事
collins.def: You can describe a situation as a bore when you find it annoying.

example.ex: It's  a bore to be sick, and the novelty of lying in bed all day wears off quickly.
example.tran: 生病是件烦人的事，整天躺在床上的新鲜劲很快就没了。

collins.def: If you bore a hole in something, you make a deep round hole in it using a special tool.

example.ex: Get the special drill bit to  bore the correct-size hole for the job.
example.tran: 做这个活儿要拿个特殊的钻头来钻个大小合适的孔。

collins.def: If someone's eyes bore into you, they stare intensely at you.

example.ex: His eyes bored into her, paralysing her, robbing her of movement...
example.tran: 他双眼凝视着她，令她全身瘫软，不能动弹。

example.ex: Her eyes seemed to bore a hole in mine.
example.tran: 她的目光似乎要把我的眼睛看穿。

collins.tran: （每年某一时期海水涌入江河的）涌潮,激潮
collins.def: A bore is a very large wave that moves quickly up certain rivers from the sea at particular times of the year as a result of unusual tides.
Bore is the past tense of bear .
If someone is your enemy, they hate you or want to harm you.
If someone is your enemy, they are opposed to you and to what you think or do.

example.ex: The Government's political enemies were quick to pick up on this series of disasters.
example.tran: 政府的政敌迅速借这一系列灾难向政府发难。

collins.def: The enemy is an army or other force that is opposed to you in a war, or a country with which your country is at war.

example.ex: The enemy were pursued for two miles...
example.tran: 敌军被追击了两英里。

example.ex: He searched the skies for enemy bombers.
example.tran: 他在空中搜寻敌军轰炸机。

collins.def: If one thing is the enemy of another thing, the second thing cannot happen or succeed because of the first thing.

example.ex: Reform, as we know, is the enemy of revolution.
example.tran: 正如我们所知，改革是革命的大敌。

collins.def: A bowl is a round container with a wide uncovered top. Some kinds of bowl are used, for example, for serving or eating food from, or in cooking, while other larger kinds are used for washing or cleaning.

example.ex: Put all the ingredients into a large bowl...
example.tran: 把所有配料都放进一个大碗里。

example.ex: Your dog should have his own bowls for food and water.
example.tran: 你的狗应该有它自己进食和饮水用的碗。

collins.def: The contents of a bowl can be referred to as a bowl of something.

example.ex: ...a bowl of soup.
example.tran: 一碗汤

collins.def: You can refer to the hollow rounded part of an object as its bowl .

example.ex: He smacked the bowl of his pipe into his hand.
example.tran: 他在自己手上磕打烟斗。

example.ex: ...the toilet bowl.
example.tran: 马桶

collins.def: Bowls is a game in which players try to roll large wooden balls as near as possible to a small wooden ball. Bowls is usually played outdoors on grass.

collins.tran: （草地滚木球运动中用的）木球
collins.def: A set of bowls is a set of round wooden balls that you play bowls with.

collins.tran: 玩草地滚木球游戏；玩保龄球
collins.def: If you bowl, you play the game of bowls or the game of bowling.

example.ex: Everyone wanted to bowl, hence everyone wanted to open a bowling alley.
example.tran: 大家都想玩保龄球，因此大家都想开保龄球馆。

collins.tran: （在板球等运动中）投（球）给击球手
collins.def: In a sport such as cricket, when a bowler bowls a ball, he or she sends it down the pitch towards a batsman.

example.ex: I can't see the point of bowling a ball like that...
example.tran: 我看不出那样投球用意何在。

example.ex: He bowled so well that we won two matches.
example.tran: 他的球投得极棒，使我们赢下了两场比赛。

collins.tran: （在板球等运动中因为投球手击中三柱门）迫使（击球手）出局
collins.def: In a sport such as cricket, when a batsman is bowled, he has to leave the pitch because the bowler has hit the wicket with the ball.

example.ex: Watkins hit 16 before being bowled by Ambrose.
example.tran: 沃特金斯击球得了16分后被安布罗斯投杀出局。

collins.tran: （尤指愉快地乘车或船）快速行驶
collins.def: If you bowl along in a car or on a boat, you move along very quickly, especially when you are enjoying yourself.

example.ex: Veronica looked at him, smiling, as they bowled along...
example.tran: 他们的车快速前行时，韦罗妮卡面带微笑地看着他。

example.ex: It felt just like old times, to bowl down Knightsbridge.
example.tran: 驱车在奈茨布里奇大街上疾驰而过，感觉就好像回到了过去。

collins.tran: 椭圆形运动场；环形剧场
collins.def: A large stadium where sports or concerts take place is sometimes called a Bowl .

example.ex: ...the Crystal Palace Bowl.
example.tran: 水晶宫露天剧场

example.ex: ...the Rose Bowl.
example.tran: 玫瑰碗体育场

collins.tran: （主赛季后最强的大学球队参加的）季后赛，杯赛
collins.def: A bowl or bowl game is a competition in which the best college teams play, after the main season has ended.

example.ex: ...the Fiesta college football bowl.
example.tran: 大学橄榄球节日碗赛

collins.def: The pupils of a school are the children who go to it.

example.ex: Over a third of those now at secondary school in Wales attend schools with over 1,000 pupils...
example.tran: 威尔士现在的初中生中有1/3以上的人就读的学校学生总数超过1,000人。

example.ex: Eleanor was a reluctant, anxious pupil.
example.tran: 埃莉诺是个扭捏局促的小学生。

collins.def: A pupil of a painter, musician, or other expert is someone who studies under that expert and learns his or her skills.

example.ex: After his education, Goldschmidt became a pupil of the composer Franz Schreker.
example.tran: 学业结束后，戈尔德施米特成了作曲家弗朗兹·施雷克尔的学生。

collins.def: The pupils of your eyes are the small, round, black holes in the centre of them.

collins.tran: 证明（决定、行为或想法）正当；表明…必要
collins.def: To justify a decision, action, or idea means to show or prove that it is reasonable or necessary.

example.ex: No argument can justify a war...
example.tran: 任何理由都不能为战争开脱。

example.ex: Ministers agreed that this decision was fully justified by economic conditions.
example.tran: 部长们一致同意，这个决定完全符合经济情况。

collins.tran: 调整（打印文本）；使齐行；使每行排齐
collins.def: To justify printed text means to adjust the spaces between the words so that each line of type is exactly the same length.

example.ex: Click on this icon to align or justify text.
example.tran: 点击这个图标使文本排齐。

collins.def: When something slides somewhere or when you slide it there, it moves there smoothly over or against something.

example.ex: She slid the door open...
example.tran: 她滑开了门。

example.ex: I slid the wallet into his pocket...
example.tran: 我把钱包麻利地塞进了他的口袋。

collins.tran: 麻利而无声地移动;悄悄地溜到
collins.def: If you slide somewhere, you move there smoothly and quietly.

example.ex: He slid into the driver's seat...
example.tran: 他麻利地坐进驾驶员的座位。

example.ex: 'Nice meeting you, Zoe,' I said and slid off.
example.tran: “很高兴见到你，佐薇，”说完我便溜走了。

collins.tran: 不自觉地陷入(某种情绪、态度或情境)
collins.def: To slide into a particular mood, attitude, or situation means to gradually start to have that mood, attitude, or situation often without intending to.

example.ex: She had slid into a depression...
example.tran: 她不觉沮丧起来。

example.ex: He needs them to stop the country sliding into chaos.
example.tran: 他需要他们来防止这个国家陷入混乱。

collins.def: If currencies or prices slide, they gradually become worse or lower in value.

example.ex: The US dollar continued to slide...
example.tran: 美元继续贬值。

example.ex: The upset sent share prices sliding to their lowest level for almost 18 months...
example.tran: 这种不安情绪使股票价格跌落到几乎 18 个月以来的最低水平。

collins.def: A slide is a small piece of photographic film which you project onto a screen so that you can see the picture.

example.ex: ...a slide show.
example.tran: 幻灯片放映

collins.def: A slide is a piece of glass on which you put something that you want to examine through a microscope.
A slide is a piece of playground equipment that has a steep slope for children to go down for fun.

collins.tran: 放任…自流;任…恶化而不予处理
collins.def: If you let something slide, you allow it to get into a worse state or condition by not attending to it.

example.ex: The company had let environmental standards slide.
example.tran: 这家公司听凭环境标准的不断下降。

means: 适当的，相当的，正当的，应该的，正式的，正常的
本来的，真正的，严格意义上的
〈方〉适当地，好好地，非常，很，完完全全地，彻底地
[宗教][常用P-]特定节日等用的仪式，弥撒（祈祷、礼仪等）书的章节，特赞

collins.tran: 适宜的；合适的；适当的；恰当的
collins.def: You use proper to describe things that you consider to be real and satisfactory rather than inadequate in some way.

example.ex: Two out of five people lack a proper job...
example.tran: 每五人中有两人没有正当的工作。

example.ex: I always cook a proper evening meal.
example.tran: 我总是把晚餐做得很丰盛。

collins.tran: 正确的；准确的；最合适的
collins.def: The proper thing is the one that is correct or most suitable.

example.ex: The Supreme Court will ensure that the proper procedures have been followed...
example.tran: 最高法院将确保程序的履行合乎规范

example.ex: He helped to put things in their proper place.
example.tran: 他帮忙把东西放置妥当。

collins.tran: 得体的；合乎体统的；正派的
collins.def: If you say that a way of behaving is proper, you mean that it is considered socially acceptable and right.

example.ex: In those days it was not thought entirely proper for a woman to be on the stage...
example.tran: 那个时候，女性登台表演被认为不太得体。

example.ex: It is right and proper to do this.
example.tran: 这么做很得体。

collins.tran: 严格意义上的；真正的；本身的
collins.def: You can add proper after a word to indicate that you are referring to the central and most important part of a place, event, or object and want to distinguish it from other things which are not regarded as being important or central to it.

example.ex: A distinction must be made between archaeology proper and science-based archaeology.
example.tran: 必须区分考古学本身和以科学为基础的考古学。

means: 使人惊讶的，出人意料的，惊人的
使惊奇，使诧异( surprise的现在分词)
意外发现[撞见]，出其不意获得

collins.tran: 令人吃惊的;令人惊奇的
collins.def: Something that is surprising is unexpected or unusual and makes you feel surprised.

example.ex: It is not surprising that children learn to read at different rates...
example.tran: 小孩子识字的速度不同,这不足为奇。

example.ex: A surprising number of customers order the same sandwich every day.
example.tran: 每天点同一种三明治的顾客多得惊人。

collins.tran: (通常指生气时或希望远方的人能听见时而)大叫，嚷，高呼
collins.def: If you shout, you say something very loudly, usually because you want people a long distance away to hear you or because you are angry.

example.ex: He had to shout to make himself heard above the near gale-force wind...
example.tran: 在呼啸的大风中他得大声喊叫才能让别人听见。

example.ex: 'She's alive!' he shouted triumphantly...
example.tran: “她还活着!”他欢欣鼓舞地大声叫道。

collins.tran: 成功在望;有成功的机会
collins.def: If you say that someone is in with a shout of achieving or winning something, you mean that they have a chance of achieving or winning it.

example.ex: He knew he was in with a shout of making Craig Brown's squad for Japan.
example.tran: 他明白自己有望为日本建成克雷格·布朗之队。

collins.def: If you are in a pub and someone you are with says 'It's your shout' or 'It's my shout', they mean that it is your turn or their turn to buy a round of drinks.

means: 关心政治的，关心社会的

collins.def: If you are concerned to do something, you want to do it because you think it is important.

example.ex: We were very concerned to keep the staff informed about what we were doing.
example.tran: 我们很注重让员工随时了解我们正在做的事情。

collins.def: A foreigner is someone who belongs to a country that is not your own.

example.ex: They are discouraged from becoming close friends with foreigners.
example.tran: 他们被劝说不要和外国人密切交往。

collins.def: If you resume an activity or if it resumes, it begins again.

example.ex: After the war he resumed his duties at Emmanuel College...
example.tran: 战争过后，他重新开始了在伊曼纽尔学院的工作。

example.ex: The search is expected to resume early today.
example.tran: 预计搜寻工作会于今天早些时候重新开始。

collins.def: If you resume your seat or position, you return to the seat or position you were in before you moved.

example.ex: 'I changed my mind,' Blanche said, resuming her seat.
example.tran: “我改变主意了，”布兰奇说着回到她的座位上。

collins.def: If someone resumes, they begin speaking again after they have stopped for a short time.

example.ex: 'Hey, Judith,' he resumed, 'tell me all about yourself.'
example.tran: “嘿，朱迪思，”他接着说，“跟我谈谈你自己吧。”

collins.def: A lens is a thin curved piece of glass or plastic used in things such as cameras, telescopes, and pairs of glasses. You look through a lens in order to make things look larger, smaller, or clearer.

example.ex: ...a camera lens...
example.tran: 照相机镜头

example.ex: I packed your sunglasses with the green lenses.
example.tran: 我把你那副绿色镜片的太阳镜装好了。

collins.def: In your eye, the lens is the part behind the pupil that focuses light and helps you to see clearly.
The coverage of something in the news is the reporting of it.

example.ex: Now a special TV network gives live coverage of most races...
example.tran: 现在有一个专门的电视网络对大部分比赛进行现场直播。

example.ex: Most media coverage disapproves of the travellers' lifestyle and values.
example.tran: 大多数媒体报道都不赞成那些旅行者的生活方式和价值观。

collins.def: If something has a bearing on a situation or event, it is relevant to it.

example.ex: Experts generally agree that diet has an important bearing on your general health...
example.tran: 专家们普遍认为饮食和健康总体状况密切相关。

example.ex: My father's achievements really don't have any bearing on what I do.
example.tran: 我父亲的成就与我做的事情真的毫无关联。

collins.def: Someone's bearing is the way in which they move or stand.

example.ex: She later wrote warmly of his bearing and behaviour.
example.tran: 后来她以饱含热情的笔触写到了他的举止和行为。

collins.def: If you take a bearing with a compass, you use it to work out the direction in which a particular place lies or in which something is moving.

collins.tran: 清楚/不清楚所在方位；知道/不知道下一步怎么做
collins.def: If you get your bearings or find your bearings, you find out where you are or what you should do next. If you lose your bearings, you do not know where you are or what you should do next.

example.ex: A sightseeing tour of the city is included to help you get your bearings...
example.tran: 市区观光游也包含在内，帮助你熟悉一下这里的情况。

example.ex: How badly the administration had lost its bearings was underlined by what happened yesterday.
example.tran: 管理之差从昨天发生的事情就可见一斑了。

collins.def: Bearings are small metal balls that are placed between moving parts of a machine in order to make them move smoothly and easily over each other.

example.ex: An oil seal was replaced, along with both front wheel bearings.
example.tran: 换了一个油封和两个前轮轴承。

collins.def: A cave is a large hole in the side of a cliff or hill, or one that is under the ground.

example.ex: ...a cave more than 1,000 feet deep.
example.tran: 1,000多英尺深的山洞

collins.def: The importance of something is its quality of being significant, valued, or necessary in a particular situation.

example.ex: We have always stressed the importance of economic reform...
example.tran: 我们一向强调经济改革的重要性。

example.ex: Safety is of paramount importance.
example.tran: 安全第一。

collins.def: Importance means having influence, power, or status.
A contest is a competition or game in which people try to win.

example.ex: Few contests in the recent history of British boxing have been as thrilling.
example.tran: 英国近年的拳击比赛中很少有如此激动人心的。

example.ex: ...a writing contest.
example.tran: 写作比赛

collins.def: A contest is a struggle to win power or control.

example.ex: The state election due in November will be the last such ballot before next year's presidential contest...
example.tran: 定于11月举行的州选举将是明年总统竞选前最后一次此类投票选举。

example.ex: ...a clear contest between church and state.
example.tran: 教会与政府之间明显的争斗

collins.tran: 争取赢得(选举、比赛等);角逐
collins.def: If someone contests an election or competition, they take part in it and try to win it.

example.ex: He quickly won his party's nomination to contest the elections.
example.tran: 他很快获得了本党提名,角逐大选。

example.ex: ...a closely contested regional flower show.
example.tran: 各方争奇斗艳、难分高下的地区花卉展

collins.def: If you contest a statement or decision, you object to it formally because you think it is wrong or unreasonable.

example.ex: Your former employer has to reply within 14 days in order to contest the case...
example.tran: 你的前任雇主若对本案存有异议，必须在14天内予以答复。

example.ex: Gender discrimination is a hotly contested issue.
example.tran: 性别歧视是一个争论激烈的话题。

collins.def: If you observe a person or thing, you watch them carefully, especially in order to learn something about them.

example.ex: Stern also studies and observes the behaviour of babies...
example.tran: 斯特恩还研究观察婴儿的行为。

example.ex: Are there any classes I could observe?...
example.tran: 有我可以观摩的课吗？

collins.def: If you observe someone or something, you see or notice them.

example.ex: In 1664 Hooke observed a reddish spot on the surface of the planet.
example.tran: 1664年，胡克注意到这颗行星表面有一块微红的斑点。

collins.tran: （尤指就注意到或深思熟虑之事）说，评论，评述
collins.def: If you observe that something is the case, you make a remark or comment about it, especially when it is something you have noticed and thought about a lot.

example.ex: We observe that the first calls for radical transformation did not begin until the period of the industrial revolution...
example.tran: 我们认为直到工业革命时期才出现了要求彻底变革的第一波呐喊。

example.ex: 'He is a fine young man,' observed Stephen.
example.tran: “他是个很不错的小伙子，”斯蒂芬评论道。

collins.def: If you observe something such as a law or custom, you obey it or follow it.

example.ex: Imposing speed restrictions is easy, but forcing motorists to observe them is trickier...
example.tran: 限制车速容易，但强制司机遵守这些限速规定就难办多了。

example.ex: The army was observing a ceasefire...
example.tran: 军队正遵守停火协议。

collins.def: You can use lower to refer to the bottom one of a pair of things.

example.ex: She bit her lower lip.
example.tran: 她咬了咬下唇。

example.ex: ...the lower deck of the bus...
example.tran: 公共汽车的下层

collins.def: You can use lower to refer to the bottom part of something.

example.ex: Use a small cushion to help give support to the lower back.
example.tran: 用一个小靠垫帮助支撑腰部。

example.ex: ...fires which started in the lower part of a tower block.
example.tran: 从塔楼底部开始烧起的大火

collins.def: You can use lower to refer to people or things that are less important than similar people or things.

example.ex: Already the awards are causing resentment in the lower ranks of council officers...
example.tran: 奖项已使政务委员会的低层官员们愤愤不平。

example.ex: The nation's  highest court reversed the lower court's  decision...
example.tran: 该国最高法院已推翻了下级法院的判决。

collins.def: If you lower something, you move it slowly downwards.

example.ex: Two reporters had to help lower the coffin into the grave...
example.tran: 两名记者不得不帮忙把灵柩慢慢地放进墓穴中。

example.ex: Sokolowski lowered himself into the black leather chair...
example.tran: 索科洛夫斯基缓缓地坐到黑色皮椅上。

collins.def: If you lower something, you make it less in amount, degree, value, or quality.

example.ex: The Central Bank has lowered interest rates by 2 percent...
example.tran: 中央银行已将利率调低了两个百分点。

example.ex: This drug lowers cholesterol levels by binding fats in the intestine.
example.tran: 这种药通过黏合肠内的脂肪降低胆固醇水平。

collins.def: If someone lowers their head or eyes, they look downwards, for example because they are sad or embarrassed.

example.ex: She lowered her head and brushed past photographers as she went back inside...
example.tran: 她再次回到里面时低着头，与摄影师擦身而过。

example.ex: She lowered her gaze to the hands in her lap.
example.tran: 她低头盯着放在大腿上的双手。

collins.def: If you say that you would not lower yourself by doing something, you mean that you would not behave in a way that would make you or other people respect you less.

example.ex: Don't lower yourself, don't be the way they are...
example.tran: 不要自贬身份,不要学他们那样。

example.ex: I've got no qualms about lowering myself to Lemmer's level to get what I want.
example.tran: 为得到我想要的东西，我一点都不忌讳把自己降格到跟莱麦尔一样。

collins.def: If you lower your voice or if your voice lowers, you speak more quietly.

example.ex: The man moved closer, lowering his voice...
example.tran: 那个男子靠上前去，压低了声音。

example.ex: His voice lowers confidentially.
example.tran: 他神秘地压低了嗓音。

collins.tran: (国际政治组织的)秘书长,总书记，总干事
collins.def: The secretary-general of an international political organization is the person in charge of its administration.

example.ex: ...the United Nations Secretary-General.
example.tran: 联合国秘书长

collins.tran: （尤用于表示反对或嘲弄）有自由主义思想的，有左翼思想的
collins.def: You can describe someone as right-on if they have liberal or left-wing ideas, especially if you disagree with them or want to make fun of them.

example.ex: The people that come to watch the play are all those right-on left-wing sort of people.
example.tran: 来看演出的都是那些有自由主义思想的左翼分子。

example.ex: ...the young, right-on student crowd.
example.tran: 一群年轻的左翼学生

collins.def: A rumour is a story or piece of information that may or may not be true, but that people are talking about.

example.ex: Simon denied rumours that he was planning to visit Bulgaria later this month...
example.tran: 西蒙否认了他打算这个月晚些时候访问保加利亚的传闻。

example.ex: There have been persistent rumours of quarrels within the movement...
example.tran: 运动团体内部存在争执的传闻始终未断。

collins.def: An indication is a sign which suggests, for example, what people are thinking or feeling.

example.ex: All the indications are that we are going to receive reasonable support from abroad...
example.tran: 所有迹象都表明，我们将从国外获得有力支持。

example.ex: He gave no indication that he was ready to compromise.
example.tran: 他没有妥协的意思。

collins.def: A dealer is a person whose business involves buying and selling things.

example.ex: ...an antique dealer.
example.tran: 古董商

example.ex: ...dealers in commodities and financial securities.
example.tran: 商品和金融证券交易商

collins.def: A dealer is someone who buys and sells illegal drugs.

example.ex: They aim to clear every dealer from the street.
example.tran: 他们打算把街上所有的毒品贩子都清走。

means: 财政部长，（苏格兰等的）检察官，（西班牙及葡萄牙的）检察长

collins.tran: (政府)财政的;国库的;(尤指)税收的
collins.def: Fiscal is used to describe something that relates to government money or public money, especially taxes.

example.ex: ...in 1987, when the government tightened fiscal policy.
example.tran: 在1987 年，当时政府紧缩财政政策

collins.tran: 聪颖的;有才智的;有灵性的
collins.def: A person or animal that is intelligent has the ability to think, understand, and learn things quickly and well.

example.ex: Susan's a very bright and intelligent woman who knows her own mind.
example.tran: 苏珊是个非常聪明、有主见的女子。

example.ex: ...lively and intelligent conversation...
example.tran: 生动有趣、聪明睿智的谈话

collins.def: Something that is intelligent has the ability to think and understand instead of doing things automatically or by instinct.

example.ex: An intelligent computer will be an indispensable diagnostic tool for doctors.
example.tran: 智能计算机将成为医生不可或缺的诊断工具。

example.ex: ...the biggest-ever search for intelligent life elsewhere in the universe.
example.tran: 有史以来规模最大的寻找外星智能生命的行动

collins.def: Ingredients are the things that are used to make something, especially all the different foods you use when you are cooking a particular dish.

example.ex: Mix in the remaining ingredients.
example.tran: 混入其余的原料。

collins.def: An ingredient of a situation is one of the essential parts of it.

example.ex: The meeting had all the ingredients of high political drama...
example.tran: 这次会议具备了作为高度戏剧性的政治事件的一切要素。

example.ex: I think that is one of the major ingredients in his success.
example.tran: 我认为那是他成功的主要因素之一。

collins.def: Something that is loose is not firmly held or fixed in place.

example.ex: If a tooth feels very loose, your dentist may recommend that it's taken out...
example.tran: 如果有一颗牙齿很松，牙医可能会建议你把它拔掉。

example.ex: Two wooden beams had come loose from the ceiling...
example.tran: 房顶上有两根木梁已经松动。

collins.tran: 零散的；不相连的；松脱的
collins.def: Something that is loose is not attached to anything, or held or contained in anything.

example.ex: Two young men were racing motorcycles on the loose gravel...
example.tran: 两个小伙子正在松散的砾石路面上赛摩托车。

example.ex: Frank emptied a handful of loose change on the table...
example.tran: 弗兰克将一把零钱撒在桌子上。

collins.def: If people or animals break loose or are set loose, they are no longer held, tied, or kept somewhere and can move around freely.

example.ex: She broke loose from his embrace and crossed to the window...
example.tran: 她从他怀抱里挣脱出来，走到窗前。

example.ex: Why didn't you tell me she'd  been set loose?...
example.tran: 你干吗不告诉我她已经自由了？

collins.def: Clothes that are loose are rather large and do not fit closely.

example.ex: A pistol wasn't  that hard to hide under a loose shirt...
example.tran: 在宽松的衬衣下藏一把手枪并不难。

example.ex: Wear loose clothes as they're more comfortable.
example.tran: 穿宽松的衣服，这样会更舒服。

collins.def: If your hair is loose, it hangs freely round your shoulders and is not tied back.

example.ex: She was still in her nightdress, with her  hair hanging loose over her shoulders.
example.tran: 她还穿着睡衣，头发披散至肩。

collins.tran: 疏松的；稀松的；结构不紧密的
collins.def: If something is loose in texture, there is space between the different particles or threads it consists of.

example.ex: She gathered loose soil and let it filter slowly through her fingers.
example.tran: 她捧起疏松的泥土，任其缓缓地从指间漏下。

collins.tran: （分组、安排、组织等）松散的，随便的，自由的
collins.def: A loose grouping, arrangement, or organization is flexible rather than strictly controlled or organized.

example.ex: Murray and Alison came to some sort of loose arrangement before he went home...
example.tran: 默里在回家前和艾莉森达成了大致的约定。

example.ex: He wants a loose coalition of leftwing forces.
example.tran: 他希望左翼力量形成一个松散的联盟。

collins.tran: 意义含糊的；不严谨的；不精确的
collins.def: Loose words or expressions are not exact but rather vague.

example.ex: ...a loose translation...
example.tran: 不精确的译文

example.ex: He despised loose thinking.
example.tran: 他鄙视不严谨的思维。

collins.def: If someone describes a woman or someone's behaviour as loose, they disapprove of that person because they think she or he has sexual relationships with too many people.

example.ex: Is an actress who strips off in public necessarily a loose woman in private?...
example.tran: 在公众面前宽衣解带的女演员私下里就一定是荡妇吗？

example.ex: Lust now seems to be associated with casual sex and loose morals.
example.tran: 色欲如今似乎与性生活随便和道德放纵联系在一起了。

collins.def: To loose a shot, arrow, or missile means to fire it.

example.ex: He trained his gun down and loosed a brief burst.
example.tran: 他用枪瞄准下面后，砰砰射出一串子弹。

collins.def: If you loose something, you hold it less tightly or untie it slightly or completely.

example.ex: He gave a grunt and loosed his grip on the rifle...
example.tran: 他闷哼了一声，松开了握着来复枪的手。

example.ex: The guards loosed his arms.
example.tran: 警卫放开了他的胳膊。

collins.def: If a person or an animal is on the loose, they are free because they have escaped from a person or place.

example.ex: Up to a thousand prisoners may be on the loose inside the jail...
example.tran: 监狱里可能有上千名囚犯跑出了牢房。

example.ex: A man-eating lion is on the loose somewhere in England.
example.tran: 英格兰有一头吃人的狮子跑出来了。

collins.def: Your employer is the person or organization that you work for.

example.ex: He had been sent to Rome by his employer...
example.tran: 他已被老板派往罗马。

example.ex: The telephone company is the country's largest employer.
example.tran: 这家电话公司是该国最大的用工单位。

collins.def: Your stomach is the organ inside your body where food is digested before it moves into the intestines.

example.ex: He had an upset stomach...
example.tran: 他胃不舒服。

example.ex: My stomach is completely full.
example.tran: 我完全吃饱了。

collins.def: You can refer to the front part of your body below your waist as your stomach .

example.ex: The children lay down on their stomachs.
example.tran: 孩子们趴着躺下。

example.ex: ...stomach muscles.
example.tran: 腹肌

collins.def: If the front part of your body below your waist feels uncomfortable because you are feeling worried or frightened, you can refer to it as your stomach .

example.ex: His stomach was in knots.
example.tran: 他的五脏六腑都揪在一起了。

collins.tran: (对令人反胃的东西的)承受能力
collins.def: If you say that someone has a strong stomach, you mean that they are not disgusted by things that disgust most other people.

example.ex: Surgery often demands actual physical strength, as well as the possession of a strong stomach.
example.tran: 做外科手术常常要求有真正的体力和很强的承受恶心反胃的能力。

collins.def: If you cannot stomach something, you cannot accept it because you dislike it or disapprove of it.

example.ex: I could never stomach the cruelty involved in the wounding of animals.
example.tran: 我永远都无法忍受伤害动物时的那种残忍。

collins.def: If you do something on an empty stomach, you do it without having eaten.

example.ex: Avoid drinking on an empty stomach.
example.tran: 不要空腹饮酒。

collins.def: If you have no stomach for something, you do not have the courage to do it.

example.ex: America has no stomach for a fight...
example.tran: 美国不敢打仗。

example.ex: The surgeon didn't have the stomach to look at Kelly's face.
example.tran: 外科医生不敢看凯莉的脸。

collins.def: If you say that you feel sick to your stomach about something, you mean that you feel very angry or upset about it.

example.ex: She felt sick to her stomach just thinking about it.
example.tran: 她一想到这事就气不打一处来。

collins.tran: 令人倒胃口;使人感到恶心
collins.def: If you say that something turns your stomach or makes your stomach turn, you mean that it is so unpleasant or offensive that it makes you feel sick.

example.ex: The true facts will turn your stomach...
example.tran: 真相会不堪入目。

example.ex: I saw the shots of what happened on television and my stomach just turned over.
example.tran: 我从电视上看到了那些镜头，觉得很恶心。

collins.def: Something that is slight is very small in degree or quantity.

example.ex: Doctors say he has made a slight improvement...
example.tran: 医生说他的病情稍有好转。

example.ex: We have a slight problem...
example.tran: 我们有一个小小的问题。

collins.def: A slight person has a fairly thin and delicate looking body.

example.ex: She is smaller and slighter than Christie.
example.tran: 她比克里斯蒂瘦小。

example.ex: ...a slight, bespectacled figure.
example.tran: 身材瘦小、戴着眼镜的人

collins.def: If you are slighted, someone does or says something that insults you by treating you as if your views or feelings are not important.

example.ex: They felt slighted by not being adequately consulted.
example.tran: 没有充分征求他们的意见，这让他们感到被冷落了。

collins.tran: (用于加强陈述的否定语气)一点也(不)
collins.def: You use in the slightest to emphasize a negative statement.

example.ex: That doesn't interest me in the slightest...
example.tran: 那一点也不能引起我的兴趣。

example.ex: 'Do you worry about ageing?' — 'Not in the slightest.'
example.tran: “你担心变老吗？”——“一点也不。”

collins.def: If you describe something or someone as extraordinary, you mean that they have some extremely good or special quality.

example.ex: We've made extraordinary progress as a society in that regard...
example.tran: 在那个方面，我们的社会已经取得了巨大的进步。

example.ex: The task requires extraordinary patience and endurance...
example.tran: 那项任务需要非凡的耐心和毅力。

collins.tran: 非常奇特的;令人惊奇的
collins.def: If you describe something as extraordinary, you mean that it is very unusual or surprising.

example.ex: What an extraordinary thing to happen!...
example.tran: 这事儿真蹊跷！

example.ex: His decision to hold talks is extraordinary because it could mean the real end of the war.
example.tran: 他作出举行谈判的决定非同寻常，因为这可能意味着战争真的要结束了。

collins.def: An extraordinary meeting is arranged specially to deal with a particular situation or problem, rather than happening regularly.

example.ex: ...at an extraordinary meeting of the sport's ruling body...
example.tran: 在体育运动管理机构的特别会议上

example.ex: Representatives of the colonies met in an extraordinary congress.
example.tran: 各殖民地代表在一次特别大会上会面。

collins.tran: (盛放液体或气体的)罐，槽，箱，缸
collins.def: A tank is a large container for holding liquid or gas.

example.ex: ...an empty fuel tank...
example.tran: 空空的油箱

example.ex: Two water tanks provide a total capacity of 400 litres.
example.tran: 两个水缸的总容量为 400 升。

collins.def: A tank is a large military vehicle that is equipped with weapons and moves along on metal tracks that are fitted over the wheels.

means: 宽恕，饶（命），救命，使某人免遭（麻烦等）
多余的，剩下的（钱等），空闲的（时间等）
预备的，备用的，替换用的
〈美〉（头两个球把十柱打得）全倒

collins.def: You use spare to describe something that is the same as things that you are already using, but that you do not need yet and are keeping ready in case another one is needed.

example.ex: If possible keep a spare pair of glasses accessible in case your main pair is broken or lost...
example.tran: 如果有可能的话，最好准备一副备用眼镜，以防常用的那副眼镜打碎或者丢失。

example.ex: Don't forget to take a few spare batteries...
example.tran: 别忘了带上几节备用电池。

collins.def: You use spare to describe something that is not being used by anyone, and is therefore available for someone to use.

example.ex: They don't have a lot of spare cash...
example.tran: 他们没有多少闲钱。

example.ex: The spare bedroom is on the second floor...
example.tran: 闲置的卧室在三楼。

collins.tran: 剩余，剩下(时间、金钱或空间)
collins.def: If you have something such as time, money, or space to spare, you have some extra time, money, or space that you have not used or which you do not need.

example.ex: You got here with ninety seconds to spare...
example.tran: 你到这里的时候还剩 90 秒钟时间。

example.ex: It's not as if he has money to spare...
example.tran: 他又不是有什么余钱。

collins.tran: 抽出，拨出(金钱或其他资源)
collins.def: If you spare time or another resource for a particular purpose, you make it available for that purpose.

example.ex: She said that she could only spare 35 minutes for our meeting...
example.tran: 她说她只能抽出 35 分钟时间参加我们的会议。

example.ex: He's a very busy man, and it's good of him to spare the time to visit...
example.tran: 他是个大忙人，能抽出时间到访真是太好了。

collins.def: If a person or a place is spared, they are not harmed, even though other people or places have been.

example.ex: We have lost everything, but thank God, our lives have been spared...
example.tran: 我们已经失去了一切，不过谢天谢地，总算是保住了性命。

example.ex: Not a man was spared...
example.tran: 无人得以幸免。

collins.def: If you spare someone an unpleasant experience, you prevent them from suffering it.

example.ex: I wanted to spare Frances the embarrassment of discussing this subject...
example.tran: 讨论这个话题太尴尬，我不想让弗朗西斯难堪。

example.ex: Prisoners are spared the indignity of wearing uniforms...
example.tran: 囚犯们不必忍受身穿囚服的侮辱。

collins.def: Someone who is described as spare is tall and not at all fat.

example.ex: She was thin and spare, with a sharply intelligent face.
example.tran: 她又高又瘦，一副精明过人的模样。

collins.tran: 简单的;不加修饰的;简朴的
collins.def: Something such as a room that is spare is very plain with no unnecessary features.

example.ex: Inside, the two small rooms were spare and neat, stripped bare of ornaments.
example.tran: 进去以后是两个简单而整洁的小房间，朴实无华，没有什么装饰。

collins.def: If you spare no effort in doing something, you do it as well as possible, without worrying about the amount of work involved. If you spare no expense in doing it, you do it as well as possible, without trying to save money.

example.ex: The government is determined to spare no effort in investigating this case thoroughly...
example.tran: 政府决定不遗余力地彻底调查这个案子。

example.ex: Officials say they'll spare no expense to prevent another riot.
example.tran: 官员说他们会不惜一切地阻止再次发生暴乱。

collins.def: If you spare a thought for an unfortunate person, you make an effort to think sympathetically about them and their bad luck.

example.ex: Spare a thought for the nation's shopkeepers — consumer sales slid again in May...
example.tran: 可怜一下这个国家的店老板吧—— 5 月份消费品的销售量又下滑了。

example.ex: I do not think any of us spared a thought for the ordeal of her crew.
example.tran: 我不认为我们中间有任何一个人同情过这艘船的船员所遭受的磨难。

collins.def: You use mere to emphasize how unimportant or inadequate something is, in comparison to the general situation you are describing.

example.ex: ...successful exhibitions which go beyond mere success...
example.tran: 不仅仅是成功而是大获成功的展览

example.ex: There is more to good health than the mere absence of disease...
example.tran: 身体健康不仅仅指不生病，还包括更多。

collins.tran: 极小的，微不足道的，单单(表示虽小却有重要影响)
collins.def: You use mere to indicate that a quality or action that is usually unimportant has a very important or strong effect.

example.ex: The mere mention of food had triggered off hunger pangs...
example.tran: 单单提到食物就引起了阵阵饥饿感。

example.ex: Whenever there was a gap in the traffic the merest pressure on the accelerator was enough to close it...
example.tran: 每当车流里出现了一点儿空距，只要稍稍一踩油门，空距就没有了。

collins.tran: 只不过，仅仅(用于强调数量之小)
collins.def: You use mere to emphasize how small a particular amount or number is.

example.ex: Sixty per cent of teachers are women, but a mere 5 percent of women are heads and deputies...
example.tran: 有60%的教师是女性，但是担任校长和副校长的女性仅占5%。

example.ex: Tickets are a mere £7.50 at the door...
example.tran: 门口买票只要7.5英镑。

means: 拉格比市（英格兰中部的城市）

collins.def: Rugby or rugby football is a game played by two teams using an oval ball. Players try to score points by carrying the ball to their opponents' end of the field, or by kicking it over a bar fixed between two posts.
If something or someone is floating in a liquid, they are in the liquid, on or just below the surface, and are being supported by it. You can also float something on a liquid.

example.ex: They noticed fifty and twenty dollar bills floating in the water.
example.tran: 他们发现水中漂浮着50和20美元的纸币。

example.ex: ...barges floating quietly by the grassy river banks...
example.tran: 青草萋萋的河岸边静静漂浮着的驳船

collins.def: Something that floats lies on or just below the surface of a liquid when it is put in it and does not sink.

example.ex: Empty things float.
example.tran: 空的物体会在水中浮起。

collins.def: A float is a light object that is used to help someone or something float.
A float is a small object attached to a fishing line which floats on the water and moves when a fish has been caught.
Something that floats in or through the air hangs in it or moves slowly and gently through it.

example.ex: The white cloud of smoke floated away.
example.tran: 白色的烟雾飘远了。

example.ex: ...the sun's rays lighting up the dust floating in the air.
example.tran: 阳光照亮了空气中浮动的灰尘

collins.def: If a sound or smell floats to a place quite far away, it can be heard or smelled there.

example.ex: Sublime music floats on a scented summer breeze to the spot where you lie on the lush grass...
example.tran: 你躺在绿草如茵的草地上，涤荡心灵的乐声随着清香的夏日微风飘到你的身边。

example.ex: The smells of delicious foods floated all around him.
example.tran: 美食的香味弥漫在他的四周。

collins.tran: 优雅地走动;轻盈地走动
collins.def: If you float somewhere, you walk there very lightly and gracefully.

example.ex: Caroline floated up the aisle on her father's arm.
example.tran: 卡罗琳挽着父亲的手臂从过道上优雅地走过。

collins.def: If you float a project, plan, or idea, you suggest it for others to think about.

example.ex: The French had floated the idea of placing the diplomatic work in the hands of the UN.
example.tran: 法国提出将外交工作交由联合国处理的想法。

collins.tran: 使(公司)发行股票;使上市
collins.def: If a company director floats their company, they start to sell shares in it to the public.

example.ex: He floated his firm on the stock market...
example.tran: 他让自己的公司上市了。

example.ex: The advisers are delaying the key decision on whether to float 60 per cent or 100 per cent of the shares.
example.tran: 顾问们对于发行60%还是100%股份的关键问题迟迟未作决定。

collins.def: If a government floats its country's currency or allows it to float, it allows the currency's value to change freely in relation to other currencies.

example.ex: A decision by the Finns to float their currency sent a shudder through the foreign exchanges...
example.tran: 芬兰允许其货币自由浮动的决定在外汇市场上引起了震动。

example.ex: 59 per cent of people believed the pound should be allowed to float freely.
example.tran: 59%的人认为应该允许英镑自由浮动。

collins.def: A float is a truck on which displays and people in special costumes are carried in a festival procession.
A float is a small amount of coins and notes of low value that someone has before they start selling things so that they are able to give customers change if necessary.
A rumour or idea that is floating around is often heard or talked about.

example.ex: There are still some unfounded fears floating around out there about cancer being contagious.
example.tran: 社会上还是有一些毫无根据的关于癌症会传染的恐惧。

collins.def: CDs are small plastic discs on which sound, especially music, is recorded. CDs can also be used to store information which can be read by a computer. CD is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'compact disc'.

example.ex: The Beatles' Red and Blue compilations are issued on CD for the first time next month.
example.tran: 下个月，披头士乐队的专辑《红与蓝》将首次发行CD。

means: 铤而走险的，孤注一掷的

collins.tran: （因绝望而）孤注一掷的，铤而走险的，拼命的
collins.def: If you are desperate, you are in such a bad situation that you are willing to try anything to change it.

example.ex: Troops are needed to help get food into Kosovo where people are in desperate need...
example.tran: 需要军队帮助将科索沃人民亟需的食品送抵那里。

example.ex: Desperate with anxiety, Bob and Hans searched the whole house...
example.tran: 焦急万分的鲍勃和汉斯把整座房子找了个遍。

collins.def: If you are desperate for something or desperate to do something, you want or need it very much indeed.

example.ex: They'd been married nearly four years and June was desperate to start a family...
example.tran: 他们结婚已快4年了，琼非常渴望要个孩子。

example.ex: People are desperate for him to do something.
example.tran: 人们极希望他能做点什么。

collins.tran: 极困难的;极严重的;极危险的
collins.def: A desperate situation is very difficult, serious, or dangerous.

example.ex: India's United Nations ambassador said the situation is desperate...
example.tran: 印度驻联合国大使说形势非常危急。

example.ex: I decided not to abandon John when he was in such a desperate position.
example.tran: 我决定不在约翰走投无路的时候抛弃他。

collins.def: You use ourselves to refer to yourself and one or more other people as a group.

example.ex: We sat round the fire to keep ourselves warm...
example.tran: 我们围坐在火边取暖。

example.ex: It was the first time we admitted to ourselves that we were tired.
example.tran: 这是我们第一次承认自己累了。

collins.tran: （泛指）我们自己，人们自己（当主语和宾语为同一群人时，用作动词或介词的宾语）
collins.def: A speaker or writer sometimes uses ourselves to refer to people in general. Ourselves is used as the object of a verb or preposition when the subject refers to the same people.

example.ex: We all know that when we exert ourselves our heart rate increases.
example.tran: 我们都知道太卖命了会导致心跳加速。

collins.tran: （用于强调第一人称复数主语；在比较正式的英语中，有时代替 us 作动词或介词的宾语以示强调）我们自己，我们本人
collins.def: You use ourselves to emphasize a first person plural subject. In more formal English, ourselves is sometimes used instead of 'us' as the object of a verb or preposition, for emphasis.

example.ex: Others are feeling just the way we ourselves would feel in the same situation...
example.tran: 别人此时的感受和我们自己在同样的情形下时没什么两样。

example.ex: The people who will suffer won't be people like ourselves.
example.tran: 受苦的不会是像我们这样的人。

collins.def: If you say something such as 'We did it ourselves', you are indicating that something was done by you and a particular group of other people, rather than anyone else.

example.ex: We villagers built that ourselves, we had no help from anyone.
example.tran: 那是我们村民自己修建的，没有依靠任何人的帮助。

collins.def: In Britain, a PC is a male police officer of the lowest rank. PC is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'police constable'.

example.ex: The PCs took her to the local station...
example.tran: 警员们把她带到了当地警察局。

example.ex: PC Keith Gate helped arrest the men.
example.tran: 警员基思·盖特协助逮捕了那些人。

collins.def: A PC is a computer that is used by one person at a time in a business, a school, or at home.  PC is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'personal computer'.

example.ex: The price of a PC has fallen by an average of 25% a year since 1982...
example.tran: 自1982年以来，个人计算机的单价年均下降25%。

example.ex: Drawing offices may use PCs for computer-aided design.
example.tran: 制图室可以使用个人计算机进行计算机辅助设计。

collins.tran: 政治上正确的；不嘲弄弱势群体的
collins.def: If you say that someone is PC, you mean that they are extremely careful not to offend or upset any group of people in society who have a disadvantage. PC is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'politically correct'.
A tap is a device that controls the flow of a liquid or gas from a pipe or container, for example on a sink.

example.ex: She turned on the taps.
example.tran: 她打开了那些龙头。

example.ex: ...a cold-water tap...
example.tran: 冷水阀

collins.def: If you tap something, you hit it with a quick light blow or a series of quick light blows.

example.ex: He tapped the table to still the shouts of protest...
example.tran: 他敲了敲桌子，以平息抗议的喧闹声。

example.ex: Tap the eggs gently with a teaspoon to crack the shells...
example.tran: 用茶匙轻敲鸡蛋，让蛋壳开裂。

collins.tran: (尤指听音乐时，用手指或脚)敲节拍，打拍子
collins.def: If you tap your fingers or feet, you make a regular pattern of sound by hitting a surface lightly and repeatedly with them, especially while you are listening to music.

example.ex: The song's so catchy it makes you bounce round the living room or tap your feet.
example.tran: 这首歌很动听，听着它你就会不由自主地在客厅里舞动，或是用脚打拍子。

collins.tran: 开发，发掘，利用(资源、形势)
collins.def: If you tap a resource or situation, you make use of it by getting from it something that you need or want.

example.ex: He owes his election to having tapped deep public disillusion with professional politicians...
example.tran: 他将自己的当选归因于充分利用了公众对于职业政治家们不再抱希望的心情。

example.ex: The company is tapping shareholders for £15.8 million...
example.tran: 公司要向股东募集 1, 580 万英镑。

collins.def: If someone taps your telephone, they attach a special device to the line so that they can secretly listen to your conversations.

example.ex: The government passed laws allowing the police to tap telephones...
example.tran: 政府通过了允许警方监听电话的法令。

example.ex: We suspected the telephone line was tapped.
example.tran: 我们怀疑电话遭人窃听了。

collins.tran: (饮料)散装的，可随时(打开旋塞)取饮的
collins.def: If drinks are on tap, they come from a tap rather than from a bottle.

example.ex: Filtered water is always on tap, making it very convenient to use.
example.tran: 随时打开龙头都有过滤水，用起来很方便。

collins.tran: 可轻松获取;可随时使用
collins.def: If something is on tap, you can have as much of it as you want whenever you want.

example.ex: The advantage of group holidays is company on tap but time alone if you want it.
example.tran: 团体度假的好处在于，要找人陪伴非常容易，想要独处也行。

collins.def: Poverty is the state of being extremely poor.

example.ex: According to World Bank figures, 41 per cent of Brazilians live in absolute poverty...
example.tran: 根据世界银行的统计数字，41%的巴西人生活在赤贫中。

example.ex: Garvey died in loneliness and poverty.
example.tran: 加维在孤独和穷困中死去。

collins.def: You can use poverty to refer to any situation in which there is not enough of something or its quality is poor.

example.ex: Britain has suffered from a poverty of ambition.
example.tran: 英国一直缺乏远大理想。

example.ex: ...a poverty of ideas.
example.tran: 思想贫乏

collins.def: When a baby is born, you refer to this event as his or her birth .

example.ex: It was the birth of his grandchildren which gave him greatest pleasure...
example.tran: 孙子孙女的出生给他带来了极大的快乐。

example.ex: She concealed her pregnancy right up to the moment of birth...
example.tran: 她隐瞒了自己怀孕的事，直到孩子出世。

collins.def: You can refer to the beginning or origin of something as its birth .

example.ex: ...the birth of popular democracy.
example.tran: 人民民主的诞生

collins.def: Some people talk about a person's  birth when they are referring to the social position of the person's family.

example.ex: ...men of low birth...
example.tran: 出身卑微的人

example.ex: His birth, background and career show that you can make it in this country on merit alone.
example.tran: 他的出身、背景和职业表明，在这个国家仅凭自己的能力就可以取得成功。

collins.def: If, for example, you are French by birth, you are French because your parents are French, or because you were born in France.

example.ex: Sadrudin was an Iranian by birth.
example.tran: 萨德尔丁是伊朗血统。

collins.def: When a woman gives birth, she produces a baby from her body.

example.ex: She's just given birth to a baby girl...
example.tran: 她刚生了一个女孩。

example.ex: She's due to give birth at any moment.
example.tran: 她随时可能分娩。

collins.def: To give birth to something such as an idea means to cause it to start to exist.

example.ex: In 1980, strikes at the Lenin Shipyards gave birth to the Solidarity trade union.
example.tran: 1980年，列宁造船厂的罢工致使团结工会得以成立。

collins.def: The country, town, or village of your birth is the place where you were born.
You can refer to a period of history or a long period of time as an era when you want to draw attention to a particular feature or quality that it has.

example.ex: ...the nuclear era...
example.tran: 核时代

example.ex: ...the Reagan-Bush era...
example.tran: 里根-布什时期

collins.tran: （尤指与未来相对的）现存的，现行的，目前的
collins.def: Existing is used to describe something which is now present, available, or in operation, especially when you are contrasting it with something which is planned for the future.

example.ex: ...the need to improve existing products and develop new lines...
example.tran: 改进现有产品、开发新生产线的需要

example.ex: Existing timbers are replaced or renewed...
example.tran: 现有的木料进行了替换或翻新。

collins.def: When you make a comparison, you consider two or more things and discover the differences between them.

example.ex: ...a comparison of the British and German economies...
example.tran: 英国经济与德国经济的比较

example.ex: Its recommendations are based on detailed comparisons between the public and private sectors...
example.tran: 建议是建立在对国营部门与私营部门进行详细比较的基础上的。

collins.def: When you make a comparison, you say that one thing is like another in some way.

example.ex: It is demonstrably an unfair comparison...
example.tran: 这样打比方显然不公平。

example.ex: He finds the comparison of insect wings with a sailing boat useful up to a point...
example.tran: 他发现把昆虫的翅膀比作一艘帆船在某种程度上是有用的。

collins.def: If you say, for example, that something is large or small in comparison with ,in comparison to, or by comparison with something else, you mean that it is larger or smaller than the other thing.

example.ex: Is the human heart weak in comparison with the other organs?...
example.tran: 与其他器官相比，人的心脏是不是很脆弱？

example.ex: The amount of carbon dioxide released by human activities such as burning coal and oil is small in comparison...
example.tran: 相比之下，人类活动燃烧煤、石油等所释放的二氧化碳要少一些。

collins.tran: 不能相提并论;不能相比
collins.def: If you say there is no comparison between one thing and another, you mean that you think the first thing is much better than the second, or very different from it.

example.ex: There is no comparison between the knowledge and skill of such a player and the ordinary casual participant.
example.tran: 临时的普通参赛者无法与这种选手所掌握的知识和技巧相提并论。

collins.def: If someone or something stands or bears comparison with another person or thing, they are as good, or almost as good.

example.ex: ...the only post-war French intellectual who stands comparison with De Tocqueville.
example.tran: 法国战后唯一能与德·托克维尔相媲美的知识分子

collins.def: A proportion of a group or an amount is a part of it.

example.ex: A large proportion of the dolphins in that area will eventually die...
example.tran: 那片区域里的很大一部分海豚终将死去。
