example.ex: A proportion of the rent is met by the city council.
example.tran: 一部分租金由市政委员会支付。

collins.def: The proportion of one kind of person or thing in a group is the number of people or things of that kind compared to the total number of people or things in the group.

example.ex: The proportion of women in the profession had risen to 17.3%...
example.tran: 从事该职业的女性比例已升高到17.3%。

example.ex: The radio station has to include a substantial proportion of classical music.
example.tran: 该电台不得不播放大量的古典音乐。

collins.def: The proportion of one amount to another is the relationship between the two amounts in terms of how much there is of each thing.

example.ex: Women's bodies tend to have a higher proportion of fat to water.
example.tran: 女性的身体内脂肪与水分的比例往往更高。

collins.tran: （通常指极其巨大的事物的）大小，尺寸
collins.def: If you refer to the proportions of something, you are referring to its size, usually when this is extremely large.

example.ex: In the tropics plants grow to huge proportions.
example.tran: 在热带，植物会长得非常高大。

example.ex: ...a fraud of breathtaking proportions.
example.tran: 金额惊人的诈骗案

collins.tran: （艺术品或设计的各部分之间的）比例
collins.def: If you refer to the proportions in a work of art or design, you are referring to the relative sizes of its different parts.

example.ex: You can vary the relative proportions of things in a picture very simply.
example.tran: 你能很简单地改变一幅画中事物的相对比例。

collins.def: If one thing increases or decreases in proportion to another thing, it increases or decreases to the same degree as that thing.

example.ex: The pressure in the cylinders would go up  in proportion to the boiler pressure.
example.tran: 汽缸内的压力会随着汽锅压力的增加而相应增加。

collins.def: If something is small or large in proportion to something else, it is small or large when compared with that thing.

example.ex: Children tend to have relatively larger heads than adults in proportion to the rest of their body.
example.tran: 与成人相比，儿童头部占整个身体的比例相对较大。

collins.tran: 与…极不成比例；与…完全不相称
collins.def: If you say that something is out of all proportion to something else, you think that it is far greater or more serious than it should be.

example.ex: The punishment was out of all proportion to the crime.
example.tran: 罚不当罪。

collins.def: If you get something out of proportion, you think it is more important or worrying than it really is. If you keep something in proportion, you have a realistic view of how important it is.

example.ex: Everything just got blown out of proportion...
example.tran: 所有一切都变得不可收拾了。

example.ex: We've got to keep this in proportion.
example.tran: 我们应当正确对待这一点。

collins.tran: 区别轻重缓急的能力；分寸感；主次观念
collins.def: If someone has a sense of proportion, they know what is really important and what is not.

example.ex: We must not lose our sense of proportion.
example.tran: 我们不能丧失主次观念。

means: 英寸（相当于 2。54 厘米，一英尺有12英寸）

collins.def: An inch is an imperial unit of length, approximately equal to 2.54 centimetres. There are twelve inches in a foot.

example.ex: ...a candy tin 6 inches high and 8 inches in diameter.
example.tran: 高 6 英寸、直径 8 英寸的糖果罐子

example.ex: ...18 inches below the surface.
example.tran: 表面以下 18 英寸

collins.def: To inch somewhere or to inch something somewhere means to move there very slowly and carefully, or to make something do this.

example.ex: ...a climber inching up a vertical wall of rock...
example.tran: 沿一面陡直石壁慢慢往上爬的人

example.ex: He inched the van forward...
example.tran: 他一点点向前挪动着货车。

collins.tran: (某个地方的)全部，每一寸地方
collins.def: If you talk about every inch of an area, you are emphasizing that you mean the whole of it.

example.ex: Every inch of shelf space was crammed with books...
example.tran: 书架上全都塞满了书。

example.ex: We are prepared to fight for every inch of territory.
example.tran: 我们时刻准备着为每一寸领土而战。

collins.def: If you say that someone looks every inch a certain type of person, you are emphasizing that they look exactly like that kind of person.

example.ex: He looks every inch the City businessman...
example.tran: 他完全是一副伦敦金融城商界人士的派头。

example.ex: There stood Gertrude, looking every inch a star.
example.tran: 格特鲁德站在那里,完全是一副明星的派头。

collins.def: If someone or something moves inch by inch, they move very slowly and carefully.

example.ex: The car moved forward inch by inch...
example.tran: 汽车一点一点地向前移动。

example.ex: The police were searching the area inch by inch.
example.tran: 警方在对那个地区进行仔细搜查。

collins.def: A homosexual relationship is a sexual relationship between people of the same sex.
Someone who is homosexual is sexually attracted to people of the same sex.

example.ex: A fraud trial involving two homosexual lawyers was abandoned.
example.tran: 一桩涉及两名同性恋律师的欺诈案审判被撤销了。

means: 势不可挡的，压倒一切的，巨大的

collins.tran: 极强烈的；势不可挡的；令人不知所措的
collins.def: If something is overwhelming, it affects you very strongly, and you do not know how to deal with it.

example.ex: The task won't feel so overwhelming if you break it down into small, easy-to-accomplish steps...
example.tran: 如果将这个任务细分为简单易行的若干步骤来做，便不会感到如此无所适从。

example.ex: She felt an overwhelming desire to have another child.
example.tran: 她一心想再要一个孩子。

collins.def: You can use overwhelming to emphasize that an amount or quantity is much greater than other amounts or quantities.

example.ex: The overwhelming majority of small businesses go broke within the first twenty-four months...
example.tran: 绝大多数小企业在头两年内就破产了。

example.ex: The party won an overwhelming victory in Burma's general elections last May...
example.tran: 去年5月，该党在缅甸大选中获得了压倒性的胜利。

means: 准予退休，强迫退休（并发给退休金）

collins.def: Someone who has a pension receives a regular sum of money from the state or from a former employer because they have retired or because they are widowed or disabled.

example.ex: ...struggling by on a pension.
example.tran: 靠养老金苦苦支撑

example.ex: ...a company pension scheme.
example.tran: 公司养老金计划

collins.def: Surgery is medical treatment in which someone's body is cut open so that a doctor can repair, remove, or replace a diseased or damaged part.

example.ex: His father has just recovered from heart surgery...
example.tran: 他父亲刚刚从心脏外科手术中康复过来。

example.ex: Mr Clark underwent five hours of emergency surgery.
example.tran: 克拉克先生经受了 5 个小时的外科急救手术。

collins.def: A surgery is the room or house where a doctor or dentist works.

example.ex: Bill was in the doctor's surgery demanding to know what was wrong with him.
example.tran: 比尔在医生的诊疗室里想要知道自己到底得了什么病。

collins.def: A doctor's surgery is the period of time each day when a doctor sees patients at his or her surgery.

example.ex: His surgery always ends at eleven.
example.tran: 他的出诊时间总是到11点结束。

collins.def: In Britain, when someone such as an MP or a local councillor holds a surgery, they go to an office where members of the public can come and talk to them about problems or issues that concern them.
A surgery is the room in a hospital where surgeons operate on their patients.

means: [橄榄球]擒住并摔倒（一名对方球员）

collins.tran: (果断或高效地)应对，处理，解决(难题或任务)
collins.def: If you tackle a difficult problem or task, you deal with it in a very determined or efficient way.

example.ex: The first reason to tackle these problems is to save children's lives...
example.tran: 果断处理这些问题的首要原因是为了挽救孩子们的生命。

example.ex: Firemen later tackled the blaze.
example.tran: 消防队员们后来扑灭了这场大火。

collins.tran: (曲棍球、足球等比赛中)抢断，阻截，铲断;(英式、美式橄榄球比赛中)擒抱摔倒
collins.def: If you tackle someone in a game such as hockey or football, you try to take the ball away from them. If you tackle someone in rugby or American football, you knock them to the ground.

example.ex: Foley tackled the quarterback.
example.tran: 福利成功拦截了四分卫。

collins.def: If you tackle someone about a particular matter, you speak to them honestly about it, usually in order to get it changed or done.

example.ex: I tackled him about how anyone could live amidst so much poverty.
example.tran: 我坦率地问他，人在如此贫穷的环境中如何还能生存。

collins.def: If you tackle someone, you attack them and fight them.

example.ex: He claims Pasolini overtook and tackled him, pushing him into the dirt.
example.tran: 他声称帕索利尼追上去打他，把他推倒在烂泥里。

collins.tran: (体育等活动的)器具，器材;（尤指）渔具
collins.def: Tackle is the equipment that you need for a sport or activity, especially fishing.

example.ex: ...fishing tackle.
example.tran: 渔具

collins.def: Tackle is the equipment, usually consisting of ropes and pulleys, needed for lifting or pulling something.

example.ex: I finally hoisted him up with a block and tackle.
example.tran: 我最终用滑轮组把他拉了上去。

means: 内心的，精神的，思想的，心理的
〈口〉精神病的，意志薄弱的，愚笨的

collins.def: Mental means relating to the process of thinking.

example.ex: ...the mental development of children.
example.tran: 儿童的智力发展

example.ex: ...intensive mental effort.
example.tran: 高强度的脑力劳动

collins.def: Mental means relating to the state or the health of a person's mind.

example.ex: The mental state that had created her psychosis was no longer present.
example.tran: 导致她精神失常的那种心理状态已经消失了。

example.ex: ...mental health problems.
example.tran: 心理健康问题

collins.tran: 内心的;在头脑中进行的
collins.def: A mental act is one that involves only thinking and not physical action.

example.ex: Practise mental arithmetic when you go out shopping...
example.tran: 外出购物的时候练习一下心算。

example.ex: Graham made a quick mental calculation.
example.tran: 格雷厄姆很快就心算出来了。

collins.def: If you say that someone is mental, you mean that you think they are mad.

example.ex: I just said to him 'you must be mental'.
example.tran: 我刚才对他说：“你一定是疯了。”

collins.tran: 记在脑子里;把…牢记在心
collins.def: If you make a mental note of something, you make an effort to store it in your memory so that you will not forget it.

example.ex: She made a mental note to have his prescription refilled.
example.tran: 她记着要拿他的处方再配一回药。

example.ex: She made a mental note not to sit anywhere near him.
example.tran: 她心里牢牢记着不坐在他的附近。

means: 给予，赠送( give的过去分词)

collins.def: Given is the past participle of give .
If you talk about, for example, any given position or a given time, you mean the particular position or time that you are discussing.

example.ex: In chess there are typically about 36 legal moves from any given board position...
example.tran: 在国际象棋中，一般来说从棋盘任何位置都可以移动大约36步。

example.ex: Over a given period, the value of shares will rise and fall.
example.tran: 股票的价值在某一特定的时期内会有涨跌。

collins.def: Given is used when indicating a possible situation in which someone has the opportunity or ability to do something. For example, given the chance means 'if I had the chance'.

example.ex: Write down the sort of thing you would like to do, given the opportunity...
example.tran: 写下有机会的话你想做的事情。

example.ex: Given patience, successful breeding of this species can be achieved.
example.tran: 只要有耐心，是能成功培育出这一品种的。

collins.def: If you say given that something is the case, you mean taking that fact into account.

example.ex: Usually, I am sensible with money, as I have to be, given that I don't earn that much.
example.tran: 考虑到自己挣得不多，我用钱通常比较精打细算，这也是迫不得已。

collins.def: If you say given something, you mean taking that thing into account.

example.ex: Given the uncertainty over Leigh's future I was left with little other choice.
example.tran: 考虑到利前途未卜，我没有什么选择余地。

collins.def: If you are given to doing something, you often do it.

example.ex: I am not very given to emotional displays.
example.tran: 我不习惯表露自己的感情。

collins.tran: 大概；很可能；也许；据推测
collins.def: If you say that something is presumably the case, you mean that you think it is very likely to be the case, although you are not certain.

example.ex: Presumably the front door was locked when you came down this morning?...
example.tran: 早上你下楼的时候，前门大概是锁上的吧？

example.ex: The spear is presumably the murder weapon...
example.tran: 这支鱼叉可能就是凶器。

means: 成形(shape的过去分词和过去式)

collins.def: Something that is shaped like a particular object or in a particular way has the shape of that object or a shape of that type.

example.ex: A new perfume from Russia came in a bottle shaped like a tank.
example.tran: 一种来自俄罗斯的新款香水装在坦克状的瓶子里。

example.ex: ...oddly shaped little packages.
example.tran: 奇形怪状的小包装

means: 对立面，对立物，相反的人[事物]

collins.def: If one thing is opposite another, it is on the other side of a space from it.

example.ex: Jennie had sat opposite her at breakfast.
example.tran: 珍妮吃早餐时坐在她对面。

collins.def: The opposite side or part of something is the side or part that is furthest away from you.

example.ex: ...the opposite corner of the room.
example.tran: 房间的对角

collins.tran: （同一类事物）截然相反的，全然不同的
collins.def: Opposite is used to describe things of the same kind which are completely different in a particular way. For example, north and south are opposite directions, and winning and losing are opposite results in a game.

example.ex: All the cars driving in the opposite direction had their headlights on...
example.tran: 对面开来的车都打着头灯。

example.ex: I should have written the notes in the opposite order...
example.tran: 我本应按相反的顺序记笔记的。

collins.def: The opposite of someone or something is the person or thing that is most different from them.

example.ex: Ritter was a very complex man but Marius was the opposite, a simple farmer...
example.tran: 里特城府颇深，而马里厄斯恰恰相反，是个心地淳朴的农民。

example.ex: Well, whatever he says you can bet he's thinking the opposite...
example.tran: 呃，不管他说什么，你都可以肯定他想的完全是另一套。

collins.def: A pub is a building where people can have drinks, especially alcoholic drinks, and talk to their friends. Many pubs also serve food.

example.ex: He was in the pub until closing time...
example.tran: 他在酒吧里一直呆到打烊。

example.ex: Richard used to run a pub.
example.tran: 理查德曾经开过酒吧。

collins.def: A percentage is a fraction of an amount expressed as a particular number of hundredths of that amount.

example.ex: Only a few vegetable-origin foods have such a high percentage of protein.
example.tran: 只有几种蔬菜食品有如此高的蛋白质含量。

collins.def: An excerpt is a short piece of writing or music which is taken from a larger piece.

example.ex: ...an excerpt from Tchaikovsky's Nutcracker.
example.tran: 柴可夫斯基的《胡桃夹子》选段

collins.def: If a long piece of writing or music is excerpted, short pieces from it are printed or played on their own.

example.ex: The readings you heard earlier were excerpted from a new oral history of Pearl Harbor.
example.tran: 你之前听到的朗读片段节选自一部新的珍珠港口述史。

means: （用颜料、彩色笔等）为…着色(colour的过去式和过去分词)

collins.def: Something that is coloured a particular colour is that colour.

example.ex: The illustration shows a cluster of five roses coloured apricot orange.
example.tran: 插图上是一簇杏橙色的玫瑰，一共5朵。

example.ex: ...a cheap gold-coloured bracelet.
example.tran: 廉价的金色手链

collins.def: Something that is coloured is a particular colour or combination of colours, rather than being just white, black, or the colour that it is naturally.

example.ex: You can often choose between plain white or coloured and patterned scarves.
example.tran: 常可在纯白色或带图案的彩色围巾中作出选择。

example.ex: ...brightly coloured silks laid out on market stalls.
example.tran: 市场摊位上摆放的颜色鲜艳的丝绸

collins.def: A coloured person belongs to a race of people with dark skins.
People whose skin is dark are sometimes referred to as coloureds .

Soccer is a game played by two teams of eleven players using a round ball. Players kick the ball to each other and try to score goals by kicking the ball into a large net. Outside the USA, this game is also referred to as football .
You can refer to the amusing things that people say as their humour .

example.ex: Her humour and determination were a source of inspiration to others.
example.tran: 她的幽默言谈和坚定决心对其他人来说是一种鼓舞。

collins.def: Humour is a quality in something that makes you laugh, for example in a situation, in someone's words or actions, or in a book or film.

example.ex: She felt sorry for the man but couldn't ignore the humour of the situation.
example.tran: 她很同情这个男人，但这一情景又让她忍俊不禁。

collins.def: If you are in a good humour, you feel cheerful and happy, and are pleasant to people. If you are in a bad humour, you feel bad-tempered and unhappy, and are unpleasant to people.

example.ex: Christina was still not clear why he had been in such ill humour...
example.tran: 克里斯蒂娜仍搞不清楚为什么他情绪这么差。

example.ex: Next day, Louis XIV was in the best of humours...
example.tran: 第二天，路易十四心情好得不得了。

collins.def: If you do something with good humour, you do it cheerfully and pleasantly.

example.ex: Hugo bore his illness with great courage and good humour.
example.tran: 雨果以巨大的勇气和良好的精神状态面对疾病。

collins.def: If you humour someone who is behaving strangely, you try to please them or pretend to agree with them, so that they will not become upset.

example.ex: She disliked Dido but was prepared to tolerate her for a weekend in order to humour her husband.
example.tran: 她不喜欢迪多，但准备暂时忍受她一个周末，以迁就自己的丈夫。

means: 自然地，表现自然地，顺理成章地

collins.def: You use naturally to indicate that you think something is very obvious and not at all surprising in the circumstances.

example.ex: When things go wrong, all of us naturally feel disappointed and frustrated...
example.tran: 出问题时，我们大家自然都感到失望和沮丧。

example.ex: Naturally these comings and goings excited some curiosity...
example.tran: 所发生的这些事自然激起了某种好奇。

collins.tran: 自然地;合理地;顺理成章地
collins.def: If one thing develops naturally from another, it develops as a normal consequence or result of it.

example.ex: A study of yoga leads naturally to meditation.
example.tran: 学习瑜伽自然会发展到进行冥想。

collins.def: You can use naturally to talk about a characteristic of someone's personality when it is the way that they normally act.

example.ex: He has a lively sense of humour and appears naturally confident.
example.tran: 他有一种活泼外向的幽默感，看上去大方自信。

collins.def: If someone is naturally good at something, they learn it easily and quickly and do it very well.

example.ex: Some individuals are naturally good communicators.
example.tran: 一些人天生善于交流沟通。

collins.def: If something comes naturally to you, you find it easy to do and quickly become good at it.

example.ex: With football, it was just something that came naturally to me.
example.tran: 说起踢足球，对我来说再容易不过。

means: 用沙哑的声音或嗓音发音

collins.def: Your throat is the back of your mouth and the top part of the tubes that go down into your stomach and your lungs.

example.ex: She had a sore throat...
example.tran: 她嗓子疼。

example.ex: As she stared at him she felt her throat go dry.
example.tran: 她盯着他看的时候，感觉自己的喉咙发干。

collins.def: Your throat is the front part of your neck.

example.ex: His striped tie was loosened at his throat.
example.tran: 他的条纹领带松松地挂在脖子上。

collins.def: If you clear your throat, you cough once in order to make it easier to speak or to attract people's attention.

example.ex: Cross cleared his throat and spoke in low, polite tones.
example.tran: 克罗斯清了清嗓子，开始有礼貌地低声说话。

collins.tran: 向…反复灌输;向…不断强调;迫使…接受
collins.def: If you ram something down someone's throat or force it down their throat, you keep mentioning a situation or idea in order to make them accept it or believe it.

example.ex: I've always been close to my dad but he's never rammed his career down my throat...
example.tran: 我一直和爸爸很亲近，不过他从不强迫我继承他的事业。

example.ex: I can't understand why we're trying to ram Shakespeare down their throats.
example.tran: 我搞不懂我们为什么硬要他们学习莎士比亚的作品。

collins.def: If two people or groups are at each other's throats, they are quarrelling or fighting violently with each other.

example.ex: The idea that Billy and I are at each other's throats couldn't be further from the truth.
example.tran: 认为我和比利斗得你死我活的想法真是大错特错。

collins.def: If something sticks in your throat, you find it unacceptable.

example.ex: What sticks in my throat is that I wasn't able to win the trophy...
example.tran: 令我耿耿于怀的是自己没能获奖。

example.ex: She wanted to ask if he had news of Keith, but the words stuck in her throat.
example.tran: 她想问他有没有基思的消息，可是难以启齿。

collins.def: Buttons are small hard objects sewn on to shirts, coats, or other pieces of clothing. You fasten the clothing by pushing the buttons through holes called buttonholes.

example.ex: ...a coat with brass buttons.
example.tran: 带铜纽扣的外套

collins.def: If you button a shirt, coat, or other piece of clothing, you fasten it by pushing its buttons through the buttonholes.

example.ex: Ferguson stood up and buttoned his coat.
example.tran: 弗格森站起身来，扣上了外套。

collins.def: A button is a small object on a machine or electrical device that you press in order to operate it.

example.ex: He reached for the remote control and pressed the 'play' button.
example.tran: 他伸手拿过遥控器，按下“播放”键。

collins.def: A button is a small piece of metal or plastic which you wear in order to show that you support a particular movement, organization, or person. You fasten a button to your clothes with a pin.
If you say that someone presses the right button or pushes the right button, you mean that they get what they want from a particular situation or person by behaving in a clever way.

example.ex: Buchanan pushed all the right buttons, appealing to Maher's loyalty and to his guilt.
example.tran: 布坎南通过激发马厄的忠心和负罪感得到了他想要的东西。

collins.def: If something is fixed somewhere, it is attached there firmly or securely.

example.ex: It is fixed on the wall...
example.tran: 它固定在墙上。

example.ex: Most blinds can be fixed directly to the top of the window-frame...
example.tran: 大多数窗帘都可直接安装在窗框上边。

collins.tran: 确定，决定，选定(日期、价格、政策等)
collins.def: If you fix something, for example a date, price, or policy, you decide and say exactly what it will be.

example.ex: He's going to fix a time when I can see him...
example.tran: 他会确定一个我和他会面的时间。

example.ex: The date of the election was fixed...
example.tran: 选举日期定下来了。

collins.def: If you fix something for someone, you arrange for it to happen or you organize it for them.

example.ex: I've fixed it for you to see Bonnie Lachlan...
example.tran: 你去见邦尼·拉克伦的事我已经安排好了。

example.ex: It's fixed. He's going to meet us at the airport...
example.tran: 已经安排好了，他会在机场接我们。

collins.def: If you fix something which is damaged or which does not work properly, you repair it.

example.ex: He cannot fix the electricity...
example.tran: 他不会修电路。

example.ex: If something is broken, we get it fixed.
example.tran: 如果什么东西坏了，我们就找人来修理。

collins.def: If you fix a problem or a bad situation, you deal with it and make it satisfactory.

example.ex: It's not too late to fix the problem, although time is clearly getting short...
example.tran: 虽然时间越来越紧迫，但现在处理这个问题还为时未晚。

example.ex: Fixing a 40-year-old wrong does not mean, however, that history can be undone.
example.tran: 但是，平反一件40年的冤案并不意味着历史可以重写。

collins.def: You can refer to a solution to a problem as a fix .

example.ex: Many of those changes could just be a temporary fix.
example.tran: 那些变革中可能有很多只是权宜之计。

collins.tran: (目光)专注于，凝视;目不转睛地看
collins.def: If you fix your eyes on someone or something or if your eyes fix on them, you look at them with complete attention.

example.ex: She fixes her steel-blue eyes on an unsuspecting local official...
example.tran: 她那灰蓝色的眼睛紧盯着一个毫无戒心的地方官员。

example.ex: Her soft brown eyes fixed on Kelly...
example.tran: 她那双温柔的棕色眼睛紧盯着凯利。

collins.def: If you fix someone with a particular kind of expression, you look at them in that way.

example.ex: He took her hand and fixed her with a look of deep concern...
example.tran: 他抓住她的手，表情极其关切地看着她。

example.ex: He fixed me with a lopsided grin.
example.tran: 他冲我歪嘴笑了笑。

collins.tran: 将(注意力)集中在;专心考虑
collins.def: If you fix your attention on someone or something, you think about them with complete attention.

example.ex: Fix your attention on the practicalities of financing your schemes...
example.tran: 重点考虑为你的计划融资是否可行。

example.ex: Attention is fixed on the stock market...
example.tran: 重点关注的是证券市场。

collins.tran: 牢记，铭记，镌刻(在头脑中)
collins.def: If someone or something is fixed in your mind, you remember them well, for example because they are very important, interesting, or unusual.

example.ex: Leonard was now fixed in his mind...
example.tran: 伦纳德现在已经令他无法忘怀。

example.ex: Amy watched the child's intent face eagerly, trying to fix it in her mind.
example.tran: 埃米急切地看着孩子那张神情专注的脸，想把它记在脑海里。

collins.tran: 把(枪、相机、雷达)对准(或瞄准、指向)
collins.def: If someone fixes a gun, camera, or radar on something, they point it at that thing.

example.ex: The US crew fixed its radar on the Turkish ship...
example.tran: 美国船员将雷达对准那艘土耳其船。

example.ex: The bore of the gun remained fixed on me.
example.tran: 枪口依然指着我。

collins.tran: (通常用雷达或电子设备)找到，弄清，确定(确切位置)
collins.def: If you fix the position of something, you find out exactly where it is, usually by using radar or electronic equipment.

example.ex: He had not been able to fix his position...
example.tran: 他一直未能确定他所在的位置。

example.ex: The satellite fixes positions by making repeated observations of each star.
example.tran: 卫星通过对每颗恒星反复观察进行定位。

collins.def: If you get a fix on someone or something, you have a clear idea or understanding of them.

example.ex: It's been hard to get a steady fix on what's going on.
example.tran: 要对正在发生的事情保持持续的关注和了解并不容易。

collins.def: If you fix some food or a drink for someone, you make it or prepare it for them.

example.ex: Sarah fixed some food for us...
example.tran: 萨拉为我们准备了一些吃的。

example.ex: Let me fix you a drink...
example.tran: 我给你弄杯饮料吧。

collins.tran: 整理，收拾(头发、衣服或妆容)
collins.def: If you fix your hair, clothes, or make-up, you arrange or adjust them so you look neat and tidy, showing you have taken care with your appearance.

example.ex: 'I've got to fix my hair,' I said and retreated to my bedroom...
example.tran: “我得把头发梳理一下，”我说罢回到了卧室。

example.ex: She called a cab, fixed her face, and scrawled a hasty note to Brian.
example.tran: 她叫了辆出租车，补了一下妆，匆匆地给布莱恩写了张便条。

collins.def: If you have your teeth fixed, you have treatment from a dentist to make your teeth even, straight, and white.

example.ex: The PR man suggested that I might benefit from getting my teeth fixed...
example.tran: 公关顾问建议说，整牙也许对我有好处。

example.ex: I wonder if Tom ever had his teeth fixed anywhere else.
example.tran: 我在想汤姆是不是在别的地方整过牙。

collins.tran: 在(比赛、竞选等活动中)作弊，做手脚，操纵
collins.def: If someone fixes a race, election, contest, or other event, they make unfair or illegal arrangements or use deception to affect the result.

example.ex: They offered opposing players bribes to fix a decisive league match against Valenciennes...
example.tran: 他们贿赂对方队员，在联赛对阵瓦朗谢讷队的一场决定性比赛中作弊。

example.ex: We didn't 'fix' anything. It'll be seen as it happens...
example.tran: 我们没做任何手脚，该什么样就会什么样。

collins.def: If you accuse someone of fixing prices, you accuse them of making unfair arrangements to charge a particular price for something, rather than allowing market forces to decide it.

example.ex: ...a suspected cartel that had fixed the price of steel for the construction market...
example.tran: 涉嫌操控建筑市场钢材价格的卡特尔

example.ex: The company is currently in dispute with the government over price fixing.
example.tran: 该公司目前与政府在是否存在价格操控问题上存在分歧。

collins.def: An injection of an addictive drug such as heroin can be referred to as a fix .

collins.tran: (维持身体或心理需要所需的)一个剂量，一定数量
collins.def: You can use fix to refer to an amount of something which a person gets or wants and which helps them physically or psychologically to survive.

example.ex: It turned the country into an 'aid junkie', heavily dependent on its annual fix of dollars...
example.tran: 这使得该国严重依赖每年救济的那点美元，成了“嗜援成瘾”的国家。

example.ex: I need my fix of sugar, sweets, and chocolate...
example.tran: 我离不开糖、甜品和巧克力。

collins.tran: (尤指由自己引起的)困境，窘境
collins.def: If you are in a fix, you are in a difficult situation, especially one that you have caused for yourself.

example.ex: He was in a fix...
example.tran: 他陷入了困境。

example.ex: The government has really got itself into a fix...
example.tran: 政府真的让自己陷入了困境。

collins.def: To fix something such as a dye or photographic image means to treat it with chemicals so that it does not lose its colour or disappear.

example.ex: Certain pigment colours were painted on to dry plaster using tempera (where egg yolk is used to fix the pigment)...
example.tran: 使用蛋彩画颜料(内含可以定色的蛋黄)在干石膏上绘出了特定颜色。

example.ex: The main aim of inbreeding is to standardise, to fix desirable inherited characteristics and to dispel undesirable ones.
example.tran: 同系交配的主要目的就是实现标准化，保持理想的遗传特性，并消除不良的特性。

collins.def: If you say that you will fix someone, you mean that you will stop their activities permanently.

example.ex: That'll fix him.
example.tran: 那样他就不会再干了。

collins.def: If you say that you are fixing to do something, you mean that you are planning or intending to do it.

example.ex: I'm fixing to go to graduate school...
example.tran: 我打算去读研究生。

example.ex: He would know when I was fixing to leave. He'd wait by the front door.
example.tran: 他会知道我打算什么时候走，他还会在前门等着。

collins.def: If you fix on a particular thing, you decide that it is the one you want and will have.

example.ex: The Vietnamese government has fixed on May 19th to celebrate his anniversary.
example.tran: 越南政府已经决定于5月19日庆祝他的诞辰。

collins.def: If you fix something up, you arrange it.

example.ex: I fixed up an appointment to see her...
example.tran: 我安排了与她见面。

example.ex: Accommodation is never fixed up in advance.
example.tran: 住宿从未提前安排好。

collins.def: If you fix something up, you do work that is necessary in order to make it more suitable or attractive.

example.ex: I've fixed up Matthew's old room...
example.tran: 我已经把马修原来住的房间装饰了一番。

example.ex: The whole block is being fixed up.
example.tran: 整个街区都在进行装修。

collins.def: If you fix someone up with something they need, you provide it for them.

example.ex: We'll fix him up with a tie...
example.tran: 我们将给他准备一条领带。

example.ex: He was fixed up with a job.
example.tran: 别人给他找了一份工作。

collins.def: If you combine two or more things or if they combine, they exist together.

example.ex: The Church has something to say on how to combine freedom with responsibility...
example.tran: 教会想就如何把自由与责任结合起来发表一下意见。

example.ex: If improved education is combined with other factors dramatic results can be achieved...
example.tran: 如果把改良的教育体系和其他的因素结合起来，会取得非常惊人的效果。

collins.def: If you combine two or more things or if they combine, they join together to make a single thing.

example.ex: David Jacobs was given the job of combining the data from these 19 studies into one giant study...
example.tran: 分给戴维·雅格布斯的任务是把这19项研究得出的数据加以综合，使之成为一项大型研究。

example.ex: Combine the flour with 3 tablespoons water to make a paste...
example.tran: 往面粉里加3大勺水揉成面团。

collins.def: If someone or something combines two qualities or features, they have both those qualities or features at the same  time.

example.ex: Their system seems to combine the two ideals of strong government and proportional representation.
example.tran: 他们的体制似乎是强有力的政府和比例代表制的完美结合。

example.ex: ...a clever, far-sighted lawyer who combines legal expertise with social concern...
example.tran: 兼有法律专业知识和社会责任感的精明而又有远见的律师

collins.def: If someone combines two activities, they do them both at the same time.

example.ex: It is possible to combine a career with being a mother...
example.tran: 兼顾职业女性和母亲这两个角色是可能的。

example.ex: He will combine the two jobs over the next three years.
example.tran: 今后3年，他将同时兼顾这两项工作。

collins.def: If two or more groups or organizations combine or if someone combines them, they join to form a single group or organization.

example.ex: ...an announcement by  Steetley and Tarmac of a joint venture that would combine their operations...
example.tran: 斯蒂特利公司和泰玛士集团发表的整合其生产经营成立一个合资企业的声明

example.ex: Different states or groups can combine to enlarge their markets.
example.tran: 不同的州或企业集团可以联合起来以扩大市场。

collins.def: A combine is a group of people or organizations that are working or acting together.

example.ex: ...Veba, an energy-and-chemicals combine that is Germany's fourth-biggest company.
example.tran: 能源化工联合企业费巴是德国的第四大企业

collins.def: String is thin rope made of twisted threads, used for tying things together or tying up parcels.

example.ex: He held out a small bag tied with string.
example.tran: 他拿出一个系着细绳的小袋子。

example.ex: ...a shiny metallic coin on a string.
example.tran: 拴在绳子上的闪闪发亮的金属硬币

collins.def: A string of things is a number of them on a piece of string, thread, or wire.

example.ex: She wore a string of pearls around her neck.
example.tran: 她脖子上戴着一串珍珠。

example.ex: ...a string of fairy lights.
example.tran: 一串圣诞树小彩灯

collins.def: A string of places or objects is a number of them that form a line.

example.ex: The landscape is broken only by a string of villages...
example.tran: 这片风景中只有一排村庄。

example.ex: A string of five rowing boats set out from the opposite bank.
example.tran: 5 只划艇排成一行从对岸出发了。

collins.tran: 一系列，一连串(类似事件)
collins.def: A string of similar events is a series of them that happen one after the other.

example.ex: The incident was the latest in a string of attacks...
example.tran: 这是一连串袭击事件中最近的一起。

example.ex: Between 1940 and 1943 he had a string of 62 consecutive victories.
example.tran: 他在 1940 年至 1943 年间连续 62 次获胜。

collins.def: The strings on a musical instrument such as a violin or guitar are the thin pieces of wire or nylon stretched across it that make sounds when the instrument is played.

example.ex: He went off to change a guitar string.
example.tran: 他出去换一根吉他弦。

example.ex: ...a twenty-one-string harp.
example.tran: 21 弦的竖琴

collins.tran: (管弦乐团的)弦乐器，弦乐器组
collins.def: The strings are the section of an orchestra which consists of stringed instruments played with a bow.

example.ex: The strings provided a melodic background to the passages played by the soloist...
example.tran: 弦乐组为独奏乐章配上了动听的背景乐。

example.ex: There was a 20-member string section.
example.tran: 有一个 20 人组成的弦乐器组。

collins.tran: (计算机技术中的)字符串，信息串
collins.def: In computing, a string is a particular series of letters, numbers, symbols, or spaces, for example a word or phrase that you want to search for in a document.
If you string something somewhere, you hang it up between two or more objects.

example.ex: He had strung a banner across the wall.
example.tran: 他在墙上挂了条横幅。

collins.def: If someone has more than one string to their bow, they have more than one ability or thing they can use if the first one they try is not successful.

example.ex: I'm never out of work because I have so many strings to my bow.
example.tran: 我会很多手艺，永远都不会没饭吃。

collins.tran: 不带附加条件;无任何限制
collins.def: If something is offered to you with no strings attached or with no strings, it is offered without any special conditions.

example.ex: Aid should be given to developing countries with no strings attached.
example.tran: 应该不带任何附加条件地向发展中国家提供援助。

example.ex: ...no-strings grants that last for five years.
example.tran: 为期5 年的无附加条件的援助赠款

collins.def: If you pull strings, you use your influence with other people in order to get something done, often unfairly.

example.ex: Tony is sure he can pull a few strings and get you in.
example.tran: 托尼有把握可以托关系让你进去。

collins.tran: （有某些特色或特点的）地区，地带，区域
collins.def: A zone  is an area that has particular features or characteristics.

example.ex: Many people have stayed behind in the potential war zone...
example.tran: 许多人留在了可能会沦为交战区的地方。

example.ex: The area has been declared a disaster zone.
example.tran: 这个地区已经被宣布为灾难地带。

collins.tran: 将…划为特殊区域;指定…为某项用途区域
collins.def: If an area of land is zoned, it is formally set aside for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The land was not zoned for commercial purposes...
example.tran: 这块地未划作商业用地。

example.ex: Most of the private land in the park wasn't zoned or protected in any way.
example.tran: 公园中的大多数私人土地并未进行任何专门规划或保护。

means: 猎狐马，猎食其他动物的野兽

collins.def: A hunter is a person who hunts wild animals for food or as a sport.

example.ex: The hunters stalked their prey.
example.tran: 猎人潜行追踪猎物。

example.ex: ...a deer hunter.
example.tran: 猎鹿人

collins.def: People who are searching for things of a particular kind are often referred to as hunters .

example.ex: ...job-hunters.
example.tran: 求职者

example.ex: ...treasure hunters.
example.tran: 寻宝人

collins.tran: （英国猎狐者乘骑的强壮的）猎狐马
collins.def: A hunter is a type of fast strong horse that is used in Britain by people who hunt foxes.

means: 记录，录音，拍摄( record的现在分词)
发表正式（或法律方面的）声明

collins.def: A recording of something is a record, CD, tape, or video of it.

example.ex: ...a video recording of a police interview.
example.tran: 警方讯问的录像带

collins.def: Recording is the process of making records, CDs, tapes, or videos.

example.ex: ...the recording industry.
example.tran: 音像业

collins.def: Besides something or beside something means in addition to it.

example.ex: I think she has many good qualities besides being very beautiful...
example.tran: 我觉得她不但长得非常漂亮，而且还有很多优秀品质。

example.ex: There was only one person besides Ford who knew Julia Jameson.
example.tran: 除了福特以外，只有一个人认识朱莉娅·詹姆森。

collins.tran: 而且，再说（强调所补充的内容）
collins.def: Besides is used to emphasize an additional point that you are making, especially one that you consider to be important.

example.ex: The house was too expensive and too big. Besides, I'd grown fond of our little rented house.
example.tran: 这座房子太贵太大了。再说，我已经喜欢上我们租的小房子了。

collins.def: A rail is a horizontal bar attached to posts or fixed round the edge of something as a fence or support.

example.ex: They had to walk across an emergency footbridge, holding onto a rope that served as a rail...
example.tran: 他们必须握着一条绳索充当扶手穿过一条紧急人行天桥。

example.ex: She gripped the hand rail in the lift.
example.tran: 她紧紧抓着电梯里的扶手。

collins.def: A rail is a horizontal bar that you hang things on.

example.ex: ...frocks hanging from a rail...
example.tran: 挂在横杆上的连衣裙

example.ex: This pair of curtains will fit a rail up to 7ft 6in wide.
example.tran: 这副窗帘需要用7.5英尺宽的横杆挂起。

collins.def: Rails are the steel bars which trains run on.

example.ex: The train left the rails but somehow forced its way back onto the line.
example.tran: 火车脱轨了，但总算设法回到了原来的轨道上。

collins.tran: 乘火车（旅行）；用火车（运送）
collins.def: If you travel or send something by rail, you travel or send it on a train.

example.ex: The president traveled by rail to his home town.
example.tran: 总统坐火车回到了他的家乡。

example.ex: ...the electric rail link between Manchester and Sheffield.
example.tran: 曼彻斯特和谢菲尔德之间的电气化铁路线

collins.def: If you rail against something, you criticize it loudly and angrily.

example.ex: He railed against hypocrisy and greed...
example.tran: 他痛斥伪善和贪婪的行为。

example.ex: I'd cursed him and railed at him.
example.tran: 我曾诅咒并且大声责骂过他。

collins.def: If something is back on the rails, it is beginning to be successful again after a period when it almost failed.

example.ex: They are keen to get the negotiating process back on the rails...
example.tran: 他们热切希望使谈判重新步入正轨。

example.ex: Her career is back on the rails.
example.tran: 她的事业得以重振。

collins.def: If someone goes off the rails, they start to behave in a way that other people think is unacceptable or very strange, for example they start taking drugs or breaking the law.

example.ex: They've got to do something about these children because clearly they've gone off the rails.
example.tran: 他们必须得管管这些孩子了，因为他们实在太不像话了。

collins.def: Combat is fighting that takes place in a war.

example.ex: Over 16 million men had died in combat...
example.tran: 1,600多万人在战斗中牺牲。

example.ex: Yesterday saw hand-to-hand combat in the city.
example.tran: 昨天该市发生了肉搏战。

collins.def: A combat is a battle, or a fight between two people.

example.ex: It was the end of a long combat.
example.tran: 这是一场长期斗争的结束。

collins.def: If people in authority combat something, they try to stop it happening.

example.ex: Congress has criticised new government measures to combat crime.
example.tran: 国会对政府打击犯罪的新措施提出了批评。

collins.tran: 有称号的;有头衔的;有爵位的
collins.def: Someone who is titled has a title such as 'Lord', 'Lady', 'Sir', or 'Princess' before their name, showing that they have a high rank in society.

example.ex: Her mother was a titled lady.
example.tran: 她母亲是个有爵位的贵夫人。

collins.tran: (厨房里的)洗涤池，洗碗槽，水槽
collins.def: A sink is a large fixed container in a kitchen, with taps to supply water. It is mainly used for washing dishes.

example.ex: The sink was full of dirty dishes.
example.tran: 水槽里堆满了脏碟子。

example.ex: ...the kitchen sink.
example.tran: 厨房洗涤槽

collins.def: A sink is the same as a washbasin or basin .

example.ex: The bathroom is furnished with 2 toilets, 2 showers, and 2 sinks.
example.tran: 卫生间里装了两个抽水马桶、两个淋浴器、和两个洗脸盆。

collins.def: If a boat sinks or if someone or something sinks it, it disappears below the surface of a mass of water.

example.ex: In a naval battle your aim is to sink the enemy's ship...
example.tran: 在海战中目标就是击沉敌船。

example.ex: The boat was beginning to sink fast...
example.tran: 小船开始快速下沉。

collins.def: If something sinks, it disappears below the surface of a mass of water.

example.ex: A fresh egg will sink and an old egg will float.
example.tran: 新鲜鸡蛋会沉下去而不新鲜的会浮在上面。

collins.def: If something sinks, it moves slowly downwards.

example.ex: Far off to the west the sun was sinking...
example.tran: 远处夕阳西下。

example.ex: When they came to build the southern spire the foundations began to sink.
example.tran: 他们建南边的塔尖时，地基就开始下沉了。

collins.def: If you sink, you move into a lower position, for example by sitting down in a chair or kneeling.

example.ex: Kate laughed, and sank down again to her seat...
example.tran: 凯特笑了，又坐回到她的座位上。

example.ex: She sank into an armchair and crossed her legs...
example.tran: 她坐到一把扶手椅上，跷起了二郎腿。

collins.def: If something sinks to a lower level or standard, it falls to that level or standard.

example.ex: Share prices would have sunk — hurting small and big investors...
example.tran: 股票价格就会下跌——大小投资者均会遭受打击。

example.ex: Pay increases have sunk to around seven per cent...
example.tran: 工资增长率已降至 7％左右。

collins.def: People use sink school or sink estate to refer to a school or housing estate that is in a very poor area with few resources.

example.ex: ...unemployed teenagers from sink estates...
example.tran: 来自贫困地区的无业青少年

example.ex: He has transformed Chicago's sink schools into beacons of hope for parents and children.
example.tran: 他已经将芝加哥的几所条件不好的学校彻底变成了为家长和孩子们带来希望的好学校。

collins.def: If your voice sinks, it becomes quieter.

example.ex: Her voice sank, and he moved closer to catch what she was saying...
example.tran: 她的声音变小了，他走近了些想听清楚她在说什么。

example.ex: Her voice had sunk to a whisper.
example.tran: 她的声音越来越小，几乎成了窃窃私语。

collins.tran: 逐渐陷入(某种令人不快的心情、状态或处境)
collins.def: To sink into an unpleasant or undesirable mood, situation, or state means to pass gradually into it.

example.ex: She'd sometimes sink into depression...
example.tran: 她有时会陷入忧郁之中。

example.ex: That night he sank into a deep coma...
example.tran: 那晚他陷入了深度昏迷。

collins.def: If your heart or your spirits sink, you become depressed or lose hope.

example.ex: My heart sank because I thought he was going to dump me for another girl...
example.tran: 我的心情一下子很沮丧，以为他要为了另一个女孩和我分手。

example.ex: Her spirits sank lower and lower.
example.tran: 她的情绪越来越低落。

collins.def: If something sharp sinks or is sunk into something solid, it goes deeply into it.

example.ex: He sinks the needle into my arm...
example.tran: 他将针插入我的胳膊。

example.ex: I sank my teeth into a peppermint cream...
example.tran: 我咬了口胡椒薄荷味奶油软糖。

collins.def: If someone sinks a well, mine, or other large hole, they make a deep hole in the ground, usually by digging or drilling.

example.ex: ...the site where Stephenson sank his first mineshaft...
example.tran: 斯蒂芬森挖掘第一口竖井的地方

example.ex: If they carry on sinking boreholes then the land is likely to subside.
example.tran: 如果他们继续钻洞，地表很有可能下沉。

collins.tran: 把(资金)投入(企业或项目)
collins.def: If you sink money into a business or project, you spend money on it in the hope of making more money.

example.ex: He has already sunk $25million into the project.
example.tran: 他在这项目上已经投资了 2,500 万美元了。

collins.def: If someone sinks a number of alcoholic drinks, they drink them quickly.

example.ex: She sank two glasses of white wine.
example.tran: 她一口气干了两杯白葡萄酒。

collins.tran: (高尔夫球)击(球)入洞;(斯诺克)击(球)入袋
collins.def: In golf, snooker, and some other games, if you sink a ball or a putt, you successfully hit the ball into a hole.

example.ex: He sank two crucial putts in the last three holes.
example.tran: 他在最后的三洞中完成了两个非常关键的击球入洞。

collins.tran: 自己努力以求生存;不自立,必沉沦
collins.def: If you say that someone will have to sink or swim, you mean that they will have to succeed through their own efforts, or fail.

example.ex: The government doesn't want to force inefficient firms to sink or swim too quickly...
example.tran: 政府并不想迫使效率低的公司过快地自生自灭。

example.ex: It was very much sink or swim.
example.tran: 这很大程度上就是不成功便沉沦。

means: 全球的，全球性的，有关全球大局的
球形的，球状的，球面的，球体的

collins.def: You can use global to describe something that happens in all parts of the world or affects all parts of the world.

example.ex: ...a global ban on nuclear testing...
example.tran: 全球核试验禁令

example.ex: On a global scale, AIDS may well become the leading cause of infant death.
example.tran: 艾滋病很可能会成为造成全球婴儿死亡的首要原因。

collins.def: A global view or vision of a situation is one in which all the different aspects of it are considered.

example.ex: ...the global view, the ability to make wider decisions based on a knowledge of all the facts, not just some of them.
example.tran: 大局观——基于全部而非部分事实作出更加宏观的决定的能力

example.ex: ...a global vision of contemporary societies.
example.tran: 对当代社会的总体看法

collins.def: Rage is strong anger that is difficult to control.

example.ex: He was red-cheeked with rage...
example.tran: 他气得满脸通红。

example.ex: I flew into a rage...
example.tran: 我勃然大怒。

collins.def: You say that something powerful or unpleasant rages when it continues with great force or violence.

example.ex: Train services were halted as the fire raged for more than four hours...
example.tran: 火灾肆虐超过4个小时，期间列车停止了运行。

example.ex: ...the fierce arguments raging over the future of the Holy City...
example.tran: 关于圣城未来的激烈争论

collins.def: If you rage about something, you speak or think very angrily about it.

example.ex: Monroe was on the phone, raging about her mistreatment by the brothers...
example.tran: 门罗正在打电话，怒不可遏地说着她被这几个兄弟虐待的事。

example.ex: Inside, Frannie was raging...
example.tran: 弗兰妮正在屋里大发脾气。

collins.tran: （尤指引发暴力或攻击行为的）暴怒,盛怒
collins.def: You can refer to the strong anger that someone feels in a particular situation as a particular rage, especially when this results in violent or aggressive behaviour.

example.ex: Cabin crews are reporting up to nine cases of air rage a week.
example.tran: 乘务人员一周内报告的飞机上闹事行为多达9起。

collins.def: When something is popular and fashionable, you can say that it is the rage or all the rage .

example.ex: The 1950s look is all the rage at the moment.
example.tran: 目前，20世纪50年代的装扮正流行。

collins.def: A breed of a pet animal or farm animal is a particular type of it. For example, terriers are a breed of dog.

example.ex: ...rare breeds of cattle...
example.tran: 稀有品种的牛

example.ex: Certain breeds are more dangerous than others.
example.tran: 某些品种比其他品种更危险。

collins.def: If you breed animals or plants, you keep them for the purpose of producing more animals or plants with particular qualities, in a controlled way.

example.ex: He lived alone, breeding horses and dogs...
example.tran: 他独自一人生活，饲养马匹和狗。

example.ex: He used to breed dogs for the police...
example.tran: 他曾经为警方培育警犬。

collins.def: When animals breed, they have babies.

example.ex: Frogs will usually breed in any convenient pond...
example.tran: 通常青蛙会在任何条件适宜的池塘中繁殖。

example.ex: The area now attracts over 60 species of breeding birds.
example.tran: 这一地区现在吸引了60多种鸟类到此繁育后代。

collins.def: If you say that something breeds bad feeling or bad behaviour, you mean that it causes bad feeling or bad behaviour to develop.

example.ex: If they are unemployed it's bound to breed resentment...
example.tran: 如果他们失去工作，一定会产生怨恨。

example.ex: Violence breeds violence.
example.tran: 暴力会催生更多暴力。

collins.def: You can refer to someone or something as one of a particular breed of person or thing when you want to talk about what they are like.

example.ex: Sue is one of the new breed of British women squash players who are making a real impact...
example.tran: 休是英国新一代的女子壁球运动员，她们的影响正在显现出来。

example.ex: The new breed of walking holidays puts the emphasis on enjoyment, not endurance...
example.tran: 这种新型的徒步旅行假日重在愉悦身心，而不是为了锻炼耐力。

collins.def: Someone who was born and bred in a place was born there and grew up there.

example.ex: I was born and bred in the highlands...
example.tran: 我在高地地区出生和长大。

example.ex: Born and bred in this country, he and his wife emigrated to Los Angeles after the war...
example.tran: 尽管生于斯长于斯，他和妻子在战后还是移民去了洛杉矶。

means: 向某人点头或摇头示意

collins.def: Motion is the activity or process of continually changing position or moving from one place to another.

example.ex: ...the laws governing light, sound, and motion...
example.tran: 有关声、光和运动的定律

example.ex: One group of muscles sets the next group in motion...
example.tran: 一组肌肉带动下一组肌肉运动。

collins.def: A motion is an action, gesture, or movement.

example.ex: Cover each part of the body with long sweeping strokes or circular motions...
example.tran: 对全身每个部位画长弧线轻抚或做圆圈状按摩。

example.ex: He made a neat chopping motion with his hand.
example.tran: 他挥手做了一个干净利落的劈砍的动作。

collins.tran: (会议、辩论或审判时提出的)动议，提议，议案
collins.def: A motion is a formal proposal or statement in a meeting, debate, or trial, which is discussed and then voted on or decided on.

example.ex: The conference is now debating the motion and will vote on it shortly...
example.tran: 大会正在就提议进行辩论，稍后将就此表决。

example.ex: Opposition parties are likely to bring a no-confidence motion against the government...
example.tran: 反对党很可能提出对政府的不信任案。

collins.def: If you motion to someone, you move your hand or head as a way of telling them to do something or telling them where to go.

example.ex: She motioned for the locked front doors to be opened...
example.tran: 她示意把锁着的前门打开。

example.ex: He stood aside and motioned Don to the door...
example.tran: 他站到一边并示意唐到门口去。

collins.tran: (尤为医生、护士用语)排便，大便
collins.def: Some people, especially doctors or nurses, use motion as a polite way of referring to a person's act of defecation or the faeces produced.

example.ex: Try to make sure your bowel motions are regular and that you avoid any constipation.
example.tran: 尽量保证大便规律，避免便秘。

collins.def: If you say that someone is going through the motions, you think they are only saying or doing something because it is expected of them without being interested, enthusiastic, or sympathetic.

example.ex: 'You really don't care, do you?' she said quietly. 'You're just going through the motions.'
example.tran: “你其实不在意，对不对？”她悄声说，“你就是装装样子而已。”

collins.def: If you go through the motions, you pretend to do something by making the movements associated with a particular action.

example.ex: The sailor went through all the motions smartly...
example.tran: 这个水手机灵地走了走过场。

example.ex: Actors go through the motions of different types of labor.
example.tran: 演员们假装从事不同的劳动。

collins.tran: 正在发生;在进行中;即将发生
collins.def: If a process or event is in motion, it is happening. If it is set in motion, it is happening or beginning to happen.

example.ex: His job as England manager begins in earnest now his World Cup campaign is in motion...
example.tran: 现在世界杯足球赛的征战工作已经展开，而他作为英格兰队主教练的工作也真正开始了。

example.ex: Her sharp, aggressive tone set in motion the events that led to her downfall.
example.tran: 她那咄咄逼人的尖锐语调拉开了导致她垮台的事件的序幕。

collins.def: If someone sets the wheels in motion, they take the necessary action to make something start happening.

example.ex: I have set the wheels in motion to sell Endsleigh Court.
example.tran: 我已着手出售恩德斯勒公馆。

collins.def: A manufacturer is a business or company which makes goods in large quantities to sell.

example.ex: ...the world's largest doll manufacturer.
example.tran: 全球最大的玩偶生产商

collins.tran: (尤指从事某一职业的人获得的)薪水，薪金,工资
collins.def: A salary is the money that someone is paid each month by their employer, especially when they are in a profession such as teaching, law, or medicine.

example.ex: ...the lawyer was paid a huge salary...
example.tran: 那个律师薪水很高。

example.ex: The government has decided to increase salaries for all civil servants.
example.tran: 政府已决定给所有公务员加薪。

collins.def: If you appreciate something, for example a piece of music or good food, you like it because you recognize its good qualities.

example.ex: Anyone can appreciate our music...
example.tran: 任何人都能欣赏我们的音乐。

example.ex: In time you'll appreciate the beauty and subtlety of this language.
example.tran: 总有一天你会体会到这门语言的优美和微妙之处。

collins.def: If you appreciate a situation or problem, you understand it and know what it involves.

example.ex: She never really appreciated the depth and bitterness of the Irish conflict...
example.tran: 她从来没有真正认识到爱尔兰矛盾的深刻和激烈。

example.ex: He appreciates that co-operation with the media is part of his professional duties.
example.tran: 他懂得与媒体合作是自己工作职责的一部分。

collins.def: If you appreciate something that someone has done for you or is going to do for you, you are grateful for it.

example.ex: Peter stood by me when I most needed it. I'll always appreciate that...
example.tran: 当我最需要的时候，彼得在我身边支持我。我将永存感激。

example.ex: Thanks, lads. I appreciate it...
example.tran: 谢了，哥们儿。我很感激。

collins.def: If something that you own appreciates over a period of time, its value increases.

example.ex: They don't have any confidence that houses will appreciate in value.
example.tran: 他们完全不相信房子会升值。

collins.tran: 在整个夜间；在夜里的某一时刻
collins.def: If something happens overnight, it happens throughout the night or at some point during the night.

example.ex: The weather remained calm overnight...
example.tran: 整晚都悄然无风。

example.ex: The decision was reached overnight...
example.tran: 决定是在夜里作出的。

collins.def: You can say that something happens overnight when it happens very quickly and unexpectedly.

example.ex: The rules are not going to change overnight...
example.tran: 这些规定不会说变就变。

example.ex: He's realistic enough to know he's not going to succeed overnight...
example.tran: 他很现实，知道自己的成功不会一蹴而就。

collins.def: Overnight bags or clothes are ones that you take when you go and stay somewhere for one or two nights.

example.ex: He realized he'd left his overnight bag at Mary's house.
example.tran: 他意识到自己把过夜包落在玛丽家了。

collins.def: If you overnight somewhere, you spend the night there.

example.ex: They had told her she would be overnighting in Sydney.
example.tran: 他们跟她说过她将在悉尼过夜。

collins.def: When someone goes forth from a place, they leave it.

example.ex: Go forth into the desert...
example.tran: 向前走进沙漠。

example.ex: I came forth to take the air.
example.tran: 我出来透透气。

collins.def: If one thing brings forth another, the first thing produces the second.

example.ex: Nature herself brings forth new forms of life...
example.tran: 自然本身会创造出新的生命形态。

example.ex: My reflections brought forth no conclusion.
example.tran: 我的思考没有得出结论。

collins.def: When someone or something is brought forth, they are brought to a place or moved into a position where people can see them.

example.ex: Pilate ordered Jesus to be brought forth...
example.tran: 彼拉多命令把耶稣带上来。

example.ex: He brought forth a small gold amulet from beneath his robe.
example.tran: 他从袍子下面拿出一个不大的金护身符。

collins.def: If you conclude that something is true, you decide that it is true using the facts you know as a basis.

example.ex: Larry had concluded that he had no choice but to accept Paul's words as the truth...
example.tran: 拉里断定自己别无选择，只能当保罗的话是真的。

example.ex: So what can we conclude from this debate?...
example.tran: 那么从这场辩论中我们能得出什么结论？

collins.def: When you conclude, you say the last thing that you are going to say.

example.ex: 'It's a waste of time,' he concluded...
example.tran: “这是浪费时间。”他总结道。

example.ex: I would like to conclude by saying that I do enjoy your magazine.
example.tran: 最后，我想说我的确很喜欢你们的杂志。

collins.def: When something concludes, or when you conclude it, you end it.

example.ex: The evening concluded with dinner and speeches...
example.tran: 这个夜晚在宴会和讲话中结束。

example.ex: The Group of Seven major industrial countries concluded its annual summit meeting today.
example.tran: 由主要工业国家组成的七国集团今天结束了其年度峰会。

collins.def: If one person or group concludes an agreement, such as a treaty or business deal, with another, they arrange it. You can also say that two people or groups conclude an agreement.

example.ex: Mexico and the Philippines have both concluded agreements with their commercial bank creditors...
example.tran: 墨西哥和菲律宾均已与商业银行债权人达成了协议。

example.ex: If the clubs cannot conclude a deal, an independent tribunal will decide.
example.tran: 如果俱乐部之间无法达成协议，将由一个独立的仲裁委员会来裁定。

collins.def: Light is the brightness that lets you see things. Light comes from sources such as the sun, moon, lamps, and fire.

example.ex: Cracks of light filtered through the shutters...
example.tran: 斑驳的光线透过百叶窗照射进来。

example.ex: Light and water in embassy buildings were cut off...
example.tran: 大使馆内的水电都被切断了。

collins.def: A light is something such as an electric lamp which produces light.

example.ex: The janitor comes round to turn the lights out...
example.tran: 看门人巡视一圈，把灯熄灭。

example.ex: You get into the music, the lights and the people around you.
example.tran: 你融入到音乐、灯光以及身边的人群中。

collins.def: You can use lights to refer to a set of traffic lights.

example.ex: ...the heavy city traffic with its endless delays at lights and crossings.
example.tran: 在交通灯和十字路口前长久等待的拥堵的城市车流

collins.def: If a place or object is lit by something, it has light shining on it.

example.ex: It was dark and a giant moon lit the road so brightly you could see the landscape clearly...
example.tran: 天黑了，一轮巨大的月亮把道路照得通明，周围的景物可以看得一清二楚。

example.ex: The room was lit by only the one light...
example.tran: 房间里仅靠这一盏灯照明。

collins.def: If it is light, the sun is providing light at the beginning or end of the day.

example.ex: It was still light when we arrived at Lalong Creek...
example.tran: 我们到达拉隆溪时天还没黑。

example.ex: He would often rise as soon as it was light and go into the garden.
example.tran: 他经常天一亮就起床去花园。

collins.def: If a room or building is light, it has a lot of natural light in it, for example because it has large windows.

example.ex: It is a light room with tall windows...
example.tran: 这间房有高大的窗子，光线充足。

example.ex: Her house is light and airy, crisp and clean.
example.tran: 她的房子光线充足，空气流通，清新整洁。

collins.def: If you light something such as a cigarette or fire, or if it lights, it starts burning.

example.ex: Stephen hunched down to light a cigarette...
example.tran: 斯蒂芬弓着身子点燃一支烟。

example.ex: If the charcoal does fail to light, use a special liquid spray and light it with a long taper.
example.tran: 要是木炭确实着不了的话，使用一种特殊的液体喷剂，再用长木片将其点燃。

collins.def: If someone asks you for a light, they want a match or cigarette lighter so they can start smoking.

example.ex: Have you got a light anybody?
example.tran: 你们谁有火吗？

collins.def: If something is presented in a particular light, it is presented so that you think about it in a particular way or so that it appears to be of a particular nature.

example.ex: He has worked hard in recent months to portray New York in a better light.
example.tran: 最近几个月里他努力从更积极的角度来描绘纽约。

collins.def: You can refer to the type of influence that something has on situations, people, or things as the light of that situation, person, or thing.

example.ex: ...the harsh light of reality.
example.tran: 现实严酷的一面

collins.def: You say that something is done or is acceptable according to someone's lights when you mean that it is done or is acceptable according to their own ideas and standards.

example.ex: They can get on with running the school system according to their own lights and in their own interests.
example.tran: 他们可以继续按照自己的想法，依据自己的利益来管理学校系统。

collins.def: If there is a light in someone's  eyes, there is an expression in their eyes that shows you the mood they are in or what they are thinking about.

example.ex: I remembered the curious expectant light in his eyes.
example.tran: 我记得他眼里那好奇而期待的目光。

collins.def: If something comes to light or is brought to light, it becomes obvious or is made known to a lot of people.

example.ex: Nothing about this sum has  come to light...
example.tran: 关于这笔钱人们一无所知。

example.ex: The truth is unlikely to be brought to light by the promised enquiry.
example.tran: 承诺要进行的调查不太可能揭露真相。

collins.def: If light dawns on you, you begin to understand something after a period of not being able to understand it.

example.ex: At last the light dawned. He was going to marry Phylis!
example.tran: 终于明白过来了——他要和菲莉丝结婚了！

collins.def: First light is the time in the early morning when light first appears and before the sun rises.

example.ex: Three hours before first light Fuentes gave orders for the evacuation of the camp.
example.tran: 黎明前3个小时富恩特斯下达了撤离营地的命令。

collins.def: If someone in authority gives you a green light, they give you permission to do something.

example.ex: The food industry was given a green light to extend the use of these chemicals...
example.tran: 食品业获准继续使用这些化学品。

example.ex: Other countries are eagerly awaiting an American green light to lift the sanctions altogether.
example.tran: 其他国家正在急切等待美国同意完全撤销制裁。

collins.def: If something is possible in the light of particular information, it is only possible because you have this information.

example.ex: In the light of this information it is now possible to identify a number of key issues.
example.tran: 根据这一信息，现在有可能弄清楚几个关键问题了。

collins.tran: 很快入睡；立即失去知觉
collins.def: If someone goes out like a light, they fall asleep or become unconscious very quickly or immediately.

example.ex: 'Why didn't  somebody come and tell me?' — 'Because you were out like a light.'
example.tran: “为什么没有人来告诉我？”——“因为你一下就睡过去了。”

collins.def: If you say that an object sees the light of day or sees the light, you mean that it is taken out of the place where it is stored.

example.ex: Museum basements are stacked full of objects which never see the light of day.
example.tran: 博物馆的地下室里堆满了永远不会重见天日的物件。

collins.def: If something sees the light of day at a particular time, it comes into existence or is made known to the public at that time.

example.ex: This extraordinary document first saw the light of day in 1966.
example.tran: 这份非同寻常的文件第一次公开是在1966年。

collins.def: If someone sees the light, they finally realize something or change their attitude or way of behaving to a better one.

example.ex: I saw the light and ditched him.
example.tran: 我终于醒悟，甩掉了他。

collins.def: If you set light to something, you make it start burning.

example.ex: They had poured fuel through the door of the flat and had then set light to it.
example.tran: 他们隔着公寓门往里边倒汽油，然后点着了火。

collins.tran: 使（某事）显得非常清楚；使人了解（某事）
collins.def: To shed light on ,throw light on, or cast light on something means to make it easier to understand, because more information is known about it.

example.ex: A new approach offers an answer, and may shed light on an even bigger question.
example.tran: 新的方法提供了一个答案，并且可能让人们对一个更大的问题有进一步的了解。

collins.tran: 隧道尽头的曙光；黑暗尽头的希望
collins.def: When you talk about the light at the end of the tunnel, you are referring to the end of the difficult or unpleasant situation that you are in at the moment.

example.ex: All I can do is tell her to hold on, that there's light at the end of the tunnel.
example.tran: 我只能告诉她要坚持，让她知道总会柳暗花明的。

collins.def: Your nose is the part of your face which sticks out above your mouth. You use it for smelling and breathing.

example.ex: She wiped her nose with a tissue...
example.tran: 她用纸巾擦了擦鼻子。

example.ex: She's got funny eyes and a big nose.
example.tran: 她有一双古怪的眼睛和一个大鼻子。

collins.tran: (汽车或飞机的)前部;车头;机头
collins.def: The nose of a vehicle such as a car or aeroplane is the front part of it.

example.ex: Sue parked off the main street, with the van's nose pointing away from the street.
example.tran: 休把小货车停在远离大街的地方，车头背对着大街。

collins.def: You can refer to your sense of smell as your nose .

example.ex: The river that runs through Middlesbrough became ugly on the eye and hard on the nose.
example.tran: 穿过米德尔斯伯勒的那条河变得污秽不堪、臭不可闻。

collins.def: If a horse wins a race by a nose, it wins by a very small distance.

example.ex: Chirkpar rattled past him on the right to snatch the prize by a nose.
example.tran: 一匹名为切厄克帕的赛马从他右侧疾驰而过，以一鼻之差获胜。

collins.def: If a vehicle noses in a certain direction or if you nose it there, you move it slowly and carefully in that direction.

example.ex: He could not see the driver as the car nosed forward...
example.tran: 车慢慢向前开，他却看不见司机。

example.ex: A motorboat nosed out of the mist and nudged into the branches of a tree...
example.tran: 一艘摩托艇缓缓驶出薄雾，蹭进一棵树的枝叶中。

collins.def: If you keep your nose clean, you behave well and stay out of trouble.

example.ex: If you kept your nose clean, you had a job for life.
example.tran: 如果你规规矩矩，就可以一辈子都捧着这个饭碗。

collins.tran: 笔直往前;沿最明显路线
collins.def: If you follow your nose to get to a place, you go straight ahead or follow the most obvious route.

example.ex: Just follow your nose and in about five minutes you're at the old railway.
example.tran: 径直往前开，大约5分钟就能到旧铁路线。

collins.tran: 凭直觉行事;凭本能行事
collins.def: If you follow your nose, you do something in a particular way because you feel it should be done like that, rather than because you are following any plan or rules.

example.ex: You won't have to think, just follow your nose.
example.tran: 你不必思考，跟着你的直觉走。

collins.def: If you say that someone has a nose for something, you mean that they have a natural ability to find it or recognize it.

example.ex: He had a nose for trouble and a brilliant tactical mind...
example.tran: 他善于发现问题，还总能想出高明的策略。

example.ex: Gergen had a great sense of news, a good nose for trends, and a wide range of contacts.
example.tran: 格根有很强的新闻意识，对潮流嗅觉灵敏，而且人脉很广。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something gets up your nose, you mean that they annoy you.

example.ex: He's just getting up my nose so much at the moment.
example.tran: 他这会儿真让我生气。

collins.def: If you say that someone looks down their nose at something or someone, you mean that they believe they are superior to that person or thing and treat them with disrespect.

example.ex: I don't look down my nose at comedy...
example.tran: 我并不轻视喜剧。

example.ex: They rather looked down their noses at anyone who couldn't speak French.
example.tran: 他们相当瞧不起不会说法语的人。

collins.def: If you say that you paid through the nose for something, you are emphasizing that you had to pay what you consider too high a price for it.

example.ex: We don't like paying through the nose for our wine when eating out.
example.tran: 下馆子时，我们不喜欢在酒水上花很多钱。

collins.def: If someone pokes their nose into something or sticks their nose into something, they try to interfere with it even though it does not concern them.

example.ex: We don't like strangers who poke their noses into our affairs...
example.tran: 我们不喜欢陌生人干预我们的事务。

example.ex: Why did you have to stick your nose in?
example.tran: 你为什么非要插手？

collins.tran: 反复向…提及(不愉快的事);揭…的疮疤
collins.def: To rub someone's nose in something that they do not want to think about, such as a failing or a mistake they have made, means to remind them repeatedly about it.

example.ex: His enemies will attempt to rub his nose in past policy statements.
example.tran: 他的对手会试图揪住他过去政策陈述的漏洞不放。

collins.tran: 跟别人怄气却害了自己;赌气做出不顾后果的事
collins.def: If you say that someone is cutting off their nose to spite their face, you mean they do something that they think will hurt someone, without realizing or caring that it will hurt themselves as well.

example.ex: There is evidence that the industry's greed means that it is cutting off its nose to spite its face.
example.tran: 有证据表明该产业的贪婪是在作茧自缚。

collins.def: If vehicles are nose to tail, the front of one vehicle is close behind the back of another.

example.ex: ...a line of about twenty fast-moving trucks driving nose to tail.
example.tran: 一排大约20辆首尾相接、快速行驶的卡车

collins.def: If you thumb your nose at someone, you behave in a way that shows that you do not care what they think.

example.ex: He has always thumbed his nose at the media.
example.tran: 他对媒体一直都嗤之以鼻。

collins.def: If you turn up your nose at something, you reject it because you think that it is not good enough for you.

example.ex: I'm not in a financial position to turn up my nose at several hundred thousand pounds.
example.tran: 我的经济境况使我无法对几十万英镑无动于衷。

collins.tran: 当着…的面;在…的眼皮底下
collins.def: If you do something under someone's nose, you do it right in front of them, without trying to hide it from them.

example.ex: Okay so have an affair, but not right under my nose.
example.tran: 有外遇就有外遇好了，但别在我眼皮底下。

collins.def: An amateur is someone who does something as a hobby and not as a job.

example.ex: Jerry is an amateur who dances because he feels like it...
example.tran: 杰里是个业余跳舞爱好者，他跳舞是因为自己喜欢。

example.ex: Taylor began his playing career as an amateur goalkeeper.
example.tran: 泰勒的运动生涯是从一名业余守门员开始的。

collins.tran: （体育运动或活动）业余爱好的
collins.def: Amateur sports or activities are done by people as a hobby and not as a job.

example.ex: ...the local amateur dramatics society...
example.tran: 地方业余戏剧社团

example.ex: At college he studied English and did amateur boxing.
example.tran: 大学时，他学习英语，同时还参加业余拳击。

means: （电脑病毒）使（电脑的）存储器[数据]受到感染

collins.def: To infect people, animals, or plants means to cause them to have a disease or illness.

example.ex: A single mosquito can infect a large number of people.
example.tran: 一只蚊子就可以感染很多人。

example.ex: ...objects used by an infected person.
example.tran: 被感染者使用过的物品

collins.def: To infect a substance or area means to cause it to contain harmful germs or bacteria.

example.ex: The birds infect the milk.
example.tran: 鸟污染了牛奶。

example.ex: ...a virus which is spread mainly by infected blood.
example.tran: 主要通过被污染的血液传播的病毒

collins.def: When people, places, or things are infected by a feeling or influence, it spreads to them.

example.ex: For an instant I was infected by her fear...
example.tran: 有那么一会儿她的恐惧也传染给了我。

example.ex: He thought they might infect others with their bourgeois ideas...
example.tran: 他认为他们可以用他们的资产阶级思想去影响别人。

collins.def: If a virus infects a computer, it affects the computer by damaging or destroying programs.

example.ex: This virus infected thousands of computers within days.
example.tran: 这种病毒在短短几天内感染了数千台计算机。

collins.def: An acid is a chemical substance, usually a liquid, which contains hydrogen and can react with other substances to form salts. Some acids burn or dissolve other substances that they come into contact with.

example.ex: ...citric acid...
example.tran: 柠檬酸

example.ex: Acids in the stomach destroy the virus.
example.tran: 胃酸能杀死病毒。

collins.def: An acid substance contains acid.

example.ex: These shrubs must have an acid, lime-free soil.
example.tran: 这些灌木必须生长在不含石灰的酸性土壤环境。

collins.def: An acid fruit or drink has a sour or sharp taste.

example.ex: These wines may taste rather hard and somewhat acid.
example.tran: 这些酒可能喝着比较冲并且有股酸味。

collins.def: An acid remark, or acid humour, is very unkind or critical.

example.ex: This comedy of contemporary manners is told with compassion and acid humour.
example.tran: 这部当代风尚喜剧杂糅了悲悯的情怀和尖酸的幽默。

collins.def: The drug LSD is sometimes referred to as acid .

collins.tran: （某个事件或已提及的时间）之后
collins.def: If you do something or if something happens afterwards, you do it or it happens after a particular event or time that has already been mentioned.

example.ex: Shortly afterwards, police arrested four suspects...
example.tran: 之后不久，警方逮捕了4名嫌犯。

example.ex: James was taken to hospital but died soon afterwards...
example.tran: 詹姆斯被送往医院，但随后不久就死了。

collins.def: If you concede something, you admit, often unwillingly, that it is true or correct.

example.ex: Bess finally conceded that Nancy was right...
example.tran: 贝丝最终承认了南希是对的。

example.ex: 'Well,' he conceded, 'I do sometimes mumble a bit.'...
example.tran: “嗯，”他承认道，“我有时候说话的确有点吐字不清。”

collins.def: If you concede something to someone, you allow them to have it as a right or privilege.

example.ex: The government conceded the right to establish independent trade unions...
example.tran: 政府承认建立独立工会的权利。

example.ex: Facing total defeat in Vietnam, the French subsequently conceded full independence to Laos.
example.tran: 法国人在越南面临彻底的失败后，接着又让老挝取得了完全的独立。

collins.def: If you concede something, you give it to the person who has been trying to get it from you.

example.ex: A strike by some ten thousand bank employees has ended after the government conceded some of their demands.
example.tran: 政府答应了他们的一些要求后，大约有一万名银行员工参加的罢工结束了。

collins.tran: (在体育运动中)未能阻止(对方进球或得分)
collins.def: In sport, if you concede goals or points, you are unable to prevent your opponent from scoring them.

example.ex: They conceded four goals to Leeds United...
example.tran: 他们被利兹联队攻进4个球。

example.ex: Luton conceded a free kick on the edge of the penalty area.
example.tran: 卢顿未能在罚球区的边缘截住对方的任意球。

collins.def: If you concede a game, contest, or argument, you end it by admitting that you can no longer win.

example.ex: Reiner, 56, has all but conceded the race to his rival...
example.tran: 56岁的赖纳在比赛中几乎已经向对手认输了。

example.ex: Alain Prost finished third and virtually conceded the world championship.
example.tran: 阿兰·普罗斯特以第三名的成绩结束比赛，实际上已经将世界冠军的位置拱手让人。

collins.def: If you concede defeat, you accept that you have lost a struggle.

example.ex: Airtours conceded defeat in its attempt to take control of holiday industry rival Owners Abroad...
example.tran: 空中旅游公司承认其对度假服务行业竞争对手海外业主旅行社的控股企图以失败告终。

example.ex: He happily conceded the election.
example.tran: 他欣然接受了选举的失败。

collins.tran: 小伙子；年轻人；少年；男孩
collins.def: A lad is a young man or boy.

example.ex: When I was a lad his age I would laugh at the strangest things...
example.tran: 我是他那样的小毛孩时，莫明其妙地就会发笑。

example.ex: Come along, lad. Time for you to get home.
example.tran: 来吧，小伙子。你该回家了。

collins.def: Some men refer to their male friends or colleagues as the lads .

example.ex: ...a drink with the lads...
example.tran: 与哥们儿一块喝一杯

example.ex: The lads don't  join the union because they're frightened of being victimized.
example.tran: 那几个伙计没加入工会是因为害怕成为牺牲品。

collins.def: To expose something that is usually hidden means to uncover it so that it can be seen.

example.ex: Lowered sea levels exposed the shallow continental shelf beneath the Bering Sea...
example.tran: 海平面下降使白令海底部的浅层大陆架暴露出来。

example.ex: For an instant his whole back was exposed.
example.tran: 一瞬间，他整个背部都露了出来。

collins.def: To expose a person or situation means to reveal that they are bad or immoral in some way.

example.ex: The Budget does expose the lies ministers were telling a year ago...
example.tran: 预算案无疑揭穿了部长们一年前所说的谎话。

example.ex: After the scandal was exposed, Dr Bailey committed suicide...
example.tran: 丑闻曝光后，贝利博士自杀了。

collins.tran: 使暴露于（险境）;使遭受（危险或不快）
collins.def: If someone is exposed to something dangerous or unpleasant, they are put in a situation in which it might affect them.

example.ex: They had not been exposed to most diseases common to urban populations...
example.tran: 城市人口中多数常见的疾病他们都没有接触到。

example.ex: A wise mother never exposes her children to the slightest possibility of danger.
example.tran: 明智的母亲决不会让她的孩子置身于一丁点儿危险之中。

collins.tran: 使受…的影响(或熏陶);使接触
collins.def: If someone is exposed to an idea or feeling, usually a new one, they are given experience of it, or introduced to it.

example.ex: ...local people who've not been exposed to glimpses of Western life before...
example.tran: 过去丝毫未曾见识过西方生活的当地人

example.ex: These units exposed children to many viewpoints of a given issue.
example.tran: 这些单元让孩子们接触到有关某一特定问题的多种观点。

collins.tran: （常因精神或感情失控）暴露性器官，当众露阴
collins.def: A man who exposes himself shows people his genitals in a public place, usually because he is mentally or emotionally disturbed.

example.ex: Smith admitted indecently exposing himself on Wimbledon Common.
example.tran: 史密斯承认自己在温布尔登公地当众露阴，有伤风化。

means: 具有城市或城市生活特点的

collins.def: Urban means belonging to, or relating to, a town or city.

example.ex: Most of the population is an urban population...
example.tran: 绝大多数人口都是城镇居民。

example.ex: Most urban areas are close to a park.
example.tran: 绝大多数城区附近都有公园。

collins.def: Anxiety is a feeling of nervousness or worry.

example.ex: Her voice was full of anxiety...
example.tran: 她的声音满是焦虑不安。

example.ex: Many editorials express their anxieties about the economic chaos in the country.
example.tran: 许多社论对该国经济的混乱状况表示忧虑。

collins.tran: 发生冲突;打斗;争论;意见不合
collins.def: When people clash, they fight, argue, or disagree with each other.

example.ex: A group of 400 demonstrators clashed with police...
example.tran: 400名示威者与警察发生了冲突。

example.ex: Behind the scenes, Parsons clashed with almost everyone on the show...
example.tran: 在幕后，帕森斯几乎和剧组的所有人都发生过冲突。

collins.tran: (信仰、观点、特性)相互冲突，相互抵触，不相容
collins.def: Beliefs, ideas, or qualities that clash with each other are very different from each other and therefore are opposed.

example.ex: Don't make any policy decisions which clash with official company thinking...
example.tran: 所作的任何决策都不要和公司官方理念相冲突。

example.ex: Here, morality and good sentiments clash headlong.
example.tran: 在这个问题上，道德和良知互不相容。

collins.def: If one event clashes with another, the two events happen at the same time so that you cannot attend both of them.

example.ex: The detective changed his holiday dates when his flight was brought forward and it now clashed with the trial.
example.tran: 由于航班提前，侦探更改了度假日期，但是这样一来就和审判冲突了。

collins.def: If one colour or style clashes with another, the colours or styles look ugly together. You can also say that two colours or styles clash .

example.ex: The red door clashed with the soft, natural tones of the stone walls...
example.tran: 红门和石墙柔和的自然色调不协调。

example.ex: So what if the colours clashed?
example.tran: 那么，要是色彩不搭怎么办？

collins.tran: (体育用语中尤用来指热情高涨的比赛双方)交锋，交手，厮杀
collins.def: Sports journalists sometimes say that two individuals or teams who compete against each other clash, especially when a lot of feeling is involved.

example.ex: Lewis has recently recovered his fitness and will clash with Christie in the 4x100m relay...
example.tran: 刘易斯近来恢复了状态，将在4×100米接力赛中和克里斯蒂一决雌雄。

example.ex: The two sides will clash there only if Chelsea beat Sunderland in their quarter-final replay.
example.tran: 只有切尔西队在四分之一决赛的重赛中击败桑德兰队，双方才会交锋。

collins.tran: (金属相互碰撞)发出当啷当啷声，发出撞击声
collins.def: When metal objects clash, they make a lot of noise by being hit together.

example.ex: The golden bangles on her arms clashed and jingled.
example.tran: 她手臂上的金手镯丁零当啷地响。

collins.tran: （尤指作为例证）引用，援引，提及
collins.def: If you cite something, you quote it or mention it, especially as an example or proof of what you are saying.

example.ex: She cites a favourite poem by George Herbert...
example.tran: 她引用了自己最喜爱的一首乔治·赫伯特的诗。

example.ex: He cites just one example...
example.tran: 他只引用了一个例子。

collins.def: To cite a person means to officially name them in a legal case. To cite a reason or cause means to state it as the official reason for your case.

example.ex: They cited Alex's refusal to return to the marital home...
example.tran: 他们引证了亚历克斯拒绝回到婚后的家中一事。

example.ex: Three admirals and a top Navy civilian will be cited for failing to act on reports of sexual assaults.
example.tran: 3位海军上将和1位海军高级文员将被指名，原因是他们在接到性侵犯的举报后没有采取任何行动。

collins.def: If someone is cited, they are officially ordered to appear before a court.

example.ex: The judge ruled a mistrial and cited the prosecutors for outrageous misconduct.
example.tran: 法官裁定为无效审判，并以严重渎职为名传讯了检察官。

collins.def: A combination of things is a mixture of them.

example.ex: ...a fantastic combination of colours.
example.tran: 多种颜色的绝妙混合

example.ex: ...the combination of science and art.
example.tran: 科学与艺术的结合

collins.def: A crystal is a small piece of a substance that has formed naturally into a regular symmetrical shape.

example.ex: ...salt crystals.
example.tran: 盐晶体

example.ex: ...ice crystals.
example.tran: 冰晶

collins.def: Crystal is a transparent rock that is used to make jewellery and ornaments.

example.ex: ...a strand of crystal beads.
example.tran: 一串水晶珠子

collins.def: Crystal is a high quality glass, usually with patterns cut into its surface.

example.ex: Some of the finest drinking glasses are made from lead crystal.
example.tran: 一些最高档的酒杯是用铅晶质玻璃制成的。

example.ex: ...crystal glasses.
example.tran: 水晶玻璃杯

collins.tran: 水晶玻璃杯;水晶玻璃容器
collins.def: Glasses and other containers made of crystal are referred to as crystal .

example.ex: Get out your best china and crystal.
