example.tran: 拿出你最好的瓷器和水晶玻璃器皿。

collins.def: The depth of something such as a river or hole is the distance downwards from its top surface, or between its upper and lower surfaces.

example.ex: The smaller lake ranges from five to fourteen feet in depth...
example.tran: 小一些的湖深度从 5 英尺到 14 英尺不等。

example.ex: The depth of the shaft is 520 yards...
example.tran: 立井的深度为520码。

collins.def: The depth of something such as a cupboard or drawer is the distance between its front surface and its back.
If an emotion is very strongly or intensely felt, you can talk about its depth .

example.ex: I am well aware of the depth of feeling that exists in Londonderry...
example.tran: 我很清楚存在于伦敦德里市的那种强烈情绪。

example.ex: 'Tough, isn't it?' was all she said, but Amy felt the depth of her unspoken sympathy.
example.tran: “很艰难，对不对？”她只说了这一句，但埃米感觉到了她未出口的深切同情。

collins.def: The depth of a situation is its extent and seriousness.

example.ex: The country's leadership had underestimated the depth of the crisis.
example.tran: 该国领导人低估了这场危机的严重性。

collins.def: The depth of someone's knowledge is the great amount that they know.

example.ex: We felt at home with her and were impressed with the depth of her knowledge...
example.tran: 我们与她在一起很自在，而她渊博的知识令我们叹服。

example.ex: It makes invaluable reading for anyone who wants to acquire a greater depth of understanding of the subject.
example.tran: 想要对这个问题有更加深入的了解，读读它会受益匪浅。

collins.def: The depth of a colour is its intensity and strength.

example.ex: White wines tend to gain depth of colour with age...
example.tran: 白葡萄酒年头愈久，颜色愈深。

example.ex: The blue base gives the red paint more depth.
example.tran: 蓝色底色将红色涂料衬托得愈加浓重。

collins.def: In photography and art, you say that a picture has depth or depth of field when you mean that it appears three-dimensional rather than flat.

example.ex: All the paintings are startlingly dramatic as a result of their depth of field and colour.
example.tran: 景深和色彩的运用令所有的画作都展现出令人惊叹的戏剧性效果。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something has depth, you mean that they have serious and interesting qualities which are not immediately obvious and which you have to think about carefully before you can fully understand them.

example.ex: His music lacks depth...
example.tran: 他的音乐缺乏深度。

example.ex: There are hidden depths in all of us.
example.tran: 我们所有人都有值得认识的深藏部分。

collins.def: The depths are places that are a long way below the surface of the sea or earth.

example.ex: The ship vanished into the depths.
example.tran: 船消失在了大海深处。

collins.def: If you talk about the depths of an area, you mean the parts of it which are very far from the edge.

example.ex: ...the depths of the countryside...
example.tran: 乡村腹地

example.ex: Somewhere in the depths of the pine forest an identical sound reverberated.
example.tran: 从松林深处传来一声回响。

collins.def: If you are in the depths of an unpleasant emotion, you feel that emotion very strongly.

example.ex: I was in the depths of despair when the baby was sick.
example.tran: 孩子生病时我陷入了绝望的深渊之中。

collins.tran: …的中间部分;…最严重的时候;…最强烈的时候
collins.def: If something happens in the depths of a difficult or unpleasant period of time, it happens in the middle and most severe or intense part of it.

example.ex: The country is in the depths of a recession.
example.tran: 该国正遭遇最严重的经济衰退。

example.ex: ...the depths of winter.
example.tran: 隆冬时节

collins.def: If you deal with a subject in depth, you deal with it very thoroughly and consider all the aspects of it.

example.ex: We will discuss these three areas in depth...
example.tran: 我们将深入探讨这3个领域。

example.ex: Their achievements have already been analysed in depth and do not require further discussion.
example.tran: 他们的成就已经全面分析过了，无需再议。

collins.def: If you say that someone is out of their depth, you mean that they are in a situation that is much too difficult for them to be able to cope with it.

example.ex: Mr Gibson is clearly intellectually out of his depth...
example.tran: 吉布森先生显然才智不逮。

example.ex: I'd always struggled at school. I hated it and felt out of my depth.
example.tran: 我上学总是很吃力。我讨厌学习，觉得太难了。

collins.def: If you are out of your depth, you are in water that is deeper than you are tall, with the result that you cannot stand up with your head above water.
A fleet is a group of ships organized to do something together, for example to fight battles or to catch fish.

example.ex: The damage inflicted upon the British fleet was devastating.
example.tran: 英国舰队遭到了毁灭性的重创。

example.ex: ...restaurants supplied by local fishing fleets.
example.tran: 由当地捕鱼船队供货的饭馆

collins.tran: (尤指同一机构或统一行动的)车队
collins.def: A fleet of vehicles is a group of them, especially when they all belong to a particular organization or business, or when they are all going somewhere together.

example.ex: With its own fleet of trucks, the company delivers most orders overnight...
example.tran: 这个公司拥有自己的货车车队，大多数订购货品可以隔日送到。

example.ex: A fleet of ambulances took the injured to hospital.
example.tran: 一队救护车把伤者送往医院。

collins.def: If someone is convicted of a crime, they are found guilty of that crime in a law court.

example.ex: In 1977 he was convicted of murder and sentenced to life imprisonment...
example.tran: 1977年，他被判谋杀罪名成立，判处终身监禁。

example.ex: There was insufficient evidence to convict him.
example.tran: 没有足够证据给他定罪。

collins.def: A convict is someone who is in prison.

means: （集合词）全家人，（包含人在内的）家眷，家属，家里人

collins.tran: 家庭;一家人;同住一幢房子的人
collins.def: A household is all the people in a family or group who live together in a house.

example.ex: ...growing up in a male-only household...
example.tran: 在一个只有男性的家庭里长大

example.ex: Many poor households are experiencing real hardship.
example.tran: 很多贫穷家庭正经历严重的困难。

collins.def: The household is your home and everything that is connected with looking after it.

example.ex: My husband gave me cash to manage the household, but none of it was ever my own.
example.tran: 丈夫给我钱来持家，但这些钱一毫一厘都不属于我。

example.ex: ...household chores.
example.tran: 家务杂活

collins.tran: 家喻户晓的;众人皆知的
collins.def: Someone or something that is a household name or word is very well known.

example.ex: Today, fashion designers are household names...
example.tran: 今天，时装设计师是家喻户晓的人物。

example.ex: My agent told me, 'This'll make your name a household word.'
example.tran: 我的经纪人告诉我：“这将使你一举成名。”

collins.tran: （用于王室警卫队名称中）皇家的
collins.def: Household is used in the names of groups of soldiers who have the job of protecting a king or queen and their family.

example.ex: ...the Household Cavalry Mounted Regiment.
example.tran: 皇家骑兵团

means: 使大为吃惊，使惊奇( amaze的现在分词)

collins.def: You say that something is amazing when it is very surprising and makes you feel pleasure, approval, or wonder.

example.ex: It's amazing what we can remember with a little prompting...
example.tran: 稍加提醒我们就能想起很多东西，真是让人惊奇。

example.ex: This movie has some of the most amazing stunts you're ever likely to see.
example.tran: 这部电影里有一些可能是你见所未见、让人惊叹的特技。

collins.def: An instrument is a tool or device that is used to do a particular task, especially a scientific task.

example.ex: ...a thin tube-like optical instrument.
example.tran: 试管状的细长光学仪器

example.ex: ...instruments for cleaning and polishing teeth...
example.tran: 清洗和抛光牙齿的器械

collins.def: A musical instrument is an object such as a piano, guitar, or flute, which you play in order to produce music.

example.ex: Learning a musical instrument introduces a child to an understanding of music.
example.tran: 学一门乐器能引导孩子了解音乐。

collins.def: An instrument is a device that is used for making measurements of something such as speed, height, or sound, for example on a ship or plane or in a car.

example.ex: ...crucial instruments on the control panel.
example.tran: 控制面板上的重要仪表

example.ex: ...navigation instruments.
example.tran: 导航仪器

collins.tran: 工具;手段;被他人利用的人
collins.def: Something that is an instrument for achieving a particular aim is used by people to achieve that aim.

example.ex: The veto has been a traditional instrument of diplomacy for centuries.
example.tran: 几个世纪以来否决权一直是外交上惯用的手段。

collins.def: Coffee is a hot drink made with water and ground or powdered coffee beans.

example.ex: Would you like some coffee?...
example.tran: 要来点咖啡吗？

example.ex: Newman poured more black coffee and lit a cigarette.
example.tran: 纽曼又倒了些黑咖啡，接着点了支烟。

collins.def: Coffee is the roasted beans or powder from which the drink is made.

example.ex: Brazil harvested 28m bags of coffee in 1991, the biggest crop for four years.
example.tran: 1991年，巴西的咖啡豆产量达2,800万袋，为4年来最高。

example.ex: ...superior quality coffee.
example.tran: 优质咖啡

collins.tran: 喜剧表演;喜剧成分;喜剧效果
collins.def: Comedy consists of types of entertainment, such as plays and films, or particular scenes in them, that are intended to make people laugh.

example.ex: Actor Dom Deluise talks about his career in comedy.
example.tran: 演员多姆·德卢西谈论自己的喜剧生涯。

example.ex: ...a TV comedy series.
example.tran: 电视喜剧连续剧

collins.def: A comedy is a play, film, or television programme that is intended to make people laugh.
The comedy of a situation involves those aspects of it that make you laugh.

example.ex: Jackie sees the comedy in her millionaire husband's thrifty habits.
example.tran: 杰姬觉得自己的百万富翁丈夫的一些节俭习惯很是滑稽。

collins.def: If something rarely happens, it does not happen very often.

example.ex: They battled against other Indian tribes, but rarely fought with the whites...
example.tran: 他们同其他印第安部落作战，但很少与白人并肩对敌。

example.ex: I very rarely wear a raincoat because I spend most of my time in a car...
example.tran: 我难得穿一次雨衣，因为大部分时间我都是呆在车里。

collins.tran: (尤指在战争中)俘虏，擒获，占领，夺取
collins.def: If you capture someone or something, you catch them, especially in a war.

example.ex: The guerrillas shot down one aeroplane and captured the pilot...
example.tran: 游击队击落了一架飞机,并俘获了飞行员。

example.ex: The whole town celebrated when two tanks were captured...
example.tran: 全城居民庆祝缴获了两辆坦克。

collins.tran: 代表（特点);表现,体现(感情、气氛)
collins.def: If something or someone captures a particular quality, feeling, or atmosphere, they represent or express it successfully.

example.ex: Chef Idris Caldora offers an inspired menu that captures the spirit of the Mediterranean...
example.tran: 厨师伊德里斯·卡尔多拉开出一份富有地中海特色的菜单，让人眼前一亮。

example.ex: Their mood was captured by one who said, 'Students here don't know or care about campus issues.'
example.tran: 一个人的话道出了他们的心情，“这儿的学生既不了解也不关心校园问题。”

collins.tran: 吸引(注意力);激发(想象);赢得(喜爱)
collins.def: If something captures your attention or imagination, you begin to be interested or excited by it. If someone or something captures your heart, you begin to love them or like them very much.

example.ex: ...the great names of the Tory party who usually capture the historian's attention.
example.tran: 往往会引起历史学家关注的保守党大人物

example.ex: ...the issue that has captured the imagination of nearly the whole nation.
example.tran: 激发了几乎所有国人想象力的争论

collins.def: If an event is captured in a photograph or on film, it is photographed or filmed.

example.ex: The incident was captured on videotape...
example.tran: 事件被拍成了录像。

example.ex: The images were captured by TV crews filming outside the base.
example.tran: 这些影像是电视剧组人员在外景地拍摄的。

collins.def: If you capture something that you are trying to obtain in competition with other people, you succeed in obtaining it.

example.ex: In 1987, McDonald's captured 19 percent of all fast-food sales...
example.tran: 1987年,麦当劳占据了整个快餐业销售额的19%。

example.ex: The Socialist candidate has captured eighty-five per cent of the vote in the three-way presidential race.
example.tran: 社会党候选人在这场三人角逐的总统竞选中已经获得85%的选票。

means: 超级的，极度的，过分的，超等的，极好的

collins.tran: 顶好的;超级的;顶呱呱的
collins.def: Some people use super to mean very nice or very good.

example.ex: We had a super time...
example.tran: 我们玩得很痛快。

example.ex: That's a super idea...
example.tran: 那真是个绝妙的主意。

collins.def: Super is used before adjectives to indicate that something has a lot of a quality.

example.ex: I'm going to Greece in the summer so I've got to be super slim.
example.tran: 夏天我要去希腊，因此我要变得格外苗条才好。

example.ex: ...squads of super-fit athletes.
example.tran: 身体超棒的一组组运动员

collins.def: Super is used before nouns to indicate that something is larger, better, or more advanced than similar things.

example.ex: ...building Russia into a super state.
example.tran: 把俄罗斯建成一个超级大国

example.ex: ...a chance to test-drive a stunning Lotus super-car.
example.tran: 试驾车速惊人的莲花牌超级汽车的机会

collins.def: If you oppose someone or oppose their plans or ideas, you disagree with what they want to do and try to prevent them from doing it.

example.ex: Mr Taylor was not bitter towards those who had opposed him...
example.tran: 泰勒先生对那些曾反对过他的人并未怀恨在心。

example.ex: Many parents oppose bilingual education in schools.
example.tran: 很多家长反对学校实行双语教育。

collins.def: If you are unable to do something, it is impossible for you to do it, for example because you do not have the necessary skill or knowledge, or because you do not have enough time or money.

example.ex: The military may feel unable to hand over power to a civilian President next year...
example.tran: 军方可能会觉得明年难以将政权移交给一位民选总统。

example.ex: Unable any longer to keep from breaking in she said, 'I simply cannot believe you're serious.'
example.tran: 她再也忍不住了，便插话道：“我真不敢相信你是认真的。”

collins.def: A revolution is a successful attempt by a large group of people to change the political system of their country by force.

example.ex: The period since the revolution has been one of political turmoil.
example.tran: 革命爆发后就陷入了政治动乱期。

example.ex: ...after the French Revolution.
example.tran: 法国革命之后

collins.def: A revolution in a particular area of human activity is an important change in that area.

example.ex: The nineteenth century witnessed a revolution in ship design and propulsion.
example.tran: 19世纪船舶设计和船舶动力领域发生了重大的变革。

example.ex: ...the industrial revolution.
example.tran: 工业革命

collins.def: Your chest is the top  part of the front of your body where your ribs, lungs, and heart are.

example.ex: He crossed his arms over his chest...
example.tran: 他双手交叉，放在胸前。

example.ex: He was shot in the chest...
example.tran: 他胸部中弹。

collins.def: A chest is a large, heavy box used for storing things.

example.ex: At the very bottom of the chest were his carving tools.
example.tran: 箱子最底下是他的雕刻工具。

example.ex: ...a treasure chest.
example.tran: 藏宝箱

collins.tran: 倾诉胸中的不快;吐苦水
collins.def: If you get something off your chest, you talk about something that has been worrying you.

example.ex: I feel it's done me good to get it off my chest.
example.tran: 我感觉吐吐苦水对我有好处。

collins.def: If you pursue an activity, interest, or plan, you carry it out or follow it.

example.ex: It became harder for women married to diplomats to pursue their own interests...
example.tran: 与外交官结婚的女性要追求自己的爱好就变得更加困难了。

example.ex: He said Japan would continue to pursue the policies laid down at the London summit...
example.tran: 他说日本将继续贯彻伦敦峰会所制定的政策。

collins.def: If you pursue a particular aim or result, you make efforts to achieve it, often over a long period of time.

example.ex: The implication seems to be that it is impossible to pursue economic reform and democracy simultaneously...
example.tran: 言外之意似乎是经济改革和民主化进程是不可能同时进行的。

example.ex: Mr. Menendez has aggressively pursued new business.
example.tran: 梅嫩德斯先生积极开拓新业务。

collins.def: If you pursue a particular topic, you try to find out more about it by asking questions.

example.ex: If your original request is denied, don't be afraid to pursue the matter.
example.tran: 如果你最初的请求遭到拒绝，不要害怕，要继续追问下去。

collins.def: If you pursue a person, vehicle, or animal, you follow them, usually in order to catch them.

example.ex: She pursued the man who had stolen a woman's bag.
example.tran: 她追赶那个偷了一个妇女提包的男人。

collins.def: An experiment is a scientific test which is done in order to discover what happens to something in particular conditions.

example.ex: The astronauts are conducting a series of experiments to learn more about how the body adapts to weightlessness...
example.tran: 那些宇航员正在进行一系列实验，以更多地了解身体如何适应失重状态。

example.ex: ...a proposed new law on animal experiments...
example.tran: 有关动物实验的最新法规提案

collins.def: If you experiment with something or experiment on it, you do a scientific test on it in order to discover what happens to it in particular conditions.

example.ex: In 1857 Mendel started experimenting with peas in his monastery garden...
example.tran: 1857年，孟德尔开始在修道院的菜园里用豌豆做实验。

example.ex: The scientists have experimented on the tiny neck arteries of rats...
example.tran: 科学家们已经在老鼠细小的颈动脉上做了实验。

collins.def: An experiment is the trying out of a new idea or method in order to see what it is like and what effects it has.

example.ex: As an experiment, we bought Ted a watch.
example.tran: 我们试着给特德买了一块手表。

example.ex: ...the country's five year experiment in democracy...
example.tran: 该国5年来对民主的尝试

collins.def: To experiment means to try out a new idea or method to see what it is like and what effects it has.

example.ex: ...if you like cooking and have the time to experiment...
example.tran: 如果你喜欢烹饪而且有时间尝试的话

example.ex: He believes that students should be encouraged to experiment with bold ideas.
example.tran: 他认为应该鼓励学生们将大胆的观念付诸试验。

means: 划分乐句，分乐节（尤指为奏乐或歌唱）

collins.def: A phrase is a short group of words that people often use as a way of saying something. The meaning of a phrase is often not obvious from the meaning of the individual words in it.

example.ex: He used a phrase I hate: 'You have to be cruel to be kind.'
example.tran: 他说了一句我讨厌的话：“要想善良，就得残忍。”

example.ex: ...the American phrase 'laying an egg' meaning to fail at something.
example.tran: 意思是“完全失败”的美国习语 laying an egg

collins.def: A phrase is a small group of words which forms a unit, either on its own or within a sentence.

example.ex: It is impossible to hypnotise someone simply by saying a particular word or phrase.
example.tran: 不可能仅通过说某个词或短语就能把人催眠。

collins.def: If you phrase something in a particular way, you express it in words in that way.

example.ex: I would have phrased it quite differently...
example.tran: 我本可以把它表述得全然不同。

example.ex: The speech was carefully phrased...
example.tran: 该演讲措词严谨。

collins.def: If someone has a particular turn of phrase, they have a particular way of expressing themselves in words.

example.ex: Rose's stories weren't bad; she had a nice turn of phrase.
example.tran: 罗斯的故事写得不错，她的语言表达形象生动。

example.ex: ...Schwarzkopf's distinctive turn of phrase.
example.tran: 施瓦茨科普夫与众不同的行文风格

collins.def: Something that is  beneath another thing is under the other thing.

example.ex: She could see the muscles of his shoulders beneath his T-shirt...
example.tran: 她可以看到他T恤衫下的肩部肌肉。

example.ex: She found pleasure in sitting beneath the trees...
example.tran: 她喜欢坐在树下。

collins.def: If you talk about what is beneath the surface of something, you are talking about the aspects of it which are hidden or not obvious.

example.ex: ...emotional strains beneath the surface...
example.tran: 表面之下的情感纠结

example.ex: Somewhere deep beneath the surface lay a caring character...
example.tran: 在内心深处的某个角落里埋藏着一颗爱心。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is beneath you, you feel that they are not good enough for you or not suitable for you.

example.ex: They decided she was marrying beneath her...
example.tran: 他们认定她要嫁给一个配不上她的人。

example.ex: Many find themselves having to take jobs far beneath them.
example.tran: 很多人觉得自己在工作上被迫大材小用。

collins.def: A deck on a vehicle such as a bus or ship is a lower or upper area of it.

example.ex: ...sitting on the top deck of the number 13 bus.
example.tran: 坐在 13 路公共汽车的顶层

example.ex: ...a luxury liner with five passenger decks.
example.tran: 有上下5层乘客舱的豪华游轮

collins.def: The deck of a ship is the top part of it that forms a floor in the open air which you can walk on.

example.ex: She stood on the deck and waved.
example.tran: 她站在甲板上挥手告别。

collins.tran: (录音机的)走带装置，匣仓;(唱机的)转盘支托面
collins.def: A tape deck or record deck is a piece of equipment on which you play tapes or records.

example.ex: ...the tape deck in my car...
example.tran: 我车里的磁带仓

example.ex: I stuck a tape in the deck.
example.tran: 我把一盘磁带放进带仓里。

collins.def: A deck of cards is a complete set of playing cards.

example.ex: Matt picked up the cards and shuffled the deck.
example.tran: 马特把牌拢起来洗牌。

collins.def: A deck is a flat wooden area next to a house, where people can sit and relax or eat.

example.ex: A natural timber deck leads into the main room of the home.
example.tran: 有一个天然的木制平台通到房子的客厅。

collins.def: If something is decked with pretty things, it is decorated with them.

example.ex: Villagers decked the streets with bunting...
example.tran: 村民用彩旗装饰街道。

example.ex: The house was decked with flowers.
example.tran: 房子里装点着鲜花。

collins.def: If someone decks you, they hit you so that you fall over.

example.ex: I hear you decked him and scared the hell out of his buddies.
example.tran: 我听说你一拳把他打倒在地，吓得他那些狐朋狗友屁滚尿流。

collins.def: If someone or something is below decks, they are inside a ship in the part of it that is underneath the deck.

example.ex: The crew of the trawler were gathered below decks.
example.tran: 托网渔船上的船员被聚集到甲板下。

collins.tran: 清除障碍以准备开始新的工作（或行动）
collins.def: If you clear the decks, you get ready to start something new by finishing any work that has to be done or getting rid of any problems that are in the way.

example.ex: The hostage release could clear the decks for war.
example.tran: 人质的获释可能会为发动战争扫清障碍。

example.ex: Clear the decks before you think of taking on any more responsibilities.
example.tran: 在考虑承担更多责任之前一定要先料理完手头的事。

collins.def: If someone or something hits the deck, they fall to the ground.

example.ex: Andover's body hit the deck.
example.tran: 安多弗摔倒在地。

collins.tran: （尤指用棍子等进行的）殴打，痛打
collins.def: If someone is given a beating, they are hit hard many times, especially with something such as a stick.

example.ex: ...the savage beating of a black motorist by white police officers...
example.tran: 白人警察对一名黑人驾车者的野蛮殴打。

example.ex: The team secured pictures of prisoners showing signs of severe beatings.
example.tran: 这个小组搞到了一些显示囚犯有被毒打痕迹的照片。

collins.def: If something such as a business, a political party, or a team takes a beating, it is defeated by a large amount in a competition or election.

example.ex: Our firm has taken a terrible beating in recent years.
example.tran: 我们公司近几年败得一塌糊涂。

collins.def: If you say that something will take some beating, you mean that it is very good and it is unlikely that anything better will be done or made.

example.ex: For sheer scale and grandeur, Leeds Castle in Kent takes some beating.
example.tran: 单从规模和气势来说，肯特的利兹城堡独领风骚。

collins.def: If you say that something normally happens or that you normally do a particular thing, you mean that it is what usually happens or what you usually do.

example.ex: All airports in the country are working normally today...
example.tran: 今天国内所有机场都运转正常。

example.ex: Social progress is normally a matter of struggles and conflicts...
example.tran: 社会进步通常是斗争和冲突的结果。

collins.def: If you do something normally, you do it in the usual or conventional way.

example.ex: She would apparently eat normally and then make herself sick.
example.tran: 她显然还会照吃不误，然后把自己吃到恶心。

example.ex: ...failure of the blood to clot normally.
example.tran: 血液未能正常凝结

collins.def: A description of someone or something is an account which explains what they are or what they look like.

example.ex: Police have issued a description of the man who was aged between fifty and sixty...
example.tran: 警方已经发布了那名年龄在 50 到 60 岁之间的男子的相貌特征通告。

example.ex: ...a detailed description of the movements and battle plans of Italy's fleet...
example.tran: 有关意大利舰队的行动和作战计划的详细说明

collins.def: If something is of a particular description, it belongs to the general class of items that are mentioned.

example.ex: ...the oldest Catholic church of any description in England...
example.tran: 英国所有天主教堂中最古老的一座

example.ex: Events of this description occurred daily.
example.tran: 这类事件天天发生。

collins.def: You can say that something is beyond description, or that it defies description, to emphasize that it is very unusual, impressive, terrible, or extreme.

example.ex: His face is weary beyond description...
example.tran: 他一脸难以形容的疲惫。

example.ex: We were in a disaster situation that defies description.
example.tran: 我们陷入了难以言表的糟糕处境。

collins.def: Sweet food and drink contains a lot of sugar.

example.ex: ...a mug of sweet tea...
example.tran: 一大杯甜茶

example.ex: If the sauce seems too sweet, add a dash of red wine vinegar.
example.tran: 如果酱汁太甜的话，可以加少许红酒醋。

collins.def: Sweets are small sweet things such as toffees, chocolates, and mints.

collins.tran: (尤指在餐厅吃饭时饭后的)甜食，甜点
collins.def: A sweet is something sweet, such as fruit or a pudding, that you eat at the end of a meal, especially in a restaurant.

example.ex: The sweet was a mousse flavoured with whisky.
example.tran: 甜点是威士忌口味的慕斯。

collins.def: A sweet smell is a pleasant one, for example the smell of a flower.

example.ex: ...the sweet smell of her shampoo...
example.tran: 她的洗发水的芳香

example.ex: She'd baked some bread which made the air smell sweet.
example.tran: 她刚烤制了一些面包，空气里都弥漫着一股香味。

collins.tran: (空气等)新鲜的,清新的;(水)纯净的,清澈的
collins.def: If you describe something such as air or water as sweet, you mean that it smells or tastes pleasantly fresh and clean.

example.ex: I gulped a breath of sweet air.
example.tran: 我吸了一大口清新的空气。

example.ex: ...a stream of sweet water.
example.tran: 一股纯净的水

collins.def: A sweet sound is pleasant, smooth, and gentle.

example.ex: Her voice was as soft and sweet as a young girl's.
example.tran: 她的声音如少女般柔美悦耳。

example.ex: ...the sweet sounds of Mozart.
example.tran: 莫扎特音乐优美的旋律

collins.def: If you describe something as sweet, you mean that it gives you great pleasure and satisfaction.

example.ex: There are few things quite as sweet as revenge.
example.tran: 几乎没有比复仇更爽的事情了。

example.ex: ...the sweet taste of illicit love...
example.tran: 婚外情带来的快感

collins.tran: 温和的;善良的;温柔的;可亲的
collins.def: If you describe someone as sweet, you mean that they are pleasant, kind, and gentle towards other people.

example.ex: He was a sweet man but when he drank he tended to quarrel...
example.tran: 他平时是一个温和的人，但喝了酒后往往就会又吵又闹。

example.ex: How sweet of you to think of me!
example.tran: 你能想着我真是太好了！

collins.tran: (小孩，小东西)迷人的，漂亮的，可爱的
collins.def: If you describe a small person or thing as sweet, you mean that they are attractive in a simple or unsophisticated way.

example.ex: ...a sweet little baby girl...
example.tran: 漂亮的小女孩

example.ex: The house was really sweet.
example.tran: 这房子太漂亮了。

collins.tran: 亲爱的,宝贝儿(用作爱称)
collins.def: You can address someone as sweet or my sweet if you are very fond of them.

example.ex: I am so proud of you, my sweet!
example.tran: 我真为你骄傲，亲爱的！

collins.def: If you keep someone sweet, you do something to please them in order to prevent them from becoming annoyed or dissatisfied.

example.ex: Where's the money to keep us sweet?
example.tran: 用来讨好我们的钱在哪呢？

collins.def: If you climb something such as a tree, mountain, or ladder, or climb up it, you move towards the top of it. If you climb down it, you move towards the bottom of it.

example.ex: Climbing the first hill took half an hour...
example.tran: 爬第一座小山花了半个钟头。

example.ex: He picked up his suitcase and climbed the stairs...
example.tran: 他拎起手提箱，爬上了楼梯。

collins.def: If you climb somewhere, you move there carefully, for example because you are moving into a small space or trying to avoid falling.

example.ex: The girls hurried outside, climbed into the car, and drove off...
example.tran: 姑娘们匆忙跑了出来，爬进汽车，然后开车走了。

example.ex: He must have climbed out of his cot...
example.tran: 他肯定是从婴儿床里爬出来的。

collins.tran: (飞机等)爬升，升高;(太阳)升高，上升
collins.def: When something such as an aeroplane climbs, it moves upwards to a higher position. When the sun climbs, it moves higher in the sky.

example.ex: The plane took off for LA, lost an engine as it climbed, and crashed just off the runway.
example.tran: 飞机起飞前往洛杉矶，在爬升过程中一台发动机熄火，刚飞离跑道就坠毁了。

collins.def: When something climbs, it increases in value or amount.

example.ex: The nation's unemployment rate has been climbing steadily since last June...
example.tran: 自去年6月以来，该国的失业率一直在不断上升。

example.ex: Prices have climbed by 21% since the beginning of the year...
example.tran: 年初以来，物价已经上涨了21%。

means: 为…提供所需物品（尤指食物）

collins.def: The provision of something is the act of giving it or making it available to people who need or want it.

example.ex: The department is responsible for the provision of residential care services.
example.tran: 该部门负责提供家庭护理服务。

example.ex: ...nursery provision for children with special needs.
example.tran: 为有特殊需要的儿童提供护理

collins.tran: 预备；准备；预先采取的措施
collins.def: If you make provision for something that might happen or that might need to be done, you make arrangements to deal with it.

example.ex: Mr King asked if it had ever occurred to her to make provision for her own pension...
example.tran: 金先生问她是否曾想过要为自己的养老金预先作安排。

example.ex: There is no provision for funding performance-related pay rises.
example.tran: 没有为与业绩挂钩的加薪预作资金准备。

collins.def: If you make provision for someone, you support them financially and make sure that they have the things that they need.

example.ex: Special provision should be made for children...
example.tran: 应给孩子在经济上专门作好安排。

example.ex: There are very generous provisions for the mother.
example.tran: 这位母亲在物质上得到了很好的赡养。

collins.tran: （法律或协议的）条文，条款，规定
collins.def: A provision in a law or an agreement is an arrangement which is included in it.

example.ex: He backed a provision that would allow judges to delay granting a divorce decree in some cases...
example.tran: 他赞成一项允许法官在一些情况下延迟作出离婚判决的法律条款。

example.ex: The bill's provision for the sale and purchase of land faces stiff opposition from conservatives.
example.tran: 该法案关于土地买卖的规定遭到保守派的强硬反对。

collins.def: Provisions are supplies of food.

example.ex: On board were enough provisions for two weeks.
example.tran: 船上有足够两周吃的食物。

means: 听力所及的距离，听得见的范围
听到，听见( hear的现在分词)

collins.def: A person's or animal's hearing is the sense which makes it possible for them to be aware of sounds.

example.ex: His mind still seemed clear and his hearing was excellent.
example.tran: 他的头脑似乎还清楚，听觉也很好。

collins.def: A hearing is an official meeting which is held in order to collect facts about an incident or problem.

example.ex: The judge adjourned the hearing until next Tuesday.
example.tran: 法官宣布休庭至下周二再审。

collins.def: If someone gives you a fair hearing or a hearing, they listen to you when you give your opinion about something.

example.ex: Weber gave a fair hearing to anyone who held a different opinion.
example.tran: 韦伯让持不同意见的人都能有机会发表意见。

collins.def: If someone says something in your hearing or within your hearing, you can hear what they say because they are with you or near you.

example.ex: No one spoke disparagingly of her father in her hearing.
example.tran: 没有人在她跟前说过她父亲的坏话。

collins.def: If something relates to a particular subject, it concerns that subject.

example.ex: Other recommendations relate to the details of how such data is stored...
example.tran: 其他建议涉及此类信息储存方面的一些细节。

example.ex: It does not matter whether the problem you have relates to food, drink, smoking or just living...
example.tran: 不管你的问题是由食物、饮料、吸烟引起，或仅仅是生活引起，都无关紧要。

collins.def: The way that two things relate, or the way that one thing relates to another, is the sort of connection that exists between them.

example.ex: More studies will be required before we know what the functions of these genes are and whether they relate to each other...
example.tran: 要弄清这些基因的功能以及它们彼此之间是否关联，我们还需要开展更多的研究。

example.ex: Cornell University offers a course that investigates how language relates to particular cultural codes...
example.tran: 康奈尔大学开设了一门研究语言与特定文化符号之间如何关联的课程。

collins.def: If you can relate to someone, you can understand how they feel or behave so that you are able to communicate with them or deal with them easily.

example.ex: He is unable to relate to other people...
example.tran: 他无法理解他人的想法。

example.ex: I think it is important for children to have brothers and sisters they can relate to...
example.tran: 我认为对孩子们来讲有可以相互理解沟通的兄弟姐妹很重要。

collins.def: If you relate a story, you tell it.

example.ex: There were officials to whom he could relate the whole story...
example.tran: 有一些官员会听他讲述整个故事。

example.ex: She related her tale of living rough.
example.tran: 她讲述了自己艰苦谋生的故事。

collins.def: A segment of something is one part of it, considered separately from the rest.

example.ex: ...the poorer segments of society.
example.tran: 社会中的较贫穷阶层

example.ex: ...the third segment of his journey.
example.tran: 他此行的第三程

collins.def: A segment of fruit such as an orange or grapefruit is one of the sections into which it is easily divided.
A segment of a circle is one of the two parts into which it is divided when you draw a straight line through it.
A segment of a market is one part of it, considered separately from the rest.

example.ex: Three-to-five day cruises are the fastest-growing segment of the market...
example.tran: 3 至 5 天的乘船游览是该市场中发展最快的部分。

example.ex: Women's tennis is the market leader in a growing market segment — women's sports.
example.tran: 女子网球正引领着一个逐渐壮大的市场——女子运动市场。

collins.def: If a company segments a market, it divides it into separate parts, usually in order to improve marketing opportunities.

example.ex: The big six record companies are multinational, and thus can segment the world market into national ones.
example.tran: 六大唱片公司都是跨国经营，因此能够将世界市场按国家划分。

collins.def: If one amount or value is the equivalent of another, they are the same.

example.ex: The equivalent of two tablespoons of polyunsaturated oils is ample each day...
example.tran: 每天相当于两大汤匙多重不饱和油的量就足够了。

example.ex: Even the cheapest car costs the equivalent of 70 years' salary for a government worker.
example.tran: 即使是最便宜的汽车，价格也相当于一个公务员70年的薪水。

collins.def: The equivalent of someone or something is a person or thing that has the same function in a different place, time, or system.

example.ex: ...the civil administrator of the West Bank and his equivalent in Gaza.
example.tran: 约旦河西岸的民政官和加沙的同职官员

example.ex: ...the Red Cross emblem, and its equivalent in Muslim countries, the Red Crescent.
example.tran: 红十字及其在伊斯兰国家的对应标志——红月牙

collins.tran: （强调效果的强烈或严重）相当于…的事情
collins.def: You can use equivalent to emphasize the great or severe effect of something.

example.ex: His party has just suffered the equivalent of a near-fatal heart attack.
example.tran: 他所在的政党刚刚经历了一次类似心脏病突发般几近致命的打击。

means: 合适的，适当的，适宜的，恰当的

collins.def: Someone or something that is suitable for a particular purpose or occasion is right or acceptable for it.

example.ex: Employers usually decide within five minutes whether someone is suitable for the job...
example.tran: 雇主通常在 5 分钟内就能决定一个人是否适合这份工作。

example.ex: She had no other dress suitable for the occasion...
example.tran: 她没有其他适合这种场合穿的套裙。

collins.def: Rural places are far away from large towns or cities.

example.ex: These plants have a tendency to grow in the more rural areas.
example.tran: 这些植物大多生长在偏远的乡村。

example.ex: ...the closure of rural schools.
example.tran: 农村学校的关闭

collins.tran: 有乡村特色的;田园的;有乡土气息的
collins.def: Rural means having features which are typical of areas that are far away from large towns or cities.

example.ex: ...the old rural way of life...
example.tran: 昔日的田园生活

example.ex: He spoke with a heavy rural accent.
example.tran: 他说话带着浓重的农村口音。

collins.def: Smoking is the act or habit of smoking cigarettes, cigars, or a pipe.

example.ex: Smoking is now banned in many places of work.
example.tran: 现在许多工作场所禁止吸烟。

example.ex: ...a no-smoking area.
example.tran: 禁烟区

collins.def: A smoking area is intended for people who want to smoke.

example.ex: ...the decision to scrap smoking compartments on Kent trains.
example.tran: 取消肯特列车上的吸烟车厢的决定

means: 悲剧理论，悲剧表演艺术

collins.def: A tragedy is an extremely sad event or situation.

example.ex: They have suffered an enormous personal tragedy...
example.tran: 他们遭逢了巨大的个人不幸。

example.ex: Maskell's life had not been without tragedy.
example.tran: 马斯克尔的生活亦有过变故。

collins.def: Tragedy is a type of literature, especially drama, that is serious and sad, and often ends with the death of the main character.

example.ex: The story has elements of tragedy and farce.
example.tran: 这个故事兼有悲剧与闹剧的元素。

example.ex: …a classic Greek tragedy.
example.tran: 古典希腊悲剧

collins.def: The countryside is land which is away from towns and cities.

example.ex: I've always loved the English countryside...
example.tran: 一直以来我都很喜欢英国的乡间。

example.ex: We are surrounded by lots of beautiful countryside.
example.tran: 我们周边是大片美丽的乡村地区。

collins.tran: 出版者；出版社；出版公司
collins.def: A publisher is a person or a company that publishes books, newspapers, or magazines.

example.ex: The publishers planned to produce the journal on a weekly basis.
example.tran: 出版者计划将该期刊定为周刊。

collins.def: The foundation of something such as a belief or way of life is the things on which it is based.

example.ex: Best friends are the foundation of my life...
example.tran: 好朋友是我生命的支柱。

example.ex: The issue strikes at the very foundation of our community...
example.tran: 这个问题严重影响了我们社会的基本根基。

collins.def: The foundations of a building or other structure are the layer of bricks or concrete below the ground that it is built on.
A foundation is an organization which provides money for a special purpose such as research or charity.

example.ex: ...the National Foundation for Educational Research.
example.tran: 全国教育研究基金会

collins.def: If a story, idea, or argument has no foundation, there are no facts to prove that it is true.

example.ex: The allegations were without foundation...
example.tran: 这些指控没有根据。

example.ex: Each complaint is analysed very closely, and if it has no foundation it is rejected.
example.tran: 每个投诉都经过仔细分析，如果发现没有依据就会予以驳回。

collins.def: Foundation is a skin-coloured cream that you put on your face before putting on the rest of your make-up.
Stocks are shares in the ownership of a company, or investments on which a fixed amount of interest will be paid.

example.ex: ...the buying and selling of stocks and shares...
example.tran: 证券和股票买卖

example.ex: As stock prices have dropped, so too has bank capital.
example.tran: 随着股价下跌，银行资本也减少了。

collins.def: A company's stock is the amount of money which the company has through selling shares.

example.ex: Two years later, when Compaq went public, their stock was valued at $38 million...
example.tran: 康柏公司两年后上市时，他们的股本为 3,800 万美元。

example.ex: The Fisher family holds 40% of the stock.
example.tran: 费希尔家族持有 40%的股份。

collins.def: If a shop stocks particular goods, it keeps a supply of them to sell.

example.ex: The shop stocks everything from cigarettes to recycled loo paper.
example.tran: 商店货品齐全，从香烟到再生厕纸应有尽有。

collins.def: A shop's stock is the total amount of goods which it has available to sell.

example.ex: We took the decision to withdraw a quantity of stock from sale.
example.tran: 我们决定将一批存货下架。

collins.def: If you stock something such as a cupboard, shelf, or room, you fill it with food or other things.

example.ex: I worked stocking shelves in a grocery store...
example.tran: 我在一家杂货店工作，负责为货架上货。

example.ex: Some families stocked their cellars with food and water...
example.tran: 有些家庭在地窖里储备了食品和水。

collins.def: If you have a stock of things, you have a supply of them stored in a place ready to be used.

example.ex: I keep a stock of cassette tapes describing various relaxation techniques...
example.tran: 我收集了一些介绍各种放松技巧的卡带。

example.ex: Stocks of ammunition were running low.
example.tran: 弹药的库存正在减少。

collins.def: The stock of something is the total amount of it that is available in a particular area.

example.ex: ...the stock of accommodation available to be rented.
example.tran: 可供租赁的住房储备量

collins.def: If you are from a particular stock, you are descended from a particular group of people.

example.ex: We are both from working class stock.
example.tran: 我们俩都出身于工人家庭。

example.ex: ...blacks, Asians and people of Mediterranean stock.
example.tran: 黑人、亚洲人和地中海沿岸高加索人的后裔

collins.tran: (尤指经过特殊饲养的)家畜，牲畜
collins.def: Stock are cattle, sheep, pigs, or other animals which are kept by a farmer, usually ones which have been specially bred.

example.ex: I am carefully selecting the breeding stock...
example.tran: 我正在精心挑选种畜。

example.ex: His herd of 170 dairy cattle and 200 young stock are kept on the land.
example.tran: 他那170头奶牛和200头乳牛都在那块地上圈养。

collins.tran: (回答、说法或做事方式)老一套的，陈腐的
collins.def: A stock answer, expression, or way of doing something is one that is very commonly used, especially because people cannot be bothered to think of something new.

example.ex: My boss had a stock response — 'If it ain't broke, don't fix it!'...
example.tran: 我上司总是这一句——“别没事找事！”

example.ex: National security is the stock excuse for keeping things confidential.
example.tran: 国家安全常被用作对一些事情保密的挡箭牌。

collins.def: Stock is a liquid, usually made by boiling meat, bones, or vegetables in water, that is used to give flavour to soups and sauces.
In former times, the stocks were an instrument of punishment. A criminal's hands and legs were locked into holes in a wooden frame while people threw things at them.
If goods are in stock, a shop has them available to sell. If they are out of stock, it does not.

example.ex: Check that your size is in stock...
example.tran: 查查你的尺码是否有货。

example.ex: Lemon and lime juice were both temporarily out of stock.
example.tran: 柠檬汁和酸橙汁暂时都缺货。

collins.tran: 作出整体估量;全面分析
collins.def: If you take stock, you pause to think about all the aspects of a situation or event before deciding what to do next.

example.ex: It was time to take stock of the situation...
example.tran: 是时候统观一下形势了。

example.ex: I was forty, the age when people take stock and change their lives.
example.tran: 我已年届不惑，到了该全面审视自己并改变生活的年龄了。

collins.tran: 产生（问题）；造成（威胁、危险等）
collins.def: If something poses a problem or a danger, it is the cause of that problem or danger.

example.ex: This could pose a threat to jobs in the coal industry...
example.tran: 这可能会给煤炭产业的就业造成威胁。

example.ex: His ill health poses serious problems for the future.
example.tran: 他身体不好，对将来造成严重的隐患。

collins.def: If you pose a question, you ask it. If you pose an issue that needs considering, you mention the issue.

example.ex: When I finally posed the question, 'Why?' he merely shrugged.
example.tran: 当我最后问“为什么”时，他只是耸了耸肩。

example.ex: ...the moral issues posed by new technologies.
example.tran: 新技术带来的道德问题

collins.def: If you pose as someone, you pretend to be that person in order to deceive people.

example.ex: The team posed as drug dealers to trap the ringleaders.
example.tran: 该队队员装扮成毒品贩子，诱捕罪犯头目。

collins.tran: 摆姿势（以供人摄影或绘画）
collins.def: If you pose for a photograph or painting, you stay in a particular position so that someone can photograph you or paint you.

example.ex: Before going into their meeting the six foreign ministers posed for photographs.
example.tran: 开会前，6位外交部长合影留念。

collins.def: You can say that people are posing when you think that they are behaving in an insincere or exaggerated way because they want to make a particular impression on other people.

example.ex: He criticized them for dressing outrageously and posing pretentiously.
example.tran: 他批评她们衣着暴露而且矫揉造作。

collins.def: A pose is a particular way that you stand, sit, or lie, for example when you are being photographed or painted.

example.ex: We have had several preliminary sittings in various poses.
example.tran: 我们进行了几次预拍摄，摆了各种不同的造型。

collins.def: A pose is an insincere or exaggerated way of behaving that is intended to make a particular impression on other people.

example.ex: In many writers modesty is a pose, but in Ford it seems to have been genuine.
example.tran: 很多作家都是故作谦虚，但福特却似乎表里如一。

collins.def: Bread is a very common food made from flour, water, and yeast.

example.ex: ...a loaf of bread...
example.tran: 一条面包

example.ex: ...bread and butter...
example.tran: 抹黄油的面包

collins.tran: （通过工作等挣得的）钱财，金钱
collins.def: If you earn your bread doing a particular job or activity, you earn your money doing it.

example.ex: There's not a living soul in Colorado who doesn't depend for his bread on silver.
example.tran: 科罗拉多的每一个人都是靠着开采银矿养家糊口。

collins.def: If food such as fish or meat is breaded, it is covered in tiny pieces of dry bread called breadcrumbs. It can then be fried or grilled.

example.ex: It is important that food be breaded just minutes before frying.
example.tran: 把食物抹上面包屑后过几分钟就炸，这一点很重要。

collins.def: If you co-operate with someone, you work with them or help them for a particular purpose. You can also say that two people co-operate .

example.ex: The UN had been co-operating with the State Department on a plan to find countries willing to take the refugees...
example.tran: 联合国一直都在与美国国务院合作推进一项计划，寻找愿意接纳难民的国家。

example.ex: The couple spoke about how they would co-operate in the raising of their child...
example.tran: 这对夫妇讲述了他们将如何共同抚养孩子。

collins.def: If you co-operate, you do what someone has asked or told you to do.

example.ex: He agreed to co-operate with the police investigation...
example.tran: 他同意配合警方的调查。

example.ex: The plan failed because the soldiers refused to co-operate.
example.tran: 因为士兵们不肯合作，这项计划宣告失败。

collins.def: An emotion is a feeling such as happiness, love, fear, anger, or hatred, which can be caused by the situation that you are in or the people you are with.

example.ex: Happiness was an emotion that Reynolds was having to relearn...
example.tran: 雷诺兹已经不知道什么是快乐。

example.ex: Her voice trembled with emotion.
example.tran: 她的声音因情绪激动而颤抖。

collins.def: Emotion is the part of a person's character that consists of their feelings, as opposed to their thoughts.

example.ex: ...the split between reason and emotion.
example.tran: 理性和感性的划分

collins.tran: 不合法的;非法的;违反规则的
collins.def: If something is illegal, the law says that it is not allowed.

example.ex: It is illegal to intercept radio messages...
example.tran: 拦截无线电报是非法的。

example.ex: Birth control was illegal there until 1978...
example.tran: 1978 年以前那里节育是非法的。

collins.tran: (移民)非法入境的;(劳工)非法务工的
collins.def: Illegal immigrants or workers have travelled into a country or are working without official permission.

collins.tran: (问题、局势)难对付的，考验人的，棘手的
collins.def: A testing problem or situation is very difficult to deal with and shows a lot about the character of the person who is dealing with it.

example.ex: The most testing time is undoubtedly in the early months of your return to work...
example.tran: 最考验人的时期莫过于重新回来上班的头几个月。

example.ex: The papers in maths and English are very testing.
example.tran: 数学试卷和英语试卷很难。

collins.def: Testing is the activity of testing something or someone in order to find out information.

example.ex: ...product testing and labelling...
example.tran: 检验产品和给产品贴标签

example.ex: The National Collegiate Athletic Association introduced drug testing in the mid-1980s.
example.tran: 美国大学体育联合会在 20 世纪 80 年代中期开始实行药物检测。

collins.def: If you implement something such as a plan, you ensure that what has been planned is done.

example.ex: The government promised to implement a new system to control financial loan institutions...
example.tran: 政府许诺实施新的制度来控制金融贷款机构。

example.ex: The report sets out strict inspection procedures to ensure that the recommendations are properly implemented.
example.tran: 报告规定了严格的检查程序，以确保建议得到切实执行。

collins.def: An implement is a tool or other piece of equipment.

example.ex: ...knives and other useful implements.
example.tran: 刀子和其他有用工具

example.ex: ...writing implements.
example.tran: 书写用具

collins.def: Meat is flesh taken from a dead animal that people cook and eat.

example.ex: Meat and fish are relatively expensive.
example.tran: 肉和鱼相对来说比较贵。

example.ex: ...imported meat products.
example.tran: 进口肉制品

collins.tran: 喜欢做的事;感兴趣的事
collins.def: If you say something is meat and drink to someone, you mean that they enjoy it very much.

example.ex: What normal people considered pressure was meat and drink to him.
example.tran: 一般人认为有压力的事情在他看来却是快乐无比的事。

collins.tran: 最基本的部分;根本部分;关键
collins.def: If you refer to the meat and potatoes of something, you mean its most basic, simple, and essential parts.

example.ex: What they want is the meat and potatoes of how we're going to improve this country and get our country moving again.
example.tran: 他们想知道的是我们如何改善国家、让其恢复活力的基本方法。

collins.tran: (行为或决定)明智的，理智的，合理的
collins.def: Sensible actions or decisions are good because they are based on reasons rather than emotions.

example.ex: It might be sensible to get a solicitor...
example.tran: 也许应该请一个诉状律师。

example.ex: The sensible thing is to leave them alone.
example.tran: 别去管他们才是明智的。

collins.tran: (人)明智的，理智的，通情达理的
collins.def: Sensible people behave in a sensible way.

example.ex: She was a sensible girl and did not panic...
example.tran: 她是一个理智的女孩，没有惊慌失措。

example.ex: Oh come on, let's be sensible about this...
example.tran: 噢，得了吧，我们还是理智地对待此事吧。

collins.tran: (衣服、鞋子)耐用的，朴素而实用的
collins.def: Sensible shoes or clothes are practical and strong rather than fashionable and attractive.

example.ex: Wear loose clothing and sensible footwear.
example.tran: 穿上宽松的衣服和舒服的鞋子。

means: 邪恶的力量、势力或化身

collins.def: Evil is a powerful force that some people believe to exist, and which causes wicked and bad things to happen.

example.ex: We are still being attacked by the forces of evil...
example.tran: 我们仍在遭受邪恶力量的攻击。

example.ex: There's always a conflict between good and evil in his plays.
example.tran: 他的戏剧中总是有善恶之间的斗争。

collins.def: Evil is used to refer to all the wicked and bad things that happen in the world.

example.ex: He could not, after all, stop all the evil in the world.
example.tran: 毕竟他无法阻止世界上的所有恶行。

example.ex: ...those who see television as the root of all evil.
example.tran: 那些将电视视为万恶之源的人

collins.def: If you refer to an evil, you mean a very unpleasant or harmful situation or activity.

example.ex: Apartheid is even a greater evil...
example.tran: 种族隔离是更大的祸害。

example.ex: Higher taxes may be a necessary evil.
example.tran: 提高税收可能会很不受欢迎，但却是必要的。

collins.def: If you describe someone as evil, you mean that they are very wicked by nature and take pleasure in doing things that harm other people.

example.ex: ...the country's most evil terrorists...
example.tran: 该国最邪恶的恐怖分子

example.ex: She's an evil woman.
example.tran: 她是个邪恶的女人。

collins.tran: 危害社会的；道德败坏的
collins.def: If you describe something as evil, you mean that you think it causes a great deal of harm to people and is morally bad.

example.ex: After 1760 few Americans refrained from condemning slavery as evil...
example.tran: 1760年后，很多美国人都在谴责奴隶制的社会危害。

example.ex: They are setting an evil example for their children.
example.tran: 他们正给孩子们树立道德败坏的反面形象。

collins.tran: 受魔鬼影响的;恶魔的;不祥的
collins.def: If you describe something as evil, you mean that you think it is influenced by the devil.

example.ex: I think this is an evil spirit at work...
example.tran: 我认为这是恶魔在作祟。

example.ex: According to local folklore it is an evil place.
example.tran: 据当地民间传说，那是个不祥的地方。

collins.def: You can describe a very unpleasant smell as evil.

example.ex: Both men were smoking evil-smelling pipes.
example.tran: 两个男人都在抽着难闻的烟斗。

collins.def: If someone is putting off the evil day or the evil hour, they have to do something unpleasant and are trying to avoid doing it for as long as possible.

example.ex: You can simply go on putting off the evil day and eventually find yourself smoking as much as ever.
example.tran: 你当然可以想方设法摆脱，但最后你会发现自己还是像以前一样拼命抽烟。

collins.def: If you have two choices, but think that they are both bad, you can describe the one which is less bad as the lesser of two evils, or the lesser evil .

example.ex: People voted for him as the lesser of two evils...
example.tran: 人们投票支持他只不过是两害相权取其轻罢了。

example.ex: One suspects that hydro power is still the lesser evil.
example.tran: 有人认为水力发电仍旧是两害相较取其轻。

collins.def: A knife is a tool for cutting or a weapon and consists of a flat piece of metal with a sharp edge on the end of a handle.

example.ex: ...a knife and fork...
example.tran: 一副刀叉

example.ex: Two robbers broke into her home, held a knife to her throat and stole her savings.
example.tran: 两个盗贼闯进了她的家，把刀架在她的脖子上，抢走了她的积蓄。

collins.def: To knife someone means to attack and injure them with a knife.

example.ex: Dawson takes revenge on the man by knifing him to death...
example.tran: 道森用刀杀死了他的仇人。

example.ex: She was knifed in the back six times.
example.tran: 她的背部中了6刀。

collins.def: A surgeon's knife is a piece of equipment used to cut flesh and organs during operations. It is made of metal and has a very thin sharp edge.
If you go under the knife, you have an operation in a hospital.

example.ex: Kelly was about to go under the knife when her surgeon stopped everything.
example.tran: 凯莉的手术就要开始时被她的外科医生给叫停了。

collins.def: If someone does something like a knife through butter or like a hot knife through butter, they do it very easily.

example.ex: Spending by Japanese companies has left them more competitive than companies in other nations. They will be cutting through the competition like a hot knife through butter.
example.tran: 日本公司的支出使得它们比其他国家的公司更具竞争力。它们将在竞争中轻而易举地取胜。

collins.tran: （紧张的气氛）使人透不过气来
collins.def: If you have been in a place where there was a very tense atmosphere, you can say that you could have cut the atmosphere with a knife.

example.ex: Officials hung the flag upside down. You could have cut the atmosphere with a knife.
example.tran: 官员们把旗子挂倒了。气氛紧张得让人透不过气来。

collins.tran: 对…磨刀霍霍；对…兴师问罪
collins.def: If a lot of people want something unpleasant to happen to someone, for example if they want them to lose their job, you can say that the knives are out for that person.

example.ex: The Party knives are out for the leader.
example.tran: 该党派要向其领导人开刀了。

collins.tran: 落井下石；往伤口上撒盐
collins.def: If you twist the knife or if you turn the knife in someone's wound, you do or say something to make an unpleasant situation they are in even more unpleasant.

example.ex: Travis twisted the knife by laughing at her...
example.tran: 特拉维斯火上浇油般地嘲笑她。

example.ex: It is the turn of Latvia to twist the knife.
example.tran: 轮到拉特维亚落井下石了。

collins.def: A chart is a diagram, picture, or graph which is intended to make information easier to understand.

example.ex: Male unemployment was 14.2%, compared with 5.8% for women (see chart on next page)...
example.tran: 相比女性的5.8%，男性失业率为14.2%(见下页图表)。

example.ex: The chart below shows our top 10 choices.
example.tran: 下图是我们优先考虑的10个选择。

collins.def: A chart is a map of the sea or stars.

example.ex: ...charts of Greek waters.
example.tran: 希腊海域图

collins.tran: 绘制…的地图(或海图、星位图)
collins.def: If you chart an area of land, sea, or sky, or a feature in that area, you make a map of the area or show the feature in it.

example.ex: Portuguese explorers had charted the west coast of Africa as far as Sierra Leone...
example.tran: 葡萄牙探险家已经绘制出了远至塞拉里昂的非洲西海岸地图。

example.ex: Ptolemy charted more than 1000 stars in 48 constella-tions...
example.tran: 托勒密绘制了48个星座1,000多颗恒星的星位图。

collins.def: The charts are the official lists that show which CDs have sold the most copies each week.

example.ex: This album confirmed The Orb's status as national stars, going straight to Number One in the charts...
example.tran: 这张专辑确立了The Orb作为全国明星的地位，销量直升至排行榜首位。

example.ex: They topped both the US singles and album charts at the same time.
example.tran: 他们同时荣登美国单曲榜和专辑榜榜首。

collins.def: If you chart the development or progress of something, you observe it and record or show it. You can also say that a report or graph charts the development or progress of something.

example.ex: One GP has charted a dramatic rise in local childhood asthma since the M25 was built nearby...
example.tran: 一位全科医生跟踪记录发现，自从附近修建了25号高速公路以来，当地哮喘病患儿数量急剧增加。

example.ex: This magnificent show charts his meteoric rise from 'small town' country singer to top international Rock idol...
example.tran: 这场盛大的演出展示了他是如何从一个“小镇”乡村歌手一跃成为国际顶级摇滚偶像的。

collins.def: If a person or plan charts a course of action, they describe what should be done in order to achieve something or to make progress in the future.

example.ex: We've charted a possible way forward...
example.tran: 我们已经制订了下一步可能的计划。

example.ex: NATO had charted a new course for stability and cooperation in Europe...
example.tran: 北约制订了保持欧洲稳定与合作的新计划。

means: 心，精神，心力，知，智力，智慧
愿望，目的，意向，意志，决心，见解，意见

collins.def: You refer to someone's mind when talking about their thoughts. For example, if you say that something is in your mind, you mean that you are thinking about it, and if you say that something is at the back of your mind, you mean that you are aware of it, although you are not thinking about it very much.

example.ex: I'm trying to clear my mind of all this...
example.tran: 我正在努力忘掉这一切。

example.ex: There was no doubt in his mind that the man was serious...
example.tran: 在他看来，这个人无疑是认真的。

collins.tran: 头脑，大脑(指思考和推理的能力)
collins.def: Your mind is your ability to think and reason.

example.ex: You have a good mind...
example.tran: 你有聪明的头脑。

example.ex: Studying stretched my mind and got me thinking about things.
example.tran: 学习拓展了我的思路，启发我去思考问题。

collins.def: If you have a particular type of mind, you have a particular way of thinking which is part of your character, or a result of your education or professional training.

example.ex: Andrew, you have a very suspicious mind...
example.tran: 安德鲁，你太多疑了。

example.ex: The key to his success is his logical mind.
example.tran: 他成功的关键在于他擅长逻辑思维。

collins.tran: 有才智的人;富有想象力的人;精英
collins.def: You can refer to someone as a particular kind of mind as a way of saying that they are clever, intelligent, or imaginative.

example.ex: She moved to London, meeting some of the best minds of her time.
example.tran: 她搬到了伦敦，遇见了她那个时代最有头脑的一些人。

collins.def: If you tell someone to bear something in mind or to keep something in mind, you are reminding or warning them about something important which they should remember.

example.ex: Bear in mind that petrol stations are scarce in the more remote areas...
example.tran: 要牢记一点：在比较偏远的地方加油站很少见。

example.ex: I should not be surprised about some of her comments, bearing in mind the party she belongs to.
example.tran: 想到她所属的那个党派，我对她的一些评论并不感到惊讶。

collins.def: If something brings another thing to mind or calls another thing to mind, it makes you think of that other thing, usually because it is similar in some way.

example.ex: That brings to mind a wonderful poem by Riokin...
example.tran: 那使我记起了里奥金的一首很赞的诗。

example.ex: The fate of many British designers calls to mind the fable of the tortoise and the hare.
example.tran: 许多英国设计师的命运令人想起了龟兔赛跑的故事。

collins.def: If you cast your mind back to a time in the past, you think about what happened then.

example.ex: Cast your mind back to 1978, when Forest won the title.
example.tran: 回想一下1978年福里斯特赢得冠军称号的时候。

collins.tran: 对…不予考虑;对…置若罔闻
collins.def: If you close your mind to something, you deliberately do not think about it or pay attention to it.

example.ex: She has closed her mind to last year's traumas.
example.tran: 她不再去想去年遭受的创伤。

collins.def: If you change your mind, or if someone or something changes your mind, you change a decision you have made or an opinion that you had.

example.ex: I was going to vote for him, but I changed my mind and voted for Reagan...
example.tran: 我原本准备投他的票，后来却改变了主意，把票投给了里根。

example.ex: She's very young. She might change her mind about what she wants to do...
example.tran: 她很年轻，对于自己想要做的事情也许会改变主意。

collins.tran: 突然想起;(想法)一下子冒出来
collins.def: If something comes to mind or springs to mind, you think of it without making any effort.

example.ex: Integrity and honesty are words that spring to mind when talking of the man.
example.tran: 谈到这个人的时候自然会想起“正直”、“诚实”这样的字眼。

collins.tran: (想法)掠过心头，被想到，进入脑海
collins.def: If you say that an idea or possibility never crossed your mind, you mean that you did not think of it.

example.ex: It had never crossed his mind that there might be a problem...
example.tran: 他从未想过可能会有问题存在。

example.ex: The possibility of failure did cross my mind.
example.tran: 我的确想过有失败的可能。

collins.def: If you see something in your mind's eye, you imagine it and have a clear picture of it in your mind.

example.ex: In his mind's eye, he can imagine the effect he's having.
example.tran: 他能在脑海里想象出将会达到的效果。

collins.def: If you have a mind to do something, you want, intend, or choose to do it.

example.ex: The captain of the guard looked as if he had a mind to challenge them...
example.tran: 警卫队长看上去似乎想向他们挑战。

example.ex: They could interpret it that way if they'd a mind to.
example.tran: 如果他们愿意的话，可以那样理解。

collins.tran: 很想做(作为一种警告或声明，实际很可能不会做)
collins.def: If you say that you have a good mind to do something or have half a mind to do it, you are threatening or announcing that you have a strong desire to do it, although you probably will not do it.

example.ex: He raged on about how he had a good mind to resign.
example.tran: 他还在大发脾气，叫嚷着真想辞职不干了。

collins.def: If you ask someone what they have in mind, you want to know in more detail about an idea or wish they have.

example.ex: 'Maybe we could celebrate tonight.' — 'What did you have in mind?'
example.tran: “也许今晚我们可以庆祝一下。”——“你有何打算？”

collins.def: If you have it in mind to do something, you intend or want to do it.

example.ex: Collins Harvill had it in mind to publish a short volume about Pasternak.
example.tran: 柯林斯·哈维尔公司打算出版一本帕斯捷尔纳克的小诗集。

collins.tran: 以…为目标(或理由、基础);考虑到
collins.def: If you do something with a particular thing in mind, you do it with that thing as your aim or as the reason or basis for your action.

example.ex: These families need support. With this in mind a group of 35 specialists met last weekend.
example.tran: 这些家庭需要帮助。为此35位专家组成的小组上周末会面进行了商谈。

collins.tran: (疾病等)只是凭空想象的，完全由心理引起的
collins.def: If you say that something such as an illness is all in the mind, you mean that it relates to someone's feelings or attitude, rather than having any physical cause.

example.ex: It could be a virus, or it could be all in the mind.
example.tran: 它可能是种病毒性疾病，也可能纯属心理作用。

collins.def: If you know your own mind, you are sure about your opinions, and are not easily influenced by other people.
If you say that someone is losing their mind, you mean that they are becoming mad.

example.ex: Sometimes I feel I'm losing my mind.
example.tran: 有时候我觉得自己快要疯掉了。

collins.def: If you make up your mind or make your mind up, you decide which of a number of possible things  you will have or do.

example.ex: Once he made up his mind to do something, there was no stopping him...
example.tran: 一旦他下定决心做某件事，就没有什么能够阻止他。

example.ex: He simply can't make his mind up...
example.tran: 他就是拿不定主意。

collins.tran: 思想支配物质(指某人似乎能够用其思想控制事情、物体或自身身体状况)
collins.def: You can use the expression mind over matter to describe situations in which a person seems to be able to control events, physical objects, or the condition of their own body using their mind.

example.ex: Good health is simply a case of mind over matter.
example.tran: 身体健康只不过是一个心态至上的问题。

collins.def: If a number of people are of one mind ,of like mind, or of the same mind, they all agree about something.

example.ex: Contact with other disabled yachtsmen of like mind would be helpful...
example.tran: 和其他志同道合的残疾人帆船运动员接触会有帮助。

example.ex: The food companies are not of one mind about these new regulations.
example.tran: 对于这些新规定，各食品公司意见不一。

collins.tran: 不再忧虑;心中的石头落地
collins.def: If you say that something that happens is a load off your mind or a weight off your mind, you mean that it causes you to stop worrying, for example because it solves a problem that you had.
If something is on your mind, you are worried or concerned about it and think about it a lot.

example.ex: This game has been on my mind all week...
example.tran: 整整一个星期，我都在为这次比赛紧绷着一根弦。

example.ex: I just forgot. I've had a lot on my mind.
example.tran: 我完全忘了，我脑子里的事太多了。

collins.def: If your mind is on something or you have your mind on something, you are thinking about that thing.

example.ex: At school I was always in trouble—my mind was never on my work.
example.tran: 上学的时候，我老是惹麻烦——我的心思从来不在学业上。

collins.tran: 开明的思想;无先入之见的心态
collins.def: If you have an open mind, you avoid forming an opinion or making a decision until you know all the facts.

example.ex: It's hard to see it any other way, though I'm trying to keep an open mind.
example.tran: 尽管我努力不妄下定论，但此事很难有其他的见解。

collins.tran: 使思想开放；使更愿意接受(或尝试)(新事物)
collins.def: If something opens your mind to new ideas or experiences, it makes you more willing to accept them or try them.

example.ex: She also stimulated his curiosity and opened his mind to other cultures.
example.tran: 她还激发了他的好奇心，使他愿意了解其他文化。

collins.def: If you say that someone is out of their mind, you mean that they are mad or very foolish.

example.ex: What are you doing? Are you out of your mind?
example.tran: 你在干什么？你疯了吗？

collins.def: If you say that someone is out of their mind with a feeling such as worry or fear, you are emphasizing that they are extremely worried or afraid.

collins.tran: 烦得要命/吓得丢了魂/在毒品作用下变得飘飘然
collins.def: If you say that someone is, for example, bored out of their mind ,scared out of their mind, or stoned out of their mind, you are emphasizing that they are extremely bored, scared, or affected by drugs.
If you put your mind to something, you start making  an effort to do it.

example.ex: You could do fine in the world if you put your mind to it.
example.tran: 如果认真去做，任何事都可以做好。

collins.tran: 使想起，使联想起(类似或相关的事)
collins.def: If something puts you in mind of something else, it reminds you of it because it is similar to it or is associated with it.

example.ex: This put me in mind of something Patrick said many years ago.
example.tran: 这使我想起多年前帕特里克曾说过的话。

collins.tran: 读懂…的思想;看出…的心思
collins.def: If you can read someone's mind, you know what they are thinking without them saying anything.

example.ex: Don't expect others to read your mind.
example.tran: 别指望别人会看出你的心思。

collins.def: To put someone's mind at rest or set their mind at rest means to stop them worrying about something.

example.ex: It may be advisable to have a blood test to put your mind at rest...
example.tran: 最好验一下血，好让你自己放心。

example.ex: She could set your mind at rest by giving you the facts.
example.tran: 她可以告诉你事实的真相以让你放心。

collins.tran: 心智正常(而不会做某事)
collins.def: If you say that nobody in their right mind would do a particular thing, you are emphasizing that it is an irrational thing to do and you would be surprised if anyone did it.

example.ex: No one in her right mind would make such a major purchase without asking questions.
example.tran: 没有哪个心智正常的人会连问都不问就花这么一大笔钱买东西。

collins.def: If you set your mind on something or have your mind set on it, you are determined to do it or obtain it.

example.ex: When my wife sets her mind on something, she invariably finds a way to achieve it.
example.tran: 我妻子一旦下定决心做某事，就总能设法完成。

collins.def: If something slips your mind, you forget it.

example.ex: I was going to mention it, but it slipped my mind.
example.tran: 我刚想提这件事，却又忘了。

collins.def: If you speak your mind, you say firmly and honestly what you think about a situation, even if this may offend or upset people.

example.ex: Martina Navratilova has never been afraid to speak her mind.
example.tran: 玛蒂娜·纳芙拉蒂洛娃从来不害怕说实话。

collins.tran: 被牢记在心；印在脑海中
collins.def: If something sticks in your mind, it remains firmly in your memory.

example.ex: I've always been fond of poetry and one piece has always stuck in my mind.
example.tran: 我一直喜爱诗歌，有一首诗总是牢记在我心间。

collins.tran: 使暂时忘记(某一问题或不愉快的情况)
collins.def: If something takes your mind off a problem or unpleasant situation, it helps you to forget about it for a while.

example.ex: 'How about a game of tennis?' suggested Alan. 'That'll take your mind off things.'
example.tran: “打一场网球怎么样？”艾伦建议说，“那样会让你暂时忘掉烦心事。”

collins.def: You say or write to my mind to indicate that the statement you are making is your own opinion.

example.ex: There are scenes in this play which to my mind are incredibly violent.
example.tran: 这出戏里有些场面在我看来过于暴力。

collins.tran: （尤指在两种行动选择间）犹豫不决，拿不定主意（亦可使用of two minds，尤见于美国英语）
collins.def: If you are in two minds, you are uncertain about what to do, especially when you have to choose between two courses of action. The expression of two minds is also used, especially in American English.

example.ex: Like many parents, I am in two minds about school uniforms...
example.tran: 跟许多家长一样，我对是否该穿校服也拿不定主意。

example.ex: Roche was in two minds whether to make the trip to Oslo.
example.tran: 对于是否要去一趟奥斯陆，罗奇犹豫不决。

collins.def: A switch is a small control for an electrical device which you use to turn the device on or off.

example.ex: Leona put some detergent into the dishwasher, shut the door and pressed the switch.
example.tran: 利昂娜将一些清洁剂放入洗碗机，关上门后按了开始键。

example.ex: ...a light switch.
example.tran: 电灯开关

collins.def: If you switch to something different, for example to a different system, task, or subject of conversation, you change to it from what you were doing or saying before.

example.ex: Estonia is switching to a market economy...
example.tran: 爱沙尼亚正在向市场经济转轨。

example.ex: The law would encourage companies to switch from coal to cleaner fuels...
example.tran: 该法律将鼓励企业转而使用比煤更加清洁的能源。

collins.tran: 转移(注意力);(注意力)转变
collins.def: If you switch your attention from one thing to another or if your attention switches, you stop paying attention to the first thing and start paying attention to the second.

example.ex: My mother's interest had switched to my health...
example.tran: 母亲转而关注起我的健康来。

example.ex: As the era wore on, she switched her attention to films.
example.tran: 随着这个时代慢慢过去，她把目光投向了电影业。

collins.def: If you switch two things, you replace one with the other.

example.ex: In half an hour, they'd switched the tags on every cable...
example.tran: 半个小时内，他们就给每根电缆都换了标签。

example.ex: The ballot boxes have been switched.
example.tran: 投票箱被人调换了。

collins.tran: (行为、态度等)一贯的，一致的，始终如一的
collins.def: Someone who is  consistent always behaves in the same way, has the same attitudes towards people or things, or achieves the same level of success in something.

example.ex: Becker has never been the most consistent of players anyway.
example.tran: 不管怎么说，贝克尔从来就不是表现最为稳定的球员。

example.ex: ...his consistent support of free trade.
example.tran: 他对自由贸易始终如一的支持

collins.tran: （观点等）一致的，吻合的，不矛盾的
collins.def: If one fact or idea is consistent with another, they do not contradict each other.

example.ex: This result is consistent with the findings of Garnett & Tobin...
example.tran: 这个结果与加尼特托宾公司的调查结果一致。

example.ex: New goals are not always consistent with the existing policies.
example.tran: 新目标并不总是与现行政策一致。

collins.tran: (观点或看法)前后一致的，连贯的
collins.def: An argument or set of ideas that is consistent is one in which no part contradicts or conflicts with any other part.

example.ex: These are clear consistent policies which we are putting into place.
example.tran: 这些就是我们正在付诸实施的政策，不但清楚而且前后一致。

collins.def: An electronic device has transistors or silicon chips which control and change the electric current passing through the device.

example.ex: ...expensive electronic equipment.
example.tran: 昂贵的电子设备

collins.tran: 电子化的;使用电子装置的
collins.def: An electronic process or activity involves the use of electronic devices.

example.ex: ...electronic surveillance.
example.tran: 电子监控

example.ex: ...electronic music.
example.tran: 电子音乐

collins.def: If you bet on the result of a horse race, football game, or other event, you give someone a sum of money which they give you back with extra money if the result is what you predicted, or which they keep if it is not.

example.ex: Jockeys are forbidden to bet on the outcome of races...
example.tran: 职业赛马骑师禁止对赛马结果下注。

example.ex: I bet £10 on a horse called Premonition...
example.tran: 我在一匹名叫“预兆”的赛马上下了10英镑的赌注。

collins.def: A bet is a sum of money which you give to someone when you bet.

example.ex: You can put a bet on almost anything these days.
example.tran: 如今几乎可以对任何东西下赌注。

collins.def: If someone is betting that something will happen, they are hoping or expecting that it will happen.

example.ex: The party is betting that the presidential race will turn into a battle for younger voters...
example.tran: 该党期待这次总统竞选变成一场争取年轻一代选民的斗争。

example.ex: People were betting on a further easing of credit conditions.
example.tran: 人们期待着贷款条件进一步放宽。

collins.def: You use expressions such as 'I bet', 'I'll bet', and 'you can bet' to indicate that you are sure something is true.

example.ex: I bet you were good at games when you were at school...
example.tran: 我敢说你上学时体育很棒。

example.ex: I bet you anything you like he's a pimp...
example.tran: 我敢打包票，他是个皮条客。

collins.tran: 十拿九稳的事；有望成功的行动；合适之选
collins.def: If you tell someone that something is a good bet, you are suggesting that it is the thing or course of action that they should choose.

example.ex: Textiles are a good bet for a country bent on industrialisation...
example.tran: 纺织业对于致力于工业化的国家来说是个比较稳妥的产业。

example.ex: Your best bet is to choose a guest house.
example.tran: 你最好选择一个小旅馆。

collins.tran: 极有可能属实（或发生）的事
collins.def: If you say that it is a good bet or a safe bet that something is true or will happen, you are saying that it is extremely likely to be true or to happen.

example.ex: It is a safe bet that the current owners will not sell.
example.tran: 十有八九现在的业主不会出售。

collins.def: If you hedge your bets, you follow two courses of action to avoid making a decision between two things because you cannot decide which one is right.

example.ex: NASA is hedging its bets and adopting both strategies.
example.tran: 美国航空航天局做了两手准备，两套策略双管齐下。

collins.tran: （通常感到恼火或好笑时表示同意或认为属实）那是，说的是，一点没错
collins.def: You use I bet or I'll bet in reply to a statement to show that you agree with it or that you expected it to be true, usually when you are annoyed or amused by it.

example.ex: 'I'd like to ask you something,' I said. — 'I bet you would,' she grinned.
example.tran: “我想问你点事，”我说。——“我就知道你要问，”她笑道。

collins.def: You can use my bet is or it's my bet to give your personal opinion about something, when you are fairly sure that you are right.

example.ex: My bet is that next year will be different...
example.tran: 我敢说明年不会这样。

example.ex: It's my bet that he's the guy behind this killing.
example.tran: 我认为他就是这起凶杀案的幕后主使。

collins.tran: 不要认为；别指望；不一定
collins.def: If you say don't bet on something or I wouldn't bet on something, you mean that you do not think that something is true or will happen.

example.ex: 'We'll never get a table in there' — 'Don't bet on it.'
example.tran: “我们在那儿是订不上座了。”——“那可不一定。”

collins.tran: （表示确信对方说的不对）敢打赌吗？
collins.def: If you reply 'Do you want to bet?' or 'Want a bet?' to someone, you mean you are certain that what they have said is wrong.

example.ex: 'Money can't buy happiness.' — 'Want to bet?'
example.tran: “金钱买不到幸福。”——“敢打赌吗？”

collins.def: You use 'You bet' or 'you bet your life' to say yes in an emphatic way or to emphasize a reply or statement.

example.ex: 'It's settled, then?' — 'You bet.'...
example.tran: “那么，就这么定了？”——“定了。”

example.ex: 'Are you afraid of snakes?' — 'You bet your life I'm afraid of snakes.'
example.tran: “你怕蛇吗？”——“这还用问，我当然怕啦。”

collins.def: If a sick person makes a recovery, he or she becomes well again.

example.ex: He made a remarkable recovery from a shin injury...
example.tran: 他的胫骨伤恢复得相当不错。

example.ex: He had been given less than a one in 500 chance of recovery by his doctors.
example.tran: 他的医生们认为他康复的几率不足1/500。

collins.def: When there is a recovery in a country's economy, it improves.

example.ex: Interest-rate cuts have failed to bring about economic recovery...
example.tran: 利率下调没有带来经济复苏。

example.ex: In many sectors of the economy the recovery has started.
example.tran: 许多经济领域已经开始复苏。

collins.def: You talk about the recovery of something when you get it back after it has been lost or stolen.

example.ex: A substantial reward is being offered for the recovery of a painting by Turner...
example.tran: 为追回特纳的一幅画，已发布了重金悬赏令。

example.ex: She has a reasonable prospect of recovery from the insurer.
example.tran: 她有望从保险公司拿到赔偿。

collins.def: You talk about the recovery of someone's physical or mental state when they return to this state.

example.ex: ...the abrupt loss and recovery of consciousness.
example.tran: 意识的突然丧失和恢复

collins.def: If someone is in recovery, they are being given a course of treatment to help them recover from something such as a drug habit or mental illness.

example.ex: ...Carole, a compulsive pot smoker and alcoholic in recovery.
example.tran: 卡萝尔，一位正在戒断康复当中的大麻吸食者和酗酒者

collins.def: A missile is a tube-shaped weapon that travels long distances through the air and explodes when it reaches its target.

example.ex: The authorities offered to stop firing missiles if the rebels agreed to stop attacking civilian targets.
example.tran: 当局表示，如果叛乱分子答应停止攻击平民目标，就不再发射导弹。

example.ex: ...nuclear missiles.
example.tran: 核弹

collins.tran: （作为武器的）投掷物，抛掷物，发射物
collins.def: Anything that is thrown as a weapon can be called a missile.

example.ex: The football supporters began throwing missiles, one of which hit the referee.
example.tran: 足球迷们开始扔东西，其中还砸到了裁判一次。

collins.def: If someone or something highlights a point or problem, they emphasize it or make you think about it.

example.ex: Last year Collins wrote a moving ballad which highlighted the plight of the homeless...
example.tran: 去年，柯林斯写了一首动人的抒情歌曲，突出描绘了无家可归者的苦境。

example.ex: Once again, the 'Free Press' prefers not to highlight these facts...
example.tran: “自由新闻”组织再次故意不去突出强调这些事实。

collins.tran: （用荧光笔）标出;（在计算机屏幕上）突出显示
collins.def: To highlight a piece of text means to mark it in a different colour, either with a special type of pen or on a computer screen.

example.ex: Highlight the chosen area by clicking and holding down the left mouse button.
example.tran: 点击并摁住鼠标左键将所选区域高亮显示。

example.ex: ...the relevant maps with the route highlighted in yellow.
example.tran: 用黄色荧光笔标出路线的相关地图

collins.tran: 最有趣（或最精彩、最重要）的部分
collins.def: The highlights of an event, activity, or period of time are the most interesting or exciting parts of it.

example.ex: ...a match that is likely to prove one of the highlights of the tournament...
example.tran: 可能是本次联赛中最精彩的比赛之一

example.ex: The highlight of my day used to be cooking Meg a meal when she came in from work...
example.tran: 过去，我一天中最有意思的事就是在梅格下班回到家时为她做顿饭。

collins.tran: 挑染的头发;（头发经阳光照射后产生强光效果的）浅色部分
collins.def: Highlights in a person's hair are narrow lighter areas made by dyeing or sunlight.
The hall in a house or flat is the area just inside the front door, into which some of the other rooms open.

example.ex: The lights were on in the hall and in the bedroom.
example.tran: 门厅和卧室的灯都亮着。

collins.def: A hall in a building is a long passage with doors into rooms on both sides of it.
A hall is a large room or building which is used for public events such as concerts, exhibitions, and meetings.

example.ex: Its 300 inhabitants will be celebrating with a dance in the village hall...
example.tran: 300名村民将在村礼堂举行一场舞会以示庆祝。

example.ex: We picked up our conference materials and filed into the lecture hall...
example.tran: 我们领了会议材料后鱼贯进入讲演厅。

collins.def: If students live in hall in British English, or in a hall in American English, they live in a university or college building called a hall of residence.

collins.tran: （乡间）大庄园，府第（用于住宅名称中）
collins.def: Hall is sometimes used as part of the name of a large house in the country.

example.ex: He died at Holly Hall, his wife's family home.
example.tran: 他在妻子的娘家冬青府去世。

collins.tran: 厅，会堂，礼堂（尤用于礼堂、音乐厅等名称中）
collins.def: Hall is sometimes used as part of the name of a large building, especially one where public events or concerts take place

example.ex: ...New York's Carnegie Hall.
example.tran: 纽约的卡内基音乐厅

collins.def: Jazz is a style of music that was invented by African American musicians in the early part of the twentieth century. Jazz music has very strong rhythms and often involves improvisation.

example.ex: The pub has live jazz on Sundays.
example.tran: 那家酒馆每周日都有现场爵士乐演奏。

example.ex: ...the great American jazz pianist George Shearing.
example.tran: 美国伟大的爵士乐钢琴演奏家乔治·希林
