collins.def: If something flexible whips in a particular way, it moves sharply when it is affected by a force, for example by the wind.

example.ex: Blond strands of hair whipped in the wind.
example.tran: 缕缕金发在风中飘扬。

collins.def: If someone whips something out or whips it off, they take it out or take it off very quickly and suddenly.

example.ex: Bob whipped out his notebook...
example.tran: 鲍勃迅速掏出他的笔记本。

example.ex: Players were whipping their shirts off...
example.tran: 运动员们在飞快地脱衬衫。

collins.def: If something or someone whips somewhere, they move there or go there very quickly.

example.ex: The wind out here is whipping along at about 30 miles an hour...
example.tran: 在这里，大风以每小时大约30英里的速度刮着。

example.ex: I whipped into a parking space.
example.tran: 我迅速地驶入一个停车位。

collins.def: When you whip something liquid such as cream or an egg, you stir it very fast until it is thick or stiff.

example.ex: Whip the cream until thick...
example.tran: 搅打奶油直到它变黏稠。

example.ex: Whip the eggs, oils and honey together.
example.tran: 把鸡蛋、油和蜂蜜搅打在一起。

collins.def: If you whip people into an emotional state, you deliberately cause and encourage them to be in that state.

example.ex: He could whip a crowd into hysteria...
example.tran: 他能让一群人变得歇斯底里。

example.ex: Politicians and businessmen have whipped themselves into a panic.
example.tran: 政治家和商人们把他们自己弄得十分恐慌。

collins.tran: 组织秘书，党鞭（维持党纪并督导该党议员出席议会重要议题的讨论和表决的人）
collins.def: A whip is a member of a political party in a parliament or legislature who is responsible for making sure that party members are present to vote on important issues and that they vote in the appropriate way.
If you have the whip hand, you have power over someone else in a particular situation.

example.ex: These days the shopper has the whip hand, and will not buy if stores fail to lower their prices.
example.tran: 如今购物者占主导地位，如果商店不降价，他们是不会买的。

collins.def: Fairly means to quite a large degree. For example, if you say that something is fairly old, you mean that it is old but not very old.

example.ex: Both ships are fairly new...
example.tran: 两艘船都还比较新。

example.ex: We did fairly well but only fairly well.
example.tran: 我们做得还过得去，但也仅仅是过得去而已。

collins.tran: (用在形容词和副词前，代替very,表示强调，但比 very 语气弱)有些，有点，还算
collins.def: You use fairly instead of  'very' to add emphasis to an adjective or adverb without making it sound too forceful.

example.ex: Were you always fairly bright at school?...
example.tran: 你在学校一直还算聪明吧？

example.ex: You've got to be fairly single-minded about it...
example.tran: 对这事你还得专心一点。

collins.tran: (表示强调)在很大程度上，简直
collins.def: Fairly is used to emphasize that something happens to a very great degree or extent.

example.ex: He fairly flew across the room...
example.tran: 他简直是飞过了房间。

example.ex: For him, the place is fairly boiling with humanity...
example.tran: 对他来说，这个地方充满了人情味。

collins.def: You use fairly to suggest that a statement is probably or possibly true, and therefore deserves to be accepted or considered.

example.ex: It can no doubt be fairly argued that Sir John, whose pay is linked to performance, is entitled to every penny...
example.tran: 毋庸置疑，既然约翰爵士的薪水是与业绩挂钩的，他的每一分钱都是理所应得的。

example.ex: After I had read the book I could fairly claim to be an expert.
example.tran: 读完这本书，我差不多可以说是专家了。

means: 令人高兴的，使人愉快的
充满欢乐的，兴高采烈的

collins.def: If you are glad about something, you are happy and pleased about it.

example.ex: I'm glad I relented in the end...
example.tran: 我很高兴自己的态度最终缓和了下来。

example.ex: The people seem genuinely glad to see you...
example.tran: 这些人见到你好像发自内心地感到喜悦。

collins.def: If you say that you will be glad to do something, usually for someone else, you mean that you are willing and eager to do it.

example.ex: I'll be glad to show you everything...
example.tran: 我将很乐意向你们展示一切。

example.ex: We should be glad to answer any questions.
example.tran: 我们愿意回答任何问题。

collins.def: Glad tidings means good news.

example.ex: ...the bringer of glad tidings.
example.tran: 报喜讯的人

collins.def: Suspicion or a suspicion is a belief or feeling that someone has committed a crime or done something wrong.

example.ex: There was a suspicion that this runner attempted to avoid the procedures for dope testing...
example.tran: 这名赛跑选手涉嫌有意逃避兴奋剂检验。

example.ex: The police said their suspicions were aroused because Mr Owens had other marks on his body...
example.tran: 警方说欧文斯先生尸体上的其他伤痕引起了他们的怀疑。

collins.def: If there is suspicion of someone or something, people do not trust them or consider them to be reliable.

example.ex: ...the traditional British suspicion of psychotherapy...
example.tran: 英国人传统上对心理疗法的猜忌

example.ex: He may have had some suspicions of Michael Foster, the editor of the journal...
example.tran: 他可能对杂志主编迈克尔·福斯特有些怀疑。

collins.def: A suspicion is a feeling that something is probably true or is likely to happen.

example.ex: I have a sneaking suspicion that they are going to succeed...
example.tran: 我隐约觉得他们将要成功了。

example.ex: Astronomers will have to collect more spectra from these stars to confirm their suspicions.
example.tran: 天文学家们必须要从这些恒星上采集更多的光谱来证实他们的推想。

collins.def: A suspicion of something is a very small amount of it.

example.ex: ...large blooms of white with a suspicion of pale pink.
example.tran: 一朵朵略带淡粉色的大白花

collins.def: If you reckon that something is true, you think that it is true.

example.ex: Toni reckoned that it must be about three o'clock...
example.tran: 托妮估计当时肯定是3点钟左右。

example.ex: He reckoned he was still fond of her.
example.tran: 他认为自己还喜欢着她。

collins.def: If you say that something is reckoned to be true, you mean that people think that it is true.

example.ex: The sale has been held up because the price is reckoned to be too high.
example.tran: 销售陷入停滞，因为大家认为价格太高了。

collins.def: If you say that someone reckons to do something, you mean that they expect to do it.

example.ex: The merged banks reckon to raise 4 billion dollars of new equity next year...
example.tran: 几家银行合并后明年有望增发40亿美元的新股。

example.ex: Police officers on the case are reckoning to charge someone very shortly.
example.tran: 调查这个案子的警官正在考虑尽快起诉嫌疑人。

collins.def: If something is reckoned to be a particular figure, it is calculated to be roughly that amount.

example.ex: The star's surface temperature is reckoned to be minus 75 degrees Celsius...
example.tran: 这颗恒星的表面温度估计在零下75摄氏度左右。

example.ex: There was a proportion of research, which I reckoned at not more than 30 percent, that was basic research.
example.tran: 我估计基础研究的比例最多只占30％。

means: 给人印象深刻的，感人的

collins.tran: 给人深刻印象的;不俗的;了不起的
collins.def: Something that is impressive impresses you, for example because it is great in size or degree, or is done with a great deal of skill.

example.ex: It is an impressive achievement...
example.tran: 那是一项了不起的成就。

example.ex: The film's special effects are particularly impressive.
example.tran: 那部电影的特技效果尤其令人赞叹。

collins.def: Someone's girlfriend is a girl or woman with whom they are having a romantic or sexual relationship.

example.ex: He had been going out with his girlfriend for seven months...
example.tran: 他同女朋友已经交往7个月了。

example.ex: Has he got a girlfriend?
example.tran: 他有女朋友吗？

collins.def: A girlfriend is a female friend.

example.ex: I met a girlfriend for lunch.
example.tran: 我同一位女友共进了午餐。

collins.def: Something that is extensive covers or includes a large physical area.

example.ex: ...an extensive tour of Latin America...
example.tran: 在拉丁美洲广泛游历

example.ex: When built, the palace and its grounds were more extensive than the city itself.
example.tran: 建成时，宫殿及其庭园比城市本身面积还要大。

collins.tran: 广泛的;全面的;包罗万象的
collins.def: Something that is extensive covers a wide range of details, ideas, or items.

example.ex: Developments in South Africa receive extensive coverage in The Sunday Telegraph...
example.tran: 《星期日电讯报》全面报道了南非的发展。

example.ex: ...the extensive research into public attitudes to science...
example.tran: 针对公众科学观的广泛调查

collins.def: If something is extensive, it is very great.

example.ex: The blast caused extensive damage, shattering the ground-floor windows...
example.tran: 爆炸造成了巨大的破坏，震碎了一楼的窗户。

example.ex: The security forces have extensive powers of search and arrest...
example.tran: 安全部队拥有搜查和逮捕的至高权力。

collins.tran: 友善的;友好的;好相处的
collins.def: If someone is friendly, they behave in a pleasant, kind way, and like to be with other people.

example.ex: Godfrey had been friendly to me.
example.tran: 戈弗雷一度对我很友善。

example.ex: ...a man with a pleasant, friendly face...
example.tran: 面容和蔼可亲的男子

collins.def: If you are friendly with someone, you like each other and enjoy spending time together.

example.ex: I'm friendly with his mother...
example.tran: 我和他母亲很要好。

example.ex: Asmus became friendly with a number of writers and appeared in print as a literary critic.
example.tran: 阿斯穆斯和许多作家成为了好友，而且还作为一名文学评论家出现在报纸上。

collins.def: You can describe another country or their government as friendly when they have good relations with your own country rather than being an enemy.

example.ex: ...a worsening in relations between the two previously friendly countries.
example.tran: 这两个曾经友好的国家之间关系的恶化

collins.def: In sport, a friendly is a match which is not part of a competition, and is played for entertainment or practice, often without any serious effort to win.

example.ex: Athletic Bilbao agreed to play a friendly at Real Sociedad.
example.tran: 毕尔巴鄂竞技队同意在皇家社会队主场打一场友谊赛。

collins.tran: 令人愉快的；舒适的；合意的
collins.def: Something that is pleasant is nice, enjoyable, or attractive.

example.ex: I've got a pleasant little apartment...
example.tran: 我有一套舒适的小公寓。

example.ex: It's always pleasant to do what you're good at doing.
example.tran: 做自己擅长的事总是令人愉快的。

collins.tran: 友好的；可亲的；讨人喜欢的
collins.def: Someone who is pleasant is friendly and likeable.

example.ex: The woman had a pleasant face...
example.tran: 这位女士面相和善。

example.ex: Lloyd George was most anxious to be agreeable and pleasant.
example.tran: 劳埃德·乔治极力想表现得平易近人、和蔼亲切。

collins.def: Someone who is cautious acts very carefully in order to avoid possible danger.

example.ex: The scientists are cautious about using enzyme therapy on humans...
example.tran: 科学家们对在人身上使用酶疗法非常慎重。

example.ex: He is a very cautious man.
example.tran: 他做事很谨慎。

collins.def: If you describe someone's attitude or reaction as cautious, you mean that it is limited or careful.

example.ex: He has been seen as a champion of a more cautious approach to economic reform.
example.tran: 人们一直将他视为主张更为谨慎的经济改革措施的提倡者。

collins.def: When a person or vehicle arrives at a place, you can refer to their arrival .

example.ex: ...the day after his arrival in England...
example.tran: 他到英格兰的第二天

example.ex: He was dead on arrival at the nearby hospital.
example.tran: 到达附近的医院时他已经死亡。

collins.def: When someone starts a new job, you can refer to their arrival in that job.

example.ex: ...the power vacuum created by the arrival of a new president...
example.tran: 新主席接任造成的权力真空

example.ex: The company had eight departures and 11 new arrivals on its management board in 1980-1989.
example.tran: 在1980至1989年间，公司管理委员会离职8人，新吸收11人。

collins.def: When something is brought to you or becomes available, you can refer to its arrival .

example.ex: I was flicking idly through a newspaper while awaiting the arrival of orange juice and coffee...
example.tran: 我一边无所事事地翻着报纸，一边等着我点的橙汁和咖啡。

example.ex: The coronation broadcast marked the arrival of television.
example.tran: 加冕典礼的转播标志着电视时代的到来。

collins.tran: （某一时间的）到来；（某一事件的）发生
collins.def: When a particular time comes or a particular event happens, you can refer to its arrival.

example.ex: He celebrated the arrival of the New Year with a party for his friends.
example.tran: 他为朋友们举行了一个聚会，庆祝新年的到来。

collins.def: You can refer to someone who has just arrived at a place as a new arrival .

example.ex: A high proportion of the new arrivals are skilled professionals...
example.tran: 新来的人中很大一部分是技术熟练的专业人士。

example.ex: He was the most junior and most recent arrival at the embassy.
example.tran: 在大使馆里，他是职位最低也是入职最晚的一位。

collins.def: When a baby is born, you can refer to its arrival.

example.ex: ...a couple anticipating the arrival of a new child.
example.tran: 盼望着孩子出生的一对夫妇

collins.def: You can refer to a baby who has just been born as a new arrival .

example.ex: Her father was besotted with the new arrival.
example.tran: 她的父亲完全沉浸在新生儿带来的喜悦中。

collins.def: If people or animals are alive, they are not dead.

example.ex: She does not know if he is alive or dead...
example.tran: 她不知道他是生是死。

example.ex: They kept her alive on a life support machine.
example.tran: 他们用呼吸机维持她的生命。

collins.def: If you say that someone seems alive, you mean that they seem to be very lively and to enjoy everything that they do.

example.ex: Our relationship made me feel more alive...
example.tran: 我们的关系使我感到更有活力。

example.ex: I never expected to feel so alive in my life again.
example.tran: 我怎么也没想到自己会再一次这样活力焕发。

collins.tran: 继续存在的;在起作用的
collins.def: If an activity, organization, or situation is alive, it continues to exist or function.

example.ex: The big factories are trying to stay alive by cutting costs...
example.tran: 大型工厂正试图通过削减成本以维持生存。

example.ex: Both communities have a tradition of keeping history alive.
example.tran: 两个团体都有延续历史的传统。

collins.def: If a place is alive with something, there are a lot of people or things there and it seems busy or exciting.

example.ex: The river was alive with birds...
example.tran: 沿河活跃着各种鸟类。

example.ex: The street was alive with the sounds of the soldiers.
example.tran: 这条街道上到处都是士兵的声音。

collins.tran: 注意到的；意识到的；觉察到的
collins.def: If you are alive to a situation or problem, you are aware of it and realize how important it is.

example.ex: You must be alive to op-portunity!...
example.tran: 你必须注意机会！

example.ex: He was alive to what he was doing.
example.tran: 他很清楚他在做什么。

collins.def: If people, places, or events come alive, they start to be lively again after a quiet period. If someone or something brings them alive, they cause them to come alive.

example.ex: The doctor's voice had come alive and his small eyes shone.
example.tran: 医生的嗓音恢复了活力，两只小眼睛也有了神采。

example.ex: ...the songs of birds that bring the garden alive.
example.tran: 使花园恢复了生机的小鸟的鸣啭

collins.tran: （使）变得生动；（使）变得有趣；（使）显得逼真
collins.def: If a story or description comes alive, it becomes interesting, lively, or realistic. If someone or something brings it alive, they make it seem more interesting, lively, or realistic.

example.ex: She made history come alive with tales from her own memories...
example.tran: 通过讲述自己记忆中的故事，她把逝去的岁月变得生动起来。

example.ex: From here on he brings the character confidently alive.
example.tran: 从这里开始他真正将这个角色演活了。

collins.tran: 将被生吞活剥；将被彻底打败
collins.def: If you say that someone will be eaten alive, you mean that they will be completely destroyed or defeated by someone who is much stronger.

example.ex: He was certain Sid would be eaten alive by the hardened criminals in the jail.
example.tran: 他确信锡德在监狱中肯定会被那些怙恶不悛的罪犯们扒掉一层皮。

collins.tran: 活蹦乱跳的；健壮的；活跃的
collins.def: If you say that someone or something is alive and kicking, you are emphasizing not only that they continue to survive, but also that they are very active.

example.ex: ...worries that the secret police may still be alive and kicking.
example.tran: 担心秘密警察可能依旧在四处活动

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is alive and well, you are emphasizing that they continue to survive.

example.ex: A man who went missing yesterday during a blizzard has been found alive and well.
example.tran: 昨天在暴风雪中失踪的一名男子已经被找到，人安然无恙。

means: 圣歌（尤指美国南部黑人的）

collins.def: Spiritual means relating to people's thoughts and beliefs, rather than to their bodies and physical surroundings.

example.ex: She lived entirely by spiritual values, in a world of poetry and imagination.
example.tran: 她追求精神上的满足，完全生活在一个诗歌和想象的世界里。

collins.tran: 宗教(上)的；宗教信仰(上)的
collins.def: Spiritual means relating to people's  religious beliefs.

example.ex: The spiritual leader of Ireland's 3.7 million Catholics...
example.tran: 爱尔兰 370 万天主教徒的宗教领袖

example.ex: A man in priestly clothes offered spiritual guidance.
example.tran: 一位身着牧师袍服的男子进行了宗教布道。

collins.tran: 灵歌(原为美国黑奴所唱的一种宗教歌曲)
collins.def: A spiritual is a religious song of  the type originally sung by black slaves in America.
Your spiritual home is the place where you feel that you belong, usually because your ideas or attitudes are the same as those of the people who live there.
If you seize something, you take hold of it quickly, firmly, and forcefully.

example.ex: 'Leigh,' he said seizing my arm to hold me back.
example.tran: “莉，”他说着一把抓住我的胳膊把我拉了回来。

example.ex: ...an otter seizing a fish.
example.tran: 捉到了一条鱼的水獭

collins.tran: (通过暴力突然迅速地)夺取，攻占，控制
collins.def: When a group of people seize a place or seize control of it, they take control of it quickly and suddenly, using force.

example.ex: Troops have seized the airport and railroad terminals...
example.tran: 军队已控制了机场和火车站。

example.ex: Army officers plotted a failed attempt yesterday to seize power.
example.tran: 军官们昨天夺权未遂。

collins.tran: (通常指通过武力)起获，没收，扣押
collins.def: If a government or other authority seize someone's property, they take it from them, often by force.

example.ex: Police were reported to have seized all copies of this morning's edition of the newspaper...
example.tran: 据说警方已经将该报纸今天的早间版全部没收。

example.ex: Bailiffs need a certificate from the county court to seize goods for rent arrears.
example.tran: 查封官需要有郡法院的证明才能没收货物以抵欠租。

collins.def: When someone is seized, they are arrested or captured.

example.ex: UN officials say two military observers were seized by the Khmer Rouge yesterday...
example.tran: 联合国官员称昨天有两名军事观察员被红色高棉逮捕。

example.ex: Men carrying sub-machine guns seized the five soldiers and drove them away.
example.tran: 持冲锋枪的几名男子俘虏了 5 名士兵并开车将他们带走。

collins.def: When you seize an opportunity, you take advantage of it and do something that you want to do.

example.ex: During the riots hundreds of people seized the opportunity to steal property...
example.tran: 在暴乱中成百上千的人纷纷趁机偷窃财物。

example.ex: The government now hopes to seize the initiative on education.
example.tran: 如今政府希望抓住教育上的主动权。

collins.def: The sky is the space around the earth which you can see when you stand outside and look upwards.

example.ex: The sun is already high in the sky.
example.tran: 已经日上三竿。

example.ex: ...warm sunshine and clear blue skies...
example.tran: 温暖的阳光和蔚蓝的晴空

collins.def: If something is done badly or goes badly, it is not very successful or effective.

example.ex: I was angry because I played so badly...
example.tran: 我很生气，因为自己的表现实在是太差了。

example.ex: The whole project was badly managed...
example.tran: 整个项目管理不善。

collins.def: If someone or something is badly hurt or badly affected, they are severely hurt or affected.

example.ex: The bomb destroyed a police station and badly damaged a church...
example.tran: 炸弹摧毁了一处警察局，并使一座教堂严重受损。

example.ex: One man was killed and another badly injured...
example.tran: 一人死亡，一人重伤。

collins.def: If you want or need something badly, you want or need it very much.

example.ex: Why do you want to go so badly?...
example.tran: 为什么你这么想走？

example.ex: Planes landed at Bagram airport today carrying badly needed food and medicine.
example.tran: 运载急需食物和药品的飞机今天在巴格拉姆机场降落。

collins.tran: 不友好地；令人不快地；恶劣地
collins.def: If someone behaves badly or treats other people badly, they act in an unkind, unpleasant, or unacceptable way.

example.ex: They have both behaved very badly and I am very hurt...
example.tran: 他们俩都很不友善，让我非常难过。

example.ex: I would like to know why we pensioners are being so badly treated.
example.tran: 我想知道为什么我们这些领养老金的人受到如此恶劣的对待。

collins.tran: 不利地；负面地；有损名声地
collins.def: If something reflects badly on someone or makes others think badly of them, it harms their reputation.

example.ex: Teachers know that low exam results will reflect badly on them...
example.tran: 老师知道考试成绩不好将对他们不利。

example.ex: The male sex comes out of the film very badly...
example.tran: 这部影片中男性的形象非常负面。

collins.def: If a person or their job is badly paid, they are not paid very much for what they do.

example.ex: You may have to work part-time, in a badly paid job with unsociable hours...
example.tran: 你或许只能做个薪水低、非正常工作时间上班的兼职。

example.ex: This is the most dangerous professional sport there is, and the worst paid.
example.tran: 这是最危险的职业体育运动，但报酬却是最低的。

means: 均匀厚度的片状硬物体

collins.def: A plate is a round or oval flat dish that is used to hold food.

example.ex: Anita pushed her plate away; she had eaten virtually nothing.
example.tran: 安妮塔把自己的盘子推开;她几乎什么都没吃。

collins.tran: （尤指用于机械或建筑上金属制的）平板，薄板
collins.def: A plate is a flat piece of metal, especially on machinery or a building.

collins.tran: （通常置于办公室或住宅门边上的）金属姓名牌
collins.def: A plate is a small, flat piece of metal with someone's name written on it, which you usually find beside the front door of an office or house.
On a road vehicle, the plates are the panels at the front and back which display the license number in the United States, and the registration number in Britain.

example.ex: ...dusty-looking cars with New Jersey plates.
example.tran: 落满灰尘、挂着新泽西州牌照的汽车

collins.def: Plate is dishes, bowls, and cups that are made of precious metal, especially silver or gold.

example.ex: ...gold and silver plate, jewellery, and roomfuls of antique furniture.
example.tran: 金银餐具、珠宝，还有整屋整屋的古董家具

collins.def: In printing, a plate is a sheet of metal which is carved or specially treated with chemicals so that it can be used to print text or pictures.
In photography, a plate is a thin sheet of glass that is covered with a layer of chemicals which react to the light and on which an image can be formed.
A plate in a book is a picture or photograph which takes up a whole page and is usually printed on better quality paper than the rest of the book.

example.ex: Fermor's book has 55 colour plates.
example.tran: 弗莫尔的书里有55页整版彩色插图。

collins.tran: （显微镜下的长方形）载物片，玻璃片
collins.def: In a microscope, the plate is a small rectangular piece of glass onto which you put a small amount of the substance that you want to look at. You then slide the plate under the microscope to look at the substance.
A dental plate is a piece of plastic which is shaped to fit inside a person's mouth and which a set of false teeth is attached to.
In geology, a plate is a large piece of the earth's surface, perhaps as large as a continent, which moves very slowly.

example.ex: The United States Geological Survey has revealed that the earthquake was not caused by a simple horizontal movement of one plate past another.
example.tran: 美国地质调查局揭示了此次地震并非由大陆板块间简单的水平交错运动所引起。

collins.tran: （棒球运动中）the plate 同 home plate
collins.def: In baseball, the plate is the same as the home plate.

collins.tran: 有很多工作要做；有很多事要处理
collins.def: If you have enough on your plate or have a lot on your plate, you have a lot of work to do or a lot of things to deal with.

example.ex: We have enough on our plate. There is plenty of work to be done on what we have.
example.tran: 我们有很多工作要做。仅是手头现有的事情就已经有的忙了。

collins.def: If you say that someone has things handed to them on a plate, you disapprove of them because they get good things easily.

example.ex: Even the presidency was handed to him on a plate.
example.tran: 他甚至连总统之位都是得来全不费工夫。

means: 在旁边，在一边，到旁边，到一边

collins.def: If you move something aside, you move it to one side of you.

example.ex: Sarah closed the book and laid it aside.
example.tran: 萨拉合上书，把它放在了一边。

collins.def: If you take or draw someone aside, you take them a little way away from a group of people in order to talk to them in private.

example.ex: Billy Ewing grabbed him by the elbow and took him aside...
example.tran: 比利·尤因拉着他的胳膊肘把他带到了一边。

example.ex: Will put his arm around her shoulders and drew her aside.
example.tran: 威尔一只胳膊搂着她的肩膀，把她拉到了一边。

collins.def: If you move aside, you get out of someone's way.

example.ex: She had been standing in the doorway, but now she stepped aside to let them pass.
example.tran: 她一直在门口站着，但是现在闪到了一边，让他们过去了。

collins.def: If you set something such as time, money, or space aside for a particular purpose, you save it and do not use it for anything else.

example.ex: She wants to put her pocket-money aside for holidays.
example.tran: 她想把零花钱攒起来用于度假。

example.ex: ...the ground set aside for the new cathedral.
example.tran: 为建新的大教堂留出的空地

collins.def: If you brush or sweep aside a feeling or suggestion, you reject it.

example.ex: Talk to a friend who will really listen and not brush aside your feelings...
example.tran: 和一个能真正倾听你诉说并重视你感受的朋友谈谈。

example.ex: The Prime Minister swept aside concern about the rising cost of mortgages.
example.tran: 首相对按揭费用上涨的忧虑置之不理。

collins.def: You use aside to indicate that you have finished talking about something, or that you are leaving it out of your discussion, and that you are about to talk about something else.

example.ex: Leaving aside the tiny minority who are clinically depressed, most people who have bad moods also have very good moods...
example.tran: 撇开极少数临床抑郁症患者不谈，大多数情绪低落的人也有心情非常愉快的时候。

example.ex: Emotional arguments aside, here are the facts.
example.tran: 撇开那些情绪化的争论不谈，下面只说客观事实。

collins.def: An aside is a comment that a character in a play makes to the audience, which the other characters are supposed not to be able to hear.

example.ex: Exasperated with her children, she rolls her eyes and mutters an aside to the camera, 'No wonder I drink!'
example.tran: 在被她的孩子们激怒后，她翻了一下白眼对着镜头嘀咕道，“难怪我会酗酒！”

collins.def: An aside is something that you say that is not directly connected with what you are talking about.

example.ex: The pace of the book is leisurely, with enjoyable literary and historical asides.
example.tran: 这本书节奏明快，另外还穿插了一些趣味盎然的文史掌故。

collins.def: If you stare at someone or something, you look at them for a long time.

example.ex: Tamara stared at him in disbelief, shaking her head...
example.tran: 塔玛拉一边狐疑地盯着他看，一边摇着头。

example.ex: Ben continued to stare out the window...
example.tran: 本一直凝视着窗外。

collins.tran: (局势、解决办法等)非常明显的，明摆在眼前
collins.def: If a situation or the answer to a problem is staring you in the face, it is very obvious, although you may not be immediately aware of it.

example.ex: Then the answer hit me. It had been staring me in the face ever since Lullington.
example.tran: 接着我突然想到了答案。从在路林顿起它就一直摆在我的眼前。

collins.def: If you have something on your lap when you are sitting down, it is on top of your legs and near to your body.

example.ex: She waited quietly with her hands in her lap...
example.tran: 她双手放在腿上静静等候。

example.ex: Hugh glanced at the child on her mother's lap.
example.tran: 休瞥了一眼坐在她妈妈膝上的小女孩。

collins.def: In a race, a competitor completes a lap when they have gone round a course once.

example.ex: ...that last lap of the race...
example.tran: 比赛最后一圈

example.ex: On lap two, Baker edged forward.
example.tran: 第二圈时，贝克悄然赶了上去。

collins.def: In a race, if you lap another competitor, you go past them while they are still on the previous lap.

example.ex: He was caught out while lapping a slower rider.
example.tran: 他在套圈超越一位落后的车手时出了错。

collins.def: A lap of a long journey is one part of it, between two points where you stop.

example.ex: I had thought we might travel as far as Oak Valley, but we only managed the first lap of the journey.
example.tran: 我原以为我们最远能到达橡树谷，结果只走完了第一段路程。

collins.def: When water laps against something such as the shore or the side of a boat, it touches it gently and makes a soft sound.

example.ex: ...the water that lapped against the pillars of the boathouse...
example.tran: 轻拍着船屋支柱的海水

example.ex: With a rising tide the water was lapping at his chin before rescuers arrived...
example.tran: 救援人员到达时上涨的潮水已经淹到了他的下巴。

collins.def: When an animal laps a drink, it uses short quick movements of its tongue to take liquid up into its mouth.

example.ex: The cat lapped milk from a dish.
example.tran: 猫舔食盘中牛奶。

collins.tran: （成败）难以预料，非人力所能左右
collins.def: If you say that a situation is in the lap of the gods, you mean that its success or failure depends entirely on luck or on things that are outside your control.

example.ex: They had to stop the operation, so at that stage my life was in the lap of the gods.
example.tran: 他们不得不停止手术，所以那时的我只能听天由命。

collins.def: If you say that someone lives in the lap of luxury, you mean that they live in conditions of great comfort and wealth.

example.ex: We don't live in the lap of luxury, but we're comfortable.
example.tran: 我们的生活虽然并非锦衣玉食，也算是衣食无忧。

collins.def: If someone or something convinces you of something, they make you believe that it is true or that it exists.

example.ex: Although I soon convinced him of my innocence, I think he still has serious doubts about my sanity...
example.tran: 虽然我很快便让他相信我是清白的，但是我想他仍然非常怀疑我是否神志正常。

example.ex: The waste disposal industry is finding it difficult to convince the public that its operations are safe.
example.tran: 废物处理行业发现很难让公众相信其操作是安全的。

collins.def: If someone or something convinces you to do something, they persuade you to do it.

example.ex: That weekend in Plattsburgh, he convinced her to go ahead and marry Bud.
example.tran: 在普拉茨堡的那个周末，他说服她嫁给巴德。

collins.def: You use mostly to indicate that a statement is generally true, for example true about the majority of a group of things or people, true most of the time, or true in most respects.

example.ex: I am working with mostly highly motivated people...
example.tran: 和我共事的人大多积极性极高。

example.ex: Cars are mostly metal.
example.tran: 轿车的大部分部件是金属制造的。

collins.def: An anniversary is a date which is remembered or celebrated because a special event happened on that date in a previous year.

example.ex: ...the one hundredth anniversary of the birth of Ho Chi Minh.
example.tran: 胡志明诞辰一百周年纪念

collins.def: If you proceed to do something, you do it, often after doing something else first.

example.ex: He proceeded to tell me of my birth...
example.tran: 他接着给我讲我出生的事。

example.ex: He asked for ice for his whiskey and proceeded to get contentedly drunk.
example.tran: 他要求在威士忌里加冰，接着心满意足地喝了个酩酊大醉。

collins.def: If you proceed with a course of action, you continue with it.

example.ex: The group proceeded with a march they knew would lead to bloodshed...
example.tran: 这个团体继续示威游行，他们知道这将导致流血事件的发生。

example.ex: The trial has been delayed until November because the defence is not ready to proceed.
example.tran: 因为被告方没有做好应诉的准备，审判已经被延期至11月份。

collins.tran: （活动、过程或事件）继续，持续，连续不断
collins.def: If an activity, process, or event proceeds, it goes on and does not stop.

example.ex: The ideas were not new. Their development had proceeded steadily since the war...
example.tran: 这些并不是什么新思想，自从战争开始就一直稳定地发展演变。

example.ex: Efforts to reform the Interior Ministry  have not yet proceeded very far.
example.tran: 对内政部进行改革的尝试还没有取得很大进展。

collins.def: If you proceed in a particular direction, you go in that direction.

example.ex: She climbed the steps and proceeded along the upstairs hallway...
example.tran: 她爬上楼梯，顺着楼上的走廊走去。

example.ex: The freighter was allowed to proceed after satisfying them that it was not breaking sanctions.
example.tran: 在确认没有违反制裁条例后，货船被放行了。

collins.tran: （某个事件或活动的）收入，收益
collins.def: The proceeds of an event or activity are the money that has been obtained from it.

example.ex: The proceeds of the arms sales were then funneled to Contra fighters in Central America...
example.tran: 出售武器所得的收入随后用来支持了中美洲的反政府武装组织。

example.ex: The proceeds from the concert will go towards famine relief.
example.tran: 音乐会的收入将用于救助饥荒。

collins.def: A forecast is a statement of what is expected to happen in the future, especially in relation to a particular event or situation.

example.ex: ...a forecast of a 2.25 per cent growth in the economy...
example.tran: 经济增长 2.25% 的预测

example.ex: He delivered his election forecast...
example.tran: 他公布了自己对选举的预测。

collins.def: If you forecast future events, you say what you think is going to happen in the future.

example.ex: They forecast a humiliating defeat for the Prime Minister...
example.tran: 他们预言首相将遭遇惨败。

example.ex: He forecasts that average salary increases will remain around 4 per cent.
example.tran: 他预测平均工资增幅将保持在 4%左右。

collins.tran: 逆转，彻底改变（决定、政策、趋势等）
collins.def: When someone or something reverses a decision, policy, or trend, they change it to the opposite decision, policy, or trend.

example.ex: They have made it clear they will not reverse the decision to increase prices...
example.tran: 他们已经明确表示不会更改提价的决定。

example.ex: The rise, the first in 10 months, reversed the downward trend in Belgium's jobless rate.
example.tran: 10个月来失业率的首次上升逆转了比利时失业率持续下降的趋势。

collins.def: If you reverse the order of a set of things, you arrange them in the opposite order, so that the first thing comes last.

example.ex: In the squares place a penny, nickel, dime and quarter in that order. The object is to reverse the order of these coins...
example.tran: 在这些方块中按顺序放置1分、5分、10分和25分的硬币各一枚。目标是颠倒这些硬币的顺序。

example.ex: The normal word order is reversed in passive sentences.
example.tran: 正常词序在被动句中是颠倒的。

collins.def: If you reverse the positions or functions of two things, you change them so that each thing has the position or function that the other one had.

example.ex: He reversed the position of the two stamps.
example.tran: 他将两枚邮票的位置调换了一下。

collins.def: When a car reverses or when you reverse it, the car is driven backwards.

example.ex: Another car reversed out of the drive...
example.tran: 另一辆车倒出了车道。

example.ex: He reversed and drove away...
example.tran: 他把车倒出来，开走了。

collins.def: If your car is in reverse, you have changed gear so that you can drive it backwards.

example.ex: He lurched the car in reverse along the ruts to the access road.
example.tran: 他顺着车辙摇摇晃晃地将车倒到了支路上。

collins.def: Reverse means opposite to what you expect or to what has just been described.

example.ex: The wrong attitude will have exactly the reverse effect.
example.tran: 错误的态度会产生完全相反的效果。

collins.def: If you say that one thing is the reverse of another, you are emphasizing that the first thing is the complete opposite of the second thing.

example.ex: There is absolutely no evidence at all that spectators want longer cricket matches. Quite the reverse...
example.tran: 完全没有证据表明观众想看时间更长的板球比赛。情况恰恰相反。

example.ex: This would lead one to expect a fat, dense and detailed autobiography. The reverse is true. The book is short and spare.
example.tran: 这会让人以为是一本内容晦涩而详尽的大部头自传。但正好相反，这本书简短明了。

collins.def: A reverse is a serious failure or defeat.

example.ex: It's clear that the party of the former Prime Minister has suffered a major reverse.
example.tran: 显然，前首相所在党派遭受了重大的挫折。

collins.def: The reverse or the reverse side of a flat object which has two sides is the less important or the other side.

example.ex: Cheques should be made payable to Country Living and your address written on the reverse.
example.tran: 支票抬头必须写“《乡村生活》杂志”，你的地址应写在背面。

collins.def: If something happens in reverse or goes into reverse, things happen in the opposite way to what usually happens or to what has been happening.

example.ex: Amis tells the story in reverse, from the moment the man dies...
example.tran: 埃米斯以倒叙的方式讲述了这个故事，从这个男人死去的时候开始讲起。

example.ex: The downward trend went into reverse and the scores started to creep up again.
example.tran: 比分下降的趋势发生逆转，分数又开始逐渐上升了。

collins.def: If you reverse the charges when you make a telephone call, the person who you are phoning pays the cost of the call and not you.

means: 出名的，众所周知的，熟悉的

collins.tran: 众所周知的;著名的;出名的
collins.def: A well-known person or thing is known about by a lot of people and is therefore famous or familiar. If someone is well-known for a particular activity, a lot of people know about them because of their involvement with that activity.

example.ex: He surrounds himself with attractive, intelligent, or well-known people...
example.tran: 他混迹于有魅力、有学问或有名气的人当中。

example.ex: He is well-known to the local police...
example.tran: 当地警察都知道他。

collins.def: A well-known fact is a fact that is known by people in general.

example.ex: It may be a well-known fact, but I didn't know it...
example.tran: 这可能是人所共知的事实，但我却不知道。

example.ex: It is well known that bamboo shoots are a panda's staple diet.
example.tran: 竹笋是熊猫的主要食物，这是人所共知的。

means: 搂着脖子亲吻，相拥互吻

collins.def: Your neck is the part of your body which joins your head to the rest of your body.

example.ex: She threw her arms round his neck and hugged him warmly...
example.tran: 她伸出双臂搂住他的脖子，热情地拥抱他。

example.ex: He was short and stocky, and had a thick neck.
example.tran: 他矮壮结实，脖子很粗。

collins.def: The neck of an article of clothing such as a shirt, dress, or sweater is the part which surrounds your neck.

example.ex: ...the low, ruffled neck of her blouse...
example.tran: 她的打褶低胸的衬衫领口

example.ex: He wore a blue shirt open at the neck.
example.tran: 他穿了件蓝衬衫，领口敞开着。

collins.tran: (瓶子、吉他等的)颈状部位，细长部分，颈部
collins.def: The neck of something such as a bottle or a guitar is the long narrow part at one end of it.

example.ex: Catherine gripped the broken neck of the bottle.
example.tran: 凯瑟琳紧握着破裂的瓶颈。

example.ex: ...cancer of the neck of the womb.
example.tran: 宫颈癌

collins.tran: 搂着脖子亲吻;相拥而吻
collins.def: If two people are necking, they are kissing each other in a sexual way.

example.ex: They sat talking and necking in the car for another ten minutes...
example.tran: 他们在车里又坐了10分钟，边说边搂着亲热。

example.ex: I found myself behind a curtain, necking with my best friend's wife.
example.tran: 我意识到自己在帘子后面吻着至友的妻子。

collins.def: If a horse wins a race by a neck, it wins by a very small distance.

example.ex: Cee En Cee went on to win by a neck from Leigh Crofter.
example.tran: 西恩西再次以微弱优势战胜莉·克罗夫特。

collins.def: If you say that someone is breathing down your neck, you mean that they are watching you very closely and checking everything you do.

example.ex: Most farmers have bank managers breathing down their necks.
example.tran: 大部分农场主的一举一动都受到银行经理们的密切关注。

collins.tran: (尤指选举中)并驾齐驱，难分高低
collins.def: In a competition, especially an election, if two or more competitors are neck and neck, they are level with each other and have an equal chance of winning.

example.ex: The latest polls indicate that the two main parties are neck and neck...
example.tran: 最近的一次民意测验显示两个主要政党难分高下。

example.ex: The party is running neck-and-neck with Labour.
example.tran: 该党和工党目前是旗鼓相当。

collins.def: If you say that someone is risking their neck, you mean they are doing something very dangerous, often in order to achieve something.

example.ex: I won't have him risking his neck on that motorcycle.
example.tran: 我不会让他冒险骑那辆摩托车。

collins.tran: 保全(某人的工作或声誉)
collins.def: To save someone's neck means to prevent them from losing their job or harming their reputation.

example.ex: He had enough friends in the right places to save his neck and cover up for him...
example.tran: 他有很多朋友能保全他，帮他打掩护。

example.ex: He said the President was making a last ditch attempt to save his own neck.
example.tran: 他说总统正在作最后的努力，希望保住自己的声誉。

collins.def: If you stick your neck out, you bravely say or do something that might be criticized or might turn out to be wrong.

example.ex: During my political life I've earned myself a reputation as someone who'll stick his neck out, a bit of a rebel.
example.tran: 我在政治生涯中敢冒风险、有点叛逆是小有名气的。

collins.def: If you say that you have something round your neck or around your neck, you mean that it is your responsibility and it causes you a lot of worry.

example.ex: No-one should start working life with a debt round their neck...
example.tran: 任何人都不该身背债务开始工作生涯。

example.ex: It's a legacy which will hang around the country's neck for some time to come.
example.tran: 这项遗留问题在未来的一段时间内仍将困扰这个国家。

collins.tran: 深深陷入，被卷入(麻烦、罪行等)
collins.def: If you say that someone is in some sort of trouble or criminal activity up to their neck, you mean that they are deeply involved in it.

example.ex: The black market was flourishing, everybody was corrupt, in it up to their necks...
example.tran: 黑市繁荣，每个人都已堕落，深陷其中。

example.ex: He is probably up to his neck in debt.
example.tran: 他很有可能债务缠身。

collins.def: Someone or something that is from your neck of the woods is from the same part of the country as you are.

example.ex: It's so good to see you. What brings you to this neck of the woods?
example.tran: 见到你真高兴，哪阵风把你吹来了？

collins.def: A bike is a bicycle or a motorcycle.

collins.tran: 骑自行车（或摩托车）去（某处）
collins.def: To bike somewhere means to go there on a bicycle.

example.ex: I biked home from the beach.
example.tran: 我从海边骑自行车回家。

collins.def: If you cycle, you ride a bicycle.

example.ex: He cycled to Ingwold...
example.tran: 他骑车去英格伍德。

example.ex: Britain could save £4.6 billion a year in road transport costs if more people cycled...
example.tran: 如更多的人骑自行车，英国一年能在道路交通上节省46亿英镑的开销。

collins.def: A cycle is a bicycle.

example.ex: ...an eight-mile cycle ride.
example.tran: 骑自行车8英里

collins.def: A cycle is a motorcycle.
A cycle is a series of events or processes that is repeated again and again, always in the same order.

example.ex: ...the life cycle of the plant...
example.tran: 植物的生命周期

example.ex: The figures marked the final low point of the present economic cycle...
example.tran: 这些数据显示了目前经济周期的最低点。

collins.tran: (运转的)一周，一圈;一个工作循环
collins.def: A cycle is a single complete series of movements in an electrical, electronic, or mechanical process.

example.ex: ...10 cycles per second.
example.tran: 每秒10转

collins.def: A cycle is a series of songs or poems that are intended to be performed or read one after the other.

example.ex: ...Wagner's Ring cycle.
example.tran: 瓦格纳的《指环》组歌

means: 训练，培养( train的现在分词)

collins.def: Training is the process of learning the skills that you need for a particular job or activity.

example.ex: He called for much higher spending on education and training...
example.tran: 他呼吁在教育和培训方面加大投入。

example.ex: Kennedy had no formal training as a decorator.
example.tran: 肯尼迪没有接受过做油漆匠的正规培训。

collins.tran: (为了健身或体育活动而进行的)训练，锻炼
collins.def: Training is physical exercise that you do regularly in order to keep fit or to prepare for an activity such as a race.

example.ex: The emphasis is on developing fitness through exercises and training.
example.tran: 重点在于通过锻炼促进健康。

example.ex: ...her busy training schedule.
example.tran: 她繁忙的训练日程

means: 闪光的，闪耀的，一闪而过的

collins.def: A flash is a sudden burst of light or of something shiny or bright.

example.ex: A sudden flash of lightning lit everything up for a second...
example.tran: 突然一个闪电瞬间照亮了一切。

example.ex: The wire snapped at the wall plug with a blue flash and the light fused...
example.tran: 墙上插头处的电线啪地发出一道蓝光，电灯的保险丝烧断了。

collins.def: If a light flashes or if you flash a light, it shines with a sudden bright light, especially as quick, regular flashes of light.

example.ex: Lightning flashed among the distant dark clouds...
example.tran: 一道道电光在远处的乌云中闪现。

example.ex: He lost his temper after a driver flashed her headlights as he overtook...
example.tran: 一个女司机在他超车时不停地闪着车前灯，这让他火冒三丈。

collins.def: You talk about a flash of something when you are saying that it happens very suddenly and unexpectedly.

example.ex: 'What did Moira tell you?' Liz demanded with a flash of anger...
example.tran: “莫伊拉跟你说什么啦？”利兹突然生气地质问道。

example.ex: When pursued, he made his escape with a flash of speed...
example.tran: 遭到追赶时，他突然飞速地逃脱了。

collins.def: If something flashes past or by, it moves past you so fast that you cannot see it properly.

example.ex: It was a busy road, cars flashed by every few minutes.
example.tran: 这是一条繁忙的道路，每隔几分钟就有汽车飞驰而过。

example.ex: ...the ball flashed across the face of the goal.
example.tran: 球从球门前飞过。

collins.def: If something flashes through or into your mind, you suddenly think about it.

example.ex: A ludicrous thought flashed through Harry's mind...
example.tran: 一个荒谬的念头突然在哈里脑中闪现。

example.ex: Those lines of Milton flashed into my mind.
example.tran: 弥尔顿的那几行诗忽然在我脑中闪过。

collins.def: If you flash something such as an identity card, you show it to people quickly and then put it away again.

example.ex: Halim flashed his official card, and managed to get hold of a soldier to guard the Land Rover.
example.tran: 哈利姆亮了一下他的军官证，设法找来了一名士兵看着路虎车。

collins.def: If a picture or message flashes up on a screen, or if you flash it onto a screen, it is displayed there briefly or suddenly, and often repeatedly.

example.ex: The figures flash up on the scoreboard...
example.tran: 数字显示在记分牌上。

example.ex: The words 'Good Luck' were flashing on the screen...
example.tran: “祝您好运”几个字出现在屏幕上。

collins.tran: (通过计算机、卫星或其他系统)快速发送，迅速播出，传送
collins.def: If you flash news or information to a place, you send it there quickly by computer, satellite, or other system.

example.ex: They had told their offices to flash the news as soon as it broke...
example.tran: 他们已经告诉各办公室，一有消息立即发布。

example.ex: This is, of course, international news and soon it was being flashed around the world.
example.tran: 当然，这是国际性新闻，很快就会传到世界各地。

collins.def: If you flash a look or a smile at someone, you suddenly look at them or smile at them.

example.ex: I flashed a look at Sue...
example.tran: 我向休瞥了一眼。

example.ex: Meg flashed Cissie a grateful smile.
example.tran: 梅格冲茜茜感激地笑了一笑。

collins.def: If someone's eyes flash, they suddenly show a strong emotion, especially anger.

example.ex: Her dark eyes flashed and she spoke rapidly.
example.tran: 她飞快地说着，黑色的双眼放着光。

collins.def: Flash is the use of special bulbs to give more light when taking a photograph.

example.ex: He was one of the first people to use high speed flash in bird photography.
example.tran: 他是最先使用高速闪光灯拍摄鸟类的人之一。

collins.def: A flash is the same as a flashlight .

example.ex: Stopping to rest, Pete shut off the flash.
example.tran: 皮特关掉手电筒，停下来休息。

collins.def: If you describe something as flash, you mean that it looks expensive, fashionable, and new.

example.ex: ...a flash uptown restaurant...
example.tran: 城郊富人区的豪华饭店

example.ex: You can go for a 'rostrum' system, which sounds flash, but can be assembled quite cheaply.
example.tran: 可以去弄一个“指挥台”系统，它听起来很昂贵，但其实花不了多少钱就可以组装起来。

collins.def: If you describe an achievement or success as a flash in the pan, you mean that it is unlikely to be repeated and is not an indication of future achievements or success.

example.ex: People will be looking in to see how good we are now and whether our success has just been a flash in the pan.
example.tran: 人们会来看看我们现在有多成功，看看我们的成功是否只是昙花一现。

collins.def: If you say that something happens in a flash, you mean that it happens suddenly and lasts only a very short time.

example.ex: The answer had come to him in a flash...
example.tran: 他一下子就有了答案。

example.ex: It was done in a flash.
example.tran: 一眨眼的工夫就完成了。

collins.def: If you say that someone reacts to something quick as a flash, you mean that they react to it extremely quickly.

example.ex: Quick as a flash, the man said, 'I have to, don't I?'
example.tran: 那人立即说道：“我必须如此，是不是？”

collins.tran: 突然记起;猛然想起;忽地记起
collins.def: If your mind flashes back to something in the past, you remember it or think of it briefly or suddenly.

example.ex: His mind kept flashing back to the previous night...
example.tran: 他脑中不断回想起头天晚上发生的事。

example.ex: Thoughts inevitably flash back to 1914, when trouble in this part of the Balkans led all the way to world war.
example.tran: 这难免会令人想起1914年，那年巴尔干半岛上这一地区的动荡最终引发了世界大战。

means: （对总体具有代表性的）典型统计论

collins.def: Statistics are facts which are obtained from analysing information expressed in numbers, for example information about the number of times that something happens.

example.ex: Official statistics show real wages declining by 24%...
example.tran: 官方统计数字表明实际工资下降了 24%。

example.ex: There are no reliable statistics for the number of deaths in the battle.
example.tran: 关于阵亡人数没有可靠的统计数字。

collins.def: Statistics is a branch of mathematics concerned with the study of information that is expressed in numbers.

example.ex: ...a professor of Mathematical Statistics.
example.tran: 数学统计学教授

collins.def: You use mutual to  describe a situation, feeling, or action that is experienced, felt, or done by both of two people mentioned.

example.ex: The East and the West can work together for their mutual benefit and progress...
example.tran: 东西方可以为彼此共同的利益和发展而合作。

example.ex: It's plain that he adores his daughter, and the feeling is mutual.
example.tran: 明摆着他很喜欢自己的女儿，而且女儿也喜欢他。

collins.def: You use mutual to describe something such as an interest which two or more people share.

example.ex: They do, however, share a mutual interest in design...
example.tran: 不过他们确实都对设计感兴趣。

example.ex: We were introduced by a mutual friend.
example.tran: 我们一个共同的朋友介绍我们认识了。

collins.tran: (指建屋互助会或保险公司)互助的，相互保险的
collins.def: If a building society or an insurance company has mutual status, it is not owned by shareholders but by its customers, who receive a share of the profits.

example.ex: Britain's third largest building society abandoned its mutual status and became a bank.
example.tran: 英国第三大建屋互助会准备放弃其互助性质，转变为银行。

collins.def: Constitutional means relating to the constitution of a particular country or organization.

example.ex: Political leaders are making no progress in their efforts to resolve the country's constitutional crisis...
example.tran: 政治领袖们在解决国家宪法危机方面没有取得任何进展。

example.ex: We have a constitutional right to demonstrate...
example.tran: 根据宪法，我们有权进行游行示威。

collins.def: If you cannot afford something, you do not have enough money to pay for it.

example.ex: My parents can't even afford a new refrigerator...
example.tran: 我父母甚至买不起一台新冰箱。

example.ex: The arts should be available to more people at prices they can afford...
example.tran: 艺术品应该以人们能够承受的价格面向更多的人出售。

collins.def: If you say that you cannot afford to do something or allow it to happen, you mean that you must not do it or must prevent it from happening because it would be harmful or embarrassing to you.

example.ex: We can't afford to wait...
example.tran: 我们等不起。

example.ex: The country could not afford the luxury of an election.
example.tran: 该国负担不起选举这样奢侈的事。

collins.def: If someone or something affords you an opportunity or protection, they give it to you.

example.ex: This affords us the opportunity to ask questions about how the systems might change...
example.tran: 这给我们提供了就系统可能如何改变进行提问的机会。

example.ex: It was a cold room, but it afforded a fine view of the Old City.
example.tran: 这房间虽然很冷，但是它能让人将古城的景致尽收眼底。

collins.def: A castle is a large building with thick, high walls. Castles were built by important people, such as kings, in former times, especially for protection during wars and battles.
In chess, a castle is a piece that can be moved forwards, backwards, or sideways.
Milk is the white liquid produced by cows, goats, and some other animals, which people drink and use to make butter, cheese, and yoghurt.

example.ex: He popped out to buy a pint of milk.
example.tran: 他匆匆出门去买一品脱牛奶。

example.ex: ...basic foods such as meat, bread and milk.
example.tran: 诸如肉、面包和牛奶之类的主食

collins.def: If someone milks a cow or goat, they get milk from it, using either their hands or a machine.

example.ex: Farm-workers milked cows by hand.
example.tran: 农场工人用手挤牛奶。

collins.def: Milk is the white liquid produced by women to feed their babies.

example.ex: Milk from the mother's breast is a perfect food for the human baby.
example.tran: 母乳是宝宝的最佳食品。

collins.tran: (清洁皮肤或使其柔嫩的)乳液
collins.def: Liquid products for cleaning your skin or making it softer are sometimes referred to as milks .

example.ex: ...sales of cleansing milks, creams and gels.
example.tran: 洗面奶、润肤膏和啫喱的销量

collins.def: If you say that someone milks something, you mean that they get as much benefit or profit as they can from it, without caring about the effects this has on other people.

example.ex: A few people tried to milk the insurance companies...
example.tran: 一些人试图从保险公司敲一笔钱。

example.ex: The callous couple milked money from a hospital charity to fund a lavish lifestyle.
example.tran: 为了过上奢靡的生活，这对冷漠无情的夫妇竟然贪污医院的慈善基金。

collins.tran: （建议、观点）淡而无味的，软弱无力的，不痛不痒的
collins.def: If you think that someone's suggestions or ideas are weak or sentimental, you can say that they are milk and water.

example.ex: Fryer dismisses the report as 'milk and water'.
example.tran: 弗赖尔认为这篇报告里的观点不痛不痒，不值一读。

means: 改进，改善，改良，增进，进步
更优秀的人，更进步的人

collins.def: If there is an improvement in something, it becomes better. If you make improvements to something, you make it better.

example.ex: ...the dramatic improvements in organ transplantation in recent years...
example.tran: 近几年器官移植方面取得的巨大进步

example.ex: There is considerable room for improvement in state facilities for treating the mentally handicapped.
example.tran: 国家现有的用于智障病人治疗的设施还有相当大的改进余地。

collins.tran: 更优秀之物;改善的事物
collins.def: If you say that something is an improvement on a previous thing or situation, you mean that it is better than that thing.

example.ex: The new Prime Minister is an improvement on his predecessor...
example.tran: 新上任的总理比他的前任要强。

example.ex: The system we introduced in 1980 has been a great improvement.
example.tran: 我们 1980 年引进的系统有了很大改进。

collins.def: If you seek something such as a job or a place to live, you try to find one.

example.ex: They have had to seek work as labourers...
example.tran: 他们只好找体力活儿干。

example.ex: Four people who sought refuge in the Italian embassy have left voluntarily...
example.tran: 4 名在意大利大使馆寻求避难的人已经自愿离开了。

collins.def: When someone seeks something, they try to obtain it.

example.ex: The prosecutors have warned they will seek the death penalty...
example.tran: 检控方律师已警告说他们会努力争取判处死刑。

example.ex: Haemophiliacs are seeking compensation for being given contaminated blood.
example.tran: 血友病患者们因为被输入了受到污染的血液而正在寻求赔偿。

collins.def: If you seek someone's help or advice, you contact them in order to ask for it.

example.ex: Always seek professional legal advice before entering into any agreement...
example.tran: 在签订任何协定之前一定要先征求法律专业人士的意见。

example.ex: On important issues, they seek a second opinion...
example.tran: 在重要问题上，他们会征求别人的看法。

collins.def: If you seek to do something, you try to do it.

example.ex: He also denied that he would seek to annex the country...
example.tran: 他还否认会试图吞并该国。

example.ex: Moscow is seeking to slow the growth of Russian inflation.
example.tran: 俄罗斯政府正力图遏制本国的通货膨胀。

collins.def: If you describe a problem or a responsibility as a burden, you mean that it causes someone a lot of difficulty, worry, or hard work.

example.ex: The developing  countries bear the burden of an enormous external debt...
example.tran: 发展中国家背负着巨额外债。

example.ex: They don't go around with the burdens of the world on their shoulders the whole time...
example.tran: 他们不会一直背负整个世界的重担。

collins.def: A burden is a heavy load that is difficult to carry.
If someone burdens you with something that is likely to worry you, for example a problem or a difficult decision, they tell you about it.

example.ex: We decided not to burden him with the news.
example.tran: 我们决定不拿这个消息去烦他。

collins.def: The burden of proof is the task of proving that you are correct, for example when you have accused someone of a crime.

example.ex: The burden of proof is on the prosecution.
example.tran: 起诉方有举证的责任。

collins.def: Air is the mixture of gases which forms the earth's atmosphere and which we breathe.

example.ex: Draughts help to circulate air...
example.tran: 穿堂风有助于空气流通。

example.ex: Keith opened the window and leaned out into the cold air.
example.tran: 基思打开窗户，探出身到冷风中。

collins.def: The air is the space around things or above the ground.

example.ex: Government troops broke up the protest by firing their guns in the air...
example.tran: 政府军队朝天鸣枪驱散了抗议人群。

example.ex: People's cigarette smoke seemed to hang in the air.
example.tran: 人们吸烟的烟雾似乎会长时间滞留在空气中。

collins.def: Air is used to refer to travel in aircraft.

example.ex: Air travel will continue to grow at about 6% per year...
example.tran: 乘飞机旅行的人数将以每年大约6%的速度持续增加。

example.ex: Casualties had to be brought to hospital by air.
example.tran: 伤者不得不用飞机送往医院。

collins.def: An air is a simple tune which can be easily recognized and remembered.

collins.tran: 神态;感觉;总体印象;氛围
collins.def: If you say that someone or something has a particular air, you mean that they give this general impression.

example.ex: Jennifer regarded him with an air of amusement...
example.tran: 珍妮弗觉得他很风趣。

example.ex: The meal gave the occasion an almost festive air.
example.tran: 这一餐使整个场合有了近乎节日般的喜庆氛围。

collins.tran: 矫揉造作；装腔作势；做作
collins.def: If you say that someone is putting on airs or giving themselves airs, you are criticizing them for behaving as if they are better than other people.

example.ex: We're poor and we never put on airs.
example.tran: 我们贫穷但从不装腔作势。

collins.tran: （通过电视或无线电）播送，播放
collins.def: If a broadcasting company airs a television or radio programme, they show it on television or broadcast it on the radio.

example.ex: Tonight PBS will air a documentary called 'Democracy In Action'.
example.tran: 今晚公共广播公司将播放一部名为《民主进行时》的纪录片。

collins.def: If you air your opinions, you make them known to people.

example.ex: They sat for more than six hours, and both sides agreed they had aired all their differences...
example.tran: 他们一起坐了六个多小时，而且双方都认为他们已经表达了所有的不同意见。

example.ex: The whole issue was thoroughly aired at the meeting.
example.tran: 在会上完全公开了整个问题。

collins.def: If you air a room or building, you let fresh air into it.

example.ex: One day a week her mother systematically cleaned and aired each room.
example.tran: 她母亲按部就班地每周一次清扫所有的房间并开窗通风。

collins.def: If you air clothing or bedding, you put it somewhere warm to make sure that it is completely dry.

example.ex: When the shirts were clean, I ironed them myself, aired them and placed them in drawers in his room.
example.tran: 衬衫洗干净之后，我自己将它们熨好、烘干并放在他房间的抽屉里。

collins.def: If you do something to clear the air, you do it in order to resolve any problems or disagreements that there might be.

example.ex: ...an inquiry just to clear the air and settle the facts of the case.
example.tran: 一项只为消除疑团并弄清案件事实而进行的调查

collins.tran: 大模大样;摆架子;装腔作势
collins.def: If you refer to someone's airs and graces, you mean that they behave in a way that shows that they think they are more important than other people.

example.ex: The old cliché of the customer being always right is what gives them airs and graces.
example.tran: “顾客总是对的”这种陈词滥调让他们变得趾高气扬。

collins.def: If something is in the air it is felt to be present, but it is not talked about.

example.ex: There was great excitement in the air...
example.tran: 人人都感到无比激动。

example.ex: She walked away and left the question hanging in the air.
example.tran: 她走开了，将疑问留在人们心里。

collins.tran: 播送（广播、电视节目）；（广播、电视节目）播放/停止播放
collins.def: If someone is on the air, they are broadcasting on radio or television. If a programme is on the air, it is being broadcast on radio or television. If it is off the air, it is not being broadcast.

example.ex: She is going on the air as presenter of a new show...
example.tran: 她即将上电视主持一档新节目。

example.ex: Rockwell hopes the program can be on the air within a year...
example.tran: 罗克韦尔希望该节目能在一年内播出。

collins.tran: （消失得）无影无踪/突然神秘地（出现）
collins.def: If someone or something disappears into thin air, they disappear completely. If someone or something appears out of thin air, they appear suddenly and mysteriously.

example.ex: 'But where could they have gone?' he demanded. 'They can't just vanish into thin air!'...
example.tran: “但是他们可能去哪里呢？”他追问道，“他们不可能就神秘消失了!”

example.ex: He had materialized out of thin air; I had not seen or heard him coming.
example.tran: 他突然间神秘地出现了；我既没看见他来，也没听见他的脚步声。

collins.def: If you say that a decision or a situation is up in the air, you mean that it has not yet been completely settled or planned.

example.ex: He told reporters today that the president's trip to Moscow is up in the air.
example.tran: 今天他告诉记者们总统是否前往莫斯科尚未确定。

collins.def: If you say that you are walking on air or floating on air, you mean that you feel extremely happy about something.

example.ex: As soon as I know I'm in the team it's like I'm walking on air.
example.tran: 一得知我加入了这个队，我高兴得像飞上了天。

collins.def: If you resist something such as a change, you refuse to accept it and try to prevent it.

example.ex: She says she will resist a single European currency being imposed...
example.tran: 她说她会反对在欧洲推行单一货币。

example.ex: They resisted our attempts to modernize the distribution of books.
example.tran: 他们反对我们采用现代化方式发行图书。

collins.def: If you resist someone or resist an attack by them, you fight back against them.

example.ex: The man was shot outside his house as he tried to resist arrest...
example.tran: 该男子在其住宅外拒捕时被击毙。

example.ex: When she had attempted to cut his nails he resisted.
example.tran: 她试图给他剪指甲，他不让。

collins.def: If you resist doing something, or resist the temptation to do it, you stop yourself from doing it although you would like to do it.

example.ex: Students should resist the temptation to focus on exams alone...
example.tran: 学生们应当抵制诱惑，集中精力备考。

example.ex: She cannot resist giving him advice.
example.tran: 她忍不住给他提建议。

collins.def: If someone or something resists damage of some kind, they are not damaged.

example.ex: ...bodies trained and toughened to resist the cold...
example.tran: 经过训练和磨炼，可以抵御寒冷的身体

example.ex: Chemicals form a protective layer that resists both oil and water-based stains.
example.tran: 化学物质形成了一个抗油污和水渍的保护层。

means: 使工业化(industrialize的过去式和过去分词)

collins.def: An industrialized area or place is one which has a lot of industries.

example.ex: Industrialized countries must reduce carbon dioxide emissions.
example.tran: 工业化国家必须减少二氧化碳的排放。

example.ex: ...the industrialized world.
example.tran: 工业化世界

collins.def: A metre is a metric unit of length equal to 100 centimetres.

example.ex: Chris Boardman won the Olympic 4,000 metres pursuit...
example.tran: 克里斯·博德曼赢得了奥运会4,000米自行车追逐赛的冠军。

example.ex: The tunnel is 10 metres wide and 600 metres long.
example.tran: 隧道宽10米，长600米。

collins.def: In the study of poetry, metre is the regular and rhythmic arrangement of syllables according to particular patterns.

example.ex: They must each compose a poem in strict alliterative metre...
example.tran: 他们必须每人作一首严格押头韵的诗。

example.ex: All of the poems are written in traditional metres and rhyme schemes.
example.tran: 所有的诗都按传统的韵律和韵脚而作。

collins.def: Cricket is an  outdoor game played between two teams. Players try to score points, called runs, by hitting a ball with a wooden bat.

example.ex: During the summer term we would play cricket at the village ground.
example.tran: 在夏季学期，我们会在村里的空地上打板球。

example.ex: ...the Yorkshire County Cricket Club.
example.tran: 约克郡板球俱乐部

collins.tran: 不公正;不光明正大;不光彩
collins.def: If you say that someone's behaviour is not cricket, you mean that they have not behaved fairly.

example.ex: Their treatment of staff is definitely not cricket.
example.tran: 他们对待员工的方式绝对不公正。

collins.def: A cricket is a small jumping insect that produces short, loud sounds by rubbing its wings together.
A  continent is a very large area of land, such as Africa or Asia, that consists of several countries.

example.ex: She loved the African continent...
example.tran: 她热爱非洲大陆。

example.ex: Dinosaurs evolved when most continents were joined in a single land mass.
example.tran: 恐龙进化的时候，多数大陆连为一体。

collins.def: People sometimes use the Continent to refer to the continent of Europe except for Britain.

example.ex: Its shops are among the most stylish on the Continent.
example.tran: 其店铺跻身欧陆最时尚的店铺之列。

means: 连锁店或旅馆系列的事物

collins.def: A chain consists of metal rings connected together in a line.

example.ex: His open shirt revealed a fat gold chain...
example.tran: 他的衬衫敞着，露出一条很粗的金链。

example.ex: The dogs were leaping and growling at the full stretch of their chains.
example.tran: 那些狗又蹦又叫，把链子绷得紧紧的。

collins.def: If prisoners are in chains, they have thick rings of metal round their wrists or ankles to prevent them from escaping.

example.ex: He'd spent four and a half years in windowless cells, much of the time in chains.
example.tran: 他已经在没有窗户的牢房里呆了4年半，多数时间都戴着镣铐。

collins.def: You can refer to feelings and duties which prevent you from doing what you want to do as chains .

example.ex: He had to break right now the chains of habit that bound him to the present.
example.tran: 他必须现在就打破把他束缚在当前境况的习惯。

collins.def: If a person or thing is chained to something, they are fastened to it with a chain.

example.ex: The dog was chained to the leg of the one solid garden seat...
example.tran: 狗被拴在公园一个固定座位的腿上。

example.ex: She chained her bike to the railings...
example.tran: 她把自行车锁在栏杆上。

collins.def: A chain of things is a group of them existing or arranged in a line.

example.ex: ...a chain of islands known as the Windward Islands...
example.tran: 名为“向风群岛”的岛群

example.ex: Students tried to form a human chain around the parliament.
example.tran: 学生们试图在议会四周围成人墙。

collins.def: A chain of shops, hotels, or other businesses is a number of them owned by the same person or company.

example.ex: ...a large supermarket chain.
example.tran: 大型连锁超市

example.ex: ...Italy's leading chain of cinemas.
example.tran: 意大利最大的连锁影院

collins.def: A chain of events is a series of them happening one after another.

example.ex: ...the bizarre chain of events that led to his departure in January 1938.
example.tran: 促使他于1938年1月离去的一连串离奇事件

collins.tran: （事件或活动的）发生地,举办地点;场地
collins.def: The venue for an event or activity is the place where it will happen.

example.ex: Birmingham's International Convention Centre is the venue for a three-day arts festival...
example.tran: 为期3天的艺术节在伯明翰的国际会议中心举办。

example.ex: Peace talks failed to take place because of a dispute over the venue.
example.tran: 由于在谈判地点上存在分歧，和平谈判未能举行。

collins.def: Illness is the fact or experience of being ill.

example.ex: If your child shows any signs of illness, take her to the doctor...
example.tran: 如果您的孩子出现任何患病症状,带她去看医生。

example.ex: Mental illness is still a taboo subject.
example.tran: 精神疾病仍然是禁忌话题。

collins.def: An illness is a particular disease such as measles or pneumonia.

example.ex: She returned to her family home to recover from an illness.
example.tran: 她回家养病来了。

means: 不中（目标），不对（题），与…无关
（表示位置）在…旁边，，在…一侧，在…附近
（表示关系）与…无关，和…相比，比起…来，比得上

collins.def: Something that is beside something else is at the side of it or next to it.

example.ex: On the table beside an empty plate was a pile of books...
example.tran: 桌上空盘子的旁边是一堆书。

example.ex: I moved from behind my desk to sit beside her.
example.tran: 我从桌子后面走到她身边坐了下来。

collins.def: If you are beside yourself with anger or excitement, you are extremely angry or excited.

example.ex: He had shouted down the phone at her, beside himself with anxiety...
example.tran: 他焦急万分地对着电话那头的她大喊大叫。

example.ex: Cathy was beside herself with excitement.
example.tran: 凯茜兴奋异常。

collins.tran: （人）充满智慧的，英明的，睿智的
collins.def: A wise person is able to use their experience and knowledge in order to make sensible decisions and judgments.

example.ex: She has the air of a wise woman...
example.tran: 她有才女气质。

example.ex: You're a wise old man: tell me what to do.
example.tran: 您是位睿智的长者：告诉我该怎么办。

collins.def: A wise action or decision is sensible.

example.ex: It's never wise to withhold evidence...
example.tran: 藏匿证据绝非明智之举。

example.ex: She had made a very wise decision...
example.tran: 她作了一个非常明智的决定。

collins.def: If someone says to you that it would be wise to do something, they are advising you to do it, because it is the most sensible and reasonable action or decision in a particular situation.

example.ex: It would be wise to get his eyes checked to ensure there is no problem.
example.tran: 最好检查一下他的眼睛，确保没有问题。

collins.tran: 明白，察觉(尤指他人试图保密之事)
collins.def: If you get wise to something, you find out about it, especially when someone has been trying to keep it secret.

example.ex: Dealers have already got wise to the trend and increased their prices accordingly.
example.tran: 交易商已经摸清了动向，相应提高了价格。

collins.tran: （在事后或作出解释后）仍然不明白，仍旧不完全知晓
collins.def: If you say that someone is none the wiser after an event or an explanation, or that nobody is any the wiser after it, you mean that they have failed to understand it, or are not fully aware of what happened.

example.ex: The brewers are still none the wiser about the shape the Government envisages for the industry...
example.tran: 啤酒公司对政府对该行业的构想仍然不甚明了。

example.ex: We could have stolen the original from the warehouse without you being any the wiser.
example.tran: 我们本可以把原作从库房里偷出来而完全不让你知晓。

collins.def: A clinic is a building where people go to receive medical advice or treatment.

example.ex: ...a family planning clinic.
example.tran: 计划生育诊所

collins.tran: （需要高等教育或训练的）职业
collins.def: A profession is a type of job that requires advanced education or training.

example.ex: Harper was a teacher by profession...
example.tran: 哈珀的职业是教师。

example.ex: Only 20 per cent of jobs in the professions are held by women.
example.tran: 在这些职业中，只有20%的岗位是由女性担任的。

collins.tran: （某一专业工作的）全体人员，业界人士，专业界
collins.def: You can use profession to refer to all the people who have the same profession.

example.ex: The attitude of the medical profession is very much more liberal now.
example.tran: 现在，医务人员的态度开明多了。

collins.def: When there is a reduction in something, it is made smaller.

example.ex: ...a future reduction in UK interest rates...
example.tran: 未来英国利率的下调

example.ex: Many companies have announced dramatic reductions in staff.
example.tran: 许多公司已经宣布大幅裁员。

collins.def: Reduction is the act of making something smaller in size or amount, or less in degree.

example.ex: ...a new strategic arms reduction agreement.
example.tran: 新的战略武器削减协议

collins.def: Controversy is a lot of discussion and argument about something, often involving strong feelings of anger or disapproval.

example.ex: The proposed cuts have caused considerable controversy.
example.tran: 削减开支的提议引起了诸多争议。

example.ex: ...a fierce political controversy over human rights abuses.
example.tran: 关于侵犯人权问题的激烈的政治辩论

collins.def: An electric device or machine works by means of electricity, rather than using some other source of power.

example.ex: ...her electric guitar.
example.tran: 她的电吉他

collins.def: An electric current, voltage, or charge is one that is produced by electricity.
Electric plugs, sockets, or power lines are designed to carry electricity.
Electric is used to refer to the supply of electricity.

example.ex: An average electric bill might go up $2 or $3 per month...
example.tran: 每月电费可能会平均增加两三美元。

collins.tran: 扣人心弦的;紧张刺激的
collins.def: If you describe the atmosphere of a place or event as electric, you mean that people are in a state of great excitement.

example.ex: The mood in the hall was electric.
example.tran: 大厅里的气氛非常紧张。

means: 怀特霍尔（伦敦的一条街名），白厅，英国政府

collins.tran: 怀特霍尔(伦敦一街名，许多政府机关所在地)；白厅(指英国政府)
collins.def: Whitehall is the name of a street in London in which there are many government offices. You can also use Whitehall to mean the British Government itself.

example.ex: ...people with banners marching down Whitehall...
example.tran: 打着标语在怀特霍尔街上行进的人们

example.ex: Whitehall said that it hoped to get the change through by the end of June.
example.tran: 英国政府称将有望在6月底前彻底完成变革。

collins.tran: 违反，违背，违犯（协议、法律或承诺）
collins.def: If someone violates an agreement, law, or promise, they break it.

example.ex: They went to prison because they violated the law...
example.tran: 他们触犯了法律，因此坐了牢。

example.ex: They violated the ceasefire agreement.
example.tran: 他们违反了停火协议。

collins.def: If you violate someone's privacy or peace, you disturb it.

example.ex: These men were violating her family's privacy.
example.tran: 这些人侵犯了她的家庭隐私。

collins.def: If someone violates a special place, for example a grave, they damage it or treat it with disrespect.

example.ex: Detectives are still searching for those who violated the graveyard.
example.tran: 侦探们仍在搜捕那些亵渎了墓园的家伙。

collins.tran: 神经紧张的;担忧的;焦虑的
collins.def: If someone is nervous, they are frightened or worried about something that is happening or might happen, and show this in their behaviour.

example.ex: The party has become deeply nervous about its prospects of winning the next election...
example.tran: 该党对赢得下一次选举的前景深感忧虑。

example.ex: She described Mr Hutchinson as nervous and jumpy after his wife's disappearance.
example.tran: 据她描述，哈钦森先生自从妻子失踪后变得神经兮兮、一惊一乍的。

collins.def: A nervous person is very tense and easily upset.

example.ex: She was apparently a very nervous woman, and that affected her career.
example.tran: 她显然是一个很神经质的女人，这一点影响了她的事业。

collins.def: A nervous illness or condition is one that affects your emotions and your mental state.

example.ex: The number of nervous disorders was rising in the region...
example.tran: 该地区神经紊乱患者的人数在上升。

example.ex: He developed nervous problems after people began repeatedly correcting him.
example.tran: 人们开始不停地纠正他的错误，之后他的神经就出现了问题。

means: 壮观的场面，精彩的表演
〈美〉一小时半以上的大场面电视节目

collins.tran: 引人注目的;惊人的;壮观的
collins.def: Something that is spectacular is very impressive or dramatic.

example.ex: ...spectacular views of the Sugar Loaf Mountain...
example.tran: 甜面包山的壮观景色

example.ex: They have revamped the business with spectacular success...
example.tran: 他们成功地调整了业务，成绩斐然。

collins.tran: 壮观的表演;盛大的演出
collins.def: A spectacular is a show or performance which is very grand and impressive.

example.ex: ...a television spectacular.
example.tran: 一场电视盛宴

example.ex: ...one of the world's great sporting spectaculars.
example.tran: 世界上最壮观的体育盛事之一

means: [建] 门或窗户上面的线脚
[化]用放射性元素使（元素或原子等）示踪

collins.def: A label is a piece of paper or plastic that is attached to an object in order to give information about it.

example.ex: He peered at the label on the bottle.
example.tran: 他仔细地看着瓶上的标签。

collins.def: If something is labelled, a label is attached to it giving information about it.

example.ex: The stuff has never been properly logged and labelled...
example.tran: 这些东西从未进行过妥善登记，也没有贴标签标注。

example.ex: Meat labelled 'Scotch Beef' sells for a premium in supermarkets...
example.tran: 带有“Scotch Beef（苏格兰牛肉）”标志的牛肉在超市里售价不菲。

collins.def: If you say that someone or something is labelled as a particular thing, you mean that people generally describe them that way and you think that this is unfair.

example.ex: Too often the press are labelled as bad boys...
example.tran: 记者们往往被视为捣蛋分子。

example.ex: Certain estates are labelled as undesirable...
example.tran: 某些物业被归入不受欢迎之列。

collins.def: If you say that someone gets a particular label, you mean that people show disapproval of them by describing them with a critical word or phrase.

example.ex: Her treatment of her husband earned her the label of the most hated woman in America.
example.tran: 她对待丈夫的行径使她赢得了“全美最可恶的女人”的称号。

collins.def: You can refer to a company that produces and sells CDs as a particular label .

example.ex: She landed a contract with record label EMI...
example.tran: 她获得了一份与百代唱片公司的合约。

example.ex: It was on the Virgin label.
example.tran: 它由维京唱片公司发行。

collins.def: Your occupation is your job or profession.

example.ex: I suppose I was looking for an occupation which was going to be an adventure...
example.tran: 我想我在找的是一份具有冒险性的工作。

example.ex: Occupation: administrative assistant.
example.tran: 职业：行政助理

collins.def: An occupation is something that you spend time doing, either for pleasure or because it needs to be done.

example.ex: Parachuting is a dangerous occupation.
example.tran: 跳伞是一项危险的消遣运动。

collins.def: The occupation of a country happens when it is entered and controlled by a foreign army.

example.ex: Prii had become fluent in German during the Wehrmacht's occupation of Estonia in 1942...
example.tran: 在1942年德军侵占爱沙尼亚期间，普里学得了一口流利的德语。

example.ex: ...the deportation of Jews from Paris during the German occupation.
example.tran: 德国人占领巴黎期间对犹太人的驱逐

collins.def: The occupation of a building is the act or fact of someone living or working in it.

example.ex: ...people who sell their home and buy another one for their own occupation.
example.tran: 出售房屋再另购一套自住的人

collins.def: The publication of a book or magazine is the act of printing it and sending it to shops to be sold.

example.ex: The guide is being translated into several languages for publication near Christmas...
example.tran: 该手册正被译成数种语言，将在临近圣诞节时出版。

example.ex: The publication of his collected poems was approaching the status of an event.
example.tran: 他的诗集的出版可能说是一件大事。

collins.def: A publication is a book or magazine that has been published.

example.ex: They have started legal proceedings against two publications which spoke of an affair.
example.tran: 他们开始对两本提及一桩婚外情的出版物提起法律诉讼。

collins.def: The publication of something such as information is the act of making it known to the public, for example by informing journalists or by publishing a government document.

example.ex: A spokesman said: 'We have no comment regarding the publication of these photographs.'
example.tran: 一位发言人说，“对于这些照片的公之于众，我们不予置评。”

collins.def: Computer programs are referred to as software .

example.ex: ...the people who write the software for big computer projects.
example.tran: 大型计算机项目的软件开发人员

means: （尤指通过增添成就、成功等）使圆满

collins.tran: 王冠;皇冠;冕;(戴在头上的)冠状物
collins.def: A crown is a circular ornament, usually made of gold and jewels, which a king or queen wears on their head at official ceremonies. You can also use crown to refer to anything circular that is worn on someone's head.

example.ex: ...a crown of flowers.
example.tran: 花冠

collins.tran: 王国政府;王国;(英国刑事案件中的)公诉人
collins.def: The government of a country that has a king or queen is sometimes referred to as the Crown. In British criminal cases the prosecutor is the Crown .

example.ex: She says the sovereignty of the Crown must be preserved.
example.tran: 她说必须维护王国政府的主权。

example.ex: ...a Minister of the Crown.
example.tran: 王国政府的大臣

collins.def: When a king or queen is crowned, a crown is placed on their head as part of a ceremony in which they are officially made king or queen.

example.ex: Elizabeth was crowned in Westminster Abbey on 2 June 1953...
example.tran: 伊丽莎白于1953年6月2日在威斯敏斯特大教堂加冕。

example.ex: Two days later, Juan Carlos was crowned king.
example.tran: 两天后，胡安·卡洛斯被加冕为国王。

collins.def: If one thing crowns another, it is on top of it.

example.ex: Here another rugged castle crowns the cliffs and crags.
example.tran: 这里又有一座高低不平的城堡建在悬崖绝壁之上。

example.ex: ...a very striking face, crowned by an abundance of hair.
example.tran: 一张非常标致的脸，长着一头浓密的头发

collins.def: Your crown is the top part of your head, at the back.

example.ex: He laid his hand gently on the crown of her head.
example.tran: 他把手轻轻放在她的头顶上。

collins.def: The crown of a hat is the part which covers the top of your head.
A crown was a British coin worth five shillings.
A crown is an artificial top piece fixed over a broken or decayed tooth.
In sport, winning an important competition is sometimes referred to as a crown .

example.ex: ...his dream of a fourth Wimbledon crown.
example.tran: 他梦想第四次获得温布尔登网球公开赛的冠军

collins.def: An achievement or event that crowns something makes it perfect, successful, or complete.

example.ex: It is an important moment, crowning the efforts of the Cup organisers...
example.tran: 这是个重要时刻，它使得优胜杯赛组织者的努力圆满告捷。

example.ex: The summit was crowned by the signing of the historic START treaty.
example.tran: 此次峰会以签订具有历史性意义的《削减进攻性战略武器条约》宣告圆满成功。

collins.def: If you crown your career with a success or achievement, you have a final success or achievement which is greater than all the others you have had.

example.ex: He went on to crown a distinguished career in radio and television with his book 'The Price of Victory'.
example.tran: 凭借《胜利的代价》一书，在广播和电视事业上成就杰出的他再创辉煌。

collins.def: Emphasis is special or extra importance that is given to an activity or to a part or aspect of something.

example.ex: Too much emphasis is placed on research...
example.tran: 过分强调研究的重要性。

example.ex: Grant puts a special emphasis on weather in his paintings.
example.tran: 格兰特在他的绘画中特别注重天气。

collins.tran: （对音节、单词或短语的）强调，重读
collins.def: Emphasis is extra force that you put on a syllable, word, or phrase when you are speaking in order to make it seem more important.

example.ex: 'I might have known it!' Miss Burnett said with emphasis...
example.tran: “我早该料到了！”伯内特小姐加重语气说。

example.ex: The emphasis is on the first syllable of the last word.
example.tran: 重音在最后一个单词的第一个音节上。
