collins.def: Pills are small solid round masses of medicine or vitamins that you swallow without chewing.

example.ex: Why do I have to take all these pills?
example.tran: 我为什么非得服下所有这些药丸呢？

example.ex: ...sleeping pills.
example.tran: 安眠药

collins.def: If a woman is on the pill, she takes a special pill that prevents her from becoming pregnant.

example.ex: She had been on the pill for three years.
example.tran: 她吃口服避孕药已有3年。

example.ex: ...the contraceptive pill.
example.tran: 避孕药丸

collins.tran: 不得不承受的苦事；不得不接受的现实
collins.def: If a person or group has to accept a failure or an unpleasant piece of news, you can say that it was a bitter pill or a bitter pill to swallow .

example.ex: You're too old to be given a job. That's a bitter pill to swallow.
example.tran: 你年龄太大了，没人愿意再给工作，这是你不得不接受的现实。

collins.tran: 把苦药包上糖衣；使不愉快的事变得较易接受
collins.def: If someone does something to sweeten the pill or sugar the pill, they do it to make some unpleasant news or an unpleasant measure more acceptable.

example.ex: He sweetened the pill by increasing wages, although by slightly less than he raised prices.
example.tran: 他提高了工资以使人们更易接受，尽管涨幅略低于他的价格升幅。

collins.def: Something that is appropriate is suitable or acceptable for a particular situation.

example.ex: It is appropriate that Irish names dominate the list...
example.tran: 名单上大部分是爱尔兰名字，这没什么不合适的。

example.ex: Dress neatly and attractively in an outfit appropriate to the job...
example.tran: 着装要整洁美观，适合于这份工作。

collins.def: If someone appropriates something which does not belong to them, they take it, usually without the right to do so.

example.ex: Several other newspapers have appropriated the idea...
example.tran: 另外有几家报社已盗用了这个创意。

example.ex: The land was simply appropriated by the rulers.
example.tran: 土地完全被统治者霸占。

collins.def: If a government or organization appropriates an amount of money for a particular purpose, it reserves it for that purpose.

example.ex: Senator Lugar is skeptical that Congress will appropriate more funding for this purpose.
example.tran: 参议员卢格怀疑国会是否会拨出更多资金用于此目的。

collins.def: A confrontation is a dispute, fight, or battle between two groups of people.

example.ex: The issue has caused great tension between the two countries and could lead to a military confrontation...
example.tran: 这个问题使得两国关系非常紧张，可能会导致军事对抗。

example.ex: The commission remains so weak that it will continue to avoid confrontation with governments.
example.tran: 该委员会的力量仍然十分薄弱，所以将继续避免与各国政府发生冲突。

means: 通过通讯卫星播送[传播]

collins.def: A satellite is an object which has been sent into space in order to collect information or to be part of a communications system. Satellites move continually round the earth or around another planet.

example.ex: The rocket launched two communications satellites...
example.tran: 火箭发射了两颗通信卫星。

example.ex: The signals are sent by satellite link...
example.tran: 信号通过人造卫星链路发出。

collins.tran: (电视)使用卫星技术的;卫视的
collins.def: Satellite television is broadcast using a satellite.

example.ex: They have four satellite channels.
example.tran: 他们有 4 个卫星频道。

collins.def: A satellite is a natural object in space that moves round a planet or star.

example.ex: ...the satellites of Jupiter.
example.tran: 木星的卫星

collins.tran: 卫星国;附属国;卫星区;卫星组织
collins.def: You can refer to a country, area, or organization as a satellite when it is controlled by or depends on a larger and more powerful one.

example.ex: Italy became a satellite state of Germany by the end of the 1930s.
example.tran: 意大利在 20 世纪 30 年代末成了德国的附庸。

example.ex: ...Russia and its former satellites.
example.tran: 俄国及其曾经的卫星国

collins.def: Beauty is the state or quality of being beautiful.

example.ex: ...an area of outstanding natural beauty...
example.tran: 自然美景美不胜收的景区

example.ex: Everyone admired her elegance and her beauty.
example.tran: 人人都羡慕她的优雅和美丽。

collins.def: A beauty is a beautiful woman.

example.ex: She is known as a great beauty.
example.tran: 她是出了名的大美女。

collins.def: You can say that something is a beauty when you think it is very good.

example.ex: The pass was a real beauty, but the shot was poor.
example.tran: 传得非常漂亮，但是临门一脚太臭了。

collins.def: The beauties of something are its attractive qualities or features.

example.ex: He was beginning to enjoy the beauties of nature.
example.tran: 他开始享受大自然之美。

collins.def: Beauty is used to describe people, products, and activities that are concerned with making women  look beautiful.

example.ex: Additional beauty treatments can be booked in advance.
example.tran: 额外的美容服务可以提前预订。

collins.def: If you say that a particular feature is the beauty of something, you mean that this feature is what makes the thing so good.

example.ex: There would be no effect on animals—that's the beauty of such water-based materials.
example.tran: 对动物毫无影响——水基材料妙就妙在这儿。

collins.def: Your impression of a person or thing is what you think they are like, usually after having seen or heard them. Your impression of a situation is what you think is going on.

example.ex: What were your first impressions of college?...
example.tran: 你对大学的第一印象是什么？

example.ex: My impression is that they are totally out of control...
example.tran: 我的感觉是它们完全失去了控制。

collins.def: If someone gives you a particular impression, they cause you to believe that something is the case, often when it is not.

example.ex: I don't want to give the impression that I'm running away from the charges...
example.tran: 我不想给人一种我在逃避指控的感觉。

example.ex: He cleverly inserted mirrors above the window to create an impression of space.
example.tran: 他巧妙地在窗子上面镶嵌了几面镜子，以营造一种空间感。

collins.def: An impression is an amusing imitation of someone's behaviour or way of talking, usually someone well-known.

example.ex: He did impressions of Sean Connery and James Mason.
example.tran: 他对肖恩·康纳利和詹姆斯·梅森进行了滑稽模仿。

collins.def: An impression of an object is a mark or outline that it has left after being pressed hard onto a surface.

example.ex: ...the world's oldest fossil impressions of plant life.
example.tran: 世界上最古老的植物化石印痕

collins.def: If someone or something makes an impression, they have a strong effect on people or a situation.

example.ex: He has told me his plans and he's made a good impression on me...
example.tran: 他告诉了我他的计划,给我留下了一个好印象。

example.ex: The aid coming in has made no impression on the horrific death rates.
example.tran: 逐渐到达的救援对可怕的死亡率并没有起到什么作用。

collins.def: If you are under the impression that something is the case, you believe that it is the case, usually when it is not actually the case.

example.ex: He had apparently been under the impression that a military coup was in progress.
example.tran: 他显然以为一场军事政变正在酝酿中。

collins.def: Fishing is the sport, hobby, or business of catching fish.

example.ex: Despite the poor weather the fishing has been pretty good.
example.tran: 尽管天气恶劣，却渔获颇丰。

example.ex: ...a fishing boat.
example.tran: 渔船

collins.def: Ultimately means finally, after a long and often complicated series of events.

example.ex: Whatever the scientists ultimately conclude, all of their data will immediately be disputed.
example.tran: 不管科学家们最后得出什么样的结论，他们的全部数据将会立即引起争议。

example.ex: ...a tough but ultimately worthwhile struggle.
example.tran: 艰苦卓绝但最终还是值得的一次抗争

collins.def: You use ultimately to indicate that what you are saying is the most important point in a discussion.

example.ex: Ultimately, Bismarck's revisionism scarcely affected or damaged British interests at all.
example.tran: 从根本上说，俾斯麦的修正主义几乎未对英国的利益造成一丝一毫的影响或损害。

collins.tran: 唱歌的人;(尤指)歌手，歌唱家
collins.def: A singer is a person who sings, especially as a job.

example.ex: My mother was a singer in a dance band.
example.tran: 我妈妈是一个舞蹈乐队的歌手。

example.ex: ...Dame Joan Sutherland, one of the great opera singers of the century.
example.tran: 琼·萨瑟兰女爵士，本世纪伟大的歌剧歌唱家之一

collins.def: A commander is an officer in charge of a military operation or organization.

example.ex: The commander and some of the men had been released.
example.tran: 指挥官和一些士兵已经获释。

example.ex: ...Commander Bob Marks.
example.tran: 指挥官鲍勃·马克斯

collins.def: A commander is an officer in the Royal Navy or the U.S. Navy.
If you wipe something, you rub its surface to remove dirt or liquid from it.

example.ex: I'll just wipe the table...
example.tran: 我就擦擦桌子。

example.ex: When he had finished washing he began to wipe the basin clean...
example.tran: 他清洗完后开始把洗脸池擦拭干净。

collins.def: If you wipe dirt or liquid from something, you remove it, for example by using a cloth or your hand.

example.ex: Gleb wiped the sweat from his face...
example.tran: 格莱布擦去脸上的汗水。

example.ex: He shook his head and wiped his tears with a tissue.
example.tran: 他摇摇头，用纸巾擦掉眼泪。

collins.def: A wipe is a small moist cloth for cleaning things and is designed to be used only once.

example.ex: ...antiseptic wipes.
example.tran: 消毒湿巾

collins.tran: 让…笑容顿失;使…兴致全无;使…丧失优势
collins.def: If you say that something wipes the smile off someone's face, you mean that it suddenly spoils their enjoyment or removes an advantage that they had and that you are pleased about it.

example.ex: Tony Holmes wiped the smile off the faces of his rivals with a solo 30-second win.
example.tran: 托尼·福尔摩斯以30秒的领先优势获得了这一赛段的个人胜利，使对手再也笑不起来。

means: 通过双方协议来计划或安排

collins.def: A concert is a performance of music.

example.ex: ...a short concert of piano music...
example.tran: 一场短暂的钢琴音乐会

example.ex: I've been to plenty of live rock concerts.
example.tran: 我去现场看过很多摇滚音乐会。

collins.def: If a musician or group of musicians appears in concert, they are giving a live performance.

example.ex: I want people to remember Elvis in concert.
example.tran: 我希望大家记住现场演唱会上的猫王。

collins.def: If a number of people do something in concert, they do it together.

example.ex: He wants to act in concert with other nations.
example.tran: 他想和其他国家采取一致行动。

collins.def: If strain is put on an organization or system, it has to do more than it is able to do.

example.ex: The prison service is already under considerable strain...
example.tran: 监狱系统已经承受了巨大的压力。

example.ex: The vast expansion in secondary education is putting an enormous strain on the system.
example.tran: 中等教育的大幅扩张正对该系统造成巨大压力。

collins.def: To strain something means to make it do more than it is able to do.

example.ex: The volume of scheduled flights is straining the air traffic control system...
example.tran: 定期航班的数量正让空中交通指挥系统不堪重负。

example.ex: Resources will be further strained by new demands for housing.
example.tran: 资源将因新的住房需求而变得更紧张。

collins.def: Strain is a state of worry and tension caused by a difficult situation.

example.ex: She was tired and under great strain.
example.tran: 她身心疲惫，压力很大。

example.ex: ...the stresses and strains of a busy and demanding career.
example.tran: 忙碌而辛苦的工作带来的巨大压力

collins.tran: 带来压力的情况;造成紧张的因素
collins.def: If you say that a situation is a strain, you mean that it makes you worried and tense.

example.ex: I sometimes find it a strain to be responsible for the mortgage.
example.tran: 我有时觉得背负这笔抵押贷款很有压力。

collins.tran: 应力;张力;拉力;作用力;压力
collins.def: Strain is a force that pushes, pulls, or stretches something in a way that may damage it.

example.ex: Place your hands under your buttocks to take some of the strain off your back...
example.tran: 将手放在臀部下面，减轻背部的一些压力。

example.ex: A build-up of strain on a section of the San Andreas Fault has been detected.
example.tran: 已经勘测到圣安德烈亚斯断层的其中一处所承受的拉力在增强。

collins.def: Strain is an injury to a muscle in your body, caused by using the muscle too much or twisting it.

example.ex: Avoid muscle strain by warming up with slow jogging.
example.tran: 先慢跑热热身，免得拉伤肌肉。

example.ex: ...a groin strain.
example.tran: 腹股沟拉伤

collins.def: If you strain a muscle, you injure it by using it too much or twisting it.

example.ex: He strained his back during a practice session.
example.tran: 他在一次锻炼中扭伤了背部。

collins.tran: 努力做;竭力做;费力做事
collins.def: If you strain to do something, you make a great effort to do it when it is difficult to do.

example.ex: I had to strain to hear...
example.tran: 我不得不使劲去听。

example.ex: Several thousand supporters strained to catch a glimpse of the new president...
example.tran: 几千名支持者翘首企盼能一睹新总统的风采。

collins.tran: 过滤;滤掉(食物中)的液体
collins.def: When you strain food, you separate the liquid part of it from the solid parts.

example.ex: Strain the stock and put it back into the pan.
example.tran: 滤出原汁，将它放回到平底锅中。

collins.def: You can use strain to refer to a particular quality in someone's character, remarks, or work.

example.ex: There was a strain of bitterness in his voice.
example.tran: 他的声音听起来有些愤愤不平。

example.ex: ...this cynical strain in the book.
example.tran: 该书中这种愤世嫉俗的意味

collins.tran: (病菌的)类型;(植物或其他有机物的)系，品系，品种
collins.def: A strain of a germ, plant, or other organism is a particular type of it.

example.ex: Every year new strains of influenza develop.
example.tran: 每年都有新的流感病毒出现。

example.ex: ...a particularly beautiful strain of Swiss pansies.
example.tran: 一种格外美丽的瑞士三色堇

collins.def: If you hear the strains of music, you hear music being played.

example.ex: She could hear the tinny strains of a chamber orchestra.
example.tran: 她能听见室内管弦乐队尖细的旋律。

collins.tran: 运输工具;(尤指)军车,运输舰
collins.def: A carrier is a vehicle that is used for carrying people, especially soldiers, or things.

example.ex: There were armoured personnel carriers and tanks on the streets...
example.tran: 街上有装甲运兵车和坦克。

example.ex: Deliveries are made by common carrier or van line.
example.tran: 货物运输采用普通货车或厢式货车。

collins.def: A carrier is a passenger airline.

example.ex: Switzerland's national carrier, Swissair, has been having a hard time recently.
example.tran: 瑞士的国有航空公司——瑞士航空公司，最近日子很不好过。

collins.def: A carrier is a person or an animal that is infected with a disease and so can make other people or animals ill.

example.ex: ...an AIDS carrier.
example.tran: 艾滋病病毒携带者

example.ex: ...carriers of disease such as mosquitoes and worms.
example.tran: 蚊子、蠕虫之类携带病毒的昆虫

collins.def: Lesbian is used to describe homosexual women.

example.ex: Many of her best friends were lesbian.
example.tran: 她最要好的朋友中有很多都是女同性恋者。

collins.def: Lesbian is used to describe the relationships and activities of homosexual women, and the organizations or publications intended for them or created by them.

example.ex: ...a long-term lesbian relationship.
example.tran: 长期的女同性恋关系

collins.def: A bathroom is a room in a house that contains a bath or shower, a washbasin, and sometimes a toilet.
A bathroom is a room in a house or public building that contains a toilet.

example.ex: She had gone in to use the bathroom.
example.tran: 她去洗手间了。

collins.def: People say that they are going to the bathroom when they want to say that they are going to use the toilet.

example.ex: Although he had been treated with antibiotics, he went to the bathroom repeatedly.
example.tran: 虽然他已经服用了抗生素，但他还是不停地上厕所。

means: 战士（尤指士兵或拳击者）

collins.def: A fighter or a fighter plane is a fast military aircraft that is used for destroying other aircraft.
If you describe someone as a fighter, you approve of them because they continue trying to achieve things in spite of great difficulties or opposition.

example.ex: From the start it was clear this tiny girl was a real fighter.
example.tran: 这个一丁点儿大的小姑娘从一开始就显露出真正的斗士本色。

collins.tran: 打架者;打斗者;(尤指)职业拳击手
collins.def: A fighter is a person who physically fights another person, especially a professional boxer.

example.ex: ...a tough little street fighter.
example.tran: 好勇斗狠的街头小混混

collins.def: If something alters or if you alter it, it changes.

example.ex: Little had altered in the village...
example.tran: 村子里几乎没有什么变化。

example.ex: They have never altered their programmes by a single day.
example.tran: 他们一天也未变更过他们的节目。

collins.def: You use personally to emphasize that you are giving your own opinion.

example.ex: Personally I think it's a waste of time...
example.tran: 在我看来，这是浪费时间。

example.ex: You can disagree about them, and I personally do, but they are great ideas that have made people think...
example.tran: 你可以不同意这些看法，我个人也不同意。但它们的确是引发人们思考的好想法。

collins.def: If you do something personally, you do it yourself rather than letting someone else do it.

example.ex: The minister is returning to Paris to answer the allegations personally...
example.tran: 部长将返回巴黎亲自回应那些指控。

example.ex: When the great man arrived, the club's manager personally escorted him upstairs...
example.tran: 那位要人到达时，俱乐部经理亲自陪他上楼。

collins.def: If you meet or know someone personally, you meet or know them in real life, rather than knowing about them or knowing their work.

example.ex: He did not know them personally, but he was familiar with their reputation...
example.tran: 他并不认识他们，但已久仰他们的大名。

example.ex: I have orders to deliver it to Mr Demiris personally...
example.tran: 我奉命要把它送给德米里斯先生本人。

collins.def: You can use personally to say that something refers to an individual person rather than to other people.

example.ex: He was personally responsible for all that the people had suffered under his rule...
example.tran: 他个人要为他统治时人民所受的所有苦难负责。

example.ex: In order for me to spend three months on something it has to interest me personally.
example.tran: 要让我在某件事情上花3个月时间,这件事必须得让我感兴趣。

collins.def: You can use personally to show that you are talking about someone's private life rather than their professional or public life.

example.ex: This has taken a great toll on me personally and professionally...
example.tran: 这给我的个人生活和我的工作都造成了严重的不良影响。

example.ex: Personally he was quiet, modest and unobtrusive...
example.tran: 私下里他文静、谦虚、不事张扬。

collins.def: If you take someone's remarks personally, you are upset because you think that they are criticizing you in particular.

example.ex: I take everything too personally...
example.tran: 我太主观了，认为一切都是针对我的。

example.ex: Remember, stick to the issues and don't take it personally.
example.tran: 记住,就事论事,不要把问题个人化。

means: 作为权力经纪人进行谈判
作为中间人来安排、设法

collins.tran: (股票、外汇或商品）经纪人，代理商
collins.def: A broker is a person whose job is to buy and sell shares, foreign money, or goods for other people.

collins.tran: （国家或政府作为中间人）协调，安排
collins.def: If a country or government brokers an agreement, a ceasefire, or a round of talks, they try to negotiate or arrange it.

example.ex: The United Nations brokered a peace in Mogadishu at the end of March.
example.tran: 3月末，联合国出面在摩加迪沙进行了和平调解。

collins.def: When you compare things, you consider them and discover the differences or similarities between them.

example.ex: Compare the two illustrations in Fig 60...
example.tran: 比较图60中的两幅插图。

example.ex: Was it fair to compare independent schools with state schools?...
example.tran: 拿私立学校与州立学校相比，这样公平吗？

collins.def: If you compare one person or thing to another, you say that they are like the other person or thing.

example.ex: Some commentators compared his work to that of James Joyce...
example.tran: 有些评注者把他的作品与詹姆斯·乔伊斯的作品相提并论。

example.ex: I can only compare the experience to falling in love.
example.tran: 我只能把这段经历比作坠入爱河。

collins.def: If one thing compares favourably with another, it is better than the other thing. If it compares unfavourably, it is worse than the other thing.

example.ex: Our road safety record compares favourably with that of other European countries...
example.tran: 我们的道路安全纪录比欧洲其他国家要好。

example.ex: How do the two techniques compare in terms of application?
example.tran: 这两种手法实际运用起来哪个好一些？

collins.def: If you say that something does not compare with something else, you mean that it is much worse.

example.ex: The flowers here do not compare with those at home...
example.tran: 这儿的花比不上家乡的花。

example.ex: The more recent conifer plantations cannot yet compare with the old woodlands.
example.tran: 年代较近的针叶树林场还比不上年代久远的林场。

collins.def: If you describe something as beyond compare, you mean that it is extremely good or extremely great.

example.ex: She was a storyteller beyond compare.
example.tran: 她是个无与伦比的讲故事高手。

example.ex: ...riches beyond compare.
example.tran: 无与伦比的财富

collins.def: Economics is the study of the way in which money, industry, and trade are organized in a society.

example.ex: He gained a first class Honours degree in economics.
example.tran: 他获得了经济学一等荣誉学位。

collins.def: The economics of a society or industry is the system of organizing money and trade in it.

example.ex: He is regarded as a committed supporter of a radical free-market economics policy.
example.tran: 他被视为激进的自由市场经济体制政策的坚定支持者。

example.ex: ...the economics of the third world.
example.tran: 第三世界的经济体制

means: 阿尔及利亚生活方式的

collins.tran: 阿尔及利亚的；阿尔及利亚人的；阿尔及利亚文化的
collins.def: Algerian means belonging or relating to Algeria, or its people or culture.

example.ex: ...the Algerian desert.
example.tran: 阿尔及利亚沙漠

example.ex: ...a young Algerian actor.
example.tran: 一位年轻的阿尔及利亚演员

collins.tran: 阿尔及利亚人；阿尔及利亚裔人
collins.def: An Algerian is an Algerian citizen or a person of Algerian origin.
You use nevertheless when saying something that contrasts with what has just been said.

example.ex: Most marriages fail after between five and nine years. Nevertheless, people continue to get married.
example.tran: 大部分婚姻在婚后第五至第九年间失败，然而，人们仍会选择结婚。

example.ex: There had been no indication of any loss of mental faculties. His whole life had nevertheless been clouded with a series of illnesses.
example.tran: 没有迹象显示他的智力受到了损害，但是他的一生却是疾病缠身。

collins.def: If you are entitled to something, you have the right to have it or do it.

example.ex: If the warranty is limited, the terms may entitle you to a replacement or refund...
example.tran: 如果保修有限制，根据条款你也许可以要求退换或者退款。

example.ex: They are entitled to first class travel...
example.tran: 他们可以坐头等舱旅行。

collins.tran: 给（书、电影、绘画等）命名；给…题名
collins.def: If the title of something such as a book, film, or painting is, for example, 'Sunrise', you can say that it is entitled 'Sunrise'.

example.ex: Chomsky's review is entitled 'Psychology and Ideology'.
example.tran: 乔姆斯基的这篇评论题为《心理学与意识形态》。

example.ex: ...a performance entitled 'United States'.
example.tran: 名为《美国》的一场演出

collins.def: Employment is the fact of having a paid job.

example.ex: She was unable to find employment...
example.tran: 她没能找到工作。

example.ex: He regularly drove from his home to his place of employment.
example.tran: 他定期开车往返于家和工作地点之间。

collins.def: Employment is the fact of employing someone.

example.ex: ...the employment of children under nine.
example.tran: 对不满9岁的儿童的雇用

collins.def: Employment is the work that is available in a country or area.

example.ex: ...economic policies designed to secure full employment.
example.tran: 旨在确保充分就业的经济政策

collins.def: A pit is a coal mine.

example.ex: It was a better community then when all the pits were working.
example.tran: 所有的煤矿都在开工的那个时候，这个社区的情况要更好一些。

collins.def: A pit is a large hole that is dug in the ground.

example.ex: Eric lost his footing and began to slide into the pit.
example.tran: 埃里克一脚踩空，开始往坑里滑。

collins.tran: （挖出沙砾或黏土后留下的）坑，窑
collins.def: A gravel pit or clay pit is a very large hole that is left where gravel or clay has been dug from the ground.

example.ex: This area of former farmland was worked as a gravel pit until 1964.
example.tran: 这块过去曾是农田的地1964年前一直被用作沙砾坑。

collins.def: If two opposing things or people are pitted against one another, they are in conflict.

example.ex: You will be pitted against people who are every bit as good as you are...
example.tran: 你将和与你势均力敌的对手展开竞争。

example.ex: This was one man pitted against the universe.
example.tran: 这是一个人挑战整个宇宙。

collins.def: In motor racing, the pits are the areas at the side of the track where drivers stop to get more fuel and to repair their cars during races.

example.ex: He moved quickly into the pits and climbed rapidly out of the car.
example.tran: 他迅速进入检修加油站，飞快地爬出赛车。

collins.def: If you describe something as the pits, you mean that it is extremely bad.

example.ex: Mary Ann asked him how dinner had been. 'The pits,' he replied.
example.tran: 玛丽·安问他晚餐怎么样，他回答说：“糟透了。”

collins.def: A pit is the stone of a fruit or vegetable.
If you pit your wits against someone, you compete with them in a test of knowledge or intelligence.

example.ex: I'd like to pit my wits against the best.
example.tran: 我希望同最优秀的对手斗智。

collins.def: If you have a feeling in the pit of your stomach, you have a tight or sick feeling in your stomach, usually because you are afraid or anxious.

example.ex: I had a funny feeling in the pit of my stomach.
example.tran: 我心头有种怪怪的感觉。

means: 叙述(relate过去式和过去分词)

collins.def: If two or more things are related, there is a connection between them.

example.ex: The philosophical problems of chance and of free will are closely related.
example.tran: 或然性和自由意志这两个哲学问题是紧密相关的。

example.ex: ...equipment and accessories for diving and related activities.
example.tran: 潜水及相关活动所需的装备和配件

collins.tran: 有亲属关系的;属同一家族的
collins.def: People who are related belong to the same family.

example.ex: ...people in countries like Bangladesh who have been able to show they are related to a spouse or parent living in Britain.
example.tran: 能够证明自己和生活在英国的配偶或父母有亲属关系的孟加拉国等国家的公民

collins.tran: (动物)有亲缘关系的;(语言)同源的
collins.def: If you say that different types of animal or different languages are related, you mean that they have developed from the same type of animal or language.

example.ex: Sanskrit is related very closely to Latin, Greek, and the Germanic and Celtic languages.
example.tran: 梵语和拉丁语、希腊语、日耳曼和凯尔特语是联系密切的同源语言。

example.ex: ...closely related species.
example.tran: 亲缘关系密切的物种

collins.def: The context of an idea or event is the general situation that relates to it, and which helps it to be understood.

example.ex: We are doing this work in the context of reforms in the economic, social and cultural spheres.
example.tran: 我们是在对经济、社会、文化诸领域进行改革的背景下从事这项工作的。

example.ex: ...the historical context in which Chaucer wrote...
example.tran: 乔叟写作的历史背景

collins.def: The context of a word, sentence, or text consists of the words, sentences, or text before and after it which help to make its meaning clear.

example.ex: Without a context, I would have assumed it was written by a man.
example.tran: 如果没有上下文，我会以为这是出自一名男子笔下。

collins.tran: 在上下文中;置于背景之下
collins.def: If something is seen in context or if it is put into context, it is considered together with all the factors that relate to it.

example.ex: Taxation is not popular in principle, merely acceptable in context...
example.tran: 征税基本上是不受欢迎的，在一定情境中才勉强为人接受。

example.ex: It is important that we put Jesus into the context of history.
example.tran: 我们将耶稣置于历史环境中来看是很重要的。

collins.tran: 脱离上下文;断章取义地
collins.def: If a statement or remark is quoted out of context, the circumstances in which it was said are not correctly reported, so that it seems to mean something different from the meaning that was intended.

example.ex: Thomas says that he has been taken out of context on the issue...
example.tran: 托马斯说，在这个问题上他的话被断章取义了。

example.ex: Quotes can be manipulated and used out of context.
example.tran: 引语可能会被篡改，使用时断章取义。

collins.def: Something that is unique is the only one of its kind.

example.ex: Each person's signature is unique...
example.tran: 每个人的签名都是独一无二的。

example.ex: The area has its own unique language, Catalan.
example.tran: 这个地区有自己单独的语言，加泰罗尼亚语。

collins.def: You can use unique to describe things that you admire because they are very unusual and special.

example.ex: Brett's vocals are just unique...
example.tran: 布雷特的歌声无与伦比。

example.ex: Kauffman was a woman of unique talent and determination.
example.tran: 考夫曼是一个有着超群才智和决断力的女子。

collins.def: If something is unique to one thing, person, group, or place, it concerns or belongs only to that thing, person, group, or place.

example.ex: No one knows for sure why adolescence is unique to humans...
example.tran: 没有人确切地知道为什么只有人类才会经历青春期。

example.ex: This interesting and charming creature is unique to Borneo.
example.tran: 这种有趣迷人的动物是婆罗洲独有的。

collins.tran: 消除，剔除，根除(尤指不需要之物)
collins.def: To eliminate something, especially something you do not want or need, means to remove it completely.

example.ex: The Sex Discrimination Act has not eliminated discrimination in employment...
example.tran: 《反性别歧视法》并未根除工作中的歧视。

example.ex: Academic departments are being eliminated...
example.tran: 纯理论研究院系即将被裁撤。

collins.def: When a person or team is eliminated from a competition, they are defeated and so take no further part in the competition.

example.ex: I was eliminated from the 400 metres in the semi-finals...
example.tran: 我在400米半决赛中被淘汰。

example.ex: If you are eliminated in the show-jumping then you are out of the complete competition.
example.tran: 如果在马术障碍赛中被淘汰，就意味着完全出局。

collins.def: If someone says that they have eliminated an enemy, they mean that they have killed them. By using the word 'eliminate', they are trying to make the action sound more positive than if they used the word 'kill'.

example.ex: He declared war on the government and urged right-wingers to eliminate their opponents...
example.tran: 他向政府宣战，并煽动右翼分子干掉他们的对手。

example.ex: The radio station claimed that 87,000 'reactionaries' had been eliminated.
example.tran: 广播电台声称已经消灭了87,000名“反动分子”。

means: 可塑的，塑性的，受范的，柔软的
造型的，塑造的，给与形态的
塑料[塑胶]的，塑料[塑胶]制的，合成树脂做的
有形成力的，有创造力的

collins.def: Plastic is a material which is produced from oil by a chemical process and which is used to make many objects. It is light in weight and does not break easily.

example.ex: ...a wooden crate, sheltered from wetness by sheets of plastic...
example.tran: 用塑料薄膜防潮的木板箱

example.ex: A lot of the plastics that carmakers are using cannot be recycled.
example.tran: 汽车制造商使用的许多塑料制品是无法回收利用的。

collins.def: If you describe something as plastic, you mean that you think it looks or tastes unnatural or not real.

example.ex: ...plastic airline food...
example.tran: 航班上味同嚼蜡的食品

example.ex: When girls put on too much eye-shadow, they look plastic.
example.tran: 女孩子如果把眼影涂得过重，看起来就不自然了。

collins.def: If you use plastic or plastic money to pay for something, you pay for it with a credit card instead of using cash.

example.ex: Using plastic to pay for an order is simplicity itself.
example.tran: 用信用卡支付订单是很简单的事。

example.ex: ...shopping with their plastic money.
example.tran: 用他们的信用卡购物

collins.def: Something that is plastic is soft and can easily be made into different shapes.

example.ex: The mud is smooth, gray, soft, and plastic as butter.
example.tran: 这种泥浆呈灰色，它光滑、柔软，像黄油一样易塑。

collins.def: If things vary, they are different from each other in size, amount, or degree.

example.ex: As they're handmade, each one varies slightly...
example.tran: 由于它们是手工制作的，彼此都会有些微小的差异。

example.ex: The text varies from the earlier versions...
example.tran: 这一文本与较早的版本有些不同。

collins.def: If something varies or if you vary it, it becomes different or changed.

example.ex: The cost of the alcohol duty varies according to the amount of wine in the bottle...
example.tran: 酒税税额随酒瓶容量的大小而有所不同。

example.ex: You are welcome to vary the diet.
example.tran: 我们鼓励不时变换饮食。

collins.def: Your ears are the two parts of your body, one on each side of your head, with which you hear sounds.

example.ex: He whispered something in her ear...
example.tran: 他在她耳边低声说了些什么。

example.ex: I'm having my ears pierced.
example.tran: 我打算穿耳洞。

collins.def: If you have an ear for music or language, you are able to hear its sounds accurately and to interpret them or reproduce them well.

example.ex: Moby certainly has a fine ear for a tune...
example.tran: 莫比无疑具有很好的乐感。

example.ex: An ear for foreign languages is advantageous.
example.tran: 能够听懂外语是种优势。

collins.def: Ear is often used to refer to people's willingness to listen to what someone is saying.

example.ex: What would cause the masses to give him a far more sympathetic ear?...
example.tran: 怎样才能使民众以更加体谅的心态倾听他的话呢？

example.ex: They had shut their eyes and ears to everything.
example.tran: 他们对一切都视而不见，充耳不闻。

collins.def: The ears of a cereal plant such as wheat or barley are the parts at the top of the stem, which contain the seeds or grains.

collins.tran: . 洗耳恭听;全神贯注地听
collins.def: If someone says that they are all ears, they mean that they are ready and eager to listen

collins.tran: （尤指让人恼火地）缠住…喋喋不休
collins.def: If you say that someone is bending  your ear about something, you mean that they keep talking to you about it because they think it is important; used especially when you are irritated by this.

example.ex: He was fed up with people bending his ear about staying on at school.
example.tran: 人们一个劲儿地跟他说要继续留在学校念书，这让他烦透了。

collins.def: If someone boxes a child's ears, they hit them on the side of their head as a punishment.

collins.tran: (要求)未被理睬，不被听取/(某人对要求)不予理睬，充耳不闻
collins.def: If a request falls on deaf ears or if the person to whom the request is made turns a deaf ear to it, they take no notice of it.

example.ex: I hope that our appeals will not fall on deaf ears...
example.tran: 我希望我们的呼吁不会没人理睬。

example.ex: He has turned a resolutely deaf ear to American demands for action.
example.tran: 他对美国提出的行动要求完全不理不睬。

collins.def: If you keep or have your ear to the ground, you make sure that you find out about the things that people are doing or saying.

example.ex: Jobs in manufacturing are relatively scarce but I keep my ear to the ground.
example.tran: 制造业的就业机会相对很少，但是我时刻留意着信息。

collins.def: If you listen to something or someone with only half an ear, you do not give your full attention to what is being said.
If you lend an ear to someone or their problems, you listen to them carefully and sympathetically.

example.ex: They are always willing to lend an ear and offer what advice they can.
example.tran: 他们总是愿意认真倾听并尽量提出建议。

collins.tran: 左耳进，右耳出;听过即忘
collins.def: If you say that something goes in one ear and out the other, you mean that someone pays no attention to it, or forgets about it immediately.

example.ex: That rubbish goes in one ear and out the other.
example.tran: 那种废话都是左耳进，右耳出。

collins.tran: 突然被解雇;突然被赶走
collins.def: If someone says that you will be out on your ear, they mean that you will be forced to leave a job, an organization or a place suddenly.

example.ex: We never objected. We'd have been out on our ears looking for another job if we had.
example.tran: 我们从未反对过，如果我们真的反对，早就被扫地出门，另谋高就了。

collins.tran: （不看乐谱而）凭记忆演奏(乐曲)
collins.def: If you play by ear or play a piece of music by ear, you play music by relying on your memory rather than by reading printed music.

example.ex: Neil played, by ear, the music he'd heard his older sister practicing.
example.tran: 尼尔凭着记忆弹奏他曾听到姐姐练习时弹的曲子。

collins.def: If you play it by ear, you decide what to say or do in a situation by responding to events rather than by following a plan which you have decided on in advance.

collins.tran: 深陷于;深深卷入；埋头于
collins.def: If you are up to your ears in something, it is taking up all of your time, attention, or resources.

example.ex: 'Why don't you come with me?' — 'I can't. I'm up to my ears in reports.'...
example.tran: “怎么不跟我一起来呀？”——“不行，我忙着写报告呢。”

example.ex: He was desperate. He was in debt up to his ears.
example.tran: 他负债累累，走投无路。

means: 工程（学）， 工程师行业

collins.def: Engineering is the work involved in designing and constructing engines and machinery, or structures such as roads and bridges. Engineering is also the subject studied by people who want to do this work.

example.ex: ...the design and engineering of aircraft and space vehicles.
example.tran: 航天器和太空交通工具的设计和工程制造

example.ex: ...graduates with degrees in engineering.
example.tran: 有工程学学位的毕业生

collins.def: Leather is treated animal skin which is used for making shoes, clothes, bags, and furniture.

example.ex: He wore a leather jacket and dark trousers.
example.tran: 他身穿皮夹克和深色裤子。

example.ex: ...an impressive range of upholstered furniture, in a choice of fabrics and leathers.
example.tran: 琳琅满目的覆面家具，有多种布料和皮革可供选择

collins.tran: （尤指骑摩托车者穿的）皮外套，皮衣
collins.def: Leathers are leather clothes such as jackets and trousers, especially those worn by motorcyclists.

example.ex: ...a couple of youths in motorcyclists' black leathers.
example.tran: 两个穿黑色机车皮衣的年轻人

collins.def: A tube is a long hollow object that is usually round, like a pipe.

example.ex: He is fed by a tube that enters his nose.
example.tran: 他靠鼻饲管进食。

example.ex: ...a cardboard tube.
example.tran: 纸卷芯

collins.def: A tube of something such as paste is a long, thin container which you squeeze in order to force the paste out.

example.ex: ...a tube of toothpaste.
example.tran: 一管牙膏

example.ex: ...a small tube of moisturizer.
example.tran: 一小管保湿液

collins.def: Some long, thin, hollow parts in your body are referred to as tubes .

example.ex: The lungs are in fact constructed of thousands of tiny tubes.
example.tran: 肺实际上由上千条细微的气管构成。

collins.def: The tube is the underground railway system in London.

example.ex: I took the tube then the train and came straight here...
example.tran: 我先乘地铁，然后坐火车直奔这里。

example.ex: He travelled by tube.
example.tran: 他乘地铁旅行。

collins.def: You can refer to the television as the tube .

example.ex: The only baseball he saw was on the tube.
example.tran: 他看过的唯一一场棒球赛是在电视上看的。

collins.tran: （公司、经济、机构）完全垮掉，彻底崩溃，告吹
collins.def: a business, economy, or institution goes down the tubes or goes down the tube, it fails or collapses completely.

example.ex: The country was going down the tubes economically...
example.tran: 该国经济正在彻底崩溃。

example.ex: When I was dieting, that was when my social life started going down the tube.
example.tran: 我节食的时候，也就切断了一切社交生活。

collins.def: Concentration on something involves giving all your attention to it.

example.ex: Neal kept interrupting, breaking my concentration...
example.tran: 尼尔不停地打断我，使得我无法集中注意力。

example.ex: We lacked concentration and it cost us the goal and the game.
example.tran: 我们注意力不够集中，结果丢了球，输了比赛。

collins.def: A concentration of something is a large amount of it or large numbers of it in a small area.

example.ex: The area has one of the world's greatest concentrations of wildlife...
example.tran: 这个地区是世界上野生动物最为密集的区域之一。

example.ex: There's been too much concentration of power in the hands of central authorities.
example.tran: 权力一直过多地集中在中央机构手中。

collins.def: The concentration of a substance is the proportion of essential ingredients or substances in it.

example.ex: pH is a measure of the concentration of free hydrogen atoms in a solution...
example.tran: pH值是测试溶液中自由氢原子浓度的单位。

example.ex: The latest data showed that global ozone concentrations had dropped several per cent over the last decade.
example.tran: 最新数据显示，过去10年来全球臭氧的浓度降低了几个百分点。

collins.def: A restriction is an official rule that limits what you can do or that limits the amount or size of something.

example.ex: ...the lifting of restrictions on political parties and the news media...
example.tran: 取消对政治党派和新闻媒体的限制

example.ex: The relaxation of travel restrictions means they are free to travel and work.
example.tran: 旅游限制的放松意味着他们可以自由地出行和工作。

collins.tran: （对行动的）限定，约束，限制因素
collins.def: You can refer to anything that limits what you can do as a restriction.

example.ex: His parents are trying to make up to him for the restrictions of urban living...
example.tran: 他的父母正试图弥补他在城市生活的局限。

example.ex: The second restriction upon the president's power is the limited time at his disposal.
example.tran: 总统权力受到的第二项限制就是可以自由支配的时间有限。

collins.tran: 英亩（等于4,840平方码或4,047平方米）
collins.def: An acre is an area of land measuring 4840 square yards or 4047 square metres.

example.ex: The property is set in two acres of land.
example.tran: 这座房产占地两英亩。

collins.def: Winter is the season between autumn and spring. In the winter the weather is usually cold.

example.ex: In winter the nights are long and cold.
example.tran: 冬夜漫长而寒冷。

example.ex: ...the winter months.
example.tran: 冬季月份

collins.def: If an animal or plant winters somewhere or is wintered there, it spends the winter there.

example.ex: The birds will winter outside in an aviary...
example.tran: 鸟儿们将在外面的大鸟笼里过冬。

example.ex: The young seedlings are usually wintered in a cold frame.
example.tran: 幼苗通常都会放在冷床里越冬。

collins.def: If you winter somewhere, you spend the winter there.

example.ex: The family decided to winter in Nice again.
example.tran: 一家人决定还是到尼斯过冬。

collins.def: Carbon is  a chemical element that diamonds and coal are made up of.
A carbon is a sheet of carbon paper.

example.ex: He inserted the paper and two carbons.
example.tran: 他放入了那张纸和两张复写纸。

means: （已经取得学士学位正在攻读高级学位的）研究生

collins.tran: （英国的）大学毕业生，学士学位获得者
collins.def: In Britain, a graduate is a person who has successfully completed a degree at a university or college and has received a certificate that shows this.

example.ex: In 1973, the first Open University graduates received their degrees.
example.tran: 1973年，第一批开放大学的毕业生获得了学位。

example.ex: ...graduates in engineering.
example.tran: 工程学学士

collins.tran: （美国的）高中（或学院、大学）毕业生
collins.def: In the United States, a graduate is a student who has successfully completed a course at a high school, college, or university.

example.ex: The top one-third of all high school graduates are entitled to an education at the California State University.
example.tran: 高中毕业生当中排名前1/3的学生可以进入加利福尼亚州立大学深造。

collins.def: In Britain, when a student graduates from university, they have successfully completed a degree course.

example.ex: She graduated in English and Drama from Manchester University.
example.tran: 她毕业于曼彻斯特大学的英语和戏剧专业。

collins.tran: （美国）中学（或大学）毕业，授予…学位（或毕业文凭）
collins.def: In the United States, when a student graduates, they complete their studies successfully and leave their school or university. You can also say that a school or university graduates a student or students.

example.ex: When the boys graduated from high school, Ann moved to a small town in Vermont...
example.tran: 当儿子们高中毕业后，安搬到佛蒙特州的一个小镇上居住。

example.ex: In 1986, American universities graduated a record number of students with degrees in computer science.
example.tran: 1986年，美国大学计算机专业的毕业生人数创下了历史纪录。

collins.def: If you graduate from one thing to another, you go from a less important job or position to a more important one.

example.ex: Bruce graduated to chef at the Bear Hotel...
example.tran: 布鲁斯晋升为大熊饭店的厨师长。

example.ex: From commercials she quickly graduated to television shows.
example.tran: 她很快就从拍商业广告上升到拍电视节目。

collins.def: The way that you behave is the way that you do and say things, and the things that you do and say.

example.ex: I couldn't believe these people were behaving in this way...
example.tran: 我难以相信这些人竟会有这种举动。

example.ex: He'd behaved badly.
example.tran: 他表现得很糟糕。

collins.tran: 守规矩；举止得体；行为检点
collins.def: If you behave or behave yourself, you act in the way that people think is correct and proper.

example.ex: You have to behave...
example.tran: 你得规矩点。

example.ex: They were expected to behave themselves.
example.tran: 他们应该守规矩。

collins.tran: （在科学领域）运动，起作用，作出反应
collins.def: In science, the way that something behaves is the things that it does.

example.ex: Under certain conditions, electrons can behave like waves rather than particles.
example.tran: 在一定条件下，电子可以作波状运动，而不是粒子状运动。

means: 实施，实行，执行，贯彻，营业

collins.def: Prosecution is the action of charging someone with a crime and putting them on trial.

example.ex: Yesterday the head of government called for the prosecution of those responsible for the deaths.
example.tran: 昨天，政府首脑要求起诉那些该为这些人的死负责的人。

collins.def: The lawyers who try to prove that a person on trial is guilty are called the prosecution .

example.ex: Colonel Pugh, for the prosecution, said that the offences occurred over a six-year period.
example.tran: 皮尤上校为控方律师作证时说这些罪行是在6年的时间里犯下的。

collins.def: When a coloured object fades or when the light fades it, it gradually becomes paler.

example.ex: All colour fades — especially under the impact of direct sunlight...
example.tran: 所有颜色都会褪色——尤其是在阳光直射下。

example.ex: No matter how soft the light is, it still plays havoc, fading carpets and curtains in every room.
example.tran: 无论多么柔和的光线，也仍然会造成损害，会让所有房间的地毯和窗帘褪色。

collins.tran: (光线)逐渐暗淡;(声音)逐渐减弱
collins.def: When light fades, it slowly becomes less bright. When a sound fades, it slowly becomes less loud.

example.ex: Seaton lay on his bed and gazed at the ceiling as the light faded...
example.tran: 光线渐渐暗了下去，西顿躺在床上，凝视着天花板。

example.ex: The sound of the last bomber's engines faded into the distance.
example.tran: 最后一架轰炸机的引擎声渐渐消失在远方。

collins.tran: (所注视之物)逐渐暗淡，逐渐模糊直至消失
collins.def: When something that you are looking at fades, it slowly becomes less bright or clear until it disappears.

example.ex: They observed the comet for 70 days before it faded from sight...
example.tran: 他们观察了这颗彗星 70 天，直至其慢慢从视线中消失。

example.ex: They watched the familiar mountains fade into the darkness.
example.tran: 他们看着熟悉的群山渐渐隐没到黑夜当中。

collins.tran: 变得不为人注意;变得无关紧要
collins.def: If someone or something fades, for example, into the background, they become hardly noticeable or very unimportant.

example.ex: She had a way of fading into the background when things got rough...
example.tran: 情况一有不妙，她总能退到幕后。

example.ex: The most prominent poets of the Victorian period had all but faded from the scene.
example.tran: 维多利亚时期最显赫的诗人差不多已全部湮没无声了。

collins.tran: (记忆)逐渐模糊;(感情)逐渐变淡;(可能性)逐渐变小
collins.def: If memories, feelings, or possibilities fade, they slowly become less intense or less strong.

example.ex: Sympathy for the rebels, the government claims, is beginning to fade...
example.tran: 政府宣称，对叛乱分子的同情开始消退。

example.ex: Prospects for peace had already started to fade.
example.tran: 和平的前景已经开始日渐暗淡。

collins.def: If someone's smile fades, they slowly stop smiling.

example.ex: Jay nodded, his smile fading.
example.tran: 杰伊点点头，笑容慢慢隐去了。

collins.tran: 淡出;变得不再引人注目(直至完全消失)
collins.def: When something fades out, it slowly becomes less noticeable or less important until it disappears completely.

example.ex: He thought her campaign would probably fade out soon in any case.
example.tran: 他认为不管怎样，她的竞选活动都可能会很快归于沉寂。

collins.tran: (光线)逐渐暗淡;(画面)淡出; (声音)渐弱
collins.def: When light, an image, or a sound fades out, it disappears after gradually becoming weaker.

example.ex: You'll need to be able to project two images onto the screen as the new one fades in and the old image fades out.
example.tran: 你得能将两个图像投射到屏幕上，让新的渐渐淡入，旧的渐渐淡出。

collins.def: A servant is someone who is employed to work at another person's home, for example as a cleaner or a gardener.

collins.tran: 提供服务的人(或事物);可以利用的人(或事物)
collins.def: You can use servant to refer to someone or something that provides a service for people or can be used by them.

example.ex: Like any other public servants, police must respond to public demand...
example.tran: 和其他所有公务员一样，警察必须服务于公众的需求。

example.ex: The question is whether technology is going to be our servant or our master.
example.tran: 问题是科技将为我们所用还是要驾驭我们。

collins.def: A corporation is a large business or company.

example.ex: ...multi-national corporations.
example.tran: 跨国公司

example.ex: ...the Seiko Corporation.
example.tran: 精工株式会社

collins.tran: (英国某些大城市的)市政委员会
collins.def: In some large British cities, the corporation is the local authority that is responsible for providing public services.

example.ex: ...the corporation's task of regenerating 900 acres of the inner city.
example.tran: 市政委员会改造900英亩的市中心贫民区的任务

collins.def: A pole is a long thin piece of wood or metal, used especially for supporting things.

example.ex: The truck crashed into a telegraph pole...
example.tran: 卡车撞到了电线杆上。

example.ex: He reached up with a hooked pole to roll down the metal shutter.
example.tran: 他用带钩的杆子把金属护窗拉了下来。

collins.def: The earth's poles are the two opposite ends of its axis, its most northern and southern points.

example.ex: For six months of the year, there is hardly any light at the poles.
example.tran: 在南北极，每年有6个月时间几乎没有光照。

collins.tran: （特质、意见或信仰）截然相反的两极之一；极端
collins.def: The two poles of a range of qualities, opinions, or beliefs are the completely opposite qualities, opinions, or beliefs at either end of the range.

example.ex: The two politicians represent opposite poles of the political spectrum.
example.tran: 这两位从政者代表了政界的两个极端。

collins.tran: （信仰、意见或性质）截然相反，南辕北辙
collins.def: If you say that two people or  things are poles apart, you mean that they have completely different beliefs, opinions, or qualities.
The climate of a place is the general weather conditions that are typical of it.

example.ex: ...the hot and humid climate of Cyprus.
example.tran: 塞浦路斯炎热潮湿的气候

collins.def: You can use climate to refer to the general atmosphere or situation somewhere.

example.ex: The economic climate remains uncertain.
example.tran: 经济形势依然不确定。

example.ex: ...the existing climate of violence and intimidation...
example.tran: 目前暴力和恐吓的氛围

collins.def: Arrangements are plans and preparations which you make so that something will happen or be possible.

example.ex: The staff is working frantically on final arrangements for the summit...
example.tran: 工作人员正紧张忙乱地为峰会做最后准备。

example.ex: She telephoned Ellen, but made no arrangements to see her.
example.tran: 她给埃伦打了电话，但没有约她见面。

collins.def: An arrangement is an agreement that you make with someone to do something.

example.ex: The caves can be visited only by prior arrangement...
example.tran: 这些洞穴只接受预约参观。

example.ex: Her class teacher made a special arrangement to discuss her progress at school once a month.
example.tran: 她班上的老师作了特别安排，每月讨论一次她在学业上的进展情况。

collins.def: An arrangement of things, for example flowers or furniture, is a group of them displayed in a particular way.

example.ex: The house was always decorated with imaginative flower arrangements.
example.tran: 这所房子总是摆放着富有创意的插花。

example.ex: ...an arrangement of dark-blue armchairs around a coffee table.
example.tran: 咖啡桌周围摆放了一些深蓝色扶手椅

collins.def: If someone makes an arrangement of a piece of music, they change it so that it is suitable for particular voices or instruments, or for a particular performance.

example.ex: ...an arrangement of a well-known piece by Mozart...
example.tran: 莫扎特一首名曲的改编曲

example.ex: Glen Bronka wrote his own orchestral arrangements.
example.tran: 格伦·布朗卡把自己的曲子改编成了管弦乐曲。

collins.def: Peaceful activities and situations do not involve war.

example.ex: He has attempted to find a peaceful solution to the Ossetian conflict...
example.tran: 他试图寻求和平解决奥赛梯冲突的方案。

example.ex: They emphasised that their equipment was for peaceful and not military purposes.
example.tran: 他们强调他们的设备用于和平而非战争目的。

collins.tran: 和平的；非暴力的；未引起骚乱的
collins.def: Peaceful occasions happen without violence or serious disorder.

example.ex: The farmers staged a noisy but peaceful protest outside the headquarters of the organization...
example.tran: 农场主在该组织总部外进行了喧闹而和平的抗议。

example.ex: Despite the violence that preceded the  elections, reports say that polling was orderly  and peaceful.
example.tran: 虽然选举之前有过暴力事件，但有报道称投票过程秩序井然，波澜不惊。

collins.def: Peaceful people are not violent and try to avoid quarrelling or fighting with other people.

example.ex: ...warriors who killed or enslaved the peaceful farmers.
example.tran: 杀害或奴役本分农民的武士

collins.tran: 宁静的；平静的；无人打扰的
collins.def: A peaceful place or time is quiet, calm, and free from disturbance.

example.ex: ...a peaceful Georgian house in the heart of Dorset...
example.tran: 多塞特腹地一幢宁静的乔治王朝风格的房子

example.ex: Mornings are usually quiet and peaceful in Hueytown.
example.tran: 胡伊镇的早晨通常一片静谧祥和。

collins.def: Someone who feels or looks peaceful feels or looks calm and free from worry.

example.ex: I feel relaxed and peaceful...
example.tran: 我感到放松而平和。

example.ex: The animals look peaceful and happy.
example.tran: 那些动物看起来气定神闲，怡然自得。

collins.def: If you drag something, you pull it along the ground, often with difficulty.

example.ex: He got up and dragged his chair towards the table.
example.tran: 他站起来把他的椅子拖向桌子。

collins.tran: (电脑操作中)用鼠标拖动，用鼠标改变（尺寸或形状）
collins.def: To drag a computer image means to use the mouse to move the position of the image on the screen, or to change its size or shape.

example.ex: Use your mouse to drag the pictures to their new size.
example.tran: 用鼠标拖动图片,将其调整为新的尺寸。

collins.def: If someone drags you somewhere, they pull you there, or force you to go there by physically threatening you.

example.ex: The vigilantes dragged the men out of the vehicles...
example.tran: 治安人员硬把那些人拉下车。

example.ex: There were no signs she'd been dragged across the grass.
example.tran: 没有迹象表明她是被硬拖着穿过草地的。

collins.def: If someone drags you somewhere you do not want to go, they make you go there.

example.ex: When you can drag him away from his work, he can also be a devoted father...
example.tran: 如果你能把他硬从工作中拉回来，他也会是个尽心尽责的父亲。

example.ex: I've been dragged back from Australia for no sufficient reason.
example.tran: 没有充分的理由，我就从澳大利亚被硬叫了回来。

collins.def: If you say that you drag yourself somewhere, you are emphasizing that you have to make a very great effort to go there.

example.ex: I find it really hard to drag myself out and exercise regularly.
example.tran: 我发现要让我自己定期出门锻炼真的很难。

example.ex: ...if you manage to drag yourself away from the luxury of the hotel.
example.tran: 如果你能舍弃酒店的奢侈享受

collins.def: If you drag your foot or your leg behind you, you walk with great difficulty because your foot or leg is injured in some way.

example.ex: He was barely able to drag his poisoned leg behind him...
example.tran: 他极费力地拖着那条中毒的腿走路。

example.ex: He drags his leg, and he can hardly lift his arm.
example.tran: 他拖着腿，几乎举不起他的胳膊。

collins.tran: 用网(或钩子)搜索(河或湖底)
collins.def: If the police drag a river or lake, they pull nets or hooks across the bottom of it in order to look for something.

example.ex: Yesterday police frogmen dragged a small pond on the Common.
example.tran: 昨天警方的蛙人在公用草地上的一个小池塘里打捞。

collins.tran: (时间)过得很慢;（活动）单调乏味地进行，拖沓地进行
collins.def: If a period of time or an event drags, it is very boring and seems to last a long time.

example.ex: The minutes dragged past...
example.tran: 时间一分钟一分钟地熬过去。

example.ex: The pacing was uneven, and the early second act dragged.
example.tran: 节奏忽快忽慢，第二幕前半场太过拖沓。

collins.def: If something is a drag on the development or progress of something, it slows it down or makes it more difficult.

example.ex: The satellite acts as a drag on the shuttle...
example.tran: 卫星成了航天飞机的累赘。

example.ex: Spending cuts will put a drag on growth.
example.tran: 缩减开支会减缓增长速度。

collins.tran: 令人不快的事;无聊的事
collins.def: If you say that something is a drag, you mean that it is unpleasant or very dull.

example.ex: As far as shopping for clothes goes, it's a drag...
example.tran: 逛街买衣服是件挺没意思的事。

example.ex: A dry sandwich is a drag to eat.
example.tran: 放干的三明治很难吃。

collins.def: If you take a drag on a cigarette or pipe that you are smoking, you take in air through it.

example.ex: He took a drag on his cigarette, and exhaled the smoke.
example.tran: 他吸了一口烟，吐出了烟雾。

collins.tran: (物体在空气或液体中移动时所受到的)阻力，抗力
collins.def: Drag is the resistance to the movement that is experienced by something that is moving through air or through a fluid.

example.ex: The drag of those extra air molecules brought the satellite crashing to Earth.
example.tran: 额外的空气分子阻力使得卫星坠毁到了地球上。

collins.def: Drag is the wearing of women's clothes by a male entertainer.

example.ex: Entertainment is laid on too, in the form of drag on Wednesdays and strippers on Sundays...
example.tran: 还安排了娱乐活动，星期三是男扮女装演出，星期天是脱衣舞演出。

example.ex: The neighborhood is given over to performers, stilt walkers and drag queens.
example.tran: 社区变成了玩杂耍的、踩高跷的和扮装皇后的天地。

collins.def: If you drag your feet or drag your heels, you delay doing something or do it very slowly because you do not want to do it.

example.ex: The government, he claimed, was dragging its feet.
example.tran: 他声称政府在故意拖延。

collins.def: You can refer to someone who sees or notices something as an observer .

example.ex: A casual observer would have taken them to be three men out for an evening stroll...
example.tran: 乍一看的话，还以为他们三人是晚上出来散步的。

example.ex: Observers say the woman pulled a knife out of the bunch of flowers and stabbed him in the neck.
example.tran: 目击者说那名女子从花束中拔出一把刀来，扎进了他的颈部。

collins.def: An observer is someone who studies current events and situations, especially in order to comment on them and predict what will happen next.

example.ex: Observers say the events of the weekend seem to have increased support for the opposition...
example.tran: 观察家说周末发生的事件似乎为反对派赢得了更多支持。

example.ex: Political observers believe that a new cabinet may be formed shortly.
example.tran: 政治观察家认为新内阁可能很快就会组建。

collins.tran: （监督重大事件或局势的）观察员
collins.def: An observer is a person who is sent to observe an important event or situation, especially in order to make sure it happens as it should, or so that they can tell other people about it.

example.ex: The president suggested that a UN observer should attend the conference.
example.tran: 总统建议联合国应派一名观察员参加本次会议。
